column7: 3) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 2-5-2008(71): Some people who are workaholics say, "I can rest when I'm dead." That is the sort of state of mind a **busy** person has!
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 17-2-2008(41): Poor Japanese people are so **busy**. They work like 80 hour weeks! Slowly, you see them turn into automatons…their bodies still alive, but their _state of mind_ like they've long ago _perished_ … (Mental image: most stressed out salaryman you know.).
column9: 5) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 1-6-2007(24): As others have suggested, I personified "state of mind" as the android, Data from here on. He is constanly analysing humans and emotions, plus he has an overactive mind for good measure. — _Data's_ is **busy** trying to understand why do humans _perish_ (die). — (If it helps bring Data to mind, think of " _Data_ -base is **busy** , please try again later").

column5: 1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 27-4-2006(189): **ECSTASY** alters our STATE OF MIND and makes us DEVILS.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 10-4-2008(82): The state of mind that horny teenagers are looking for.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-8-2007(43): The _devil_ sells _Data_ some **ecstasy** saying it will make him, like, human, man.
column8: 4) [[kfmfe04](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kfmfe04)] 24-9-2008(31): Someone offers you **ecstasy** at a rave party. Cool, logical _Data_ is on one shoulder saying "No, don't take it!". The _devil_ is on your other shoulder saying "You know you want it!".
column9: 5) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 16-10-2007(17): Data was in a state of **ecstasy** on the holodeck when he loaded up the new program full of horny teenagers that he stole from Riker.

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 26-10-2007(325): **Constancy** is holding the same _state of mind_ over a long _span_ of time. (tweaking PepeSeco and mspertus).
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-8-2007(70): _Data_ is the epitome of **constancy**. As a robot, his consistency _spans_ the entire day.
column7: 3) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 25-10-2007(20): A term used by Kant. Kant says that humans are preconditioned to experience the world in space and time, but God's mind has **Constancy**. That is, God's is a state of mind that spans all time and is not inhibited by it.
column8: 4) [[ivoSF](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivoSF)] 20-6-2006(16): Imagine a giant field of grass where a man sits trying to abtain zen, he sit still as a statue, holding his fingertips against eachother, while the day and night (the _span_ ning of the day) shoot pass you like in a 100000x forwarded movie. the seasons change but yet the man does not move. that whole picture combined gives me a feel of **constancy**.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 6-2-2008(14): _Data_ couldn't break the _span_ of his **CONSTANCY** of his _state of mind_ (ooh double reinforcement) if he tried. Just watch: <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mMWoaHyIKMs> See? He is serious from dusk to dawn. He can't break that serious look for one moment.

column3: To keep this character distinct from others of similar connotation, one need only think of the Prophet Jeremiah whose poetry gave an _eminence_ to _the state of mind_ we call **lamentation**.
column5: 1) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 17-2-2008(264): When the world's most _eminent_ magician died, everyone's _state of mind_ became that of **lament** ation. He was buried with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand.
column6: 2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 1-6-2007(66): _Data_ **lament** s that he could never see his _eminent_ father, his creator, ever again. He paints a picture of his father, that looks like a sunflower in the shape of a magic wand.
column7: 3) [[ambassadog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ambassadog)] 11-12-2008(42): Closely related to grief, mourning and regret, it was difficult for me to isolate this kanji. A **lament** is a song or poem that deals with loss or regret. This brings to mind the works of the world's most _eminent_ artists, their brilliance and powerful works owed to their _emotional states of mind_.
column8: 4) [[vicnet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vicnet)] 26-7-2009(22): **Lament** is the _state of mind_ most _eminent_ people live in, because so many expectations lay on their shoulders.
column9: 5) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 30-10-2007(17): Instead of using eminent - use its components - _divining rod_ and _sunflower_. Think of the current state of the environment symbolized by the sunflower and use the divining rod to see the possible future - pollution, global warming, overpopulation - we have a lot to **lament**.

column3: I know of an Indian religious sect which teaches that **enlightenment** is to be had by covering the eyes with one's index fingers, the ears with the thumbs, and the mouth with the little fingers. While these differ a bit from the _five holes_ that we used to represent the  " _I_ " (frame 17), the idea of achieving a special _state of mind_ by covering those five places can help you learn this kanji. You might try the position out while you are learning this character.
column5: 1) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 2-11-2007(263): **Enlightenment** is a state of mind that goes beyond the five senses.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-8-2007(88): _Data_ finds **enlightenment** when he discovers the answer to the question, "Who am _I_?". (Image: _Data_ meditating in a sitting lotus position).
column7: 3) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 1-6-2008(55): Enlightment, a _state of mind_ that _I_ must find. Only _I_ can find this _state of mind_.
column8: 4) [[cullingsong](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cullingsong)] 2-12-2008(50): What the hell is liosama talking about? (under me).
column9: 5) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 29-11-2008(40): Heisig's was so perfect, getting all that saliva in on my pinkies after having been caught by my mother doing some absolutely stupid sign while looking at a book has shown her that i've reached enlightment too, she walked out. To be honest i would have rather been caught doing something less… obscure..

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 19-4-2007(204): Someone in a **dreadful** _state of mind_ has crawled into his bed and is hiding under the sheets ( _linens_ ).
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 5-11-2007(58): From the Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy: **Dreadful** : (n) The _state of mind_ of a frood who doesn't have a _towel_ at his side.
column7: 3) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 7-9-2007(52): Being an android, _Data_ is white as a _sheet_. Doctor Crusher always has to remind herself that this is perfectly normal. From a doctor's perspective, he really does look **dreadful**.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(45): What would be your state of mind after seeing some linen animate and fly down a hallway (a ghost) ? Surely, full of dread. Hence, **dreadful**. Picture someone experiencing dread, trying to reach for the big switch on top of their head, to turn off their mind because they are so scared.
column9: 5) [[zardoz73](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zardoz73)] 29-8-2008(25): _Data_ goes to the holodeck and loads up **dread**. He's suddenly in a haunted gothic mansion, and a stereotypical ghost made of a mere **linen sheet** flies at him. "I do not understand this human emotion of dread. This is merely a sheet" he says.

column5: 1) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 19-9-2006(154): (re: wazzab) The _state of mind_ of the people of New Orleans as they examined their city's concert hall _laid waste_ can best described as **disconcerted**.
column6: 2) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 8-5-2008(93): When I am **disconcerted** my _state of mind_ is " _laid to waste_ ".
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 26-2-2008(50): Data walks in and sees Picard weeping. "What is the matter, Captain?" Picard looks up, and replies that his entire home planet has been _laid to waste_. Data, the master of tact, offers up this consolation: "Ah. I can see how that would be **DISCONCERT** ing". It turns out that the _flow of tears_ was really just because Picard had lost his chance at getting at some rare (and thus valuable) _flowers_ on his home planet.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(45): In this kanji we see a **disconcerted** as a mind which has been laid waste by a flood of contradicting information. Try to picture someone's head being flooded, looking left and right in disconcert, and the switch on top of their head turning on and off uncontrollably.
column9: 5) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 1-6-2007(38): _Data_ was **disconcerted** to find that he had been _laid waste_ in a robot scrap yard. "This is very disconcerting", he says in the calmest possible manner given his unfortunate predicament. Make sure you see him there, looking around trying to analyse how his Captain could have abandoned him.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 2-5-2007(186): "For all have sinned…" so _every_ one's _state of mind_ should be to **repent**.
column6: 2) [[smujohnson](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smujohnson)] 22-7-2008(115): When you **repent** , you heal your _state of mind_ by going over _every_ thing you regret doing.
column7: 3) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 16-10-2008(74): **Repent** : the state of mind that everyone here will share when they get their 2000 star trek stories mixed up.
column8: 4) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 10-1-2009(54): Data in the confessional: the minister says "repent every sin". Unfortunately for the minister, Data has perfect memory storage, so he really **repent** s EVERY sin. "On Jan 1, i stepped on a bacteria, on Jan 2 I forgot to put the toilet seat down…".
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-8-2007(50): An evangelical minister screams at _Data_ to, **Repent** of _every_ sin!!" Data just replies that there is not 'every' sin to **repent** from since as a robot, he cannot sin.

column5: 1) [[eriklc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eriklc)] 20-11-2005(209): Like the saying goes, **Hate** just begets **Hate**. A state of mind that just increases and increases until it explodes.
column6: 2) [[Rivvie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rivvie)] 17-2-2008(85): Your _state of mind_ would turn to **hate** when someone would take away a loved one that was _formerly_ yours.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-8-2007(55): _Data_ 's one true emotion is **hate** for _Prince's_ music. (Image: Data hunched over hands to his ears and screaming while Picard bobs to Purple Rain).
column8: 4) [[Captain+Kanjipants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Captain+Kanjipants)] 7-8-2011(47): **Hate** is the _state of mind_ that turned the man who was _formerly_ Anakin Skywalker into Darth Vader.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-10-2005(22): **Hate** is unfortunately a _state of mind_ on the _increase_ in today's society. You may picture **hate** as a green face with red eyes, multiplying wildly (see frame 501 “formerly”). If the mnemonic doesn't do the job, add the _state-of-mind_ switch.

column5: 1) [[narafan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/narafan)] 12-8-2007(147): Some hardcore monks have a _state of mind_ that has become **accustomed** to their self-torture through _piercing_ themselves.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 1-9-2007(119): It took him awhile, but Data finally got **ACCUSTOMED** to his _nipple/breast piercings_. They were constantly rubbing up against his shirt and his _heart- shaped locket_. Picture _Data_ , shirtless, squeezing his nipples in front of Picard and saying "Yes, at first they were a bit shelly, but I've grown quite **ACCUSTOMED** to them". That last bit should do it for you.
column7: 3) [[dsamari](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dsamari)] 21-1-2008(88): At first I thought that seeing people getting so many piercings was gross, but as time goes by your state of mind gets **accustomed** to it.
column8: 4) [[elanlan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elanlan)] 16-5-2009(46): The previous generations had the _state of mind_ that _piercings_ were outlandish, but now the general public has become **accustomed** to this practice.
column9: 5) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 3-3-2009(16): Through a trained **state of mind** one can become **accustomed** to being **pierce** d by sharp objects.

column5: 1) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 9-11-2007(345): At the _meeting of butchers_ , in their narrow _state of mind_ , they throw lame jokes around like, 'Oh hello, it's a **pleasure** to _meat_ you', and find this rather pleasing.
column6: 2) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 13-5-2008(77): Image : _Data_ attending a _meeting of the butchers union_. As a joke to begin his speech he says, 'Its a **pleasure** to MEAT you all.' (thanx to Shibo  & nestOr).
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 20-5-2008(62): Manson? Bundy? Jack the Ripper? Whichever killer or _butcher_ brings to mind the most graphic image (maybe a meeting of all of them?) - you won't forget this kanji as you peer into their deranged _state of mind_ : can't you just see their vacant stares and smiles on their faces, while they takes great **PLEASURE** in plying their trade? Creepy.
column8: 4) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 17-11-2005(27): A _meeting of butchers_ has dissolved into an orgy of blood-squirting violence. But since the killing _state of mind_ is the highest **pleasure** a butcher can experience, they are all smiles.
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-11-2009(22): **Pleasure** is the state of mind when flesh meets flesh (especially when one flesh is sabre-like).

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 10-5-2007(448): When I am in a **LAZY** _state of mind_ I use my _left_ hand to play with my _meat_ …it feels like someone else is doing it, which is good cause I'm to **lazy** to get a date.
column6: 2) [[iheckman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/iheckman)] 27-5-2008(174): When in a **lazy** state of mind, the things you need to do are left for next month.
column7: 3) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 24-10-2005(66): This may only work for me, but I just think that the left side of my body is the **lazy** side. It sometimes takes over and puts my whole body in a **lazy** state of mind.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-8-2007(61): _Data_ was just being **lazy** when he claimed the _left_ side of his _body_ had malfunctioned and he couldn't help.
column9: 5) [[dizzwave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dizzwave)] 15-7-2008(40): Picard notices that the Enterprise is off course, and shouts, " _Data_! I told you to turn _left_ at the _moon_! What happened?" Data replies, with his characteristic eyebrow-raise, "I don't know, sir. I just didn't feel like doing it. Is that what humans call…. **lazy**?".

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 27-10-2007(337): **Humility** is the _state of mind_ of accepting the _truth_ about yourself - both favorable and unfavorable. (tweaked version of Raichu's).
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-9-2006(95): **Humility** is a state of mind when you consider yourself in accordance with the truth (you neither boast nor demean yourself).
column7: 3) [[scout](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scout)] 6-12-2007(28): _Data_ , who is convinced he is perfect, is taught a lesson in **humility** when Riker shows him how to extract truth from someone by placing them on a _workbench_ and poking them in the _eye_ with a _needle_. Data just didn't understand how to play with the person's state of mind.
column8: 4) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 13-1-2009(26): **Humility** is **the state of mind** of accepting the **truth** no matter how much you don't like it.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-8-2007(24): _Data_ has great **humility** even though he knows more _truth_ than any human.

column3: _State of mind_ . . . _emotion_. Hint: the etymology of  " **remorse** " indicates a memory that returns again and again to "bite at" one's conscience and disturb one's peace of mind.
column5: 1) [[stauff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stauff)] 29-11-2005(258): _Remorse_ is the _state of mind_ where I feel bad for what I did while I was tired and _emotional_!
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 10-2-2008(191): Tip: If you are confusing this keyword, **remorse** , with [repent](../v4/625.html) (#625 悔) and [regret/resentment](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1460) (#1460 恨), then note that **rEMOrse** contains EMOtion.
column7: 3) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 6-10-2007(83): _Data_ feels **remorse** for stealing the human _emotion_ chip.
column8: 4) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 3-8-2008(38): _Data_ feels **remorse** for stealing the human _emotion_ chip. So, he takes it out. Then his **remorse** is gone so he puts it back in.. Then he takes it out. This could go on for a while, couldn't it? (thanks jamiemw!).
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(26): This kanji shows **remorse** (regret) as a mind filled with emotions from the past, coming back to “bite at” one's conscience and disturb one's piece of mind.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 29-4-2006(234): **Recollection** is about bringing ideas back to your mind.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-8-2007(103): _Data_ 's **recollection** powers are unparalled. He never loses a single _idea_.
column7: 3) [[AdamLeliel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AdamLeliel)] 9-8-2008(78): I have no **recollection** of my _state of mind_ from last night, dude… I must have been drunk or something. Do you have any _idea_ what I did last night, man?
column8: 4) [[vicnet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vicnet)] 20-8-2009(26): **Recollection** is the _state of mind_ where one brings _ideas_ back in one's mind.
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 31-1-2010(10): **Recollection** is a _state of mind_ where old _ideas_ are contemplated.

column5: 1) [[Gaignun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Gaignun)] 29-3-2011(24): When sitting through laser eye surgery, the surgeon _stretches_ open your _eye_ with a tight-fitting _tool_. The thought of a laser cutting through the lens of your eye within moments, and possibly blinding you in the case of a mishap, makes for a very **disquieting** _state of mind_.
column6: 2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 5-7-2010(22): **Disquiet** : The feeling _Data_ gets when they bring out the _eye- stretching_ tool to try to give him emotions by forcing him to watch disturbing movies (like they did to Alex in A Clockwork Orange).
column7: 3) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 8-12-2009(13): **dread** : Dread is the state of mind when you see the odd tool made of stretched human eyes.
column8: 4) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 24-12-2010(9): What is all that racket!? My _state of mind_ is **disquieted** by _extended tool_ use!
column9: 5) [[melchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/melchan)] 16-12-2011(5): **Disquieting** is the _state of mind_ you get after seeing a table full of _tools_ with little eyes staring at you.

column3: Think of the _state of mind_  you were in as a child with a particularly _juvenile_   **yearning**.
column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 11-11-2008(64): A paedophile's _state of mind_ is to **yearn** for _juveniles_.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 28-12-2007(24): A _juvenile's state of mind_ tends to go apeshit when they see something they **yearn** for. Usually involving jumping up and down, tantrums, and other bullshit. (Imagine giving them a big backhand across the face.).
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 15-11-2008(21): Whenever Data sees a computer he has a **yearn** ing to stand on top of it and act juvenile. He really has to control this **yearn** ing. Picture Data looking wistfully at a computer and imagining himself standing on top of it in a thought bubble to the right.
column8: 4) [[anragreg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/anragreg)] 17-6-2010(10): _Data_ **YEARN** S for _juveniles_ \- bad robot!
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-10-2008(9): The _state of mind_ of a _juvenile_ tends to **yearn** for things like fortune or fame.

column5: 1) [[FooSoft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FooSoft)] 1-1-2010(38): I'm in a _state of mind_ where I **desire** to see the _sun_ over the _capital_ for some nice _scenery_ for a change (no more rain!).
column6: 2) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 16-9-2010(16): Think of a commercial designed at making you **hanker** for the product they're advertising. See how they cleverly use that _scenery_ to put you in the _state of mind_ they desire.
column7: 3) [[algarich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/algarich)] 26-12-2010(6): A prison cell can be nice for a while, but after some time your _state of mind_ will change and you will **hanker** for more _scenery_.
column8: 4) [[aaroncp](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aaroncp)] 19-10-2011(3): I'm often in a _state of mind_ where I **desire** to see some beautiful scenery. That's why traveling is necessary to keep me in a good _state of mind_.
column9: 5) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 18-10-2010(3): The _scenery_ of Texas puts _Data_ in the _state of mind_ to **hanker** for a Roy's roast beef burger.

column3: _Graveyard_ . . . _valentine_. Note carefully the stroke order of the _valentine_ primitive.
column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 20-10-2006(256): **Pining** , yearn for… etc. Presumably for lost love. An easy one here, someone standing in the _graveyard_ , placing an old _valentine_ card amonst all the existing tributes.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-10-2005(54): Morticia and Gomez (of the “Addams Family”) are spending their _Valentine's_ Day at the _graveyard_ , **pining** for each other's affection.
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-6-2006(25): Remember the dead parrot from Monty Python's parrot's sketch? The shop owner said that the Norwegian Blue was **pining** for the fjords! But of course it should have been put in the _graveyard_ already. Poor buyer, he meant to give the bird away as a _valentine_ present…
column8: 4) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 15-2-2008(22): I am in the _graveyard_ **pining** for my lost _valentine_.
column9: 5) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 17-6-2008(15): Imagine an 'emo' kid **pining** away in a _graveyard_ because his _valentine_ didn't turn up… His emo make-up is running because he's crying now. (Emo kids like to hang out in graveyards 'because it's cool' or something and they were going to have a date there).

column5: 1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 7-9-2007(229): Hawaii is a little drop of _heaven_ nestled in the _waters_ of the Pacific, most often visited by honeymooners and valentines. It was **annexed** to the U.S.A. in 1959, and more recently to Japan as well– albeit only unofficially, and through private commercial holdings.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-11-2009(95): Tip 1: 天 and 夭 ( _heavens_ and _sapling_ ) are different, but RTK confuses them. Sapling appears in numbers 634, 938, 2078, 2079, 2080, and all characters containing _angel_ 喬 (429, 430, 1221, 2104, 2120, 2369). Tip 2: The kanji 添 means "something added/attached", so think of it as a building annex. Story: While in the **Annex** _water_ ing _saplings_ , you find a _valentine card_ amongst them – addressed to you!
column7: 3) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 3-3-2008(60): He drank all the holy water, so god **annexed** his heart to heaven.
column8: 4) [[Ceryn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ceryn)] 9-5-2008(51): First learn 忝 【ＧＲＡＴＥＦＵＬ】 (I was very GRATEFUL to have recieved a VALENTINE straight from HEAVEN.) It's a rare kanji used in かたじけない which means grateful. Then 添 【ＡＮＮＥＸＥＤ】 (You should be GRATEFUL the city just **ANNEXED** some land and is building a new WATER park.).
column9: 5) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 21-3-2008(47): You shed tears ( _water_ ) as your departed _valentine_ is **annexed** to the _heavens_.

column3: First note the stroke order of this character, which did not really evolve from the _heart_ , even though we take it that way. If one takes it as a pictograph "dividing" _the heart_ in half, then one has one of those **invariably** true bits of human anatomy: the fact that each _heart_ is divided into two halves.
column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 27-10-2007(203): You swear you'll be in love forever, but **invariably** there comes a time when your _heart_ is _divided_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-6-2008(97): For this kanji I **invariably** got the stroke order wrong. I nearly lost _heart_ , but decided to _stick_ (pun) to it. Then I noticed the order is 1) katakana ソ (altered slightly), 2) fishhook, 3) two drops. Now I **invariably** get it right.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 21-9-2009(71): A _stake_ through the _heart_ **invariably** kills a vampire. (As a primitive this can take the meaning ' **vampire** ').
column8: 4) [[Christoph](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christoph)] 16-8-2006(20): A heart that has been slashed becomes **invariably** altered forever.
column9: 5) [[matstc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matstc)] 14-1-2009(19): When you say 'cross my heart', you will **invariably** keep your word.

column5: 1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 22-10-2005(234): Anything full of _water_ will _invariably_ begin to **ooze**.
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 22-12-2007(85): When you pierce a _heart_ with a _stake_ , it _invariably_ **oozes** _blood_.
column7: 3) [[thegeelonghellswan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeelonghellswan)] 21-9-2008(29): The invariably divided heart is… oozing water? Is it crying because it is broken?
column8: 4) [[lee101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lee101)] 19-8-2010(15): Heisig, your a great man. Don't let people tell you overwise. Don't let them get you down ok?
column9: 5) [[nath04](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nath04)] 19-8-2009(10): When you _divide_ Michael Phelps' _heart_ , _water_ **ooze** s out instead of blood.

column3: Any way you count them, there are either too many or too few fingers to see a good pictograph of a **hand** in this character. But that it is, and so you must.
column4: * Keep to the etymology when using this kanji as a primitive: a single _hand_ all by itself.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-1-2007(99): This pictograph actually really works if you look at it as a **hand** with fingers spread and middle finger pointing down. see the very top stroke as the edge of a shirt cuff, and it will all come together.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 4-8-2009(86): A **hand** is useful for 千一 (1001) things.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-2-2007(33): Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die. (the 6-fingered man).
column8: 4) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 23-11-2006(13): Heisig says it's not a very good pictograph of a human **hand** , but it _is_ a good pictograph of a cartoon **hand**. Picture Mickey Mouse's distinctive white glove with its three fingers and a thumb. The kanji that use this element can also use _Mickey Mouse_ as a primitive element in place of _hand_.
column9: 5) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 4-5-2009(7): The slightly bent _nail_ went through _two_ of the **hand** 's fingers (this one is pretty easy to memorize).

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(255): It's a hot day of summer with a clear sky, you're sitting outside a cafe (or maybe on a reclining chair in the garden), and you **watch over** the kids with a hand covering your eyes from the sunlight (next time, don't forget the sunglasses).
column6: 2) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 10-10-2007(84): Think of the monster from Pan's Labrynth, that **watched over** the poor girl with _eyes_ in the palm of his _hands_.
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 10-4-2008(68): I picture a lifeguard standing in his tower with his **hand** over his **eyes** , **watching over** the swimmers below (might work better for Australians- picturing that distinctive yellow and red cap).
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 19-5-2007(42): My parents **watch over** me: whenever bad things are on the TV, they put a _hand_ over my _eyes_.
column9: 5) [[submacrolize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/submacrolize)] 13-6-2010(18): It's a Hamsa, that **hand** shaped trinket from the Middle East that **WATCHES OVER** the wearer and protects against the evil **eye**. If you've never seen one, check this out and this kanji is yours: <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamsa>.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(231): If you grind the _hemp_ without a stone but use your _hand_ instead it will **chafe**. (Image: "Robin, why are your hands all **chafe** d?" 'Uh… (I've been grinding hemp all day)').
column6: 2) [[Amadan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Amadan)] 9-7-2008(105): Imagine sliding down a _hemp_ rope, without gloves, just bare _hands_. **Chafe** s, doesn't it?
column7: 3) [[scout](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scout)] 8-12-2007(47): When the feds came to bust your little _hemp_ _grove_ , you jumped out the back side of the _cave_ and tried to repel down with a _hemp_ rope. Unfortunately, the rope **chafe** d your _hands_ and you fell .. ouch!
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-10-2005(12): Think of **chafe** in the sense of “friction” for this particular kanji. There are many garments made of _hemp_ (though maybe not gloves). Contemporary _hemp_ clothes are likely very comfortable, but for this story let's imagine rudimentary gloves which are coarse and rough like the unprocessed _hemp_ fiber, and hence, **chafe** your _hands_.
column9: 5) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 3-1-2010(7): Growing _hemp_ **chafe** s your _hand_ s.

column3: _Hand_ . . . _fiesta_. Note how the second stroke of the _hand_ is stretched across to double up as the first stroke of the tasseled arrow we use for _fiesta_. Compare to frames 17, 36, and 564.
column5: 1) [[GhettoPenguin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/GhettoPenguin)] 14-3-2007(498): Someone with a huge **EGO** is too good for any romantic partner and as such has nothing but personal " _hand_ _fiesta_ s" with himself every night.
column6: 2) [[frozach](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/frozach)] 1-8-2007(50): Did you hear about the guy who had such a big **EGO** that he threw a fiesta for his left hand?
column7: 3) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 15-12-2007(29): At a truly excellent gay _fiesta_ , _hands_ are used to stroke more than just each other's **egos**. Graphic, perhaps … maybe even disturbing for a few of you more prudish/phobic types … but damned if it won't stick this way.
column8: 4) [[haole](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/haole)] 21-1-2010(17): That guy has such a huge **ego**. He had to have a _hand_ in everything to do with planning the _fiesta_.
column9: 5) [[bigloui](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigloui)] 5-6-2006(12): The truly **ego** tistical prefer a _hand-fiesta_ to anything anyone else can give them. Ok, its not a lovely image, but its kind of memorable. Big **ego** : _hand-fiesta_.

column5: 1) [[jyoung](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jyoung)] 21-7-2006(388): Righteous Christians are sheep with egos (reworked from raulir, fixes word order to match radical order).
column6: 2) [[lynbroughton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lynbroughton)] 24-6-2007(87): Follow the path of **RIGHTEOUSNESS** like _sheep_ follow the shepherd , let go of your _ego_.
column7: 3) [[GhettoPenguin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/GhettoPenguin)] 2-7-2008(65): On the other hand, Woman tend to have too much self- _righteousness_ to allow any man to touch their wooly black _sheep_ this results in similar _hand_ _fiesta_ s.
column8: 4) [[alantin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alantin)] 4-11-2007(39): Putting the lamb of God ahead of your own ego and seeking His will before all else. This is true **righteousness**.
column9: 5) [[Clint](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Clint)] 12-5-2008(27): Christians believe one attains **righteousness** by elevating the Agnus Dei, or " _Lamb_ of God", above the whims of one's _ego_ (with thanks to axelb!).

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 1-4-2007(277): Careful **deliberation** produces _words_ of _righteousness_.
column6: 2) [[samusam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samusam)] 18-9-2007(72): At the worst of times, a jury's **deliberation** descends into a war of _words_ between competing self- _righteous_ , power-tripping bastards.
column7: 3) [[Lozza](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Lozza)] 27-9-2008(69): Picture Samuel L Jackson's character in Pulp Fiction carefully deliberating over what words to say to freak someone out before killing them. He even browses through a list of bible quotations for inspiration. Then he finds it!… "the path of the righteous man".
column8: 4) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 9-6-2009(30): WARNING: This does NOT mean **deliberation** as in careful consideration before decision. It is the other definition of **deliberation** : formal consultation or discussion, as in 議会 , the Diet. In the **deliberation** s of the diet, only _Righteous words_ are allowed. If you don't speak in _righteous words_ , they kick you out of the discussion.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 2-9-2007(30): [+yorkii] Socrates, the righteous man that he is, is **DELIBERAT** ing on whether or not the sheep in front of him has an ego. He is also **DELIBERAT** ing on whether or not to give the sheep a _hand fiesta_. Tempting….

column3: _Cow_ . . . _righteousness_. Do NOT use the image of an animal **sacrifice** here, as that will have it own character later on.
column5: 1) [[zwarte_kat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zwarte_kat)] 28-4-2007(262): A cow that is righteous **sacrifice** s her milk for the human race.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 2-9-2007(157): _Cows_ are truly _righteous_ animals. They **SACRIFICE** their milk so that we can have some. And if they don't have any left, they give a _sheep_ a _hand fiesta_ (good lord this is going too far) and give us that instead. What _righteous_ _cows_.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 26-5-2008(102): There are two kanji that need to be kept separate: this one and [animal sacrifice](../v4/1559.html) (#1559 牲). Think of it this way: here there is a _cow_ and a _righteous_ person (presumably a Hindu). One must be **SACRIFICE** d, so the righteous Hindu takes the place of the holy cow. But by the time frame 1559 rolls around, the Hindu is no longer alive to protect the cow, resulting in the _cow's life_ ending in an **animal **sacrifice****.
column8: 4) [[Rivvie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rivvie)] 18-2-2008(65): Vegetarians **sacrifice** eating steak ( _cow_ ) because they believe it is a _righteous_ thing to do.
column9: 5) [[MYRRIA](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MYRRIA)] 28-9-2008(16): In the old testament times, _COWS_ were **SACRIFICE** for _RIGHTEOUSNESS_.

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 29-6-2008(344): I like to **RUB** my FINGERS over my EXTREMITIES ….like my extremity-ly long, umm, hair…. This has been edited in response to being reported …you can change "hair" to whatever extremity-ly long body part you like.
column6: 2) [[forestsprite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/forestsprite)] 30-9-2007(114): When you're cold, your **RUB** your FINGERS over your EXTREMITIES vigorously to warm up a bit. I'd still rather go in for a warm fire and some hot cocoa, though.
column7: 3) [[samusam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samusam)] 18-9-2007(72): Picture Mr. Burn's **rub** bing the _extremities_ of his _fingers_ together and saying "excellent…".
column8: 4) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 21-5-2008(41): This is easy. What other _extremities_ could you possibly use to **RUB** something? We use our _fingers_ , of course. (I do appreciate the tendency to read perverted things into kanji, but sometimes a more logical approach is better).
column9: 5) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 21-7-2008(20): This means **rub** as in "rubbed out" or "erased."– 抹消 【まっしょう】 (n,vs) erasure, delete (e.g., DEL character), (P). 抹殺 【まっさつ】 (n,vs) erasure, denial, obliteration, ignoring (an opinion), (P) 抹茶 (P), 末茶 (iK) 【まっちゃ】 (n) powdered green tea for ceremonies, (P) STORY: Think of God using his huge FINGER to **RUB** OUT/ERASE the unnecessary EXTREMITIES of the world. Similarly to how a young child uses their finger to **rub** out an ant hole ant by ant.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-6-2009(129): Why carry a handkerchief? I **wipe** my nose _finger-style_.
column6: 2) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 6-11-2011(21): It is not my STYLE to use my FINGERS to **WIPE** my butt.
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 3-1-2007(15): If you are going to **wipe** your nose with your _fingers_ , better do it in a grand _style_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-10-2008(7): Using your _finger_ is just one _style_ of **wiping**. I use toilet paper.
column9: 5) [[EratiK](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EratiK)] 27-8-2011(5): We've all seen those hip-hop videos where they **wipe** their shoulder with their _fingers_ , and it's supposed to be the height of _style_.

column3: The sense of this key word is to pull or jerk, as in opening a door or making "ramen" noodles. Its elements: _fingers_ . . . _vase_.
column5: 1) [[Splatted](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Splatted)] 8-6-2011(40): He quickly **yank** ed his _finger_ s out of the _vase_. Maybe no one noticed the attempt to steal the cookies…
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 11-5-2010(16): As well as the meaning of 'taking captive', this also means 'crush' or 'batter'. One also often sees it written in Chinese, with the meaning "pull". (I think this is where 拉麺 comes from - 'drawn' or perhaps 'flattened' noodles.) My keyword is **crush** (I **crushed** my _fingers_ trying to lift a heavy _vase_ ) but **Ramen** or the other common use for this kanji in Japanese, **Latin** (it's the abbreviation for the Latin language) would also be appropriate, as they help you learn the reading (ラ).
column7: 3) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 17-1-2011(11): He **yank** ed his _finger_ out of the _vase_ upon discovering it had a venus fly trap in it.
column8: 4) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 25-12-2009(8): **kidnapper** : The kidnapper wraps his fingers around the vase and then smashes it on the kid’s head. They carry him away. He’s been kidnapped.
column9: 5) [[Dakoina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dakoina)] 2-9-2010(5): RTK supplement: **yank** : I _yank_ ed with my _fingers_ at my car's steering wheel to avoid hitting someone who was standing in the middle of the road carying a Ming _vase_. I ended up against a light pole. I was hoping that Chinese would still be intact, but the person got scared and let it fall down… in pieces…

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(214): When embracing someone, wrap your fingers around her butt for added effect. You may think of "bound with snakes" as a description of the fingers slithering around the buttocks, if you want a particularly graphic image.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 3-10-2007(64): Here, I'm picturing that scene from ET (the extra terrestrial), where ET hugs Elliot before leaving. You see that **EMBRACE** is ET's long FINGERS that WRAP around Elliot.
column7: 3) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 14-4-2008(41): Ladies, for a truly intimate **embrace** your _fingers_ should be _wrapped_ around your man's….imagine _binding_ his _snake_ with your fingers.
column8: 4) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 21-10-2009(34): King Kong's way to **embrace** Ann Darrow (the blond beauty) is to _wrap_ his _fingers_ around her. He is too huge to **embrace** her like everybody else.
column9: 5) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 7-8-2006(16): From 風の谷のナウシカ . Nausicaa is **embrace** d by the Ohm's _finger_ like tenticles. The effect is very similar to raulir's "bound with snakes" image.

column3: The key word refers to **boarding** vessels for travel. Its elements are: _finger_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _fit together_ (See frame 270).
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-1-2007(340): Ok, this is a little wierd, but i took this back to the kanji for [pagoda](../v4/254.html) (#254 塔). I think it helps simplify the image, and also helps anchor the pagoda kanji in memory better as an added bonus. say this aloud once, and i think it will bring out a vivid image very quickly: "Now **board** ing the _pagoda_ ride. Please keep your _fingers_ inside at all times…".
column6: 2) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 20-4-2006(86): When you **board** the ship on the way out from Hawaii a beautiful crewmember takes her _fingers_ and fits a lei around you ….a lei is _flowers_ _fitted together_ with your _fingers_.
column7: 3) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 22-10-2006(39): A romantic scene. The kanji is an illustration of that fact, because the [mouth](../v4/11.html) (#11 口) is above the [sword](../v4/83.html) (#83 刀).
