column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 15-8-2007(322): When a man **PROPOSE** S to a lady, he takes her FINGER and places the ring on it JUST SO, and the moment sweeps her away.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 23-4-2008(87): I tried to **propose** to my girlfriend, but the ring was too small to fit her _finger_. Instead of saying yes, she just uttered an annoyed sigh. So I rushed to the jeweler where he made it bigger. But now it was too big, so I rushed back to make it smaller. This spiel kept going on until the ring was finally _just so_. Her eyes lit up and she said yes.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 15-2-2007(38): When you **propose** , the ring you place on your fiance's _finger_ better be _just so_ (style/size/placement/etc.) or she'll reject your sorry ass.
column8: 4) [[zoletype](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zoletype)] 3-8-2009(33): Business proposals in Japan have to be set out just so. If you fail to lay them out in the correct way, you have to give up a finger, just like the yakuza. _NOTE_ This is not the same type of **propose** as to **propose** for marriage, so I opted for a different direction.
column9: 5) [[.David](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/.David)] 23-5-2011(14): You raise your _finger_ at a meeting, to **propose** things to be done _just so_. _NOTE_ This is not the same "propose" as to "propose for marriage".

column5: 1) [[tk2000](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tk2000)] 4-1-2007(298): Boss yells, "Who **damaged** the Xerox machine?!" _fingers_ of _employees_ point at one another.
column6: 2) [[wazato](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wazato)] 4-10-2007(107): If you finger your employee, you risk incurring many **damage** s from a possible sexual harassment lawsuit.
column7: 3) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 25-10-2010(62): An _employee_ lost a _finger_ in a workplace accident, and sued the company for **damage** s. (Don't confuse with [harm](../v4/1551.html) (#1551 害). 損 (そん) : loss, disadvantage, 損なう (そこなう) : to harm, to hurt, to injure, to **damage** , to fail in doing, 損失 (そんしつ) : loss.
column8: 4) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 11-9-2007(20): An _employee_ who takes the "five- _finger_ discount" (i.e., steals) can **damage** the business.
column9: 5) [[zwarte_kat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zwarte_kat)] 28-4-2007(15): In the industrial age employees always **damage** d their fingers. That's where the word **damage** comes from: when they **damage** d their fingers, they shouted: DAMN AGE!!! , hence the word **damage**.

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 28-4-2007(397): I tried to **PICK UP** the bowling ball…but my FINGERS didn't FIT in the holes.
column6: 2) [[elhnad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elhnad)] 2-2-2008(94): Try PICKING UP a girl by trying to FIT your FINGER in you know what… let me know how that works.
column7: 3) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 22-4-2008(54): When you are trying to **pick up** a girl, don't get too excited and start _fingering_ her before you have a _meeting of the mouths_.
column8: 4) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 13-4-2008(33): If it can FIT in your HAND, you can PICK IT UP.
column9: 5) [[cerulean](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cerulean)] 30-9-2008(17): To **Pick Up** something, your _FINGERS_ must _FIT_ around the object. — This is a basic rule for all primates.

column3: The key word of this frame refers to **shouldering** a burden of some sort. Its elements are: _fingers_ . . . _nightbreak_.
column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 13-5-2007(296): One of Hercules' labors was to hold the world in his _fingers_ for Atlas and not move until _nightbreak_ , **shouldering** the considerable burden.
column6: 2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 27-3-2007(78): One of the classic stories of **shouldering** a heavy burden is that of the kid who had to stick his _finger_ on a dam until _nightbreak_ to prevent it from breaking down.
column7: 3) [[styrmis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/styrmis)] 28-10-2007(56): A surgeon works 'til nightbreak, fingers working with precision, **shouldering** the responsibility of saving the life of the person on the operating table.
column8: 4) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 15-9-2006(42): **Shouldering** the heavy burden of supporting one's family you work your _fingers_ to the bone everyday till _nightbreak_ comes.
column9: 5) [[snozle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snozle)] 8-2-2009(31): Atlas: "Hey Hercules, my **shoulders** kind of hurt. Do you think you can take this globe off my **shoulders** until _nightbreak_ , I've got a date with Aphrodite? Hercules: "Of course, I can hold it with just my _fingers_!" Atlas: "Show off!" (thanks smithsonian).

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 17-11-2006(312): When rockclimbing, when your weight _disposes_ of the valuble **foothold** , all that's left is your _fingers_ keeping you from death. Meanwhile, your _walking legs_ are left dangling in the _wind_.
column6: 2) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 10-4-2008(174): Once you have a good **foothold** , you can _dispose_ of your _finger_ hold.
column7: 3) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 18-8-2008(30): If you lose your **foothold** you will have to hold on for dear life with your _fingers_ as your _legs_ are left dangling in the _wind_. (Inspired by aircawn.).
column8: 4) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 16-8-2009(25): Break this down into its component parts here. Think of rockclimbing: you must place your _fingers_ and _moving legs_ carefully, always finding a secure **foothold** so that that _wind_ can't knock you off the rock face.
column9: 5) [[howdycowdy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/howdycowdy)] 29-3-2008(16): While _disposing_ of trash into a particularly large dumpster, I lost my **FOOTHOLD** and was left dangling from the dumpster by my _fingers_.

column5: 1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 24-7-2007(173): A **sketch** is a [seedling](../v4/234.html) (#234 苗) of things to come. Before the assault, the sergeant draws a **sketch** of the attack with his fingers in the sand.
column6: 2) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 16-12-2006(125): I'm bad at drawing, so when I try to **sketch** the kanji for cat, you can sort of recognize it, but I don't get the curve of the "wild dogs" just right.
column7: 3) [[rosgmact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rosgmact)] 13-8-2007(68): You chop off one of your FINGERs and plant it like a SEEDLING, planning to **sketch** it daily to show its progress. Unfortunately, all your **sketch** es are the same - fingers don't grow like that, you see… plus one of your hands is now a bloody mess and **sketch** ing doesn't come too easily with a paw like that. All in all, a very bad idea which has done nothing to hone your artistic talent, in fact, you have only impaired it.
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 10-4-2008(57): Isn't _finger_ paint great? This kanji shows a kid _finger_ painting a **sketch** of a _flowery field_.
column9: 5) [[OddAndersen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/OddAndersen)] 17-4-2008(30): A **sketch** can be considered the _seedling_ of a full-fledged technical drawing. Contrary to the drawing itself, which require exact measures, rulers, compasses, etc., the **sketch** can be roughly drawn up using only your _fingers_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(232): Tip: _goods_ \+ _wood/tree_ : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it's worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest " _furniture_ " (a common type of _wooden goods_ ). REF: [parch](../v4/215.html) (#215 燥) , _maneuver_ (FRAME 671), [winding](../v4/1369.html) (#1369 繰), [seaweed](../v4/2035.html) (#2035 藻). Story: Using just a _finger_ you are trying to **maneuver** your _furniture_ round your room.
column6: 2) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 3-10-2007(147): Luke skywalker points his fingers and uses the force to **maneuver** the goods through the tree branches and up over the tree.
column7: 3) [[dat5h](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dat5h)] 27-5-2009(34): The rare kanji 喿 means "chirping birds." Therefore, why not use it since it occurs 4 times in Heisig? (note that it looks like a bunch of mouths up in a tree) Story: Think of _Thing_ from the Adam's family (just a _hand_ walking around) crawling around in a tree. He carefully **maneuver** 's (this way and that) in order to isolate and stalk his pray, the _chirping birds_. They are quite a nuisance and he **maneuver** s up close and snatches one in his _fingers_ , thus silencing its _chirping_.
column8: 4) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 28-11-2007(31): The apple/orange/coconut picker **maneuvers** his way around the _tree_ , grabbing the _goods_ with his _fingers_.
column9: 5) [[kuraujiokun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kuraujiokun)] 22-7-2009(19): Being good **maneuvering** using your _fingers_ in **Mario Kart** isn't enough! You still have to avoid all the _goods_ the other players throw at you and hitting the _trees_.

column5: 1) [[zenkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zenkun)] 11-3-2006(240): A pervert meets a _woman_. The pervert tries to **touch** the women with his lustful _fingers_. The _woman_ takes a _vase_ , lifts it over her head and smashes it on the pervert's head…
column6: 2) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 10-4-2008(221): CHIKAN!! These are the perverts who use their _fingers_ to **touch** _standing women_ on crowded trains.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(46): With a **touch** of his _fingers_ , a holy man cures a paralysed _woman_ and allows her to _stand up_ again.
column8: 4) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 18-7-2009(40): Heh, Can't believe i didn't think of this any earlier. <http://www.transitionsabroad.com/publications/magazine/0611/women_in_niger_carrying_water.jpg> This image is perfect, some woman need to **touch** , others don't. :) (Vase, bucket, same thinggg :P ).
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-11-2007(22): Notice: “Do not **touch**!” (please do not _finger_ the [concubine](../v4/2622.html) (#2622 妾)).

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(247): A _muchacho_ **puts up a notice** that says “NO FINGER SNAPPING ALLOWED. MUCHACHOS ON SIESTA”. The muchachos are sleeping soundly, completely oblivious to the sound of dogs barking, guitar playing and even gun shots. Now imagine one tourist passing by and snapping his _fingers_ and waking up all the _muchachos_ at once.
column6: 2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 13-4-2008(148): Just as I was finished **putting up** a "no _siestas_ " **notice** on my property, a muchacho gave me the _finger_ , sat down, and promptly fell asleep.
column7: 3) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(25): The Mexican piano tutor **PUT UP A NOTICE** that his _FINGERS_ were tired and that he was going to take an extended _SIESTA_.
column8: 4) [[elanlan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elanlan)] 18-6-2009(14): I used a _finger_ and a thumbtack to **put up** a sign on my door to notify others that I was taking a _siesta_ and was not to be disturbed. **(think finger = thumb[tack] and this kanji is easy)**.
column9: 5) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 29-8-2007(10): Keep your _fingers_ crossed when you go to a shop in Italy: you might see the shop owner **putting up a notice** : "closed because of _siesta_ ".

column5: 1) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 19-12-2007(161): Think RPG. The wizard points his _finger_ to the guard and the _ivy_ he has just animated with his _magic wand_ climbs down the wall to **hang** the poor guy, opening the way for the adventurers into the dungeon.
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 10-10-2005(105): 3 ways you could **hang** something: 1) the normal way, with your finger putting something on a hook or whatever, 2) **hang** ing from a vine the natural way, or 3) by means of the magic of the wand.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 28-5-2008(82): This kanji depicts 3 different ways to **hang** something: using your _fingers_ , using **hang** ing _ivy_ /rope, or with the flick of a _magic wand_. (much thanks to Darg Sama!).
column8: 4) [[Lozza](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Lozza)] 28-9-2008(44): Naked Tarzan is swinging through the jungle, gripping the ivy with his fingers, his wand **hang** ing out.
column9: 5) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 8-8-2009(21): ( **Warning** \- _really_ grotesque image ahead - **Warning** ) Use your _fingers_ to wrap the _ivy_ rope around the convict's neck, and then see if there is any truth to the story about a man's, ahem, _magic wand_ becoming swollen when executed by **hang** ing.

column3: Let your _fingers_  do the _walking_  as you **make headway**  through the Yellow Pages in search of something hard to find.
column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 1-5-2007(81): "Come on people, the only way to **make headway** in this business is to let your _fingers_ do the _walking_!" bust out the yellow pages and dial as many numbers as possible, surely someone is a sucker for a cold call sell.
column6: 2) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 18-8-2009(15): You can't just point with a _finger_ and **make headway** , you have to actually walk* there.
column7: 3) [[Puchatek](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Puchatek)] 25-7-2011(10): _Walking_ on your _fingers_ it's really difficult to **make headway** \- any progress at all is very slow.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-10-2008(7): Even if you _walk_ with your _fingers_ , it's important to continue to **make headway** and never give up.
column9: 5) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 22-11-2009(4): The best way to **MAKE HEADWAY** , is to let your FINGERS do the WALKING.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 15-5-2007(218): My _stones_ are so huge that it takes _two hands_ to **polish** them!
column6: 2) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 30-1-2007(184): You use two hands to **polish** a stone: one to hold it and the other to rub it.
column7: 3) [[wazzab](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wazzab)] 18-2-2007(37): Scene from Karate Kid: Wax on (with one hand), wax off (with the other). But instead of using cloth he's using stones in his hand.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-9-2009(23): Cinderella **polishing** the _stone_ floor with _both hands_.
column9: 5) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 6-3-2010(15): To **polish** a katana you need two things: finest grade of **polishing** _stones_ , and of course _two hands_. If you accidentally chop one off, your career as sword **polish** er is over. (once again I'm using this to remember the order of the elements - first stone, then two hands).

column5: 1) [[TedLyons](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TedLyons)] 27-11-2007(189): Two hands, fiesta…..when moses received the ten **commandment** s with two hands, he went back down the mountain and threw a fiesta with the jews, celebrating the arrival of the **commandment** s.
column6: 2) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 14-10-2007(129): When Moses returned with the **commandments** in his _hands_ he saw that his people were throwing a _fiesta_. At first he was excited. Then he looked around and got pissed. "Awww, c'mon guys. Golden idols? Really?".
column7: 3) [[wazato](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wazato)] 4-10-2007(69): The little-known 11th **commandment** : thou shalt have a two-handed fiesta every Saturday night. That's why Sunday is supposed to be a day of rest.
column8: 4) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 4-6-2008(64): The 11th **commandment** : thy girlfriend shalt give thou _two-hand_ ed _fiestas_ every night.
column9: 5) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 3-3-2008(27): The last unofficial **commandment** "Throw your hands in the air like you just don't care and _fiesta_!

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(67): The _king_ used _both hands_ to **tinker with** himself in his spare time.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-6-2007(20): Picture the king holding a large pan in his two hands and tinkering with it, wishing he could lead the itinerant life of a tinker. As a rhyme: The _king_ , he uses his _two hands_ , To **tinker with** his pots and pans . . .
column7: 3) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 9-11-2009(15): Tinker seems to imply mending or working at something, which is wrong. This is more like "to trifle with". (The meaning of "to trifle with" is sufficiently different from "trifle" that there should be no confusion). The king can trifle with anything using his two hands (be it objects, his subjects, or himself).
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 21-11-2008(7): When something new is invented, the king is always the first to be able to **tinker with** it. So picture yourself looking up at the _king_ with _both hands_ holding your new invention, only to have it **tinkered with** and broken by the king who would say nothing more than "oh dear".
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 10-4-2007(5): The _king_ wore jewels on _both hands_ that had been **tinkered with** so that they contained poison.

column5: 1) [[akimoto](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akimoto)] 12-2-2007(435): The ten commandments were heavy. So to help carry them, Moses made a wooden **contraption** , the ark of the covenant.
column6: 2) [[FutureBlues](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FutureBlues)] 17-6-2008(64): Think of a complex _wood_ en **contraption** capable of giving you a _two- handed_ _fiesta_.
column7: 3) [[zz_alex_zz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zz_alex_zz)] 16-10-2007(40): In the medieval days, all who broke the _commandment_ s were locked up in a _wood_ en **contraption**. (AKA _Wood_ en Stocks).
column8: 4) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 14-10-2007(15): _Tree_ beard's _commandment_ was that the ents destroy Sauromans layer and all of the magical **contraption** s therein.
column9: 5) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 4-5-2009(12): The 12th _commandment_ : Thou shalt create a **contraption** for masturbation out of _wood_ large enough for God to use. You have 24 hours. Good luck.

column3: Let me share a rather grotesque image to help with this kanji. Imagine taking your _two hands_ and reaching up into someone's _nostrils_. Once inside you grab hold of the _brain_ and yank it out. At the end, you would have a picture something like that of this character, the full kanji for **nose**.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-12-2007(220): An Egyptian embalmer reaching _both hands_ into the dead pharaoh's **nose** and yanking out handfuls of _brain_.
column6: 2) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 14-8-2008(104): I sneezed so hard that through my **NOSE** I blew out my BRAINS into BOTH HANDS.
column7: 3) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 6-6-2006(36): Remember when you had the flu, and you were sneezing all the time? I bet you thought that you could end up holding your _brain_ in _both hands_ after it was spitted from your running _nose_!
column8: 4) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 2-5-2006(15): An addition to Heisig's story in order to remember the position of the elements: Everyone hates people that turn their **nose** s 'up' at people. This provides motivation to reach in through that turned up **nose** and drag out those brains with both hands.
column9: 5) [[ludd1t3_sp4nn3r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ludd1t3_sp4nn3r)] 8-5-2008(13): _Oneself_ may experience hay fever from _rice fields_ requiring _two hands_ to cover the **nose** while sneezing.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-12-2006(254): This kanji is for _severe_ **punish** ment. A man has his shackled _hands_ placed on a wood block and they're chopped off with a _saber_. No more stealing bread in the Middle East…
column6: 2) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 14-8-2008(111): In Arab countries they **punish** theives by cutting off BOTH HANDS with a SABRE.
column7: 3) [[osaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/osaki)] 20-6-2007(45): I'm gonna use my two hands and my saber to **punish** you naughty girls!
column8: 4) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 14-6-2008(23): The ancient **punish** ment for theft was to have the thief's _two hands_ chopped off by a red-hot _sabre_. To distinguish from [penalty](../v4/833.html) (#833 罰), think in terms of 'to **punish** ', the actual -application- of the **punish** ment, which only comes after deciding what the penalty shall be.
column9: 5) [[Alexis598](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Alexis598)] 3-2-2012(10): This is Saber from Fate/Stay Night holding her Excalibur with both hands dealing Divine **Punish** ment to the evil Servants!

column3: _Punish_ . . . _soil_. In cases like this, you might find it easier to break the character up into its more basic elements, like this: _two hands_ . . . _saber_ . . . _soil_.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(231): A famous ninja once pressed his _two hands_ and _saber_ into the _soil_ of his temple, before going onto a mission from which he never came back. Think of some sort of signature that he left behind him. The **mould** of his two hands and saber has since become a popular attraction in the area.
column6: 2) [[Ceryn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ceryn)] 5-6-2008(103): As a PUNISHMENT they made me lay face down in the DIRT leaving a nice imprinted **MOULD** of my whole BODY.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-2-2007(44): Did you know there's a street in Japan like Hollywood Blvd. where famous ninjas press their _hands_ and _sword_ (which are famously deadly) into the _sidewalk(soil)_ to form a **mould**?
column8: 4) [[tgray88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tgray88)] 23-10-2008(28): When you are **mould** ing clay, you are in fact _punishing_ the _ground_ by folding, pressing, and hardening the **mould**.
column9: 5) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 7-5-2008(17): On the fifth day God did _punish_ the _soil_ by **molding** it into man.

column3: Whatever one is particularly adept at - one's special " **genius** " \- one can do very easily, "with one finger" as the phrase goes. This kanji is a pictograph of that one finger. Note how its distinctive form is created by writing the final stroke of the element for _fingers_ backwards.
column4: * The primitive meaning, _genie_ , derives from the roots of the word _genius_. Use the _genie_ out in the open when the primitive appears to the right of or below its relative primitive, in that case it also keeps its same form. At the left, the form is altered, and the meaning becomes a _genie in the bottle_.
column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 31-10-2007(143): Spinal tap: "Every other band's amps go to _ten_. But you see my _extra stroke_ of **genius** \- these go to eleven.".
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 29-6-2008(133): A TEN year old had a STROKE of **GENIUS** and wrote this joke: [何歳ですか？](midori://search?text=何歳ですか？) [。。。天才です！](midori://search?text=。。。天才です！) .
column7: 3) [[osaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/osaki)] 20-6-2007(52): Ten is ten, but add a stroke of **genius** and…
column8: 4) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 20-1-2009(48): Oooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo! **Genius**!
column9: 5) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 7-9-2006(24): I use Azumanga Daioh's Mihama Chiyo-chan for this. Not only is this character "genius", but it is also the simplified "years old" counter, one which children use instead of 歳 . I can imagine Chiyo-chan saying: [「十才ですよ」](midori://search?text=「十才ですよ」) "I'm ten years old." Ten-year-old **genius**? 十才天才 .

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 31-10-2007(257): If you're a _money genius_ , you can afford a lot of **property**.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(116): The keyword refers to **property** in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership” : “They're mines, my **property**!”.
column7: 3) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 23-11-2008(81): **Property** comes in several forms, shells (money) and intellectual **property** (genius).
column8: 4) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 21-6-2007(17): A genius with money LEFT over buys **property**.
column9: 5) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 8-10-2009(15): To gain a lot of **property** , you need either a _genie_ or to be a _genius_. The _clam_ is there to emphasize that this character is more about financial **property** or funds than real estate.

column5: 1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 3-8-2008(205): A TREE GENIUS is a **LUMBER** jack. Duh.
column6: 2) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 3-10-2007(63): Just when the were about to turn the last tree into **lumber** , the Lorax (the _tree-genie_ ) jumps out and puts a stop to the whole affair.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 21-1-2007(47): The _genie_ turns the **lumber** back into a _tree_.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(38): Here we have a _wood-genie_ or _tree-genie_ , dancing and singing the popular song from the Monthy Pythons : “I'm a **lumber** jack and I'm O - K, I sleep all night and I work all - day” … “I cut down trees, I eat my lunch, …”, etc. – "the _tree-genie_ is a **lumber** kack (and he's O K)".
column9: 5) [[rachels](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rachels)] 1-2-2010(27): This can be remembered as a pictograph = 2 trees, one of which, has had a branch cut off to make **lumber**.

column3: _Genie in the bottle_ . . . _a child_. Hint: focus on the key word's connotation of  "make believe".
column5: 1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 4-5-2008(269): How do you **suppose** they manage to cram a genie inside a bottle? Well, I **suppose** they put him in there while he's still a little _child_ …
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(110): Villagers on a little remote island one day find a bottle washed out by the sea onto the beach. After wiping the bottle and taking a closer look, they are amazed to see a (very small) _child_ in it. The villagers **suppose** that the _child_ is a _genie in a bottle_.
column7: 3) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 21-11-2007(51): **Suppose** a _genie in a bottle_ granted a child 3 wishes, that'd be great eh?
column8: 4) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 20-12-2007(42): Only _children_ **suppose** _genies_ are for real.
column9: 5) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 8-10-2009(33): A _genie in a bottle_ is **suppose** d to grant you three wishes (one for each stroke of the _genie_ primitive). Every _child_ knows ( ご存じ ) that.

column5: 1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 24-7-2007(276): Genie in the bottle does **exist** but you need to dig deep into the soil to find one.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 24-1-2008(66): You wipe the _soil_ from the bottle, only to have a genie float out above you, saying: 'I am the _genie in a bottle_ , what is your wish?' So now you know that they do **exist**.
column7: 3) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 13-3-2006(46): Genies don't **exist**! If you open the _"genie in a bottle"_ you'll find nothing but _soil_.
column8: 4) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 2-6-2008(22): Only one extra stroke separates this from [pressure](../v4/152.html) (#152 圧). // If _genies_ do **EXIST** in bottles, they must certainly be crammed in them under extreme pressure ( 圧 ). If you really want to make sure that they do **exist** , be sure to clean the _dirt_ off the lamp and give it an 'extra stroke' to find out!
column9: 5) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 14-10-2007(18): When Aladin discovered the _magic bottle_ , he rubbed it and nothing happened. He then concluded that genies did not **exist**. However, upon arriving home, he saw that the spout was filled with _soil_. After cleaning the bottle the genie emerged and disperesed the skeptical Aladin's doubts.

column3: This pictograph of a clenched fist is another of the "hand primitives." Take note of its rather peculiar drawing. Try to think of drawing a _fist_ (the primitive meaning)  " **from** " this character to give yourself a connotation for the otherwise abstract key word.
column4: * The primitive meaning is taken from the pictograph: a _fist_.
column5: 1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 18-10-2007(218): **FROM** a pictograph of a thumbs up. That's how it also gets the primitive meaning of fist.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(86): Pictograph, see book. This kanji, as a chinese character, is in fact the origin for the hiragana possessive particle “no”. Try drawing this kanji fast, in a single stroke and you will end up with の .
column7: 3) [[mhheie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mhheie)] 6-3-2008(46): Think Charlton Heston: " **From** my cold, dead fists". Speech given to the National Boxing Association, in response to stricter control on boxing gloves.
column8: 4) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 29-1-2008(25): Imagine fists punching at you **from** all angles.
column9: 5) [[Captain+Kanjipants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Captain+Kanjipants)] 7-8-2011(21): **FROM** s up!

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 17-7-2006(363): This character is the "kei" in "keitai" (cell phone), a word you will no doubt hear often in Japan, since everyone has one. Imagine you've just arrived in Japan, but don't have a cell phone yet, so instead you're carrying around a **portable** turkey you can hold in your fist. To dial a number, just poke it with your fingers.
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 5-4-2007(116): Because they have no _fingers_ , _turkeys_ must use their _fists_ when dialing on a **portable** phone.
column7: 3) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 22-6-2009(36): This character is the "kei" in "keitai" (cell phone), a word you will no doubt hear often in Japan, since everyone has one. I use my keitai with my FINGERS, like everyone, but if some TURKEY try to steal it, I don't hesitate to use my FIST .
column8: 4) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 8-8-2006(19): Some TURKEY has been sitting in the **PORTABLE** toilet forever. I pound my FIST on the door. Finally he comes out and gives me the FINGER.
column9: 5) [[terebijoke](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/terebijoke)] 16-2-2012(16): What do you do with your **portable** keitai? Play ANGRY BIRDS, of course! You use you **fingers** to drag the birds across the screen. How do you know these birds are angry? Just picture a **turkey** scowling and shaking his **fist** at you.

column3: The addition of a final stroke transforms this character from the primitive for a clenched _fist_ into the kanji for **reaching out** , much as a stroke of kindness can often turn anger into acceptance.
column4: * As a primitive, this shall stand for _outstretched hands_. Only take care not to confuse it with that for _beg_ (Frame 501)
column5: 1) [[Killersquierl](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Killersquierl)] 22-11-2007(103): I like to think of this as a _fist_ with with brass knuckles because of the extra line. An old school thug **reaches out** to help you up but then with his other hand ( with the brass knuckles) punches you.
column6: 2) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 28-7-2008(97): **Reach out** and fist someone (Do you see the person primitive?).
column7: 3) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 29-3-2007(49): I like to think of the MATRIX. Now hear me out… Remember the scene when Neo and Mr. Smith fought in the subway? there was this one part where Mr. Smith threw his _FIST_ at Neo, but Neo stopped it. Mr. Smith **reached out** his finger (the line coming from fist) and hit Neo in the throat.
column8: 4) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 14-10-2009(38): This is an image of the fist getting an arm (the new stroke). The FIST now **reaches out** farther than before.
column9: 5) [[Asriel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asriel)] 16-3-2009(15): Dhalism (Street Figher) can **reach out** his _fist_ an _extra stroke_ farther than anyone else, even if their _hands are outstretched._.

column3: _Mouth_ . . . _outstretched hands_. Hint: use the image of a nursing baby.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-1-2006(174): An _open mouth_ and _reaching hands_ : a baby wants to **suck** at his mother's breast.
column6: 2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 24-2-2007(142): Imagine a baby reaching out and holding mom's breast as if it were bottle, and **suck** ing on it to get some milk.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 3-6-2008(54): It's a terrible image, but I see a baby _reaching out_ to her mother's breasts, wanting to **suck** le some milk with her _mouth_. Meanwhile, her mother is **suck** ing back on a cig with total disregard to her child's health. / Thanks Proxx: This is also the kanji for すう ( 吸う ), used for "to smoke [a cigarette]".
column8: 4) [[jwy2k2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jwy2k2)] 2-4-2007(40): Reach out and **suck** someone.
column9: 5) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 30-8-2007(27): To **suck** : open your _mouth_ and _reach out_ for you-know-what… (see also [handle](../v4/690.html) (#690 扱)).

column5: 1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 30-8-2007(192): See [suck](../v4/689.html) (#689 吸): if it's too big to **handle** , just use your _fingers_ instead…
column6: 2) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 6-10-2007(131): One of the first thing a baby can do with his hand is to _reach out_ and grab your _finger_ as if it was a little **handle**.
column7: 3) [[paddy71](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paddy71)] 7-2-2008(60): **Handle** with care… carefully hold the Nitroglycerin within your fingers with outstretched hands for fear of it blowing up in your face…
column8: 4) [[nagisa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nagisa)] 18-5-2007(51): A toddler reaching up with OUTSTRETCHED HANDS for a mug sitting on the table, just barely out of his reach. Straining, he can just barely get his FINGER to brush the **handle**.
column9: 5) [[tomtosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomtosh)] 22-6-2009(42): Pay attention to this story because you'll learn how to recall the reading of this kanji as well: We've all heard the expression: "Too hot to **handle** " – Well, just imagine you are _reaching out_ your _fingers_ to touch someone's face and it is too hot to **handle**. (Then you can combine the word for hot (atsui) with the word for face (kao) and always remember how this character is read: atsukau - あつかう.).

column3: The **length** whose measure this kanji depicts extends from the tip of one hand to the tip of the other with _arms_ at full length. Notice the final stroke, which cuts across the vertical second stroke to distinguish it from _large_ (Frame 112).
column5: 1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 14-9-2007(197): Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length.
column6: 2) [[samesong](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samesong)] 29-8-2008(67): When girls ask about my **length** , I hold out my _one arm_ , and tell them "you get the idea".
column7: 3) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 15-4-2008(57): This kanji reminds me of the kanji for big (I think it looks the same kinda of except for the last stroke). Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare "length" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn't show "it" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your **length**. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! I just find it easier to relate this to the previous kanji.
column8: 4) [[fragileshards](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fragileshards)] 29-11-2007(37): This kanji demonstrates the proper technique for throwing a bowling ball the **LENGTH** of the alley. Stroke 1- lift the ball up horizontally to judge the throw Stroke 2 - gently swing the arm back Stroke 3 - whip your arm forward and roll the ball off the tips of your fingers Strike!
column9: 5) [[fruitangel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fruitangel)] 4-1-2009(23): ONE ARM **LENGTH**.

column3: A mouth . . . tucked under the arm.
column5: 1) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 24-11-2007(253): I sleep in **history** class with my _mouth tucked under my arm_.
column6: 2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 3-9-2007(118): **History** students usually going to school with a **history** book tucked under their arm. But now instead of a book, you have a small talking mouth that tell you about **history**. "When I was young, I used to walk 5 miles everyday…..".
column7: 3) [[bigspenderJ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigspenderJ)] 2-3-2007(76): **History** is told by one mouth, the winner's. The loser's opinion is not told and is tucked under the arm (silenced ) by the winner.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 24-1-2008(27): You've got your Hogwarts Magic **History** book in time for the semester, but with its ferociously snapping _mouth_ , you can't just _tuck it under the arm_ and carry it to class.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 3-8-2006(17): Someone with big arms goes to a museum and picks up an historian at the entrance, _tucks it under his arm_ , and proceeds with the visit. The historian is like a _mouth_ _tucked under the arm_ , telling the big man all he needs to know about **history**.

column3: One . . . mouth . . . tucked under the arm.
column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 5-10-2006(325): _One_ **officer** can change the course of _history_.
column6: 2) [[mhheie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mhheie)] 24-3-2008(95): _One_ **officer** , namely Napoleon, changed the course of _history_. (Thanks, ayoung24). Napoleon is also my primitive meaning.
column7: 3) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 1-7-2007(37): In a police state, the police **officer** s all speak with _one mouth_ and have a gun tucked _under their arm_.
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 3-7-2011(26): This is not [military officer](../v4/1095.html) (#1095 尉), but more of a government **officer** , official or bureaucrat, such as Barack Obama, who started out as a lowly government **officer** (communitee organizer) and the broke through the glass _ceiling_ to become president of the United States and make _history_ (I know a glass ceiling generally refers to an obstacle for women, but I wanted to avoid key words such as [woman](../v4/98.html) (#98 女), [lady](../v4/1151.html) (#1151 婦) or [feminine/female](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/563) (#563 雌)).
column9: 5) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 3-10-2006(20): I used HISTORY as a primitive rather than separating it into 'mouth' and 'tucked under the arm'. Think about the Japanese history textbook controversy. The government **OFFICER** S choosing the textbooks are the ONE elite group determining Japan's HISTORY.

column3: The implication behind the meaning of **grow late** is that things are changing in the same way that the day turns into night. The elements: _ceiling_ . . . _sun_ . . . _tucked under the arm_.
column5: 1) [[perfecturbo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perfecturbo)] 28-6-2006(235): It's starting to **GROW LATE** , so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he'll bring it back, so don't worry.
column6: 2) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 24-7-2007(106): At [nightbreak](../v4/30.html) (#30 旦) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm.
column7: 3) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 24-11-2007(78): I keep _one sun tucked under my arm_ for light when it grows late.
column8: 4) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 27-10-2005(29): As it begins to **grow late** the _sun_ projects the shadow of my _arm_ on the _ceiling_.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 2-3-2011(27): When it is **growing late** , the _sun_ sinks below the _floor_. Time to tuck your belongings _under your arm_ and head home. 更ける (ふける) : get late, advance, wear on, 更に (さらに) : furthermore, again, after all, more and more, moreover, 変更 (へんこう) : change, modification, alteration, 夜更け (よふけ) : late at night.

column5: 1) [[Deborah](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Deborah)] 12-11-2007(256): A **stiff** drink on the _ROCK_ s after it _GROWS LATE_ is a way to unwind after a long day…
column6: 2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 11-7-2006(113): _Stones_ are so **stiff** that even if you spent all day straining trying to change their shape, it would _grow late_ far before you ever accomplished your task.
column7: 3) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 1-9-2007(97): There's a city whose inhabitants **stiff** en and turn to _stone_ every night when it _grows late_.
column8: 4) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 23-4-2008(74): My girlfriend started playing with my _stones_ when it was _growing late_ , and I got a **stiff** y.
column9: 5) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 24-5-2008(39): The trolls took so much time discussing how to cook their meal that it _grew late_ : they all became **stiff** and turned to _stone_.

column3: This character refers originally to a deciduous, rough tree that grows on mountain plains. From this it gets the secondary sense of rugged or **spiny**. Its primitive elements: _tree_ . . . _grow late_.
column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 13-6-2007(64): I learned this one from the movie Evil Dead, but when it _grows late_ , _trees_ change shape and become **spiny** creatures! Lesson: don't go out at night.
column6: 2) [[Gwindarr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Gwindarr)] 13-6-2008(15): As it grows late, Lakitu retires for the evening, leaving the **spiny** s to fend for themselves against Mario. Picture them jumping out of trees instead of being hurled from Lakitu. Lakitu - is the guy who flys the cloud in the Mario games…
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(11): Usually the _tree_ you bump into when it _grows late_ happens to be **spiny**.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 27-10-2010(4): 梗概 , 梗塞 , 心筋梗塞 , 桔梗 , [spiny](../v4/2498.html) (#2498 梗) コウ, キョウ … Parts: 木 , 更 [grow late](../v4/694.html) (#694 更) … Story: Since this is used for infarction ( 梗塞 ), and myocardial infarction ( 心筋梗塞 ), the **Spiny** should tie into that. So when it _Grows Late_ , and the old guy gets _Wood_ , he has a **myocardial infarction** that feels like a **Spiny** monster grabbing his heart.
column9: 5) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 10-3-2013(2): INFARCTION (new keyword, according to real meaning). If it GROWS LATE and you get an INFARCTION, have someone call an ambulance. In the meantime try to relax, stay under a TREE.

column3: Like the several abbreviations in Roman script to indicate "and" (+, &, etc.), this short two-stroke kanji is used for the similar meaning of **or again**.
column4: * As a primitive, it will mean _crotch_ , as in the _crotch_ of the arm. Or whatever.
column5: 1) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 1-8-2008(155): This keyword should really be "again" not "or again" Here is some context: think of the phrase "Jya mata" " じゃ又 " which is a farewell similar to "then again". Also "Mata ne" " 又ね " and mata ashita (again tomorrow) " 又明日 "。 Note this kanji is rarely used, most of the time JP people spell it out "mata" except for in the last example: 又明日 .
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-4-2007(132): After her boyfriend's _crotch_ has been satisfied, a woman might suggest they cuddle. The boyfriend, on the other hand, might say, " **Or again** , we could fool around . . . ".
column7: 3) [[tomtosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomtosh)] 26-9-2007(62): The crotch is the area of vital " **or again** s". (Organs, that is.).
column8: 4) [[zenkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zenkun)] 12-3-2006(23): As a primitive, instead of using "crotch", I also often use "sat cross-legged" as this also looks like the kanji.
column9: 5) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 9-1-2009(17): I agree with bodhisamaya and sindhikara, this kanji is more like just "again". You can change this kanji to "again" if you change [ again FRAME 1815 ] to Re- , which is it's real meaning anyways. Also, beware of too many penis euphemisms. Associating crotch with penis is not too bad, but if you associate column, meat, gigantic, etc. with penises, you might find yourself confused as to which euphemism you meant.

column5: 1) [[felicitygreen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/felicitygreen)] 1-4-2006(298): The animals boarding Noah's Ark all came in **pair** s – but Noah had to carefully check the two crotches in each **pair** to ensure that the animals were of different sexes and thus able to further their species after the flood.
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 23-11-2006(113): _Crotch to crotch_ is how many **pairs** spend their private time together. . .
column7: 3) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 4-10-2006(24): Instead of bringing home 1 girl and enjoying her CROTCH, it's better to bring home a **PAIR** of girls and enjoy 2 CROTCHES!! I've done this several times so I'll remember this kanji easily.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 18-2-2007(16): The left _crotch_ looks more like the man's and the right a woman's, the ultimate **pair**.
column9: 5) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 21-4-2008(11): Hey buddy, grow a **pair**! (two testies) Oops, one is kind of misshaped. :0.

column3: _Crotches_ , _crotches_ everywhere . . . _tree_. Hint: think of a group of children playing an original version of  "Here We Go 'Round the **Mulberry** Bush. "
column5: 1) [[dilandau23](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dilandau23)] 5-11-2006(228): Children going around the **mulberry** _tree_ singing "This is the way we wash our _crotch_ , wash our _crotch_ , wash our _crotch_ …".
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 1-11-2007(97): Imagine kids _all over_ the top of a **mulberry** _tree_ , sitting astride limbs so that their weight is on their _crotches_. (Mulberry trees have big sprawling limbs that run horizontally or at shallow angles making them easy to climb and sit in. I have an old **mulberry** in my yard, and my kids are in it constantly).
column7: 3) [[howdycowdy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/howdycowdy)] 2-4-2008(37): According to Wikipedia, "unripe [MULBERRY] fruit and green parts of the plant have a white sap that is intoxicating and mildly hallucinogenic." When looking at the **MULBERRY** _tree_ , some have hallucinated that they are seeing _crotches, crotches everywhere_!
column8: 4) [[strider62590](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/strider62590)] 9-7-2009(21): Mulberries taste like crotch. This is a pictograph of the crotchberry tree. Look at all the ripe berries up top!
column9: 5) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 12-12-2008(13): Do you see the three students _sitting cross-legged_ on the _tree_ eating **mulberry**?

column3: The key word indicates the Japanese generic term for counting ships. Its elements: _turkey_ . . . _crotch_.
column5: 1) [[perfecturbo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perfecturbo)] 28-6-2006(308): On **Vessels** that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the **VESSELS** , but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's CROTCH.
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 23-12-2007(129): Donald Duck is a _big bird_ that does _not wear pants_. It's good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count **vessels**.
column7: 3) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 30-1-2007(69): The turky's crotch is a vessel for the stuffing that you fill it with.
column8: 4) [[peterlasky](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peterlasky)] 7-7-2009(35): The USS Turkeycrotch is a seaworthy vessel.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(16): An ole' pirate _turkey_ sits _astride_ the prow of a vessel (i.e. with his _crotch_ on the prow). Recall from PAGE 211 the old turkey with pipe and monocle : now he takes off his monocle and uses a “field-glass” to count other **vessels** (pirate ships) on the horizon (this kanji is also a counter for ships).

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-3-2006(203): Think of the _flower-vessels_ as a the Greenpeace vessel “Arctic Sunrise”, only instead of a rainbow there is a big _flower_ painted on the hull (this will come back in [seize](../v4/701.html) (#701 獲) and [harvest](../v4/908.html) (#908 穫)). Think of “flower-power” and of the “peace” in “Greenpeace” and it will make some sense hopefully. – In this kanji, we see an inauguration _speech_ being given before the Greenpeace vessel is set afloat and sent to **safeguard** our planet.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 24-11-2007(128): _Words_ and _Flowers_ are exchanged between sailors and their wives before they board the _vessel_ to **safeguard** the world.
column7: 3) [[samueruht](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samueruht)] 20-1-2008(126): (With sarcasm) A Bush speech telling how all the US _vessels_ are always welcomed, covered with _flowers_ and _word_ s of gratitude for **safeguard** ing democracy from the evil doers.
column8: 4) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 14-4-2007(38): The _flower vessel_ is of course the _Mayflower_ in which the pilgrims came to America in their search for turkeys. During they trip, they prayed non-stop - using _words_ as spells to **safeguard** Mayflower from danger.
column9: 5) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 3-11-2008(22): Thanks to fuaburisu with modification Think of the _flower- vessels_ as a ship full of hippies garlanded with flowers – In this kanji, we see that the hippies carry no weapons on the ship to **safeguard** against pirates. No, because of their nonviolence pact they have decided they will fend off pirates only with their words.

column3: A pack of _wild dogs_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _vessels_. Do not confuse this with the character for _arrest_ (Frame 706).
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-3-2006(183): A pack of genetically-modified _wild dogs_ is **seize** d by a group of Greenpeace activists and taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (the _flower vessel_ , see [safeguard](../v4/700.html) (#700 護)).
column6: 2) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 27-10-2005(127): Customs just **seize** d a crate of poppies ( _flowers_ ) detected by trained _wild dogs_ who inspected the _vessel_.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 31-10-2008(60): A group of **police dogs** are used to sniff out some opium **flowers** on a cargo **vessel**. The drugs are then **seized** by the authorities.
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 24-10-2010(14): Pirates, the _wild dogs_ of the seas ( **seize** ), capture a _vessel_ loaded with poppy _flowers_. (The poppies were intended for medicinal use, but the pirates have other ideas). 獲物 (えもの) : game, spoils, trophy 捕獲 (ほかく) : capture, seizure.
column9: 5) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 4-8-2008(14): Wild dogs **SEIZE** the (may)flower vessel! Those meanies.

column5: 1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 26-2-2008(208): That **GUY** stole my WOMAN so I kicked him in the CROTCH. (This story helps keep the word "GUY" as someone you hold in contempt).
column6: 2) [[kinkypete](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kinkypete)] 11-1-2008(89): **Guy** s only care about 2 things: _women_ and their _crotch_ (preferably at the same time).
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 3-9-2007(44): All I need is a _woman_ next to my _crotch_. What can I say, I'm a **GUY**.
column8: 4) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 5-10-2008(27): **GUY** S (derogatory) are always thinking about women's crotches. 1) 此奴 【こいつ】this **guy**. 2) 其奴 【そいつ】that **guy**. 3) 彼奴 【あいつ】that **guy**.
column9: 5) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 30-3-2010(14): On the streets of Bangkok you see what looks like a _woman_ , but a glance at the _crotch_ reveals it's a **guy**.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-10-2005(268): This _woman_ is **angry** because of the guys in the previous frame who pay more attention to her _crotch_ than her _heart_. I prefer to decompose the kanji in three elements here because it is easier to read like a mnemonic.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 15-8-2007(84): WOMEN get very **ANGRY** over the thought that GUYS are more interested in her CROTCH than her HEART.
column7: 3) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 13-5-2007(54): When a _guy_ steps on her _heart_ , a woman can get quite **angry**.
column8: 4) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 14-1-2009(17): Guys are **angry** at heart.
column9: 5) [[zardoz73](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zardoz73)] 28-8-2008(16): You want **angry**? Here's **angry** : just tell a **woman** that you value her **crotch** over her **heart**. I don't wanna be 1) you or 2) around when that happens, dude.

column5: 1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 10-1-2007(143): A good **friend** is always at your side. —- I teach at a Japanese High School, and I often see chummy male students grabbing each other's crotches in a joking manner. It's still weird to me, but apparently reaching to your side and grabbing you neighbor's crotch is a great way to express **friend** ship.
column6: 2) [[nakome](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nakome)] 4-3-2008(111): Think of a sex **friend** (a fuck buddy if you will). The benefit of such a relationship is that there will always be a _crotch by your side_. (the Japanese refer to such a **friend** as セフレ, just as we do).
column7: 3) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 24-10-2006(64): **Friend** s with benefits anyone?
column8: 4) [[Lizzie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Lizzie)] 18-8-2008(32): A **friend** is always on your side - again and again and again.
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 27-12-2007(32): Your best **friend** is your crotch. Its always by your side and never lets you down.

column5: 1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 27-10-2005(297): Don't let good _friends_ **slip out** between your _fingers_.
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 19-5-2007(146): Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation: one person is lying on the edge of the abyss and another (presumably his _friend_ ) is hanging, only thing holding him is the grip of their hands. Then _fingers_ **slip out** of the grip and he falls in said abyss.
column7: 3) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 11-4-2008(89): The only stories I can think of here are really aggressively pornographic, so maybe I should just say nothing.
column8: 4) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 10-6-2008(51): "I want to _finger_ my _friend_!" The words just **slipped out**. That's the last time I play truth or dare while drunk.
column9: 5) [[kansaigaijin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kansaigaijin)] 3-2-2009(23): My _finger_ s **slipped out** of my _friend_ and I knew we were past the friend's stage at that moment.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 6-2-2007(174): Well, you usually use your _fingers_ to **throw** objects used as _missile_ weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the _missile_ primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it's a _crotch_ (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the _wind_. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers…
column6: 2) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 11-8-2009(169): **If you use the primitive "semen" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story**.
column7: 3) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 23-12-2007(59): RPG. A wizard **throws** magic _missiles_ from the tip of his _fingers_.
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 11-4-2008(35): He's a great pitcher. He can **throw** a split _finger_ fastball that's like a _missile._.
column9: 5) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 19-8-2008(13): In Japan, where gun-control laws are strict, the desperate criminals have resorted to **throw** ing chopped-off _finger missiles_ at each other.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 18-2-2007(267): (Note: this kanji is more collapse/cave-in/[sink](../v4/1888.html) (#1888 沈) than humans **drown** ing) A _water missile_? A torpedo! And when it hits it's target? The ship _collapses_ then _sinks_ and everyone **drown** s!
column6: 2) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 6-10-2007(54): The submarine's hull was breached after being struck by a torpedo (" _water missile_ "), causing the entire crew to **drown**.
column7: 3) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 5-5-2009(48): I made her **drown** in my in my _semen_ , which was coming down on her like buckets of _water_. (applying crystal's perfect primitive element).
column8: 4) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 29-11-2008(29): I give this Kanji the keyword **go down** (in the sense of something plummeting or going down badly, not in the sense of descending, which is already used) because it is used in sinking ( 沈没 ), dying ( 戦没 ), and sunset ( 日没 ). It seems to me 溺 is the character for **drown** , and in fact it is given the keyword "drowning" later, which is just confusing to me. Story: The ship is **going down**! We were hit by a _water_ _missile_ (a torpedo).
column9: 5) [[Captain+Kanjipants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Captain+Kanjipants)] 6-2-2010(13): When a torpedo ( _water missile_ ) hits its target, everyone **drown** s!

column5: 1) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 11-1-2009(107): Where's my _flesh missile_? Between my **thighs** , naturally…
column6: 2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 22-11-2008(18): My **thigh** is the part of the body that my missile smacks against.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 19-1-2010(11): This also means **crotch** , and is on the 2010 常用漢字 list. So to_nihon's story is very apt.
column8: 4) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 7-6-2007(9): To smuggle arms across the border, I have heard of amputees who replace the _flesh_ of their **thigh** with a _missle_! If you paint it right…
column9: 5) [[Gaignun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Gaignun)] 3-7-2010(7): Chun Li's thunder **thighs** – the _part of her body_ that lets her kick with the force and speed of a _missile_.

column5: 1) [[mairov](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mairov)] 8-9-2007(215): **Establishment** can be attacked by words or by missiles. Writers will use words, whereas militars will use missiles.
column6: 2) [[sacmaliyorsun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sacmaliyorsun)] 28-2-2008(160): When you attack the **establishment** with _words_ , it fights back with _missiles_.
column7: 3) [[peepiceek](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peepiceek)] 12-7-2008(54): In the United States, we began by **establishing** justice with _words_ (in our constitution), but somewhere along the line we began ' **establishing** justice' with _missiles_ instead. :(.
column8: 4) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 10-5-2009(28): "I thought we had an **establishment** that where my **words** come from, there will NOT be any **semen** ".
column9: 5) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 30-10-2009(17): <Http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/7760/1663/320/more%20girls%20signing%20bombs.2.jpg> <http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/7760/1663/320/israeli%20girls%20indoctrinated%201.jpg> <http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/7760/1663/1600/israeli%20girls%20signing%202.jpg> The israeli **establishment** , one that involves having children write words on missiles in order to establish their barbaric wrath.

column5: 1) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 16-1-2007(429): Your car has missles?! That **beat** s mine, hands down.
column6: 2) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 9-1-2008(115): Think 3 methods of attack all combined into 1 kanji: 1. Vehicle to transport troops 2. Once troops have disembarked they have their missiles 3. If they run out of missiles they resort to hand to hand combat to **beat** the enemy.
column7: 3) [[kinkypete](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kinkypete)] 11-1-2008(77): In a random version of rock,paper, scissors. A car is **beat** en by a missile that hits it, the missile is **beat** en by the hand that can type in the deactivation code (which in turn is **beat** en by the car that runs over it).
column8: 4) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 15-6-2009(32): Dirty little young driver in his **car** , **semen** flies up in the air and hits his **hand** as he **beats** it.
column9: 5) [[Lizzie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Lizzie)] 10-9-2008(14): I have three strategies to **beat** this guy. First I try to run him over with my car. If that fails I through missles at him. Finally, if that also doesn't work I simply use my hands to **beat** him up.

column5: 1) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 28-7-2007(190): Samurai's **husk** /shell/armour is superflous to missile attacks 甲殻 卵殻 貝殻 .
column6: 2) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 30-8-2007(152): **husk** or **shell**. Japan's recent history in a nut **shell** : first the _samurai_ became _superfluous_ and then the Americans started to _throw missiles_ and bombs during WWII.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 29-6-2008(124): The primitives tie so nicely into a story: upon the use of _missiles_ in warfare, the traditional role of _samurai_ became _superfluous_ in battle. How to tie it to the keyword of "husk"? Easy! Afterwards, the samurai were demoted (like potato-peeling privates), and they sat around **HUSK** ING corn and cracking eggs and peanut shells (kanji refers to both 'husk' and 'shell'). A strong image to lock in the kanji: imagine samurai using their mighty swords to de- husk corn and split peanuts! Also see [cereals](../v4/917.html) (#917 穀).
column8: 4) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 12-1-2008(28): The samurai, now superfluous since the advent of the missile, was but a **husk** of a man. (Sumarai/Superfluous):Missile = **Husk**.
column9: 5) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 3-9-2007(28): A samurai **husk** ing corn, which means removing the part that is superfluous, so that he can use the corn as missiles in some upcoming war………

column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 16-8-2006(269): Picture sliding down the **branch** of a tree (in this case a pine tree or any tree with _needles_ ) and getting a bunch of _needles_ stuck in your _crotch_ –ouch!!
column6: 2) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 26-11-2007(69): A special **branch** of the military called the _Needle Crotch_ Unit. Their only weapon is the _needle_ embedded in their _crotches_ , and they're quite adept at using them.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 6-6-2008(50): Sitting on the **BRANCH** of a coniferous tree, getting sharp _needles_ in my _crotch_. (Remember there is no tree radical in this kanji, whereas [bough](../v4/713.html) (#713 枝) ( 枝 ) does because a "bough" is a main part of the tree, whereas this kanji refers to a smaller **branch**. It can also be used to refer to the **branch** of a store ( 支店 ) which also has nothing to do with a tree).
column8: 4) [[faded](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/faded)] 14-12-2009(22): I have a 10 inch **branch** coming out of my crotch.
column9: 5) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 29-11-2008(21): I would try to steer away from using tree imagery for this kanji: 支 (branch) is not actually used for tree **branch** es, but rather for conceptual **branch** es, like a store **branch** ( 支店 ). 枝 (bough), on the other hand, is an actual _branch_ from a _tree_.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 29-7-2006(198): (Adapted from darg_sama's) Balancing a _branch_ on your _finger_ is the prototypical example of a **skill** that is nothing more than a **skill** (i.e., it is completely useless).
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 24-10-2005(70): I think of a guy balancing a branch on his finger, which definitely takes some minimal amount of **skill**.
column7: 3) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 10-5-2008(63): Better be **skilled** with your _finger_ if all you've got is a _needle_ _crotch_.
column8: 4) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 5-4-2009(52): Forget balancing branches and stupid shit like that. It takes real **skill** to _finger_ _ten_ _crotches_ at the same time. For real, nobody was ever a hero for balancing branches.
column9: 5) [[Ceryn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ceryn)] 6-6-2008(31): Grasping a BRANCH with their FINGERS was the first **SKILL** that premodern humans learned.

column3: _Tree_ . . . _branch_. Take a moment to focus on the differences between a **bough** , a _branch_ , and a _twig_ (Frame 319).
column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 29-11-2006(269): The _tree's_ primary _branch_ is known as the **bough**.
column6: 2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 6-6-2008(94): Differentiate between **BOUGH** and [branch](../v4/711.html) (#711 支): 'branch' is smaller, and can also refer to the branch of a store ( 支店 ), which has nothing to do with a tree. But a **BOUGH** is a main part of a tree, perhaps where the trunk splits into several large **bough** s, and so it logically utilizes the 木 radical.
column7: 3) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 10-6-2008(25): I think of a **bough** as a _branch_ that's big enough to be a _tree_ itself.
column8: 4) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 29-11-2008(13): 支 (branch) is not actually used for tree branches, but rather for conceptual branches, like a store branch, or a branch of mathematics. 枝 (bough), on the other hand, is an actual _branch_ from a _tree_.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-10-2005(11): As James Heisig suggests, let's take a moment to focus on the differences between a **bough** , a branch, and a twig. A twig is “a small, leafless branch of a woody plant”. A **bough** is “a large or main _branch_ of a _tree_ ” (a branch is somewhere in between the **bough** s and the twigs).

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-10-2005(237): The **limb** s that this kanji represents are _parts of the body_ that are connected to the trunk, like the main _branches_ to a tree (“arms and legs” is the second meaning of this kanji). In other words, **limb** s are " _flesh branches_ ".
column6: 2) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 4-11-2007(91): **Limb** s are _body parts_ that _branch_ off.
column7: 3) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 5-6-2008(29): No Timmy, we don't say "flesh branches", we say "limbs".
column8: 4) [[Newkie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Newkie)] 21-2-2009(17): **Limb** s are _flesh_ y _branch_ es.
column9: 5) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 11-4-2008(9): **Limb** = _meat branch_ (sometimes it's almost too easy).

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(196): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reasons: (1) _Toilet paper/roll_ usually comes on a _spool_. (2) _Toilet paper_ is used to clean the _soil_ off your _crotch_. Story: Just get a _flower_ and carefully wrap some _toilet paper_ around its **stalk**. Spool also appears in [suspicious](../v4/716.html) (#716 怪), [lightly](../v4/717.html) (#717 軽), [diameter](../v4/882.html) (#882 径), [sutra](../v4/1360.html) (#1360 経).
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-8-2007(130): PRIMITIVE: _soiled crotch_ = _soiled underwear_. To precent anyone from picking the beautiful _flower_ , the gardner hung _soiled underwear_ on the **stalk**.
column7: 3) [[nac_est](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nac_est)] 24-7-2007(83): A _flower_ 's **stalk** can be seen as connecting the _flower_ to the _soil_ , _or again_ the _soil_ to the _flower_. It depends on how you look at it.
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 15-10-2010(62): Jack and the Bean **stalk** : _dirt_ below, _flowers_ above, and Jack's _crotch_ visible as he climbs up and up. 茎 (くき) : **stalk**.
column9: 5) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 16-9-2007(30): Flowering vines growing up a post or column. The **stalk** s wrap around the post– again and again– like a _spool_ of thread, and _flowers_ bloom at the very top. At the bottom, of course, is the soil.

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 1-11-2007(171): When you're **suspicious** , your state of mind twists round and round like a spool of thread.
column6: 2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 4-6-2007(85): Imagine a loud farting sound on The Enterprise (sorry). Everyone looks around trying to find who did it. The one looking most **suspicious** is _Data_. His _soiled crotch_ gives him away.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(67): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reason: See my note at [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎). Story: _Sigmund Freud_ (= state of mind) has a mystery patient who has wrapped himself entirely in _toilet paper_. Freud is very **suspicious** that it's someone he knows (who wants to remain anonymous). Spool also appears in [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎), [lightly](../v4/717.html) (#717 軽), [diameter](../v4/882.html) (#882 径), [sutra](../v4/1360.html) (#1360 経).
column8: 4) [[sethg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethg)] 17-3-2009(46): The girl's _state of mind_ certainly became **suspicious** when she found a lot of used _toilet paper_ in the waste basket beside her boyfriend's computer…
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 16-1-2009(23): Captain Picard notices a **suspicious** smell coming from _Data_. Picard turns to Riker and asks "What on earth is that awful stench, Number One?" "No," says Riker, pointing to Data's _soiled crotch_. "I think it's number two." (thanks vosmiura).

column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 25-2-2007(167): Fact: this kanji is used to denote a certain class of vehicles in Japan whose engines are under a certain size (less than 750cc I think) and are called **light** vehicles here. Imagine a so-called **light** vehicle or a **light** -truck with a load of _spools_ driving down a road ever so **lightly** , careful not to let any of the _spools_ roll out onto the street.
column6: 2) [[paddy71](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paddy71)] 2-2-2008(119): I want to tread **lightly** on the environment…. That's why I CAR-SPOOL to work everyday…. I know, lame.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(94): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reason: See my note at [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎). Story: You are fussy about your _car_ and to clean it you will only dab it very **lightly** with _toilet paper_. Spool also appears in [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎), [suspicious](../v4/716.html) (#716 怪), [diameter](../v4/882.html) (#882 径), [sutra](../v4/1360.html) (#1360 経).
column8: 4) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 28-7-2008(56): I'm such an infamously bad driver, even if I press the car's gas peddle **lightly** , everyone soils their pants.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 19-11-2008(21): Car made out of toilet paper would be very light.

column5: 1) [[bigloui](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigloui)] 1-5-2006(307): Oh come on people - say what we've all been thinking: the **uncle** is that creepy guy towering _above_ a _little_ one's _crotch_.
column6: 2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 28-6-2008(165): Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your **UNCLE** was full of [loneliness](../v4/720.html) (#720 寂) ( 寂 ), and he lived by himself. He was naturally [graceful](../v4/721.html) (#721 淑) ( 淑 ) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team). You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he _watched_ over you carefully as [coach](../v4/719.html) (#719 督) ( 督 ). It was uncomfortable, though, how your [uncle](../v4/718.html) (#718 叔) often touched you just _a little above_ the _crotch_ ( 叔 ) when coaching…
column7: 3) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 16-6-2006(86): Imagine one of those cliches of comedy: an **uncle** is _above_ the _little_ _crotch_ of the new born nephew, when the baby pees in his face!
column8: 4) [[mrred](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mrred)] 16-7-2008(68): This kanji becomes easy if you use its proper meaning as a keyword: **younger sibling of parent**. Now read the character as a set of instructions to locate the **younger siblings of your parents** in your family tree, starting from yourself: If you go up to the row (generation) _above_ , to your parents, then the **younger siblings of your parents** are the _littler_ ones as that sprang from the same _crotch_.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(37): You don't want to know. Really.

column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 3-9-2007(19): Aww. I mean, you kinda gotta feel sorry for creepy _Uncle Herbert the Pervert_. When he goes to his house, which is nothing more than a _floating roof_ , nobody else is there. It's so _small_ there's only room for him and his _crotch_. What an image of **LONELINESS**.
column9: 5) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 7-2-2007(14): This is the famous Japanese emotive word SABI. For a good image of SABI, here is a quote from the Haiku poet Basho (translated by Robert Haas): "If a man goes to war wearing stout armor or to a party dressed up in gay clothes, and if this man happens to be an old man, there is something lonely about him. Sabi is something like that." Now just put your old _uncle_ in the picture and imagine the **loneliness** he feels in the _house._.
