column5: 1) [[jimsublimeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimsublimeman)] 3-7-2007(232): I think of an **anti-** hero (Dirty Harry etc.) for this primitive, whose trademark for disposing of villians is not an honorable fight, but a kick in the _crotch_ and then a shove off a _cliff_ (perhaps whilst the villain's back is turned).
column6: 2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 4-3-2007(104): Many cultures are so **anti-** sex you'd think they just want people to throw their _crotches_ over a _cliff_.
column7: 3) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 9-1-2008(60): Some people are using an **ANTI-** hero for this one, and it seems a good idea. The problem is… what **ANTI-** hero can you relate to **crotch**? Well, the answer is……………… . ハードゲイでえええええええええええええす！フォォォォォォォォォォォォォー！ (If you don't know Hard Gay, just look it up on Youtube. You'll remember this kanji, that's guaranteed.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 27-11-2008(25): A group of people protesting against something expose their crotches at the top of a cliff. They're shaking their naked posteriors up in the air, with the letters a-n-t-i- spelled on their buttocks, as a sign of protestation. * You can use the image of the “anti-” protesters shaking their naked posteriors up in the air for the primitive.
column9: 5) [[Chaze](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Chaze)] 16-11-2010(22): Despite their stunning similarity, this is not a [friend](../v4/704.html) (#704 友), but the opposite: An **anti-friend**! Instead of always being at your side he throws you off a _cliff_.

column5: 1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 8-10-2007(112): As the villain (pushed off by the anti-hero) is tumbling down the **slope** , he activates gadget skis to escape, spraying soil everywhere as he flies down the **slope**.
column6: 2) [[nakome](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nakome)] 4-3-2008(100): This kanji depicts a classic enviornmental problem: erosion. Erosion occurs when all of the _soil_ washes of the side of the _cliff_ , eventually causing the _cliff_ to disappear, leaving a **slope** (an _anti- cliff_ if you will) in its place.
column7: 3) [[Dakoina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dakoina)] 2-3-2009(83): A **slope** is _anti_ -flat _soil_.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 7-1-2008(30): **Slope** = ski **slope**. You're speeding down the ski **slope** with your _anti-_ gravity skis. These special skis work not only on snow, they even work on raw _soil_ , allowing you to hover above the _ground_.
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 28-1-2008(20): Dirty Harry kicks the guy in the crotch. The poor guy rolling down the **slope** end up in a pile of earth.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 5-7-2006(390): Of course, _trees_ are _anti-_ plank. Wouldn't you be if you were a _tree_?
column6: 2) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 24-6-2006(32): Trees are naturally opposed to, or anti, the making of **plank** s.
column7: 3) [[zdude255](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zdude255)] 13-6-2008(22): Trees are definitely anti-plank. They're even having a protest. Ironically the signs are still made of paper.
column8: 4) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 23-12-2007(16): Our _anti_ hero Dirty Harry is having a pirate fantasy about pushing the villain from a _tree_ **plank**.
column9: 5) [[Pete171](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pete171)] 2-10-2008(11): A **plank** of wood is made from _trees_. Obviously _trees_ are" _anti-_ **plank** " since they are cut down and shaped to be made into **planks**. Now imagine a demonstration of anti- **plank** _trees_ protesting against their massacre by grouping together and waving around their campaign slogans in the air on signs. And what are those signs made of out, people? Irony.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 7-5-2006(121): Pretty obvious: to **return** is to turn back on the road you're on and go the opposite way.
column6: 2) [[etpan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/etpan)] 16-7-2008(98): **Return** here means "return something" rather than "go back". So here it goes, for those of you who are also suffering of the Japanese summer ,-) I ordered an _anti_ mosquito kit, but it was damaged on the _way_ so I had to **return** it.
column7: 3) [[jimsublimeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimsublimeman)] 6-11-2007(67): In "The **Return** of the _anti-hero_ ", Clint Eastwood kicks the villain in the crotch, pushes them off the cliff and onto a busy _highway_. A tiring movie franchise to say the least….
column8: 4) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 15-6-2009(44): If you're ANTI-ROAD then of course, you'll just **return** home.

column7: 3) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 17-12-2007(31): Dirty Harry (our anti-hero) refused the villainous **marketing** director's offer of money before he kicked him in the crotch and pushed him off the cliff.
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(30): **Marketing** is an anti-money of sorts. When it comes into contact with money, the money disappears.
column9: 5) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 30-9-2007(18): **Marketing** tries to get consumers to be _anti-money_ and pro-products.

column3: This character is a pictograph of a bird's **claw** , and from there comes to mean animal **claws** in general (including human fingernails).
column4: * As a primitive, we shall use the graphic image of a _vulture_ , a bird known for its powerful _claws_. It generally appears above another primitive, in which case it gets squeezed into the form ⺥.
column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 29-4-2007(215): A pictograph of Wolverine's adamantium **claw** s.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(54): Pictograph, see book. * I prefer the primitive meaning of an eagle rather than vulture. Somehow vulture makes me think more about meat and dead corpses than **claw** s. An eagle however immediately brings to my mind the image of an eagle plunging into a stream catching fish in his **claw** s, or that of the great eagles rescuing Bilbo and his party in Jrr Tolkien's novel “Bilbo the Hobbit”.
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 16-8-2007(18): Pictograph of a vulture's **CLAW**. The **CLAW** DROPS and leaves a STREAM of blood. *Primitive = vulture.
column8: 4) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 25-1-2008(13): Use the "w" in **claw** to remember the shape of this kanji.
column9: 5) [[meredithcat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meredithcat)] 26-2-2010(5): A **claw**.

The _fledgling_ soon becomes addicted to **milk** , giving us this very catchy mnemonic: “ _fledgling hooked_ on **milk** ”.
column6: 2) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 1-10-2007(67): Drinking **milk** not only reduces [cavity](../v4/96.html) (#96 孔)'s but also strengthens _nails_ (claws) thanks astgtciv.

column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 1-3-2011(19): As a _child_ , _Wolverine_ became _hook_ ed on **milk** …and that's how he grew those claws (excess calcium). 牛乳 (ぎゅうにゅう) : cow's **milk**.

I think it's a picture vivid enough for the kanji with **lewd** _porter_ jerking off in his room to a TV screening a couple of _vultures_ doing it in _water_ of some pond or such.

column5: 1) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(345): The **leader** in this race is the _turtle_! It appears he has covered the _vulture_ ’s feet in _glue_ , so that the vulture cannot get off the starting block.
column6: 2) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 18-12-2007(73): X-men and TMNT join forces: Their new **leader** is an awsome asshole. He is simply Wolverine and Raphael glued together back to back (the biggest assholes from both groups combined).
column7: 3) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 9-4-2007(43): Once upon a time a _turtle_ managed to trick a _vulture_ into _gluing_ itself to the turtle's shell. This way the turtle could now fly anywhere and became the **leader** of the turtles.
column8: 4) [[theBryan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theBryan)] 25-7-2008(32): A great **leader** must have three things: The robustness of a turtles shell. The shrewdness of a vulture. People that will stick to him like glue and follow him anywhere.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 13-1-2011(18): A **leader** should possess the qualities of the _turtle_ \- patience and persistance - and the _eagle_ \- aggression and good sight. And loads of charisma, so the followers stick like _glue_. 将来 しょうらい future, 将軍 しょうぐん General.

column3: _Leader_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_. Do not confuse with _urge_ (Frame 300).
column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 21-8-2007(213): It's easy to picture a LEADER that uses a BIG dog to **EXHORT** his people to do more.
column6: 2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(96): Here we have a _St.Bernard_ **exhort** ing the vulture to become the _leader_ in the race against the turtle, but he can't because of the glue. see [leader](../v4/731.html) (#731 将).
column7: 3) [[Angrybeez](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Angrybeez)] 6-7-2008(87): Never support the _leader_!! Always **exhort** the under _dog_ !!!
column8: 4) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 21-8-2008(40): A great _leader_ will always **exhort** his followers to go forth and do GREAT and _big_ things.
column9: 5) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 11-3-2008(40): Think of a dog sled. The LEADER of the pack **exhort** s the St. Bernard's behind him to MUSH! MUSH! MUSH!

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 16-4-2007(98): You ever wondered why this appeared as a primitive in so many RTK1 kanji? Well, you should know that once a vulture **grab** s hold of a _tree_ , he can never let go. Even Heisig couldn't shake him loose.
column6: 2) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 12-5-2008(30): A common meaning for this kanji is 'DICE'. — Ever wonder what _vultures_ do up in the _trees_? They play DICE. But of course, being vultures, they are always **grabbing** the dice away from each other.
column7: 3) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 2-3-2009(23): The gigantic VULTURE swoops down and **grab** s that huge TREE!! AAAAH!!
column8: 4) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 25-11-2008(5): Like a VULTURE, she **grab** ed my WOOD! Boy, you cannot stop her.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 14-7-2009(3): In a particularly lame X-Men comic, _Wolverine_ is in a _tree_ , and Sabretooth is trying to shake him out of it. _Wolverine_ **grab** s the tree trunk as tightly as he can so he doesn't fall out.

column3: Unlike _pick up_ (Frame 720), this character is used for **picking** fruits from trees. Its elements: _finger_ . . . _grab_.
column5: 1) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 14-10-2007(292): You **pick** cheries with your _fingers_ , then along comes a giant _vulture_ and **pick** s up the whole _tree_ with its _claws_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-2-2008(87): Tip: _vulture_ \+ _tree_ : Heisig later combines these into a single kanji 采 called [grab](../v4/2090.html) (#2090 采). Story: As you go to **pick** your nose, your parent _grabs_ your _finger_ and pulls it away ( & gives you a lecture on social etiquette). REF: "grab" also appears in [vegetable](../v4/734.html) (#734 菜), [coloring](../v4/1714.html) (#1714 彩).
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 17-8-2007(44): Attempting to use your FINGERS to **PICK** the fruit off the TREE can be hazardous if there's a VULTURE waiting to **PICK** your FINGERS off you!
column8: 4) [[trusmis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/trusmis)] 6-9-2009(30): 采 is grab (FRAME [grab](../v4/2090.html) (#2090 采)) **Pick** is grab but delicately with your fingers only (thanks katsuo).
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 29-10-2008(21): Imagine trying to **pick** fruit from a _vulture_ -infested _tree_ , but before you can even get close, the _vultures_ peck at your _fingers_ to stop you.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 23-8-2007(213): A vegetarian vulture is munching on a _flower_ , perched on a _tree_ , patiently waiting for a patch of **vegetable** s to grow.
column6: 2) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 5-6-2008(98): _[grab](../v4/2090.html) (#2090 采)_ beneath the _flowers_ to get the **vegetable** s. 野菜 やさい.
column7: 3) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 18-12-2007(86): Wolverine is turning into total hippie. He said he only eats **vegetable** s now and last time I saw him sitting in a tree with flowers in his hair.
column8: 4) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 30-1-2008(21): Nobody likes to eat their **vegetable** s, not even _vultures_ who will eat anything. So they hide in a _flower_ -covered _tree_ , until the scary **vegetable** s disappear. Picture the ugly vulture head peeking out from behind the flowers.
column9: 5) [[delbertmon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delbertmon)] 26-11-2009(15): Tip: vulture + tree : Heisig later combines these into a single kanji 采 called grab ( **2090). — Story: Many **vegetable** s are roots and so you take their flowers and grab them in order to harvest the **vegetable**. — REF: "grab" also appears in pick (** 733), coloring (#1714 彩).

column5: 1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 22-2-2006(232): The bird house is the brothel (someone else said so) and of course everyone is welcome - thay **accept** any crotch.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-2-2007(83): A _birdhouse_ is a _whorehouse_ that will **accept** any _crotch_ even those with STDs. (Image: a birdhouse whorehouse with every kind of bird coming and going. Some old madam at the front hole **accept** s everyone, even the nasty old crows).
column7: 3) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 19-7-2008(57): [WARNING - Possibly offending content] Hard Gay (the Japanese comedian: <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masaki_Sumitani>) has a **birdhouse** over his **crotch**. It has a note that goes: "Only cocks are **ACCEPT** ED". It can't be a coincidence the fact that this is the kanji for 受け , if you know what I mean. フウウウウウウウウウ！.
column8: 4) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 23-6-2007(55): Can you **ACCEPT** that I like to put my CROTCH in a BIRDHOUSE?
column9: 5) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 15-9-2008(34): You have to **accept** that your hippie girlfriend has a CROTCH that looks like a BIRDHOUSE (nest).

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 26-10-2007(231): "Please _accept_ this _finger_ ," you say, **impart** ing it to your yakuza boss.
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 3-11-2005(217): This character depicts a student and teacher. The teacher **impart** s his knowledge on the student, pointing the way and guiding with the finger. Meanwhile, the student sits there passively accepting the tutelage of his superior.
column7: 3) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 29-4-2006(43): **Impart** means to "grant a share of." so imagine yourself **impart** ing a share of M&M's (with your fingers) and it being happily _accept_ ed by the recipient.
column8: 4) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 15-11-2008(33): Allow me to **impart** my middle **finger** to those that do not **accept** others for who they are.
column9: 5) [[pjhoover](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pjhoover)] 20-3-2008(22): Sistine chapel paiting. god stretches out his finger to **impart** humanity with his nature and adam would accept, but can’t.

column5: 1) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 5-8-2007(263): If you really **love** someone, you won't keep them in a cage-like _bird house_ relationship, but rather open the door and let their _heart_ _walk_ around freely. Think less about "I" (あい) and more about "we".
column6: 2) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 17-3-2008(156): The man is about to enter the ' _birdhouse_ ' (brothel) when he remembers his true _love_ at home, and, following his _heart_ , uses his _walking legs_ to go straight home.
column7: 3) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 17-10-2007(58): [愛は相手の心を受けることです。](midori://search?text=愛は相手の心を受けることです。) (I heard that one from a buddhist priest - dont forget the extra stroke).
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(21): Here we see what the guy from [melancholy](../v4/616.html) (#616 憂) ended up doing. To solve his matters of heart, he turned his walking legs towards the brothel (bird house) seeking for **love**.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(19): An overly romantic man carries a bird house all the time with him, so he can send **love** -messages with his pigeons wherever he goes on his walking legs. His heart beating heavily in between the bird house (sitting atop the head like a hat), and the walking legs.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(91): The _sun_ 's _love_ is **equivocal** : it warms yet burns us.
column6: 2) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 17-9-2010(21): Inspired by haabaato: You confess your _love_ under the _sun_ , but the girl runs away. Her response is **unclear** to you (Using the supplement's keyword).
column7: 3) [[FoxintheStars](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FoxintheStars)] 18-1-2011(16): In RTK1 Supplement as "unclear." His feelings about her were **equivocal/unclear,** so she spent all _day_ playing " _loves_ me, loves me not.".
column8: 4) [[haabaato](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/haabaato)] 13-3-2008(13): [曖昧。](midori://search?text=曖昧。) On a _sunny_ day, a guy professes his _love_ to a girl he admires. But she gives him the common **equivocal** response, "Let's just be friends.".
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 10-11-2010(5): (Thanks HaaBaato) [曖昧。](midori://search?text=曖昧。) On a _sunny_ day, a guy professes his _love_ to a girl he admires. However, while he's down on one knee, the sun comes out from behind a cloud and blinds him. The girl takes her opportunity, gives him the common **equivocal** response, "Let's just be friends," and runs away while the poor guy is still blinded.

column5: 1) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 3-8-2007(326): You're at a restaurant and raise your _finger_ to indicate to the waiter that you want to **pay**. Your friend _elbows_ you in the ribs – it's his shout, and he insists on taking care of the bill.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 25-10-2007(95): You are walking out of the restaurant when the waiter uses his FINGERS to grab you at the ELBOW and says, "excuse me sir, didn't you forget to **PAY**?".
column7: 3) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 25-5-2010(56): It costs an arm and a leg but I **pay** a _finger_ and an _elbow_ …
column8: 4) [[stazor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stazor)] 27-8-2010(26): Traditionally Japanese people kept vallet in their kimono sleeves, so they reach for elbow with their fingers when they want to **pay**.
column9: 5) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 12-9-2008(24): As if making people **pay** with their _fingers_ is bad enough, the Yakuza now accept _elbows_ as a form of **pay** ment….. :-p.

column5: 1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 22-1-2007(217): The Batcave is very **wide** and has a lot of elbow room for Batman to do his yoga.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(107): A **wide** cave has a lot of "elbow room".
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 16-1-2006(34): A caveman **wide** ns his _cave_ by pounding on the interior with his strong _elbows_.
column8: 4) [[sleepyday](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sleepyday)] 30-9-2008(20): This character depicts that of someone standing at the entrance of a _cave._ He's standing there with his hands on his hips, and his _elbows_ pointing out to each side. He's telling you that the cave is **wide** enough to walk through comfortably. Try playing with the form of the Kanji to draw out the pictograph I described. :).
column9: 5) [[Koos83](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Koos83)] 1-11-2009(10): The CAVE wasn't very **wide**. Both my ELBOWS touched the sides.

column3: _Bound up_ . . . _elbow_. Think of this key word in the sense of something that has been nabbed or cought.
column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(60): Your _elbow_ is _bound up_ so that your biceps will stay **flexed**.
column6: 2) [[FoxintheStars](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FoxintheStars)] 18-1-2011(18): In RTK1 Supplement as "hooked." A friend **hooked** someone literally, by _binding them up_ with their **hooked** _elbow_.
column7: 3) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 2-12-2007(14): My _elbow_ was _bound up_ in a cast, making it impossible to keep it **flexed**.
column8: 4) [[drwaltoa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/drwaltoa)] 11-9-2011(6): Peter Pan tried to escape, but Hook hooked him by the _elbow_ and _bound_ him _up_.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 23-1-2009(3): At the risk of confusing with "captured" (frame 1018) I'm going to use "to capture" as the keyword since this kanji often shows up in kidnapping related compounds and **flexed** is hard for me to work with. Here, you bind up the kidnapping victim's arms together at the elbows behind his back when you capture him.

column3: _Fingers_ . . . _wide_. The connection with the previous character is very close. Beware.
column5: 1) [[tofuinoakland](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tofuinoakland)] 17-7-2008(419): Japanese girls are tight and may require _fingers_ inserted to **broaden** them and make them _wide_ enough before you can…
column6: 2) [[mattoc_g](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattoc_g)] 17-10-2006(166): Spread your fingers wide to **broaden** your hand.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 10-11-2007(70): When Batman's _cave_ isn't _wide_ enough to hold all of his new inventions and gadgets, he has his friend Superman use his superstrong _fingers_ to grip the entrance of the cave and **broaden** it, making more _elbow_ room. Goatse- style visuals at your own risk.
column8: 4) [[chully](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chully)] 3-2-2009(37): **goatse.** If that word doesn't help you remember this, maybe you should **broaden** your horizons a little.
column9: 5) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 6-1-2008(27): An orthodontist with his _fingers_ in your mouth says "open _wide_ " and helps you to **broaden** your smile.

column5: 1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 2-4-2007(212): _Elbonium_ : a new **mineral** found in _wide caves_ shaped like elbows and made of metal.
column6: 2) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 17-3-2008(172): A _wide_ range of _metal_ s are classed as **mineral** s.
column7: 3) [[jimsublimeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimsublimeman)] 19-10-2007(45): You need a _wide_ range of **mineral** s and _iron_ (metal) in your diet to avoid anaemia and other nasty things.
column8: 4) [[Raschaverak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raschaverak)] 30-6-2009(38): Imagine some miners mining some **mineral** s, with their metal picks, in a cave, as they mine out more and more **mineral** s, the cave gets wider and wider….
column9: 5) [[dsamari](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dsamari)] 28-10-2007(18): _Metal_ is a general term for a _wide_ range of **mineral** s.

column5: 1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 1-12-2005(350): Opening a stuck **valve** requires 2 hands and a lot of elbow grease.
column6: 2) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 20-1-2007(62): The cubans build a pipe to flood the USA. Castro just has to turn the **valve** on it, and USA is flooded. Suddenly, CIA agents tackle him from behind, grabbing both his arms. But _Castro_ manages to open the **valve** with his _elbow_ , by raising the _elbow_ above his head. Success! USA is no more…
column7: 3) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 17-1-2008(55): Opening a stuck **valve** requires 2 hands, and on top of that, a lot of elbow grease. (thanks scottamus).
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 1-1-2006(20): You try to unblock an old rusty **valve** with a hit of the _elbow_ , and then with your _two hands_ , to no avail.
column9: 5) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 10-6-2008(17): "She's stuck real good-like" the guy from the いなか ( 田舎 , country) said to me with a strong rural **dialect** ( 弁 , べん). "You best grab on ta'er with _both hands_ and giv-er that **VALVE** some _elba_ ' greeze." (I couldn't resist: this is a favourite Japanese word of mine, which also means "regional dialect." Such as Osaka-ben 大阪弁 , almost all prefectures in Japan will boast of their own 弁 and slang).

column3: _By one's side_ . . . _elbow_ . . . _turkey_. Its match is in frame 605.
column5: 1) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 11-3-2008(298): Men walk with their _elbows_ out from their _sides_ in a weird _turkey_ trot when they try to appear very MASCULINE. Think of a 70's pimp walk.
column6: 2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 15-4-2007(94): **Masculine** duties are to offer your _elbow_ to the lady _by your left side_ and to cut the _turkey_ on special meals.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 9-7-2008(80): Surely you remember [feminine/female](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/563) (#563 雌)? In that kanji, we said _stop_ / _spooning_ / _turkeys_ , spoon **females**! Here, once again, my buddy is looking at a _turkey_. What the heck is his problem? I give him a sharp _elbow_ in the _side_. "Dude, be a man!" I said. "Where's your MASCULINE side?".
column8: 4) [[Hawkeye123](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hawkeye123)] 19-1-2009(26): While it's not [feminine/female](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/563) (#563 雌) to eat a turkey with a spoon, a **masculine** man would push people a _side_ with his _elbow_ to get to the _turkey_ first.
column9: 5) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 29-4-2007(16): Imagine a turkey making a pose like it's really buff….it's elbows are by their side at an angle.

column5: 1) [[akotkav](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akotkav)] 5-3-2006(224): When someone's _elbow_ is above your _mouth_ he/she is probably standing on a **pedestal**.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 12-11-2006(160): After training your whole life, you manage to get a bronze medal in the Olympics. You're extremely proud of your accomplishment as you step up to receive your medal. The guy in first place is up on a **pedestal** , towering above you, his elbow level with your mouth. Being a smug bastard, he "accidentally" knocks his elbow into your mouth, causing you to bleed and lose a tooth. Just cause he won the gold doesn't mean he can place himself on such a high **pedestal** and do whatever he wants!
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 16-11-2007(96): Rodin's 'Thinker' sitting on a **pedestal** , the arm bent at the _elbow_ cradling the _mouth_.
column8: 4) [[frychiko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/frychiko)] 24-7-2008(44): Think Indiana Jones… he rests his ELBOW on some ancient **pedestal** to gather his thoughts, when all of a sudden an OPENING appears in a wall and treasure is revealed!
column9: 5) [[Rivvie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rivvie)] 15-12-2008(24): It is physically impossible to put your elbows in your mouth (just try it…) the first one to do so deserves to be on a **pedestal**.

column5: 1) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 3-11-2007(196): While standing on the _pedestal_ at the award ceremony, the recipient _heart_ lessly **neglect** ed to mention the people that got him there.
column6: 2) [[Evangelo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Evangelo)] 22-7-2008(121): Someone you put on a _pedestal_ will **NEGLECT** your _heart_.
column7: 3) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 14-4-2007(67): The _Gold Medal Winner_ (see [pedestal](../v4/744.html) (#744 台)) gets all cocky and **neglect** s his girlfriend ("throws her _heart_ away"). She cries and cries, her _heart_ eventually exploding from the grief and she dies from **neglect**.
column8: 4) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 16-10-2008(40): People who **neglect** don't put your _heart_ on a _pedestal_ , they put it below it!
column9: 5) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 20-6-2007(34): If you **neglect** your personal hygiene, you will end up with elbow, mouth and heart disease and wind up looking pretty nasty! Just imagine what you will look like with a locked elbow, your mouth open in a grimace with missing teeth, and one handclutch your heart as it shoots pain through your body! That is the price of **neglect** my friends!

column5: 1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 6-5-2006(389): From his _water_ _pedestal_ Neptune **reign** s over his Sea Empire.
column6: 2) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 17-7-2006(40): Build a moat around your pedestal to protect your **reign** of power.
column7: 3) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 20-1-2007(23): The **reign** of the _Gold Medal Winner Bastard_ over _water_ sports is of unsurpassed length. There he is, once again, his hair gray, wearing a bathing cap, on his _pedestal_ with the gold medal around his neck.
column8: 4) [[sethg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethg)] 22-3-2009(19): Michael Phelps **reign** s supreme as he stands on his _water_ y _pedestal_ (he just got out of the pool).
column9: 5) [[Daizumi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Daizumi)] 8-9-2008(12): From his _pedestal_ , Manneken Pis **reign** s over Belgium with his… _water_.

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 10-10-2007(65): The secrets of **metallurgy** and smithing: get your redhot metal and bang it against the _pedestal_ as an anvil. Then cool it quickly with lots of _ice_.
column6: 2) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 16-9-2008(30): An ICE PEDESTAL is useless in **METALLURGY** since it will just melt.
column7: 3) [[wilsoncb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wilsoncb)] 22-8-2010(11): I get this confused with all the similar words (forge, tempering, etc.), so I'll make this metal-allergy. The poor blacksmith's son, who had no choice but to take up his father's vocation, spent every day by the pedestal/anvil. Sadly, he had a metal-allergy, so he spent every night putting ICE on his hives…
column8: 4) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 30-7-2009(11): One secret used in **metallurgy** is to have a _ice pedestal_ , in case you burn your butt.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(4): _Ice_ on the _pedestal_ was no longer a problem thanks to the science of **metallurgy**.

column5: 1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 1-9-2007(254): Many men, before they **commence** their relationship with the _woman_ of their desires, place her on something of a _pedestal_ , which often leads to disappointment later on.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 18-8-2007(86): Just think of any art class. You put a WOMAN on a PEDESTAL then you **COMMENCE** to draw her.
column7: 3) [[amthomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amthomas)] 23-4-2007(83): If you want to **commence** a relationship, just put a woman on a pedestal and she'll love ya forever.
column8: 4) [[penot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penot)] 15-9-2008(25): After the march of [intimidate](../v4/364.html) (#364 威) women… the _woman_ stood on the _pedestal_ and **commenced** her speech with, " **hajimemashite**.".
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 23-12-2007(21): Your life _commences_ when the matron (a very fat _woman_ ) extends her _elbow_ and takes you out from the _womb_ of your mother. This image will also help you on the next kanji.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(311): The body part feminists like to put on a pedestal is the **womb** , especially when they hear a man complain about some responsibility. "We give birth, so it's your duty to do so-and-so".
column6: 2) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 4-2-2008(184): If any _body part_ deserves to be put on a _pedestal_ , it is the **womb** from which new life springs forth.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 3-1-2007(60): In this kanji pedestal carries a sense of base, or stand. The **womb** is part of the body that acts as a pedestal: a base or stand from which a new human being is brought into life.
column8: 4) [[mrred](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mrred)] 11-10-2008(22): Imagine the **womb** as a _part of the body_ which contains a little [pedestal](../v4/744.html) (#744 台) for the baby to stand on. Picture the baby, like a little statue of a cherub, standing on its pedestal in the fleshy **womb**.
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 23-12-2007(13): I suggest studing this kanji alongside with [commence](../v4/747.html) (#747 始). The **womb** is the _part of the body_ with a _mouth_ from which the matron took you out when you were born, using her _elbow_.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(399): This is either a love scene or a murder scene that you are seeing through a **window**. The love scene: through the **window** of a house (from a distance), you see a pair of human legs, then elbows, and then some pink hearts floating up like in a cartoon. The murder scene: peering through the **window** of a house, you see a gruesome murder scene. Human legs dangling from a ceiling fan, an elbow sticking out of a wall, and a heart still beating on the carpet.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 21-6-2006(81): A photographer is at _home_ , recovering his broken _human legs_. With nothing better to do, he is looking through the rear **window** with his camera (he needs to use his _elbow_ to support those heavy lenses) until his _heart_ begins to race as he witnesses a murder!
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 18-2-2007(67): A voyeur peeks in the **window** of a _house_ , but all he can see is _legs_. So he _elbows_ up into the **window** for a better view which gets his _heart_ racing.
column8: 4) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 21-4-2008(52): When I see that **window** I get chills… I was in that house when my girlfriend threw me out the **window**. She broke my _legs, my elbows and my heart_!
column9: 5) [[karmatheif](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/karmatheif)] 8-7-2008(33): The top primitive is similar to [hole](../v4/1316.html) (#1316 穴). A **window** is a [hole](../v4/1316.html) (#1316 穴) in your house that you occassionally sit next to while leaning on your ELBOW and gazing out, a picture of a lonely HEARTedness.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-11-2007(385): "Going, going, **GONE**!", said the gravedigger as he shoveled _soil_ onto the body's protruding _elbow_ (the last bit left to cover).
column6: 2) [[khooks](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/khooks)] 9-4-2007(65): If you want the soil stains **gone** from your clothes, then you'll need to put some elbow grease into cleaning them.
column7: 3) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 31-1-2007(37): A trick they do in war movies is they bury the arm up to the _elbow_ in the soil, then put some fake flesh and blood by the elbow to make it look like the arm is **gone**. "AAAHHH!!! My arm's **gone**! MEDIC!!".
column8: 4) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 14-1-2009(27): **Gone, past, quit, leave, elapse, eliminate, divorce.** When I _myself_ (厶) am under the _earth_ my time will have elapsed and I will be dead and **gone**. 死去 (death). 消去 (elimination, erasure, purge). 一難去ってまた一難 (it's been one thing after another). 歩き去る (walk away). 洗い去る (wash away). この世を去る (to leave the world, die). 引き去る (retreat). 走り去る (run away).
column9: 5) [[vinniram](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vinniram)] 16-12-2009(16): I brush _soil_ off my _elbow_ \- now it's **GONE**.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 11-2-2007(258): This kanji shows up in a lot of words related to the legal process. Try this image: using a very outdated judicial **method** , the people of Salem dunked accused witches in the _water_ until they were all _gone_.
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 19-5-2007(102): There already was a [system](../v4/418.html) (#418 制) for butchering cows, a [technique](../v4/421.html) (#421 芸) for turning smoke into flowers - why can't there be a _method_ of about the same relevance for making _water_ _gone_? Evaporation anyone?
column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 26-10-2006(63): Following from the last frame, when rubbing isn't good enough, WATER is the best **METHOD** for making sure the SOIL on your ELBOW is GONE.
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 21-3-2008(43): If all the water is gone, we must develop new **method** s to survive. (Imagine Earth devoid of water, the opposite of the movie Waterworld).
column9: 5) [[TaylorSan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TaylorSan)] 31-1-2009(22): The Heisig **Method** will Water down your kanji problems, until at some point, they are gone.

column3: _Meeting_ . . . _wall_. This is the full character for **meeting** , from which the abbreviated primitive that we met back in lesson 12 gets its name.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(194): At the local company they have a very gory way of getting rid of incompetent personnel : they arrange a business **meeting** in a very special room where the walls are … **meeting**. Not surprisingly the boss is never present at these **meeting** s, he's the one who pushes the button that sets the walls in motion.
column6: 2) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 5-11-2007(102): The only thing created in most **meeting** s is a lot of hot air. Imagine a _cloud of it rising_ to the _roof_.
column7: 3) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 1-9-2007(60): Easy: (secret) **meeting** s are held between 4 walls.
column8: 4) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 1-4-2009(39): No business **meeting** during honeymoon! _Ha-Ni-Mu_ (n) ハニム.
column9: 5) [[Tweenk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tweenk)] 9-3-2007(17): When _rising clouds_ want to hold a **meeting** , they need to an _umbrella_ to gather under and keep them from flying everywhere.

column3: _Wall_ . . . _soil_. The key word allows for the full variety of connotations: to peak, to arrive at the end, and the like.
column5: 1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 19-8-2008(293): Sexual **climax** es don't always happen on the bed, they sometimes happen against a wall or on the ground!
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(134): The **climax** of the Berlin Wall affair was the tearing of it to ground.
column7: 3) [[rosgmact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rosgmact)] 13-8-2007(44): The Biblical Onan was condemned for his solo **climax**. Working ONE ELBOW furiously, he spilled his seed on the GROUND, and God was angry at his selfishness and wastefulness. (Perhaps the greatest punishment is that his name has been synonymous with such solitary pursuits throughout the ages since.).
column8: 4) [[playadom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/playadom)] 6-12-2008(29): He **climax** ed so hard, it spurted up on to the wall, and he soiled his pants in the process.
column9: 5) [[jimsublimeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimsublimeman)] 19-9-2007(24): You put bags of _soil_ against the bedroom _wall_ to drown out the neighbour's _climax_ noises.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-11-2007(236): You book a **room** in a love hotel called " _Climax House_ ".
column6: 2) [[eieneverafter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eieneverafter)] 25-3-2008(150): A simple **room** is made up of a roof, some walls, and a dirt floor.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(40): This is the **room** of a “climax house”, that is, a Japanese love hotel.
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 28-5-2007(27): "Jesus, get a **room** you two." So the couple went back to their _house_ and _climaxed_ there instead.
column9: 5) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 11-6-2008(18): Under my _roof_ , I've _climaxed_ in every **ROOM**. I also enjoy doing it in different kinds of **room** s: the bedroom ( 寝室 ), Japanese-style **room** s ( 和室 ), even once in a changing **room** ( 更衣室 ).

column5: 1) [[watanuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/watanuki)] 29-12-2007(834): <Http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/7731/karatesd3.jpg> Just look at this image…
column6: 2) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 26-2-2008(126): Just as we were about to climax her father arrived with a sword.
column7: 3) [[oRis1024](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oRis1024)] 29-8-2008(59): **Arrival** of a hero always happens at the CLIMAX of the movie, and of course he carries a SABER to defeat the enemy.
column8: 4) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 21-5-2007(25): The **arrival** of the main character from Yojimbo back in town with a _saber_ in hand, is the unforgettable _climax_ of the movie.
column9: 5) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 21-3-2008(15): Musashi's rather late **arrival** for a duel, _sabre_ in hand, is the _climax_ of that novel…

column3: The archaic English form for "does" indicates a humble form of the verb "to do." It is made up of _climax_ and _taskmaster_.
column5: 1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 12-6-2008(267): This character is used in two very high-frequency words: "you are welcome" ( どう致しまして ) and the honorific form of onegaishimasu ( お願い致します , おねがいいたします). Can't you just picture this ridiculously polite S&M picture? A businessman, who **DOTH** the bidding of his _taskmistress_ , is _climaxing_ and yelling out " お願い致します " while she whips and says " どう致しまして ". (This kanji also means "to bring about" and "do humbly", which is perfect for this image).
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 23-4-2007(208): To reach _climax_ I **doth** the bidding of my dominatrix _taskmaster_.
column7: 3) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 7-11-2007(35): After he had climaxed Shakespeare is reported to have said to his _taskmistress_ , "The lady **doth** charge too much.".
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 27-11-2008(24): Let's have an irreverent take on a line from the play “Hamlet”, by William Shakespeare : “The lady **doth** protest too much.” : “The climaxing taskmistress **doth** whippeth too much”. Our taskmistress is enjoying the whipping so much, she climaxes. My taskmistress image comes from the classic game “Dungeon Keeper”. In this game, the “mistress” character is dressed in a 'domination' outfit, and whips your servants (goblins etc.) to make them work faster.
column9: 5) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 31-5-2008(22): The _taskmaster_ is my old English teacher. He loved Shakespeare, and the _climax_ if his day was to hear his pupils say **doth**.

column3: When you draw this character think of linking two _walls_ together, one right side up and the other upside down.
column5: 1) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 4-2-2008(413): The 69 position allows both parties to **mutually** give themselves pleasure.
column6: 2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 4-9-2007(37): If you can combined your _walls_ with another house's _walls_ , both houses would **mutually** benefit, by the increase in size….
column7: 3) [[FoxintheStars](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FoxintheStars)] 20-8-2010(16): **Mutually** means "You and You together"—two katakana ユ (yu)s interlocking top and bottom.
column8: 4) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 4-12-2008(16): It feels better to imagine two elbows linked together in mutuality.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(10): Pictograph, see book. To me this kanji looks like the T and L of **mutually** (in the first two strokes) mirrored upside-down just like the King/Queen/Valet of a card game. The two L's of **mutually** are there to remind you the pair of TL's are **mutually** joined by the L's (i.e. “two times T and L, joined by the L's”).

column5: 1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 4-9-2007(274): Think of a really loud and annoying baby, you want to **abandon** it but it keeps coming back…so you take of your belt by the buckle, and buckle the baby to a tree!
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 11-4-2007(74): As in [sash](../v4/415.html) (#415 帯), I treat the _one_ _mountain_ in the middle to mean Mt. Fuji (Japan's ichiban mountain). Now we see an _infant_ being **abandon** ed on top of _Mt. Fuji_ well above the _tree_ line to die of exposure.
column7: 3) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 8-11-2007(58): A terrible image of an **abandon** ed _infant_. Here he is in his little car seat _buckled_ to a _tree_.
column8: 4) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 14-12-2008(27): **Note** : This Kanji does not contain 山 (mountain) as part of its radicals, it can rather be broken down to 木 厶 凵 亠 一 . Hence, it would be best to avoid using mountain in your story. **Story** : An inhumane way to **abandon** an _infant_ is to _buckle_ him to a _tree_ …
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 7-6-2009(14): The **abandon** ned _infant_ was _buckled_ to a _tree_.

column3: Since the key word has to do with raising children to be strong both in mind and body, it is easy to coordinate the primitive elements: _infant_ . . . _meat_.
column5: 1) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 14-9-2006(247): **Bringing up** your offspring means raising them from _infant_ until they are _meat_ ready to be harvested. What, cannibalism is in poor taste? Forget I ever brought it up. But **bring up** will forver be _infant meat_ to me. I want my baby back baby back baby back ribs!
column6: 2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 6-10-2008(163): I will **bring up** my _infants_ to eat _meat_. I'll not endure any vegetarian children in my house!
column7: 3) [[sprutnik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sprutnik)] 19-3-2009(85): **Bringing up** an _infant_ requires _months_ of hard work.
column8: 4) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 4-10-2007(41): Bringing up an infant on the Moon is easier than it is on Earth. (month=lunar) Gravity is lower, so they're easier to carry and they don't get hurt if they fall down. Best of all, their little space suits keep all that poopy smell inside!
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-10-2007(19): Remember The Matrix ? There was a spectacular scene where you could see human _infants_ brought up by the machines, as if they were vulgar _meat_ , for the sole purpose of feeding from the human's biological energy.

column5: 1) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 13-1-2008(309): A terrible yakuza **taskmaster** is **bringing up** his infant. Every time the infant does something wrong… well, you know what happens to yakuzas when they do something wrong.
column6: 2) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 29-12-2007(60): "Don't lay a _finger_ on him," a concerned mother says as the state **REMOVE** S her child away for _upbringing_ by a _taskmaster_ foster home.
column7: 3) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 24-11-2005(59): Ever heard of a kancho? If you haven't, just look it up. ,P Well I think of a kid giving his taskmaster a kancho. His parents, thinking they raised him properly, are appalled when they see this one day and immediately scold him, telling him to **remove** his finger from the taskmaster.
column8: 4) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 11-8-2008(36): A _taskmaster brings up_ his _infant_ by threatening to **remove** a _finger_ as punishment.
column9: 5) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 11-4-2010(32): To **remove** your _taskmaster_ , _bring up_ your middle _finger_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 10-11-2007(305): Scene at the baby factory: Manager: "Good news! Your _infant_ has been **allot** ted _human legs_ ". Parent to be: "Thanks **a lot**!".
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(40): An infant at the maternity ward is **allot** ed a new pair of human legs, because his are not grown properly or absent. Picture the “lot” as a parcel, placed near the infant, to be used later. The “lot” of human legs has been **allot** ed by some doctor, to be used later. Mnemonic “infant **allot** ed new pair of human legs”. Note: to **allot** means to apportion by lots, it has the same root as the word “lottery”.
column7: 3) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-12-2006(29): Each _infant_ gets its very own pair of _human legs_ , **allotted** by God.

column9: 5) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 21-6-2009(11): God decided to **allot** each infant only _one pair of legs_.

Stewie can already walk, so it's no surprise to see him get out of his cot with his _human legs_.

column5: 1) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 4-11-2007(317): **Sulphur** is like a _rock_ , but it can stink like a _stream_ of _infant_ doodie.
column6: 2) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 6-2-2007(69): Infants are baptised in streams inorder to prevent their descent into a place of **sulphur** and brimstone.
column7: 3) [[inaka_rob](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inaka_rob)] 17-4-2012(54): **Sulphur** IS a _rock_ , but it often stinks like a _stream_ of _infant_ urine. It is the same color too!!!
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 27-11-2008(44): One day a woman found an infant near the brim of a volcanic crater (“brimstone” is another name of **sulphur** ) who was made of yellow stone. She brought him back to the village. The next day the village was flooded. The villagers thus cursed the woman for bringing him to the village. – History: In the 8th century AD. Chinese scientists discovered that an explosive mixture could be produced by combining sulfur, charcoal and nitrate. We have learned [nitrate](../v4/115.html) (#115 硝) and sulfur, charcoal comes in lesson 24.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 31-10-2008(25): Imagine an _infant_ stranded on a _rock_ in the middle of a _stream_ of **sulphuric** acid, created by a nearby volcano… ( _continued in next kanji_ ).

column3: _Water_ . . . _infant_ . . . _flood_. Be sure to distinguish the two water primitives from one another in making your story.
column5: 1) [[Dragg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dragg)] 21-11-2007(254): INFANT Moses placed in the WATER and sent down the **current** of the STREAM.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(57): A water-breathing infant (genetically modified?) is caught in a flood, and drifts with the **current** , apparently enjoying himself in the process.
column7: 3) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 15-8-2008(29): An INFANT fell in the WATER and was lost down the **CURRENT** of the STREAM.
column8: 4) [[numirabis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/numirabis)] 1-3-2009(19): The best way to deal with a _stream_ of _infant_ doodie is _watery_ **current**.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 31-10-2008(18): …( _continued from previous kanji_ ). Unfortunately, the _water_ -level rose and the poor _infant_ was washed away by the _stream's **current**_ … dying a sulphurous death.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-10-2005(237): In some Asian kung-fu version of James Bond, the main protagonist has a “License To Kill” with his deadly _elbows_ and _human legs_. His suit is always stained of red blood at the _elbows_ and _lower legs_ (this to help create an image that distinguish the two elements).
column6: 2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 12-9-2008(82): A midget driver trying to pass the road test to get their driver's **license**. Their _elbows_ are too short to turn the wheel and their _legs_ are too short to reach the gas and breaks.
column7: 3) [[mazterdeath](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mazterdeath)] 14-2-2008(78): You need a **license** to show your _elbows_ and _legs_ in mid east countries.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 7-1-2008(44): To apply for your drivers **license** in Japan, you have to fill out lots of forms at standing-only counters. This kanji is a pictograph of you standing at the counter filling out the forms for your driver's **license**. Your _elbow_ is bent, writing the necessary information on the form (in kanji, of course!), your _human legs_ are getting tired from standing. Why can't they provide chairs and desks?
column9: 5) [[Oyabecory](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Oyabecory)] 6-4-2013(24): She did not pass her driver's **license** test: she steered with her _elbows_ while texting and then with her _legs_ while putting on make-up.

column5: 1) [[LordGolem](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LordGolem)] 17-7-2007(232): I named the right part _legal prostitute_ has it represents a walker [ _walking legs_ ] with the _license_. It's easy to imagine a _legal prostitute_ **tempt** ing a man with her _mouth_.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 20-2-2007(154): Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a _license_ to show off their _walking legs_ and **tempt** customers with their _mouths_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 2-5-2007(48): Tip : the right side can be thought of as a profession where one works on the street, for which they require a " _license_ to work on their _walking legs_ ". This could be a _sandwich man_ , or a _prostitute_ (see gorgon's story). In this case, it's easily remembered as a prostitute **tempt** ing passers-by with her _mouth_. The combination will appear again in frames 1014, and 1437, and another four times in RTK Volume 3, where it is known as _streetwalker_ (which is very close).
column8: 4) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 21-4-2008(20): With a hot _mouth_ , a _licence_ to screw and a _pair of legs_ , Amsterdam prostitutes are sure to **tempt** you.
column9: 5) [[dicedice](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dicedice)] 6-6-2008(16): The cop that pulled me over was such a prick, and I was sooo **tempt** ed to _mouth_ off at him! However, I LEFT my mouth shut because I knew if I didn't, he would suspend my _license_ for quite some time, and I'd be stuck with my _walking legs_.

column3: The kanji for **exit** pictures a series of mountain peaks coming out of the _earth_. Learn it together with the following frame.
column5: 1) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 4-1-2008(141): Suddenly, a _cactus_ comes out of the ground with a sign that reads: **exit**. Now you can leave the desert! (Note: giving this primitive the meaning 'cactus' can be useful later).
column6: 2) [[theBryan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theBryan)] 19-7-2008(63): The **exit** lays between these two mountains.
column7: 3) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 8-2-2007(19): A mountain chain blocked our **exit** from Mordor.
column8: 4) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 7-5-2009(7): Imagine Gollum from LOTR telling you the way to get out from Mordor, the **exit** is behind the stacked _mountains_.
column9: 5) [[okamix2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/okamix2)] 5-2-2009(7): The two _mountains_ one on top of the other, point to the only **exit** from Earth.

column3: Note the clearer outline of a triangular **mountain** here.
column5: 1) [[the40pancakes](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the40pancakes)] 14-4-2009(108): YOU CAN'T POSSIBLY NEED A MNEMONIC FOR THIS!!!!
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(67): Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a **mountain** often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the **mountain** (see FRAME 775 for an example).
column7: 3) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 17-2-2009(15): Chi chi chi chia. P p p penis!
column8: 4) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 14-5-2009(9): Stroke order: Begin with the center vertical.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-10-2008(7): I wouldn't have thrown my _walking stick_ in the _trash bin_ if I'd known I'd be climbing a **mountain**!

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 5-12-2006(217): With _fingers_ fumbling around trying to get the key in the door so he could _exit_ , the **bungling** husband woke his wife as he tried to leave for a rendezvous with his mistress.
column6: 2) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 3-6-2008(116): Horror movie cliche 769: **Bungling** victim's _fingers_ fumble  & bungle trying to open the _exit_ door.
column7: 3) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 23-12-2007(54): You were **bungling** in the darkness and touched the _cactus_ with your _fingers_. OUCH!!
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 25-11-2008(33): Here's a guy who's **bungling** his first experience with his hand up a girl's skirt and ends up with his fingers in the exit hole. She yells: get out of my bung- hole!
column9: 5) [[ambrokusa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ambrokusa)] 25-3-2007(22): After the brief press conference in China, the **bungling** President Bush put his _fingers_ on the door to escape, but the _exit_ was locked.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 11-12-2006(236): A _mountain_ -sized _stone_ is known as a **boulder**.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-10-2005(51): Here we see _mountain rocks_ rolling down the mountain, gathering into a single monstrous **boulder** crushing everything in its path. Think snowball effect, even if it wouldn't work with rocks.
column7: 3) [[Wizard](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wizard)] 30-6-2008(42): **Boulder** s are _rocks_ that fall from the _mountains_ above, just like in zelda.
column8: 4) [[Rivvie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rivvie)] 5-3-2008(12): A huge **boulder** ( _rock_ ) is tumbling down from the mountain (towards you! duck!).
column9: 5) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 14-9-2008(5): **Boulder** , Colorado the _rocky mountain_ state.

column5: 1) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 8-4-2008(311): Burn enough **charcoal** and you'll have a _mountain_ of _ash_.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 30-4-2006(42): You get **charcoal** from volcano ("fire mountain", 火山 ) ashes.
column7: 3) [[Killersquierl](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Killersquierl)] 24-11-2007(37): Imagine a that a _mountain_ fell onto a pile of _ashes_ , compressing it into **charcoal**.
column8: 4) [[Jaunty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Jaunty)] 6-7-2009(24): A huge _mountain_ sitting on top of some _ashes_ will compress it into **charcoal** (I know not really - but this makes it easy to remember).
column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 24-4-2009(18): Gas or **charcoal** grill? BBQ aficionados agree: **charcoal** wins. The only downside is the _mountain_ of _ash_ to clean up afterwards.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 30-4-2006(218): On the left, there are three mountains. The road **branches off** to each of them. (Note: This kanji is mostly used for branches in the road).
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 5-12-2006(94): In a lot of Super Nintendo-era RPGs, there are _mountain_ levels to get through. You view them from overhead, so you can see a mazelike path with many _branches_. Picture your sprite characters at one such fork in the mountain path, as it **branches off** in two directions.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(25): Mountain branches mean you branched off the mountain path. In other words, once you **branch off** from the mountain path you are going to have to hack your way through the branches.
column8: 4) [[kadano](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kadano)] 24-3-2009(24): You want to avoid the mountain road, so you **branch off** to an easier path.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 22-11-2006(17): I just picture a tall mountain with many branches growing off its right-hand side. So many, that the mountain loses balance and falls on its side.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 24-10-2006(215): Heisig mentions at kanjiclinic.com that he wishes he'd chosen **mountain pass** for this keyword as it's closer to what the word means. If we do this, the kanji makes complete sense because a **mountain pass** is just _below_ the _mountain_ _top_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-1-2006(76): To the north of Lorien lies the Misty Mountains, and below their towering peaks are the Mines of Moria. The Fellowship of the Ring first tried for the **MOUNTAIN PASS** that goes above, but were halted by the wizardry of Saruman at Caradhras, and so are forced to take the **MOUNTAIN PASS** that goes below, through the mountain - a path long feared by Gandalf for the ancient evil that lurks there. Note : the kanji does in fact refer to a "mountain pass".
column7: 3) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 5-12-2006(31): The place on the _mountain_ where you stand _above_ and look _down_ upon all creation is the mountain peak.
column8: 4) [[howdycowdy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/howdycowdy)] 10-4-2008(24): You're stuck. You look _up_ and see only _mountain_. You look _down_ and see only _mountain_. How the hell do you get out of here? Oh, there's a **MOUNTAIN PASS**. Thank God!
column9: 5) [[Izumo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Izumo)] 31-3-2010(19): The **MOUNTAIN PASS** helps you go _up_ and _down_ the _mountain_.

column5: 1) [[joyeboy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joyeboy)] 11-8-2006(260): Sam and Frodo were steadfast _companions_ even as _Mount Doom_ **crumble** d above them.
column6: 2) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 6-2-2009(214): September 11. [lol it also has 11 strokes], whoever reported this story is a loser, get alife. This is the best story on the website.
column7: 3) [[nekoyaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nekoyaki)] 9-4-2009(122): Sept 11: The _twin towers_ (= 朋 ) **crumble** into a _mountain_ of rubble. (thanks liosama).
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 3-9-2007(67): You and your _companion_ are climbing to the top of the _mountain_ when it suddenly begins to **crumble**. Only one of you can survive - who's it going to be? You or your _companion_?
column9: 5) [[Beneus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beneus)] 4-3-2009(24): The reason to always bring a _companion_ when you go climbing in _mountains_. It is unsteady and may **crumble** under you at any time. That's when you need that someone to pull you up again.

column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 29-4-2007(214): To maintain **secrecy** , secret societies invariably have to house themselves in the moutains.
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 7-11-2007(161): To maintain **secrecy** , secret societies invariably have to house themselves on top of the moutains. (Slight tweak of chamcham's story, using fuaburisa's idea for remembering where to put the mountain primitive.).
column7: 3) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 16-1-2008(53): This kanji tells you an original version of "Brokeback **Mountain** ". Here, the couple of cowboys have fallen in love, and their only way to keep their love in **SECRECY** is by meeting **invariably** at the **house** on the top of the **mountain**.
column8: 4) [[j0k0m0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/j0k0m0)] 12-4-2009(41): **Secrecy** in your house, invariably leads to a mountain of trouble.
column9: 5) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 4-9-2007(17): My lover and I had a _house_ in the _mountains_ so that we could meet in **secrecy** , but it was _invariably_ found out by my wife.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 3-7-2006(311): When I think of **honey** , I think of a bee hive, which is a HOUSE that INVARIABLY has INSECTS.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 13-12-2007(95): A _house_ with a lot of **honey** will _invariably_ attract many _insects_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(17): The “house” which is invariably divided in hexagons and is full of insects is where **honey** comes from (a bee hive).
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 28-12-2012(9): **Honey** left in a _house_ will _invariably_ attract _insects_.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 22-11-2006(9): Think of a queen bee that has been forcefully separated from her "king bee" and put in a luxurious beehouse to produce **honey** for a factory. Despite all the homely comforts, she weeps all day from a broken heart, thereby producing some of the most foul-tasting **honey** anyone has ever tried.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 30-4-2006(250): **Storm** is a full-blown wind that rips the mountains off the ground (you see one flying here).
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 16-1-2006(76): _Winds_ are gathering at the base of the _mountain_ (note the hint to primitive placement), going up, and turning into a huge mountain **storm**.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 5-11-2007(73): What a **storm**! Even a _mountain_ was carried off by the _wind_!
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 21-2-2007(15): A **storm** is _winds_ strong enough to lift a _mountain_!
column9: 5) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 9-4-2009(6): You are sitting on top of Fuji, enjoying spectacular view of the **storm** below.

column3: _Mountain_ . . . _strange_. Hint: you might save yourself the trouble of a story here simply by recalling the kanji for _cape_ (Frame 164) and toying around with the differing images suggested by the key words **promontory** and _cape_.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 30-1-2008(297): This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with _mountain_ in place of _soil_. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives _stone_ and _strange_. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which **promontory** is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.
column6: 2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 3-9-2007(128): A **promontory** is a small, _strange mountain_ that juts out into the sea.
column7: 3) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 4-5-2009(32): **Pro _mount_ ory**. A _strange_ word, indeed.
column8: 4) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 14-5-2008(22): A **promontory** is a _mountain strange_ (not a mountain range) that juts out like Cape Odd.
column9: 5) [[krungthep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/krungthep)] 12-12-2009(17): Ayumi Hamasaki 浜崎 あゆみ will promote her Nagasaki 長崎 concert with a _strange_ promotional stunt: she will ride a Kawasaki 川崎 to the top of a **promontory** _mountain_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-10-2007(85): Standing at the base of the **bluffs** I announce, "I'm going to climb those _ivy- covered cliffs_ , and then the _mountain_ on top of them." My friends don't believe me, "He **bluffs**!" they say.
column6: 2) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 23-3-2008(16): The _ivy_ -covered _cliff_ we saw on the [horizon](../v4/157.html) (#157 涯) … the sheer beauty of the _mountain_ that overlooks these **bluffs** is enough to make you want to swim for shore yourself!
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-9-2009(11): This is used in the title of the 2008 Studio Ghibli film "Ponyo on the _Cliff_ by the Sea" [崖の上のポニョ。](midori://search?text=崖の上のポニョ。) "Ponyo on the _Mountain- high Ivy-covered_ **Bluffs** by the Sea" is an alternative title. <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponyo_on_the_Cliff_by_the_Sea>.
column8: 4) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 12-8-2009(7): In 崖の上のポニョ (Ponyo), the **bluffs** are where Yousuke's house is, on the _mountainous cliff_ covered in _ivy_.
column9: 5) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 6-11-2011(4): To get to the MOUNTAIN **BLUFFS** you have to scale the IVY CLIFFS.

column3: This character is meant to be a picture of someone walking leftwards, putting one leg forward in order to **enter** someplace. Since the  "in" side of a character is the left, it should be easy to remember the writing of this character.
column4: * As a primitive, the meaning of the key word is expanded to include: _to go in_ , _to put in_ , _to come in_ , and the like. It generally appears atop its relative primitive, where, unlike the element for _umbrella_ , the two strokes do not touch each other, making it virtually the same as the kanji for _eight_. When it appears in any other position, however, it retains its original form.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(69): Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive, using the image of going through a door, even one that stands alone with the frame and no wall around, helps flesh out the primitive “enter”.
column6: 2) [[vgambit](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vgambit)] 26-12-2008(36): Gordon Freeman **enters** the Black Mesa corporation's headquarters on that fateful day, after starting up a game of Half-Life (this kanji looks exactly like the lambda from the logo when written).
column7: 3) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 11-8-2008(11): Something only a Native American could pull off instead of saying "Come in please.". When used as a primitive, instead of **enter** , I use a **tepee** for this character. See my stories up to [sue](../v4/787.html) (#787 訟).
column8: 4) [[myglagata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/myglagata)] 12-5-2008(8): Note that the printed character and the written character appear very differently.
column9: 5) [[brainrobert](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brainrobert)] 9-6-2010(5): HAIRU **ENTER** 入る person **enter** s stage left.

column5: 1) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 11-10-2007(167): During a traffic jam it is impossible to get your car to _enter_ the _roadway_ as it is **crowded** with cars. Think of a grid lock so bad cars are litterally scraping up against each other like people on a Japanese train during rush hour.
column6: 2) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 6-2-2009(148): Everybody tries to _enter_ the _road_ during rush hour. That's why it's so **crowded**.
column7: 3) [[blueraccoon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blueraccoon)] 26-1-2009(36): There is a Japanese comedy skit where they play a trick on an unaware person who is walking down a quiet empty street. The trick is that a huge **crowd** suddenly _enters_ the _road_ and stampedes towards the person. <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qb7zwr3vQKo> (thanks, decals).
column8: 4) [[bigspenderJ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigspenderJ)] 13-3-2007(15): Don't enter the main roads in Tokyo on weekdays… they are **CROWDED**.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-12-2007(9): It's so **crowded** that even _stepping into_ the _road_ doesn't relieve the problem. ('These **Crowded** _Streets_ ', Dave Matthews Band).

column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 4-1-2007(159): When something is _entered_ by a _dagger_ , it ends up being cut in several **parts**.
column6: 2) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 21-3-2008(147): (This kanji also has the meanings of "understand" and "minute"). It's important to understand that were you to _enter_ an hour with a _dagger_ and cut it into **parts** , those **parts** would be minutes.
column7: 3) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 28-5-2008(76): Perhaps one of the most read kanji in Japanese. It means to understand, to **part** , fraction, to break up, rate, minute, etc. To understand something completly one must _enter_ a _dagger_ into it to break it up into its **part** s. Imagine understanding a body by doing an autopsy( _enter, dagger_ ) and studying the **parts**. [分かりますか？](midori://search?text=分かりますか？) .
column8: 4) [[Hujis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hujis)] 30-11-2008(22): I cut the cake in to _eight_ **part** s by using a _dagger_. Then I ate one **part** every minute. (I just found eight easier to use than enter.).
column9: 5) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 19-4-2010(13): Forget mnemonics for this one. Just look at it, it's a sword **part** ing the line above it (cutting it into two **part** s). Easy!

column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-11-2005(255): In the case of true **poverty** , not having money is only part of the problem. There are other components as well, like lack of education, class structuring, etc., but that doesn't really matter. Just remember that the money is only part of it, not the whole.
column6: 2) [[bokuzukuri](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bokuzukuri)] 5-1-2006(123): Parting with your money will lead to **poverty**.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 23-1-2006(41): Nice one darg_sama. Since I imagine _part_ as a section of a pie chart, I'll think of a pie chart representing the causes of **poverty**. _Shells_ (lack of money) is just one _part_ of the pie chart.
column8: 4) [[Chocobonstrife](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Chocobonstrife)] 26-4-2012(26): **Poverty** is having only a PART of the MONEY you need to get by.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 5-11-2008(25): Imagine someone so poor they only have part of a penny(or shell).

column5: 1) [[henroski](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/henroski)] 6-2-2008(226): The PART of my HEAD where I remember the KANJI is in the kanji **PARTITION**.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 22-11-2006(129): The last time I tried to **partition** a hard drive under Linux, I got a severe migraine that parted my head.
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 22-5-2007(40): There are different _parts_ of the _head_ and they each have their own **partition** s: the corpus callosum, the different hemispheres, etc.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(24): The head is **partition** ed into parts. Thinking of the head as a “hard drive” (where all the information we know is stored) we may imagine the head being **partition** ed just like a 3D pie chart.
column9: 5) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 10-1-2008(18): Ｔｈｉｎｋ ｂａｃｋ ｔｏ ８２ [項、](midori://search?text=項、) the craft of starting a paragraph. This time you want to **partition** the page instead so add 分 part to the front instead.

column3: _Come in_ . . . _elbows_. Use the key word in its adjectival sense, not as a noun.
column5: 1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 12-2-2007(335): I always open the doors to the **public** restrooms with my elbows because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.
column6: 2) [[mcbainpc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcbainpc)] 27-6-2008(270): I always _enter_ the doors to the **public** restrooms with my _elbows_ because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.
column7: 3) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 27-6-2009(48): The **public** trains in Japan are so crowded, to _enter_ you have to _elbow_ your way in.
column8: 4) [[nakome](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nakome)] 7-3-2008(11): It's bad manners to put your _elbows_ on the table when you eat. So, when I _come in_ to **public** restaurants, I always make sure that I keep my _elbows_ down, out of the **public** 's eye. (notice: down helps me keep track of where the elbow primitive goes).
column9: 5) [[tritonxg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tritonxg)] 7-1-2010(7): [FR]public japlt:N1 **KÔ ôyake** kanji &kana:126 _huit+coude_ **ennemi **public** : la bande des quatre :** l'ennemi **PUBLIC** en Chine était la bande des quatre, soit HUIT COUDES 公案 【こうあん】kouan 公会問答 【こうかいもんどう】catechism 公会堂 【こうかいどう】town hall 公転周期 【こうてんしゅうき】solar revolution 霍公鳥 【ほととぎす】cuckoo 大公国 【たいこうこく】grand duchy 公民権 【こうみんけん】civil rights.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 9-2-2007(198): Following up with the "entering public restrooms" story for the right-hand primitive: _public_ restrooms always reek of **pine _tree_** scented disinfectant.
column6: 2) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 15-4-2007(83): A **pine tree** is a _public tree_ : they are frequently planted in public squares, in commemoration of the respect Conficius held for them.
