In the kanji for **perusal** , we have _see_ , but also the addition of the Japanese sales assistant who acts as your personal _slave_ with their body always _inclined_ to the _floor_ in a bow, marking the more respectful nuance of this kanji..
column9: 5) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 25-3-2008(26): [var of romanrozhok's story] This kanji is used for the keigo ご覧になる . A _slave_ comes up to his master who is _reclining_ on the _floor_ while his mistresses keep him cool with big leaves. The slave holds a document that has just been completed. As a slave talking to a master, he doesn't just say "you wanted to _see_ this" but "the document is ready for your **perusal** ". In Japanese, he would use " ご覧になる .".

column3: This kanji depicts a **gigantic** "pop-eye," which accounts for its shape. Be sure not to confuse it with the _slave_ ( _retainer_ ) we just learned.
column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 1-5-2007(342): This is actually the top view of a porn star with a **gigantic** erect penis. The top and bottom are his arms and the middle is his penis. Imagine him making the pumping motion while he's banging some chick. The arms move in, the penis moves out and vice versa.
column6: 2) [[thegeelonghellswan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeelonghellswan)] 4-10-2008(130): The letter E, with a **GIGANTIC** middle stroke.
column7: 3) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 12-5-2009(25): The _slave_ without his bonds (the missing two strokes) feels **gigantic**.
column8: 4) [[lugelen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lugelen)] 9-1-2012(23): **Gigantic** … nay, 巨 normous!
column9: 5) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 1-6-2008(17): You know if this 漢字 was just rotated 90 degrees to left/right, there wouldn't be any stories on this page…

column5: 1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 10-7-2006(172): Having _gigantic_ _fingers_ is useful to **repel** insects. You can swat them away a lot easier!
column6: 2) [[SpaceCakeGirl](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SpaceCakeGirl)] 1-1-2008(114): A woman might be **REPEL** LED by a porn star's GIGANTIC penis, so he kindly offers to use his FINGERS instead.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 10-11-2007(73): Watching those _giant fingers_ at work cracking lobster, Jerry Seinfeld was **repel** led by his new girlfriend at dinner.
column8: 4) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 30-6-2008(50): Want to **REPEL** someone? Give em the _gigantic finger_ \- your biggest finger, which is your middle one of course! (It's even more memorable if you imagine someone with a grotesquely large middle finger).
column9: 5) [[henroski](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/henroski)] 9-2-2008(15): A woman with man's hands is all it takes to **repel** Seinfeld, "but George, her FIGERS are GIGANTIC".

column3: With a little imagination, one can see a muscle in this simple, two-stroke character meaning **power**.
column4: * As a primitive, either _muscle_ or _power_ can be used.
column5: 1) [[lankydan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lankydan)] 23-8-2007(140): I always refer to the **power** of the _KATAKANA "KA"_.
column6: 2) [[stshores24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stshores24)] 10-7-2008(39): I have a very **power** ful _muscle カ_ in my driveway!
column7: 3) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 3-1-2010(23): As a primitive, I chose Arnold Schwarzenegger. Picture him saying California with his **power** ful accent (KA-lee-fornia).
column8: 4) [[oyxoyx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oyxoyx)] 5-5-2011(19): The **power** of Goku: _KA_ -mehamehaaaaaaa! (Katakana KA).
column9: 5) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 28-12-2007(12): You've got to have a lot of **power** to wield a sword with such a small blade (notice how the handle of the sword is about 5 times the size of the little blade on top?).

column3: _Rice fields_ . . . _power_. This character is the gender-specific **man** , not the generic human _person_ of frame 951.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(212): Male is seen here as muscles working in the field, in other words working in the rice fields is the work of the male who are usually stronger. This is more or less the meaning of the original Chinese character.
column6: 2) [[Callooh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Callooh)] 3-9-2007(107): When it comes to choosing a **MAN** , I prefer _brains_ over _muscles_.
column7: 3) [[phauna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/phauna)] 7-2-2008(39): Men have brains and muscles. And, er, women don't.
column8: 4) [[sethg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethg)] 29-3-2009(12): A **man** should value his _brains_ over his _muscles_.
column9: 5) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 10-5-2009(7): **Male** have more _power_ to work the _rice field_.

column5: 1) [[partyrash](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/partyrash)] 15-1-2008(343): Those jocks who always tried to show their muscles in the schoolhouse are now the ones out there doing manual **labor** jobs while we sit here and learn Japanese. Ha!
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 13-5-2007(92): At the _schoolhouse_ , the administration develops the children's _muscles_ by making them do manual **labour**.
column7: 3) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(51): Hard **labor** is like a _schoolhouse_ for your _muscles_.
column8: 4) [[akahige](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akahige)] 5-6-2009(13): The **labor** laws in Japan are different from America. At public _schools_ you'll see kids cleaning–they're the **labor** force.
column9: 5) [[j0k0m0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/j0k0m0)] 17-5-2009(10): Stay in school, kids, if you want the power to avoid a life of hard **labor**.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 21-5-2007(293): The necromancer hangs out at the local _graveyard_ and uses his dark _powers_ to **recruit** an army of undead. Emphasize the verb form to keep distinct from the noun [cadet](../v4/1173.html) (#1173 曹).
column6: 2) [[henroski](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/henroski)] 9-2-2008(53): WANTED: Hardworking GRAVEYARD diggers. Must have 6 months experience with POWERFUL muscles as will be working in South Africa burying deceased elephants.
column7: 3) [[partyrash](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/partyrash)] 15-1-2008(23): The army starts heavily **recruit** ing a lot of manpower and muscle to replace the many who have been killed and sent to the graveyard.
column8: 4) [[nagisa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nagisa)] 22-11-2007(15): The best place for the zombie army to **recruit** is the graveyard, where their power in numbers can easily be doubled.
column9: 5) [[j0k0m0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/j0k0m0)] 21-4-2009(10): The graveyard does have the power to **recruit** us all.

column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(229): I have an **inferiority** complex because I have _fewer_ _muscles_ than everyone else at the gym. They all look like _Macho Man Randy Savage_ (power) to me.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 4-5-2007(59): I had trouble remembering the relative position of the components, so now I use this story: Even _muscular_ men have **inferiority** if they have _few_ things above their _muscles_ (i.e., brain cells).
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 31-12-2006(43): I have an **inferiority** complex because I have _few muscles_! (Image: Arnold laughing at a weakling on the beach with few muscles).
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 9-11-2008(10): If you like 'Heroes', then imagine Sylar having an **inferiority** complex, because he has a _few powers_ less than Peter Petrelli.
column9: 5) [[cingold](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cingold)] 11-9-2009(7): **Inferiority** is felt by those with _few muscles_.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-3-2007(298): The great **achievement** s of humankind, were _crafts_ completed by _muscle power_ : the pyramids, the Eiffel tower, etc.
column6: 2) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 1-10-2007(62): All of Arnold Schwarzenegger's **achievement** s started with him _crafting_ his _muscles_.
column7: 3) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 28-9-2009(35): Try adding the phrase: "What an エカcellent **achievement**!" to whatever story you come up with.
column8: 4) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 13-12-2008(30): In WarCRAFT, **ACHIEVEMENT** S were added so POWERful players would have something else to do.
column9: 5) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 18-2-2008(11): The greatest **achievement** is to bent an _I-beam_ with your own _power_ and muscles.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 11-9-2006(183): Mnemonic " _pegasus_ **persuasion** _power_ ". I think of the hippogriff from Harry Potter as being like a _pegasus_. To befriend a hippogriff, you have to **persuade** it you mean no harm, you can do this if you have " _pegasus_ **persuasion** _power_ ".
column6: 2) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 13-6-2008(76): A little girl is trying to **persuade** a little boy to play dolls with her. She offers him her plastic _pegasus_ figure and says, "See? _Pegasus_ has _muscles_. He's got _Pegasus_ _power_." And the little boy says "You cannot **persuade** me to play with your flying unicorn. I'm not of that persuasion.".
column7: 3) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 26-8-2008(53): Only the **power** ful can **persuade** **Pegasus** to let them ride her.
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 18-4-2008(31): _Pegasus Power?_ What kind of dorky name for an electric company is that? You'll never ever **persuade** me to invest my money in a company called _Pegasus Power_.
column9: 5) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 15-4-2007(16): The crafty _Pegasus_ **persuades** stupid _Conan_ that he, _Pegasus_ , should ride on _Conan's_ back, and not the other way around. Picture it! The power of persuasion…

column5: 1) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(112): Guy + Power: To reach a position of power in the company, the average guy has to **toil** very hard for many years.
column6: 2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 28-4-2009(70): Attempted rape……a man attemps to use his power to force his crotch into a woman….try to imagine her actually struggling as much as possible (toiling) and putting up a good fight…..also instead of intercourse, you can imagine him trying to force her to give him a blowjob(the crotch next to the woman).
column7: 3) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 6-10-2007(44): _Guys_ with large _muscles_ usually find themselves **toiling** in dirty, disgusting trenches doing the work more delicately constructed individuals cannot (or will not).
column8: 4) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 20-8-2008(28): Guy + Power: the average _guy_ has to **toil** very hard for many years in order to reach a position of _power_ in the company.
column9: 5) [[Shingo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shingo)] 14-11-2009(24): For the average guy to get muscles he must really **toil** in the gym.

column3: If you think of the _ten_ as a little  "cross" sitting atop the root of a _house_ where we are used to seeing the  "chimney" ( _drop_ ), then you have the image of a _chapel_. (This combination will appear once more in this book: Frame 1465.) To complete the picture for **uprising** , add: _child_ . . . _muscles_.
column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(54): An **erection** can shoot like a _needle_ from its _crown_ and has the _power_ to make a _child_.
column6: 2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 20-1-2009(18): The **erection** is the crowned needle that's got the power to make children.
column7: 3) [[eri401](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eri401)] 5-7-2011(13): (Using both keywords). The _child_ had the _power_ of _10 crowns_ \- it was he who led the peasant **uprising**. He didn't even have his first **erection** and yet he was more powerful than all the adults. 勃然 【ぼつぜん】 (adj-t,adv-to) sudden, fit of anger 勃起 【ぼっき】 (n,vs) **erection** (usu. penis), standing erect, stiffening.
column8: 4) [[KanjiKami](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/KanjiKami)] 11-8-2011(9): (Using the "newer" key word of "Uprising" and the 6th edition explanation that the _needle/crown_ combo = "chapel") Joan of Arc was just a _child_ under the influence of the _chapel_ when she was inspired with the _power_ to lead the French uprising.
column9: 5) [[alucardchuu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alucardchuu)] 17-8-2010(6): The power of his **erection** crowned him with 10 children.

column5: 1) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 10-11-2007(296): _10,000_ Persians are at the base of the _cliff_ , but the leader of the 300 Spartans just flexes his huge _muscles_ and **encourage** s his men by shouting that they have the _power_ to fight them all.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 21-7-2007(71): People **encourage** you, giving you the power so you can dive off the 10,000m high cliff into the sea.
column7: 3) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 13-2-2008(56): See the most-starred story in [horse chestnut](../v4/514.html) (#514 栃) for an easy way to remember this one. –> That same famous _cliffside_ in Japan at which _10,000_ people died … together, we have the _power_ to do something about it … let's **encourage** the government to take action!
column8: 4) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 8-6-2008(54): _10,000_ lemmings, an invisible _power_ seems to be encouraging them to dive off the _cliff_.
column9: 5) [[yukkuri_kame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yukkuri_kame)] 9-4-2009(33): All of you on this site **encourage** me so much. Japanese no longer seems like an impossible cliff 10,000 meters high. Thanks to the **encourage** ment I've gotten here, I have the POWER to learn 10,000 Kanji!

column3: _Muscles_ . . . _mouth_. This is the only case in which the primitive for _muscle_ appears on the left, note should be taken of the fact in composing one's story.
column5: 1) [[bigspenderJ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigspenderJ)] 29-3-2007(374): If you eat anymore, you will be **add** ing more カロries. (katakana karo).
column6: 2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 5-10-2006(127): This is _Power Mouth_ , the most annoying neighbour in the world who always has something to **add**.
column7: 3) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 3-8-2008(80): To **add** _muscle_ mass it's important to put protein in your _mouth_ after working out.
column8: 4) [[krungthep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/krungthep)] 6-7-2008(21): Some tenis players seem to think that they can **add** _power_ to their shots by opening their _mouths_ and groaning as they hit the ball.
column9: 5) [[meredithcat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meredithcat)] 3-8-2010(14): To **add** muscles, **add** some calories (カロリー) to your mouth.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 18-4-2007(220): When someone at work gets married, you pass around an envelope to which you _add_ some _money_ and a card which you sign with your **congratulations**.
column6: 2) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 9-6-2008(122): **Congratulations** are so much better when you _add money_ to them.
column7: 3) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 30-5-2006(61): I was a bit shocked when I learnt that it's tradition in Japan to _add_ around 30,000 yen ( _shells_ ) or more to a wedding **congratulations** card.
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 25-2-2008(31): **Congratulations** on winning the lottery! We'll add the clams (money) to your account.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(7): You like it when shells (money) are added to your “congratulations cards”.

column3: _Add_ . . . _trees_. Hint: if you ever _played with_ an  " **Erector** Set " or "Tinker Toys" as a child, don't pass up the opportunity to relate it to this kanji's key word and the element for _trees_.
column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 17-7-2006(261): Instant wood. Just add Viagra.
column6: 2) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 13-5-2006(180): I'm not sure I know about **erect** or sets or tinker toys but I do know about jenga. You play by taking _wooden_ pieces from the middle of a wooden tower and _add_ ing them to the top. In this way you **erect** a very unstable structure.
column7: 3) [[ivoSF](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivoSF)] 12-7-2006(86): Powerfull mouth makes "tree" stand **erect** , hmm what does that mean?
column8: 4) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 26-8-2008(70): _Add wood_ to **erect** a structure.
column9: 5) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 30-7-2008(36): To **erect** a building in Warcraft, you just keep _adding_ more _wood_ , until the building is fully **erect** ed.

column3: _Part of the body_ . . . _muscles_ (three of which give us  " _triceps_ " or " _muscles_ on top of _muscles_ "). You will want to keep the kanji distinct from the one that follows by paying attention to the positioning of the elements.
column5: 1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 1-5-2008(244): What _part of the body_ has a _very, very, very powerful_ smell? The **armpit** , of course!
column6: 2) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 1-7-2008(71): **Armpit** is the _flesh_ near your _tri_ ceps.
column7: 3) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 11-3-2008(51): (no important on yomi) The part of Conan's body that is three times more effective at defeating foes than his muscles are his stinky **ARMPIT** s. [Note: Typically, when the flesh primitive is on the left side it refers to a body part - this helps distinguish in from [threaten](../v4/871.html) (#871 脅)].
column8: 4) [[manos](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/manos)] 14-9-2007(33): The piece of flesh between the triceps and the deltoid muscle (note how the 3 strengths form a neat delta) is the **armpit**.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 9-2-2006(19): The part of the body on your flank, where the triceps is attached, is the **armpit**. Note: the kanji is often used in the sense of “flank” or “side”. The **armpit** is a part of the body on your sides/flanks.

column5: 1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 27-10-2007(257): Compare the primitive positions of [armpit](../v4/870.html) (#870 脇) and [threaten](../v4/871.html) (#871 脅). When your _triceps_ rest alongside your _body_ , they fit snugly against your **armpit**. When you hold them above your _body_ , however, your posture becomes quite **threaten** ing.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 29-4-2007(39): Arnold S. ( _triceps_ ) **threaten** s to kill the waiter if he does not put a steak ( _meat_ ) infront of him immediately.
column7: 3) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 7-3-2009(38): Zelda (NES): Link **THREATEN** S Ganon by lifting the "TRIforce of POWER" over his BODY. Then the final battle begins.
column8: 4) [[TunS77](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TunS77)] 25-10-2008(21): Is he really that **THREATEN** ing..? He may have big _triceps_ above, but I bet theres a tiny bit of _meat_ below!
column9: 5) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(15): A towering mass of _muscles_ on top of _muscles_ is looming over you, **threatening** to beat you into a bloody pile of _meat_.

column3: This prefix should be kept distinct from _inter_ (Frame 222) and _mutual_ (Frame 819). Its elements: _needle_ . . . _triceps_.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 7-2-2006(321): The nurse says : “If you **co-** operate, that _needle_ (syringe) in your _triceps_ won't hurt”. Note: both **co-** and cooperate are meanings for this kanji.
column6: 2) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 21-4-2009(103): **Co-** operation: 3 persons can have the _power_ of _ten_ if they **co-** operate.
column7: 3) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 17-3-2008(22): _3 times Arnold_ (Schwazzaneggar) asked his **co-** workers to cooperate and give him a _needle_ (syringe) of steroids (into his tricep), but each time they refused to **co-** ooperate.
column8: 4) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 23-6-2008(21): The nurse says: "If you don't **co-operate** with us and let us stick this _needle_ into your _triceps_ , sir, we'll have to stick it somewhere else! (Thnx Fabrice!).
column9: 5) [[axelb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/axelb)] 11-8-2008(11): If we cooperate, we will have _ten_ times as much _power_ and _triceps_.

column3: By joining the top four strokes, you should get a picture of the front current of a river, the stream trailing behind. Hence the character for **going**.
column4: * As a primitive, this character has two forms. Reduced to the left side only, it can mean a _column_ , _going_ , or a _line_ of something or other. When the middle is opened up to make room for other elements, it means a _boulevard_.
column5: 1) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 3-5-2008(76): To me, this looks like a bridge **going** over a body of water, being supported by columns underneath it. Being that I live near the ocean, I see tourists and vacationers coming and **going** constantly on the bridge. Because the bridge is so long, it forms an arc to support the structural integrity. You can see that arc here.
column6: 2) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 4-11-2005(53): I use _The Flash_ for for this primitive, a superhero who is always _going_ very fast.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(32): See book. * As a primitive I will prefer to use the meaning of column whenever possible, and use the image of columns of the temples of ancient Greece (such as Corinthian columns). The primitive meaning of line is best avoided in my opinion because it is very close to FRAME 812 “file”. **Going** is not very graphic, but may be used when a mnemonic calls for it.
column8: 4) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 8-9-2007(30): For those who need a mnemonic in order not to forget how to write this kanji, think of katakana イテ _ite_ (here the イeven gets a dot): _ite_ in Latin means _go_! +++ As for the primitive: I'll use _i_ as in _iTunes_ or _**i** tinerary_.
column9: 5) [[Hyreia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyreia)] 4-3-2009(12): I was having a hard time using 'columns' and 'going' for the left-side later on. What helped me was using it as "crossing the line". You know, as in "going too far". This might help, it did for me.

column3: This character depicts a calligrapher's _brush_ and its **rhythmic** sway as it flows down _a column_ writing kanji on the way.
column5: 1) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 30-11-2007(186): The calligrapher's _brush_ is moving down a _column_ of a script, in **rhythm** with his meditation.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 1-9-2007(47): The army COLUMN walked to the **RHYTHM** made by the drummer using a cool BRUSH like drum stick. Picturing the brush as a drum stick is not difficult if you've seen such a thing in jazz videos.
column7: 3) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 5-6-2009(38): Picture a school of studious calligraphers. All their _brushes_ are moving up and down the _columns_ at the same time, in beautiful **rhythm**.
column8: 4) [[CSBarnes](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CSBarnes)] 30-12-2008(22): _Brush_ Hero: The latest in **rhythm** games, you have to use your _brush_ in **rhythm** to the music as the _column_ of strokes move down the screen.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(20): [+woel] _Lance Armstrong_ is riding here while _brush_ ing his teeth. This is actually one of the secrets to his success - he sets his **rhythm** by _brush_ ing his teeth, and following that **rhythm** on the pedals. In-out-in-out-in- out, right-left-right-left-right-left. You can try it sometime if you really want to bring your **rhythm** to a good pace.

column5: 1) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(293): Before _going_ all the way to the Boss in a Final Fantasy game, you should probably _double back_ to save at a **restore** point.
column6: 2) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 11-6-2008(72): The _column_ of soldiers has to _double back_ to **restore** the peace in the village they just left.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 8-1-2008(33): You are writing a complex technical document on your computer when suddenly your computer crashes and your document is lost. You have to **restore** your computer from backups. Your backups are kept in a tall _column_ (spindle) of DVD's. After you finish restoring your computer, you _double-back_ on your train of thought, reconstructing your lost work.
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 11-4-2007(17): To **restore** order, time travelers _double back_ by _going_ back on the timeline.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(16): A **restore** d column displayed at the Louvres in Paris, makes you double back for another snapshot or another good look at it. Alternatively you may imagine that as part of the restoration of an ancient Greek temple, some columns have been “double backed”.

column5: 1) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 21-1-2008(211): To **gain** more knowledge of what's goin on in the world I'm reading _column_ after _column_ of articles in the newspapers, and it takes so much time I'm _glued_ to it till _nightbreak_.
column6: 2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 20-9-2008(106): Imagine fat people……they avoid _going_ outside to exercise and stay _glued_ to their TV set until _nightbreak_ ….so of course they **gain** weight.
column7: 3) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 17-3-2009(82): Just to **GAIN** a level in WOW, I will keep _GOING_ until _NIGHTBREAK_ _GLUED_ to my PC.
column8: 4) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 1-9-2007(46): A COLUMN of soldiers gets up at NIGHTBREAK to chase the enemy whose trail they have remained GLUED to, and thus **GAIN** on them.
column9: 5) [[elanlan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elanlan)] 26-11-2009(36): To **gain** more knowledge of japanese I'm reading _column_ after _column_ of RTK, and it takes so much time that I'm _glued_ to my SRS until _nightbreak_ (I love you Spidercat).

column5: 1) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 7-2-2007(294): The line of viking soldiers is always accompanied by a horn mending specialist.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 17-12-2007(163): I'm _going_ to **accompany** the _horny_ girl to her room so I can "mend" her.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 11-11-2007(91): As you're _going_ along someplace, you pause to _mend_ a wounded _animal's horns_ , and it decides to _go_ with you, to **accompany** you as a pet/sidekick, out of gratitude.
column8: 4) [[cerulean](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cerulean)] 29-1-2009(72): Japanese Folklore:———– _Mend_ the _Horns_ of an Oni, and he will **accompany** you on your travels, _Going_ anywhere you choose.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 12-11-2008(23): The symbol on the right works well as Horny Repairman (mender) so you can imagine a porn character like a cable repairman that shows up at the door, and a beautiful girl answers (having seen the Big Lebowski helps with this visual). But instead of coming in, he asks the girl to **accompany** him to his van and she obeys and goes with him. "obey" is the primary meaning of this kanji so it's good to work it into the visual.

column5: 1) [[Deborah](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Deborah)] 28-11-2007(160): The **junior** employee is always _RUNNING_ around _GOING_ here and there for his superiors.
column6: 2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 28-9-2006(58): Your **junior** or Jr. in the succession _line_ is the one who _run_ s after you.
column7: 3) [[pageturner1988](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pageturner1988)] 18-12-2007(36): I'm not sure where Heisig gets the **junior** keyword, but this kanji is more often used in the sense of either futile (e.g. 徒労 - fruitless efforts) or group(gang) member (e.g. 聖徒 - disciple, キリスト教徒 - Christian). I'll use gang member for this one. The **junior** **gang member** is going to represent at the running competition.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-8-2007(18): Little _The Flash_ **junior** likes to _run_ around in his red undies. But he's nowhere near as fast as his dad.
column9: 5) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 18-2-2006(16): Spartan soldiers raised their _junior_ boys strictly, one of the tests forcing them to _run_ around their impressive _columns_ untill the **junior** s fell to the ground, exhausted and dizzy to the state of nausea.

column5: 1) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(189): A _line_ queued up outside the _Buddhist temple_ , **waiting** to see the shrine on New Year's Day.
column6: 2) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 2-2-2006(63): The COLUMNS of this TEMPLE are a well-know meeting spot. You can always see someone **WAIT** ING there.
column7: 3) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 8-1-2009(43): According to my japanese teacher the etymology of this kanji is that in ancient japan, when people were going on trips they would **wait** at temples for other people, or to get rest.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-8-2007(20): _The Flash_ hates _Buddhist temples_ because they always make him sit still and **wait** for prayers to finish. (Image: _The Flash_ sitting in seiza with his legs twitchingly impatiently **wait** ing for prayers to end).
column9: 5) [[gopineapples](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gopineapples)] 15-6-2009(13): Im GOING to **wait** at the TEMPLE until buddha returns.

column3: _Column_ . . . _candlestick_. This character has the special sense of **journeying** to someplace or other.
column5: 1) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(186): In Medieval Japan, _going_ to see your _lord_ was often a long **journey**.
column6: 2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 10-1-2006(69): The fellowship of the ring is on a long **journey** through the depths of Khaz Modan. Imagine they walk through the hall of pillars, with only light being from their own candlesticks that. Soon they will meet much more light than they would ever want to…
column7: 3) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(60): Parties should stay in a single-file _line_ and carry a _candlestick_ while **journeying** through an unknown dungeon in an RPG.
column8: 4) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 21-1-2008(43): Famous **journey** , the three kings, sheperds, and all, _going_ to see their new _lord_.
column9: 5) [[akahige](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akahige)] 6-2-2009(22): The Olympic _torch(candlestick)_ is on a **journey** around the world carried by _The Flash_. While he's running, he's got **Journey** playing on his iPod: "Don't stop/Believin'!".

column5: 1) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 4-7-2008(446): America seeks to _GO_ and _CORRECT_ other nations. But really what they do is **subjugate** them…
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(108): To **subjugate** is to have somebody stand still and stiff as a column and behave one hundred percent correctly.
column7: 3) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 5-3-2007(43): **Subjugate** d Samson. Here's the Bible story of Samson after Delilah deceived him into telling her the secret of his strength, his long hair, now shaved and **subjugate** d into submission by the Philistines, chained to the temple _columns_ where he choose to do the _correct_ thing, called upon the God of the Israelites to give him one last burst of power and brought down the entire temple of the Philistines and slew more enemies of Israel in his death than in his life.
column8: 4) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 30-5-2007(18): Roman legion (column), carrying a standard with SPQR emblazoned on it, **subjugate** s the babarians and corrects their ways.
column9: 5) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(12): The _line_ of phalanxes entered the small town to show them the " _correct_ " way to act and **subjugate** them to the will of the Emperor.

column5: 1) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(162): Scientists recently measured the **diameter** of Earth by drilling a deep hole and dropping a _line_ of thread off a humongous _spool_ until it got to the other side.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(109): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reasons: (1) _Toilet paper/roll_ usually comes on a _spool_. (2) _Toilet paper_ is used to clean the _soil_ off your _crotch_. Story: Measure the **diameter** of a _column_ (maybe Nelson's Column in London?) using a roll of _toilet paper_. Spool also appears in [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎), [suspicious](../v4/716.html) (#716 怪), [lightly](../v4/717.html) (#717 軽), [sutra](../v4/1360.html) (#1360 経).
column7: 3) [[randomkrazy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/randomkrazy)] 31-1-2009(38): I'm _going_ to measure the **diameter** of your _crotch_ , sorry I know it sounds _dirty_ but its for the good of science!
column8: 4) [[jamestaverner](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamestaverner)] 22-12-2007(29): _Lance Armstrong_ wins because his bike has wheels with a bigger **diameter**. This raises his _crotch_ higher off the _ground_ , giving him more pedalling power. (After winning the Tour de France so many times, the French public liked him almost as much as Princess Di (they use her as the yardstick to measure how much they like celebrities. You could even say that he went up a few notches on the Princess **Di-a-Meter** … (sorry))).
column9: 5) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 10-6-2008(16): The _column_ of soldiers to the left has been assigned to measure the **diameter** of a bomb crater. They carry a huge _spool_ of measuring tape with them as they march to the other side.

column3: _Going_ . . . _pelt_. This kanji refers to the third person singular personal pronoun, generally in its masculine form.
column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 28-5-2007(309): What's the main difference between a **he** and a she? The **he** has a _column_ covered in a _pelt_ … a penis. Badum-ching.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 8-1-2008(58): The ultimate **he** -man is the Neanderthal cave man. His club is as big as a pillar ( _column_ ), and **he** wears a ragged _pelt_ as his only clothing. To remember the _column_ , imagine the cave man resting the club vertically like a column when not in use.
column7: 3) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 11-8-2009(42): Wherever **he** _goes_ // **he** wears _pelt_ clothes.
column8: 4) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 12-6-2008(21): **He** tough man. **He** wear _pelt_. **He** go fight _column_ of other **he** -s.
column9: 5) [[Asgard](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asgard)] 3-9-2006(21): **He-** man fights with _The Flash_ over a fine _pelt_. Both want to make a new cape for their costume out of it.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 26-9-2006(258): Japanese kamikaze pilots (and the American from Dr. Strangelove) are so devoted to their **duty** that they _go_ with their _missiles_.
column6: 2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 29-6-2008(83): It is every American citizen's **duty** to _GO_ and fire _MISSILES_ at defenceless countries.
column7: 3) [[rodders](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rodders)] 19-10-2009(41): Imagine those poor saps in charge of nuclear silos, responsible for ICBMS, those towering _column_ _missiles_. When the order comes they must decide whether to obey their concience or do their **duty** and damn the world to atomic annihilation.
column8: 4) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 7-8-2008(32): GOING and CUMMING is a man's **DUTY**.
column9: 5) [[kigabit](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kigabit)] 20-6-2009(16): It is a soldier's **duty** to maintain a perfectly formed battle _column_ , even when _missiles_ are exploding all around them.

column3: _Going_ . . . _needle_ . . . _eye_ . . . _heart_. Refer back now to the note in frame 890.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 29-5-2007(136): Hearkening back to the kanji for LISTEN… **Benevolence** is a good _listener_ who is willing to _go_ the distance to help.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 29-4-2007(109): In a rare act of **benevolence** , the Sparten _column_ removes the needle from the _cyclops's_ eye, and he repays them by eating their _hearts_.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 16-9-2008(93): **Benevolence** : _going_ to help those who are unable to _listen_ (i.e. have no ears).
column8: 4) [[marydj](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/marydj)] 21-10-2007(40): Darth Vader was put in charge of the **benevolence** fund. He stands holding a bucket with a big heart on it as the column of soilders passes by. Everyone contributes.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(27): A _heart_ which was full of **benevolence** , but so small that it could pass through the _eye of a needle_ , was displayed atop a huge Corinthian _column_ (maybe the relic of some Saint). The _column_ which acted as a stand, reminded viewers not to be fooled by the _heart_ 's _needle-eye_ size.

column5: 1) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 9-1-2008(190): The _taskmistress_ in a moment of weakness allowed the man's _column_ to **penetrate** her. As punishment he was made to _bring up_ their infant.
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 7-11-2005(122): Ha! In this frame, a bunch of taskmasters are lined up to **penetrate** the kids they raise/bring up! I'm thinking of some priests and choir boys.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 10-1-2008(65): Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to **penetrate** enemy _line_ s (or the _columns_ of soliders). It won't be easy: the soldiers have been _brought up_ since birth, by the _taskmaster_ , to be on guard. To remember _brought up_ , imagine horrible Orcs being created and _brought up_ through black magic and pledging their allegiance to the evil _taskmaster_. These aren't Orc recruits, these are Orcs that have been created through black magic and _brought up_ to destroy the enemy.
column8: 4) [[tomtosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomtosh)] 3-9-2007(55): **Penetrate** = " **goes** into." As in the lessons of the taskmaster penetrating the minds of those he his bringing up.
column9: 5) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 24-6-2008(26): Compare the two kanji for 'penetrate' and 'remove': here, the child who wasn't _raised / brought up_ with very good manners is _going_ to give his taskmaster a big _kancho_. After he is **penetrate** d, his angry parents tell him to [remove](../v4/760.html) (#760 撤) his finger. (Don't know what a kancho is? <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kancho>).

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 23-9-2007(227): If you see a _column_ of _kings_ being marched up the _mountain_ under a _taskmaster_ 's whip… **indications** are, there has been a coup.
column6: 2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 14-11-2009(50): The combination of _column_ \+ _mountain_ \+ _taskmaster_ appear in quite a few kanji ( 徴 , 微 ,薇,黴), so let's give it the meaning of ' _trek_ '. Story: If you see kings trekking like peasants, **indications** are they've been outcast.
column7: 3) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 15-6-2009(46): This kanji actually means **symbol**. GO to the MOUNTAIN of the KINGS and find a TASKMISTRESS with the **symbol** (of the devil on her forehead)!!
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-11-2007(19): If your going through the hall of the mountain king, and you hear the music speeding up, **indications** are that the taskmaster is coming to get you… Thanks nest0r.
column9: 5) [[amthomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amthomas)] 15-3-2007(16): All **indications** are that _The Flash_ and the _taskmaster_ have cornered the _king_ under a _mountain_!

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 1-5-2006(280): **Penal** servitude is served until indications show that one has had a change of heart (learned one's lesson). Easily confused with [punish](../v4/679.html) (#679 刑) and [penalty](../v4/833.html) (#833 罰). Concentrate on the reasons behind the **penal** system ("changing people's hearts" here), instead of the **penal** ty itself or the punishment (revenge) aspect. It may help to note that there's no sword, but a heart :-) (Note: 懲りる = learn from one's bad experiences).
column6: 2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(170): Judge: You will serve a **penal** sentence until _indications_ show you have a _heart_.
column7: 3) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 13-6-2008(28): **Penal** servitude is served until _indications_ show that one has had a change of _heart_. In other words, when your _i_ **Indications** changes from "I"M A BADASS _MOUNTAIN KING TASKMASTER_ " to "I _heart_ the world".
column8: 4) [[cingold](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cingold)] 21-9-2009(20): The _indications_ of a good _heart_ are what is required to get you out of the **penal** system.
column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 10-2-2009(7): **Penal** servitude is served until _indications_ show that one has had a change of _heart_. Remember in _The Shawshank Redemption_ , Morgan Freeman wasn't released on parole until he had such a change of heart.

column3: Line . . . mountain . . . ceiling . . . human legs . . . taskmaster.
column5: 1) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 14-7-2007(111): The Column of 300 spartans were in a **delicate** situation. They had travelled in one line (using only their legs) to the mountain pass to face the fierce Persian task master.
column6: 2) [[cingold](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cingold)] 18-9-2009(74): We're _going_ up the _mountain_ announces the _taskmaster_. Anyone with _legs_ too **delicate** must stay behind.
column7: 3) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 4-10-2007(63): [The sense of **delicate** implied by this Kanj – easily broken, weak, brittle, insignificant] A _column_ of _taskmasters_ is trying to _leg_ -press _one_ _mountain_ between them. They are old and frail, and their legs skinny and **delicate**. A _single_ pair of _legs_ wouldn't be able to achive anything in this case. However, together they manage to push the _mountain_ up towards the sky.
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 16-11-2008(38): Here we have a taskmaster who orders a **mountain** to **go** away. The mountain is so frightened that it sprouts two little **delicate** **legs** and gingerly walks away. Be sure to imagine the legs as really tiny and the mountain as really big so the **delicate** -ness is there.
column9: 5) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 13-10-2007(19): The fellowship of the ring had to move as a _column_ **delicate** ly through the mines of moria. The _mountain_ was above them with _legs_ hanging from the _ceiling_ , no doubt left there by the _taskmaster_ they didn't want to awaken.

column3: This is the character from which the sense of **boulevard** mentioned in frame 938 derives. Its elements: _boulevard_ . . . _ivy_.
column5: 1) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 11-1-2007(104): The **boulevard** of **boulevard** s, the _Champs Elysées_ , with the Arc de Triomphe covered in _ivy_ to give the champions a heroes' welcome.
column6: 2) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 6-6-2008(61): Specifically… _ivy_ **boulevard** … think hollywood & vine.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 9-2-2006(48): Mnemonic trick : the "Harvard **Boulevard** " is covered withf _ivy_ (just like Harvard University).
column8: 4) [[axelb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/axelb)] 9-3-2009(43): A **boulevard** is _one street_ where they use _columns_ of _ivy_ for decorations.
column9: 5) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 18-12-2008(22): This is a pictograph of an ancient **boulevard** , so long disused that it is now covered in _ivy_ all down the middle.

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 29-12-2008(62): When the _wooden_ **girders** start to snap, the workmen shout "Run! Let's _go!_ ".
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 12-3-2007(16): **Girder** s are support beams that are nowadays mostly made out of steel. But in the ancient houses that are placed at the _boulevard_ the **girder** s will be made out of _wood_.
column7: 3) [[aniseed](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aniseed)] 7-3-2010(12): 「けた」。This kanji is used to denote a number of digits or decimal places, e.g. 三桁のパスワード (a 3-digit password).
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-4-2009(10): People use **girder** s these days – _wood's going_ out.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 5-12-2009(6): [+astridtops] **Girder** s are support beams now most often made of steel. But the **girders** of the ancient houses of this _boulevard_ are strong _columns_ of _wood_.

column3: Boulevard . . . bound up . . . brains . . . St. Bernard dog.
column5: 1) [[Tweenk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tweenk)] 10-3-2007(180): To maintain the social **equilibrium** in a future dystopian society, the _brains_ of citizens are _bound up_ (hypnotized). The government is using mental wave emitting statues shaped like _St. Bernard's dogs_ put alongside the _boulevards_.
column6: 2) [[matt_jenkins](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matt_jenkins)] 26-3-2008(165): I think BALANCE is an easier keyword. I was walking down a busy French _boulevard_ when between the rushing traffic I saw the wierdest thing. BALANCING on the central crash barrier was a _St. Bernard dog_ , BALANCING a _fish_ on its nose. As I looked closer, I realised it was a trick, it was holding the fish's tail in its teeth, and only pretending to BALANCE it. (keeps the position of the elements!).
column7: 3) [[boyprangko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/boyprangko)] 20-10-2007(38): [ _boulevard_ … _bound up_ … _rice field_ … _large_ …] imagine a _fish_ walking a _boulevard_ trying to maintain **equilibrium** having had its fins cut off and replaced by a _st. bernard_.
column8: 4) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 7-9-2007(23): The poor _St. Bernard_ walking down the middle of the _boulevard_ cannot see to mantain his **equilibrium**. It seems his _brain_ is all _bound up_ with alcohol.
column9: 5) [[kazelee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kazelee)] 25-7-2008(21): If you've ever seen the movie **Equilibrium** , you know this kanji has it all. Bound minds, dogs, and building shaped like long columns enveloped by endless boulevards of soldiered surveillance. Add some imaginary gun katas and you've got a lawsuit on your hands. If you've never seen this movie, do, or…. CrazyWashu uses the field of **equilibrium** generated between Azaka and Kamidake to create a hybrid fish dog.

column3: The key word connotes the preliminary composition of a plan or manuscript. Its elements: _wheat_ . . . _tall_.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-3-2007(235): Aliens often **draft** their plans for invasion by cutting designs among the _tall_ _wheat_.
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 2-10-2007(220): The first **DRAFT** of catcher in the rye was actually called "catcher in the TALL WHEAT"…good thing they changed it. I read it in 高校 .
column7: 3) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 5-4-2008(85): **Draft** _wheat_ beer (Hefeweizen) is served in the typical _tall_ German glass.
column8: 4) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 9-9-2007(43): They tried to **draft** a plan to make the _wheat_ grow _tall_.
column9: 5) [[melchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/melchan)] 11-6-2009(20): The writer hid himself in the middle of _tall wheat_ so he would not be disturbed while writing the **draft**.

column5: 1) [[Kieron](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kieron)] 3-7-2007(295): Your **earnings** allow you to bring _home_ your daily bread (made of _wheat_ , naturally).
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 25-4-2008(85): Hmm, **EARNINGS**. Think of the popular saying "Bringing HOME the bacon". Here, **EARNINGS** is the picture "Bringing HOME the bread(WHEAT) and the bacon (PIG).
column7: 3) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 10-4-2007(37): A farmer's **earnings** can be viewed as the amount of wheat he has in his grain silo (house).
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-3-2007(30): **Earnings**? Where I'm from, it's called bringing _home_ the _dough_ …
column9: 5) [[jinkouchinou](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jinkouchinou)] 3-8-2009(14): The breadwinner ( _wheat_ bread winner) brings _home_ the **earnings**.

column5: 1) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 26-11-2008(257): The **extent** to which some people will go to create ' _wheat displays_ ', or as some call them 'crop circles', is truly amazing.
column6: 2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(92): The _wheat_ crop has come in, and the mouth of the king is gobbling it all up. Everyone is waiting to see… to what **extent** will the king manage to eat it this year?
column7: 3) [[rodders](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rodders)] 20-6-2007(37): The **extent** of the _wheat display_ (an ostentatious olympic opening-style event held at harvest time) will show you how profitable a year the kingdoms farmers had. "Ooo, pretty, wheat fireworks! Must have been a good year!".
column8: 4) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 18-6-2008(27): The **extent** to which the _king_ can open his _mouth_ to fit in _wheat_ is really astounding.
column9: 5) [[kiisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kiisu)] 2-3-2008(23): The ostentatious wheat display shows the **extent** of the king's wealth.

column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(234): Nobody likes the **tax** man, so here it is only fitting that the person who comes over to take some of your _wheat_ is depicted here as a devil. Keep in mind that in feudal societies there was no kind of money to speak of, so **tax** es were paid by serfs in _wheat_ to the _devils_ who came over to keep them poor.
column6: 2) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 11-1-2008(98): This is an easy one. **Tax** es is like the devil taking away your hard earned wheat.
column7: 3) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 22-7-2007(21): I don't know if it makes sense, but it works for me: If the Warrior cannot levy the shells [frame 378], then the Devil will come and colllect your Wheat as **Tax**.
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 20-4-2008(11): "No, mister **tax** man, please no! Anything but this! Please don't take our _bread_ away! how shall I feed my _horny teenager_ now?".
column9: 5) [[Pangolin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pangolin)] 21-12-2008(9): When the church takes 10% of your _wheat_ harvest, it's a tithe. When the _devil_ takes it, it's a **tax**.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-8-2007(233): **Immature** _turkeys_ are stuffed with _wheat_ to make it look bigger.
column6: 2) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 20-4-2008(107): I can't believe I brought you to the fanciest restaurant in town and you asked for _turkey_ on _wheat_ …how **immature** is that?!
column7: 3) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 3-9-2008(28): It's **immature** to whip **turkeys** with **wheat**.
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 20-11-2006(28): The only _wheat_ that a _turkey_ is able to reach for eating is **immature** and shouldn't be touched. Wheat that is ready for harvest is as tall as a human. Shoo the turkeys away from the fields! Gobble gobble! (I guess there's no crows in Japan?).
column9: 5) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 30-8-2008(23): Wheat + Turkey: This is NOT Fresh (Fish + Sheep). Wheat and turkeys have to mature before they are harvested - both are not very good when they are **immature**.

column5: 1) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 18-10-2007(342): The first step to **harmony** is having enough _wheat_ to feed every _mouth_ in the world. Once we are all fed it is easier to get a long in **harmony**.
column6: 2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 29-1-2006(40): People who live in **harmony** with nature live in the country. they are yokels or hillbillys. See Billy-bob sitting on the porch in their denhim dungarees a sheaf of _wheat_ , sticking from their _mouth_.
column7: 3) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 5-6-2006(32): What better image of **harmony** and peace than relaxing amidst the wheat, with one long stalk in your mouth.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 20-1-2008(10): A cereal commercial. Look at the family so happy in **harmony**. You know its true. Early in the morning you feel like smiling at each other, and being very happy while you eat that cereal…. not… I wake up, shuve it in my mouth and off i am.
column9: 5) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 8-6-2008(8): Tasty _wheat_ brings true **harmony** to the _mouth_.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(229): Picture the WHEAT field, filled with MANY, MANY stalks of WHEAT. Notice how they **SHIFT** like waves in the slightest breeze. When you hear **SHIFT** , just picture that scene.
column6: 2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 10-9-2007(144): _Many_ people are making the **shift** from white to whole _wheat_ bread.
column7: 3) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 24-12-2007(40): To hide the _wheat_ from the devilish [tax](../v4/895.html) (#895 税) collector, the villagers **shift** the wheat between them _many_ , _many_ times. "We don't have much, sir, but we'll do anything for the crown".
column8: 4) [[harhol](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harhol)] 12-5-2009(18): I have to work _two_ EVENING **shifts** a week just to be able to put WHEAT on the table. Damn recession.
column9: 5) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 20-4-2008(17): As Japan became westernized, eating habits changed. Lots of people **shift** ed from rice to _bread_ … _many, many_ loaves of *bread.

column3: The reference here is to a **second** of time. The elements: _wheat_ . . . _few_.
column5: 1) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 24-10-2007(327): An hourglass filled with _wheat_ counts time. A _few_ _wheat seeds_ drop every **second**.
column6: 2) [[nmkohi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nmkohi)] 12-4-2006(121): I'll be with you soon… please wheat a few **second** s.
column7: 3) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 14-4-2007(39): I first came across this kanji on my microwave, so, if you want to microwave _wheat_ , it's important to remember only to set it for a _few_ **second** s. If it helps you can picture those wheat/bran bag things that you heat in the microwave and apply to muscle aches.
column8: 4) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 2-12-2008(26): _Wheat_ can be cooked in _a few_ **seconds**.
column9: 5) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 30-3-2010(14): [thanks, vosmiura] An hourglass filled with _wheat_ counts time. A _few_ _wheat grains_ drop every **second**. Why wheat, not rice? Because wheat grains are yellow, just like the sand in a regular hourglass.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 27-8-2007(268): In **AUTUMN** , the WHEAT looks the color of FIRE, meaning it's time to harvest it.
column6: 2) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 2-6-2008(96): Every **autumn** the wheat is set on fire to clear the way for next year's crop…
column7: 3) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 18-1-2007(55): After the _wheat_ harvest, the farmers have a _bonfire_ to celebrate the **autumn** season.
column8: 4) [[stshores24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stshores24)] 14-7-2008(20): Every **autumn** they gather in the _wheat_ and then set it all a _fire_. I don't think they know what they're doing.
column9: 5) [[shinyclef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shinyclef)] 11-5-2009(9): Have a look at this guy's photo if you need a mental image. Compare it to the pic before it to see how drastically the colour changes. <http://www.panoramio.com/photo/572483> Story: _Wheat_ fields are the colour of _fire_ in **Autumn**.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 5-9-2007(205): In AUTUMN, the farmer's HEART is in **DISTRESS** as to if he has enough crops. Even better, the farmer will experience great **DISTRESS** in his HEART if his WHEAT catches FIRE!
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-4-2006(112): Here we have **distress** ed (think "gloomy") people with "seasonal mood disorder" during the autumn season. Hence "autumn heart" is **distress** ed (gloomy).
column7: 3) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 18-12-2007(55): The HEART becomes **distress** ed in the AUTUMN when summer loves end.
column8: 4) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 16-5-2008(29): The damsel in **distress** was tied to a big stalk of _wheat_ in the middle of a field.. The evil, dastardly villain then set the field on _fire_! Can our hero get to her in time, saving her life and winning her _heart_?? Tune in next week!
column9: 5) [[Jaunty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Jaunty)] 12-6-2009(20): I have to imagine a "damsel in **distress** " to avoid confusing this with similar keywords. Think of Rapunzel sitting in her tower staring out at the _autumn_ scenery, her _heart_ aching.

column3: _Wheat_ . . . _elbow_. Like the characters for I (Frame 17) and _ego_ (Frame 690), this kanji is also representative of the subject, with the special connotation of **privacy**.
column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 1-5-2006(294): Warning sign: "Private wheat, trespassers will be elbowed".
column6: 2) [[hilber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hilber)] 12-12-2009(114): A joke so bad as "wheatashi wa" deserves an elbow in the **private** parts.
column7: 3) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 7-5-2008(82): I already know this as watashi, or "I". In order to associate the keyword of **private** , I'll think of this one as "Private I", like a detective.
column8: 4) [[baldy514](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/baldy514)] 2-2-2009(48): Wheatashi wa.
column9: 5) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 1-12-2005(43): I was glad that nobody was around when I stuck my _elbow_ in my _cereal_ bowl and spilled the whole damned mess all over myself. Something that stupid should remain **private** – between "me, myself, and I".

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 27-8-2007(223): Think of **REGULARITY** in terms of bowel movements. Enough WHEAT in your diet will help your DROPS with improved **REGULARITY**.
column6: 2) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 7-5-2008(125): Eating plenty of _wheat_ will improve **regularity** and help you _lose_ weight.
column7: 3) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 13-12-2008(67): I got it. **Regularity** , order, system, systematic. Now, Imagine the husband (the 'head' of the household, the farmer and what not). Walking across his farm, then in a regular, ordered, and systemised fashion he DROPS (the drop) a little piece of wheat. I love this image not only because it answers the keyword, but it is really close to the meaning of the actual kanji.
column8: 4) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 29-4-2007(31): Increase your **regularity** by eating _wheat_ -bran _cereal_ to improve the **regularity** of your _drops_ in the bathroom.
column9: 5) [[eieneverafter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eieneverafter)] 6-4-2008(23): Farmers deal with _losing_ some of their _wheat_ as a **regularity**.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 29-5-2007(158): The prize at the bottom of a _cereal_ box is _invariably_ a **secret** decoder ring.
column6: 2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 25-2-2008(120): A young couple meets in **secret** in the _wheat_ field because their families are enemies. They _cross their hearts_ and swear eternal - even if **secret** \- love. Do not confuse with [secrecy](../v4/775.html) (#775 密).
column7: 3) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 18-11-2006(77): The farmers _invariably_ keep the actual amount of _wheat_ produced a **secret** from the tax assessor.
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 20-4-2008(28): My diet **secret** : _bread invariably_ makes you fat.
column9: 5) [[penot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penot)] 30-10-2008(25): NOTE: [secrecy](../v4/775.html) (#775 密) and **secret** both have the same _invariable_ /[ _cross my heart_ ]. // But " **secreC** _ **Y**_ " **C** ontains _**Y** ama_. // and **secre** _ **T**_ has _whea_ _ **T**_ hidden in it. // **ヒ mi4 비 (bi)**.

column5: 1) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 16-5-2006(224): Taking **appellation** to mean the act of naming, we have the _little_ baby superman _reclining_ in the space craft that landed in a _wheat_ field. Mr. and Mrs. Kent look down and decide to call him Clark. (I also thought of Jesus but he was born in a barn full of hay not wheat).
column6: 2) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 17-1-2007(119): _WHEAT_ that is _RECLINING_ and _LITTLE_ ( _small_ ) can't get the _APPELLATION_ "quality wheat".
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 3-11-2007(87): An Indian chief explains the art of **appellation** by introducing his three children: Swaying _Wheat_ , _Reclining_ Buffalo and _Little_ Bear.
column8: 4) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 18-7-2006(47): The way this _wheat_ _reclines_ a _little_ justifies its **appellation** : "lazy wheat".
column9: 5) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 5-1-2009(24): If you're having trouble thinking of a name for your little one, go lie down in a field of wheat for a while and gaze at the stars.

column3: _Wheat_ . . . _saber_. Be careful not to confuse with _gain_ (Frame 941) or _earnings_ (Frame 959).
column5: 1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 30-12-2007(241): 1. Steal a bunch of wheat from a wheat field by cutting it down with your saber. 2. ????? 3. **Profit**!
column6: 2) [[ivoSF](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivoSF)] 4-8-2006(201): In the middle ages there where only 2 ways for peasantry to make a **profit**. one by being a farmer, 2 to be a mercenary and live by the way of the sword.
column7: 3) [[mairov](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mairov)] 10-10-2007(49): Use the saber to cut the wheat and get your **profit**.
column8: 4) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 24-12-2007(22): Your [earnings](../v4/893.html) (#893 稼) are divided between the tax man's share and your **profit** using a saber, which by the way is a cavalry sword, wielded by the [tax](../v4/895.html) (#895 税) man on his pale horse (not pictured).
column9: 5) [[HydroKirby](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HydroKirby)] 24-7-2011(19): The Legend of Zelda players know that you will **profit** from going into fields of _wheat_ and cutting them down with your _saber_.

column5: 1) [[rptb1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rptb1)] 11-11-2005(299): The Japanese **pear tree** is the most profitable in the world, because it produces its fruit in pairs [sorry for the awful pun].
column6: 2) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 21-6-2006(83): And a _profit_ in a pear _tree_ …12 days of christmas.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 30-6-2008(46): The _profit_ on Japanese **pear tree** s is next to なし! (get it?).
column8: 4) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 1-2-2007(42): During the 12 days of Christmas, the person who made the most _profit_ was the _tree_ salesman, since he sold 12 partriges in a **pear tree**.
column9: 5) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 8-8-2009(41): Japanese pears (<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyrus_pyrifolia>) are very tasty fruits and frequently used as a gift in Japan. They are quite expensive, so you can assume that a farmer can make a good _profit_ from these fruits after getting them from the _tree_.

column3: _Wheat_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _vessels_. Compare frames 756 and 757 for the right side.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(197): The **harvest** of genetically modified crops is taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (see the _flower vessel_ in [safeguard](../v4/700.html) (#700 護)).
column6: 2) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 31-5-2007(109): Wheat is **harvest** ed, the grain (flower) is put into vessels for shipping.
column7: 3) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 7-11-2005(35): The **harvest** of wheat was bountiful for the Pilgrims abord the Mayflower, which is supposedly the reason for the first Thanksgiving.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-3-2007(29): Aha! It's the _wheat_ **harvest** that's being [safeguard](../v4/700.html) (#700 護) on the ship! That's why the pack of wild dogs [seize](../v4/701.html) (#701 獲) the ship!
column9: 5) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 4-3-2009(15): The _flower vessel_ that the hippies tried to [safeguard](../v4/700.html) (#700 護) with their words of peace but the pirates managed to [seize](../v4/701.html) (#701 獲) with the help of their pack of wild dogs, actually contained the whole _wheat_ **harvest** for the year. (Thanks, dingomick.) 収穫 (しゅうかく): **harvest** 収穫期 (しゅうかくき): **harvest** time, picking season.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-2-2007(288): The pilgrims only had _wheat_ , so they asked the Indians to do them a _favor_ and trade them for some **ears** of corn.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-10-2005(107): The "ear of a plant" is the seed-bearing spike of a cereal plant, such as corn. In other words, it is the part which feeds us. Hence – "the **ear** (of a plant) is the _favor_ of the _wheat_ ".
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-11-2007(40): Botanist (lecturing to class): ". . . and this is the **ear of the plant**." _Wheat_ plant: "Will you do me a _favor_ and stop shouting in my **ear**!".
column8: 4) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 20-10-2009(17): The **ear** of corn fell into the dirt. It shouted to the nearby _wheat_ \- "Hey! HEY! Could you do me a _favor_?!" No answer… stupid stuck up wheat.
column9: 5) [[unicornpuddlefoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/unicornpuddlefoot)] 6-12-2008(10): Wheat, favour. The **ear** of the plant is nature's favour.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 15-6-2007(519): The **rice plant** is common in Japan because all the _wheat_ was eaten by _vultures_ in the _olden times_.
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-3-2007(44): It used to be that _wheat_ was grown in Japan. However, this was often stolen by _vultures_ , so in _olden times_ , the gods gave the Japanese the **rice plant**.
column7: 3) [[altape](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/altape)] 2-1-2008(20): The **rice plant** evolved from wheat in olden times to defend itself against vultures eating it - rice causes vultures to explode.
column8: 4) [[Rooboy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rooboy)] 1-4-2009(10): Wheat has been trying to claw its way in to japan since olden times but the **rice plant** still domiantes the landscape.
column9: 5) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 9-12-2008(8): What we are calling wheat really refers to a **rice plant** , known to Wolverine from olden times (Wolverine is a lot older than he looks – he was born in the 1880s). Imagine Wolverine in ancient times (mukashi mukashi) planting rice by poking a little hole with his claws and then settling the plant into the mud.

column5: 1) [[rptb1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rptb1)] 11-11-2005(220): If you focus the suns though a magnifying glass on to the bottom of a stalk of wheat it will start to smoulder and burn like a stick of **incense**. The weird thing is that it burns from the bottom upwards, hanging in the air as if my magic. Try it and see!
column6: 2) [[Alucard](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Alucard)] 8-12-2006(112): When the _sun_ burns the _wheat_ a smell of **incense** remains in the air.
column7: 3) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 20-1-2008(52): If we would throw a huge amount of wheat on top of the sun, would it become a galactic **incense**? Maybe then aliens wouls come more often, enjoying the **incense**.
column8: 4) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 1-12-2007(15): When the _Sun_ goes down, the pagans light their _wheat_ , producing a natural **incense** , to honour the _Sun_ God.
column9: 5) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 29-6-2008(8): **Incense** is commonly used in worship and at shrines in Japan. On _sun_ ( 日 ) _days_ ( 日 ), many people used to go to their shrine of choice, probably that of the SUN goddess Amaterasu, and place a small gift of **incense** and _wheat_ at the foot of the shrine, wishing for a profitable harvest.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 28-11-2006(287): There's a season for planting wheat and there's mating season for having children.
column6: 2) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 11-12-2011(102): As the **seasons** pass, the _wheat_ and the _children_ grow, but the wheat grows faster, right over the children.

column3: This kanji has a pictographic resemblance to a number of grains of **rice** lying on a plate in the shape of a star.
column4: * As a primitive, it keeps its meaning of _rice_ , and is meant to connote a very ordinary, commonplace grain, in contrast to the primitive for _wheat_ that we just learned. (This meaning accords well with Japan, where the output of _rice_ far exceeds that of _wheat_.) It occasionally takes a different shape when it stands on its own, or is joined to a line above. In this case, we shall have it refer specifically to _grains of rice_. This primitive is not to be confused with the similar-looking primitive for _water_. While the stroke orders are nearly alike, _grains of rice_ has 5 strokes, while _water_ only has 4 because it joins the second and third strokes into one. Finally, we may note that by itself the kanji for _rice_ is an abbreviation used for the _United States_ , which can then also serve as an alternate reading for the main primitive form, if you so wish.
