Japan also has a National **Chrysanthemum** Day, which is called the Festival of Happiness.” Mnemonic: _flower_ that looks like a lot of _grains_ _bound_ together.
column8: 4) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 21-4-2008(20): **Chrysanthemum** is a _flower_ that is as intimately _bound up_ with Japan as gohan.
column9: 5) [[Hyreia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyreia)] 11-3-2009(16): I'm not a florist, I had to see what a **chrysanthemum** looked like: <http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/7/73/IMG_2967.JPG> And I'm happy with what I see. The pistils(?) in the middle and the budding flower on the left both look like grains of _rice_ somewhat, but _bound_ together and on a _flower_.

column3: _A drop_ . . . _pent in_ . . . _rice_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_. Notice that the horizontal line of the bottom primitive doubles up as the final stroke for _pent in_.
column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 27-3-2006(279): In the **core** of a nuclear reactor, scientists have discovered a way to get power from rice, by penting it in under high pressure. It's very dangerous, so they've trained a st. bernard dog to run things, he's adding more drops of rice as necessary.
column6: 2) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 17-2-2008(126): 奥さん （おくさん) is a common way to say "wife". In the innermost **core** of the house, the bored _pent up_ housewife _drops_ her chores and consumes so much _rice_ she becomes a very _large_ housewife.
column7: 3) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 8-10-2009(62): The **Core** CPU is just a small _drop_ of silicone the size of a _grain of rice_ that has more power _pent in_ it than the very _big_ machines of the past.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(40): In the innermost **core** of the house the wife keeps the rice, well penned in and guarded by a st bernards dog.
column9: 5) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 9-5-2007(21): In the interior **core** of a single _drop_ of _rice_ , a _large_ _rice_ plant is _pent in_.

column5: 1) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 4-4-2007(264): Young _taskmaster_ is learning **numbers** by watching _women_ haul sacks of _rice_ past him. "One… two… four! No, wrong! Go back, go back!".
column6: 2) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 20-8-2006(79): _Women_ toil in the _rice_ fields carrying heavy sacks of _rice_ to be **number** ed and counted by the _taskmaster_.
column7: 3) [[ivoSF](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivoSF)] 25-8-2006(63): Maybe a bit rude but a vivid image: a woman slave is forced to count rice-grains and get whiped by the taskmaster who shouts "count you bi***".
column8: 4) [[mikemorr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikemorr)] 12-4-2009(47): _Rice_ above _woman_ is the character 娄, which can refer to a constellation. (Mnemonic: The stars of the **constellation** are like grains of _rice_ , forming the shape of a _woman_ in the sky.) We'll also see 娄 in [watchtower](../v4/930.html) (#930 楼) and [frequently](../v4/2221.html) (#2221 屡). **Number** : The _taskmaster_ makes you count the **number** of stars in the _constellation_.
column9: 5) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 22-4-2008(23): _Rice-ladies_ are nothing but **number** s to the _taskmaster_.

column5: 1) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 4-4-2007(203): The young taskmaster (see [number](../v4/929.html) (#929 数)) uses a _tree_ as a **watchtower** to get a better view of his _rice_ -carrying _women_. "I can seeeee you! One! Two! Three!".
column6: 2) [[Filippo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filippo)] 15-7-2008(137): On the top of the _wood_ made **watchtower** we look for our enemies, who will come to steal our _rice_ and our _women_.
column7: 3) [[mikemorr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikemorr)] 12-4-2009(28): _Rice_ above _woman_ is the character 娄, which can refer to a constellation. (Mnemonic: The stars of the **constellation** are like grains of _rice_ , forming the shape of a _woman_ in the sky.) 娄 also appears in [number](../v4/929.html) (#929 数) and [frequently](../v4/2221.html) (#2221 屡). **Watchtower** : A wooden **watchtower** lets you get a better view of the _constellation_.
column8: 4) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 9-4-2007(21): The Jehovah's Witnesses kill plenty of _trees_ in order to try to convert _American women_ (like Madonna) with their publication, The **Watchtower**.
column9: 5) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 18-6-2008(16): A wooden **watchtower** is constructed so that the rice-carrying women can be monitored.

column5: 1) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 5-1-2008(277): Note this character means **sort** in the sense of what kind, I believe a better keyword would be "variety" and this character does appear in some dictionaries with the primary meaning as variety, my story: I'm in a Chinese restaurant and the waiter says "What **sort** of _rice_ would you like with your _dog head_?".
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(118): What **SORT** of person comes from the U.S.? Well, some would say a person with a BIG HEAD.
column7: 3) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 29-6-2008(102): _Condi Rice_ is the **SORT** of person that would give HEADaches to a BIG DOG…..This story has been edited because of people reporting it. I like it better without "aches", but whatever works for you!
column8: 4) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 2-5-2007(49): (Compilation of raulir's and Raichu's stories). Various types of food are enumerated on the _page_ (maybe a menu): in the upper half you see vegetarian **sorts** of food (such as _rice_ ), and in the lower half you see **sorts** of meat dishes (such as _St. Bernard dog_ 's meat).
column9: 5) [[mclin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mclin)] 29-1-2009(23): There are many **sort** s of _rice_ in Japan. Some are as _big_ as your _head_!

column3: Water . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . grains of rice.
column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(202): **LACQUER** is a type of WATERY type of liquid used to protect items made from TREES, sort of an UMBRELLA of protection. So protective, you can carry around RICE in the **LACQUER** ED, WOODEN product.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2006(172): _Water_ is falling from a _tree_ onto the _umbrella_ underneath which is protecting the _rice_ underneath it. But it's completely dry since the umbrella is **lacquer** ed.
column7: 3) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-8-2006(33): Water falls from the trees onto my **lacquer** umbrella and bounces and beads off like grains of rice.
column8: 4) [[strugglebunny](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/strugglebunny)] 12-1-2009(21): Rain _drops_ bounce off **lacquer** ed _wood_ like an _umbrella_ having _grains of rice_ poured on it.
column9: 5) [[delenir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delenir)] 6-1-2010(9): **LACQUER** protects your WOODEN products from WATER like an UMBRELLA–the rain will just bounce off of it like RICE.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 26-7-2009(80): Before [lacquer](../v4/932.html) (#932 漆) was made with water, it was made by draining this _body part_ of fluid: the **knee**!
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 2-8-2008(44): Back in ancient Japan, people didn't have **knee** pads for things like rollerblading and such (what, come on. Ninjas on rollerblades. Ultimate 90s flashback). Instead, they would simply dip their **knee** s in _laquer_ , and wait until it dried (hence the _flesh_ , and the abscence of any _drops of water_ ). Unfortunately, this meant that you would have to wait about 30 minutes after deciding to go rollerblade until you could actually do it (took some time to dry) - and removing it was a serious pain.
column7: 3) [[Corodon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Corodon)] 11-8-2009(31): The **knee** s are the _part of the body_ that I protect with _lacquer_ ed **knee** pads.
column8: 4) [[Yozora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Yozora)] 7-6-2010(12): Don't **knee** l on the wet lacquer. When it dries your flesh will be stuck to it!
column9: 5) [[mecreant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mecreant)] 7-8-2012(4): I used to be an adventurer like you, then I took and arrow in the **knee**. Now I have to wear a lacquered **knee** brace to protect my wounded flesh.

column3: The abbreviation **Esq.** will help associate this character with the honorific form of address to which it belongs. Its elements are: _tree_ . . . _sheep_ . . . _grains of rice_. Note that the final vertical stroke in the element for _sheep_ is extended to form the first stroke for _grains of rice_.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 6-4-2007(321): Here we have the requirements to be counted among the ranks of the noble **Esq.** You must posses a _forested_ estate, herds of _sheep_ , and granary full of _grains of rice_.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(165): This is **-Sama** , a generic high term of respect for someone in an unusual profession. If you met a person that created a _wooden_ _sheep_ that was squeezing a single _grain of rice_ out of its ass, you'd definitely call that person **-sama**. Because that is impressive.
column7: 3) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 23-2-2006(48): A squire's (Esq.) job is to get his knight 3 things: weapons, women, and food. In this case a really bad squire brings back a piece of wood, a sheep, and a few grains of rice.
column8: 4) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 12-8-2008(39): This kanji actually means **-sama**. You are the creator of TREES, SHEEP, and RICE?! Ooooh great creator **-SAMA**!! (kneels).
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 10-11-2008(23): In Japan, your **sama** -ness is determined by how many _trees, sheep, and grains of rice_ you have.

column3: Let the _drop_ in the upper right-hand corner of this character close the right angle off to make an _arrowhead_. Whenever we find the _needle_ with that _drop_ in an element that has no other special meaning, we will take advantage of this primitive meaning. At the bottom, we see the _grains of rice_ , the vertical line doubling up for the two elements. Do not confuse with _petition_ (Frame 143).
column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 16-6-2007(221): Enemy: "Any final **request** s?" // MacGyver: "Just an _arrowhead_ and some _grains of rice_." (MacGyver then throws the _grains of rice_ at the enemy and uses the _arrowhead_ to cut his hands free from the rope.).
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-8-2007(134): _Robin Hood_ holds his rich victim at _arrowpoint_ and kindly **request** s that he hands over his _grains of rice_.
column7: 3) [[nagisa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nagisa)] 27-11-2007(52): A beggar asks for you if you can spare a few grains of rice, after you refuse you find him pointing an arrowhead at your throat. "That wasn't a **request**.".
column8: 4) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 1-7-2008(39): For reasons I'll leave up to you, a monk is being put to death. "Any last **REQUEST** S?" they asked him, as they began to squirt _drops_ of poison from a _needle_ into the _water_ of his intravenous line. Yet he said nothing, only concentrating on 求道 , **seeking** the path to enlightenment. (PLEASE note that the 部首 for this character is "shitamizu" - NOT rice, but _water_. Also, the keyword "seek" would be much more appropriate, and it is not used elsewhere in RTK. shrug).
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 12-6-2010(18): I don't **request** much, just _one_ _drop_ of those _rice grains_.

column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 6-5-2007(298): Someone files a _request_ to see the family _jewels_ and, to their surprise, you show them your **ball** s!
column6: 2) [[Deborah](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Deborah)] 30-11-2007(105): The _KING REQUESTS_ your presence at the **ball** … game.
column7: 3) [[b0ng0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/b0ng0)] 5-2-2009(58): You cannot disobey the _king_ , so when he _requests_ to see your **ball** s you have no choice.
column8: 4) [[FutureBlues](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FutureBlues)] 16-7-2008(28): Imaging the _King_ from Katamari Damacy _requesting_ a new **ball** of things to make into a heavenly body! (And don't confuse with [clod](../v4/2024.html) (#2024 塊), whose reading is _katamari_ …).
column9: 5) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 6-7-2008(28): The _king requests_ to see his favorite three **BALL** games: eminent-ball ( 卓球 , ping pong), field-ball ( 野球 , baseball), and courtyard-ball ( 庭球 , tennis). He was having a great time until he caught a **ball** in the golden-jewels ( 金玉 , **ball** s)!

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 24-12-2006(243): Like in the biblical sense, someone looks skyward and makes a _request_ for **salvation** from this horrible _taskmaster_ …
column6: 2) [[Johan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johan)] 22-4-2006(131): For **salvation** you have to _request_ forgiveness from God (the ultimate _taskmaster_ ).
column7: 3) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 10-6-2007(31): A cruel _taskmaster_ makes a _request_ to god for **salvation** from the sins commited during his life. Yeaaaah… right.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 14-4-2008(16): [+rtk] Who would need to _request_ **salvation** more than _Hitler_? Hitler has joined the _Salvation_ Army (in order to get some of his own). He hears that they need _rice_ , and figures that the more _grains of rice_ he gets, the more _salvation_ he'll get. So he goes around town in his Santa suit _request_ ing _grains of rice_. If someone doesn't pony up, he produces a small _arrowhead_ (knives over 6cm are illegal in Japan) and snarls, "that wasn't a _request_ ".
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 11-11-2012(11): He _requested_ **salvation** from God, the _taskmaster_ (compare with [pardon](../v4/1744.html) (#1744 赦)).

column3: **Bamboo** grows upwards, like a straight _nail_ , and at each stage of its growth (which legend associates with the arrival of the new moon) there is a jointed rootstock (the first stroke). Two such **bamboo** stalks are pictured here.
column4: * As a primitive, the meaning remains the same, but the vertical lines are severely abbreviated so that they can take their place at the top where, like _flowers_ , they are always to be found.
column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 30-6-2008(99): Pandas like to eat **bamboo**. I'm using panda as the primitive name when it fits the story. ^__^.
column6: 2) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 5-7-2009(39): Two _reclining_ victims impaled by **bamboo** _spikes_.
column7: 3) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 18-11-2007(36): Since this is a really common kanji and so easy to remember on its own, I just remembered it by it's reading, which is たけ.
column8: 4) [[FoxintheStars](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FoxintheStars)] 27-9-2010(9): I see this pictographically. Stroke 1: leaf. Stroke 2: joint of stalk. Stroke 3: section of stalk. And it's doubled because it comes in groves (just as you double "tree" to make "grove").
column9: 5) [[bigpapalove17](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigpapalove17)] 10-10-2010(6): Oh NO, NO (think katakana), two pieces of **BAMBOO** stabbed TJ.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 30-1-2007(304): When the people tried to build a tower of _bamboo_ to reach the _heavens_ , the gods just **laughed** and **laughed**.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 7-5-2009(101): Tip: 天 and 夭 ( _heavens_ and _sapling_ ) are different, but RTK confuses them sometimes. The latter appears in numbers 634, 938, 2078, 2079, 2080, and all characters containing _angel_ 喬 (429, 430, 1221, 2104, 2120, 2369). Story: The fully-grown _bamboo_ trees are **laugh** ing at the little _sapling_.
column7: 3) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 21-4-2008(82): That Panda is in _bamboo heaven_! Just look at him **laugh**!
column8: 4) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 10-3-2007(38): He couldn't stop **laugh** ing after smoking some _Bamboo_ _Heaven_ the latest in cannabis …
column9: 5) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 2-4-2007(25): The rustling of the _bamboo_ leaves is the **laugh** ter of the _heavens_.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 30-1-2007(251): The _bamboo_ _vase_ was beautifully crafted, but the tourist didn't know what it was and wore it as a little **bamboo hat**.
column6: 2) [[broderickjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/broderickjeff)] 29-1-2008(70): The _bamboo_ part is easy. Just remember that this kanji refers to those particular **bamboo hats** that are worn primarily by Buddhist monks, who always seem to _stand_ outside of train stations, collecting alms.
column7: 3) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 21-4-2008(53): Hey, where'd you buy that **bamboo hat**? Over at that _bamboo stand_!
column8: 4) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(24): Just cause you're _standing_ with _bamboo_ on your head, doesn't mean it's a **bamboo hat**!
column9: 5) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 14-2-2009(13): The **Bamboo hat** , **stands** on your head.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 16-6-2007(245): The _bamboo_ _generation_ smokes **bamboo grass**.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-11-2005(94): “One of the most attractive aspects of bamboo is that it is a renewable resource, it takes less than a year for a stalk to reach maturity, compared to the decades for most trees, whether needle or broadleaf.” – Mnemonic : "bamboo grass is the next _bamboo generation_ ".
column7: 3) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 12-1-2008(50): **Bamboo grass** lasts generations. very strong  & durable.
column8: 4) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 25-5-2009(35): _Bamboo_ is known for its rapid _generation_. Therefore, even if you spend hours hacking away at bamboo plants, go back the next day and you'll see freshly-sprouted **bamboo grass**. It's almost like it _generates_ before your eyes.
column9: 5) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 29-8-2007(19): The 70's _generation_ of _Panda's_ smoked a lot of **bamboo grass**.

column3: _Bamboo_ . . . _float_. Note that the drawing of the primitive for _float_ uses the abbreviated form that has become standard in the general-use kanji and as we met it earlier (Frames 393-95). Until such time as typesetting fonts make the adjustment, only the older form has been approved. Here we have opted for the simpler, avant garde drawing.
column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-7-2007(74): Note: the spelling should be **stationery** (= paper, office supplies), not **stationary** (= not moving). The error is in the original book.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-9-2007(52): The _two fiestas_ communicated to each other on their respective floats by using _bamboo_ **stationery**.
column7: 3) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 5-9-2009(15): They used bamboo stationery to document where and when the two fiestas would take place.
column8: 4) [[Hoticehunter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hoticehunter)] 27-3-2012(10): Because this character was added to the Joyo list in 2010, it now uses a simplified version of the writing. It's now the "float" primitive instead of "two fiestas".
column9: 5) [[shirahime](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shirahime)] 17-7-2008(10): The fiesta celebrating bamboo and the fiesta celebrating **stationary** combined into one big fiesta celebrating bamboo **stationary**. You get giant bamboo pencils for attending.

column3: _Bamboo_ . . . _part of the body_ . . . _power_. Here we see how the primitive meaning of **muscle** was derived from the kanji for _power_.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-3-2006(202): **Muscle** is part of the body that gives strength, and can be both supple and tense like the bamboo.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(86): Lifting BAMBOO STICKS is an old way for your BODY to put on lots of **MUSCLE**.
column7: 3) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 12-4-2010(54): If you have enough **MUSCLE** POWER, you can throw BAMBOO to the MOON.
column8: 4) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 26-7-2008(38): 肋 is [rib](../v4/2463.html) (#2463 肋). Over your _ribs_ the **muscle** (pecs) can flex and bend like _bamboo_.
column9: 5) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 6-5-2007(15): **Muscle** is powerful flesh that bends like bamboo.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(330): The best kind of **BOX** is made from BAMBOO sticks that are INTER-laced to make it air tight. Just picture such a **box** and you've mastered this kanji.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(74): I think of a **box** made of inter-locking of bamboo strips.
column7: 3) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 22-11-2008(50): Stick your _bamboo_ in her **box** to have _inter-_.
column8: 4) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 3-3-2007(13): BAMBOO that INTER- locks makes a **BOX**. (thanks to Fuaburisu).
column9: 5) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 3-5-2008(9): Bamboo interwoven, makes a nice **box**.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 14-5-2007(182): _Bamboo_ is the best material from which to make a _brush_ if you want it to be a **writing brush**.
column6: 2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 8-7-2008(57): Traditionally, the ふで, or **writing brush** , was made with a _bamboo_ handle and the hair of an animal (usually horse, rabbit, or wolf). Before the advent of paper (which the Chinese invented), writing was also done on segments of bamboo.
column7: 3) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 3-1-2010(11): When the _panda_ held the magical **writing brush** , he was able to draw every Heisig kanji without having even studied the book. Picture yourself studying for months and the panda picks up the **writing brush** and does better than you.
column8: 4) [[matt_jenkins](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matt_jenkins)] 7-4-2008(7): For _bamboo_ , I visualise _panda_. The first writing _brushes_ were of an enormous size, because there was no ink as yet and scribes had to write by poking _pandas_ in the backside and writing with panda manure. ( _Ancient Chinese legend explaining why pandas are so shy and retiring_ ).
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-4-2006(6): My **writing brush** is a “bamboo brush”, my handwriting is both supple and tense, like the bamboo.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(424): Seriously, all BAMBOO sticks look the SAME, just long **CYLINDER** S. Should the story be more complicated?
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 9-1-2008(44): Fully- grown bamboo consists of a number of **cylinder** -like sections, all exactly the same.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 19-2-2007(452): The _Bamboo Buddhist Temple_ has bamboo buddhas, bamboo buildings, bamboo benches, bamboo beds, bamboo bowls, **etc.** **etc.** **etc.**
column6: 2) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 28-11-2007(138): "So what'd you see in Japan?" - " _Bamboo_ , _temples_ … **etc.** ".
column7: 3) [[bandwidthjunkie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bandwidthjunkie)] 23-12-2008(16): Two Gods sitting in a pub, one God says to the other, "oh yeah by the way I'm making China today." The other says, "how do you do that then?" God number one replies "oh you know, a bit of bamboo, a few Buddhist temples, **etc.**.." God Two "Not much to it then?" God One "No not really, should be done by lunch time, should leave plenty of time to work on my handicap.".
column8: 4) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 12-4-2007(16): One monk at a _buddhist temple_ says to another: "You only have to look at a _bamboo_ grove to understand the meaning of **et cetera** ". "How so?" "There is no single bamboo plant which catches your attention, no main attraction, they are ALL **et cetera**.".
column9: 5) [[Rujiel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rujiel)] 19-12-2009(9): This is the suffix you'd use in referring to a group of people in a familiar or condescending way, such as to jokingly imply you feel they come from, say, a _bamboo Buddhist temple_. (This is the -ら (-ra) suffix, as in お前ら omaera [、奴ら](midori://search?text=、奴ら) yatsura [、僕ら](midori://search?text=、僕ら) bokura, **etc.** ).

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 2-8-2006(305): Before the time of digital **calculators** , people used old school **calculators** made of _bamboo_ (abacus). It's not as easy as a **calculator** , but you don't need any batteries either. All you need are your _eyes_ and your _two hands_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(117): Tip : you may see this as an Abacus, which is used to **calculate**. This particular ancient chinese Abacus has _eyeballs_ in place of beads, and its frame is made of _bamboo_. You'd be amazed at how fast people can **calculate** with this, especially if they can use _both hands_ at once to move the … _eyeballs_.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 13-1-2007(50): Gah! I just can't **calculate** this differential equation! So I take a sharp bamboo pen in each hand and jam them into my eyes out of frustration.
column8: 4) [[stephan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stephan)] 17-11-2008(27): Warning: a different abacus will be used later as a primitive, see [how many](../v4/1381.html) (#1381 幾).
column9: 5) [[mbaron](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mbaron)] 18-8-2008(27): To **calculate** with the _bamboo_ abacus, you need a sharp _eye_ and _both hands_.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 16-6-2007(204): The **solution** to this puzzle is, like the match stick game, to make the _bamboo_ pieces _fit together_.
column6: 2) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 17-7-2008(141): For the frustrated housewife the **solution** came in form of a BAMBOO stick that FITS her well.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 9-1-2008(76): Be careful not to confuse this with the inter-locking bamboo pieces of [box](../v4/942.html) (#942 箱). Imagine a child's building-block puzzle. There are three holes: triangle, square, circle. Also there is a cylindrical piece of bamboo. Which of the holes does the _bamboo_ _fit_ into? The fitting hole is the **solution**.
column8: 4) [[dicedice](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dicedice)] 10-1-2009(40): The **solution** to every problem? Bamboofit! column5: 1) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 14-10-2006(229): The temples in kyoto belt bamboo around trees in a **scheme** to protect them from the huge number of tourists. (true story)———– 対策 たいさく measure, countermeasure.
column6: 2) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 3-4-2008(122): (Elaboration of jameserb's story:) A clever **scheme** from Wile E Coyote – he ties one of those rubber _belts_ to some _trees_ and uses it to launch a _bamboo_ spear at the roadrunner…
column7: 3) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 23-3-2009(77): In Japan gardeners use a **scheme** to protect _tree_ s by putting a _bamboo_ _belt_ around them.
column8: 4) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 8-7-2008(25): I have trouble recalling this keyword, so I'm going to employ the mnemonic: the "Bamboo Belt **Scheme**." It's linked to a true story: In India, the gov't implemented a **SCHEME** to make use of the abundant _bamboo belt_ in the north of the country. As compared to the hardwood _trees_ there, bamboo is highly renewable and will create rural jobs in a push for 300% increase in bamboo production. There. Bamboo, not trees. It's in the **scheme**.
column9: 5) [[narafan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/narafan)] 3-9-2007(13): The **scheme** was to capture him, tie him to a _tree_ with a _belt_ , and whip him with the _bamboo_.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-1-2006(213): Note : the keyword is not a verb, think of a record book. This _acupuncturist_ who uses _bamboo_ in place of flowers to dilute _water_ into his patients (see frame 227), managed somehow to appear on the **register** of acupuncturists. Chances are, he won't stay on the **register** for long. My image is close to that of gorgon's story.
column6: 2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 29-1-2006(106): This doctor dilutes (see 227) his patients with bamboo stalks rather than the flowers of a standard diluting acupuncturist hence he needs to be on the Bamboo Accumpunturist Diltuers (BAD) **register**. Pumping that much water into a body can be dangerous, see the huge bamboo stems with gallons of water sloshing in and out of the patient.
column7: 3) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 20-11-2007(25): The _acupuncturist_ was not very good. His _bamboo_ needles made his patients cry copious amounts of _water_. He was put on a **register** of doctors to avoid.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(16): After _diluting_ your bad humours with flowers in Frame 217, the _acupuncturist_ pulls out a _bamboo_ slab and asks you to sign the **register** , including your e-mail address, so that you can receive periodic updates on special promotions and also read his blog.
column9: 5) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-9-2009(14): The keyword refers to **register** as in an expense book. I imagine a wealthy housewife writing up her elaborate and unnecessary expenses in her **register** notebook: fancy _bamboo_ flatware, sparkling _water_ , her weekly trip to the _acupuncturist_ , and so on…

column5: 1) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 17-10-2007(193): _Bamboo craft_ ing is a _mediocre_ substitute for _wood_ when you are **build** ing or **fabricat** ing a house. While it may look good and might attract a chick (ちく) or two, the kids'll (きず) just tear it to pieces as its not sturdy enough.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 25-7-2007(112): A bamboo fabrication is a mediocre substitute for wood.
column7: 3) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 20-11-2007(81): If you **fabricate** a boat from _bamboo_ you get a pretty _mediocre craft_. Use _wood_ instead.
column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 21-10-2008(51): Just as you wouldn't want heart surgeons who were _mediocre_ at their _craft_ operating on you (see raulir's story for [fear](../v4/613.html) (#613 恐)), you also wouldn't want house builders who were _mediocre_ at their _craft_ **fabricating** your house for you–they might **fabricate** a flimsy one of _bamboo_ instead of sturdy one of _wood_. 建築 (けんちく): construction, architecture 建築家 (けんちくか): architect 築き上げる (きずきあげる): to build up/establish (one's reputation) Careful: [erect](../v4/869.html) (#869 架).
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-2-2008(26): Note: _bamboo + craft + mediocre_ are later combined into 筑 [ancient harp](../v4/2637.html) (#2637 筑).

column3: _Bamboo_ . . . _dragon_. Note that the older (and still official) form of this kanji uses the old character for dragon 龍, which is good to learn and is fun to write in any case. It is made up of five primitive elements: _vase_ . . . _flesh_ . . . _slingshot_ . . . _fishhook_ (enclosure) . . . _three_.
column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(39): The only **cage** that can keep a _dragon_ is made of _bamboo_.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 22-1-2009(24): A _bamboo_ **cage** won't hold a _dragon_!
column7: 3) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 9-12-2009(12): A _bamboo_ **cage** has a 50% chance of containing a _dragon_ (thanks Mantixen and cb4960) I should add that this is yet another example of Heisig choosing a less used simplification. 籠 is more common.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 19-9-2011(5): 立て篭る =立て籠る, 印籠 =印篭[cage](../v4/2638.html) (#2638 篭)ロウ, かご, こもる … Parts: 竹 , 竜 /龍 ( 印籠 [cage [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/3028) (#3028 籠), 龍安寺 [dragon [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2981) (#2981 龍) … Note: When かご is written in Kanji, it can use simple form 篭 . The verb (たって)こもる uses the old form of Dragon. Probably better to learn 龍 [dragon [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2981) (#2981 龍) and then get used to seeing either the old or new form of dragon in any Kanji using it as a part, rather than trying to remember one or the other. This is true for all Kanji using dragon 滝 -瀧 etc.
column9: 5) [[dominikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dominikun)] 17-1-2011(3): German: Ein Käfig aus brennbaren Bambus taugt wohl nicht so recht um einen Drachen - egal ob alt oder jung - einzufangen oder gar gefangen zu halten. Um seine Laune zu verschlechtern, taugt der Käfig wohl aber doch…

column3: The character for _enter_ (Frame 842) showed someone walking inwards (in terms of the direction of writing), the one for **person** , shown here, represents someone walking outwards.
column4: * As a primitive, it can keep its kanji form except when it appears to the left (its normal position), where it is made to stand up in the form ⺅ (Similar to イ). The primitive meaning is another matter. The abstract notion of _person_ so often has a relation to the meaning of the kanji that confusion readily sets in. So many of the previous stories have included people in them that simply to use _person_ for a primitive meaning would be risky. We need to be more specific, to focus on one particular _person_. Try to choose someone who has not figured in the stories so far, perhaps a colorful member of the family or a friend whom you have known for a long time. That individual will appear again and again, so be sure to choose someone who excites your imagination.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 27-11-2008(156): Behold Mister T (of "A-Team" fame)! I chose Mr.T because he's sure to make amusing stories. He is a very versatile character since he's both the big, tough guy and the “moralistic” **person** , telling kids not “to do drugs or alcohol”. He is easy to imagine, the heavy gold chains are probably the most prominent feature of the character. And last but not least you can always pepper your story with the famous line “I pity da foo!” * Fittingly, on the left side of the kanji, it looks like a “T”.
column6: 2) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 1-10-2006(44): [I appreciate some people's occasional habit of using _P_ for **person** in shared stories. That makes it easier to substitute _Mr. T_ , _Captain Picard_ , or whomever else a student is using as **person.** ].
column7: 3) [[ImaginaryJapan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ImaginaryJapan)] 31-12-2009(31): _Khatzumoto_.
column8: 4) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 31-12-2007(30): For this character, I'm going to use Chuck Norris. He is a world class martial artist, winning several karate championships in a row. He also achieved ultimate power according to his Chuck Norris Facts, and works as a Texas Ranger (sheriff). He is however a very kind and religious **person**. Here we have a view of his powerful legs, while the contracted form shows him performing a roundhouse kick.
column9: 5) [[didz13](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/didz13)] 19-8-2008(24): JESUS.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 27-11-2008(177): Mr T's **assistant** is on his left. Why? So now his **assistant** is always to his left side, much safer - "Stay on my _left_ , foo!".

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-12-2006(178): Note: this kanji refers to event or case. Current **Affair** headline: _Mr. T_ has **affair** with _cow_. "It's only animal 'man' enough for me".
column6: 2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 19-6-2008(37): How could you have an **affair** with _that person_?? She's a _cow_!
column7: 3) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 23-3-2007(30): I'm having a hard time keep straight just which animal Mr. T is having an **affair** with. chamcham's story made me realize that Mr. T is not having an "affair", he's having an "heifair." Get it?
column8: 4) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(10): The _Jedi_ Anakin rides a _cow_ (a Shaak) on Naboo to try to impress Padme and draw her into an **affair**.
column9: 5) [[brianobush](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brianobush)] 2-5-2009(9): Mr. T tried to have an **affair** with a cow - picture him running around the feed lot "Come here foool, I just need a little lovin".

column3: _Person_ . . . _samurai_. The key word means to wait on someone or serve them.
column5: 1) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 30-8-2007(114): Back in the day, a _person_ who stands beside a _samurai_ is usually **attend** ing to them or **work** ing for them.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(79): [+fuaburisu] _Mr T_ **attend** s to _Tom Cruise_ in the Last Samurai, who is doing hara-kiri. Imagine _Tom Cruise_ outside in the final scene, stabbing his knife into his stomach, while _Mr T_ looks patiently on. "I pity da foo….no, really.".
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 18-6-2008(57): _Mr. T_ has become a _samurai_. Now he has to **attend** his feudal lord. "I pity da foo don't **attend** to his lord", says _Mr. T_.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(23): Mr T **attend** s to the samurai doing harakiri. .
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 14-10-2010(18): _Jedi_ and _samurai_ were very similar types…in spite of their awesome abilities, both devoted their lives to serving and **attend** ing to others. 仕事 (しごと) : work, occupation, employment, 仕える (つかえる) : to serve, to work for.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(161): It's one or the **other** : fight _Mr. T_ , or be thrown into the _scorpion_ pit.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 25-7-2006(67): Old latin saying: homo hominis scorpio ( _people_ are _scorpions_ to **other** _people_ ).
column7: 3) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 8-8-2008(36): _Mr. T_ picks a live scorpion up off the ground and starts munching on it. "Mmmmm…. _scorpion_. The **other** white meat".
column8: 4) [[tenken3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tenken3)] 20-4-2007(30): P is an animal lover, he already had an affair with a cow (frame 959) and his **other** lover is a scorpion. (if you visualize it really graphic you will never forget this, but your good taste won't thank you for it).
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 22-3-2011(19): _Sith_ \- the " **other** " jedi - were like _scorpions_ …deadly and treacherous. 他 (ほか) : **other** (especially places and things), 他人 (たにん) : another person, unrelated person, outsider, stranger.

column5: 1) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 25-11-2006(224): Don't need a silly story for this one: prostration is when a person puts themselves in a low position like a dog, as an extreme gesture of humility.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(114): _Mr T_ has beaten up the _chihuahua_ , who lies **prostrated** in front of him. "Now," _Mr T_ says, "I quiero some Taco Bell!".
column7: 3) [[gpetroce](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gpetroce)] 27-9-2007(15): Rocco likes to prostrate women in front of him in a dog-like position…
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 1-9-2008(8): _Haruhi_ orders everyone to sit like a _dog_ in a **prostrated** position.
column9: 5) [[jonusbalonus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jonusbalonus)] 7-5-2013(5): “Get up foo, you ain't no _chihuahua_!" says _Mr. T_ to the obsessive fan **prostrated** on the ground in front of him. "I pity da foo who gets hiself **prostrated** before anyone like a little dumb ass _chihuahua_!" says _Mr. T_. (don't confuse with [ceremony](../v4/984.html) (#984 儀)).

column3: _Person_ . . . _rising cloud_. Hint: the Amerindians' smoke signal scan help provide a good image for this kanji, whose key word is meant to include **transmissions** of all sorts.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-10-2005(295): Mister T **transmit** s a message with rising clouds (smoke) signals, to a nearby American Indian tribe. The smoke signals spell : "I p-i-t-y y-o-u f-o-o !".
column6: 2) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(21): Hanging one-handed under _Cloud_ City, the _Jedi_ -in-training Luke, uses the force to **transmit** his distress to Leia.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 1-9-2008(11): _Haruhi_ **transmit** s her message to the aliens via smoke signals ( _rising clouds_ of smoke).
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 28-8-2011(6): _person_ **transmit** ting smoke signals in coded _rising clouds_.
column9: 5) [[randomkrazy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/randomkrazy)] 16-1-2009(6): Can you imagine if _people_ used comic dialogue _rising clouds_ to **transmit** their thoughts?

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-2-2007(143): _Mr. T_ says, "I ain't afraid o' no foo! I'll give anyone an _elbow_ to the face, I don't care if it's _Buddha_ himself!".
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 11-4-2007(77): **Buddha** is a _person_ who always seems to have his _elbows_ bent.
column7: 3) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 25-5-2009(30): Out of respect for **Buddha** , _Chuck Norris_ simply _elbows_ him rather than roundhouse-kicking him in the face. However, the sheer force of _Chuck Norris's elbow_ is still powerful enough to bring **Buddha** to enlightenment in one blow.
column8: 4) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 21-4-2008(17): "If you see the **Buddha** , kill him" goes the koan. _Mr T_ wouldn't go that far, but he'd certainly be prepared to _elbow_ the guy in the ribs…
column9: 5) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 13-11-2007(15): In Japan, _Dracula_ fears images of **Buddha** rather than the cross, so here you see him with his crooked _elbow_ raised in the classic movie pose, holding his cape up to cover his face, as someone confronts him with a tiny **Buddha** statue.

column3: _Person_ . . . _tree_. Be sure not to confuse with _relax_ (Frame 202).
column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 9-8-2006(135): _Mr T_ **rest** ing by a _tree_.
column6: 2) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 2-3-2007(44): _Chuck norris_ **rest** s againsts the _tree_ , but wait, no… the tree **rest** s and stands against him.
column7: 3) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-2-2007(26): _Mr T_ leans against a _tree_ and takes a **rest** after mopping up a band of eco-terrorists.
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 16-11-2008(12): Imagine _Luke Skywalker_ taking a **rest** by a tree, as he struggles to complete Yoda's tasks.
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 12-8-2006(12): **Mr. T** doesn't _rest_ like the _rest_ of us. He recovers by yanking out a **tree** by the roots. "I pity da foo that has to _rest_ ".

column5: 1) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 9-8-2008(145): _Mr. T_ is _anti_ anything **provisional**. "I pity da foo' who's so indecisive that he can't make nothin' permanent".
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 19-11-2007(90): Mr. T was offered a job in the Iraq **Provisional** Authority, but he turned it down, because he's anti-war. "I pity da fool thinks this sand pit worth invadin' when our schools be in such sad shape!".
column7: 3) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 15-10-2007(49): If **provisional** governments are left in power for too long, the _people_ will begin to turn _anti-_ establishment.
column8: 4) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(27): The **provisional** government established under Palpatine was a **sham** , lead by a Sith, an _anti Jedi_.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 1-9-2008(13): _Haruhi_ is _anti-_ provisional: she always wants her changes to be permanent.

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 4-10-2007(50): _Mr T_ is dancing and singing and all that, but he's doing it on a _branch_. All that talent and can still still keep his balance? That's a real **performing artist**.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-8-2006(24): (note: this is the 'ki' from kabuki).//The **performing artist** is a _person_ doing Kabuki theater and dancing around with a _branch_ in his hand.
column7: 3) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 17-6-2010(17): As **PERFORMING ARTIST** , _MR T_ 's career is all about _BRANCH_ ing out. You name it, he's done it: From bouncer to gold-chain-wearing local night-scene celeb, to action hero, to rap artist, to his new smashing breakout role as Radikal-9 aka "Da Man" aka亻, his experiments with can-can ( 何 [what](../v4/1012.html) (#1012 何)), and now classical kabuki ( 歌舞伎 ), for which he is a natural. (Yes, you got it: _MR T_ pities da foo's who don't _BRANCH_ out.).
column8: 4) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 4-4-2010(7): Mr. T has branched out into the world of Kabuki ( 歌舞伎 ). What a veritable **performing artist**! Image: Mr. T performing kabuki on a slim branch, grandiose motions and all.
column9: 5) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 4-11-2011(2): As a **PERFORMING ARTIST** MR.T has BRANCHED out into KABUKI theater.

column5: 1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 30-1-2006(96): If _Mr T_ was _white_ I am sure he would have been commander in **chief** of the USA, he just the sort of clown Americans love to vote for. (NB: I tried with the indian **chief** motif but kept adding feathers by mistake).
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(63): _Mr T_ was originally supposed to be the **chief** of the A-Team, but then the producers realized that America didn't want to see a Black guy as the **chief** of a prime-time TV show. So here, we see _Mr T_ doing a bunch of _cocaine_ , and then spreading it all over his face to look _white_ , and trying out for the part of Hannibal. The directors were so impressed that they let him stunt double for Hannibal in a few episodes. OR, _Mr T_ **chief** in' on some _crack cocaine_. You make the call.
column7: 3) [[dinmamma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dinmamma)] 16-8-2009(39): OMG that kanji is racist!!! It shows the **chief** as a _white person_!!! Let's change it!
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 13-11-2007(15): This also means **Count** … **Count** _Dracula_ , the **chief** vampire, is easily recognized by his pale _white_ skin, gleaming _white_ fangs, _white_ shirt, _white gloves_ , et cetera.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 16-11-2008(14): Only the _jedi_ **chief** gets to use a _white_ lightsaber.

column3: _Person_ . . . _valley_. The key word should be taken in its older sense of "popular" or "commonplace."
column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 9-4-2007(142): _Mr. T_ says, "Don't be like them _valley girls_ , always speaking **vulgar** language and acting all **vulgar**! They ain't nothing but foos!".
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(55): Mr T meets the **vulgar** (common) people of the valley and participates in the **vulgar** customs (folkways). Looking at the **vulgar** (common) people, Mr T says - “I pity you foo!”.
column7: 3) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 16-3-2008(30): Most of the personages in the valley are **vulgar** types – miners, farmers, day laborers.
column8: 4) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 11-5-2009(17): Oh nooo! _Mr.T_ tasting a _female valley_ , how **vulgar**!
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 16-11-2008(11): _Anakin Skywalker_ hated the Tuscan Raiders because of their **vulgar** animal-like behaviour. When they took his mother, he decided to go down to the _valley_ where they lived, and murder them all.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(169): _Mr. T_ has **faith** in the _Word_ of God. (Image: Mr. T kneeling and prayering in front of a bible. "Pity me, fool.").
column6: 2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 9-4-2007(83): **Faith** is believing that a _person_ will be true to his _word_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(42): Have **faith** in the words of Mr T, “Don't do alcohol” “Don't do drugs” “I pity the foo what does not have **faith** !” “have **faith** (believe) in Mr T's words”.
column8: 4) [[japanralf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/japanralf)] 13-4-2008(22): Have **faith** in _Mr. Ts_ _words_!
column9: 5) [[ImaginaryJapan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ImaginaryJapan)] 23-12-2009(9): Have **faith** in _Khatzumoto_ and his _words_ , and one day you too will be fluent in Japanese.

column3: _Person_ . . . _ivy_. To distinguish from _excel_ (Frame 980), _eminent_ (Frame 52), _esteem_ (Frame 196), and _exquisite_ (Frame 130), give the key word its own unique connotation.
column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(138): _Mr T_ wants to go to an **excellent** school, so he enrolls in Harvard, an _ivy_ -league school.
column6: 2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 29-10-2006(122): Bill and Ted are walking through medieval Europe when they see a humongous _square jewel_. " **Excellent**!" they both yell. But only after grabbing it do they realize it is chained to the neck of _Mr. T_ , who grimaces angrily at them. "Bogus!" they cry, and totally run away.
column7: 3) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 12-9-2007(48): In Holland, when a person gives you an **excellent** mark for a test or an exam, he'll give you _10_ out of _10_ (10/10) and he underlines the numbers to emphasize your excellence!
column8: 4) [[findus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/findus)] 3-4-2008(31): The _square jewel_ chained to the neck of _Mr.T_ is what makes him **excellent**.
column9: 5) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 30-12-2006(19): **"Excellent!"** said by Charles Montgomery Burns as he gloats over a captured _P_ tied down with _ivy_ (think Lilliputians and Gulliver).

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(148): Mr T is **reliant** (depends on) on his garment (the gold chains).
column6: 2) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 9-3-2008(49): Mr. T. is so self-reliant he even makes his own garments.
column7: 3) [[pjhoover](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pjhoover)] 21-10-2008(36): Proverb: the clothes make the man (person). that is, we are **reliant** on what we wear to be who we are.
column8: 4) [[RisuMiso](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RisuMiso)] 13-10-2009(19): _People_ are **reliant** on _garments_ to survive cold winters.
column9: 5) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 24-10-2008(17): In his heyday, _Mr. T_ was not **reliant** on his _garments_ for his image, he relied more on his physique, his haircut, his gold chains, and his "I pity da foo" comments. 依存 (いぞん): dependence, **reliance** 依然 (いぜん): still, as yet 依頼人 (いらいにん): client に依ると (によると): according to (someone).

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(118): Mr T shows the **example** to the kids, and stays in the file (at supermarket, …). “I pity da foo who does not follow my **example** !”.
column6: 2) [[Clint](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Clint)] 20-11-2008(79): When _Mr. T._ wants to make an **example** out of a group of people, he lines them up all single _file_ and knocks them all out with one punch!
column7: 3) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 28-9-2006(30): _Mr. T_ always sets a good **example** by _filing_ his taxes early. "I pita da foo who files his taxes late!".
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(22): Mr. T teaching a fighting class, "For **example** , watch me beat the hell out of this _file_ of _skeleton warriors_ ".
column9: 5) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 25-5-2009(11): _Chuck Norris_ made an **example** of a group of criminals - he delivered one single roundhouse-kick to the entire _file_ of them, stripping each one of skin and flesh until only their _bones_ and _swords_ remained.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(120): This keyword gave me trouble, I could write the kanji from memory but could not remember the keyword the other way around. In such case the dictionary definition can be helpful : "Middle English, single, indivisible". Here we have _Mr. T._ who is so _hardened_ (all the body workout he's had) that he became **in-dividual** , that is, in-divisible. "I pity da foo who can be divided into smaller units.".
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(86): _Mr. T_ insists that people be **individual**. He appears on television, saying, "Being an **individual** is _hard_! But you gotta do it! _Harden_ yourself, and be **individual**!".
column7: 3) [[phauna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/phauna)] 11-2-2008(79): _Mr._ T is a _hardened_ **individual**.
column8: 4) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(17): _Mr T_ works out everyday until each **individual** muscle has _harden_ ed.
column9: 5) [[jezerey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jezerey)] 13-4-2008(15): Yoda says that to really be an **individual** you must harden your resolve against other people's opinions.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(125): _Mr. T_ in a public service announcement yells, "I'm **healthy** because every day I _build_ a food pyramid, foo!".
column6: 2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 9-7-2008(88): " _Mr.T_ , sir, how do you stay so **healthy**?" I asked. "Simple, foo," he answered, "you gotta _build_ the body up by bodybuilding!".
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 22-8-2006(26): _Mr. T_ is so **healthy** he can _build_ an entire _build_ ing all by himself! (After he eats his 納豆 .).
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 20-3-2011(13): _Jedi build_ **healthy** minds and bodies with their way of life. 健康 (けんこう) : health, sound, wholesome, 健やか (すこやか) : vigorous, **healthy** , sound.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-7-2009(11): In order to _build_ her club, _Haruhi_ needs to stay **healthy**.

column5: 1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 12-9-2007(185): _Mr. T rulezzz_! I am on his **side**!
column6: 2) [[amthomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amthomas)] 21-3-2007(38): _Chuck Norris_ 's _rules_ are easy to live by, just be on his **side**.
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 17-12-2006(29): " **Mr. T** got one **rule**!" says **Mr. T**. "I'm on the _side_ of those picked on by the bullies. I pity da foo who tries to bully those smaller than he is!".
column8: 4) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(23): There is the dark **side** and the _Jedi_ **side**. Those on the _Jedi_ **side** follows the _rules_.
column9: 5) [[cescoz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cescoz)] 24-7-2009(15): A PERSON that follow your RULES is at your **side**.

column3: _Person_ . . . _Buddhist temple_. The key word is deceptively modern, but the kanji is actually another way of writing  "samurai." Be careful not to confuse with _attend_ (Frame 1033).
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(139): _Mr. T_ infiltrates the secret samurai _Buddhist temple_ as a **waiter** with a tray of green tea. (Careful: [attend](../v4/960.html) (#960 仕)).
column6: 2) [[thelooseteeth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thelooseteeth)] 1-3-2009(115): Remember the kanji for **wait** , 待 . Well, now we have a **waiter** , and he's dropped a dish. See: 侍 ! 待 _crash_ 侍 .
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-10-2005(41): _Mister T_ can do no meditation! So he is a **waiter** at the _Buddhist temple_ , attending upon the zen monks, serving green tea, etc. (but mostly, he is annoying all the monks with the noise of his big gold chains).
column8: 4) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 19-12-2008(19): I think its best if we derive this from 待 (wait). So the **waiter** , WAITS for the people to pick their order by holding the menu [extra stroke] in his hand. This clever keyword allows one to go from **waiter** - > person that SERVES you. A samurai was bound by oath to SERVE their master etc etc, 侍女 【じじょ】 (n) lady attendant, maid, (P) 侍医 【じい】 (n) court physician, (P).
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 8-12-2006(10): The A-team tries to disguise **Mr. T** as a _waiter_. It would have worked too, except that he was to go undercover at a **Buddhist temple**. "I pity da foo sent me to a **Buddhist temple** dressed up like a _waiter_!".

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 5-9-2006(160): "Halt fool" - _Mr T_ acting as a bouncer at the _pavillion_.
column6: 2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 4-7-2008(70): Used in バス停 【バスてい】 (bus stop, or bus **halt** literally). Story: The _pavilion_ where _people_ wait for buses to **halt**.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-1-2006(70): _Mister T_ makes a **halt** at the African _pavilion_ at the World's Fair. He eats all the snacks on offer, and chats up the ladies - "“I pity da foo who does not **halt** by your _pavilion_ , it's the best !".
column8: 4) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(15): A _Jedi_ stands guard outside a _pavilion_. " **Halt** , who goes there?" he cries.
column9: 5) [[kyldyyr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kyldyyr)] 11-11-2005(10): A _person_ decides to visit the rotating restaurant on the top of the _pavilion_. Noticing how nice a restaurant it is, he/she decides to call a few friends to visit the restaurant, as well. The new arrivals also notice the nice atmosphere of the restaurant and decide to call a few more friends. And so on. Eventually the restaurant is filled with hundreds of people, whose sheer weight causes the rotating section to come to a complete **halt**.

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 11-5-2007(163): Mr. T ( _person_ ) tells the used car salesman to tell him the real **price** _straight away_ , and when he doesn't he throws him through the windshield.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-2-2007(88): _Mr. T_ is shopping for new chains. He knows what he wants and money isn't an issue. "Cut the jibba-jabba, tell me the **price** , _straightaway_!".
column7: 3) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-5-2006(72): The **price** is what _people_ want to know _straightaway_.
column8: 4) [[etpan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/etpan)] 18-10-2008(21): When _Chuck Norris_ goes shopping, do not ever talk about the **price**. Just hand your stuff over to him _straight away_ if you want to survive.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 2-12-2010(10): _Jedi_ Skywalker paid a terrible **price** for rushing _straightaway_ to Bespin to help his friends. 値 (あたい) : value, **price** , cost, worth, merit, 値段 (ねだん) : **price** , cost, 価値 (かち) : value, worth, merit.

column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(64): The black slave who was [set free](../v4/496.html) (#496 放) decides to **emulate** _Mr. T_ , his role model. He uses his _compass_ to head to Cali to start anew.

column8: 4) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 21-3-2008(42): A _person_ is truly _set free_ when there is no longer any felt need to **emulate** any type of person (for parents, boss, community, etc).
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 25-1-2009(14): _Mr. T_ wants kids to **emulate** him so they can be _set free_ from drugs and alcohol. "I pity the foo who won't **emulate** me and be set free!" says Mr. T.

column3: _Person_ . . . _soil_ . . . _compass_ . . . _taskmaster_. You may, of course, take the character for _emulate_ from the previous frame as the basis for this kanji, adding to it only the element for _soil_.
column5: 1) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 8-12-2009(46): **arrogant** : Mr.T, the arrogant taskmaster he is, assures the group he’s leading them in the right direction. Until he realises his compass is filled with dirt.
column6: 2) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 30-3-2012(7): _Mr T_ may appear **arrogant** because he addresses everyone as foo'. But, he's willing to get _dirty_ in order to _set free_ the youth in inner cities from drugs and poverty. Truly someone to be _emulated_. 傲慢 (ごうまん): pride, haughtiness, **arrogance** , insolence, hubris 傲岸 (ごうがん): haughtiness, pride, irreverence 倨傲 (きょごう): pride, **arrogance** 傲る (おごる): give (someone) a treat, be extravagant, live luxuriously, be proud, haughty.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 27-6-2010(7): **Arrogance**. How to [set free](../v4/496.html) (#496 放) 放 a _person_ from the annoying trait of **arrogance**. Dump a skip load of _soil_ on them (see "legs" of 方 flexing under the weight).
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 23-7-2012(5): He showed his **arrogance** as he poured _dirt_ on those who tried to _emulate_ him.

column3: To refer to the fullness of **humanity** that can only be achieved in dialogue with another ( _person_ . . . _two_ ), Confucius used this character.
column5: 1) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 11-5-2008(136): Mr. T shows his **humanity** by giving _two_ bucks to every homeless person he sees.
column6: 2) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 21-12-2007(90): **Warning** : This is not **humanity** as in all the people. But rather the qualities that make us human such as compassion and benevolence.
column7: 3) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 9-7-2008(51): This character, as Heisig points out, is strongly Confucian. Some scholars say that it references the importance of **humane** relationships between _two people_ (parent/child, sibling/sibling, ruler/subject, etc). It's easy enough, though, to look at it as a person in a dialogue with another - the give and take, yin and yang - the _two_ -way street in which **humanity** relates to each other.
column8: 4) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 15-2-2006(22): **Humanity** began with _two people_ , adam and eve.
column9: 5) [[adrenaline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrenaline)] 18-5-2009(15): **Humanity** needs only two things: CHUCK and NORRIS.

column3: _Person_ . . . _fiesta_. Hint: recall the German legend of the English missionary, Saint Boniface, who **felled** the sacred oak tree dedicated to Thor at Geismar (in lower Hessia), occasioning a great _fiesta_ for the Christians in the neighborhood to mark the defeat of their pagan competition. Be sure to fit your special _person_ into the story if you use it.
column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 18-2-2006(193): At a _fiesta_ , Mr. T tries to knock down a large pinata, but in his overly enthusiastic swings to get "the sucka," he actually **FELL** S the tree the piñata is hanging from, crushing some party goers. “I pity da fools who got crushed by my **FELL** ED tree!”.

column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(22): _Mr. T_ **fell** the chupacabra with a single arrow. The Mexican villagers had a _fiesta_ to rejoice.

He has cut off its legs one by one until it cannot stand, yet, despite being rendered almost completely useless it won't surrender. “It's just a flesh _wound_!” the **reclining** **piggy bank** yells.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 19-10-2008(77): _Mr. T_ gets **wound** ed by _reclining_ on his _piggy bank_.
column7: 3) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 30-12-2009(60): Some guy was robbed and beaten……he's the _person_ with the gaping **wound** _reclining on the floor_ with his _piggy bank_ smashed to pieces.
column8: 4) [[Tweenk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tweenk)] 9-9-2007(41): Absurd commercial: First, a closed quarters fight scene. Eventually _P_ beats everyone, but gets a serious **wound**. (S)he is shown _reclining_ on a sofa, suffering. Suddenly a cute _piggy bank_ pops up and says "What about your Health Insurance NOW? Don't wait and call right away!".
column9: 5) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 19-8-2009(21): OBAMA'S policies will **WOUND** our economy as the (piggy)BANKS RECLINE on taxpayer money.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-2-2008(156): Tip: Heisig later combines _mouth_ and _tree_ into 呆 [dumbfounded](../v4/2181.html) (#2181 呆). Story: Your _person_ (Mr. T. or whoever) is _dumbfounded_ when told to **protect** the bad guys rather than fight them.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(151): _Mr. T_ opens his _mouth_ from the top of the _tree_ saying "I pitty da foo who don't **protect** the trees!".
column7: 3) [[Sabien](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Sabien)] 27-7-2009(23): To **protect** the environment people _speak_ on the behalf of _trees_ …
column8: 4) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 15-10-2007(23): During a public service announcement broadcast, _Mr. T_ opens his big _mouth_ while sitting on the top branch of an enormous _tree_ and yells, "I pity the fool who doesn't **protect** the environment!".
column9: 5) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 13-3-2008(9): That personage with the big mouth yelling from the top of the tree is an environmental activist, trying to **protect** a redwood from a rapacious logging company.

column3: _Top hat and scarf_ . . . _protect_. Note that the  "tree" in _protect_ becomes a _wooden pole_ here.
column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(195): _Mr. T_ is **praise** d for his _protecting_ of the trees by being given a _top hat and scarf_ which he wears over his mohawk and chains, respectively.
column6: 2) [[TunS77](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TunS77)] 28-7-2009(33): I have to **praise** this _tophat and scarf_ , it sure did do a great job _protecting_ me from the cold!
column7: 3) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 7-11-2005(23): The guard that protects the castle is **praise** d for his top hat and scarf. Unfortunately, he's one of those royal guards in front of the palace in England, so he's not allowed to say anything. The top hat and scarf were placed on him by a tourist as a joke, and the "praise" is really his cohorts mocking him.
column8: 4) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 19-3-2008(21): **Praise** be to Jesus, who was once thought of as PATHETIC, but actually PROTECTED us (from death/sin, etc), and is worthy of **praise**.
column9: 5) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 14-1-2007(15): [praise, extol] A kid will only hear **praise** from his/her mother if he/she is wearing a _top hat_ and _scarf_ to be _protect_ ed from the cold outside, just like she's always asking…

column5: 1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 6-11-2005(233): My wise _person_ says **greatness** does not come from wearing shades ( _sunglasses_ ) but from planting _trees_ to shade everyone.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 31-1-2007(133): _Mr T_ stands in front of you, his **greatness** radiating out from him so brightly. You need to put on your _sunglasses_ and hide behind a _tree_ to even talk to the guy. "Recognise, foo!".
column7: 3) [[samusam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samusam)] 27-1-2008(43): Wise _Mr. T_ says **greatness** does not come from giving out shades ( _sunglasses_ ) but from planting _trees_ to shade everyone. (thanks to scottamus).
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(21): Mr T wears sunglasses and shows what an outstanding person he is climbing at the top of the tallest tree of the world “I pity da foo with no **greatness** !” (he wears sunglasses because the top of the tree rises above the clouds).
column9: 5) [[adrenaline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrenaline)] 18-5-2009(11): Chuck Norris. Wearing only sunglasses. With "wood". This IS **Greatness** personified.

column3: _Person_ . . . _glue_. The few cases in which this character serves as a primitive should include some connotation of  " **adhering** to " that distinguishes it from " _glued to_. " Two examples follow.
column5: 1) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 15-6-2009(567): 賀 TO EVERYONE WHO MADE IT TO 千 kanji!! Remember, after this, you'll be 読 ing japanese novels, the news, and the internet like a native. 吉 to ALL of you in your amazing japanese 往 . :).
column6: 2) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 13-2-2007(172): If a PERSON **ADHERE** S to something, they stick to it like GLUE.
column7: 3) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 23-8-2007(114): He's low on cash, so Mr. T wants to sell ad space on his body. When you ask him where it goes he says, "glue it here, fool! Ad here! ad here!".
column8: 4) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-2-2007(66): _Mr. T_ says, "Foo, of course I don't sniff _glue_! I **adhere** to my own advice to not use drugs!".
column9: 5) [[jino123](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jino123)] 2-11-2009(19): SIII! 1000!! CAZZO!

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(172): I dropped my **token** down the drain, so I used a piece of _bamboo_ with _chewing gum_ on the end to retrieve it.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(103): At the arcade, Mr. T _adheres_ a _bamboo_ rod to his **token** so that he can put it in the machine and pull it out repeatedly.
column7: 3) [[cheechuan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cheechuan)] 17-3-2008(46): Before entering the temple, one must _adhere_ to the rules and buy _bamboo_ **token** s. Mandatory offerings.
column8: 4) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 27-6-2007(34): A subway **token** can be obtained by sliding a thin piece of bamboo into the machine. The **token** _adheres_ to the _bamboo_ , and you can fish it out.
column9: 5) [[eri401](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eri401)] 17-6-2011(17): The **token** minority asian on TV has to wear a bamboo hat and [adhere](../v4/1000.html) (#1000 付) to all kinds of stereotypes. 切符 【きっぷ】 (n) ticket.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 24-6-2006(169): A **municipality** , like any type of government, _adheres_ to having _caves_ for offices (see [government office](../v4/591.html) (#591 庁)).
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-7-2009(88): Even if a **municipality** is in a _cave_ , you have to _adhere_ to its policies.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(34): _Mr. T_ _glues_ together the _caves_ forming a **municipality**.
column8: 4) [[partyrash](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/partyrash)] 22-1-2008(29): Adhere. Cave. Fu from Osaka-fu. In the **municipality** (fu) of Osaka you find advertisements adhered all over the subway tunnel caves.
column9: 5) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 17-10-2007(18): In this **municipality** there's a strange rule that you can only chew _gum_ in _caves_.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(183): It is always _Mr. T_ 's **responsibility** to be the _porter_ and carry around everyone's luggage because he's so strong.
column6: 2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 13-7-2008(67): In [pregnancy](../v4/507.html) (#507 妊), the woman was the porter for the first nine months. Now, as a new father, _Mr.T_ is assuming all the **RESPONSIBILITIES** that comes with it. Can't you just see him here as the new _porter_ , wearing a harness with a his little dude (who already has a little matching mohawk)?
column7: 3) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 15-3-2007(23): _Mr. T_ berates a lazy worker: "Foo! You're a _porter_! It's your **responsibility** to carry bags, clean the bathroom, and stuff!" To keep distinct from [duty](../v4/884.html) (#884 役), consider a **responsibility** to come from without, rather than from within.
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 24-3-2012(9): The _porter_ of people (rather than of baggage – i.e., bus driver, airline pilot, …) is the _person_ with the greatest responsibilty.
column9: 5) [[etpan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/etpan)] 22-10-2008(9): You can hire _Chuck Norris_ to be your _porter_ but he will take no **responsibility** if he damages your luggage while saving the world.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(256): It's your own _responsibility_ to pay the bus **fare** with the correct number of _shells/money_.
column6: 2) [[henroski](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/henroski)] 18-2-2007(32): In Japan they have automatic ticket gates so you cant easily cheat on your train **fare**. In England however the ticket gates are fairly open. It is a different kind of system. In England you are given the RESPONSIBILITY to put in the right amount of MONEY, but if you are caught cheating, the fines are stiff and you feel like a real CHINCHIN. "un.CHIN".
column7: 3) [[dtstutz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtstutz)] 14-7-2008(20): Belligerent passenger to bus driver: "Look buddy, I'll pay the **fare** if you just give me some change for my $20 bill!" Bus driver: "Hey it's your **responsibility** to bring the right amount of **cash**. Now get off the bus if you can't pay the **fare**." Don't confuse with [token](../v4/1001.html) (#1001 符) - fairness goes with responsibility.
column8: 4) [[Hujis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hujis)] 8-2-2009(10): In Japan you often pay the **fare** when you get off the bus. You have to put the correct change in to a machine. It's your _responsibility_ to make sure you have the correct _money/shells_ ready so as not to waste time. There is another machine you can put bills and large coins in to, which dispenses smaller change at the bottom.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-2-2007(10): _Mr. T_ walks out on his _porter_ job and hails a cab. The cabbie tells him how much the ridiculous **fare** is and out of spite Mr. T pays him with _shells_ he's kept in his ass.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 18-10-2005(178): " _Mister T_ **substitute** s an _arrow_ for a toothpick" – The keyword meaning is to replace something with something else, to act for another, to represent. It's best to stick to the first meaning, because the last two are very close to "mediator" which will come in frame 1761. The idea here is that the _arrow_ is not a toothpick, neither it is changed into one, but it can **substitute** for one.
column6: 2) [[bkvogel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bkvogel)] 31-7-2008(60): Mr. T shot the **substitute** teacher with an arrow.
column7: 3) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 9-9-2007(31): The gym teacher asks _Mr. T_ to **substitute** for him on the day the kids will be shooting _arrows_ for archery class. Imagine going home and telling your friends "dude! Mr T was my sub today! I hope my teacher gets hit with an arrowhead and never comes back!". (thanks dihutenosa).
column8: 4) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 18-9-2006(15): [substitute, change, convert, replace, period, age, counter for decades of ages, eras, etc., generation, charge, rate, fee] A stuntman is a _person_ working as **substitute** for the main actor in the scene when he is shot by an _arrow_.
column9: 5) [[Ellen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ellen)] 5-4-2010(7): I immediately thought of **substitute** in a footballing sense, and this video came to mind: <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-jUzIxnbkpI>. Imagine Mr. T in Segata Sanshiro's position and you have Mr. T throwing a **substitute** player like an arrow.

column5: 1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 27-4-2007(261): A **sack** is an easy substitute for a garment.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 18-10-2005(44): A worker who was recently **sack** ed from his job, is wearing a **sack** of potatoes as a _substitute garment_ (naked otherwise), in some kind of protest. The kanji is close to frame 1547 "bag", and although the later really refers to a "straw **sack** ", I use the image of a **sack** of potatoes here, and that of a "plastic bag" for frame 1547. The keywords would have been better swapped in my opinion, but the relevancy is not so important at this point (see notes of Lesson 31 in the book).
