column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 12-1-2008(86): "Aaaargh, stop!" cries the victim of **torture** , his fingers being squeezed by the thumb screws. "I'll consider it," the **torture** r says coolly, "if you tell me the names of all the agents in your organization.".
column7: 3) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 13-5-2008(30): Pulling finger nails is considered to be the most common kind of **torture**.
column8: 4) [[woodwojr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woodwojr)] 5-7-2008(18): Down in the interrogation room, the suspect's _fingers_ are, one by one, slowly bent back, broken, and then crushed, one by one, he's given some time to _consider_ confessing. It's uncertain whether the interrogators even care that **torture** rarely yields reliable information.
column9: 5) [[peterlasky](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peterlasky)] 25-7-2009(13): Dick Cheney was _considering_ having prisoner's _fingers_ broken (after the waterboarding). But he doesn't _consider_ that to be **torture**.

column3: _Old man_ . . . _sun_. This key word looks to be difficult because of its proximity to _somebody_. In fact, it is a very common kanji that will cause you no difficulty at all. Its meaning should be seen as the human referent for the abstract noun  "something."
column4: * As a primitive it means a _puppet_ -on-a-string.
column5: 1) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 24-8-2007(196): I find the best way of memorizing this kanji is in conjunction with the Japanese compound for **ninja** : 忍者 – i.e. **someone** who **endures** (see FRAME 597 for the kanji 忍 ). A 忍者 is not just a 身 (somebody), it's 者 who can 忍 great 拷 !
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 20-1-2007(72): Back in the _day_ , the _old man_ used to be **someone**. His name was in the papers and all that. I use CHUCKY from the movie Child's Play as my major alternate meaning for this primitive.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 25-11-2009(42): An _old man_ is **someone** who has seen many _days_.
column8: 4) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 14-3-2007(32): The _old man_ who desperately wanted a _son_ ( _sun_ ) was Gepetto. He just wanted **someone** to love. As a primitive, this character will mean _Pinocchio_.
column9: 5) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 12-9-2009(18): [aircawn] Back in the _day_ , the _old man_ used to be **someone**. He was famous for being the world's number one puppet manufacturer. (let the "one" be your way to differentiate this between the kanji for 'somebody').

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(214): I had a hard time with the next several frame numbers trying to use "puppet." So i thought of "voodoo doll" but then found "love doll" (which is just a special type of puppet) fit well with these 8 frames. Observe: Here I am **boil** ing my _love doll_ over the _flames_ to warm her up a bit…
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 31-5-2006(68): There is a lesser known voodoo practice of **boil** ing a _puppet_ over an _oven fire_ , to really make your victim feel the heat!
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 25-5-2008(49): Instead of puppet I like to think of "someone" as ninja (since it is the second kanji in ninja)- it made me think of some interesting stories. First up: A **ninja** must be able to walk over **fire** without his blood **boil** ing. (see him walking across the stretch of fire in concentration).
column8: 4) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 20-5-2009(32): I **boil** my _love doll_ (thanks decamer0n) over _oven fire_ to disinfect her because somebody might have "used" her before…
column9: 5) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 17-12-2007(18): Instead of puppet, I use Chucky. _Chucky_ is being **boil** ed to death over a _fire_ at the end of one of the movies.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(180): Here I am, putting a wreath of _flowers_ on my _love doll's_ head and pretending she is someone of great **renowned**.
column6: 2) [[trikatu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/trikatu)] 14-2-2007(51): This _someone_ is so **renowned** they are covered with _flowers_ every time they perform on stage.
column7: 3) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 30-6-2009(46): The most **renowned** _ninja_ can use even _flowers_ to kill _someone_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-9-2008(26): If you put _flowers_ on your _voodoo doll_ that person will become **renowned**.
column9: 5) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 14-3-2007(25): People throw _flowers_ on the stage after _Pinocchio_ performs his act for the **renowned** evil puppeteer guy.

column5: 1) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 8-8-2009(53): I've always wanted to use _bamboo_ **chopsticks** to eat sushi off a naked woman. Unfortunately, there is no woman in my life, so this _love doll_ will have to do.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 26-5-2008(31): Bamboo, lovedoll: At dinner, my _lovedoll_ decided to eat her meal the Japanese way using **chopsticks**. But well, what a problems she had getting those _bamboo_ shoots into her mouth (which should not be that difficult, I would say!).
column7: 3) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 31-3-2010(16): This _ninja_ uses _bamboo_ **chopsticks** to fight enemies.
column8: 4) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 22-1-2009(5): Times are tough. And since _Pinocchio_ is made from _bamboo_ , his master sells him to the disposable bamboo **chopsticks** factory.
column9: 5) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 8-12-2011(3): In the Japanese version of _Chucky_ , his preferred method of killing is with _bamboo_ **chopsticks**.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 9-10-2007(170): Before giving your **SIGNATURE** to accept the LOVEDOLL, you should EYE over the LOVEDOLL for any damages, then give your **SIGNATURE**.
column6: 2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 30-6-2009(50): The _ninja_ 's **signature** move was to paralyse people just by looking in their _eyes_.
column7: 3) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(29): Someone _looking askance_ at my _love doll's_ **signature** on a waiver of liablility…
column8: 4) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 22-9-2006(29): [signature, govt office, police station] **Signature**? Forget it! Retina scanners (using our _eyes_ as **signature** ) will empower governments to find _someone_ in any _soil_ , any _day_ , rendering all of us like _puppets_!
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 29-7-2006(22): The character also means "public-service office or station" (tax office, police station, …). I'll use this to distinguish the kanji from other keywords like "inscription" that suggest a written name. Here I have a public-service station where residents can get a new **signature** , in calligraphy form. There are two sizes : big and small. The big one is made by the _cyclops_ , and the small one by the _puppet_. So that's where you find this unlikely duo: at the **signature** public-service station.

column3: The key word refers to the heat of summer. Its elements: _sun_ . . . _puppet_.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(178): Ahh, a fine **sultry** day with my _love doll_ under the hot _sun_. I think she's getting a tan!
column6: 2) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 5-11-2007(71): [from decamer0n] This is the kanji for atsui ( 暑い ) as in hot. If you've ever been in Japan in the summer no doubt you have heard hoards of people bellowing "Atsui! Atsui!" Here you are laying with your _love doll_ under the hot _sun._ Luckily the manufacturers were smart and when the doll got to hot it would bellow "Atsui! It's so **sultry**!".
column7: 3) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 24-5-2009(48): Ever wonder why _ninjas_ only operate at night? It's to avoid the **sultry** _sun_ of course!
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 3-12-2008(18): You make a _voodoo doll_ in your own image and set it down under the _sun_ , on a deserted tropical island so you can feel the benefits of **sultry** weather all year round.
column9: 5) [[nebusoku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nebusoku)] 20-8-2009(8): On even the most **sultry** _day_ s, _Pinocchio_ can stand under the hot summer _sun_ and it doesn't bother him one bit because he's made of wood!

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 20-5-2007(161): Because i get tired of _saying_ the same old thing, I have lately been trying to use **various** terms of endearment to my _love doll_. I think she appreciates it too.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 16-1-2007(49): When you pull the string at the back of _Chucky_ , he will _say_ **various** things. "Hidey-ho! Ha ha ha!" "Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?" "I'm going to eat your liver, bitch!".
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 12-10-2008(41): The _love doll_ can say **various** _words_ such as " 気持ちいい " " 痛い " and "やめて!".
column8: 4) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 25-5-2008(35): A **ninja** must be able to cope with **various** situations- like reciting **word** for word what he overheard while spying. (see the ninja clinging to the roof and spying on a conversation, preparing to recite what he heard later).
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 17-5-2006(28): Imagine a wacky _variety_ show on TV (i.e. _talk_ show) where _puppets_ are invited to _talk_ about **various** topics. Here I use the expression "a _variety_ show" to remember the particular keyword, and also keep it distinct from [miscellaneous](../v4/562.html) (#562 雑).

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(152): My _love doll_ is made of special pheremone impregnated vinyl. Unfortunately, a _pack of wild dogs_ mistook her for a wild **boar** and tore her to pieces. Oh dear!
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-1-2007(56): (Image: a _pack of wild dogs_ chasing _Pinocchio_ who's trying to escape by riding on the back of a **boar**. See him bouncing around as they race along?).
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 25-5-2008(40): The **pack of wild dogs** attacked the **ninja** , but he turned into a wild **boar** and gutted them all. (see the ninja snapping his fingers, cloud of smoke, and turning into a giant **boar** ).
column8: 4) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 15-8-2007(28): **Boar** hunting has been quite popular but under pressure from PETA, the hunters had to replace the real **boar** with a mechanical puppet for the pack of dogs to catch.
column9: 5) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 20-1-2007(14): _Chucky_ is being chased through the long grass by a _pack of wild dogs_. He's looking behind him to see where they are until he runs smack into a **boar**. Now he had an angry swine to deal with… karma for being a murderer I guess.

column3: The **strand** referred to here is the stretch of land along a beach or shoreline. Its elements are: _water_ . . . _puppet_.
column5: 1) [[Talka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Talka)] 9-9-2007(161): I was **strand** ed on a desert island surrounded by water for hundreds of miles on end. I wasn't upset though - I had my love doll! What a great **strand** of sand to be **strand** ed on - just me and my love doll!
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(76): A lovely romantic walk on the **strand** , splashing in the _water_ with my _love doll_.
column7: 3) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 14-12-2007(31): The whale belches _Pinnochio_ out of the _water_ onto the **strand**.
column8: 4) [[akahige](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akahige)] 11-4-2009(21): There's a ninja here on this **strand** of beach. Can't see him hiding in the **water**? Can't see him hiding in the sand of the **strand**? Nope? He sees you, though…
column9: 5) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 1-12-2007(19): If _someone's_ **stranded** , I hope they have _water_.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(122): When we **gamble** at the _shell_ game, I always win against my _love doll_.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 12-1-2008(118): People who **gamble** compulsively are like puppets controlled by money.
column7: 3) [[Hyreia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyreia)] 5-4-2009(74): If you're worried about the drop above the sun, don't be: <http://forum.koohii.com/viewtopic.php?id=1576>.
column8: 4) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-3-2006(37): Lots of shells are lost by Pinocchio when he **gamble** s. He is a real poor **gamble** r because everytime he tries to bluff, his nose grows longer!
column9: 5) [[Corodon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Corodon)] 9-12-2008(34): Some **gamble** with _money_. _Ninja_ **gamble** with life and death.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 6-12-2006(296): A **gorge** is where God has cut into a _mountain_ with a pair of _scissors_. (synewave,6-10-2006) <http://www.travelblog.org/Photos/197361.html>.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 10-2-2007(29): A **gorge** is where God has cut into a _mountain_ with a pair of _scissors_. Nice pic mspertus!
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 1-1-2006(27): A kid cuts a **gorge** into a paper _mountain_ , with a pair of _scissors_.
column8: 4) [[shinyclef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shinyclef)] 26-5-2009(25): Etymology of right half = 夾 (Type 1 Phonetic) (be pressed between). Interesting? [gorge](../v4/1265.html) (#1265 峡) [cramped](../v4/1266.html) (#1266 狭) [sandwiched](../v4/1267.html) (#1267 挟). Very directly related to the meaning of these three kanji.
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 24-7-2008(16): For the radical on the right, I suggest using _zipper_ instead of _scissors_ (chosen by Heisig merely because it slighty looks like one), as I found it made this batch a walk in the park. What's more humorous than the image of a _mountain_ **gorge** that can be opened or closed at will with a _zipper_?

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 18-4-2008(271): In a **CRAMPED** space, a brave man holds off PACK OF WILD DOGS with only a pair of SCISSORS.
column6: 2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 23-9-2007(65): A _pack of wild dogs_ , waiting in a very **cramped** waiting room, to get their hair cut by _Edward Scissors Hands_ , who is very popular.
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 14-9-2007(57): It's far too _cramped_ on the train. You see that there is a guy with a _pack of wild dogs_ , held only by a ribbon. You saunter up to him, and as the train doors open, you casually snip the ribbon with your _scissors_. Sensing that they are free, the _pack of wild dogs_ spring into action and chase everyone on the car out, including their owner. A few people may get mangled, but hey, at least you're not so **cramped** anymore - in fact, you've got the whole car to yourself.
column8: 4) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 29-9-2006(22): Pack of wild dogs in a **cramped** little room waiting to get a haircut from the barber (who uses scissors).
column9: 5) [[shinyclef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shinyclef)] 26-5-2009(12): Etymology of right half = 夾 (Type 1 Phonetic) (be pressed between). Interesting? [gorge](../v4/1265.html) (#1265 峡) [cramped](../v4/1266.html) (#1266 狭) [sandwiched](../v4/1267.html) (#1267 挟). Very directly related to the meaning of these three kanji.

column3: _Fingers_ . . . _scissors_. Do not confuse with the kanji for _pinch_ (Frame 709).
column5: 1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-1-2008(241): 挟まる 【はさまる】 (v5r,vi) to get between, to be caught in, (P) Story: You know how in tokyo there are those really packed trains where train staff in gloves shove people in? Well imagine being **sandwiched** in so tight, that when the doors close, only your FINGERS are sticking out. The train staff have no choice… they must cut them off with SCISSORS =( snip snip..
column6: 2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 3-3-2010(134): Fingers **sandwiched** between a pair of scissors. Don't move or else!
column7: 3) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 21-12-2008(26): In Tokyo trains, they've got a problem with chikan, or old men who "accidently" molest women while being **sandwiched** against them on crowded trains. So now, Japan has hired Edward scissorhands to cut off the fingers of the offenders. Being **sandwiched** together is no excuse for chikan!
column8: 4) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 30-7-2007(17): (Being left-handed and always using right-handed scissors turned upside down) My _fingers_ **get caught/sandwiched** in _scissors'_ finger holes.
column9: 5) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-5-2007(9): Hannibal Lector cuts his victim's _fingers_ off with a pair of _scissors_ and then serves them to him **sandwiched** between two pieces of bread.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 23-11-2007(67): Your **cheeks** contain your jawbones, which are known as the " _scissors_ of the _head_.".
column6: 2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 26-11-2008(51): The Joker from Batman had his **cheek** s cut with scissors to give him that eternal smile. Now the Joker isn't right in the head.
column7: 3) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 18-2-2007(8): Imagine using _scissors_ to cut your **cheek** s off your _head_ キョウ ほお ほほ.
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 4-11-2012(3): She grabbed the _scissors_ and slashed at her assailant's _head_ and right through his **cheek** s.
column9: 5) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 4-6-2008(3): Scissors, head: Stories from the emergency room: 'A guy came in with _scissors_ stuck in his _head_. Said he wanted to trim the hair on his **cheeks**. It seemed more like he was practicing some kind of juggling trick.'.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-2-2007(222): _Maestro_ , coattails flapping wildly, is being **chase** d down the _road_ by his fans.
column6: 2) [[sleepyday](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sleepyday)] 26-10-2008(51): This Kanji reminds me of Nodame Cantabile. I just have to imagine Chiaki, our _maestro_ in training, getting **chase** d by Nodame down the _road_.
column7: 3) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 8-4-2007(50): _Maestro_ primative = _James Bond_. Here he gives **chase** down the _road_ to the bad guys. I'm thinking of the car **chase** in 'The Man with the Golden Gun' - NOT [pursue](../v4/539.html) (#539 逐). I think about 'Race N **Chase** ' (a scalextric type toy)…there were no pigs in 'Race N **Chase** ', only cars.
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 2-3-2011(33): I'm going to use Beyonce as the primitive meaning. She's a bit of a musical maestro herself AND she has an amazing butt, so all the bases are covered. Plus the radical looks like a 'B'! So this kanji is a pictograph of me **chasing** gorgeous _Beyonce_ down the _road_. Mmm, Beyonce! (drool). 追う おう run after, drive out, 追い付く おいつく overtake, catch up (with), 追放 ついほう banishment, exile, 追加 ついか supplement, addition.
column9: 5) [[jslindst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jslindst)] 6-3-2009(9): I use Bond for the Maestro (the primitive also resembles B). Here you see James _Bond_ being **chase** d on a road.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 7-11-2008(70): The _maestro_ lives on top of a **large hill** so that he can play music at over _ten_ decibels without anyone giving a damn.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 13-7-2010(19): **Note to those who have not got this far in the book:** This is the full kanji for the _Pinnacle_ primitive (i.e. only the left-hand version of the primitive). The full kanji for the _City Walls_ primitive is [city walls](../v4/2180.html) (#2180 邑). _Beyonce_ went for an invigorating walk up a **large hill** on a summer's afternoon. Since the grass was so lush and cool, she took off her sandals and immediately stepped on a used hypodermic _needle_. 岐 **阜** 県 ぎ **ふ** けん Gi **fu** Prefecture.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 7-6-2009(11): _James Bond_ is planning a surprise attack on the enemy. He's sitting on top of a hill, overlooking where he expects the enemy to go by. He checks the _hand of his watch (the needle)_ , noting that there are _ten_ seconds left before the enemy arrives.
column8: 4) [[Gaignun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Gaignun)] 11-4-2011(3): Ludwig van Beethoven, the famous and famously irascible _maestro_ , moves to the **largest hill** he can find in Vienna. At _10^10_ feet above sea level (a ridiculously impossible height), he can compose his _tenth_ symphony in peace. Unfortunately, death takes him before he completes it. Do not confuse with [hillock](../v4/1039.html) (#1039 塚) or [hill](../v4/1329.html) (#1329 丘).
column9: 5) [[abdwef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abdwef)] 8-2-2009(2): James Bond carefully balanced the **large hill** on top of the needle.

column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 19-9-2006(159): A _maestro_ in a large auditorium with high _ceilings_ is conducting his orchestra of **expert** musicians at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his _towel_ to wipe his brow.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(108): _Maestro_ is such as **expert** , he can conduct even with a _towel_ hanging from the ceiling in front of him.
column7: 3) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 14-5-2008(64): The maestro hangs the towel from the ceiling. He's not only a brilliant conductor but an **expert** in acoustics.
column8: 4) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 6-10-2006(43): _James Bond_ is an **expert** at wearing _one towel_. Think of all the shower scenes. I also think that there is at least _one_ **(s)expert** scene per Bond movie.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 21-9-2008(31): The _maestro_ is such an **expert** , he throws his _towel_ to the _ceiling_ , conducts the performance, catches it on its way down and wipes his brow.

column5: 1) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 6-3-2006(244): The **COMMANDER** is a military MAESTRO who never throws in the TOWEL.
column6: 2) [[tomtosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomtosh)] 16-1-2008(43): I like to recall **commander** in conjuntion with _expert._ Both are _maestros_ with _towels_ – however, there is no upper limit (no _ceiling_ ) to what a **commander** can achieve in comparison to a mere expert.
column7: 3) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 1-3-2006(42): The greatest of them all, **Commander** James Bond, 007. Here he is the _maestro_ of undressing women, removing the _towel_ from some bond girl. Of course the towel symbolises her last vestige of resistance.
column8: 4) [[dat5h](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dat5h)] 22-6-2009(26): Here we see _James Bond_ as the ultimate **Commander**. In fact you can see him **command- her** to take off that _towel_ and it just falls off without a second thought.
column9: 5) [[thelooseteeth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thelooseteeth)] 15-3-2009(12): _Beyonce_ make a controversial military **commander** as she goes into battle dressed only in a _towel_!

column3: By replacing the _maestro_ 's baton (the _drop_ ) with the roof of a _house_ , we have his equivalent in the institutional world of big government: the **bureaucrat**.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-1-2007(208): No one likes classical music anymore. Our _Maestro_ is here at _home_ without his baton sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a **bureaucrat**.
column6: 2) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 29-9-2007(67): **Bureaucrat** , def: The maestro without a baton, the one who orchestrates oppressive rules, regulations and taxes on every household.
column7: 3) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 27-9-2007(35): Life as 007 is quite dangerous. Ready for a new life, we see _James Bond_ trading in his gun so he can stay at _home_. Here he is sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a **bureaucrat**. [dingomick].
column8: 4) [[swiftman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/swiftman)] 28-7-2009(27): **Bureaucrat** = the letter "B" beneath the "roof" of the House of Representatives … writing legislation.
column9: 5) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 8-2-2009(12): Here we see _Bond_ sneaking into a **bureaucrat** 's _house_ , to steal the latest information from the Russian government. But he no longer has his gun….

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 1-6-2006(174): An excellent use of _wood_ is to make **coffin** s for _bureaucrat_ s.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 25-6-2007(154): The maestro at home was sick of being a _bureaucrat_ , so he got some _wood_ and built himself a **coffin** and got in.
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 6-11-2006(48): The _coffin_ must be constructed only of the wood of certain **trees**. It's the sort of rule that only a **bureaucrat** would come up with.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 21-1-2008(28): The _wooden_ cubicle is the _bureaucrat_ 's **coffin**.
column9: 5) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 20-3-2007(13): You can't even die for free these days. It's impossible to get a _wood_ **coffin** without a _bureaucratic_ muddle.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-2-2007(299): Japanese _bureaucrats_ send all their messages through an inter-office _bamboo_ **pipe** system.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 12-1-2008(100): "The Japanese internet is a series of bamboo **pipe** s" said one ignorant bureaucrat trying to draft Internet legislation.
column7: 3) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 7-9-2007(22): Contrary to popular belief, more bureaucrats smoke, you know what, with Bamboo **Pipe** s than any other social group. I imagine a dull salary man (as the japanese say) with a collection o **pipe** s at home.
column8: 4) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 18-8-2008(16): In Japan, _bureaucrats_ only smoke from _bamboo_ **pipes**. They're "too good" for cigarettes.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 4-4-2009(8): Japanese version of the board game CLUE: The _bureaucrat_ did it with the _bamboo_ **pipe** in the tatami room.

column3: The kindness and hard work of the ideal **father** is seen in this abbreviation of the _taskmaster_ that leaves off his rod or whip (the first stroke) and replaces it with the sweat of the **father's** brow (the two _drops_ at the top).
column5: 1) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 2-2-2008(214): Luke, I am your **father**. Darth Vader (really surprised nobody put this one up before: 2 laserswords).
column6: 2) [[sleepyday](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sleepyday)] 26-10-2008(59): Not to confuse anyone, but I think if you put your mind to it, you can see the image of a **father** here. The first two strokes take on the form of his eye brows, and the third and fourth stroke make up the nose and mustache.
column7: 3) [[alantin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alantin)] 21-6-2008(21): It is a pictograph of your dad tying his tie!
column8: 4) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 26-2-2009(15): My two gay **fathers**. The Sitcom (really surprised nobody put this one up before: 2 cockswords).
column9: 5) [[vengeorgeb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vengeorgeb)] 17-5-2009(13): Pictograph of **father**. <http://www.flickr.com/photos/97627349>@N00/19312460.

column3: _Father_ . . . _metal_. Note the stroke overlap between _father_ and _metal_.
column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(82): Your _father_ uses his legs to stop himself from being put in a _metal_ **cauldron**.
column6: 2) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 14-1-2008(37): Whilst on holiday, my _father_ was captured by cannibals and put in a _metal_ **cauldron**.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 12-12-2010(16): 釜飯 , 茶釜 , 釜茹で , 電気釜 , お釜 , [cauldron](../v4/2332.html) (#2332 釜) かま … Parts: 父 + 金 … Similars: 鬲[Unicode-0x9b32](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/39730) (#39730 鬲), 鼎 [tripod](../v4/2865.html) (#2865 鼎), 鍋 [pot](../v4/2757.html) (#2757 鍋) … Fun Fact: this is slang for butt, and because of that it has become the word for male homosexual/transvestites お釜 (Okama), Always hard to tell with these sorts of words, but it _seems_ matter of fact, and not loaded with hate. So, when you are making stories about lowering _fathers into metal_ **cauldron** s….
column8: 4) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 12-7-2010(12): _Father_ keeps his _gold_ in a **cauldron** (he's a leprechaun).
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(5): Picture some witches around their **cauldron**. They are making a magic brew to bring back their long-departed father. It works, kind of. The **cauldron** turns into their _father_ , but unfortunately it’s just a _metal_ statue of him (prob because the **cauldron** was made out of metal too).

column5: 1) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 6-9-2006(257): Even though your FATHER is an old man, he can't give up his party lifestyle. Once a week he still dons his cool TOP HAT (well, it was cool 40 years ago) and goes out on the town to **MINGLE** with the ladies. This is a pretty common thing in Japan, where old motherfuckers still think they can pick up 19 year old girls.
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 2-2-2008(51): Darth Vader tries to **mingle** with his troops. He even weares one of the helmets of the stromtroopers. (one of them laughs: white helmet, black suit. Darth Vader thereby slashes him in 2).
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 25-6-2007(41): My _father_ puts on a _top hat_ and tries to **mingle**.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(22): The _father_ of a poor family is trying to **mingle** with the high society, hoping to build up some good relations and maybe find some help. This is why he's wearing a very high class _top hat_.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 14-9-2007(18): _Father_ = _Bill Cosby_. Here, _Bill Cosby_ has put on his _top hat_ and is going to **mingle** with some old jazz legends, like he tends to do on his show.

column3: _Mingle_ . . . _power_. Note the distinct connotations that separate **merit** from _achievement_ (Frame 927).
column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 1-6-2006(284): _Mingling_ with the _powerful_ can bring you success, bypassing the need for any **merit**.
column6: 2) [[ashman63](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ashman63)] 17-6-2008(88): There is great **merit** in _mingling_ with the _power_ ful.
column7: 3) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 22-3-2009(22): Once again Heisig makes a keyword that doesn't make much sense. The real meaning is **effect** / **efficacy** (take your pick). My dad tried out both wearing a top hat and doing some body-building for his muscles to see which was more efficacious .
column8: 4) [[robertmyers](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/robertmyers)] 6-12-2011(15): Father explained to me that the top hat **merit** s attention because it signifies power…with the crowd that matters.
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 2-2-2008(14): I'm the only one that instead of [mangling… powerful] sees [six… メカ]? All muslims should visit the _Meca_ at least once in their lives, and many stop there. So, if anyone has visited the _Meca_ _six_ times, that has **merit**!!

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-3-2007(254): The people I had invited to the party were mingling quite well with one another, until they all suddenly started talking about the cars they own. Pretty soon the crowd divided itself into distinct, **contrast** ing crowds: rich snobs with fancy cars, soccer moms with minivans, and hippies with bicycles.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 1-6-2006(67): Our world of today, _cars_ _mingling_ on busy streets, is in stark **contrast** to the one of yesteryear, where it was people who would _mingle_ on the streets.
column7: 3) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 2-2-2008(40): So Darth Vader tried to mingle with the earthlings, wearing his top hat. People were willing to forget his suit, but the Deathstar parked next to the other cars. Its a big **contrast** you know.
column8: 4) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 26-10-2008(28): People _mingle_ at parties. In **contrast** , _cars mingle_ in traffic jams.
column9: 5) [[shakkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shakkun)] 15-6-2008(20): All the CARS MINGLING at the intersection ( 交差点 ）contrast sharply with each other - expensive porches next to old bombs, red next to green, huge SUVs towering over little Minis….

column5: 1) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 28-6-2012(209): The schools that accepted them were posted on a TREE, the students MINGLED around trying to find their names. (コオ）.
column6: 2) [[JetSetArnett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/JetSetArnett)] 12-3-2009(136): Note: this Kanji does _not_ mean **exam**. It means school. I find this keyword an choice odd as **school** by itself is not used elsewhere. **Exam** ples: 校長 is principal (lit. school chief), 中学校 is junior high school (lit. middle study/knowledge school).
column7: 3) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 31-12-2007(63): Ninja school **exam** : _Mingle_ with the _trees_. If the teacher can spot you, you fail.
column8: 4) [[akahige](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akahige)] 14-4-2009(40): Note: this Kanji does _not_ mean **exam**. It means school. I find this keyword an choice odd as **school** by itself is not used elsewhere. **Exam** ples: 校長 is principal (lit. school chief), 中学校 is junior high school (lit. middle study/knowledge school). To add to JetSetArnett's: at the _school_ , the **trees** outside are a popular place for the students to **mingle**.
column9: 5) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 5-12-2008(37): I " _WOOD MINGLE_ ", but I have an **exam**. Ha ha ha.

column3: _Mouth_ . . . _mending_. Note that the last stroke of _mouth_ and the first of _mending_ overlap.
column4: * As a primitive on the left, it is amended to something similar to _correct_ in place of _mending_. Its meaning remains _leg_ , but should be thought of as a _wooden leg_ in order to avoid confusion with other similar elements, namely _human legs_ , _animal legs_ , and _walking legs_.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 2-6-2007(218): Captain Ahab lost his **leg** to the great white whale's _mouth_ and had to _mend_ it with a peg **leg**.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 18-1-2008(86): I'll use my _mouth_ to _mend_ your **leg** , I'll kiss it all better :).
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-3-2006(18): Tip : best avoid the generic image of a human **leg** , and use that of a _wooden **leg**_. As a primitive, the image of a pirate can easily stand for the _wooden **leg**_. As for this kanji, I think James Heisig provided a story, which worked well enough for me.
column8: 4) [[zwarte_kat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zwarte_kat)] 12-2-2009(8): I'm gonna mend your mouth with my 3rd **leg** ,).
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 5-1-2010(5): I picture Seamus, the peg- **leg** sailor from Family Guy. He only has a _mouth_ and a bunch of _mended_ limbs.

column5: 1) [[akira](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akira)] 28-9-2007(97): You **stimulate** a person by giving him a kick.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-9-2007(90): _Mr T_ , ever the optimist, is trying to **stimulate** _Capt Ahab_ 's _wooden leg_ by rubbing it down. _Capt Ahab_ normally wouldn't let anyone do that, but he appreciates _Mr T_ 's **stimulat** ing conversation.
column7: 3) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 18-12-2007(62): I know a girl with a _wooden leg_ who is only sexually **stimulate** d when I chop it with an axe and call her my dirty little pirate.
column8: 4) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 17-10-2009(42): _Mr. T_ is such an incredible masseuse that he can even **stimulate** a _wooden leg_. "I pity the peg that don't feel like a leg!".
column9: 5) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 25-6-2007(28): _Mr. T_ **stimulate** s the hot pirate girl's _wooden leg_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(99): I felt a _finger_ on my _leg_ as someone tried to **nab** my wallet.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-6-2007(8): _Fingers_ **nab** s Davy Jone's _wooden leg_ : Argh! Bring me back me _leg_ , ya scurvy dog!
column7: 3) [[bej001](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bej001)] 12-12-2012(5): We almost **nab** bed the pirate. I had my FINGER on his WOODEN LEG.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 5-9-2011(3): 捉える =捕らえる, 捕捉 , 捉まえる =掴まえる=捕まえる=摑まえる,[nab](../v4/2260.html) (#2260 捉) ソク( 足 ), とらえる, つかまえる … Parts: 扌, 足 … Similars: つかまえる= 捕まえる [catch](../v4/1836.html) (#1836 捕), 捉まえる [nab](../v4/2260.html) (#2260 捉), 掴まえる [clutch](../v4/2249.html) (#2249 掴), … Story: Donovan Mc **Nabb** has fast _Legs_ (runs well) and slippery _Fingers_ (fumbles a lot).
column9: 5) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 22-9-2010(3): This kanji shows someone jumping to **nab** a pirate by his wooden leg with his fingers.

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 20-12-2007(200): You can step a **long-distance** if you have a _leg_ that's _gigantic_!
column6: 2) [[raseru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raseru)] 14-4-2008(117): You can step a **long-distance** if you have gigantic wooden legs (stilts).
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-9-2007(34): _Capt Ahab_ chases a _gigantic_ , one-eyed (if you take Moby Dick a bit more literally), monster over a very **long-distance**.
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 9-5-2007(33): Anything we might consider **long-distance** would be a truly _gigantic_ distance for someone with a _wooden leg_.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-3-2007(14): My ex- girlfriend suffered a car accident and had her leg amputated. Ever since the accident, she's been completely irrational. I had to break up with her, so I drove out a few states away and called her from a public phone. Naturally she flipped out, and out of nowhere came this _gigantic wooden leg_ aimed straight at the telephone booth. Thankfully I jumped out before the leg pulverized the phone booth, but good thing I broke up with her with a **long-distance** call instead of in person.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 17-4-2007(223): When pirates try to hide, it's always easy to find them. Their _wooden legs_ leave distinctive prints, showing where _each_ is hiding and the exact **path** he took.
column6: 2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 17-8-2006(98): I have a wooden leg for each type of **path**. One with a rubber stopper at the end for absorbing shocks on paved **path** s, and one with a wide foot to distribute weight better on mud **path** s.
column7: 3) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 19-8-2008(33): On the **path** to becoming a pirate, _each_ one must gain a _wooden leg_.
column8: 4) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 28-11-2008(13): _each_ _leg_ of the Tour-de-France race has its own **path**.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 28-3-2011(12): _Each_ person must walk their own **path** …even those with _wooden legs_. 道路 (どうろ) : road, highway, 海路 (うみじ) : sea route.

column5: 1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 21-4-2006(234): After the _rain_ the _path_ was covered with **dew**.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 23-1-2008(44): A lame Mountain **Dew** commercial: Someone is hiking on a _path_ , when the latest rock music begins to play and it starts _raining_ –to the extreme!!!!!!
column7: 3) [[Tzadeck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tzadeck)] 24-6-2009(33): The _path_ is always so wet with **dew** in the early hours that everyone assumes that it had _rained_.
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 20-12-2006(25): **Dew** forms on the _path_ least _weathered_.
column9: 5) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 15-11-2006(17): **Dew** becomes _rain_ from the _path_ of the gods. When the gods walk along their _path_ , **dew** drops shake loose and fall to the ground as _rain_.

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 14-12-2007(132): A turtle with a wooden leg needs to **hop** to get around.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-3-2007(115): A girl with a wooden leg always wanted to play **hop** scotch with the other girls, but every time she tried to **hop** she'd lose her balance and injure another girl. That's why the other girls make fun of her and see her presence as a portent to injury.
column7: 3) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(49): Captain Ahab's _peg leg_ is so sensitive to Moby Dick's presence that when Ahab starts **hop** ping around the deck, it _portends_ trouble.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 19-11-2007(26): Don't **hop**! Because it's a _portent_ that in the future you will have a _wooden leg_.
column9: 5) [[SimHuman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SimHuman)] 13-12-2009(24): Mario can **hop** on every turtle (Koopa) except Bowser. If he tries **hop** ping on Bowser, he'll end up with a peg leg.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(140): Well, there are weekdays [weekday](../v4/576.html) (#576 曜) and there are laundry days [laundry](../v4/577.html) (#577 濯), and on February 29th **leap** day, the manufacturer recommends servicing or replacing your _peg leg_ because they tend to wear out every 4 years.
column6: 2) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 19-4-2008(120): [Story for people following katsuo in making feathers+turkey a 'futon' primitive] If you're going to **leap** from a high place, better hope there's a _futon_ below – otherwise you're going to break your _leg_ at the very least…
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 31-8-2010(80): Tip: _feathers_ \+ _turkey_ : This combination of primitives appears six times in Heisig, so it's worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest " _futon_ " (your _futon_ is made from _turkey feathers_ ). REF: [weekday](../v4/576.html) (#576 曜) , [laundry](../v4/577.html) (#577 濯), _leap_ (FRAME 1285), [outstanding](../v4/2272.html) (#2272 擢), [twinkle](../v4/2534.html) (#2534 燿), [shimmering](../v4/2880.html) (#2880 耀). Story: I **leap** out of bed so fast that my _wooden leg_ gets left behind in the _futon_.
column8: 4) [[marydj](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/marydj)] 2-11-2007(41): The _turkey_ with a _peg leg_ is trying to **leap** across the canyon. He flaps his wings wildly and _feathers_ fly but he doesn't make it.
column9: 5) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 20-12-2006(30): I've always imagined a **leap** involving one leg instead of two, which would be a jump. Using your only good _leg_ for propulsion, not the _pegleg_ , you try to **leap** over the canyon. Even with the aid of _feathers_ , you fly like a _turkey_ and fall like stone. This is very Roadrunneresque.

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 11-4-2007(140): The pirate with the _wooden leg_ chased after the _parade float_ and was run over by the next one, leaving **tread** marks all over him and his leg.
column6: 2) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 19-12-2007(122): Pirates must **tread** carefully when walking on _parade floats_ , so as not to break through the weak plaster with their _wooden legs_.
column7: 3) [[Christoph](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christoph)] 14-2-2007(50): Did Jesus actually **tread** on water? or maybe his _wooden leg_ just allowed him to _float_.
column8: 4) [[zz_alex_zz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zz_alex_zz)] 18-2-2008(14): At our natsu-matsuri they fixed auto-powered moving _wooden leg_ s to the _parade float_. It looked like a big festival insect and it was all great until it started going crazy and began to **tread** on all the little Japanese kids… I can still hear them screaming in terror.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 31-3-2006(11): Note: I am playing on the meaning of the keyword in order to remember it through a more graphic image. Someone dressed like a pirate ( _wooden leg_ ) comes down from the pirate-themed _float_ (a vehicle in a carnival), to check the **tread** on the tyres. The actual keyword meaning is a verb (i.e. "to trample", "to carry through").

column3: The meaning of this character is virtually identical with that of the last frame. Be sure to come up with distinct connotations suggested by phrases in which each is commonly used. _Wooden leg_ . . . _water_ . . . _sun_.
column5: 1) [[trikatu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/trikatu)] 28-2-2007(219): You have to watch your **step** when moving your _leg_ on a _watery day_.
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-5-2007(80): So, we've walked on the moon, but it's going to take a pirate with a _wooden leg_ , with a huge supply of cooling _water_ to land on the _sun_ and take that "one small **step** for a man".
column7: 3) [[wazato](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wazato)] 5-11-2007(47): Use Floatingweed5's story, except, to remember the positioning of water and sun, picture the pirate pouring water into his mouth with a wagging tongue. How refreshing while doing his **step** aerobics.
column8: 4) [[Floatingweed5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Floatingweed5)] 10-10-2007(44): The peg leg pirate, wanting to get fit, signs up for some **step** aerobic classes. Here is is clutching his bottle of water and **step** ping up and down from his **step** platform in the island sunshine.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 23-11-2008(36): This is better remembered as "step on" or trample. I picture a puddle of water with the sun reflected in it (to get the water above sun positioning), then you **step** on the puddle with your foot to trample the image.

column3: _Wooden leg_ . . . _religion_. The key word refers to a **trail** of footprints or tracks left behind.
column5: 1) [[fightswumbrellas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fightswumbrellas)] 5-12-2009(36): Footprint: In the pirate(=leg) religion, footprints are important because they lead to treasure.
column6: 2) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 24-12-2010(24): The **trail** of the _wooden leg religion_ was very easy to follow, since all its followers have wooden legs.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 25-3-2011(17): **Footprint** : You can actually tell a pirates _religion_ by the shape of their **footprint**. Catholic pirates have crucifix shaped peg legs, jewish ones have david's star, and muslim ones have crescent moon and star peg legs. PS Is anyone else finding all of the supplement keywords to be really poorly chosen?
column8: 4) [[Phlail](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Phlail)] 1-9-2012(11): Note: If you are using the 6th edition of RTK, the keywords (person…soil…compass…taskmaster) are completely wrong! The key words are _leg_ … _religion_.
column9: 5) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 21-10-2010(9): The disappearance 失踪 しっそう of the pirate, leaving nothing but footprints and a _wooden leg_ , inspired a strange new _religion_ about Bluebeard's resurrection and ascension.

column3: This kanji and primitive refers to the _part of the body_ composed of the bones and their joints. The top part of the kanji, terminating in the element for _crown_ , is a pictograph of a bone joint. I leave it to you to put the pieces together, so to speak.
column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 1-6-2006(145): Your body _meat_ is attached to the _bone joints_ of your **skeleton**.
column6: 2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 27-11-2009(105): The top box 口 is the skull and the brain 田 has shriveled to the size of marble (but following kanji convention it is depicted as a square) and rolled into the bottom right hand corner. With all the hair and flesh gone the crown has slipped down to the shoulders like a necklace. 月 represents the rest of the body of the **skeleton**. [Idea for position of crown thanks to n1williams].
column7: 3) [[Medialis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Medialis)] 23-3-2010(44): The most awesome pictograph ever: It's a guy going through an x-ray examination. The crown primitive depicts a glowing power field that goes from the top of this head down to the floor, progressively revealing his _skeleton_. Now, it's at the position of his shoulders, so everything below it is still _flesh_.
column8: 4) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 5-3-2009(25): Imagine a king who died on his throne and was never removed. Since his **SKELETON** has no hair, ears, etc, the CROWN has slipped down past several bone JOINTS and rests amid other PARTS OF his BODY.
column9: 5) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 26-6-2007(22): Imagine a **skeleton** wearing a _crown_ and with _flesh_ on just its _bone joints_. What a strange **skeleton** …

column5: 1) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 3-11-2006(265): Don't give _water_ to a _skeleton_. When he drinks it, it'll sluice right through his bones, forcing you to put one of those "Caution - **Slippery** Floor" signs up on the resultant puddle.
column6: 2) [[Ramchip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ramchip)] 10-6-2008(98): **Slippery** surfaces are very dangerous for skeletons, since their bone feet slip easily… a few drops of water, and zweep! A large mess of bones to pick up and reassemble!
column7: 3) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 19-5-2008(23): Caution: Skeletons in these waters indicate someone didn't abide by the "slippery when wet" sign.
column8: 4) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 17-6-2010(15): _WET SKELETONS_ are notoriously **SLIPPERY**.
column9: 5) [[Captain+Kanjipants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Captain+Kanjipants)] 27-2-2010(13): Most **slippery** when wet signs show a picture of _water_ to caution you. This one goes a little far by showing a _skeleton_ laying in the middle of a pool of water.

column5: 1) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 30-7-2007(300): A _skeleton_ is shuffling along the shoulder of the road, so you pull up next to him and ask where he is going. He says he's going to donate his **marrow** to the hospital because he got into some financial trouble and lost everything, his **marrow** is the only thing he still _possesses_.
column6: 2) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 16-7-2007(25): Did you know there are road ways in skeleton? Yeah, they are cool, they possess **marrow**.
column7: 3) [[karmatheif](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/karmatheif)] 5-3-2009(16): Why didn't the _skeleton_ cross the _road_? Cause he didn't have ( _possess_ ) any guts (or **marrow** for that matter…) RTK2: ズイ 脳髄 のうずい(the brains)….
column8: 4) [[Monkeys_Spiders](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Monkeys_Spiders)] 13-2-2012(15): Pictograph: A skeleton walking along the sidewalk trips over breaking his arm and spills his only possession over the road, his precious **marrow**.
column9: 5) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 18-1-2008(10): A **marrow** transplant is needed, the _skeleton_ _possesses_ the **marrow** needed to ensure a fast _road_ to recovery.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-3-2007(157): Continued from [auspicious](../v4/1088.html) (#1088 祥). Once a year, the people pray for a sign from the gods. But if the gods are feeling particularly mischievous, they'll send down a _jawbone_ to the _altar_. The people see this as a sign of **calamity** to come. The gods think of it as an amusing prank.
column6: 2) [[Rivvie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rivvie)] 4-6-2008(71): Truely a **calamity** for an undead wedding, just as he may kiss the bride at the _altar_ , he loses his _jawbone_.
column7: 3) [[Rooboy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rooboy)] 30-3-2009(42): Bit of a **calamity** at the wedding. The bride tripped and broke her _jawbone_ on the _altar_. Funniest home vids here we come.
column8: 4) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 6-12-2007(19): Well, for Jawbone I think of Samson and his JAWBONE of an ass. So, Samson caused great **CALAMITY** at the Philistine ALTAR when he attack the priesthood with that JAWBONE of an ass.
column9: 5) [[gopineapples](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gopineapples)] 1-7-2009(10): The pope fell at the ALTAR and smashed his JAWBONE. Wine and blood everywhere. What a **calamity**!

column5: 1) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 16-7-2007(274): Grampa's flushing the toilet, when his denture (Jawbone) pops out and gets sucked down the **whirlpool**!
column6: 2) [[adhmm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adhmm)] 22-5-2008(93): A **whirlpool** is water opening its jaws to swallow anything whole.
column7: 3) [[akimoto](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akimoto)] 28-2-2007(35): Jaws, the shark, sitting at the bottom of the **whirlpool** waiting for victims.
column8: 4) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 1-3-2006(20): A **whirlpool** of _water_ in your _jaw bone_ as you rinse your mouth after brushing your teeth (gara gara pe!).
column9: 5) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 12-5-2007(15): Charybdis (from "The Odyssey") opens her _jawbones_ and creates a _watery_ **whirlpool**.

column5: 1) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 24-6-2009(74): A _metall_ **pot** with non-thermoconductive _jawbones_ as handholds.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 28-5-2007(31): A gruesome kind of cauldron that Snape might have used is a _metal_ **pot** in the shape of a _skull_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(20): A _jawbone_ is thrown in a _metal_ **pot** to make bone soup.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-7-2007(8): Back before _metal_ , people used other people's _jawbones_ for **pot** s.
column9: 5) [[einahpets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/einahpets)] 27-2-2012(7): A _metal_ **なべ** full of _jawbones_ for dinner? No thanks…

column5: 1) [[Talka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Talka)] 9-9-2007(256): Jaws XII~! Jaws strikes the highway! Man, they're really **overdo** ing it now.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 4-9-2006(180): In 'American History X' Edward Norton's character **overdoes** it when he makes the dude that tried to steal his car lie face down with his _jawbone_ open over the pavement of the _roadway_ and then stamps on the back of his head. My teeth still tingle when I think of that!
column7: 3) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 16-7-2007(74): Grampa is in the old age marathon, but after a half mile on the road he is wheezing so hard he coughs up his dentures (Jawbone). Geez Grampa, don't **overdo** it man!
column8: 4) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 19-9-2007(23): To **pass the day** grandpa decided to throw his _jawbone_ (dentures) onto the _road_ , and then sue (す) the next car that came along and crushed them. I know he's bored, but that's just **overdo** ing it! NOTE: This kanji also means 'to pass the day'.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 6-11-2010(18): Don't **overdo** the running. Your _jawbone_ will be hanging open, as you puff and pant your way down the _road_. 過ぎる すぎる pass, exceed, be too ~~ , 過ごす すごす pass time, spend time or money, get through, 経過する けいかする pass, elapse, expire, 過程 かてい a process.

column3: This character is used for proper names, much as the English word " **Heights** " is. Its primitives: _pinnacle_ . . . _anti-_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(260): If you're scared of **Heights** , you don't want to stay at _The Pinnacle_ , you are _anti-_ _The Pinnacle_. Primitive: _The Pinnacle_ is a dream-like gated community at the top of a mount. This allows for innumerable stories for all the kanji with this primitive since you have a whole city to work with. Also prevents confusion with "mountain".
column6: 2) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 6-12-2007(47): People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka **Heights** , the _pinnacle_ of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with _Anti-_ Osaka **Heights** signs.
column7: 3) [[cefreddffo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cefreddffo)] 25-9-2009(23): This kanji is only used in names and in "Osaka". By chance, last week my japanese friend told me that it used to be 大坂 (as in "slope"), but Hideyoshi, the Taiko, didnt want to have anything to do with "land" (his ascendance were farmers…) so he replaced the "earth" for what we call "pinnacle". Its true. RTK2: ハン 阪神 はんしん(Osaka and Kobe)… MIXED GROUP: 反 722 坂 723 板 724 販 726 版 1213 飯 1473 (ﾍﾝ): 返 725 (ｶ): 仮 966.
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 17-5-2007(19): Just by changing the soil in [slope](../v4/723.html) (#723 坂) to a _pinnacle_ you get to the **Heights**. If only reaching the top of Everest were this easy…
column9: 5) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 23-9-2006(10): Hint: Try naming the primitive _pinnacle_ " _The Pinnacle_ ". Giving it a place name sort of sets the image firmly in mind. " _The Pinnacle_ " can then become a large facility set on a _pinnacle_ overlooking a city or valley or whatever of your choice. In this facility are many functions such as restaruants, sports areas, rooms, halls etc. which can eventually be used in forming kanji in the future.

column3: This kanji, an abbreviation for **Africa** , is now used chiefly for its sound, "a," not unlike the kanji for _Italy_ and the sound  "i" that we met earlier (Frame 1245). Its composite elements are: _pinnacles_ . . . _can_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(255): _Can_ you see **Africa** from _The Pinnacle_? I _can_! I _can_!
column6: 2) [[alreadytaken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alreadytaken)] 11-5-2008(79): A kinda pictogram: 'BoT', the first 3 letters in 'Botswana' an **Africa** n country.
column7: 3) [[saizen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saizen)] 26-8-2008(43): At the _pinnacle_ of the Mt. Kilmanjaro imagine Chaka Zulu (famous **Africa** n war commander) yelling at his troops, "are you an Afri-" _can_ " or an Afri"can't?!" To get the pumped up for the next battle.
column8: 4) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 18-4-2010(16): It B-can in Afrikakakakaka…
column9: 5) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 19-3-2008(10): You can see all of **Africa** if you can climb to its pinnacle, Kilimanjaro. "Can you see all of **Africa** now? Yes, I can.".

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 26-6-2007(194): On occasian, _rituals_ are held at the very tip of _The Pinnacle_.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 4-9-2006(68): Many _rituals_ are practiced every day (blessing before meals, evening prayer, etc.) Only the _peak_ _rituals_ (wedding, Bar Mitzvah, etc.) qualify to be called an **occasion**.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(36): The **international** _penis matsuri_ at _The Pinnacle_ is the biggest **occasion** of the year.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 21-2-2008(19): Wordplay (occastion->caucasian). _The Pinnacle_ is a whites-only community, and is a favorite place for white-supremacy _rituals_. The motto of the Pinnacle: "the best in caucasian **occasion** s".
column9: 5) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 22-1-2009(14): They usually do the A-ritual, but on a special **occasion** they do the B-ritual.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(177): The officer at the gate to _The Pinnacle_ with a giant _badge_ sewn to his chest **hinder** s all visitors. But not the **handicapped**. They're **hinder** ed enough already. They're given a _badge_ and can pass right into _The Pinnacle_.
column6: 2) [[Soseki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Soseki)] 27-2-2008(65): The _pinnacle_ of racism was that of the Nazis. They made the Jews wear a _badge_ on their clothes to identify them. They **hindered** their every movement. Moreover the peace-loving Dutch all wore the _badges_ so that the Jews would be unidentifiable. Effectively **hindering** the Nazi plot.
column7: 3) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 15-11-2008(50): At the **pinnacle** I was awarded a **badge** so big that it **hinder** s my movement.
column8: 4) [[nadiatims](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nadiatims)] 8-2-2008(15): Getting to the PINNACLE of mount fuji is full of **hinder** ances and you don't even get a BADGE at the top.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 24-4-2009(10): When you visit _The Pinnacle_ , they are so keen to make sure everyone knows who lives there and who's just visiting, so they force you to wear a massive _badge_ that reaches from your neck to your knees, and **hinders** your movement substantially.

column3: _Pinnacle_ . . . _little_ . . . _sun_ . . . _little_. Note that the form of the first element for _little_ given here is the simpler form that has become standard in general-use characters (See Frame 110). For the time being, until typesetting fonts have made the adjustment, the official approved drawing has the drops similar to the bottom _little_.
column5: 1) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 11-1-2009(68): They won't let me in _The Pinnacle_ , but I can see a _little_ bit of _sun_ through this _little_ **chink** in the wall. Hmm, maybe I could make this **chink** bigger…
column6: 2) [[steves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/steves)] 3-10-2007(46): There was only one **chink** in his plan. Even standing atop the highest _pinnacle_ , standing above even the _sun_ , the _little_ man was still just as _little_ as when he was under the sun.
column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 5-6-2007(18): Man those _little_ **chinks** can do anything! They were the first to build rockets, and by launching one off the top of the highest _pinnacle_ in China, one _little_ **chink** was the first to ride _above the sun_ , and see all the _little_ **chink** s below!
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 19-6-2007(4): In a wall at _The Pinnacle_ , there must be a **chink** in the wall because I see some _small_ rays of _sun_ light peepin' through, up there and down there.
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 16-9-2009(3): Daedalus, a talented craftsman, attempted to escape from his exile, where he and his son Icarus were imprisoned. Daedalus fashioned two pairs of wings out of wax and feathers for himself and his son (you can see them flying in the sky, they are very _small_ ) However, Icarus did not listen to his father warning and flew too high - even above the _sun_! The wax melted and the wings got **chink** s. The end of this old story? Icarus crashed onto the _pinnacles_ (small variation of the original story)…

column5: 1) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 25-10-2007(137): [Image: **Follow** the 'Yellow-Brick Road' to success] The _pinnacle_ signifies your personal goal and destination. What you're seeking to _possess_ lies at the end of the yellow-brick _road_. You must **follow** the road to get what you want.
column6: 2) [[pjhoover](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pjhoover)] 17-6-2008(82): This story is about lemmings. when the first takes a road that falls off a pinnacle, the rest **follow** as if possessed.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(72): I fled to _The Pinnacle_ for safety, but the _demon_ **follow** ed me right up the _road_!
column8: 4) [[b0ng0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/b0ng0)] 4-2-2009(51): Those who _possess_ a map of the _road_ to the _pinnacle_ are the best people to **follow**.
column9: 5) [[dimi3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dimi3)] 17-6-2009(24): You want to go to _The Pinnacle_? If you _possess_ a pass, **follow** this _road_.

column5: 1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 22-7-2007(169): In case of emergency, The Pinnacle has **auxiliary** guard dogs, but they keep them muzzeled until they're needed.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 18-1-2008(102): When you climb the _pinnacle_ you'll need to take a _muzzle_ of **auxiliary** oxygen.
column7: 3) [[Kieron](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kieron)] 31-3-2008(70): Make sure you've got the primitives and ordering down, so as to avoid confusion with 部 [section](../v4/1845.html) (#1845 部) later on.
column8: 4) [[unauthorized](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/unauthorized)] 5-12-2009(48): Hint: This is a very rarely used kanji and the only relatively common word that contain it is 陪審 「ばいしん」 (meaning jury, juryman). I recommend using one of these meanings as a keyword, since you are not going to see it anywhere else unless you intend to read historic novels. [Trivia: The other meaning of this kanji is something in the spirit of subordinate. Look it up on wwwjdic if you are curious.].
column9: 5) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 12-1-2008(28): When I see **auxiliary** I think of the "AUX" input on an amplifier. Imagine a PA system being used at a protest event outside the gates of _The Pinnacle_. The protester shouts into his PA system to get the attention of the decadent residents of The Pinnacle. The guardsman of The Pinnacle silences ( _muzzle_ s) the protester by unplugging his microphone from the **auxiliary** jack of his amplifier. (Similar scene in Forrest Gump).

column3: Different from the primitive for _sun_ (which figures in the character) and the kanji for _ray_ (Frame 125), the key word **sunshine** is meant to convey the meaning of the masculine principle in nature, or  "Yang." (The dark is viewed mythically as the feminine principle, see frame 1718.) From there it comes to mean _sun_ also. The elements are: _pinnacle_ . . . _piggy bank_.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-1-2006(191): A kid is perched on a _pinnacle_ with his _piggy bank_. He uses the coins to catch the **sunshine** , and redirect it into people's eyes, far below.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(77): _The Pinnacle_ is environmentally friendly. They collect **solar** power through **sunshine** on their _piggybank_ shaped solar arrays.
column7: 3) [[gibosi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gibosi)] 10-1-2007(65): At the Pinnacle, they use solar collectors, sun piggy banks, if you will, to capture the sunlight.
column8: 4) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 13-4-2008(30): Mario **SUNSHINE** : collect enough shines to fill the PIGGY-BANK and the **sunshine** will issue forth from THE PINNACLE of Isle Delphino.
column9: 5) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 19-3-2008(30): The pinnacle catches the **sunshine** like a piggy bank catches coins.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(167): Every morning at _The Pinnacle_ , the residents **line up** on the _East_ side for morning stretches and leisure.
column6: 2) [[kadano](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kadano)] 16-4-2009(62): Hikers **line up** to get to the top of that great _pinnacle_ of the _East_ … Mount Fuji. Seriously, they really do! …probably the only mountain in the world with a queue at the top.
column7: 3) [[snallygaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snallygaster)] 26-2-2008(25): Modified dingomick's: Every morning _the pinnacle_ 's workers **line up** on the _East_ side for inspection by the pinnacle's boss.
column8: 4) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 14-3-2008(21): At the _pinnacle_ of your studies, you'll be able to exhibit your knowledge of the kanji : these characters from the _east_.
column9: 5) [[typosensei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/typosensei)] 18-3-2010(16): This is not "people in a line". This is "a **line up** " like a **line up** of shows or performers. @gavmck At The Pinnacle they are having an exhibition of Oriental art where you can see all kinds of amazing artifacts lined up.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(207): A giant compass is _The Pinnacle_ 's self- **defense** system. It points in the direction of any invaders so the city is prepared well ahead to **ward off** the intruders.
column6: 2) [[Johan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johan)] 28-4-2006(68): To **ward off** enemies, the ancient Greece kept watch from the _Acropolis_ , where they had a clear view in all _directions_.
column7: 3) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 28-5-2009(58): On the _pinnacle_ you can see in every _direction_ and can **ward off** attacks or invasions.
column8: 4) [[ivoSF](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivoSF)] 26-9-2006(11): In the anime naruto, Neji Hyuga uses 2 techniques Byakugan and the Hakkeshō Kaiten to ward of any atack from any direction, the pinnacle of warding off.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 5-12-2008(8): _The Pinnacle_ hotel employs cutting-edge technology to **ward off** spirits. They even have detectors that can tell you which _direction_ the spirits are coming from.

column5: 1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 12-6-2006(153): A sign was **AFFIXED** on the PINNACLE of the Acropolis so that tourists would ADHERE to the rules.
column6: 2) [[xentropic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xentropic)] 27-7-2008(68): Signs are **affixed** to walls in _The Pinnacle_ to ensure tourists _adhere_ to the rules.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(60): _The Pinnacle_ is firmly **affixed** to the top of the mount with _bubble gum_. ([adhere](../v4/1000.html) (#1000 付)).
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 1-6-2009(14): At _The Pinnacle_ , they use the best quality glue to make sure things _adhere_ properly. If you see a sign _adhered_ to the wall of _The Pinnacle_ , don't bother trying to steal it - it's firmly **affixed**.
column9: 5) [[haole](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/haole)] 15-2-2010(10): Being **affixed** is really the _pinnacle_ of _adherence_.

column3: This key word, the abbreviation for **Institution** , represents the use of that word as a suffix affixed to certain buildings and organizations. Its primitive elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _perfect_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(163): The **Institution** of _The Pinnacle_ is _perfect_ in every way. It is the new House of God, his chosen city.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 22-2-2008(79): To reach the _pinnacle_ of kanji _perfect_ you need to attend the Heisig **Inst.**
column7: 3) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(28): The **Inst.** of Kanji.Koohii. It's where we all try to get to the _pinnacle_ of Japanese by _perfecting_ our kanji writing skills.
column8: 4) [[kanjiknight](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjiknight)] 15-1-2009(18): The Astronomical **Inst.** at _The Pinnacle_ is the _perfect_ **institute** to study stars as nothing blocks the view at that height. 病院 びょういん hospital.
column9: 5) [[kodama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodama)] 16-10-2007(17): The _Acropolis_ is the _perfect_ place for an **Institute** to study Ancient Greece.

column5: 1) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 29-9-2007(155): Paparazzi make **camp** outside of _The Pinnacle_ in their _cars_ , waiting for the celebs to come out.
column6: 2) [[Hinode](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hinode)] 11-2-2009(117): Note: This kanji is most often used in a military context. Story: Here we see an en **camp** ment of military _vehicles_ laying siege to _The Pinnacle_. With other countries being envious of the perfect life they lead there that makes sense. Fortunately, the pinnacle knows how to [ward off](../v4/1302.html) (#1302 防) enemies.
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 3-5-2007(45): At the **pinnacle** of Mt. Everest, you can _camp_ , but you cannot find a parking place for your **car**!
column8: 4) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 27-5-2008(5): My grandparents think the **pinnacle of cars** is to have an RV **camp** er- they go everywhere in one.
column9: 5) [[tritonxg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tritonxg)] 11-3-2010(4): [FR] **campement** N1 **JIN** k &k:1404 _pinacle+véhicule_ **campement de gitans :** ils ont porté au PINACLE ce mode de vie dans un VEHICULE appelé roulotte 陣形 【じんけい】military formation 本陣 【ほんじん】troop headquarters 陣地 【じんち】position 布陣 【ふじん】battle formation 退陣 【たいじん】retreat 先陣 【せんじん】vanguard 陣立て 【じんだて】battle formation 軍陣 【ぐんじん】battlefield 堅陣 【けんじん】stronghold 陣営 【じんえい】camp.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-1-2007(171): Every **regiment** of _The Pinnacle_ 's army is lead by a _Miss Piggy_ with a _viking_ helmet on.
column6: 2) [[Hinode](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hinode)] 11-2-2009(57): Every **regiment** of _The Pinnacle_ 's army has an animal name. This **regiment** is called " _Horned Pig_ **Regiment** ". They're wearing Wiking helms and are usually cowered in mud.
column7: 3) [[tomtosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomtosh)] 16-1-2008(22): As the only female in her police **regiment** , Officer _Pinnacle_ often endures sexist remarks from the _horn_ y male _pigs_ she has to work with.
column8: 4) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 12-10-2009(13): After fleeing from _horny_ _miss piggy_ who tried to [consummate](../v4/540.html) (#540 遂), Kermit is now sitting on the _pinnacle_. But not for long, because Miss Piggy and her **regiment** are launching their assault!
column9: 5) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 6-12-2007(7): Here we have a Pinnacle full of Horny Piggies to mean **REGIMENT**. Well, just the elements and shape give it away. The very lurid details that don’t need to be mentioned are always involved with **REGIMENT** S. They work very hard to get to the Pinnacle to get the high land and on the way, they act as though they are just Horny Piggies that rape and take away everything.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 7-11-2006(178): One of the members of our air force _regiment_ has been shot down, he managed to safely eject, but his plane **crash** ed into the _ground_.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 28-12-2007(46): The _regiment_ led by horny Miss Piggy wearing a viking helmet accidently falls off _The Pinnacle_ and **crash** es into the _ground_ below. // old story with wrong meaning of regiment: Kermit is so frustrated with horny Miss Piggy's _regimented_ sex schedule, he throws her off The Pinnacle and she **crash** es into the _ground_.
column7: 3) [[Pangolin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pangolin)] 31-1-2009(26): Horn- helmeted Miss Piggy and her _regiment_ of Valkyries really believed they could fly just like real Valkyries (yeah, and pigs might fly) so they launched themselves from the parapet of The _Pinnacle_. Of course they **crash** ed to the ground ( _soil_ ).
column8: 4) [[unicornpuddlefoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/unicornpuddlefoot)] 23-2-2009(15): The parachute regiment **crash** ed to the ground.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 25-2-2012(11): The Airborne _regiment_ hit the _ground_ in a **crash**.

column3: _Pinnacle_ . . . _walking legs_ . . . _sunglasses with a lens popped out_. Distinguish from _fall_ (Frame 320) and _crash_ , which we considered in the previous frame.
column5: 1) [[wingedge](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wingedge)] 22-12-2007(207): "Sunglasses-missing-one-lens" is obviously the _monocle_. The proper, high- class way to **descend** _The Pinnacle_ is wearing a _monocle_ with your _walking legs_ splayed to a full gentlemanly stride.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-5-2007(33): After a cool, hip businessman angered the executives at _The Pinnacle_ , they beat him up, popping out a lens from his _sunglasses_ , and tossed out the window, head first, _walking legs_ second. One executive later commented, "It was like he was **descend** ing into Hell from Heaven!".
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-1-2007(27): To **descend** from _The Pinnacle_ you must _walk_ down the stairs with your sunglasses-missing-one-lense on.
column8: 4) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 27-8-2008(18): Used in 降りる 【おりる】（to alight or get off - e.g. from a bus).
