So here we have a tour bus arriving at the _acropolis_ : Everyone **descends** from the bus, stretches their _walking legs_ and puts on their _monocles_. (EDIT: fixed up primitives).
column9: 5) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 24-1-2008(16): A Yakuza member **descend** ing down from the _pinnacle_ with limping _walking legs_ and a lens from his _sunglasses_ missing. He tried to break into the resort but the security threw him out.

column3: The **story** of this character refers to floors in a building. The elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _all_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(205): _All_ buildings of _The Pinnacle_ are multi- **storey**. They don't have much room, so they have to build up. It sucks when someone presses _all_ the buttons on the elevator! You have to stop at each **storey**!
column6: 2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 25-2-2008(81): Some stupid kid has pushed _all_ the buttons in the elevator. As it stops at _all_ **storey** s you reach a _pinnacle_ of impatience. Finally you reach your **storey** , the last one, at the _pinnacle_ of the building.
column7: 3) [[b0ng0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/b0ng0)] 4-2-2009(42): The _pinnacle_ of a building is the sum of _all_ the **storey** s.
column8: 4) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 14-12-2006(11): The second **storey** of the acropolis is the Laundrymopolis, where the elite Greeks meet to compare the whiteness of their sheets.
column9: 5) [[Jaunty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Jaunty)] 7-8-2009(9): You're taking the elevator up to the _pinnacle_ , and someone presses _all_ the buttons, making _everyone_ wait while it stops at every **storey** (thanks dingomick).

column3: This key word indicates a title of address to royalty. Its elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _compare_ . . . _ground_.
column5: 1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 6-9-2006(196): Your **highness** is the _pinnacle_ of finesse _compared_ to all of us commoners who are but like _dirt_ on the _ground_.
column6: 2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 30-3-2008(113): His **Highness** , the main man at the Pinnacle, often compares those who live outside the city's walls to dirt.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(33): One of the many talents of the **highness** of _The Pinnacle_ is his astounding knowledge of _soils_. He can _compare_ any two _soil_ samples brought to him.
column8: 4) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 10-10-2007(9): We search high (pinnacle) and low(ground), and nothing compares to your **highness**!
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 13-10-2008(5): "You're nothing but _dirt_ when _compared_ to me" said His **Highness** of _The Pinnacle_.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 26-5-2007(229): _America_ thinks it is the _pinnacle_ of the world, looking down on all **neighboring** countries through its mirrored, aviator _sunglasses_.
column6: 2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 30-3-2008(184): All the **neighboring** communities to the Pinnacle have a major problem. The kids at the Pinnacle have a habit of throwing down rice from the city walls in all directions, so people in **neighboring** communities are forced to wear sunglasses all the time in order to avoid getting rice in their eyes.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(55): Tip: _rice_ \+ _sunglasses_ : In RTK3 Heisig names this combination " _shoeshine_ ". It also appears in: [sympathize with](../v4/2051.html) (#2051 憐), [phosphorus](../v4/2052.html) (#2052 燐), [camelopard](../v4/2053.html) (#2053 麟), [scaled](../v4/2054.html) (#2054 鱗). Story: You visit the _Acropolis_ and are amazed to see the guy from your **neighboring** house back home working there as a _shoeshiner_.
column8: 4) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 23-4-2009(32): Tom Cruise ( _American_ with _sunglasses_ ) tried to get admitted to _The Pinnacle_ but, with all the weird press, he was rejected and so now lives in a **neighboring** Scientology exclusive gated community.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(19): _The Pinnacle_ 's **neighboring** mount is a place where they grow rice. They wear _sunglasses_ since it's the sun's glare is so strong there.

column3: _Pinnacle_ . . . _ceiling_ . . . _mouth_ . . . _glass canopy_ . . . _human legs_ . . . _spike_. You might want to compare the kanji for _dissolve_ (Frame 1123).
column5: 1) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 5-3-2008(113): _The Pinnacle_ , to me, is a city that makes itself out to be perfect but is filled with dirty secrets that photographers are always trying to reveal (see [dissolve](../v4/1044.html) (#1044 融) The city's councilmen have **isolate** d all professional photographers to make sure they don't photograph these "dirty secrets". (which are up to your imagination).
column6: 2) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 24-10-2007(97): The people of the _pinnacle_ **isolate** themselves, _dissolving_ any outside friendships.
column7: 3) [[playadom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/playadom)] 20-6-2008(77): Sadly, since the Pinnacle is **isolate** d, they have no modern technology. Their only means of photography is an old camera. What's that? Forgot how old cameras work? Let me show you: Light is captured through the lens (one mouth), the photographer is in a giant hood, all you can see out of it are his human legs. He holds his flash controller(a spike) in hand.
column8: 4) [[shimouma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shimouma)] 23-6-2008(21): Imagine the landscape photographer, like Ansel Adams, **isolate** d and alone at the pinancle taking pictures with his camera. (See zenkun's story for (FRAME 1044) dissolve).
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 6-10-2009(18): Do you remember the poor insect in [dissolve](../v4/1044.html) (#1044 融)? Actually, it was not dissolved - it was beamed right into the _pinnacle_ prison for committing the crime of disturbing a _photographer preparing for a snapshot_ and now lives **isolate** d until the end of its three days long life… (note: 隔てる (へだてる) also means to **disturb ones view** ).

column3: _Pinnacle_ . . . _vulture_ . . . _broom_ . . . _heart_. Compare the element sat the right to the kanji for _calm_ (Frame 1230).
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(168): The wheat farmer's _heart_ is [calm](../v4/1147.html) (#1147 穏) about the _eagle_ not stealing his crops because of the _broom_ scarecrow. But he still **conceal** s all his wheat at _The Pinnacle_ in case anyone else trys to steal it.
column6: 2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 11-1-2008(85): Move the _broom with a vulture perched on top_ , and you'll find the **concealed** entrance to the _heart_ of _The Pinnacle_.
column7: 3) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 24-10-2007(24): People of the _pinnacle_ learned to **conceal** their nature with _calm_ demeanors, though in their _hearts_ they are _vultures_ and _witches_ (broom).
column8: 4) [[etpan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/etpan)] 18-1-2009(14): Kiki is back on her _broom_ , she's being chased by _vultures_ and she's trying to **conceal** herself. Her _heart_ is still pounding, but instead of landing in a corn field, she decides to fly up to the pinnacle of the city.
column9: 5) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 20-8-2008(9): Many treasures are **concealed** within the _acropolis_. Which is why it is guarded by _vultures perched on brooms_ , ready to peck out your _heart_ if you try to sneak in and steal them.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 26-9-2007(145): Any attempt to _possess_ the _pinnacle_ will **degenerate** into a land (" _ground_ ") war.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(102): A **degenerate** doctor at _The Pinnacle_ is doing illegal **abortions**. He's so sick he just throws the aborted fetuses onto the _ground_ far below. And like a _possess demon_ , he keeps some tied to his side on a belt as trophies.
column7: 3) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 11-1-2008(97): _The Pinnacle_ has **degenerated** into an group that just tries to _possess_ as much _soil_ as possible.
column8: 4) [[penot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penot)] 11-11-2008(60): The _**Pinnacle**_ of the Roman Empire (as with many other empires since) **degenerated** as they just tried to _**possess**_ more  & more _**land**_. " like . . . . . . duh!(' **ダ** ') " // お.ちる / ダ duo4 타 (ta) 휴 (hyu).
column9: 5) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(16): _The Pinnacle_ _possess_ es class and sophistication. By contrast, the land ( _soil_ ) below is **degenerate** , and unrefined.

column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 19-9-2007(223): _The Pinnacle_ is actually _bound up_ by supports from _olden times_. Eventually, they give out, and the whole thing starts to **collapse**.
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 19-12-2007(91): _The Pinnacle_ is supported by pilings which were _bound up_ in _olden times_. One day when the bindings rot away, the whole thing will **collapse**. (tweaking dihutensoa's story to work a little better for me).
column7: 3) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 6-8-2008(40): At the pinnacle of any society's development, being overly bound to rules from olden times leads to **collapse** (see Jared Diamond's **Collapse** ).
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 24-1-2008(24): The adventurers reached the _pinnacle_ , and claimed the artefact which had been _bound up_ since _olden times_ : the _staff_ of the _Sun_ God. But as soon as they removed it, the place began to **collapse**! Will they make it out in time??
column9: 5) [[genevere](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genevere)] 25-4-2009(11): The **collapse** of the pinnacle society occurred after they were _bound up_ in _olden times_ beliefs and practices and thereby failed to progress.

column4: * As a primitive, this kanji uses an alternate form: the primitive for _eight_ is replaced with that for _human legs_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-8-2007(249): A black **hole** is a "House of Infinity". Infinity is of course represented by a sideways "8", but here we have a Japanese "8" instead.
column6: 2) [[zz_alex_zz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zz_alex_zz)] 19-2-2008(105): Billiards anyone? _House_ rules here state that the first person to pot the _eight_ ball into the **hole** wins the game.
column7: 3) [[montecristo73](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/montecristo73)] 20-7-2009(20): What good is it to buy a house with 8 **hole** s in the ceiling? (The kanji for 8 also looks like water flowing from the ceiling.).
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(15): I think of people playing on a mini golf course. One player is frustrated because the ball got stuck into a _house_ (a small building decoration), and ends up doing a "hole-in- _eight_ " instead of a **hole** -in-one.
column9: 5) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 19-5-2008(11): I came home one day to find that termites had _eight_ my entire _house_ … nothing but a **hole** left.

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 4-6-2006(132): The _craft_ of creating a _black hole_ is in creating an **emptiness** which can attract things.
column6: 2) [[Ameyama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ameyama)] 7-11-2007(76): Hole- craft is the way of making **empty** spaces, like the sky.
column7: 3) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 21-5-2010(50): The _craft_ of making donut _holes_ …..the middle of the donut is _empty_.
column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 28-7-2008(35): _Hole-craft_ is the _craft_ of making _holes_ that are filled with **emptiness** or vacuum ( 真空 (しんくう): vacuum). Normal holes appear to be **empty** , but are actually filled with air ( 空気 (くうき): air). 空港 (くうこう): airport 航空機 (こうくうき): aircraft 空 (そら): sky 空 (から): **empty** 空手 (からて): karate.
column9: 5) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 30-3-2008(16): HoleCraft, the new game from Blizzard, involves running around taking various items out of holes in the ground and bringing them back to your home base. The person with the most items after all the holes are **empty** wins. I'm already camping the game store for this release, can't wait. Been practicing by digging holes in my backyard, throwing various things in them and **empty** ing them as fast as I can.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 7-11-2006(317): With my _fingers_ , I punch in my bank code and **withdraw** some money from my account. And now it's _empty_ again, as usual!
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 12-12-2007(77): If you find yourself in a fight with a karate master with no weapons or martial art skills, just your _empty fingers_ , you should **withdraw** because 空手 (karate="empty hand") is more powerful than 控 (="empty fingers").
column7: 3) [[senorsmile](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/senorsmile)] 2-3-2008(22): **WITHDRAW** your FINGERS from the cookie jar if it is already EMPTY.
column8: 4) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 17-1-2007(20): As in Aesop's fable: the monkey puts its hand in a jar to get a piece of fruit, but now it can't pull its hand out. It will have to empty its fingers before it can **withdraw** its hand.
column9: 5) [[shang](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shang)] 1-6-2009(17): This is a bit of an odd keyword choice from Heisig. " **Withhold** " would work a lot better considering how this kanji is used. As in restrain/hold yourself back ( 控える ) or withhold/deduct taxes ( 控除 ) or withholding a spare/reserve copy ( 控え ).

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-5-2006(269): When you **stab** something you often leave a big hole.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 25-4-2007(55): The police have recruited a special breed of _St. Bernard_ that can lick the wounds of a **stab** bing victim. The bleeding will stop instantly, saving the victim's life. One quirky side-effect, however, is that this treatment leaves behind a rather large hole…
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 3-1-2007(28): I **stab** your annoying _St. Bernard_ and stare in shock at the giant black _hole_ it leaves instead of a wound.
column8: 4) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 24-5-2008(18): There's a hole in that Saint Bernard – somebody **stab** bed it.
column9: 5) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 14-5-2009(11): A big **stab** leaves a _big hole_.

column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 1-10-2006(281): Most **research** scientists have 9 holes…..two nostrils, two ears, a mouth, and four eyes…… :-).
column6: 2) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 13-3-2007(98): Scientiest are **research** ing , and have already found _nine_ black _holes_ !
column7: 3) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 15-1-2008(63): The manager is doing **research** to find the _holes_ in the opposing _baseball team_ 's strategy.
column8: 4) [[leecha2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/leecha2)] 30-7-2009(36): When I saw this kanji I had the instant image of scientists throwing a _baseball_ through a _hole_ and noting the 'results'. I found that quite hilarious, but well, maybe it's just me.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 30-11-2008(32): **Research** has shown that _9 holes_ of golf can help alleviate stress.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 1-7-2006(347): Sticking a **plug up** your hole will lead to stronger climaxes.
column6: 2) [[Captain+Kanjipants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Captain+Kanjipants)] 7-8-2011(187): I'm pretty sure Heisig wrote the whole book just so he could make this joke.
column7: 3) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 6-12-2007(102): Here we have a Hole and Climax to mean **PLUG UP**. This is so butt-f**king easy, pun intended. If you **PLUG UP** her Hole, she will Climax.
column8: 4) [[Danno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danno)] 22-7-2009(83): I just think its hilarious how many stories are getting reported for this character. Come on!! what else could it be! How better to remember it ? Prudes please get over yourselves. If someone has a good story, just because you are easily offended, doesn't mean someone else( the majority ) won't find it useful. planning to be missionaries in Japan with all your Kanji skillz ? If you find this offensive…hahahaha. You will get a shock when you see your first KONBINI magazine shelf.LMAO..i gotsreported.
column9: 5) [[penot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penot)] 11-11-2008(41): My girlfriend **plugs up** her **ちつ** (vagina 膣) _hole_ to _climax_! This Kanji's on-yomi is pronounced ' **ちつ** ' (チツ) // zhi4 질 (jil) 절 (jeol).

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-5-2006(184): This more commonly means "steal", like how a thief _cuts_ a _hole_ to steal the jewels.
column6: 2) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 14-4-2008(97): The word **STEALTH** makes me instantly think of Solid Snake, who CUTS a HOLE in a cardboard box so he can peer out of it.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 4-11-2007(66): **Stealth** bombers _cut holes_ through the enemy radar.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 16-11-2008(53): I picture a **stealth** y thief cutting a round hole in the glass window to quietly unlock it.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 19-9-2007(11): The new **stealth** bomber being developed by the US government is insane. Instead of flying under radar or disrupting it, it simply bypasses the whole thing. It _cuts_ a _black hole_ just above it with its nose, then disappears into it. Then it travels invisibly and instantly to its destination, then _cuts_ another _black hole_ into the sky and reappears. Only trouble is that they have to make sure not to enter or exit somewhere important - or they'll suck the whole place into the _black hole_.

column5: 1) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 28-5-2008(54): After Osama blew a _hole_ in NY, the counterreaction forced him to _yield_ and retreat into **caverns**.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-2-2007(23): In "The Empire Strikes Back", the Milennium Falcon flies into a large _hole_ , of what they think is a **cavern** , because they don't want to _yield_ to the forces of the Empire. Turns out it's not a **cavern** at all, actually…
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 20-12-2009(17): The entrance to the **cavern** tavern is little more than a _hole_ in the wall, but inside the place is such a maze of **cavern** s that they have to stick a _flag_ over the _exit_ or you'd never find your way out.
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 24-3-2013(8): It seemed to be just a _hole_ , but it did _yield_ a wondrous **cavern** of stalactites and stalagmites.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 13-1-2009(6): Remember when they found Saddam Hussein in a hole and he finally yielded and exited holding a white flag? Wish they'd have found Osama in his **cavern** instead..

column3: _Hole_ . . . _water_ . . . _ivy_. The **depression** referred to here is a sunken place in the ground, rather than in one's spirits.
column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-10-2006(245): A **depression** is a hole in the ground. Water naturally collects there which provides moisture for vines to grow.
column6: 2) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 30-3-2007(113): The **depression** in the ground become a trap: the _hole_ was filled with _water_ and covered with _ivy_.
column7: 3) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 29-8-2006(35): The meaning of this character is an indentation in the ground, not emotional **depression**. It's best to avoid using the latter in your story because it will give you the wrong meaning (keep in mind the eventual goal is to read kanji and understand the actual meaning of them). This particular **depression** is a _hole_ in the ground that collects water, and ivy is growing out of it.
column8: 4) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 24-6-2009(16): ( **WARNING** : Sexual content) Being the dirty girl that she is, I came upon _Paris Hilton_ having sex in a **depression** , or _hole_ , in the ground. At this point, however, she and her unfortunately partner were tangled up in some _ivy_ and couldn't get out. So I filled it with _water_ and watched them both drown.
column9: 5) [[coinbaahd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/coinbaahd)] 20-11-2011(7): This kanji reminds me of video games. There's a big _sink hole_ in the ground that is now filled with _water_ that you can swim in and _vines_ growing all around that you can climb on.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-4-2007(163): You have trouble squeezing your hand through the hole so you use a saw to enlarge it.
column6: 2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 27-3-2008(99): (Thanks DrJones) You **squeeze** the teats of the cow with your _fingers_ but it's your first try and you don't have any milk come through the _holes_ , so you take a _saw_ and cut the teats to make bigger _holes_. Poor cow, this story **squeeze** s my heart.
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 29-3-2008(94): Very simple visual image makes this an easy kanji to remember. Just picture that you **SQUEEZE** your FINGERS going through the HOLE in the handle of the SAW. You then **SQUEEZE** your FINGERS tight to use the SAW to cut a HOLE.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 22-9-2008(43): To **squeeze** is to hold something [tight](../v4/2614.html) (#2614 窄) in your _fingers_.
column9: 5) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 20-5-2009(29): Oh no! You cut a _hole_ in your _finger_ with a _saw_! **Squeeze** your _finger_ to stop the bleeding!!

column5: 1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 21-5-2007(374): Be sure to put a _hole_ in that ceramic _sheep_ before you put it over the _fire_. Otherwise, it'll just explode in the **kiln**. (If you've never done ceramics before, it's important that the object have a hole in it, or this really will happen.).
column6: 2) [[raseru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raseru)] 14-4-2008(34): You put the sheep in the hole of the **kiln** and turn on the flames.
column7: 3) [[kodorakun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodorakun)] 14-7-2009(19): True story: when I was a kid if there were lambs born in the winter we'd put them in a cardboard box and put them in the oven (on low!) to keep them warm. I guess this only really helps me out hehehe…
column8: 4) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 3-1-2008(13): Oh Boy! A craft project indeed! Thru the _hole_ in the top of the **kiln** , put in the _sheep_ you sculpted from clay. Turn on the _fire_ underneath and voila!
column9: 5) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 25-1-2008(11): I kept forgetting the _sheep_ in smithsonian's story, so just imagine the sound effects: "Baaa…" (bleating)/Baaam! (explosion).

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 21-9-2006(165): **Hard up** = nothing but your body, living in a hole, with just a bow to hunt for your food.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-8-2007(114): **Somebody** so **hard up** for cash, the volunteered to explore a _black hole_ with nothing but a _bow_.
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 16-3-2008(54): Ok, picture a HOLE (well, more a pit trap) that SOMEBODY (well, a hunter with a BOW) just fell in. He's dangling over the HOLE holding onto his BOW across it. SOMEBODY finds it's HARD to get UP out of the HOLE. That great visual image should grant mastery of this kanji.
column8: 4) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 4-6-2006(25): With the research to plug up a _black hole_ going nowhere and funding slashed, (see [research](../v4/1320.html) (#1320 究)), the team can not afford to launch any more probes due to the high cost of the fuel. _Somebody_ , probably one of the **hard up** scientists desperately in need of more funding, tries using a _bow_ to shoot a probe into the centre of the _block hole_ – and funnily enough it succeeds!
column9: 5) [[aaronvanvalen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aaronvanvalen)] 19-5-2009(22): A girl is so **hard up** for cash she lets _somebody_ use her _hole_ with a _bow_ , it's a fetish-thing I guess, makes the guy hard and up.

column5: 1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 20-2-2006(183): A pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting **grope** d by perverts on the train. The _fingers_ of course, a _crown_ (her too short skirt) and her _legs_ below (which to be honest are pretty thick like _tree_ trunks).
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-1-2012(121): Note: " _crown+human legs_ " appears 7 times in RTK. In 4 cases (nos. 323, 1327, 1328, 2920) _crown_ is above _human legs_ , and in the other 3 (1888, 2472, 2679) one leg passes through the crown. I call the 1st pattern " _Miss World_ " (who is wearing a _crown_ & has long _human legs_ ) and the 2nd " _garter_ " (one _human leg_ passes through the _crown_ wearing it as a _garter_ ). Story: _Miss World_ has climbed a _tree_ to avoid the _finger_ that was **groping** for her. ( 探 means "grope for", i.e. search).
column7: 3) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 31-5-2008(69): (based on gorgon's story) a pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting **grope** d by perverts on the train. The _fingers_ of course, a _crown_ (her too short skirt) and her _legs_ below. It's her own fault for wearing such a short skirt and causing the perverts to get _wood_!
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-12-2006(57): I don't know why, but this is a pictograph of someone groping about in the dark (with his fingers, obviously) for his beloved wooden paper punch.
column9: 5) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 17-1-2008(39): As esaulgd said, this kanji DOES NOT mean "touch" like [触る。](midori://search?text=触る。) Here is my story: Imagine a blind detective who must **GROPE** for answers in by reading old police reports. But because he is blind, he must use brail books, you know, the ones that have been PAPER PUNCHED on PAPER (wood). Naturally, he uses his FINGERS for this.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 12-9-2006(277): If the groper's _"tree"_ goes up the girl's _miniskirt_ too **deep** , he'll ejaculate _fluid_. (Sorry it's kinda coarse but it works.).
column6: 2) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 24-8-2007(69): Thrown in **deep** water, the Japanese School girl tries to reach a floating tree to save herself.
column7: 3) [[tenken3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tenken3)] 10-1-2008(33): Made a hole with a paper punch in a tree, so **deep** that water started flowing out.
column8: 4) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 18-3-2009(30): _Miss World_ (see Katsuo's note on [grope](../v4/1327.html) (#1327 探)) is now hiding on a _tree_ because now she is afraid of the **deep** _water_ below.
column9: 5) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 27-5-2007(24): The gardner finds _liquid_ oozing from a **deep** _paper punched_ hole in the _tree_.

column3: Since this supposedly pictographic representation of a hill looks like anything but, picture a row of _axes_ driven into the ground up to their heads, and see if that doesn't present a more memorable image of **hill** \- at least a riskier one sliding down!
column5: 1) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 18-2-2008(284): Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known AXCAHILLBUR is the _axe_ planted on top of a **hill**.
column6: 2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 31-10-2006(67): At Capitol **Hill** proposals get _axe_ d on the _floor_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-1-2006(24): This is Faeries **Hill** (the kingdom of faeries is said to live under the **hill** s, as in english myths) where a lumberjack mysteriously disappeared. At the top of the **hill** is an _axe_ planted in the _floor_ , left there by the faeries as a warning to anyone else who would be fool enough to go up the **hill** to gather wood.
column8: 4) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(19): I climbed to the top of a **hill** but didn't have a flag so I stuck my _axe_ in the _ground_ in order to mark my momentous ascent.
column9: 5) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 6-4-2008(14): I like to c- **hill** - _ax_ on the _floor_.

column3: Think of the key word as referring to proper names of mountains, but do not confuse with _mountain pass_ (Frame 835). The elements are: _hill_ . . . _mountain_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(176): A **point** is a extra little _hill_ at the top of a _mountain_. We'll call it 'Fireman's **Point** '.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-12-2006(103): This actually means a high mountain. So, to cater to the keyword, it's surely obvious (ahem) that if something gets such a fine title as **Point** , it must be more magnificent than the average mountain. It's as if there was a hill on top of an average mountain, adding to its height.
column7: 3) [[Pauline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pauline)] 3-7-2006(29): There's a movie called "The Englishman who went up a hill but came down a mountain". The story is that English cartographer says that the mountain near a Welsh village is actually a hill (too low for a mountain), but the locals decide to make it a mountain (by making it higher). Let's say that in the end the _hill_ got the title **Point** to mark it as a _mountain_.
column8: 4) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(19): I chopped off the **point** of the _mountain_ with my _axe_. Now it is just a hill.
column9: 5) [[Odieone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Odieone)] 30-12-2008(12): At some **point** , a _hill_ becomes a _mountain_.

column5: 1) [[hirai](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hirai)] 15-10-2007(265): Listen up **soldier** s! We're going to take that _hill_. You are no longer men with human legs. You are voracious animals, with _animal legs_! Got it? _Animal legs_! Now take that hill!
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 21-5-2007(73): The _hill_ is so steep that you almost have to have _animal legs_ to walk on it. However, the **soldiers** have no problem because they've been trained to march there.
column7: 3) [[tk2000](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tk2000)] 8-1-2007(36): Army ant **soldiers** climb up a _hill_ with their mighty _animal_ "insect" _legs_ to battle the grasshoppers.
column8: 4) [[nishur](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nishur)] 8-3-2009(34): **Soldier** s specially designed for combat in the **hill** s have got their lower body replaced by that of a mountain goat. Picture them hopping up the hills like silly little centaurs with their new **animal legs**!
column9: 5) [[LorenPaul](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LorenPaul)] 23-7-2009(16): **Soldier** s use an axe as a tool of war!

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(268): **Seacoast** - > Coast Guard -> " _water soldiers_ " lined up on the **seacoast** defending our shores.
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 7-12-2008(75): Imagine Normandy after the strikes on the beach. The _water_ of the entire **seacoast** dyed red with the blood of thousands of _soldiers_.
column7: 3) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 3-6-2007(27): Water and soldier. Letters from iwojima. The **seacoast** scattered with soldiers, floating in the water.
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 29-12-2010(20): The **seacoast** is where the marines assault. Marines are _water soldiers_. 浜 (はま) : beach, seashore.
column9: 5) [[Aldain](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aldain)] 27-5-2008(6): In the time of the "sakoku" (from 17th to 19th centuary) japanese was isolated. Soldiers at the seacost had to watch out that nobody enters he water.

column3: Remember when your granny used to ask you to bend your arms at the _elbows_ and hold them out so that she could use them like a rack to hold a skein of string or yarn (here **thread** ) while she rolled it up into a _little_ ball? Now can you see the two _elbows_ (with the second stroke doubling up) at the top, and the character for _little_ below?
column5: 1) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 3-7-2007(195): I also went with Spiderman. However, in the cases where this primitive appears under other primitives, as opposed to on the left (I think there are ~5 times in this chapter) I've opted to use a similar character: Venom. This helps keep the positioning clear, especially on such characters as [dainty](../v4/1363.html) (#1363 細) and [accumulate](../v4/1364.html) (#1364 累).
column6: 2) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 17-7-2006(81): You'll be seeing this one a lot. Seriously.
column7: 3) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 28-7-2007(56): On left with nothing on top of it –> SPIDERMAN. everywhere else….SPIDERPIG.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-6-2007(20): I'll stick with Spiderman. He's a very memorable character, and don't forget that he can shoot strings from both arms. What happens to the relative primitive when Spiderman comes along? If you can clearly picture his **thread** s winding, pulling, yanking, sticking to, filling, tying, and strangling objects, then you'll never confuse this primitive with another one.
column9: 5) [[aphasiac](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aphasiac)] 13-10-2009(16): Hate to be pedantic, but it's spelt _Spider-man_ , not _Spiderman_. Stan Lee added the hyphen to differentiate him from _Superman_..

column5: 1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 30-7-2007(195): Spiderman **weave** s his way through the skyline while listening to his theme song on his ipod. It is played, of course, by kazoos.
column6: 2) [[akimoto](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akimoto)] 4-3-2007(46): Play the kazoo magically and the thread will **weave** itself.
column7: 3) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 1-8-2008(43): _Spiderman_ 's housemate insists on playing the _kazoo_ every night, despite _Spiderman_ 's protests. Eventually, _Spiderman_ can't bear it anymore and **weave** s a tight web around his housemate's face to prevent him from playing the _kazoo_. 織布 (しょくふ): woven cloth, fabric 織物 (おりもの): fabric, textile.
column8: 4) [[zwarte_kat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zwarte_kat)] 13-2-2009(23): When spider-man **weave** s threads, they sound like kazoos when they shoot out his arms. When you imagine it, it's quite funny.
column9: 5) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 7-3-2008(18): _Spiderman_ **weave** s his _threads_ using a _kazoo_ as a shuttle.

column5: 1) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 8-11-2007(200): After a day being _virtuouos_ and keeping the city safe, _Spiderman_ 's outfit is in need of some repair. Luckily, as he can shoot out threads **darning** is very easy for him to do.
column6: 2) [[Rakushun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rakushun)] 7-7-2007(60): **Darning** is too obscure a word for me, I prefer to just think of it as repair. And obviously, repairing someones broken cloth things is a virtuous thing to do, and you need thread to do it.
column7: 3) [[cheechuan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cheechuan)] 19-3-2008(49): _Spiderman_ is of course _virtuous_ and spends a lot of time **darning** his costume after battles so that his privates don't show.
column8: 4) [[akimoto](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akimoto)] 1-3-2007(24): **Darning** socks instead of buying new ones shows the virtousness of the person - it exhibits the Japanese virtue of thrift (the Meiji emperor would refuse to buy new boots, constantly having them repaired. The Showa emperor would refuse to buy books he wanted because he "couldn't afford them.").
column9: 5) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 13-9-2007(19): The _thread_ is too _virtuous_ for damning, it can only be used for **darning**.

column5: 1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 22-6-2007(243): After spending the night at an _inn_ , _spider man_ discovered to his dismay that his costume had **shrunk** in the wash, and no longer fit!
column6: 2) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 21-11-2008(74): Don't let the **Inn** wash your **thread** s, they will **shrink** them!
column7: 3) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 18-9-2007(23): _Spiderman_ spends the night at a traditional Japanese [inn](../v4/995.html) (#995 宿), to spend time with his friend _Mr T_ snorting _cocaine under the ceiling_. Alas, that's not _cocaine_ , it's one of those magic mushrooms from Alice in Wonderland. _Spiderman_ and _Mr T_ start to **shrink**.
column8: 4) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 28-5-2007(18): To fit 100 people in one house you have to **shrink** until you're as thin as threads.
column9: 5) [[kazelee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kazelee)] 13-8-2008(12): After spending the night at a cheap inn, spider man discovered to his dismay that his costume has been shrunk in the wash, and no longer fits! Perhaps now here will stop getting cheap Inn cleaning service. ,).

column5: 1) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(215): Important: **Luxuriant** does NOT mean luxurious, as the other stories indicate. Definition: abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation. When _Venom_ realized he couldn't beat _Spider-Man_ in a fair fight, he showed his _cleverness_ by spraying venom all over Spider-Man's **luxuriant** garden.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(52): _Venom_ is covered in a **luxuriant** and surprisingly _clever_ symbiotic suit, but it's also the _taskmaster_ for his _every_ evil act.
column7: 3) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 31-12-2006(43): _Every taskmaster's threads_ are **luxuriant** , made with only the best fabrics in all the brightest colours.
column8: 4) [[spleenlol](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/spleenlol)] 7-6-2010(38): This kanji is 1337 ^^.
column9: 5) [[Kurenai_no_Buta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurenai_no_Buta)] 3-6-2008(29): Key word is _luxuriant_ (abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation, teeming). _Venom_ uses his _cleverness_ to create a **luxuriant** garden, teeming with **luxuriant** vegetation, in a bid to lure Mary Jane into his clutches. (Thanks esaulgd.).

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 24-9-2007(208): When _Spider-man_ does his amazing **vertical** wall climbing, a throng of photographers _accompanies_ him to get a good shot of the action.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 19-10-2008(90): You may only _accompany_ _spiderman_ if you're able to climb buildings **vertical** ly.
column7: 3) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 14-2-2006(64): True **vertical** can be found by hanging a plumb line - a thread accompanied by a weight.
column8: 4) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 26-5-2010(30): When _Spider-Man_ goes **vertical** , it's very hard to _accompany_ him.
column9: 5) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 28-5-2007(22): When you are facing a **vertical** climb, it is best to be _accompanied_ by some good, strong _thread_.

column3: The key word should be taken to mean minute, detailed, or nuanced. Its primitive elements are: _thread_ . . . _doth_.
column5: 1) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 23-9-2010(33): This kanji shows _Spiderman_ giving a dress of the **finest** thread to his girlfriend. Of course, the real purpose of the gift is to get his girlfriend to _doth_ him.
column6: 2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 9-1-2010(16): **fine** : If the _thread_ _doth_ fit through the eye of the needle, it is **fine** _thread_ indeed.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 23-3-2010(10): **Fine**. The new Goth _Spiderman doth_ wear a costume made from black spider silk of the **fine** st weave. [緻密・ちみつ](midori://search?text=緻密・ちみつ) close, minute, elaborate, intricate.
column8: 4) [[lernsky](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lernsky)] 5-5-2013(7): When _Spiderman_ does ([doth](../v4/756.html) (#756 致)) _climax_ he ejects only the **fine** st _thread_ because his _taskmaster_ (taskmistress) told him so.
column9: 5) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 24-12-2010(7): _Spiderman doth climax_ whenever the **fine** _dominatrix_ Mary Jane tells him to.

column5: 1) [[jamestaverner](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamestaverner)] 15-2-2008(251): This kanji is used for train **lines**. _Spiderman_ does a hot _spring_ tour of Japan using the train **lines**. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing **line** as he enjoys the onsen.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 11-7-2006(75): Japan's train **line** s are like threads that spring from Tokyo station.
column7: 3) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 18-9-2007(38): Spiderman casts a **line** in order to get across a very hot srping.
column8: 4) [[elmaestrokgb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elmaestrokgb)] 12-7-2009(33): _Spiderman_ usually just travels by web, but when he goes to visit the hot _spring_ , he has to take several train **line** s instead, since there are no buildings to swing from. [He tried swinging from power **line** s once–big mistake].
column9: 5) [[skyerise](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skyerise)] 6-7-2010(7): On a vacation in Japan, SPIDER MAN waits in **LINE** to get in the hot SPRING.

(pick your favourite nowadays country ruler who isn't doing a good job). Spidey has **tighten** d a web around the sovereing's throat. As long as the sovereign says what spidey whispers, he will be fine. Sovereign yelping : ' we will draw are troops back! and we will spend more money on healthcare, schools and less on wars!' Spidey whispering: ' If you continue at this pace, you might be doing good things AND the people will like you.'.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 12-3-2007(98): The _sovereign_ appears to be ruling, but in reality someone behind him (for instance his wife) has a _thread_ around his throat, and if he dares to make a decision she doesn't like, she starts pulling the _thread_ and **tighten** s it around his throat.
column7: 3) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 8-11-2007(55): _The Sovereign_ (a crazy comic book villain) has been caught by _Spiderman._ He's trying to get free so _Spiderman_ **tighten** s the web around him.
column8: 4) [[cerulean](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cerulean)] 6-4-2009(36): _Spiderman_ **tighten** s a web around _Caesar_ 's throat.. "Et tu, Spiderman?".
column9: 5) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 8-8-2008(24): The _sovereign_ uses his _threads_ of influence ("pulling the strings") to **tighten** his grip on power.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-5-2007(139): Hey, _Spidey_! Eat that _turkey_ if you want, but make sure you eat some **fiber** s: you want spidey _threads_ , don't ya?
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 28-5-2007(88): If you want to increase your **fiber** intake, just leave on those _threads_ that are used to sew up the stuffed _turkey_ and eat them too.
column7: 3) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 1-8-2007(65): Feeling mischievous while shopping, Spiderman throws his web into the cavity of a _turkey_. He chuckles, "That ought to raise the _turkey_ 's **FIBER** content.".
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(32): When _Spider-Man_ first made his suit, he was so fixated on the textile aspect, on making sure all of the **fibres** were sturdy, he didn't realize till he finished that he'd made it with a _turkey_ design on the chest instead of a spider. He felt like a real _turkey_ then (that's the sort of campy insult he might use).
column9: 5) [[bonitoclub](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bonitoclub)] 29-8-2008(20): _Spiderman_ needs more **fibre** so he eats _turkey_ sandwiches on wholewheat bread.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 28-5-2007(192): Lots of girls in Japan wear **gauze** patches over one _eye_ made of course white _fibers_. They think it is cute, and I must admit, I have come to think so too.
column6: 2) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 30-8-2006(125): Rocky won the match but left with a nasty _eye_ injury, and needs some **gauze** for it. I use a modified version of the Rocky theme song to remember this one – "the _eye_ and the _fiber_ ".
column7: 3) [[testoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/testoman)] 10-8-2008(55): The _eyes_ on Spiderman's mask are made of carbon _fibre_ **gauze**. Light, strong and see-through.
column8: 4) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 13-9-2008(24): **Gauze** is a _net_ of _fiber_.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 6-12-2006(21): This is also used to mean "web" (e.g. in 網羅 ) and "ordered" (e.g. in 羅列 ). The web meaning is the basic one, and a web consists of fibers and the "eyes" (holes, 網の目 , like "eye" of a needle) between them. **Gauze** is just a form of web. "Ordered" comes from the order inherent in the matrix formed by the holes. Think of ghastly eyes peeking at you from between the fibers (and fabric of space?) when you're not looking, and you won't look webs the same way ever again.

column6: 2) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 8-11-2007(137): [+ skinnyneo] _Spiderman_ visits the _East_ to **practice** his swinging skills. All those Asian cities with skyscrapers and low crime rates make it easy for him to **practice**.
column7: 3) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 2-10-2006(54): You **practice** your Japanese skills in a discussion _thread_ with lots of people from the Far _East_ (since many of the people who are interested in studying Japanese are Asian).
column8: 4) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 31-3-2008(40): After being defeated one too many times, Spiderman heads East to the Orient in order to **practice** various martial arts.
column9: 5) [[kapson](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapson)] 14-12-2010(22): PRACTICING Japanese every day is the THREAD that binds me to the EAST.

column3: _Thread_ . . . _puppet_. Although we usually think of a **thong** as coming at the end of a piece of string, this character's meaning allows for it to come at the beginning as well.
column5: 1) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 8-11-2007(195): _Spiderman_ has a secret fetish, he likes nothing better than to dress his _lovedoll_ in a **thong**. Wierd, eh!
column6: 2) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 18-3-2009(44): A **thong** is no more than a _thread_ used by _someone_ as underwear!
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 29-5-2008(32): Instead of puppet I like to think of "someone" as ninja (since it is the second kanji in ninja). A **ninja** must be able to steal a **thread** from a woman's **thong** without her noticing.

column7: 3) [[Nayelianne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nayelianne)] 24-9-2008(26): A **picture** is just a matter of the harmonious _meeting_ of lines. The many _threads_ of a brush _meet_ together on paper, finally forming a **painting**.
column8: 4) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 6-1-2008(13): By coercing fine, colorful _threads_ to _meet_ other threads in a needlepoint, it's entirely possible to create a very nice **picture**.
column9: 5) [[rucury](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rucury)] 30-5-2013(12): A word of **caution** : This kanji's on-yomi is "え”, and it's meaning is that of a **picture** , painting, drawing… However, it's not, strictly speaking, a photograph. The kanji for photograph is 写真 （しゃしん）「keyword 1: copy, 2: truth」. Try to remember this kanji without using the image of a photograph, to distinguish them further. The top two stories right now (by PacifistGod and joesan) sort of make you think of a photograph, so bear this in mind!

column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 11-7-2009(26): Small tweak to Django's story: "Stop thieves!" yells the greengrocer. The thieves don't, so _Spidey_ saves the day by **entwining** _each_ of them in a web, and dangling them _walking legs_ over _mouth_. 絡まる (からまる): to become **entwine** d, entangled, involved 絡み合い (からみあい): entanglement 連絡する (れんらくする): contact, get in touch, inform 連絡先 (れんらくさき): contact address.
column9: 5) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 9-1-2009(18): _Spider-man_ has developed different kinds of _thread_ to **entwine** _each_ different villain with. Metal webbing for Doc Ock, gas- proof webbing for Green Goblin, alien-proof webbing for Venom…

Now, at US weddings, it ends with the couple driving away with cans being dragged behind the car. So here, think of SPIDERMAN, who will **TIE** the knot with Mary Jane. At his wedding, Spider THREAD attached (or **TIE** D) to SPRAYCANS are being drug behind the limo as they drive off.

column5: 1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 19-5-2008(276): This Kanji is the same ones used in the Japanese Language proficiency tests, i.e. ikkyuu ( 一級 ) The Kanji doesnt describe **class** as in a "class of students" or "classroom," but rather a grade of quality or ability. ———- Spiderman is taking the JLPT Level 1. In desperation he REACHES OUT to grab his friend's answer sheet next to him, who seems to be doing well. The other test takers are obviously a **class** above him. Looks like this test is above his **class** of knowledge.
column6: 2) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 17-9-2007(65): Spiderman with his arm stretched out showing the **class** how he produces webs.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 23-9-2008(59): _Spider-Man reaches out_ to every **class** , rich and poor.
column8: 4) [[akira](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akira)] 25-12-2007(22): Spiderman stretching his arms at different length produces a different **class** of web.
column9: 5) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 14-1-2009(20): **Class, grade, rank.** Members of a particular **class** or rank are connected (as if by a _thread_ ) by their similarities and common circumstances, and often, by the extent to which they will _reach out and exert_ themselves to new heights. 下級 (low grade). 学級 (school **class** ). 勤労階級 (working **class** ). 最高級 (top **class** ). 審級 (instance). 上級 (advanced level, senior). 中級 (intermediate level). 飛び級 (skipping a grade). 上の級に進む (to move up to a higher grade).
