column6: 2) [[gdaxeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gdaxeman)] 2-1-2008(130): _Spider-Man_ was working as a surgeon's assistant. By accident, he threw his spider webs _inside_ the patient, causing his death. Fortunately, the hospital reached an out-of-court **settlement** with the victim's family.
column7: 3) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 6-2-2008(100): Another twist on the same theme: malpractise **settlement** for leaving a plastic spiderman inside patient.
column8: 4) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(50): _Spiderman_ was caught hanging upside down _inside_ the girls changing room. The resulting public backlash and court- **settlement** were embarassing, but he still thinks it was worth it.
column9: 5) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 29-6-2010(24): Natto ( 納豆 ) is fermented soybeans. One theory about the name says it was used as a form of payment to **settle** debts to your lord. Picture the little styrofoam natto package and when you open it up it's full of _threads_ of sticky, stringy goo _inside_ … 納金 [のうきん] payment [、納品](midori://search?text=、納品) [のうひん] [、納得](midori://search?text=、納得) [なっとく] [、納める](midori://search?text=、納める) [おさめる].

column3: For the kanji that means the _spinning_ of _thread_ and other fibers we have the elements: _thread_ . . . _compass_.
column5: 1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 24-9-2007(187): _Spiderman_ can **spin** his webs in any _direction_.
column6: 2) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 25-10-2007(94): "You keep me **spinning** right round, baby right round, like a _compass_ baby." _Spidey_ is making a retro 80s music video, **spinning** right round on his giant _compass_ , singing his favourite song.
column7: 3) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 15-1-2008(50): The easiest way to spin some _threads_ is to hook them up to a _compass_ and take them to the North Pole. The compass will spin like crazy and the threads will spin with it. I confuse this with [swing](../v4/1967.html) (#1967 揺).
column8: 4) [[adhmm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adhmm)] 16-11-2007(38): Spiderman is **spinning** around, shooting webs in every direction.
column9: 5) [[blueraccoon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blueraccoon)] 25-2-2009(8): A normal spider **spins** a web into a specific pattern in order to catch prey. _Spiderman_ , however, uses his web primarily as a mode of transportation, shooting it in all _directions_.

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 9-1-2008(207): Spiderman got **distract** ed when someone yelled, "Spiderman, wait a minute." He turned around and flew into a building. ("part" also means "minute").
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 1-11-2007(121): Due to the **distract** ions of being a super-hero, _spiderman_ can only work _part_ -time. (variation on ayoung24's story).
column7: 3) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 1-11-2006(65): **Distract** = to lose the _thread_ of thought in _part_ , i.e. not completely.
column8: 4) [[Angrybeez](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Angrybeez)] 4-9-2011(37): Spiderman gets **distract** ed as Wonderwoman parts her legs next to him.
column9: 5) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 26-10-2007(31): _Spiderman_ is fired from his _part_ -time job for being constantly **distract** ed by his super-hero duties.

column5: 1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 21-8-2008(251): Spiderman seduces all the girls he's **introduce** d to.
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 9-12-2008(94): Peter Parker did a terrible job of _seducing_ MJ. _Spiderman_ however, _seduced_ her as soon as they were first **introduced**.
column7: 3) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 30-12-2008(42): The first _thread_ of a _seduction_ is an **introduction**.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 14-1-2008(27): A strange 1960's party game as a new way to _introduce_ people to each other at a party. Six men, six women, and six _threads_. The threads are mixed together and thrown into a bowl. Each person takes one end of a _thread_ , thereby matching that person up with a random partner. Obviously, the couples try to _seduce_ each other.
column9: 5) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 27-9-2007(13): The prostitute wore little more than a few _threads_ , quickly _seduced_ her client and left without even **introduc** ing herself.

column5: 1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 23-6-2006(148): The word ‘sutra’ literally means a rope or thread that holds things together. Here we see that it is a _spool_ that is holding the _threads_ together.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(105): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reasons: (1) _Toilet paper/roll_ usually comes on a _spool_. (2) _Toilet paper_ is used to clean the _soil_ off your _crotch_. Story: _Spiderman_ (= thread) has a roll of _toilet paper_ with the words of a **sutra** printed on each sheet (picture _Spiderman_ saying the **sutra** as he tears sheets off the _toilet roll_ ). Spool also appears in [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎), [suspicious](../v4/716.html) (#716 怪), [lightly](../v4/717.html) (#717 軽), [diameter](../v4/882.html) (#882 径).
column7: 3) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 10-11-2007(96): _Spiderman_ is intriqued by some of the positions of the karma **sutra** , but reluctant to take part in an **sutra** orgy as he'd have to reveal his _soiled underwear_.
column8: 4) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 18-1-2008(19): A **sutra** reads: time **flows** as a _thread_ constantly **flowing** out of a _spool_.
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(18): _Spider-Man's_ kama **sutra** technique is so crazy that he always needs a whole roll of _toilet paper_ to clean up afterward. Mary Jane is always soaked in a sticky white substance, and it isn't Spidey's webs.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-4-2007(292): Monkeys are very adept at swinging around trees. But when they met Spiderman, who could swing around even better than they could, they all quickly addressed him as **sire**.
column6: 2) [[Atomik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Atomik)] 4-2-2010(127): You are now two-thirds of the way through the book! Keep it up!
column7: 3) [[diracbracket](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/diracbracket)] 23-12-2008(83): _Spiderman_ married a _monkey_ and **sire** d a brood of spider- _monkeys_.
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 29-5-2007(38): When conversing with a **sire** (noble person) you should always use proper words like " _speaketh_ " and allow them to set the _thread_ of the conversation.
column9: 5) [[cae99v](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cae99v)] 28-1-2008(16): What do you call a monkey that wears the finest threads? **Sire** of course.

column3: Consider for a moment the etymology of the word " **promise** " in order to notice its roots in the activity of putting one thing (e.g., one's word of honor) in place of another (e.g., the fulfillment of a task). For as it turns out, this character also means "to abridge, economize, and abbreviate" \- all activities that involve putting one thing in place of another. With that in mind, we may now work with the elements: _thread_ . . . _ladle_.
column5: 1) [[eatyoda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eatyoda)] 27-10-2008(150): Anytime _Spiderman_ breaks a **promise** , Aunt Mae hits him one over with her _ladle_.
column6: 2) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 2-10-2007(125): Spiderman **promise** d to get Aunt Mae's ladle back. He started to do a blood oath by spilling drops of blood but Aunt Mae stopped him and bound up the wound. "It's only a ladle Peter".
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 13-12-2006(35): Thread + bound + drop of blood. Blood oath is a **promise** , where a drop of blood turns into a binding thread.
column8: 4) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 19-4-2010(24): _Spiderman_ broke his **promise** to be home in time for dinner. When he came in late, Aunt Mae beat him viciously with a _ladle_. She just kept hitting, and hitting, and hitting until he lost consciousness, and even then she still kept _ladling_ his pulpy carcass for like fifteen more minutes. Don't break **promise** s to Aunt Mae.
column9: 5) [[Rakushun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rakushun)] 30-8-2007(17): _Spiderman_ and Spiderwoman share a _drop_ of blood (the blood handshake thing, like in Natural Born Killers) to _bind_ their **promise** that they'll always fight crime. Ladle was too hard. _Spiderman_ **PROMISE** S to get MJs cooking _ladle_ back.

column5: 1) [[marydj](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/marydj)] 3-11-2007(200): **Dainty** women would always rather work with thread than in a field.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(118): _Spider- Man_ used to just be a **dainty** , _brainy_ nerd.
column7: 3) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 23-3-2011(50): Spiderman slips and smack his brain on a building… now he's sitting in the middle of the street pouring imaginary tea and acting **dainty**.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 22-9-2008(50): _Spider-Man_ 's ideal type is a **dainty** girl with _brains_.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 9-12-2006(33): The threads of the brain (neurons) are **dainty**.

column3: _Rice field_ . . . _threads_. Make use of the position of the elements to distinguish this kanji from that of the previous frame.
column5: 1) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 19-9-2007(160): (dingomick) _Venom_ is upset because Spidey is just that much brainier than he is! He chooses to **accumulate** as many _brains_ as he can, snatching them out of people's heads and storing them on top of his own, till there's just one massive _brain_ on top of his head!
column6: 2) [[Mighty_Matt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mighty_Matt)] 22-2-2008(140): When you **accumulate** knowledge in your _brain_ , neural pathways are constructed. All those pathways end up like a huge ball of _thread_ tangled together. The more knowledge you **accumulate** the more _threads_ you throw into the mix!!
column7: 3) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 23-8-2007(63): Like a jellyfish, a floating BRAIN **accumulate** s THREADS beneath it– a weird collection.
column8: 4) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 14-11-2007(55): _Venom_ is accumulating _brains_ (much like Sylar in Heroes).
column9: 5) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 6-1-2008(21): I found billyclyde's a bit abstract so I picture a _brain_ rolling about the floor, accumulating _threads_ scattered around and getting bigger as it rolls. (this is easy if you've played Katamari).

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-4-2007(148): Spiderman has been captured and given the ultimate torture: they forced a crown of needles on his head and attached it to an electrical **cord** , which they are about to plug into an outlet…
column6: 2) [[shakkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shakkun)] 16-6-2008(137): (modified akrodha's great story) VENOM has been captured by scientists and is being experimented on: they forced a CROWN of NEEDLES on his head and attached it to multiple electrical **cord** s, which are connected to a big machine.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 14-1-2008(59): An electrical **cord** has two (or three) prongs - _needles_ \- sticking out of it, a housing for the prongs that can be thought of as a _crown_ , and the long _thread_ -like wire leading to the appliance.
column8: 4) [[Biene](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Biene)] 18-6-2008(47): That's _venom_ for you! Since he can't make webs like spiderman can, he's now desperately hanging from a thin **cord** that he bought cheap in Sweden. It cost him only _10 Kroner_ (Crowns). I'm sure the **cord** will rip in a second or two. (Thanks desmidus).
column9: 5) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 24-6-2006(31): A **cord** is made of _ten_ _threads_ _belted_ together.

column3: This kanji, meaning universal or widespread, is composed of three elements: _thread_ . . . _public_ . . . _heart_.
column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 26-10-2007(305): _Spiderman_ could not achieve **general** acceptance by the media even after winning the _public_ 's _heart_.
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 27-3-2008(57): **NOTE** : This kanji stands for [ **Total** , All, whole, gross]. The Kanji commonly used for "In **general** " will appear later as [carrier](../v4/1871.html) (#1871 般).
column7: 3) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 6-3-2006(38): To win **GENERAL** approval THREAD your way into the PUBLIC's HEART.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 4-2-2008(33): In **general** , spidey is accepted in the public's heart (see Spiderman1,2 and 3) Its only Jameson of the daily bugle that hates him (and a bunch of super villains). But in **general** , Spidey is in the public's heart, and the public is in Spidey's heart.
column9: 5) [[mfistik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mfistik)] 29-8-2007(22): **General** or universal refers to the common thread running through the public's heart.

column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 26-10-2007(157): _Spiderman_ 's polyethylene suit starts to ride up after a while, so he always looks forward to the _white_ **cotton** _towels_ he wears while lounging around his apartment.
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 19-12-2007(95): **Cotton** is the preferred _thread_ for making _white_ _towels_.
column7: 3) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 2-4-2008(67): Spiderman has a dark secret - he has stolen all the white **cotton** towels from every hotel he has ever been in.
column8: 4) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-5-2006(22): Thread customarily used to make white towels with.
column9: 5) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 14-1-2008(18): Compare with [brocade](../v4/411.html) (#411 錦). If the _white_ _towel_ is made of plain _threads_ with no golden decoration, then it's just a plain towel. But at least it's a good fluffy **cotton** towel, not one of those cheap synthetic fibers. Remember: if it can't be golden (as in [brocade](../v4/411.html) (#411 錦)), at least make it **cotton**.

column5: 1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 27-9-2007(199): Spider-man loves to run his mouth all over Mary Jane's **silk** y flesh.
column6: 2) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 2-8-2007(114): Spiderman has little squares in the flesh of his wrists that the **silk** webbing comes out of.
column7: 3) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 19-1-2007(77): [silk] **Silk** is a _thread_ that a larvae produces from its _mouth_ to involve its _body_.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(33): _Spider- Man_ barged in on our honey _moon_ , stuffing our **silk** sheets in his _mouth_ –apparently he was out of webbing and needed to refuel.
column9: 5) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 27-5-2008(30): Spider-man loves to use his _mouth_ to remove Mary Jane's **silk** stockings and kiss the _flesh_ underneath. (thanks Zazen666!).

column5: 1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 2-8-2007(155): After stopping a bank heist, Spiderman is seen **winding** his webbing around the stolen goods to trap them in a tree until the police arrive to take them back.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 28-2-2008(116): Tip: _goods_ \+ _wood/tree_ : This combination appears 4 times. I suggest calling it " _furniture_ " (a common type of _wooden goods_ ). REF: [parch](../v4/215.html) (#215 燥) , [maneuver](../v4/671.html) (#671 操), _winding_ (FRAME 1369), [seaweed](../v4/2035.html) (#2035 藻). Story: You are **winding** up your new _furniture_ using a _thread_ to get it through the window of your high-rise apartment.
column7: 3) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 13-5-2008(81): _Spiderman_ often accidentally breaks his _furniture_ (thanks Katsuo!) with his spider strength, so he is often seen **winding** his webbing around various pieces to repair them.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 28-11-2009(41): Primary meaning of this kanji has to do with turning pages/leafing through a book so I focus on that meaning. Also taking the furniture suggestion from Katsuo about the primitive on the right and making it even more concrete by having it refer to IKEA. Here I see Spiderman reading an IKEA catalogue, he's lost in thought leafing through the pages.
column9: 5) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 14-7-2008(21): **Winding** _thread_ around _wood_ en _goods_ to ready them for safe transport.

column5: 1) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(308): _Spider- Man_ is _hooked_ on _rice_ –it's all he **inherit** ed from his Uncle Ben. (thanks Nukemarine).
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 5-4-2007(69): A poor chinese fisherman could expect to **inherit** : the _thread_ for his pole, a _hook_ for catching something to eat, and some _rice_ to live off of. (not concentrating on stroke order, sorry if that throws anyone off). (Adapted from bigloui,12-4-2006).
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 20-10-2007(40): The **INHERIT** ANCE given to SPIDERMAN was only RICE, because it came from his "Uncle Ben", ha ha ha, get the HOOK? "Uncle Ben" RICE? To be fair, I couldn't work hook into that tale very well.
column8: 4) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 14-11-2007(23): Uncle Ben _was_ the employee that got the axe in [severance](../v4/1136.html) (#1136 断), so naturally the _fishing hook_ and _rice ball_ is all that _spidey_ will **inherit**.
column9: 5) [[bigloui](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bigloui)] 12-4-2006(11): A poor chinese farmer could expect to **inherit** : the _thread_ of life, a _hook_ for catching something to eat, and some _rice_ to live off of. (not concentrating on stroke order, sorry if that throws anyone off).

column5: 1) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 3-7-2007(303): _Spiderman's_ nemesis the **Green** Goblin is in a slump, He's replaced his glider with a _broom_ and is throwing _grains of rice_ instead of bombs.
column6: 2) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 8-4-2007(55): Tie **green** _thread_ around the _broom_ that you use for sweeping up _grains of rice_ (ie the kitchen broom) to distinguish it from the other colour threaded brooms that you might use in say the toilet, or the garage etc…
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 31-3-2006(26): Hint : I think of the little _broom_ used for preparing Japanese **green** tea.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(24): Tip: _broom_ \+ _rice grains_ : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it may be worthwhile giving it a name. [record](../v4/1144.html) (#1144 録) , _green_ (FRAME 1371), [peel off](../v4/2145.html) (#2145 剥), [salarium](../v4/2602.html) (#2602 禄).
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 22-5-2009(19): _Spiderman's_ fight against the **green** goblin was recorded on _videotape_ (录, see [record](../v4/1144.html) (#1144 録) and sold. You know the film, don't you? It's no hollywood movie - it's true!

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 19-4-2007(206): There once was a lonely little pig that constantly followed Spiderman, always nuzzling his leg and oinking tenderly. Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition: the _pig_ was to take a _broom_ and sweep up all of _Spiderman's leftover threads_ after having fought crime. The pig felt such **affinity** for Spiderman, he happily accepted—and did a good job too.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 8-2-2008(159): Spiderman has no **affinity** for a broom hence his house is a pig sty.
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 23-10-2007(67): I hate doing this, since the Simpson's Movie was recent. But think of the **AFFINITY** Homer had with the PIG that was to be killed. The **AFFINITY** first had SPIDER PIG (Spiderpig, spiderpig, does whatever a spiderpig does). Then Homer dressed the PIG up with a BROOM and glasses making him Harry PORKER. Homer had more **AFFINITY** for that PIG than his family, hence hilarity ensues.
column8: 4) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 5-8-2008(28): There is an **affinity** between the THREADS of a BROOM and a SOW's hair.
column9: 5) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 30-12-2008(19): Spiderman, though genuinely a good person, had an **affinity** for beating _pigs_ with a _broom_. (I know it's random, but the mental picture is both vivid and hilarious).

column3: Thread . . . glass canopy . . . animal horns . . . perish.
column5: 1) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 7-10-2007(188): _Spiderman_ traps The Rhino under the _hood_ of his famous **netting** , where even Rhino's _horns_ can not break free, in fact if the **netting** did not dissappear after a few hours then Rhino might even _perish_ in there.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-10-2006(76): You use a 糸 to make a net shaped like a hood. A stray animal got caught in it by its horns and perished.
column7: 3) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 18-1-2008(54): Sadly, sometimes **nettings** have a _thread_ so strong, the net gets caught like a _hood_ on an animal's _horns_ , and stays there until the poor thing _perishes_.
column8: 4) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 28-1-2007(26): Spider- woman dies of a mosquito bite. They replace the (ineffectual) **netting** over her bed with a glass canopy, and put a viking's horned helmet on her dead head, so she can lie in state with dignity.
column9: 5) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 14-4-2010(25): _Spiderman_ caught The Rhino, under a _glass canopy_ , instead of his usual webbed **netting**. But unfortunately, the _horned one perished_ : he couldn't breathe. Next time spidey will stick to his traditional methods… (I prefer to say _horned one_ rather than just _horned_ , to remind myself of the extra stroke).

column5: 1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 14-11-2007(147): Whenever _Venom_ is **tense** , he loses control of his sex drive and becomes a _slave_ to his _crotch_.
column6: 2) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 17-1-2008(65): You'd be **tense** too if you were a _slave_ and your owner removed the _threads_ covering your _crotch_.
column7: 3) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 28-9-2009(55): TIP: This is the first kanji in "kinbaku" ( 緊縛 ), the art of Japanese rope bondage. STORY: The _slave's_ _crotch_ is tied up with rope ( _thread_ ) to heighten the sado-erotic **tension** … 緊張 [きんちょう].
column8: 4) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 10-2-2007(21): The crotch-slave from "intelligent" this time has hidden some thread as part of her elaborate plan to escape from her owner. Now she's being searched, and is afraid they'll find where she hid the thread – she is quite **tense** , and it shows.
column9: 5) [[busaiku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/busaiku)] 13-11-2009(14): _Spiderman_ is _slave_ to his _crotch_ , literally, because of that leotard he uses. If he get's just a little too excited in public, the situation would become very **tense** (if you know what I mean).

column5: 1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 14-11-2007(140): _Venom_ starts to choke on a _spoon_. He's about to get it out, when you manage to _stop_ the _spoon_ from getting out, so he turns **purple** , as he chokes, and dies.
column6: 2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(75): Why is your ass **purple**? Well, I _stopped_ and _sat_ for a bit on a pile of _thread_ … (I guess it was freshly dyed).
column7: 3) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 12-3-2008(46): _Stop_ _sitting_ for so long - or else you'll get those **purple** _threads_ (veins) on your legs from bad circulation. [link **purple** with those huge **purple** , bulging, crawling, worm-like varicose veins …..].
column8: 4) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 19-8-2010(36): If you use **Venom** for the lower primitive, this kanji is a piece of cake. The upper primitive is the left part of [feminine/female](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/563) (#563 雌). So, **PURPLE** is the color of Agony, the **female** offspring of **Venom** <http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_hmOfolKlLFI/SN1l3LqagTI/AAAAAAAAA1Q/7tEpxy- Bfu0/s1600-h/agony.jpg> <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agony_%28comics%29>.
column9: 5) [[thomasritz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thomasritz)] 8-9-2009(23): _Stop_ _spooning_ _spiderpig_. He's turning **purple**!

column5: 1) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 19-9-2007(160): _Spidey_ received good word that the _acupuncturist_ working down the road was actually the evil Doctor Octopus! _Spidey_ headed over to the clinic, and **truss** ed the _acupuncturist_ Doc Oc up using the maniac's own metal limbs!
column6: 2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-7-2007(114): Because people are so afraid of the procedure, _string_ has to be used by the _acunpunturist_ to **truss** up his victims, er, patients.
column7: 3) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 8-12-2009(89): Ok, I already finished RtK, I'm coming back to warn you about this one - the right primitive is _acupuncturist_ , not _specialty_. Trust me, mixing these up will mess you up later.
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 24-3-2008(42): Spiderman's specialty: **truss** ing up villains of course.
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 5-2-2008(19): Spiderman gets **truss** ed/binded, tied by the new villain: the acupuncturist. This new vilain is able to paralyze you by just sticking needles in you. Spidey is all tied up on the table …

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 5-9-2006(200): The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a **straw rope** , but all that's left of the rope are some torn _threads_ , and the _unbound tortoise_ is nowhere to be found. (Note that the right half here is not "eels". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in [waterfall](../v4/537.html) (#537 滝) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as "eels". It is much better to call the right half of this character an "unbound tortoise".).
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 28-9-2007(145): When _Spiderman_ fights the giant _tortoise_ , he grabs a **straw rope** from the edges of the sumo ring and swings it at his head. However, the _tortoise_ quickly tucks his head back into his shell to avoid the blow (hence no head on the _tortoise_ ).
column7: 3) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 2-4-2007(30): A **straw rope** is made from _threads_ and has about the thickness of an _eel_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 22-9-2008(21): Our friendly neighborhood _Spider-Man_ takes off the **straw rope** that was _binding_ the _tortoise_.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-4-2008(13): _Spiderman's_ threads conduct electricity a bit too well, so when he has to bind up _electric eels_ , he just buys some **straw rope** at the post office and shoots it out of his arm. Ouch, that stuff sure leaves a rash.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 5-9-2006(287): In its **infancy** , a butterfly is protected by a _cocoon_ , as it doesn't yet have any _power_ of its own.
column6: 2) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 26-10-2006(52): During their **infancy** , children are often wrapped up tight like a _cocoon_ (i.e. in those Snugli carriers) and supported by the _muscle_ of their parents.
column7: 3) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 13-6-2006(38): During **INFANCY** the moth in its COCOON gains its POWER.
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-5-2007(21): In **infancy** it is the struggle to break out of the _cocoon_ that develops a butterfly's _muscles_.
column9: 5) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 30-9-2009(15): Your **infancy** starts when you have enough _power_ to break your _cocoon_ (amniotic sac).

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 16-12-2006(228): Column of walking legs (caterpillar) getting into a cocoon, about to leave its past self **behind**.
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 30-5-2007(75): **after** a grub _goes_ through the _cocoon_ stage, it leaves its _walking legs_ **behind** for a life of flight.
column7: 3) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 14-1-2008(67): Think of a _column_ of ants moving to a new nest. The soldiers are in front. The workers are **behind** carrying the _cocoons_ on their long _walking legs_.
column8: 4) [[angerman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/angerman)] 18-11-2009(23): Better get _going_ , there's a _cocoon_ on _walking legs_ **behind** us!
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-12-2007(23): Lookout _The Flash_! There's an evil _cocoon_ _walking_ **behind** you!

column3: _Two cocoons_ . . . _mountain_. Observe how the two vertical strokes of _the mountain_ are extended upwards to serve as a kind of enclosure.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-12-2007(184): The villagers haven't the **faint** est idea that giant _coccoons_ resting in the _mountain_ are soon to hatch.
column6: 2) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 24-5-2006(100): Frodo and Sam **faint** ed in the mountains and the spider wrapped them in cacoons.
column7: 3) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 23-6-2008(72): Hint: this is **faint** as in dim, weak or indistinct, not the verb.
column8: 4) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 5-11-2006(41): **Two cocoons** set out to climb a **mountain** , but they get separated. They shout to each other, but their voices, blocked by the mountain, are so _faint_. Notice that the first stroke of **mountain** is first, followed by the 2 **cocoons** , then the conclusion of **mountain**.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 21-1-2009(35): Two people wrapped in their sleeping bags like _cocoons_ are **seclude** d in the _mountains_ and can't hear the **faint** est sound.

column4: * As a primitive, this kanji will mean an _abacus_ , the bead-instrument used in the Orient to calculate _how many_.
column5: 1) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 30-10-2007(286): At the Mexican _fiesta_ , there is a _coccoon_ eating competition. **How many** _coccoons_ can one _person_ eat? No one has managed more than two before giving up…
column6: 2) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 7-3-2006(43): **How many** went to the party? Two aliens and one person (I feel sorry for that person).
column7: 3) [[Justin42](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Justin42)] 20-8-2009(33): It is a little awkward when you are at a _fiesta_ and the host serves some rare delicacy, like moth _cocoons_ , the guests must decide **how many** it would be polite to eat. You do the math in your head and it comes out to two _cocoons_ per _person_. This is why the horizontal line is a fraction bar with two _cocoons_ on the top, and one _person_ the bottom.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-2-2007(18): There's a _cocoon_ on each side of the entrance to the _fiesta_ that can detect when a person crosses the threshold. They are the two _cocoon_ s that determine **how many** people are attending the fiesta. So **how many** were there? The answer is displayed on an **abacus**.
column9: 5) [[MRT88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MRT88)] 30-11-2009(16): At the Mexican _fiesta_ , there is a _cocoon_ eating competition. **How many** _cocoons_ can _Mr.T_ eat? Mr.T currently holds the record at two. Took misha's and edited for Mr. T purposes.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 22-10-2006(261): An _abacus_ is a **mechanism** made of _wood_ used to calculate _how many_ 'anythings'.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 14-1-2008(75): To avoid confusing with [contraption](../v4/677.html) (#677 械), focus on the "ism" of **mechanism**. For example, fetishism refers to having a fetish, **mechanism** here refers to having a mecha-like property, where mecha is a type of anime robot that can transform itself. Imagine a mecha that can transform itself between two forms: a huge immovable _tree_ (as a form of defense) and a gigantic marching _abacus_ that smashes enemies between its giant beads.
column7: 3) [[Hinode](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hinode)] 12-2-2009(39): [synewave]An _abacus_ is a **mechanism** made of _wood_ used to calculate _how many_ 'anythings'. Important geek note: This is used as the counter for your remaining lives in video games, as it also means chance/opportunity.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 28-4-2007(18): Tolkien's ents are actually ancient robot-like **mechanism** s made of _wood_. Picture a pilot sitting inside, furiously sliding away at an _abacus_ to steer the ent.
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(14): Uh- oh. You accidentally hit the self-destruct **mechanism** on your _abacus_. You hide behind a _tree_ and wait for the explosion.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(78): People aside, I wonder _how many rice fields_ there are in the **capital suburbs**.
column6: 2) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-1-2009(14): _How many brains_ does it take to run the **capital suburbs**?
column7: 3) [[einahpets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/einahpets)] 28-2-2012(8): This keyword refers to Japan's Kinki Region, a historic name for present-day Kansai. 近畿 きんき Just _how many rice fields_ are in the **capital suburbs**? (The kinky (Kinki) _people_ are hidden in the fields so you can't see them).
column8: 4) [[sulris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sulris)] 18-4-2011(8): The **capital suburbs** were the five areas that around the kyoto nara osaka area that were under direct imperial rule (not ruled by the feudal lords) (the capital being first nara then kyoto) in this time the most important thing was how many rice fields you had. and as the area grew in the large cities that emporer had less and less rice fields (the latter half is not true).
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-10-2007(5): While exploring the capital you come across a _cocoon fiesta_ being held in a _paddyfield_. "There's no space for this kind of thing in the city centre, we must be in the **capital suburbs** ," you think.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-2-2007(164): What could be more **mysterious** than a _cocoon_ in a _top hat_ trying to sneak in…? (Pimitive: _GANDALF_ ).
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-5-2007(97): The invisible man in his _top hat_ and _cocoon_ of white bandages is the most **mysterious** man in the world.
column7: 3) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 17-2-2008(83): As romanrozhok said, this kanji has little to do with **mysterious**. It has the meanings [dark, abstruse, calm] (in Spanish, [moreno and recóndito]). As for the story, the union of a _hat_ and a _coccoon_ is obviously a fakir _turban_. India was maybe an **abstruse** place far away from China. Visualize a **mysterious** , **dark-skinned** fakir with a _turban_ (in **calming** meditation) and the kanji is yours!
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 24-2-2008(30): This kanji does not really mean "mysterious." In fact, out of all the words this kanji in used in, only one, an uncommon word, has that meaning faintly. If you look the kanji up, you will see that it is used in: 玄関 【げんかん】 (n) entranceway, entry hall, (P)–and– 玄米 【げんまい】 (n) unpolished rice, unmilled rice, brown rice, (P) (as well as other "unpolished grains." (EDIT: I removed my story and am using DrJones's story).
column9: 5) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 25-1-2008(10): Even more **mysterious** than this huge alien _cocoon_ is the fact that it is wearing a _top hat_.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 7-11-2006(170): This _mysterious_ _rice field_ grows not only rice, but **livestock** too! Picture little pigs and chickens growing right out of the ground, among the rice plants. How bizarre!
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(122): The **livestock** are disappearing! I've placed _Gandalf_ over the _rice field_ to protect them.
column7: 3) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-4-2006(73): **Livestock** has been mysteriously disappearing from the field. Aliens?
column8: 4) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 18-2-2008(35): Top part, 玄 , means _dark color_. There's a certain _dark-colored_ thing that **livestock** produce that farmers traditionally used as fertilizer on their _rice fields_. What could this _mysterious_ thing be? Mmh…
column9: 5) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 17-1-2008(24): In Japan there is no Bermuda triangle but there is a _mysterious rice field_ where **livestock** disappear.

column5: 1) [[rptb1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rptb1)] 11-11-2005(285): One sneaky farmer wanted to **amass** a large collection of livestock. We all know that cows like to eat flowers, so he planted lines of flowers leading to his own fields. The livestock followed the lines, eating the flowers one by one, and **amass** ed in his field.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 17-12-2006(28): It may seem illogical, but the fact is, you need to plant **flowers** if your aim is to _amass_ **livestock**.
column7: 3) [[eri401](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eri401)] 31-5-2011(21): To keep the difference between **amass** and [gather](../v4/559.html) (#559 集) and [accumulate](../v4/1364.html) (#1364 累), I emphasize the MASS. To **amass** MASSIVE _livestock_ , always feed them _flowers_. They'll get nice and plump. 蓄え = たくわえ = store, reserve, stock, savings.
column8: 4) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 29-2-2008(18): Farmers in Japan grow flowers in the summer and rear livestock in the winter, in this way they **amass** a fortune.
column9: 5) [[kanji_nightmare](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanji_nightmare)] 12-9-2008(12): I **amass** ed so many flowers from my many boyfriends, I had to feed them to my livestock to get rid of them.

column5: 1) [[nyquil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nyquil)] 5-3-2007(145): A magic _bow_ that only _Gandalf_ can yield: there is no **bowstring** on it, and he uses his magic to fire arrows.
column6: 2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 23-6-2006(115): A bow with a mysterious invisible **bowstring**.
column7: 3) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 3-4-2011(28): TIP: This is used for string instruments, **NOT** bow  & arrow. STORY: The greatest master of the violin _bow_ and **bowstring** was the _mysterious_ Paganini… 弦 [つる].
column8: 4) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-5-2007(25): It was always (and still is) a bit _mysterious_ to me just what type of **bowstring** was supposed to be used on Chewbacca's laser bolt cross _bow_.
column9: 5) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 14-11-2007(18): Legolas asks Gandalf to conjure him a new **bowstring**.

column3: _Fingers_ . . . _mysterious_ . . . _turkey_. Note that the _top hat_ is extended across both elements, though it belongs only to the _cocoon_. This means that you may either use _mysterious_  \- as we did here - or take the three elements separately.
column5: 1) [[Proxx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Proxx)] 17-11-2007(252): A _mysterious_ _turkey_ with human _finger_ s wants to **hug** me… I will never go to Tokyo Disneyland again!
column6: 2) [[pupul07](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pupul07)] 14-12-2007(62): Imagine Gandalf **hug** ging a turkey….ouch! It bit off his finger!
column7: 3) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 25-3-2008(33): Ok sweetheart, I want you to point your finger at the mysterious turkey who **hug** ged you inappropriately.
column8: 4) [[felicitygreen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/felicitygreen)] 18-3-2006(20): As you peer even more closely at the _top-hat_ clad _cocoon_ from frame 1383 you realise that it's actually ET in disguise, back on earth for Christmas (carrying a _turkey_ from his home planet), and holding out a luminescent brown _finger_ towards you. You leap up and give him a **hug**.
column9: 5) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 13-11-2006(17): You can also break this into primitives as conjecture with mysterious stuck in the middle (I have enough finger and turkey primitives going through my head that I don't need any more…). As you **hug** your loved one who's going off on a mysterious mission, your conjecture is that you won't see them again.

column3: _Water_ . . . double- _mysterious_. Note the doubling up of the element for _top hat_ in the primitive for _mysterious_ and assign it a special image, as it will come up in the next two frames.
column5: 1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-8-2006(198): Water is doubly mysterious. It's in all our nourishment…and yet, it's really not **nourishing** at all.
column6: 2) [[Okonomiyaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Okonomiyaki)] 24-5-2008(113): Going off the idea of the right side meaning rapid growth/increase of small objects, I've decided to make the right side be _Gremlins_ , those little _mysterious_ creatures that _double_ rapidly. _Gremlins_ find _water_ a little too **nourishing** , as it makes them instantly multiply.
column7: 3) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 7-1-2008(40): Because _Siamese twins_ need twice as much fluid as their single body produces, the most **nourishing** thing they can have is _water_.
column8: 4) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 29-7-2006(30): It’s _doubly mysterious_ how _water_ can be so **nourishing** —it doesn’t seem to have any substance and yet we would die without it.
column9: 5) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 24-5-2006(22): Gandalf ([mysterious](../v4/1383.html) (#1383 玄)) finds **nourishing** water that reflects an evil double Gandalf looming beneath the surface.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 13-6-2006(158): **Mercy** comes from the doubly mysterious heart of God.
column6: 2) [[mullr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mullr)] 20-1-2009(93): Two gremlins are atop a victim, tearing out his heart while he begs for **mercy**.
column7: 3) [[Fluhk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Fluhk)] 9-6-2006(57): Here we see the DOUBLE-MYSTERIOUS Siamese twins again, at the **MERCY** of the machines that pump blood through their veins, since the single HEART they share won't do the job…
column8: 4) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 24-5-2006(24): Gandalf ([mysterious](../v4/1383.html) (#1383 玄)) shows no **mercy** and rips his evil double's heart out. Instead of destroying evil, his malevolent act has merged the two of them into the grey Gandalf.
column9: 5) [[atylmo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atylmo)] 30-3-2009(23): **Mercy** is a _doubly mysterious_ turn of the _heart_. On the one hand, everybody wants it, but on the other hardly anybody gives it.

column5: 1) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 9-10-2007(202): A **magnet** is a _rock_ with two sides, one that _mysteriously_ pushes and one that pulls, doubly mysterious. (see astridtops' story).
column6: 2) [[arrogantape](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/arrogantape)] 17-7-2012(49): STONE + BAND OF NIGGERS: Band of niggers throwing rocks. Now that's a police **magnet**.
column7: 3) [[mullr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mullr)] 20-1-2009(39): The gremlins have this mysterious rock the use to attract yet more gremlins.
column8: 4) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 22-6-2007(35): I found some _stones_ on the _siamese twins_. Turns out the _stones_ were **magnetic** , and they weren't _siamese twins_ at all!
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 16-7-2006(32): In the old days, people didn't know what **magnet** s were. They just thought of them as _stones_ that were _double mysterious_.

column3: The single stroke added to the beginning of the primitive for _thread_ gives the image of threads woven into a single cord. Hence the meaning, **lineage**.
column4: * As a primitive, we shall give this kanji the meaning of _yarn_ , as the uniting of many threads into a single strand is most obvious with _yarn_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(281): (Primitive: _DNA_ , a drop of looong spiraled thread that is the key to your **lineage** ).
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 6-2-2008(95): Spiderman's **lineage** (who his family is etc…) can be found in his DNA in a drop of blood. The villain that gets blood of Spidey will be able to find out who is family and **lineage** is. be carfefull spidey…
column7: 3) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 25-1-2008(26): A single _drop_ of your blood holds the proof of the unbroken _thread_ of your **lineage**.
column8: 4) [[cleber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cleber)] 16-7-2009(11): One _drop_ of _Venom_ 's blood created a **lineage** of evil spiders.
column9: 5) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 5-6-2009(10): Your **lineage** can be found in your DNA, a loooong molecular _thread_ that can pulled from a single _drop_ of blood.

column5: 1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 17-11-2007(197): _Mister T_ gets a _DNA_ test, and discovers that he was meant to be the **person in charge** after all.
column6: 2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 5-6-2007(77): The **person in charge** usually must come from a long standing _lineage_ of persons in charge.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-2-2007(26): _Mr. T_ is the **person in charge** of the _DNA_ research center.
column8: 4) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 5-6-2007(13): _chuck norris_ is always the **person in charge**! it's written in his _DNA_!
column9: 5) [[mr_hans_moleman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mr_hans_moleman)] 6-11-2008(12): We think we have control over our own lives. But our DNA is the **PERSON IN CHARGE**. Our DNA controls our looks, and basically who we are.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-2-2007(183): Your **grandchild** is the child of your _DNA_.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 27-1-2008(132): Your _child_ continues the family _lineage_ by passing on your _DNA_ , giving you a **grandchild**.
column7: 3) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 12-3-2006(25): **Grandchild** is a kid of your directe lineage.
column8: 4) [[tinuviel228](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tinuviel228)] 8-7-2008(10): I didn't find out that child was my **grandchild** until I got a DNA test… I didn't even know I had a child until I got a DNA test for that matter!
column9: 5) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 5-7-2009(6): The child took a DNA test and found out that he was his own **grandchild**. "What the fuck?! This doesn't even make sense with time travel involved. How did you figure this out with a DNA test anyway?".

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(201): The _prefecture_ has **suspend** ed all _DNA_ research for _heart_ disease because of corruption. All involved will be **suspend** ed by their wrists.
column6: 2) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 12-1-2010(95): In a very racist _prefecture_ of Japan, they screen everyone's _DNA_. If they find out you are of a different _lineage_ , they rip out your _heart_ and **suspend** it in the Hall of Shame.
column7: 3) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 23-6-2008(47): Hint: **suspend** as in hang up.
column8: 4) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 11-9-2007(39): The prefecture has **suspend** ed all research into inheritable (lineage) heart disease.
column9: 5) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 19-7-2009(38): **Suspend** ed in the middle of the _prefecture_ is a chart of the area's _lineage_. But, since this is Japan, it has to be cute, so the chart has been covered with little _hearts_.

column5: 1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 4-2-2008(66): My parents aren't at all **modest** about their _grandchildren_ , at every opportunity they take them on the _road_ showing them off to their friends!
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 11-7-2009(36): He wasn't at all **modest** when telling us about his _grandchildren_ \- "They're all on the _road_ to success" he said.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 17-1-2010(24): Swift wrote in "A **Modest** Proposal" that Ireland should solve its economic problems by collecting the nation's _grandchildren_ from off the _streets_ and eating them.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 17-1-2007(8): When grandparents take their grandchildren out on the _road_ , they want them to be **modest** little children.
column9: 5) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 30-11-2009(4): To instill a **MODEST** mindset in his GRANDCHILD, the grandpa sent him down the ROAD to find work instead of just giving him money.

column5: 1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 31-1-2007(428): [instead, on the contrary, rather] _Gone_ is the time for _stamps_ \- use e-mail **instead**.
column6: 2) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(47): We use e-mail now **instead** of regular mail. My e-mail is _gone_ before you can even put a _stamp_ on your snail mail.
column7: 3) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 23-3-2007(18): If you tried to attach money to an envelope to pay for postage it would be GONE before it arrived at the post office. That's why we use STAMPS **instead**.
column8: 4) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 16-2-2008(9): Having accidentally sent his children a home made sex video **instead** of the family Christmas tape, the man ran to the post office to switch packages. "I'm sorry sir, but your package was _gone_ moments after you paid for the _stamp_.".
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-1-2006(9): Lick soiled-elbow **instead** of stamp ?

column3: _Part of the body_ . . . _instead_. This character has more or less the same meaning as that for _leg_ learned back in frame 1372. It can also indicate the part of the legs from the **shins** down, which explains the choice of the key word.
column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 5-6-2007(266): **Shins** are the _part of the body_ that Japanese traditionally sit on _instead_ of their asses.
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 12-10-2007(204): **Shins** are the _part of the body_ that one uses _instead of_ one's eyes, for finding furniture in the dark. (Ouch!).
column7: 3) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 22-2-2006(27): This is one of the key aspects of soccer. At the beginning of every game you start by trying to kick the opponent's **shins** , their _flesh, instead_ of the ball (lets them know you mean business).
column8: 4) [[etpan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/etpan)] 10-8-2010(19): In Western countries, women show who want to show a _part of their body_ usually show cleavage. In Japan, they show their **shins** _instead_.
column9: 5) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 11-11-2007(7): When you want to say **shins** you can use this kanji for that _part of the body_ _instead_ of the kanji for leg.

column3: The left primitive is a union of _a horse_ and _footprint_. To the right, the _stamp_.
column5: 1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 14-6-2006(282): Selling **WHOLESALE** HORSES over the internet had to be STOPPED because the cost of STAMPS was too much.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 14-1-2008(62): If you need _horseshoes_ (shoes that fit your _horse_ 's _footprint_ ), buy them at the **wholesale** shop. They lick and paste _stamps_ in your membership card so you can get free merchandise later.
column7: 3) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 5-5-2009(28): A horse as a **wholesale** r: It _stamps_ every contract with its _horse-footprint_ (horseshoe) since it obviously can't write with its hooves.
column8: 4) [[SuzuBell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SuzuBell)] 18-2-2011(14): **Wholesale** refers to the sale of goods in quantity to retailers for resale. When this kanji was invented, large loads of goods needed to be transported by _horses_ who left steep _footprints_ because of the weight they carried. The **wholesale** goods needed a special _stamp_ to indicate that they were legal for resale. See [honorable](../v4/1398.html) (#1398 御).
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 30-4-2007(13): At Costco you can buy horses **wholesale**. Just remember that they charge you by the size of the _horse's footprint_ , and you need to bring your own _stamps_ for delivery.

column5: 1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 9-6-2007(207): An **honorable** man will not try to cut in front of the _line_ at the _wholesale_ stamp store. (Imagine just how much honor it takes facing those long lines at the post office!).
column6: 2) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 5-5-2007(68): In front of the COLUMNS of the Capitol, the **HONORABLE** congressmen can be bought WHOLESALE.
column7: 3) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 17-1-2008(40): When buying wholesale the **honorable** thing to do would be to wait in line like everyone else.
column8: 4) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 31-12-2008(27): Salesman: "I'm _going_ to do the **honorable** thing and sell you this item _wholesale_.".
column9: 5) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 30-6-2007(12): _The Flash_ , being an **honorable** person, zoomed around Costco _wholesale_ helping everyone quickly find everything. (They honored him by using 御 (ご) a lot in their speech. [御ゆっくり、御めん](midori://search?text=御ゆっくり、御めん) etc.).

column3: _Flesh_ . . . _stamp_ . . . _crotch_. Note how the _stamp_ is stretched out here.
column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 24-1-2007(359): It's customary to cover the _flesh_ with **clothing** , but some designs are so outrageous they're not bigger than a _stamp_ that just covers your _crotch_.
column6: 2) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 11-1-2009(74): Modern **clothing** shows a lot of _flesh_ – some is practically no more than a _postage stamp_ covering your _crotch_!
column7: 3) [[Fluhk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Fluhk)] 9-6-2006(16): The latest hype in **CLOTHING** , straight from the catwalk - models covered in STAMPS, revealing FLESH only at the CROTCH - hot!!!
column8: 4) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 15-8-2009(9): On TV, people with no **clothing** on, _meat_ swinging freely, have a black bar _stamped_ on their _crotch_. ======.
column9: 5) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 1-1-2009(9): The PART OF THE BODY that you must STAMP **clothing** on, no matter what, is your CROTCH!

column3: This character connotes life in general, but also the particular life that is **fated** one by virtue of the distinctive character with which one is born. Its elements are: _fit_ . . . _stamp_. The bottom portion of _fit_ is nudged to the left in order to make room for the _stamp_.
column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 1-6-2007(240): When you're born, your **fate** is measured, _fitted_ , and _stamped_ onto your soul. Good luck defying it.
column6: 2) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 19-7-2009(109): It is your **fate** to _meet_ with a _mouth_ , young _postage stamp_.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 30-6-2007(25): It is my **fate** /life to _fit_ _stamps_ together.
column8: 4) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 21-1-2009(19): Was it **fate** that I was born with an _umbrella_ hair-do, an _unibrow_ , no pupils, and an eye shaped like a _stamp_?
column9: 5) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 20-3-2009(15): Your **FATE** is sealed with your first kiss! (meeting of mouths). Just imagine a STAMP between the mouths that are meeting in the kiss…..(thanks CharleyGarret).

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 30-4-2007(208): (re: dingomick) "These are your **orders** ," declares the general while passing out documents at the _meeting_. As everyone started to leave, the general exclaims "Oh wait! I need to certify these **orders**!" and went around stamping each paper with his personal _chop-seal_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-2-2007(73): "These are your **orders** ," declares the general at the _meeting_ as he stamps them with his _chop-seal_. (Primitive: chop-seal imaged as a papal ring, the one's they would press into wax as their official seal. Also a cattle brand.).
column7: 3) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 29-4-2009(52): Take note that this is written differently from how it looks in the typed font. See: <http://kakijun.main.jp/> for the next kanji or [http://www.saiga-jp.com/cgi- bin/dic.cgi?m=search&sc=0&f=0&j=%E4%BB%A4&g=&e=&s=&rt=0&start=1&sid=1240981825_91321](http://www.saiga- jp.com/cgi- bin/dic.cgi?m=search&sc=0&f=0&j=%E4%BB%A4&g=&e=&s=&rt=0&start=1&sid=1240981825_91321), for example.
column8: 4) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 4-7-2007(36): I assigned this the primitive meaning of President Bush, giving crazy **orders** and letting everything go to his head.
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 27-5-2009(10): At the _meeting_ the chairman put a _chop-seal_ mark on the official **orders**.

column5: 1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 7-5-2006(304): The amount of people that can order the rain to rain.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(46): Despite the _rain_ , the **zero** pilot flies on. He has kamikaze _orders_.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 28-1-2008(34): **Zero** from Code Geas gives his _orders_ , and as usual there's a _rain_ of bullets and blood.
column8: 4) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 9-12-2008(26): When it RAINS out, the ice cream store gets **ZERO** ORDERS.
column9: 5) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 4-7-2007(16): _President Bush_ 's **zero** -tolerance policies even apply towards the _rain_. He tries to _order_ it around, as if it'll do any good…

column3: This character is used to express the years of one's **age**. Its elements: _teeth_ . . . _orders_.
column5: 1) [[willmerry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/willmerry)] 25-7-2006(268): You know you are fast approaching a ripe old **AGE** when you get ORDERS from the dentist to get new TEETH.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(25): "Pull all their _teeth_ to count their **age**!" _orders_ the insane Nazi general.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 15-12-2009(18): _Teeth_ are an indicator of **age** : 1) None = baby, 2) milk teeth = child, 3) 2nd teeth = adult, 4) False = old. 1~3 are on _orders_ from God, 4 is on _orders_ from your dentist.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 7-2-2008(15): 'What is your **age** Mr President' Bush opens his mouth and starts counting his teeth. (You role your eyes and expect him to say 32) '62' Bush says. Did he pull a joke on you are does he have trouble counting?
column9: 5) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 8-9-2008(8): At your **age** false TEETH are the ORDER of the day.

column5: 1) [[samueruht](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samueruht)] 31-1-2008(262): To keep your water **cool** , just _order_ some _ice_.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 30-6-2007(67): The Japanese boss gives an _order_ at the meeting: eat _ice_ to stay **cool** (since they won't be running the air conditioning anymore).
column7: 3) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 4-7-2007(39): _President Bush_ 's drink isn't **cool** enough, and the Whitehouse is out of _ice_. "Time to invade Alaska!", _President Bush_ says. "But sir… we already own it!".
column8: 4) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 23-6-2007(24): My superior says to me, "You need to **cool** off, and that's an _order_!" Just for emphasis, he dumps a bunch of ice cubes on my head.
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 30-8-2008(6): Vanilla _Ice_ _orders_ you to stay **cool**.

column5: 1) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 18-9-2007(246): Two cowboys are crossing a state limit. One says to him “Did you know that in this **Jurisdiction** there are Orders to get your head?”, so he takes out his gun and shoots him. He claims the reward afterwards. (Thanks Fuaburisu).
column6: 2) [[phauna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/phauna)] 19-2-2008(97): _Orders_ are given by the _head_ person in any **jurisdiction**.
column7: 3) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 4-7-2007(31): _President Bush_ , with his swelled _head_ , thinks everything is under his **jurisdiction**.
column8: 4) [[Talka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Talka)] 10-9-2007(23): You're outside of your **jurisdiction** , Johnson! Show me your orders or I'll have your head.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-5-2006(17): **Jurisdiction** just makes me think of "sheriff". So my story takes place in the **jurisdiction** of some sheriff. The sheriff goes into a bar and calls the waitress. He looks at one of those "WANTED" posters, with the portrait of a criminal he's been trying to catch for such a long time. When asked for his _orders_ , still staring intently at the picture, he says : "I want the _head_ of that guy on a plate, yep, right now!". The waitress scurried away and brought him just that : _orders_ with a _head_.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 13-6-2006(243): Some restaurants have a small gold bell to call someone to take customers' orders.
column6: 2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 25-2-2008(122): In high society, people ring a **small** _golden_ **bell** to call their servants and give their _orders_.
column7: 3) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 4-7-2007(20): _President Bush_ has a **small bell**. It's made of _gold_. And everytime he has an _order_ to give, he rings it to summon someone to write it down.
column8: 4) [[Wosret](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wosret)] 30-11-2008(9): I use a **small golden bell** to issue **orders** to my underlings!
column9: 5) [[SuzuBell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SuzuBell)] 21-2-2011(6): This kanji refers to the _golden_ , **small bell** s ( 鈴 =すず) that people ring at Shinto Shrines to communicate with gods who give [orders](../v4/1401.html) (#1401 令) on how to acquire authority and repel evil spirits!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-5-2006(206): I imagined some kind of initiation rite in old China, where every young _man_ has to show his **courage**. They then receive a _chopseal_ which is a mark of their **courage**.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 28-1-2008(76): Re: fuaburisu - The initiation rite in question is actually a reverse elbow chop to the _brain_ , and you receive the _chop seal_ if you have the _power_ to withstand it. This initial imagery helps me with the altered _chop seal_ and vertical placement.
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 6-6-2008(62): A **MA** （マ） raises a **man** to have **courage**.
column8: 4) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 20-4-2010(39): After showing sufficient **courage** , the young _male_ gets a マ marked on their forehead with a hanko, to show they are now a マン.
column9: 5) [[shinyclef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shinyclef)] 4-6-2009(18): **Note:** Interesting kanji. It's actually not マ + 男 , but rather, this is an abbreviated form of 甬 + 力 , which gives it more of a meaning of 'path of power' or 'run through with power' or something like that. But if you don't care about the real origins and formation, either way of thinking of it works ^-^. (Source: <http://tinyurl.com/oj4jes> \+ <http://tinyurl.com/rcmnss>). **Story:** To have **courage** is to _run through_ (甬) with _power_. When that happens, a マ becomes a man ( 男 ). (Thx Captal).

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 25-3-2007(91): The _courageous_ man who went into the _water_ to save a drowning victim couldn't be seen, except by the air that **bubbled up**.
column6: 2) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 2-6-2009(29): **Bubble up** the WATER and see who has the COURAGE to jump into it.
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-7-2008(15): [+astrid] A very _courageous_ man dove to the bottom of the _water_ to save someone who had fallen in (and couldn't swim). The whole crowd was watching..30 seconds…a minute…1:20…are they both dead? Suddenly, a huge bubble rose to the surface, with the nearly-drowned victim - he **bubble** d **up** to the surface, in a bubble blown by the _courageous_ man! And then soon after, the hero him self **bubble** d **up**. What a great story!
column8: 4) [[einahpets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/einahpets)] 28-2-2012(4): _Water_ **bubbling up** is like a metaphor for being _courageous_ , having a strength that will **bubble up** in times of need.
column9: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 25-8-2009(3): Think of the first time someone has to **bubble up** enough _courage_ to take that first step into the _water_.

column3: _Chop-seal_ . . . _utilize_ . . . _road_. By combining the first two primitives into a single image, you will be able to use that image in a few instances later, one of which comes immediately.
column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 13-2-2008(328): I bounce down the _road_ on my _pogo stick_ , easily getting through the dense **traffic**. (Note: New primitive: chop-seal + utilize = pogo stick. Because a _chop-seal_ is long and thin with a rubbery bit at the end. If it were big enough, you could _utilize_ it as a _pogo stick_ ). [Edit: _pogo stick_ also appears in 1409, 1690, 2530].
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 7-7-2006(45): Building on gorgon's story I now change mine to a much more silly and rememberable one. The Chinese police is using a helicopter to check and regulate the **traffic**. Hanging from the helicopter is a huge _chopseal_ that they _utilize_ to mark some of the cars that are causing trouble on the _road_.
column7: 3) [[stshores24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stshores24)] 3-9-2008(22): **MA** （マ） drinks one too many _screwdriver_ s and then drives off down the _road_. Unfortunately, she's so inebriated she causes a **traffic** accident.
column8: 4) [[jotun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jotun)] 1-6-2008(12): They have built a new road downtown. It bypasses all the **traffic**. If your papers have been _chop seal_ ed, you can _utilize_ it.
column9: 5) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 20-11-2007(8): Same as Katsuo, but I remember "utilize" better as "philips screw driver". A long _screw driver_ with a _chop-seal_ on the end makes an interesting _pogo stick_.

column5: 1) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 20-11-2007(169): The winner of the long **jump** competition was disqualified when they found he used a _pogo stick_ tied to his _leg_ to **jump** further.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 7-11-2009(106): The high **jump** er has his _wooden leg_ fitted with a _pogo stick_ , and can now **jump** even higher. (See my note at [traffic](../v4/1408.html) (#1408 通) for _pogo stick_ ). EDIT (2 years later): Keyword "jump" leads to confusion later on (see cjon256's post), **"Dancing"** would be better (but be sure to keep it distinct from [dance](../v4/1774.html) (#1774 舞)). New Story: I was no good at **dancing** due to my _wooden leg_ … until I had it fitted with a _pogo stick_!
column7: 3) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 27-6-2006(54): This is totally wrong. It doesn't mean "jump", it means "dance"! 踊 [jump](../v4/1409.html) (#1409 踊) and 曜 [leap](../v4/1285.html) (#1285 躍) are homonyms, so it is easy to become permanently confused about which one DOES NOT mean "jump/leap". Caveat Lector! Note: 舞 [dance](../v4/1774.html) (#1774 舞) is quite a bit rarer (and not a homonym).
column8: 4) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 29-4-2009(40): Heisig is triiippppiiiin'. This means dance, not **jump**. I named the other "dance" kanji "interpretive dance" because it is used in all sorts of concepts figuratively related to dance, like stages, fluttering, etc. One of my _legs is wooden_ , the other is a _pogo stick_. Surprisingly, I'm actually a pretty good at **dancing**.
column9: 5) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 27-8-2007(19): My wooden leg has a chop-seal at the end, but I have to **jump** so as to utilize it (so the chop-seal hits the right spot from above).

column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(30): She sure was _unlucky_! First of all, her car went off the **cliff** , right? column3: _Receipt_ . . . _stamp_ . . . and _a drop_ in each side to represent a little smear of **egg** yoke. The third stroke is drawn slightly higher to close the **egg** up tightly and keep the yoke inside.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-3-2007(207): The _Easter Bunny_ dropped an **egg** on my desk and got yolk all over my _receipts_ and _stamps_.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 1-7-2007(27): The Easter Bunny ( _hare_ ) drops a few _drops_ of **egg** yolk while hiding easter **Egg** s.
column7: 3) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 11-2-2008(22): The Easter Bunny is hiding an easter **EGG** in each of its ears.
column8: 4) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 5-3-2009(15): Sorry folks, but this looks like a pictogram of male private parts, with dots marking the **egg** -shaped bits.
column9: 5) [[Medialis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Medialis)] 8-4-2010(12): Simple: Pictogram of the cracking of an **egg**. One half in each hand.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-3-2007(322): Got a _receipt_ for that _dagger_ , son? If not, we're going to **detain** you and send you to work in the _rice fields_.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 8-11-2007(89): The use of RANSOM NOTE (think of a receipt with a dagger through it on a door) works great with **DETAIN**. Here the RANSOM NOTE says that the girl has been **DETAIN** ED in an undisclosed location. To get her back take the RANSOM to a empty FIELD.
column7: 3) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 3-8-2006(41): "We're **detain** ing you because we found a receipt on you for this dagger we found in the brain of the man your wife was having an affair with. Care to explain?".
column8: 4) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 28-12-2008(15): The 留学生 【りゅうがくせい】went over to Japan on an international exchange program, but on his way from the airport he was **detained** by slave traders! They took his student-visa _receipts_ and kept him under _knife point_ working in the _rice fields_.
column9: 5) [[Beneus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beneus)] 15-7-2009(9): We finally have enough evidence to **detain** the susppect. The _knife_ used in the murder was found in his _rice field' out back, and the_ receipt* for it was in his desk drawer.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-1-2008(88): “The _king_ has been _detained_ by some marines!” “How do you know they were marines?” “Because they were wearing **marine blue**.”.
column6: 2) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 5-11-2010(13): 瑠璃 =琉璃, 浄瑠璃 , 瑠璃色 , 瑠璃唐草 [marine blue](../v4/2555.html) (#2555 瑠) ル, リュウ … Parts: 王 , 留 [detain](../v4/1423.html) (#1423 留) … Note: 瑠 [marine blue](../v4/2555.html) (#2555 瑠), 琉 [lapis lazuli](../v4/2557.html) (#2557 琉) both mean Lapis Lazuli … Story: The Exchange Students ( 留学生 ) in Japan are popular as Kings because they got **Marine Blue** Jewels for eyes.
column7: 3) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 2-1-2012(7): The _king_ has _detained_ you for wearing **marine blue** underwear!! (Don't expect this to make sense, that's the same king that requested to see your balls after all…).
column8: 4) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 9-7-2010(4): The _king_ was _detained_ , by men in **marine blue** , Must be the marines, planning a coup. (thx Katsuo/gavmck).
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 6-2-2013(1): The corpse of the _king_ of terror was _detained_ for a burial in the **marine blue** sea (don't confuse with [navy blue](../v4/1758.html) (#1758 紺)).

column3: _Receipt_ . . . _dagger_ . . . _shells_. Though the meanings are related, do not confuse with _make a deal_ (Frame 471) or _wholesale_ (Frame 1499).
column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 3-5-2007(188): There's a buyback program where you can **trade** in your _dagger_ for _money_. But it's quite ineffective, since only registered dagger-owners with the _original receipts_ can participate, and not criminals with illegally-purchased daggers.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 8-11-2007(74): The new RANSOM note (a receipt stuck to a door with a dagger) from DETAIN (1423) appears again (probably after you went to the field as instructed) now gives instruction to **TRADE** the victim for CURRENCY you were told to bring.
column7: 3) [[Proxx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Proxx)] 4-2-2008(51): Here is my _receipt_ and here is my _dagger_. Now give me my _money_ back! Isn't that a fair **trade**?
column8: 4) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 17-5-2009(22): A fair **trade** means some _shells_ (money) and a _receipt_. An unfair **trade** (robbery) means a _dagger_ and no _receipt_.
column9: 5) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 26-3-2007(12): [trade, exchange] The ancient tools-of-the- **trade** for trading are: _receipts_ , _shells_ and a _dagger_ (to persuade a trading part that refuses to give the first or the second).

column3: At last we come to the general character meaning **stamp**. Its elements: _staples_ . . . _stamp_.
column5: 1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-8-2006(275): Before sticky backs, they had to staple **stamp** s to letters.
column6: 2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 10-3-2008(88): Aaaagh, this old **stamp** doesn't _stick_! Okay I'll just _staple_ it.
column7: 3) [[breravin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/breravin)] 8-6-2010(31): A **stamp** for the 印 velope of course!
column8: 4) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 14-3-2009(27): If you are sending a letter from IN-dia [this Kanji is used for the country name], staple the **stamp** to your letter, or it might get steamed off and resold. イン 印刷 いんさつ(printing).
column9: 5) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 21-5-2008(13): Staple and **stamp** , staple and **stamp** : the life of your average Japanese いんかん（ 印鑑 ） wielding office worker.

column3: The image here is of _back-to-back staples_. The **mortar** referred to in this key word is a stone or wooden basin used for grinding with a pestle.
column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 9-8-2006(69): I removed all the _back to back staples_ and grinded them in a **mortar** to create metal dust.
column6: 2) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 10-9-2008(55): The **mortar** bomb exploded, ripping the sun in half.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 21-3-2011(20): 臼歯 [mortar](../v4/2063.html) (#2063 臼)キュウ，うす … Parts: Back to back Staples… Or Cracked 白 (cf. 興味 [entertain](../v4/1426.html) (#1426 興), 輿入れ [palanquin](../v4/2860.html) (#2860 輿), 新潟 ) … Note: this is simplified to 旧 in the Joyo characters. Ex: 児 =兒[newborn babe](../v4/58.html) (#58 児), 稲 =稻[rice plant](../v4/910.html) (#910 稲), but not in 潟 [lagoon](../v4/2039.html) (#2039 潟) because it is a traditional place name (Niigata). In non-Joyo, the characters are written both ways: 焔 [flames](../v4/2546.html) (#2546 焔) is often written 焰. … Note2: Stroke order varies since it is not Joyo.
column8: 4) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 26-3-2010(13): I went pictograph with this one: a _cracked white rice grain_ –one that has been bashed in a **mortar**.
