column8: 4) [[squeaky_lill_mk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/squeaky_lill_mk)] 26-8-2010(17): New primitive: Death, the Discworld's Grim **Reap** er: <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_>(Discworld) for [hope](../v4/1489.html) (#1489 希), [villain](../v4/1490.html) (#1490 凶), [kill](../v4/1493.html) (#1493 殺), [ward](../v4/1696.html) (#1696 区) The X is the movement of the **Reap** er's sword. _Death_ uses his _sword_ to **reap** some lives, as in this video: <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oJ_0z_a0LI0> (starting from 03:40).
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 19-9-2006(11): _X_ marks the spot where you sweep your _blade_ to **reap** the harvest.

column3: The key word here is the noun meaning "a breif moment." Its elements: _sheaf_ . . . _tree_ . . . _saber_.
column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(43): _Wolverine_ waiting atop a _tree_ to spring down on _Sabre_ tooth at any **moment**.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-1-2007(25): The kendo artist takes a brief **moment** to practice his skills: he throws _sheafs_ over the _tree_ and tries to cut them with his _saber_ when they come down again.
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 1-1-2009(15): Wtf **moment**? This kanji means temple. Wooden x-men statues with sabres guard the entrance to the Professor Xavier temple. Might help if you imagine the two x-men as Wolverine and Sabretooth.
column8: 4) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 5-7-2009(11): You pray in a **temple** (see herman) when you suddenly hear the sound of cracking _wood_. You know that _Wolverine_ lurks around and that he will try to [kill](../v4/1493.html) (#1493 殺) you in a few **moment** s. "Shit! I should have taken my missle launcher with me!" You draw your _sabre_ and prepare for the attack.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 6-2-2013(7): Kendo artist takes a **moment** in the **temple** before tossing _sheafs_ over the _tree_ and slicing them with his _sabre_ as they came back down.

column5: 1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 20-6-2006(176): Wolverine (sheaf, see [reap](../v4/1488.html) (#1488 刈)) **hope** s they invent linen sheets that he won't keep shredding in his sleep.
column6: 2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 12-11-2006(130): "I **hope** this works," you say as you stuff a _sheaf_ of stalks under your blanket but above your _linens_. Your real **hope** is that your parents don't find out that you left the house.
column7: 3) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 21-1-2008(58): Most people outside the first world **hope** only for food and clothing - a _sheaf_ of wheat, a bolt of _linen_.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 9-2-2008(33): The Grim Reaper showes up before you. You still have **hope** to escape. You throw some linen over yourself, pretending you are a ghost. Ghosts are already dead right. Grim Reaper:'Humans always have some **hope** to escape me…funny' SCHLING… the last sound you here.
column9: 5) [[squeaky_lill_mk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/squeaky_lill_mk)] 15-8-2010(11): Seeing _Death_ (see my stories for [reap](../v4/1488.html) (#1488 刈), [villain](../v4/1490.html) (#1490 凶), [kill](../v4/1493.html) (#1493 殺), [ward](../v4/1696.html) (#1696 区)) towering over his bed, a person hides under the _linen_ **hoping** that _Death_ would just go away. But it is **hope** less.

column5: 1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 12-6-2006(168): Wolverine (sheaf, see [reap](../v4/1488.html) (#1488 刈)) takes out a **villain** who can't be cut by smacking the crap out of him with a shovel.
column6: 2) [[adhmm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adhmm)] 18-11-2007(152): Here the **villain** digs a hole with a shovel and covers it with a sheaf, hoping someone will fall in.
column7: 3) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 27-7-2007(34): Note: the stroke order is actually: sheaf, shovel.
column8: 4) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 4-8-2006(15): The **villain** uses a _shovel_ to hide his victim under a pile of _sheafs_ , before making a quick getaway.
column9: 5) [[squeaky_lill_mk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/squeaky_lill_mk)] 15-8-2010(11): _Death_ (I use Terry Pratchett's _Death_ as a primitive for [reap](../v4/1488.html) (#1488 刈), [hope](../v4/1489.html) (#1489 希), [kill](../v4/1493.html) (#1493 殺), [ward](../v4/1696.html) (#1696 区)) uses a sword ( 刈 ) on kings, a scythe on ordinary folk, and a _shovel_ on **villains**.

column3: Part of the body . . . bound up . . . villain.
column5: 1) [[parisnoneko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/parisnoneko)] 27-9-2006(195): **Bosom** is a Flesh part that should be bound up lest it provoke villian thoughts.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 15-8-2006(114): As you know, female comics _villains_ are always _binding_ the _flesh_ of their **bosom** _up_ in interesting ways. One has to wonder how these clothes stay on their body at all…
column7: 3) [[fergal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fergal)] 27-6-2009(29): Just think of the heroine's **bosom** in a movie. The _villain_ _ties up_ the heroine (to the traintracks or the conveyor belt etc) but her **bosom** is the _body part_ that is always left sticking out.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 1-6-2007(27): Here's an easy way to defeat the bad guy: have Wonder Woman do topless jumping jacks and quickly _bind up the villain_ while he ogles the most seductive _part of her body_ —her **bosom**.
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 5-9-2006(17): In Japanese lyrics, 胸 often refers to one's heart, one's soul. It is the part of one's body (metaphorically speaking) which wraps, according to Christian theology, our evil ways.

column3: _Top hat_ . . . _villain_ . . . _belt_ . . . _elbow_ . . . _turkey_. This is potentially one of the most difficult characters to remember. Tackle it positively and let the image  "sink in" by carrying it around with you today and calling it up in your spare moments.
column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 9-5-2007(295): I've finally met my arch-rival, the evilest of all _villains_. Finally, I'm about to fight him. But what's this? He's suspiciously quiet. I move to attack him, and his right arm falls off at the _elbow_. Strange. I walk up to him and **detach** his left arm. Very strange. I undo his _belt_ , and take off his _top hat_ … BLAST! It was just a decoy _turkey_!
column6: 2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 16-6-2008(135): The most ridiculous character ever dreamt up for a film. **DETACH** O, a top-hat wearing villian who is able to **detach** his body parts for use as weapons. His most powerful weapons are his elbows, which he can **detach** , tie together with his belt and use as nunchucks. **DETACH** O has a sidekick turkey which he uses as an advanced scout as well.
column7: 3) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 17-1-2008(73): I'm surprised no one has worked Oddjob, the _villain_ from the James Bond movie, Goldfinger into their stories. He's the big oriental guy that killed people by throwing his _top hat_ at them. He practises his technique on turkeys, **detach** ing their heads in the process. Being an assassin, he can also kill people by garroting them with his _belt_ or smashing them with his _elbows_.
column8: 4) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 29-5-2009(32): As for the left element - 离 - i think it'd be interesting to read the following wiki-article <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chi_>(mythology). This is _chi_ (in this case _ri_ ) - mythological hornless dragon or _wyvern_. Best to remember it as a primitive, because it appears in a number of rare kanji: 禽 (2049), 璃 (2048), 檎 (2050),擒. Though Heisig defined this element as _sheik_ in RTK3, this is completely arbitrary.
column9: 5) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 1-2-2008(18): This _turkey_ is a _top hat_ -wearing _villain_ , and he keeps his own _elbows_ in his _belt_ , gunslinger style, ready to **detach** them and throw them one after another like boomerangs when necessary.

column3: This kanji refers to one of the seven classical stones of China. Its elements: _jewel_ . . . _top hat_ . . . _villain_ . . . _belt_ . . . _elbow_.
column5: 1) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 11-7-2009(56): The _King_ 's **crystal** got _detached_ from his royal throne, and is missing! Looks like the turkey got away with it. He's no where to be seen!
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 16-9-2007(21): In my story for detatch [detach](../v4/1492.html) (#1492 離), the left side primitive was _junkie_. The top-hatted villian of society with a belt around their elbow. Here, the _junkie_ is getting a fix of **crystal** meth: the _jewel_ in the crown of today's drugs.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 11-10-2008(19): _Michael Jackson_ is the _king_ of pop, wearing his **crystal** rhinestone glove (see [detach](../v4/1492.html) (#1492 離).
column8: 4) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 29-6-2008(14): Primitive: _Sheik_ is too vague for me. How about Prince Ali, Aladdin dressed up like a sheik to impress Princess Jasmine? I'll use Aladdin or Prince Ali for this primitive, whichever works best in a story. Story: Prince Ali holds up a large **crystal** _jewel_ to impress Princess Jasmine. She looks quite bored, but the Sultan looks thrilled!
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 19-1-2009(10): When Oddjob ran out of shoes to throw he tossed a **crystal** ball.

column5: 1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 25-8-2006(164): Wolverine (sheaf, see [reap](../v4/1488.html) (#1488 刈)) leaps over a tree and with one swipe of his claws **kill** s a bad guy aiming a missle launcher.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 1-2-2008(111): I suppose when this kanji was made, it was most effective to **kill** your enemies with _sheafs of wood_ used as _missiles_.
column7: 3) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 9-5-2007(33): This is the Monty Python "How not to be seen" sketch (<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/How_Not_To_Be_Seen>) where they use heat seeking _missiles_ to **kill** people first behind _sheafs_ of hay and then behind _trees_.
column8: 4) [[ovioprime](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ovioprime)] 18-10-2007(20): Sheaf, tree, missile Someone is trying to **kill** you. They've fired a heat seeking missile at you. You're confused with the stress and think it is a wheat seeking missile - you put a sheaf at the top of a tree to mislead it.
column9: 5) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 7-7-2009(16): Wolverine, from atop a _tree_ , blasts his _semen_ into the below enemy's mouth, which **kill** s him instantly.

column3: The sense of the key word is of something refreshing and invigorating. It is made up of the _St. Bernard_ and a pair of _sheaves_ on each side.
column5: 1) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 18-1-2009(41): The _St Bernard_ is **bracing** itself for an operation requiring _four stitches_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(27): A _large_ airship drops parachuting _Wolverine_ clones into the **bracing** night air.
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(12): That old _St. Bernard_ was just barely limping around, but me, I _stitched_ up the ol' chap and I dare say that the operation was quite **bracing**.
column8: 4) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 26-3-2010(11): Often used in shaving lotion and fragrance descriptions 爽やか さわやか refreshing, **bracing** , sweet, clear. Story: Slap some alcohol-based さわやか aftershave lotion onto the _4_ _big_ x-shaped hockey _stitches_ on your face. That's **bracing**!
column9: 5) [[Louismi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Louismi)] 19-6-2011(8): St. Bernard dog had a refreshing **bracing** bath and now is shaking all the water out of his fur. The drops are thrown in all direction and that's why the have an x shape in the pictogram.

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 18-10-2007(157): _Earthworm Jim's_ prized possession is a **genuine** copy of the #1 issue of _Spiderman_.
column6: 2) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 10-7-2006(120): You need to attach a **genuine** earthworm to the thread. With plastic bait you won't catch anything.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 9-5-2007(73): The real _Spiderman_ loves to eat _earthworms_ —they provide essential nutrients that make his threads stronger. So next time someone goes around claiming to be the real, **genuine** Spiderman, give him a few earthworms to eat.
column8: 4) [[hotkiller123](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hotkiller123)] 15-4-2009(37): For remembering the primitive earthworm: _Drops of_ rain were falling so I took my _shovel_ to dig up some **earthworms** to put them on my _fishook_ ….. My story: To have a **genuine** fishing line you don't just pick up a stick but you also attach some _thread_ onto it and at the end an _earthworm_ must be hung.
column9: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 21-12-2008(32): _Earthworm Jim's_ prized possession is a **genuine** copy of the #1 issue of _Spiderman_. And oddly enough, _Spiderman_ 's most prized possession is a **genuine** first edition of _Earthworm_ Jim.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 6-9-2007(78): Ever chopped the _head_ off an _earthworm_? Notice how it will grow back **immediately**! Beware the killer earthworms…
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 29-3-2010(14): When playing _Earthworm Jim_ , remember that the weak point of the boss is his _head_. Don't bother attacking anywhere else, it will just waste time. Attack the _head_ **immediate** ly! 道 **頓** 堀 どう **とん** ぼり, the main nightlife street in Osaka.
column7: 3) [[endote](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/endote)] 25-2-2011(6): Get that earthworm off my page!! **Immediate** ly!! I'm trying to write kanji here!!
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 27-1-2010(6): [+ikmys]. To separate **immediate** from 即 [instant](../v4/1462.html) (#1462 即) & 忽 [instantaneously](../v4/2431.html) (#2431 忽) make the _earthworm_ **immediate** ly grow back two _heads_ , one each end, with the wriggly body in between **immediate** ly **mediating** them.
column9: 5) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 14-1-2010(4): An EARTHWORM trying to crawl into your HEAD is a problem demanding **IMMEDIATE** attention! (thanks Maching Gun Cat).

column5: 1) [[gibosi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gibosi)] 2-5-2007(193): The metal hook is too **dull** to even pierce an earthworm….
column6: 2) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 21-12-2008(52): I was excited when they made a game that was a combination of _Metal_ Gear and _Earthworm_ Jim. But it turned out to be pretty **dull**.
column7: 3) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 12-3-2006(45): From the earthworm's perspective, it most be pretty **dull** when you are put in a metal bowl, just waiting for being put on the hook on the fishing trip the next day.
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 30-1-2008(29): Can mean both a **dull** object and a **dull** person. STORY: If the tip if your GOLD/METAL knife looks like the tip of an EARTHWORM, it is a **DULL** knife.
column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 12-6-2009(19): There are two kinds of **dull**. One is like _metals_ without lustre. The other is like how an _earthworm_ is really boring. Two different kinds of **dull**.

column3: This character pictures food whose taste is so hot and **spicy** that it makes the hairs on your body _stand up_ as straight as _needles_.
column4: * As a primitive, we shall use this meaning of _spicy_ , except when the two extra strokes are added to the bottom, giving it the form of a tree. Then we take its alternate meaning of a _red pepper_ plant. The connection is obvious.
column5: 1) [[carnieri](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/carnieri)] 19-7-2006(200): Eating **spicy** food makes you _stand up_ _ten_ times faster than usual, 'cause you just need to get something to drink!
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-10-2006(111): Eating **spicy** food makes you stand up as if you had sat on a needle.
column7: 3) [[xingji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xingji)] 21-4-2008(23): This caracter has 2 meaning : **Spicy** - > see book (からい） and heart-breaking painful （つらい） => stand up on barefooted on needles is painful.
column8: 4) [[Hujis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hujis)] 26-3-2009(19): After eating really **spicy** food you will probably spend most of the next day _stading_ up because it will feel like you have a _needle_ stuck up your arse. Numbers dont work well for me.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 11-6-2010(5): **Spicy** like drinking a vase full of needles.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-7-2006(282): This guy's job is tasting the _spicy curry_ at the local Indian Food Factory. He has to **resign** from his job before his _tongue_ is rendered completely useless after all the spicy food that he has to try all day long…
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 17-7-2006(55): A lecherous male worker is forced to **resign** because the female employees compained about his _spicy_ _tounge_.
column7: 3) [[stshores24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stshores24)] 7-9-2008(26): After my _tongue_ touched the most _spicy_ pepper of all, I had to **resign** from the contest…too hot for me!
column8: 4) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 26-1-2010(16): When they guy goes to his boss to **resign** from the Indian Food Factory (see Fuaburisu's story) all he can say is "Tongue….Spicy". This helps me remember the stroke order. 辞める 【やめる】 (v1) to retire, (P) 辞意 【じい】 (n) intention to **resign** , (P) お辞儀 【おじぎ】 (n,vs) bow, (P).
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-12-2009(15): When you're **resign** ing, it's often hard to know what to say. You could say that your tongue( 舌 ) is in pain ( 辛い ).

column5: 1) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 14-3-2006(235): The **CATALPA** is the tree that bears the SPICY Indian bean (NOTE - The **Catalpa** is also known as the "Indian Bean" due to the bean pods that grow from it).
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 7-8-2007(43): The **caterpillar's** favorite _tree_ is the **catalpa** because it tastes _spicy_.
column7: 3) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 6-10-2008(22): Tree + Spicy, The **catalpa** _tree_ has seed pods that look like _spicy_ peppers.
column8: 4) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 21-3-2008(17): I know the **Catalpa** as the "promise tree". A young person will cite the person he or she loves under a **Catalpa** _tree_ to declare his or her feelings. The fact that the right primitive means both _spicy_ and _bitter_ illustrates the hesitance and stress that precedes the ultimate reply.
column9: 5) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 1-6-2012(11): This kanji is barely used. Just rename the keyword to PEPPER TREE (so you don't need a story) and move on. If you do a google image search for the kanji 梓 , you'll find that this character almost exclusively refers to the female name あずさ (by the way, you will see some cute girls).

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 23-1-2007(238): **Superintend** ant Chalmers is dining at Principal Skinner's _house_. He takes a bite of his meal which is unbelievably _spicy_. His wig pops off and he yells out: "SKINNERRR!".
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 8-5-2007(93): The **superintend** ent of an old-age _house_ has to make sure the food is never too _spicy_.
column7: 3) [[hirai](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hirai)] 8-11-2007(37): The **superintendant** of the _house_ is ecstatic because the new tenants are non other than the _Spice Girls_.
column8: 4) [[bkvogel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bkvogel)] 30-8-2008(19): The school **superintend** ent likes spicy food, but no one else at the school does. Therefore, he can only eat spicy food under the roof of his own house.
column9: 5) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 16-9-2009(12): This also means "manage," so just think of a manager of a " _House of Curry_ " 宰領 さいりょう **superintend** /manage.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-3-2007(302): Did anyone else used to put _ketchup_ packets on the _ground_ and jump on them so they spattered on the **wall**?
column6: 2) [[saizen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saizen)] 4-1-2009(117): Primitive for **Ketchup** : When the taste is too _spicy_ your _mouth_ has basically given up trying to handle it ..or in other words raised the white _flag_ of surrender. But unlike war , putting **Ketchup** on it will usually solve the problem. **Wall** (dingomick), Did anyone else used to put ketchup packets on the _ground_ and jump on them so they spattered on the **wall**?
column7: 3) [[kokage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kokage)] 21-12-2010(23): Excited about kanji 1500?
column8: 4) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 26-6-2008(21): The **ketchup** primitive has an even more saucy true meaning: _Flag_ means buttocks, _mouth_ means hole and _spicy_ means penetrate…
column9: 5) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 21-4-2008(14): Heisig mentions _ketchup_ , which I remember by imagining that someone is wiping the _ketchup_ from their _mouth_ with a _flag_ , keeping everyone _standing_ on pins and _needles_ , means _false_ as a kanji. So: the _false_ **wall** led to a secret lair under _ground_.

column3: The **holed gem** to which this kanji refers is a flat, circular object of about a foot in length, made of stone or glass and having a large hole in the middle. It's elements: _ketchup_ . . . _ball_.
column5: 1) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 30-9-2010(35): This kanji shows a policeman with a **holed gem** (which can be thought of as _jewelry_ , I guess), but he thinks it's a doughnut. For some reason though, he liked his doughnuts with ketchup on them, so he added some, and tried to take a bite. He lost a few teeth on the process.
column6: 2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 9-12-2009(20): **perfection** : Only the tomatoes of perfection, comparable to jewels, were used for the expensive ketchup.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 7-11-2011(19): 完璧 [holed gem](../v4/3021.html) (#3021 璧) **Holed Gem** RTK ＃1500.1 ヘキ … Parts: 壁 - 土 , 玉 … Note: This is a new official Kanji added 05/10 to the Japanese lists. Japanese people mix this and 壁 up all the time, so learn them together. **Holed Gem** is the official Heisig Keyword. (though it has nothing to do with IRL usage. IRL this is just the second half of 完璧 . It's only used in that compound, but that compound is very very common, and means **Perfect!** as an exclamation. …
column8: 4) [[drwaltoa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/drwaltoa)] 15-9-2011(15): It's a little known fact that _ketchup_ is highly corrosive and is used to cut **holes** into **gemstones** so they can be put onto chains. This kanji shows a piece of _Jade_ with a blob of _ketchup_ on the top eating a hole through it.
column9: 5) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 15-8-2010(8): **Holed Gem** , _ketchup_ , _jewel_. According to Rikichan, this is bi (ancient Chinese artifact, flat jade or glass disc with a circular hole in the centre). It used to be a perfect un **holed gem** until Indiana Jones showed up and replaced the _jewel_ in the center with _ketchup_. All they were left with was a piece of worthless glass with a hole in middle. But it did taste good.

column5: 1) [[lazygreg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lazygreg)] 6-6-2007(286): You can try and **evade** them, but they'll ketchup with you on the road… Sorry, couldn't resist it.
column6: 2) [[DurablePants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DurablePants)] 23-1-2007(84): In order to **evade** the bear, you lie down on the road, put ketchup on yourself, and play dead.
column7: 3) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 21-12-2008(68): A giant Heinz Tomato _Ketchup_ truck crashed on the road, spilling giant globs of ketchup everywhere. They didn't close the _road_ , but you have to **evade** the globs of _ketchup_ as you drive.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 9-2-2008(25): You have a very nice vehicle (whatever you like). A truck has been losing his ketchup bottle load on the road. You are trying to **evade** these bottles or you will stain your vehicle and that would be the end of the world…(a high speed chase with a cool bike, evading ketchup bottles on the road).
column9: 5) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 17-1-2008(17): James Bond's latest car is equipped with ketchup that can be sprayed along the road to **evade** enemies.

column5: 1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 27-2-2006(207): (I don't like the 'red pepper plant' primative so I just go for _standing atop a tree_ ). Here we have the woodcutter _standing atop a tree_ waving his brand **new** _axe_. "Look what I got for christmas, yippee!".
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 16-10-2005(66): Axe-man grows a patch of _red pepper plants_ in his back garden. He rubs _red peppers_ on the edge of his _axes_ , and this seems to keep them sharp like brand **new**.
column7: 3) [[Angrybeez](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Angrybeez)] 7-4-2009(43): The Red Hot _Chilli Peppers_ and _Axe_ l Rose form a **new** band.
column8: 4) [[Aploosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aploosh)] 24-6-2007(24): "Great. I'm standing on top of a tree that's about to be cut by an axe. Well, I guess it's time for my **NEW** life." (Referring to reincarnation).
column9: 5) [[chibilchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibilchan)] 4-10-2009(14): Don't confuse left primitive with [catalpa](../v4/1498.html) (#1498 梓). Every time the farmer cuts down the peppers from the _red pepper plant_ , he has to use a brand **new** axe. This is because the spicy peppers cause the metal to erode very quickly, thereby rendering the axe completely useless.

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 28-1-2007(310): If your **firewood** is too _new_ and still has _flowers_ on it, it's unsuitable for burning. You need drier wood.
column6: 2) [[jamestaverner](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamestaverner)] 23-2-2008(29): Still giving _flowers_ to that special woman in your life? That's so last year. Everyone knows now with the price of **fuel** that / " **Firewood** is the _new_ _flowers_ " / Go on, get some **firewood** today and make her Valentine's Day dreams come true.
column7: 3) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-7-2006(22): Sometimes, _new_ **firewood** still has _flowers_ on it.
column8: 4) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 26-5-2010(10): If you can see _flowers_ growing where your log pile should be, its time to go chop some _new_ **firewood**.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(10): Axe-man brings a new bunch of flowers for his wife each time he goes gathering **firewood**. Each time he tries to find new flowers, different from the previous ones. He actually spends more time looking for new flowers, than he does gathering the **firewood** !

column5: 1) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 13-3-2007(321): I remember this one the way the Japanese do: a **parent** _standing_ on top of a _tree_ _watching_ what his or her kid is doing.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 14-12-2006(80): A wise **parent** lets their kids learn. A kid wants to try to eat the _red pepper plant_ , the wise **parent** says "Try it and _see_ for yourself".
column7: 3) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 21-12-2008(19): A **PARENT** _STANDING_ at the top of their family _TREE_ , _LOOKING_ at their kids.
column8: 4) [[Atomik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Atomik)] 15-2-2010(8): _Standing_ on top of this _tree_ , I can _see_ my **parent** s' house! Hi, Mom! Hi, Dad!
column9: 5) [[nesert](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nesert)] 1-7-2010(7): _The Red Hot Chili Peppers_ – my **parent** s would never let me _see_ them.

column3: Simply by turning the dot at the top of the primitive for _spicy_ into a cross shape, we move from things bitter and _spicy_ to things **happy**.
column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 7-8-2007(174): **happiness** is the ONE bite of SPICY curry.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 24-12-2006(89): This is one of those rare occasions when I forgo Heisig for other methods. [「幸せから一本取ると辛い」](midori://search?text=「幸せから一本取ると辛い」) – if you take but one stroke away from **happiness** , you get painfulness. (oh well, Heisig used similar one for 百 ).
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-3-2007(44): **Happiness** and pain(spicy) are just one stroke diffence. It's a fine balance.
column8: 4) [[jimitha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimitha)] 10-10-2009(20): A rare instance in which Heisig made a mistake in the primitives. The bottom is not _spicy_ , because there is no _vase_ or _standing_ here–the first horizontal stroke of the "vase" is too long. Rather, this is _soil_ and a new primitive below, which we shall call a garden-variety _goat_. It's like the _mountain goat_ in frame 1959, just not in the mountains. Thus, **happiness** is exemplified by a _goat_ nibbling on _soil_ ed garbage on the _ground_. (We'll only get to use _goat_ once more, in frame 1613).
column9: 5) [[CaLeDee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CaLeDee)] 18-9-2008(14): **Happiness** adds a bit of spice to your life.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-3-2007(249): **Tenacious** -D is _happy_ band led by a _fat man_. (It's **Tenacious** -D time, ya muthafucka', gwaoh!).
column6: 2) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 16-3-2007(107): To be **tenacious** , you need to have deep stores of happiness (so troubles don't discourage you) and you need to be big and round (so hunger doesn't drive you to give up). The most **tenacious** person of all time was happy round Buddha!
column7: 3) [[tk2000](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tk2000)] 11-1-2007(83): The _fat man_ Santa Claus is **tenacious** about carrying out his duty to bring _happiness_ to all the children of the world on Christmas day.
column8: 4) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 2-6-2008(29): **Tenacious** D is a band of happy, round fellows.
column9: 5) [[delbertmon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delbertmon)] 7-1-2010(15): If you are **tenacious** about finding _happiness_ , you will become well _round_ ed.

column3: Of the many and widely different meanings of this kanji, we select the verbal meaning of **clasp** , which fits in well with its primitive elements: _tenacious_ . . . _hand_.
column5: 1) [[FooSoft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FooSoft)] 1-1-2010(38): _Tenaciously_ **clasping** something with your hand.
column6: 2) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 24-12-2010(18): You could tell he was **earnest** from how _tenaciously_ he shook your _hand_.
column7: 3) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 11-1-2010(13): **earnest** : The earnest look out for others: when you fall over, they’ll _tenaciously_ grab your _hand_ and pull you back up. [ 真摯 - Earnest].
column8: 4) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 15-10-2010(5): This kanji shows _Santa Claus_ (refer to frame [tenacious](../v4/1506.html) (#1506 執)) **clasping** the reins of his deers with his _hands_ , holding onto dear life as he almost falls off his carriage.
column9: 5) [[jure23](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jure23)] 11-4-2012(4): After finally tracking down your real father he _Tenaciously_ **clasps** your _hand_.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 4-7-2007(251): Recall the fashion model wearing just a _stamp_ over his _crotch_ ([clothing](../v4/1399.html) (#1399 服)). When he got _happy_ , of course, it ended up in the news **report**.
column6: 2) [[PrettyKitty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PrettyKitty)] 30-4-2008(85): On the news: "We are happy to **report** that stamp-sized bikini bottoms are back in style!" (Well, the men are happy about it, at least.).
column7: 3) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 14-3-2006(20): The **REPORT** from the doctor made me _HAPPY_ because it said that he had _STAMPED_ out my _CROTCH_ infection.
column8: 4) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 1-7-2012(17): "My child's book **report** got a _happy stamp again_ :-)…" ——————————————————————————————– (In case you're wondering, the **report** s to this story are actually for my previous, somewhat obscene story. This story is courtesy of another RTK member (bodhisamaya?), who seems to have deleted it. Hope he/she doesn't mind.).
column9: 5) [[yuriehoshii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yuriehoshii)] 31-5-2011(14): BÁO : Fashion **REPORT** :new bikini with just a STAMP cover the CROTCH , make men more HAPPY :D !!!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(243): There was a man in a village who had a special gift : whenever he **shout** ed and screamed, his mouth became a cornucopia, overflowing with fruits and food of all sorts. Many of the locals thought he was a cruel man, always screaming at his wife, until they realised he was in fact very kind, and his gift brought prosperity to his family.
column6: 2) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 28-8-2006(133): You can hold a CORNUCOPIA up to your MOUTH (like a megaphone) to **SHOUT** lounder. Also notice that the shape of CORNUCOPIA implies the **shout** s are 4 letter words.
column7: 3) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 24-10-2007(57): FOUR!! like in golf, someone **shout** s four and you see the golf ball right in front of you.
column8: 4) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 19-3-2008(47): **Note** : the _cornucopia_ primitive is not described adequately in Heisig. It has 3 strokes as opposed to 2 as mentioned in the book, but on the left may have 2 or 3 depending on who you ask… Also, on the left, the long stroke is written first. See <http://forum.koohii.com/viewtopic.php?id=921> and <http://forum.koohii.com/viewtopic.php?id=185> for more.
column9: 5) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 3-10-2006(27): Your _mouth_ is used _4_ **shout** ing.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 10-7-2009(126): A Pepsi promotion where you **twist** off the cap to find pictures of your favorite heroes like _Spider-Man_ or members of the _Fantastic Four_.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 20-5-2007(100): [twist, ask, investigate, verify] Stories full of **twist** s are difficult to write, because of the _cornucopia_ of _threads_ the author has to manage.
column7: 3) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 23-9-2007(38): _Spiderman_ really, really just wants to dance the **twist**. But he doesn't have time to seek out a teacher and go to lessons. So he wishes into his _cornucopia_ and who should appear from the horn of plenty but Chubby Checker himself, already mid way through his famous refrain: "Come on baby, let's do the **twist** …".
column8: 4) [[zz_alex_zz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zz_alex_zz)] 18-3-2008(27): +++SPOILER ALERT+++ For the **twist** to the next _spiderman_ movie we'll find out that Peter Parker's seemingly endless supply of web is actually produced by a _cornucopia_.
column9: 5) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 22-2-2008(16): Spiderman counts in his new cover band singing cheesy golden oldies. 1,2,3, _4_..Lets **twist** again…

column5: 1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 25-3-2007(250): Prostitutes can make a veritable _cornucopia_ of **income** by using their _crotches_ – they put the "come" in "income." (A bit lewd perhaps, but effective in keeping this character distinct from similar keywords like [profit](../v4/906.html) (#906 利) or [earnings](../v4/893.html) (#893 稼)).
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 22-2-2008(85): Women love men with money. If you have a high **income** you can get a cornicopia of crotches.
column7: 3) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 30-11-2008(69): **STROKE ORDER WARNING:** The order in which the _cornucopia_ primitive is written is altered here. First the long vertical bar, then the L part in either one or two strokes (this seems to vary in different reference materials).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 26-9-2008(41): The _Fantastic Four_ use Jessica Alba's _crotch_ to gain some extra **income**.
column9: 5) [[slats70](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/slats70)] 4-1-2009(33): A prostitute with _4 crotches_ could sure pull in a big **income**.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 17-11-2006(209): A **LOWLY** single rice grain, DROPPED in an empty FIELD, can produce a CORNUCOPIA of food.
column6: 2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 5-2-2007(138): **Lowly** people only have a _drop of brains_ and use nothing but _4-letter words_.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(50): The **lowly** people with _a drop of brains_ are the ones who labor to produce the _cornucopia_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(26): That _Fantastic Four_ movie was so **lowly** , I only needed a _drop_ of _brains_ to watch it. Note: When written with only 8 strokes, this kanji is assigned the meaning "Chinese pirated DVDs" (rough copies of already **lowly** movies).
column9: 5) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 30-3-2008(13): Even a **lowly** person of low birth can - with a _bit of brains_ \- find a _cornucopia_ in this land of plenty.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(252): There is a grave of a _lowly_ man with a **tombstone** made of a simple, small _stone_. If you bow really low you can read the very small inscription engraved on the _stone_ , it says - “Now that you bowed so low to read this, you are as _lowly_ as I once was”.
column6: 2) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 6-8-2007(139): A STONE makes a LOWLY **TOMBSTONE**.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-5-2007(24): Rocks are actually sentient beings with social structure, and it just so happens that the _lowliest of stones_ are chosen to end up as humiliating **tombstone** s.
column8: 4) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 1-3-2009(22): A simple stone serves as the **tombstone** of a lowly peasant.
column9: 5) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 9-1-2008(9): The _lowly_ only get a solitary _rock_ upon their resting places as a **tombstone** (while the highly get monuments like Stone Henge).

column3: The sense of **land** carried by this kanji is distinct from _soil_ (Frame 161) and _ground_ (Frame 554) in that it is meant to represent **land** seen from a distance, that is, _land_ as opposed to  "water." Its elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _rice seedlings_ . . . _ground_.
column5: 1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 11-4-2006(162): My rice-seedlings have become sentient and will go on a mission. I can only apologise for the next 6 frames. In the distance, there is a _pinnacle_ , which the newly-awakened _rice-seedlings_ who are still stuck in the _ground_ can see. Could it be the Promised **Land**?
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 23-7-2006(90): When sailors see **land** in the distance, they first see the _pinnacles_ of the new **land** , but when they come close enough they'll be able to make out the _rice seedlings_ , and finally the _ground_!
column7: 3) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 23-7-2009(70): (圥 is the rare kanji for a mushroom. Sticking out of the _ground_ like little knubby _legs_ , it's pretty easy to remember.) Story ~ The **land** around _The Pinnacle_ has _mushrooms_ covering the _ground_.
column8: 4) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 19-3-2008(46): Primitive: Soil covered human legs is the result of planting rice seedlings into rice paddies all day. Poor rice farmers!
column9: 5) [[nagisa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nagisa)] 4-2-2008(32): The Pinnacle's **land** is so valuable that they cannot afford to let a single rice seedling be planted in the soil.

column5: 1) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 29-8-2007(146): I keep an **intimate** relationship with my rice seedlings – I never take my eye from the soil.
column6: 2) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 11-4-2006(121): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) Some of them begin to see _eye_ to eye about the possibility of reaching the promised land. A group of awakened _rice- seedlings stuck in the ground_ becomes **intimate** and starts to form a plan.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-3-2007(75): Make _eye_ contact with the sexy girl planting _rice seedlings_ and you can get **intimate** with her on the _ground_.
column8: 4) [[thelooseteeth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thelooseteeth)] 17-10-2009(25): So are you just _eying_ my _mushroom_ , or do you want to get **intimate**?
column9: 5) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 12-11-2007(17): Here the EYE of Sauron wants to form an **INTIMATE** bond (I SEE YOU, there is no life in the void!) with FRODO each time he wears the ring. But FRODO, overcome by the intimacy, takes off the ring and throws it to the GROUND.

column3: Rice seedlings . . ground . . . fat man . . . muscle.
column5: 1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 25-6-2006(182): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) The _rice-seedlings still stuck in the soil_ gather _round_ in a circle. Their combined _power_ **forces** them out of the ground at last.
column6: 2) [[thelooseteeth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thelooseteeth)] 17-10-2009(42): _Mushroom_ … _Fat man_ ….= _Mario_. _Mario_ jumps on top of Bowser's **forces** , crushing their evil _power_.
column7: 3) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 28-7-2006(37): The _fat_ sumo-farmer **forces** _rice seedlings_ into the _ground_ with his huge _muscles_. With his combination of mass and strength, it's not suprising very few of the seedlings survive and he is **forced** to diet.
column8: 4) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 19-11-2006(24): Looks like a physics formula to me: rate of time (rate of growth of _rice seedlings_ ) over the rate of ( _ground_ ) distance _round_ ed and multiplied by _power_ gives you **forces**.
column9: 5) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 5-1-2012(20): **Halfway** the journey of 3030 kanji (both Heisig 一  & 三 ), you watch the long road that lies ahead of you, and you start to feel down and overwhelmed… like if you were being swallowed by _quicksand - grounds_ … but you soon realize that if you made it this far, you can keep going and eventually finish! You _round_ up all the will- _force_ UNDER your control, and get out of this rut! And just like you, our **FORCES** combined will let us finish this journey! **Let's go users!!**.

column3: Rice seedlings . . . ground . . . fat man . . . oven fire.
column5: 1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 9-4-2007(169): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) The _rice-seedlings_ (newly freed from the ground but with _soil_ still clinging to their roots) gather in a circle _around_ an _oven fire_. They need to **heat** up prior to their journey (presumably plants can't walk if they're too cold?).
column6: 2) [[zanzibar](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zanzibar)] 31-5-2009(57): **Heat** up those RICE SEEDLINGS you pulled from the SOIL in a ROUND pan over a low FLAME. (Note: the hot pan image helps reinforce the idea that this kanji for "atsui" refers to something hot to the touch, as opposed to hot weather).
column7: 3) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 29-10-2009(34): This is _Mario_ avoiding the _fire_ 's **heat**. <http://retromedia.ign.com/retro/image/article/870/870378/super-mario- bros-20080429110134449_640w.jpg>.
column8: 4) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 10-5-2006(29): Just a comment on Erikkusan's story: Although one of the pronunciations of this kanji is "atsui" this isn't the atsui that you feel in Tokyo in August, (which is Frame 1260's "sultry' 暑 ). This atsui is the one when you touch something hot, like a fry pan. Another reading of this is "netsu," which is the "fever" this fat man may feel after planting the rice seedlings.
column9: 5) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 18-4-2010(7): (NB: The top of 熱 (埶) is a rare kanji meaning "art". We already have [art](../v4/1525.html) (#1525 術) so I call it _ARTISTRY_.) Keeping a primitive dwelling **HEAT** ed ain't easy! It requires much _ARTISTRY_ to keep those _EMBERS_ glowing. (I decompose _ARTISTRY_ as _DIVOT_ (坴) … _ROUND_ : Tiger Woods' uncanny _ARTISTRY_ for whacking _DIVOT_ s as _ROUND_ as golf balls. 坴 is a rare kanji meaning "clod", we already have [clod](../v4/2024.html) (#2024 塊) so I call it _DIVOT_ , I see it pictographically: a golfer [above] whacking a divot [below].).

column3: Named after a **diamond** -shaped flower (the water caltrop), this key word refers to things shaped like a **diamond**. Its elements: _flower_ . . . _rice seedlings_ . . . _walking legs_.
column5: 1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 20-6-2006(145): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) Deciding to use the **diamond** -shaped water caltrop _flower_ as cover/protection, the _rice-seedlings_ with their _walking legs_ (now free from soil), can start their journey.
column6: 2) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 6-6-2008(141): Some girls want **diamond** s, but others will be satisfied with just _flowers_. However if you think you can win her over with _rice seedlings_ , expect her to get up on her _walking legs_ and walk on out!
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(75): I gave her a _flower_ and a **diamond**. We went for a walk through the _rice seedlings_ after she said yes.
column8: 4) [[Drack](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Drack)] 11-1-2011(46): Mitsubishi! In Japanese, 三菱 .. "Three **Diamond** s" .. Now look at their logo! THREE **DIAMOND** S. Not really a story for remembering this kanji, just wanted to share how I was just amazed by something obvious.
column9: 5) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 29-8-2007(26): I would give that lady a **diamond** , if she let me plant a rice seedling in her flower between her walking legs…

column5: 1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 11-4-2006(191): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) However, the _pinnacle_ that the _rice- seedlings_ finally reach with the use of their _walking legs_ turns out not to be the Promised Land after all, but simply a **mausoleum** (containing many dead rice-seedlings exhausted from previous quests?). Oh no!
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(61): On top of _The Pinnacle_ is a **masoleum** for rice seedling farmers. They make an annual _walking_ pilgrimage there.
column7: 3) [[bananarama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bananarama)] 2-3-2008(36): At the pinnicle is a mausolem. The ground is sown with rice seedings to stop the dead from rising on walking legs.
column8: 4) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 29-10-2009(25): Every year, thousands _walk_ up _The Pinnacle_ to see the _Mushroom_ **Mausoleum**. It's shaped like a _mushroom_ , surrounded by _mushrooms_ , and supposedly Toad is enshrined inside (he died in a fiery Rainbow Road accident).
column9: 5) [[elmaestrokgb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elmaestrokgb)] 31-10-2009(11): Ancient Japanese built a **mausoleum** for the "unknown rice farmer". It's on the _pinnacle_ of Mt. Fuji, and it has a statue of a guy with huge _walking legs_ planting _rice seedlings_ as he goes.

column3: This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the **sign of the hog**. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating **hog** in connection with the primitive meaning given below.
column4: * The _top hat_ represents the external shape of the _acorn_ , and the unusual but easily written complex of strokes beneath it (which you might also see as distortions of an _elbow_ and _person_ ) stands for the mysterious secret whereby the _acorn_ contains the oak tree in a nutshell.
column5: 1) [[Floatingweed5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Floatingweed5)] 20-11-2007(193): A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them.
column6: 2) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 8-10-2008(39): Top Hat + Elbow + Person: The **sign of the hog** was a very recognizable tattoo - a hog with a big grin in a _top hat_ , sticking his _elbow_ into the _person_ next to him.
column7: 3) [[roundrabbit](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/roundrabbit)] 8-9-2009(26): This is easy, if you know Mr. Peanut, the logo of Planters. Replace his face or body with an acorn and you have Mr. Acorn, the logo / **sign of the hog**. He wears the same _top hat_ , has the same turned out _elbow_ holding a diagonal _walking stick_ , and poses like a _human_.
column8: 4) [[Tobberoth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tobberoth)] 25-11-2008(18): Warning: Stroke order in book is wrong. The top hat should be written as normal.
column9: 5) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 8-6-2007(13): Q: What is the difference between a pig and a hog? A: A hog is the generic term for all swine. Pigs are immature hogs weighing less than 125 pounds. Other swine related terms include the following: Piglet: a baby swine less than ten weeks old (nursing pig) Sow: a female pig that has had a litter Boar: a male hog (with tusks?).

column5: 1) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 26-6-2008(170): The **nucleus** of an oak TREE is an ACORN.
column6: 2) [[yorkii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yorkii)] 16-6-2006(160): In the **nucleus** of the acorn, all the DNA is stored – the building blocks for a new tree.
column7: 3) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 3-6-2008(48): Ernest Rutherford discovered the **Nucleus**. Picture him sitting under a tree pondering atoms, after an ACORN falls on him he suddenly understands that each atom has a **nucleus**.
column8: 4) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 28-3-2007(28): [nucleus, core, kernel] Right in the **nucleus** of the _acorn_ , you can find a future _tree_.
column9: 5) [[atylmo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atylmo)] 4-3-2009(18): Imagine the _tree_ as the **nucleus** , and the _acorn_ as the electrons rotating out around it. It's a forest of **nuclei**!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-4-2008(199): This famous ninja (I always use ninjas with _sabres_ , distinct from samurai) used to **engrave** the kanji for his name onto _acorns_ , and throw the _acorns_ to distract his enemies. The legend goes that by the time his victims would pick up the _acorn_ and read the **engrave** d kanji, they were already dead.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 3-8-2006(76): While it's traditional for lovers to **engrave** their names on a tree in many countries, in Japan, however, it was traditional for a samurai to signify his undying love for a woman by engraving the kanji of her name on an _acorn_ with his _sabre_.
column7: 3) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 17-10-2009(20): TIP: This also means "time"… STORY: The Swiss watchmaker is a master **engrave** r. He **engrave** s the minutes and seconds on an _acorn_ using a tiny _saber_ to make a miniature cuckoo clock… 遅刻 [ちこく].
column8: 4) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 14-8-2006(19): Whenever i think of "engraving" i think of wedding invitations. :) well there's this one bride who wanted to be unique, so rather than on paper, she decided to **engrave** their wedding invitations on an _acorn_ with a _sabre_ , and give that out to their guests. (Not true story, but with brides' crazy ideas these days, I wouldn't be surprised…) :-).
column9: 5) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 9-1-2008(17): Just picture Zorro using his _saber_ to **engrave** his name out on a giant _acorn_.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-5-2007(231): I asked my teacher what this strange _word_ meant, and she furiously replied that it was explained in the **above-stated** paragraph before throwing an _acorn_ at me!
column6: 2) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 5-2-2007(99): The **above-stated** _words_ are the _acorn_ from which the following statement grows.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 24-7-2008(79): I literally imagined atree with _words_ stuck on _acorns_. And thus the _words_ are **above-stated** (that is until they fall on your head I guess). (This one really needs a mental picture).
column8: 4) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 16-12-2008(26): **ABOVE-STATED** is a synonym with ACORNmentioned. I mean "aforementioned". Really easy to remember if you just think of ACORNmentioned.
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 10-2-2008(12): You, a hog, just asked what the word means. Socrates answers:'The meaning of this word is stated above' 'yes, but I don't understand the kanji.' S:'Well it is stated above' ' I just told you that I dont understand it.' S:'The word is stated above''Yes but…' S:' You dum hog, stated above is the word'… this could go on for a while as the kanji you are pointing to is 該 .

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-3-2007(79): The **remains** consisted of a _skeleton_ which had the **remains** of some _acorns_ in its stomach area. Whether it died from eating the acorns **remains** to be seen.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 2-12-2008(41): Hint: The **remains** of a chipmunk.
column7: 3) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-1-2009(18): (big ups to cameron_en) Whatever happened to Chip and Dale? We investigated their tree, and the only **remains** there were their _skeleton_ s and a huge pile of _acorn_ s.
column8: 4) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 19-1-2010(10): Ultimately unsuccessful, all that **REMAINS** of Scrat (of Ice Age fame) is his SKELETON which is almost clutching the ever elusive ACORN.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 5-8-2010(4): After the BBQ, the there was no _sign of the hog_ except the **remains** i.e. a _skeleton_. Careful with [remainder](../v4/808.html) (#808 残).

column5: 1) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 29-3-2008(146): _Acorn Power_ is the people's way to **CENSURE** a congressman you don't agree with. Pelt your Senator with acorns today.
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 8-8-2007(96): The liberal squirrel blogged that he would give all his ACORNS to congress if it would exercise its POWER to **censure** Bush and Cheney.
column7: 3) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 15-3-2007(69): Animal Farm works for me - where the _hogs_ have the greatest _power_ of **censure**.
column8: 4) [[ezmoreldo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ezmoreldo)] 14-5-2008(66): Sorry, I know this is crude, but it's just so easy to remember: if you expose your acorns and your muscle in public, you'll be **censure** d.
column9: 5) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 14-11-2006(29): **Censure** is the political equivalent of a "strongly worded letter," according to Cornell's School of Law. It is a flex of muscle by congress against the current president, but it is a very weak one. Imagine **censure** as congress flexing as hard as it can, only to have a little _acorn_ -sized bump of _muscle_ pop up suddenly.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-5-2007(172): Why are the roads leading through the woods so sticky and dirty? Hmm… I think the forest ranger **mention** ed something about excess _resin on the roads_ …
column6: 2) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(112): No-body **mention** ed that there was _resin_ on the _road_. Now I'm stuck!
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 23-1-2008(52): The resin factory worker sees the boiler about to explode and hesitantly says to his boss, "um, there's something I should **mention** to you…" At that moment the factory explodes and sends an overflowing batch of resin is cascading down the road bringing fiery death. (Semi-true story, see <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Boston_Molasses_Disaster>).
column8: 4) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 24-1-2010(30): Resin **Primitive** : Cell Phone tower. They make _cell phone towers_ look like _trees_ by putting _fake branches_ on them, but you know it's just a metal pole. The _antenna_ at the top is a dead giveaway. **Story** : On the top 10 list of dumbest ideas, placing a _cell phone tower_ in the middle of the road earned an honorable **mention**. I nearly hit it everyday when I drive to work.
column9: 5) [[Kyle_N](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kyle_N)] 2-4-2008(21): Did I **mention** this road was freshly resined and you shouldn't walk on it? Sorry too late, sucker!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-1-2006(194): Behold the "Boulev'Art" : a life-size section of a boulevard cast in a huge block of resin. Some call it … **art**.
column6: 2) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 30-6-2008(58): The definition of **art** is getting more and more loose these days. Why even some _resin_ spilled onto the _boulevard_ is now counted as **art**! Hmmph!
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 5-2-2008(25): I get it, when the _resin_ is on a _boulevard_ instead of a road (see complaints in [mention](../v4/1524.html) (#1524 述)), it's **art**.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-3-2007(22): The violinists( _resin_ ) practive their **art** on the _boulevard_ much to the pleasure of passersby.
column9: 5) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 27-5-2006(21): An modert **art** ist exposes his sculpute on a boulevard…. here you can see his latestest creation, a sculputure made out of resin.

column5: 1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 1-3-2006(182): A **cold** lunch: in the _house_ , _celery_ , pre cooked _animal legs_ (i.e. chicken drumsticks) and _ice_ tea.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-5-2007(104): Some strange animal tried to steal a stalk of celery from my house. However, it was freezing and the floor was covered in ice, so the mysterious animal couldn't get any traction. Picture a _stalk of celery_ and a _pair of animal legs_ slipping and sliding clumsily around the _ice_ , and never able to leave the _house_. Eventually it got so **cold** that the little animal froze to death.
column7: 3) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 1-2-2008(76): The story of gordon is really great except that there is a tremendous mistake : this kanji is used for the weather , the temperature (samui 寒い ) …. not for the feeling to the touch : for this one it's tsumetai 冷たい [cool](../v4/1404.html) (#1404 冷) the jap HOUSE are infamous for being insanely **cold** . How much **cold** ? you don't even need a freezer for keeping your CELERY . Worse it's this much **cold** that there is some ICE on the floor and that you must have arched ANIMAL LEGS like pingoo for moving without falling.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 5-2-2008(40): Did you ever see that Tom and Jerry episode where they made it so **cold** that the inside of the _house_ became a winter wonderland, and Jerry grabbed some _celery_ and used his _animal legs_ to skate and sled around on the _ice_? It was a real _celery_ -bration, ha ha… ha..
column9: 5) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 31-3-2007(31): When it's freezing **cold** outside (ice everywhere), it's best to stay in the house, eating celery (winter vegetable) and wear your bunny slippers (animal legs).

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 15-6-2007(124): The A/C wasn't making the house _cold_ because the filters had been **blocked up** with _dirt_.
column6: 2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 19-3-2010(18): It was so [cold](../v4/1526.html) (#1526 寒), the pipes **blocked up** with ice. After _removing the ice_ , we insulated them with _soil_.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 31-7-2009(6): If you cared enough to **block up** that hole around the edge of the window that lets that _cold_ draft in, it wouldn't feel so _icy_ in here. It doesn't matter what you **block up** the hole with, even _soil_ will do! Just do it soon, it's freezing in here.
column8: 4) [[lankydan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lankydan)] 13-9-2007(6): **Block up** _cold_ house with _dirt_.
column9: 5) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 22-9-2011(3): Occurs in heart attack ( 心筋梗塞 ). To prevent it: Get out of the _house_ (do sports!) regulary, eat good things ( _celery_ comes to mind) and do not snack between meals (no fast food _dirt_!) (thanks to dukelexon for the inspiration!).

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(198): On the troical island of JOU, they **brew** _whiskey_ while wearing _grass skirts_ (top hats and scarves too). (Image: the strangely dresses islanders stirring a pot of **brew**. Careful [fermentation](../v4/1430.html) (#1430 酵)).
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 26-12-2006(79): To me, the grass skirt is composed of six celery sticks and a scarf. Apparently you can **brew** whiskey out of grass skirts. No wonder it tastes horrible.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-1-2007(66): Note : up to frame 1530, the kanji share the same chinese reading (JOU), so don't hesitate to group them into the same environment. Here we have the "brew"-man, who **brew** s some kind of _whiskey_ using palm tree leaves. Instead of collecting them himself, he just buys the _grass skirts_ from the people on this tropical island where he lives (which you may name the JOU island, after the chinese reading).
column8: 4) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 10-1-2008(27): **Grass Skirt** primitive: Picture some Hawaiian girls, wearing **grass skirts** and tropical _scarfs_ (or leis), doing a dance. "3, 4, 5, _6_ pick up all the _celery_ sticks!".
column9: 5) [[alantin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alantin)] 5-7-2008(22): This **brew** of whiskey will cause you wear grass skirts and dance around like a maniac!

column5: 1) [[jreaves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jreaves)] 12-7-2007(150): (thanks chamcham) A graduate student in anthropology tells the University that he plans to **defer** his studies for a year, and instead conduct "field research" on the grass-skirt-wearing native women on the island of Jou.
column6: 2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 6-1-2008(128): The islanders **defer** to the _word_ s of their chief Jou in his _grass skirt_.
column7: 3) [[OddAndersen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/OddAndersen)] 27-1-2008(65): I talked to my Japanese spouse, who confirmed that this kanji does _not_ mean "defer" as in "put off, delay". It means "defer" in the sense of "submit" or "yield".
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 4-2-2008(64): OddAndersen is correct. 譲る 【ゆずる】 (v5r,vt) to turn over, to assign, to hand over, to transmit, to convey, to sell, to dispose of, to yield, to surrender, (P) 譲渡 【じょうと】 (n,vs) transfer, assignment, conveyance, (P) STORY: I heard of Japanese Boss who SUBMITTED a new notice saying all the female employees must wear GRASS SKIRTS to work. Naturally, the female employees YIELDED to the man's wishes, unable to say a single WORD.
column9: 5) [[aaronvanvalen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aaronvanvalen)] 28-5-2009(26): The island girl in the grass skirt says demurely "I **defer** (yield) to your _words_ of judgment, wise one". Colonization is great.

column3: _Ground_ . . . _grass skirt_. The **lot** of this key word refers to a portion of land.
column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 19-2-2007(213): My dream is to buy a small _lot_ on a tropical island and spend the rest of my days relaxing in a _grass skirt_.
column6: 2) [[OddAndersen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/OddAndersen)] 27-1-2008(66): On the island of JOU, in order to be considered a **lot** , a _ground_ must be big enough to grow sufficient grass for a _grass skirt_.
column7: 3) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 20-2-2008(49): (RE: Stormchild) My dream is to buy a small _lot_ on a tropical island and spend the rest of my days relaxing surrounded by women in _grass skirts_.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-1-2006(13): Note : the keyword refers to a **lot** of land, as hinted by the _soil_ primitive. This is the **lot** of land owned by the "brew"-man (see "brew"). To mark its perimeter, he drew cord between pickets, and hangs _grass skirts_ all around the **lot** (they don't have much materials on JOU island).
column9: 5) [[broderickjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/broderickjeff)] 22-5-2009(6): To _Groundskeeper Willy_ , the most important parcel of _ground_ is the **lot** upon which Springfield Elementary is built.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-4-2007(203): Conversation at a party: A: "Who is that **lass**?" B: "Which one?" A: "The _woman_ wearing the _grass skirt_." B: "Alas, I don't know".
column6: 2) [[Beneus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beneus)] 1-1-2009(46): "There once was a **lass** , whose skirt was made of grass…" insert your own humorous ending.
column7: 3) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 1-5-2008(20): The correct term for a WOMAN in a GRASS SKIRT is a **LASS** , ask any Hawaiian.
column8: 4) [[xxinde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xxinde)] 30-6-2011(19): **LASS** is short for _LAdy-in-a-skirt-made-of-graSS_.
column9: 5) [[hirai](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hirai)] 8-11-2007(19): Two Irishmen visit Hawaii and see a _woman_ wearing a _grass skirt_ and nothing else. "That's some **lassie** ," says one to the other. "But a **lass** Danny Boy, you can't be bringing her home.".

column5: 1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 14-3-2006(237): If you grow up with a mother that drinks and smokes, you can be sure it's **poison** in the stuff you get from her breasts.
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 4-5-2007(82): Note that stroke order of _grow up_ primitive isn't obvious from Heisig's diagram: single horizontal stroke is drawn first, then vertical and two horizontals.
column7: 3) [[ctraabe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ctraabe)] 5-11-2008(59): You can use silicone implants to to make your _breasts "grow up"_ but if they leak, it's **poison**.
column8: 4) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 26-3-2008(34): For _grow up_ I will be using the idea of _Peter Pan_ the boy who did anything but grow up. Have you ever wondered what happened to _Peter Pans_ mother? My guess is he **poison** ed her.
column9: 5) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 24-12-2007(23): To those who _grow up_ lactose intolerant, _mother's_ milk is a **poison**.

column5: 1) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 26-7-2007(161): When he was _growing up_ , _Venom_ never had many friends in **elementary** school. Maybe it explains why he turned out how he did.
column6: 2) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 1-3-2007(117): This is a pictogram of _string theory_. _Strings_ are the most **elementary** particles of matter, which then _grow up_ to become matter itself.
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 8-6-2008(38): **Elementary** my dear Watson! Peter parker **grew up** to become **Spiderman**!
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 28-5-2007(26): _Spiderman_ started fighting crime at an early age, so he didn't go to school as he _grew up_. He may be an expert in practical things, but his scholarly knowledge is quite **elementary**.
column9: 5) [[eatyoda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eatyoda)] 10-11-2008(16): In **elementary** school _Peter Pan_ taunted _Venom_ eventually pushing him onto the path of evil.

column5: 1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 27-9-2007(229): If you eat lots of **barley** , you'll _grow up_ to have strong _walking legs_.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 17-5-2007(80): **Barley** is a very cheap grain, and it's not really worth spending time to harvest. Therefore, scientists have genetically engineered it to grow _walking legs_ once the grain is _grown up_ and mature, so it can harvest itself.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 26-12-2006(37): "Grown up" **barley** , i.e. beer, is what gets you tottering legs.
column8: 4) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 29-4-2008(25): The secret of PETER PAN's flight - he eats **BARLEY** to turn his WALKING LEGS into flying legs.
column9: 5) [[Beneus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beneus)] 2-1-2009(22): You're _walking_ through a **barley** field. With every step you take, it _grows_ noticeably, but if you go back it shrinks. You need to get to the other side of the field, but with every step it gets harder to navigate. Will you make it out of this strange field?

column5: 1) [[mhheie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mhheie)] 6-2-2008(147): "Once in a **blue** _moon_ " refers to a rare event. But originally "blue moon" refers to a full moon, in other words a fully _grown-up_ moon. Whether once a month is rare or not depends on what we're talking about, but that happens to be the origin of the expression.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(104): The last time I saw a **blue** _moon_ was in my **youth** when I was _growing up_.
column7: 3) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 19-6-2006(40): **Blue** = Smurfs, whose _bodies_ never _grow up_.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 17-5-2007(34): They say that as the sun gets older, it grows up and becomes red. However, that's not the case for the _moon_ , which turns **blue** as it _grows up_.
column9: 5) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 26-3-2008(22): Once in a **Blue** _moon_ you can see _Peter Pan_ flying high above it.

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 8-8-2007(154): Before _rice_ is **refined** , it is actually _blue_ …bet ya didn't know that!! (alternate…. _Condi Rice_ was _blue_ when insurgents blew up the iraqi **refinery** where oil is **refined** ).
column6: 2) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 15-1-2009(141): Very **refined** people in the upper classes have skin as pale as _rice_ and _blue_ blood.
column7: 3) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-4-2008(40): NB This means "spirit", "vitality", "essence", "semen". For vitality, you need to eat healthy food, symbolized by rice, and exercise under the blue sky.
column8: 4) [[yorkii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yorkii)] 25-6-2006(24): The job of the smurfs. not many people know this, but it is to create the most **refined** rice in the world.
column9: 5) [[wonderflonium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wonderflonium)] 20-10-2009(18): "Uh, why is your rice blue?" "It's been **refined**! And by 'refined' I mean it's been in the back of my fridge for a few months.".

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 22-2-2007(193): That door-to-door salesman can stand outside ringing my doorbell until he's _blue_ in the face. There's a big sign on my front door, and the _words_ clearly say "No **Solicit** ing".
column6: 2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 18-7-2008(62): You can _talk_ until you're _blue_ in the face, but if you're trying to **solicit** me, you're just wasting your time…
column7: 3) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 14-1-2008(46): Going through smurf blue light district - heres a smurfette saying all sorts of dirty words trying to **solicit** herself.
column8: 4) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 15-11-2006(15): When you're blue, you need to **solicit** words to help you.
column9: 5) [[cerulean](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cerulean)] 19-4-2009(12): The _Blue Man Group_ need no _Words_ to **Solicit** themselves. They naturally draw a crowd without ever speaking a word.

column3: _State of mind_ . . . _blue_. Do not confuse with _emotion_ (Frame 662).
column5: 1) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 19-11-2007(174): _Data_ is **feeling** _blue_ about not having any **feelings** … hey, wait a minute.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 15-11-2006(150): Feeling blue is a state of mind where you're dominated by your **feelings**.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-3-2006(43): Spending too much time with one's **feelings** leads to the "having the blues", which we can put graphically as a _blue_ _state of mind_.
column8: 4) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 26-6-2008(34): Feeling _blue_ is your _state of mind_ when someone hurts your **feelings**.
column9: 5) [[elanlan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elanlan)] 2-8-2009(11): When your _state of mind_ is _blue_ , you tend to want to talk about your **feelings**.

column3: Take the key word in its associations with the weather (unless that tempts you to include the primitive for _weather_ , which doesn't belong here). Its elements: _sun_ . . . _blue_.
column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 22-2-2006(378): Sun and blue sky! Yep, the weather's cleared up!
column6: 2) [[dilandau23](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dilandau23)] 1-4-2007(25): When we speak of **clearing up** we easily think of both the _sun_ and _blue_ skies. But in another since to **clear up** is the absence of weather. And therefor the reason weather has no place in its writing.
column7: 3) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 17-5-2009(17): The sky **cleared up** and we have a _sunny blue day_.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 10-2-2008(9): Its clear weather now. Smufs are sunbathing. Sun and blue sky. What more do they need?
column9: 5) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 16-1-2008(3): Once it clears up, the sun will wash your blues away!

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(249): **Pure** sea _water_ is always a radiant _blue_.
column6: 2) [[partyrash](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/partyrash)] 4-2-2008(53): Bottles of water claim to be **pure**. They're generally in blue containers, because blue makes you feel like its that much more **pure**.
column7: 3) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 16-4-2008(29): **Pure** water is **pure** blue.
column8: 4) [[felicitygreen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/felicitygreen)] 30-3-2006(8): Aristocrats who boast of the purity of their lineage claim to have blue blood, as suggested by the delicate blue veins showing under their pale, thin skin. Here one of them is moved to cut himself, letting a few blue drops out to show the purity of his ancestry, breeding and intentions.
column9: 5) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 17-10-2007(5): You can't say (せい) that there is anything **pure** r than crystal clear _blue water_ from the ocean.

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(201): When someone you know who is normally talkative goes **quiet** , it's usually a sign that they are _contending_ with the _blues_.
column6: 2) [[zz_alex_zz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zz_alex_zz)] 24-3-2008(75): "And the next _contend_ er is…. a _Smurf_!" As you can imagine, the crowd goes **quiet** with shock.
column7: 3) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 31-8-2006(62): When you feel _blue_ , you want to go somewhere **quiet** to help you _contend_ with your problems.
column8: 4) [[robertmyers](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/robertmyers)] 17-12-2011(33): The once proud and boisterous contender has been smacked down by a smurf and is **quiet** for once.
column9: 5) [[Skinny](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Skinny)] 16-6-2009(24): Best way to get kids to be **quiet**. Have a **quiet** contest. Each contender must be **quiet** by holding their breath until they turn blue in the face.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 22-2-2007(318): As one _grows up_ , one typically starts to **blame** all of their problems on _money_.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 20-10-2008(79): This is the story of a poor fisherman and his wife. A long time ago he caught an oyster with a small but precious pearl. The intelligent wife told him to sell the pearl immediately: the greedy husband figured if he kept the oyster and fed it, it would grow up and yield an even bigger pearl. One day the _oyster grew so big_ , it crashed through the house and escaped back to sea. The angry wife left her husband, **blaming** his blind greed for their poverty.
column7: 3) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 21-6-2006(20): Alice ([poison](../v4/1531.html) (#1531 毒)) **blame** s her strange adventures on a batch of bad raw oysters.
