column8: 4) [[felicitygreen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/felicitygreen)] 30-3-2006(12): Those poor little oysters will never grow up now. And who's to **blame**? The Walrus and the Carpenter of course.
column9: 5) [[scotty28](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scotty28)] 23-1-2010(9): Peter Pan farts a lot, and he **blame** s it on all the oysters he greedily devours! Tinkerbell says, "Peter, stop blaming the shells and grow up!".

column5: 1) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 4-6-2008(224): _Spidey'_ s **exploits** are world famous but still The Daily Bugle's pages _blame_ him for every problem out there.
column6: 2) [[rptb1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rptb1)] 12-11-2005(99): [Geek alert] A lot of modern software is full of **exploits** which can be abused by hackers. I blame multi-threading.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 17-5-2007(30): Thorough psychological analysis reveals that all of Spiderman's villains are actually obsessed with him and long to be "dominated" by him. Therefore, the citizens of New York have no-one to _blame_ but _Spiderman_ for these villains' reckless **exploits**.
column8: 4) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 30-6-2009(29): _Spiderman's_ **exploits** have earned him fame and _blame_.
column9: 5) [[jajaaan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jajaaan)] 12-12-2009(24): The **exploits** of the RTK online community are such that every single poster has personified the thread radical into Spiderman. I blame it on the video games and TV that the kids are watching now-a-days.

column3: _Wheat_ . . . _blame_. This key word has to do with measurement, and should be kept distinct from the kanji for _quantity_ (Frame 189) - even though the meanings are similar.
column5: 1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 12-9-2006(207): On many _wheat cereal_ boxes, there is a disclaimer stating that "This package is sold by weight, not by **volume**. Some settling of contents may have occurred." well they only say that because they don't want to be _blame_ d by people getting really disappointed after they see what a small **volume** of _cereal_ the box really contains.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(138): The **volume** of the _wheat_ crop is way down this year! _Blame_ the weather!
column7: 3) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 26-7-2008(75): _Wheaties_ and other cereals are sold by weight, not **volume** , in order to avoid _blame_ if the contents settle. (simplified version of sweetneet's).
column8: 4) [[Odieone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Odieone)] 5-1-2009(31): The **volume** of _wheat_ I ate is to _blame_ for my weight gain.
column9: 5) [[arun90](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/arun90)] 14-4-2008(23): Most people say carbohydrates ( _grain_ ) are to _blame_ for their excessive **volume**.

column3: _Person_ . . . _blame_. The key word refers to financial **bonds**.
column5: 1) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 16-5-2007(166): Mr. T's plot of world domination is foiled. Who is to blame? **Bond**. James **Bond**.
column6: 2) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 20-1-2008(143): [bond, loan, debt] _Mr. T_ buys a lot of high risk **bond** s and then _blames_ his broker when they all plummet in value.
column7: 3) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 25-9-2007(22): It also means Loan and Debt: A friend of mine (or if you prefer, Mr. T) bought **Bond** s worth 1000 dollars, which came from a Loan from his parents. As predicted by his coworkers, family and friends, he lost everything in 3 days. He is the only Person to Blame. Now he has big Debt (true story).
column8: 4) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 14-3-2009(13): OBAMA won't take the BLAME for the drop in **BOND** markets, he'll blame Bush.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 10-6-2007(6): _Mr._ T came by my house and demanded I repay my **bond** s. But I told him it wasn't my fault—my annoying neighbor is to _blame_. Huh? It worked!? Seems like he went next door and beat my neighbor to a pulp!

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 25-5-2007(239): When **pickling** you MUST use distilled water! When it doesn't come out right, generally it is the _water_ that is to _blame_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(54): Bad _water_ is to _blame_ for the process of **pickling**.
column7: 3) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 20-5-2006(25): When the **pickling** doesn't come out right, generally the water is to blame.
column8: 4) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 3-10-2007(18): Think of knocking over a big jar of dill pickles and spilling water everywhere, then blaming your friend.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 23-12-2009(14): During **pickling** , _water_ is drawn out of the vegetable or fruit. Thus the **pickling** agent (miso, salt etc.) is responsible (to _blame_ ) for robbing the pickled item of its water.

column3: _Grow up_ . . . _rags_. This character represents the  "outside" of a garment, just as the kanji for _back_ (Frame 426) depicted the  "inside" or lining.
column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 17-7-2006(239): When I was GROWING UP, the **SURFACE** of my SCARF was always covered with snot from blowing my nose on it.
column6: 2) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 6-8-2008(97): As girls _grow up_ , something slowly **surfaces** from under their _scarf_.
column7: 3) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 25-9-2006(46): _Alice_ got back to the **surface** by climbing up the rabbit hole on an extremely long _scarf_.
column8: 4) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 12-4-2008(32): Imagine a _scarf_ _growing up_ until it covers the entire **SURFACE** of the world.
column9: 5) [[fergal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fergal)] 28-6-2009(23): It seems to mean "outer layer". Some animals shed their **surface** as they _grow up_. If it doesn't shed fully they end up wearing it like a _scarf_!

column3: Keep this kanji distinct from that for _sack_ (Frame 1081). Its elements are: _person_ . . . _surface_.
column5: 1) [[volfy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/volfy)] 17-4-2006(176): _Mr. T_ 's punching **bag** has one beat up _surface_.
column6: 2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 28-2-2006(57): Do you know why every _person_ in Japan has a Louis Vuitton **bag**? After the 1985 JAL air crash that killed 520 people (the world's worst). An image on tv of the crash showed Louis Vuitton **bag** s (whose LV logo covered _surface_ was somehow impervious) litering the crash site. From that point on they stuck in Japanese people's mind's as durable and high quality. (True story).
column7: 3) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 27-5-2008(43): Superficial _people_ (ie those who are only concerned about the _surface_ ) are obsessed with expensive **bag** s.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 26-9-2008(19): _Haruhi_ is imprinted on the _surface_ of my **bag**.
column9: 5) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 12-11-2009(17): TIP: Not a **bag** , this is a straw container that looks like a straw bale. Also used to mark the edge of the sumo ring… STORY: When _Mr T_ tried sumo wrestling he got knocked right to the _surface_ of the dohyo and ended up staring at the **tawara** … 俵 [たわら] [、土俵](midori://search?text=、土俵) [どひょう].

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(207): To ensure she remained **undefiled** , a young girl _growing up_ in a rough area always kept a _dagger_ concealed under her _threads_ , even when she went into the _water_.
column6: 2) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 17-8-2008(134): (rgravina) To ensure she remained **undefiled** , a young girl _growing up_ in a rough area always kept a _dagger_ concealed under her _Spiderman underwear_ (to remember the position of _thread_ ), even when she went into the _water_.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 6-2-2008(28): _Venom_ 's suit is self-cleaning and remains **undefiled** , despite its forming weapons, _growing up_ into _daggers_ and killing people, sending _drops of fluid_ (blood) flying everywhere. No _water_ necessary, and his conscience is clean too.
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 26-12-2006(24): Oh no, comeback of the dirty imagery.. And I thought I got rid of that. Anyway, the "grown-up dagger" is a, um, phallus (are these characters like the Rorschach ink blots? Freud would be proud). Here someone ties a thread around it, so that dirty liquid won't come out of it and his surroundings remain **undefiled**.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 7-12-2008(17): By _growing up_ with a _dagger_ under his pillow, _Venom_ remained **undefiled** until marriage. He even washed himself with holy _water_ just to be sure.

column3: _Grow up_ . . . _dagger_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for _vow_ (Frame 1214) and _promise_ (Frame 1462).
column5: 1) [[frozach](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/frozach)] 18-10-2007(164): Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while _growing up_ , you have to **pledge** allegiance to the flag at _dagger_ -point and with _St. Bernard_ guard dogs watching you.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 27-5-2008(81): With our new pills we **pledge** to _grow_ your _dagger bigger_ \- typical junk mail.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 3-9-2007(55): In order to **pledge** into her sorority, _Alice_ had to stab a _St. Bernard_ with a _dagger_. (Come on! DO it, _Alice_!).
column8: 4) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 17-6-2009(18): In medieval Japan often to form an alliance Warlords would give up their daughter as a **pledge**. She would _grow up_ guarded by _daggers_ and _St. Bernard_ dogs. If the alliance was broken she would be killed (More or less true).
column9: 5) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 21-8-2006(18): "I **pledge** my allegiance to the flag….: " _Growing up_ we **pledge** d out allegiance to the flag of our nation to protect it from being torn or disgraced such as with _daggers_ or to fall on the ground and be ripped to shreds by _dogs_.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 10-12-2006(146): This means eat/drink/smoke. Maybe you make a pledge to stop gutsing/binging/puffing, but your own mouth is tempting you to put something in it.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 17-12-2007(112): I make my _mouth pledge_ to **consume** less.
column7: 3) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 23-10-2008(64): New American _pledge_ of allegiance: I will **consume**.
column8: 4) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 5-7-2007(25): After _pledging_ , Alice and the sorority **consume** d the St. Bernard with their _mouths_.
column9: 5) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 5-11-2007(15): You have an eating problem and always **CONSUME** too much, cramming it in your MOUTH. Here, you make a PLEDGE to **CONSUME** less, maybe by keeping your MOUTH shut more often.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(282): With kids _growing up_ in your _house_ , you have to keep them from **harm** of putting anything in their _mouth_ , paint chips, bleach, knvies, etc.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 26-12-2006(72): This is silly, but.. If a house suddenly grows up from your mouth, you will come to great **harm**.
column7: 3) [[Beneus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beneus)] 19-1-2009(19): Babies think that there's no **harm** in putting stuff in their mouths, but you just know that one day they'll find a growth pill, eat it and crash through the roof of your house as they grow.
column8: 4) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 23-8-2009(14): In the _house_ , whenever _Alice_ opens her _mouth_ (to eat or drink) she causes **harm** (by growing too big for the house).
column9: 5) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 1-4-2008(14): **Harm** is being done all throughout the _house_ that _Peter Pan_ lives in. Him and all the lost boys are all putting things they aren't supposed to into their mouths! (thanks dingomick) I'm going to call this the lost boys house.

column3: _Car_ . . . _harm_. Hint: the image of an auto going  "out of **control** " may help keep this key word distinct from others like it, such as _manipulate_ (Frame 864).
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 7-5-2007(161): **Control** is very important! Especially when operating a _car_. Few people realize the _harm_ they can cause just by losing **control** of their _car_ for a second. Tremendous _harm_. Stay in **control**!
column6: 2) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 14-3-2007(99): The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of _cars_ have spun out of **control**! Luckily, it was just a couple of dents, nobody was _harmed_.
column7: 3) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 17-4-2008(63): If you lose **control** of your car, you may come to great harm.
column8: 4) [[blubko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blubko)] 16-6-2010(16): Losing **control** of your car results in great harm.
column9: 5) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 21-4-2010(7): In Knightrider, the _car_ KITT was in **control** , making sure no _harm_ came to the Hoff.

column5: 1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 10-4-2007(181): [proportion, comparatively, divide, cut, separate, split] Hey, don't take this out of **proportion**! I did you just a little _harm_ , no need to come over here with a _saber_ …
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(136): As shown on this pie-chart, the **proportion** of people _harmed_ by _sabres_ is relatively a small slice compared to those _harmed_ by guns.
column7: 3) [[QuackingShoe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/QuackingShoe)] 10-9-2008(73): In Japanese anime and video games, the heroes often have _sabers_ that seem way out of **proportion** to their weilders, especially with how scrawny these pointy-haired kids tend to be. I'm not sure if the **proportion** s of those _sabers_ will cause more _harm_ to their enemies or their weilders… Or, I'm surprised they don't _harm_ themselves with the **proportion** s of their _sabres_.
column8: 4) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 7-12-2008(24): The _harm_ caused by a _saber_ is not always in **proportion** to its size.
column9: 5) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 25-6-2009(17): The harm is **proportion** al to the size of the saber.

column3: The key word refers to the fundamental guiding principles of a government or other organization. Its elements: _House_ . . . _grow up_ . . . _eyes_ . . . _heart_.
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 17-1-2007(255): The **constitution** is important. At least my parents thought so. In the _house_ where I _grew up_ , it was framed on the wall. Under the watchful (sideways) _eye_ of my mother, we had to study it until we knew it by _heart_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(77): The _house_ of US Congress needs to _grow up_! Their _twisted_ eyes have lost the _heart_ of the **constitution**.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 17-5-2007(49): The original Japanese **constitution** is locked up deep within the Imperial Palace, _home_ of the Emperor. Since its creation, it's gotten _bigger and bigger_ , and it's even grown a _pair of eyes_ , as well as a _beating heart_. Naturally the Emperor tries to keep this hidden from the public, but what will they do once the **constitution** -monster becomes big enough to destroy the palace?
column8: 4) [[Odieone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Odieone)] 5-1-2009(34): I _grow up_ in a _house_ which values the **constitution**. My father always told me to look not just with my _eyes_ but with my _heart_ as well.
column9: 5) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 15-6-2009(23): [ +CharleyGarret + Growing up=Peter Pan] In Peter Pan's Lost Boys house, they eye the consitution every day and have learned it by heart. "No Lost Girls, Captain Hook stinks, we'll never grow up! We'll scream till we're pink!" (Hey, I'm trying here - there are no other Peter Pan stories.).

column3: A single _drop_ added to the element for _grow up_ gives us the character for **life**.
column4: * As a primitive, we may think of a microscopic cell, that miraculous unit that grows up to become a living being.
column5: 1) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 5-11-2007(221): This is the first CELL of a human, the foundation of its entire **LIFE** , a small DROP that will GROW UP to form a complex organism.
column6: 2) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 19-12-2007(29): Growing Up is just a Drop of our **LIFE**.
column7: 3) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 26-6-2006(13): Frankenstein's monster given the spark of **life**. Let's call him Frank. From Mary Shelley's work along with Young Frankenstein and other references.
column8: 4) [[dboyle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dboyle)] 13-2-2009(11): Add a _drop_ of miracle _grow_ and a plant really comes to **life**.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 26-8-2009(8): **Life** starts with a _drop_ of sperm and then you _grow up_.

column5: 1) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 17-10-2007(180): The _sun_ is the nearest **star** to the only planet with _life_ \- Earth.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 26-12-2006(98): Sun is a **star** that has given life. Can't say that of any other **star** s yet.
column7: 3) [[kiisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kiisu)] 23-4-2008(41): Our **star** , the _sun_ , gives life to all _cells_.
column8: 4) [[shuusaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shuusaku)] 9-1-2013(16): The SUN is the **STAR** that gives LIFE to our planet.
column9: 5) [[paramausi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paramausi)] 29-6-2009(14): One _day_ in my _life_ i will be a **star**!

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 19-6-2007(73): On **awakening** the first thing I notice is a (nearly empty) _whiskey bottle_ by my bed. Then I see the _stars_ are still shining. “I think I’ll go back to sleep and try **awakening** again later.”.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(17): You'll need an **awakening** after the _whiskey bottle_ makes you see _stars_.
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(3): My **awakening** came not from ordinary hallucinogens but from extraordinary _whiskey_ : I saw _stars_.
column8: 4) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 18-12-2011(2): The first thing I see when I **awaken** is _stars_ , I wonder why until I feel the _whiskey bottle_ next to me. Ah crap, I still need to **sober up**.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 30-10-2010(2): 半醒半睡 , 覚せい剤 , 覚醒剤 , 醒ます , 醒める [awakening](../v4/2750.html) (#2750 醒) セイ, (さます, さめる (now usu. [覚ます・覚める](midori://search?text=覚ます・覚める) ) … Parts: 酉 , 星 [star](../v4/1556.html) (#1556 星) … Similars: 醒める [awakening](../v4/2750.html) (#2750 醒), 悟り [enlightenment](../v4/622.html) (#622 悟) … Story: The path to **Awakening** are many, _Drinking_ until you see _Stars_ is not one of them. (well maybe it is for the Tantric sects. (actual meaning: stimulant).

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(292): When _women_ marry, they adopt the **surname** of their husband, signifiying the start of a new _life_ together. (adapted from gorgon).
column6: 2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 1-3-2006(87): _Woman_ change their **surname** when they "start their new _life_ ".
column7: 3) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 16-4-2008(34): To help you keep this separate from [family name](../v4/1828.html) (#1828 氏) (as I have been doing lately…), picture a woman who just married a man, and of course, she adopts his **surname** and they start a new life together. Throughout their entire life together, he requires her to address him as "sir." Yes, like the sur in "surname".
column8: 4) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 6-3-2008(21): _Women_ should keep their own **surname** when they marry. Changing **surname** is like disavowing your previous _life_.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 3-9-2007(10): The _woman_ didn't want to marry _Frankenstein_ in the first place, much less have to change her **surname**. (Image: the bride griamcing in the contables office signing the certificate to change her name).

column5: 1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 5-4-2006(186): **Sex** is the only _state of mind_ for many men through their whole _life_.
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 11-1-2008(113): When you're in the _state of mind_ for creating new _lives_.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 7-2-2008(64): I think this can also mean **gender** –one could look at the differences between **gender** and **sex** : one is a _state of mind_ , the other is set biologically in the _cells_.
column8: 4) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 19-11-2007(57): _Data's_ _life_ did not begin with **sex**.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 3-9-2007(21): Despite being of the same **sex** , _Data_ and _Frankenstein_ do each other knowing it's the only **sex** they'll ever get. (Image: do I even have to paint this one…?).

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 8-1-2008(279): **Animal sacrifice** = taking the life of a cow.
column6: 2) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 12-3-2007(71): In the 21st century, **animal sacrifice** is no longer really necessary. We can take a single cell from a cow, with no harm to the cow. We create a viable cell line from this single cell, and feed the resulting biomatter into a furnace at the exact rate necessary to appease the gods.
column7: 3) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 20-12-2007(20): The whole _life_ of a _cow_ is like one big long **animal sacrifice**.
column8: 4) [[Odieone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Odieone)] 5-1-2009(13): _Life_ for a _cow_ in India is pretty good. At least they would never be used as an animal scarifice.
column9: 5) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 16-6-2008(13): There are two kanji that should be kept separate: [sacrifice](../v4/643.html) (#643 犠) ( 義 ), and this one. Think of it this way: in 義 there is a _cow_ and a _righteous_ person (presumably a Hindu). One must be **SACRIFICE** d, so naturally the righteous Hindu took the place of the holy cow. But as the Hindu is no longer alive to protect the cow, so we will now take the _cow's life_ in an **animal sacrifice**.

column5: 1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 8-11-2006(234): If you were to _stand up_ all the **products** you have accumulated over the course of your entire _life_ on top of one another, the result would probably be as tall as a _cliff_.
column6: 2) [[Ramchip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ramchip)] 23-7-2008(190): The salesman is _standing on the cliff_ 's edge. "Buy my **products**!! Buy my **products**! Or else I'll take my own _life_ "! Man, that's selling on pressure.
column7: 3) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 16-6-2008(20): Japanese are obsesed with all the **products** they can buy. Stand up for your self!! take the **products** to a cliff, threw them off, and stat a new life!!!
column8: 4) [[paramausi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paramausi)] 2-7-2009(12): People _stand_ on a _cliff_ and want to end their _lifes_. This is a **product** of todays society.
column9: 5) [[kodama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodama)] 27-10-2007(11): A Biotech company has an unusual showcase for their **products** : they line up the _vases_ full of _cells_ on a spectacular _cliff_ -top facing out to sea.

column3: This character, used for everything from little **humps** of hills to camel **humps** , easily suggests the hunch on the pig's back and hind parts where the best cuts of meat are to be found (and hence the English expression for luxury, "living high off the hog.") The elements we have to work with are: _pinnacle_ . . . _walking legs_ . . . _cell_.
column5: 1) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 25-9-2007(186): You are struggling to the top across the **hump** s, but you suddenly see the _pinnacle_ and you feel new _life_ in your _walking legs_.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 14-4-2007(51): A woman takes her _bra_ off and what happens? Nine months later the **hump** in her belly pops out between her _legs_ as a new _life_.
column7: 3) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 16-1-2008(43): I climbed to the pinnacle with my girlfriend and we immediately got to making life between her legs (humping).
column8: 4) [[Ramchip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ramchip)] 23-7-2008(31): _The Pinnacle_ , this perfect place, did have one person with a **hump** on his back. Poor guy spent his whole _life_ aimlessly walking around the Pinnacle, without finding anyone to relate to.
column9: 5) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 24-1-2008(31): The **hump** of a camel is actually a separate animal resting on top of the camel. It has its own _walking legs_ and its own _life_. These animals are great as pets but are very expensive. A resident of _The Pinnacle_ has bought one of the expensive pets - a **hump** with _walking legs_ and a _life_ of its own - and is walking it home from the pet store.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 6-3-2010(218): "Walking legs" over "bushes" needs to have a primitive meaning of its own. It appears in several kanji, such as 縫 [sew](../v4/1563.html) (#1563 縫), 逢 [tryst](../v4/2417.html) (#2417 逢), 蜂 [bee](../v4/2687.html) (#2687 蜂), and 鋒 [sword’s point](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2768) (#2768 鋒), and it is clumsy to work bushes and walking legs into every story. "Pointy" works fairly well: the walking legs are stuck on top of the pointy part of the bush, and for this character: a **summit** is the _pointy_ end of a _mountain_.
column6: 2) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 17-4-2008(72): Moses climbs to the **summit** of the mountain using his walking legs to talk to the burning bush.
column7: 3) [[crayonmaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crayonmaster)] 17-5-2009(57): If you are using the "walking legs + bushes = pubic hair" primitive… The nudist colony was banished to the top of the mountain's **summit** , so that nobody would have to see their bushes again!
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 3-1-2007(27): Like in the next frame, the right side element is "walking through bushes". This time they're not on the road, but on a mountain, whose **summit** you're trying to reach. (the element will come in at least 逢 again).
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 16-8-2009(16): _Bush_ between _walking legs_ = _pubic hair_!

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 31-12-2007(62): A **bee** is an _insect_ with a _pointy_ (see [summit](../v4/1562.html) (#1562 峰)) stinger.
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 22-1-2010(37): I got stung by an _insect walking through the bushes_ , I think it was a **bee**.
column7: 3) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 27-7-2009(10): Many people think **bee** s are insects with fur. But that is not correct! The "fur" is actually the _pubic hair_ ( _bush_ under _walking legs_ ).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(9): The _insect_ that interrupted our [tryst](../v4/2417.html) (#2417 逢) was a **bee**!
column9: 5) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 12-12-2011(3): Most people don't know that the hair covering a **bee** ( _insect_ ) isn't fur, but actually _pubic hair_. Little known fact.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 17-5-2007(110): Good thing I brought some _thread_ , cause I need to **sew** my pants that I tore up _walking through the bushes_ (see [summit](../v4/1562.html) (#1562 峰)) before we hit the _road_ to go back down the mountain.
column6: 2) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 25-11-2007(94): _Spiderman_ while _walking through bushes_ chasing a villain, rips his suit and stops on the road to **sew** it up.
column7: 3) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 5-6-2008(72): _Spider man_ has to **sew** a new costume. He slipped while web swinging and fell on a bunch of _pointy_ stuff in the _road_. Ouch! (See Mcfate's [summit](../v4/1562.html) (#1562 峰) story for the "pointy" primitive).
column8: 4) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 27-12-2008(29): _Spiderman_ has to **sew** his spider suit after the _[tryst](../v4/2417.html) (#2417 逢)_ last night. (He had to keep his suit on during the tryst to keep his anonymity).
column9: 5) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 26-11-2007(25): After a 逢 [tryst](../v4/2417.html) (#2417 逢), they will **sew** a scarlet letter to your clothes with red _thread_. Or at least, that's how it used to be done.

column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 14-3-2007(209): I put my _fingers_ together in **worship** of the _bush_ that hangs from the _ceiling_ – that wonderful mistletoe which has gotten me kissed by many a girl.
column6: 2) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 3-7-2008(153): Because I **worship** her, I only finger ONE BUSH, her's, and no others!
column7: 3) [[mikedough2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikedough2)] 20-1-2008(72): Imagine a weird cult where you hang a _bush from the ceiling_ and then point at it with one _finger_ saying " _Bush_ , _bush_ , _bush_ , I **worship** the bush!".
column8: 4) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 5-11-2007(31): PRESIDENT BUSH thought that coming to power would cause people to **WORSHIP** him, but now that his approval rating is so low, people just give him the FINGER and hang BUSH-pinatas from the CEILING to hit with bats.
column9: 5) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 5-6-2008(28): Some people **worship** George _Bush_. I'd like to hang him from the _ceiling_ and give him the _finger_.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-10-2005(231): This old China man _glued_ _shrubs_ to his body. The added intake of oxygen from the _shrubs_ was, according to him, the secret of his **longevity**. Sometimes he would sit all day in meditation without moving, and the locals believed the old man had actually turned into a _shrub_ !
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 6-7-2007(104): To ensure **longevity** of her virginity, Alice applied a thick layer of _glue_ on her _bush_.
column7: 3) [[sarek05](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sarek05)] 28-9-2008(96): In an attempt to increase a _bush's_ **longevity** , an incompitent gardener _glues_ all the leaves back on that have fallen off. Maybe he should have tried watering it instead.
column8: 4) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 25-11-2007(17): The only reason "President Bush" has had such **longevity** in the white house is all the people under him who keep _gluing_ his presidential career back together.
column9: 5) [[sir_sanuk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sir_sanuk)] 26-1-2011(13): Increase the **longevity** of a _bush_ by sticking the fallen leaves back on with _glue_.

column3: _Metal_ . . . _longevity_. As you probably guessed from the elements, the key word refers to the **casting** of metals.
column5: 1) [[scout](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scout)] 9-2-2008(160): They made a _metal_ **casting** of the Chinese man who _glued_ _shrubs_ to himself to increase his _longevity_. It's now sold around the world as it's thought that having one will increase your own _longevity._.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 6-2-2007(86): You make a **casting** of your baby's shoes in _gold_ to ensure the _longevity_ of the experience.
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 20-9-2006(71): We take a **casting** because _metal_ will have much greater _longevity_ than the original.
column8: 4) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 26-5-2010(35): **Casting** things in _metal_ improves their _longevity_.
column9: 5) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 18-7-2007(15): I have a problem with _longevity_ so I need _Bush_ in this story too. Here das _Bush_ is wanting a _metal_ **casting** made of him to guarantee his _longevity_ \- reminds me of the statue of Saddam that was pulled down.

column3: Bamboo . . . Christmas tree . . . once upon a time.
column5: 1) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 14-9-2007(266): _Once upon a time_ , in order to **enroll** in a Christian school you had to answer a series of questions to ensure that you were really Christian. For example, the principal might show you a picture of a _Christmas tree_ and a picture of some _bamboo_ and ask you which one is most suitable for decoration at Christmas time.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 24-1-2008(90): Japanese father **enroll** s his student in a well-rounded school: they teach eastern traditions (the way of the _bamboo_ ), western traditions (like _Christmas trees_ ), and also teach literature ( _once upon a time_ ).
column7: 3) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 18-4-2008(41): Once upon a time, Santa Claus visited Asia and left presents under bamboo Christmas trees for all the children who **enroll** ed in his Asian beta-testing…
column8: 4) [[rptb1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rptb1)] 14-11-2005(23): Once upon a time, there was a little bamboo plant who tried to **enroll** as a Christmas tree.
column9: 5) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 18-7-2012(11): **Enroll** in the class to make the BAMBOO- CHRISTMAS TREE that were made ONCE UPON A TIME. (セキ).

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-3-2007(194): In the **springtime** _bonsai_ get plenty of _sun_.
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 11-1-2008(90): When it's **springtime** you can only leave the _bonsai_ out when the _sun_ has gone down. Their little leaves can't handle too much heat.
column7: 3) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 29-12-2008(27): **Springtime** is the best season for Bonsai, because you can leave it out in the sun all day.
column8: 4) [[gibler](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gibler)] 15-10-2010(19): A more simple Primitive than bonsai: **3 people 三 ＋ 人** Springtime: **3 people** sitting enjoying the escape from winter, soaking in the **sun**. RTK2: シュン 売春 ばいしゅん(prostitution) "selling spring".
column9: 5) [[Cyclone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cyclone)] 20-9-2011(10): Quand le soleil sort enfin au printemps (il est encore bas dans le ciel), papa, maman, bébé (trois personnes 三 人 ) se promènent au soleil( 日 ).

column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 14-3-2007(280): The _tree_ of _spring_. Fact: **Camellia** are highly valued in Japan and elsewhere for their very early flowering, often among the first flowers to appear in the late winter [early spring?].
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-3-2007(43): Anyone who's lived in Japan knows **camellia** are by far the first tree of spring to flower. And how can you miss those shockingly pink flowers!
column7: 3) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 2-1-2009(14): The **camellia** _tree_ got its name from all the chameleons that cover every part of it during the _spring_.
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 23-4-2012(8): The **camellia** is the _tree_ which brings out its own _springtime_ , even when it's not springtime, as it blooms around January.
column9: 5) [[sskaggs](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sskaggs)] 22-10-2011(5): The **camellia** is the famous _tree_ you see blooming in early _spring_ , and also, the **camellia** is taken from its _tree_ to be used in "flowering tea," as a small way to bring _spring_ into your tea breaks. —- Ways you've seen **camellia** s that may help memorization: the tree called C. Japonica is in the **camellia** family, flowering teas (where the tea in sewn to a **camellia** flower which "blooms" when brewed, and this kanji is read as つばき, which is a very common anime name. similar [chrysanthemum](../v4/927.html) (#927 菊), [wisteria](../v4/1210.html) (#1210 藤).

column5: 1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 15-3-2006(233): If you look into Japanese gardens they seem so **peaceful** \- with their small bonsais and the white stones looking like rice grains.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 24-1-2008(52): A monk pleads with an invading warrior not to destroy his people. "We are a **peaceful** people," the monk pleads. "Our monks spend all of their time tending to their harmless _bonsai trees_. And as for food, we require only a few _grains of rice_.".
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 3-9-2007(28): A _bonsai_ with _rice_ under it (to imitate a miniature white rock garden) is the epitome of a **peaceful** image.
column8: 4) [[iVoid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/iVoid)] 26-5-2008(12): I can't help but imagine a monk mediating under a bonsai tree, surviving only on a few grains of rice, seems so **peaceful**.
column9: 5) [[gibler](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gibler)] 15-10-2010(7): A more simple Primitive than bonsai: **3 people 三 ＋ 人** Nothing more **Peaceful** than **3 friends/people** from different cultures exchanging ways to fix food. From Japan Rice, from USA a nice burger, and Thailand Spicy Cashew Chicken!! RTK2: タイ 泰国 たいこく (Thailand).

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 24-1-2007(200): When you **play music** to them, your _bonsai_ will grow like they are in _heaven_.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 24-5-2007(79): In _heaven_ you are surrounded by _bonsai_ trees (full-sized ones fall through the clouds) while you **play music** on your harp. I always have trouble remembering that the bonsai tree is on top, so think of them growing on top of the clouds.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 18-5-2009(59): I **play music** to my _bonsai_ to help it grow. Its favourite song is Stairway to _Heaven_.
column8: 4) [[mr_hans_moleman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mr_hans_moleman)] 7-11-2008(16): When you **play music** to them, your _bonsai_ will grow until they reach the HEAVENS.
column9: 5) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(13): The Japanese believe that when they die, they will go to a _heaven_ with beautiful _bonzai_ gardens and gentle **music playing**.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 27-12-2006(239): Bonsais are grown in a house, away from the harsh **reality** of the real world where they wouldn't survive.
column6: 2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 12-12-2007(104): On this rather boring 'big brother' type **reality** show, they have locked up _bonsai_ inside a _house_ and everyone is watching them on TV 24x7. The viewers have to vote on which bonsai shall remain in the house and which one has to leave.
column7: 3) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 13-10-2006(27): (adapted from PepeSeco) In a new TV **reality** show called _bonsai_ _house_ , participants are challenged to grow the best bonsai. It takes years to make just one episode!
column8: 4) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 7-6-2008(14): _Mr. Miyagi_ is on a new **reality** TV show, _House of Miyagi_. 20 aspiring martial artists have to wash and clean an old house, while growing their own bonsai. Of course, their Bonsai don't come out very well, since they're novices. (I'm trying to differentiate this bonsai from the rest of the ones we've learned as being a messed up bonsai.. Notice the last stroke doesn't connect to the 2nd stroke of the kanji, but the 3rd instead.).
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 1-7-2009(12): The **reality** is that most _bonsai_ don't do well in the _house_.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(213): To join the temple, you have to **dedicate** yourself to raising _bonsai_ for enlightenment, and _cornstalks_ for sustenance.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 23-4-2006(61): A Japanese farmer who was growing _corn_ tried to **dedicate** himself to the god of _corn_ (in the hope it would bring better harvests). He had a little room with prayer beads, incense, etc. One day he brought an offerand that he thought would please the god of _corn_ : a _bonsai - corn_ (a _corn_ plant turned into a _bonsai_ ). The god was infuriated and yelled at him "HOW DARE YOU TORTURE MY CORN IN SUCH WAYS!". The End.
column7: 3) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 8-12-2008(42): I used _does not equal_ for the primitve(slant the line as a slash through the "equals" sign). Story: Decorating a _bonsai tree_ for Christmas _does not equal_ an **observance** of the real meaning of Christmas. Just like most people who **dedicate** themselves to appeasing the Credit Card gods for Christmas. Just _dosen't equal_ the Christmas I know of.
column8: 4) [[drivers99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/drivers99)] 14-8-2009(34): You have to be really **dedicate** d to make a _bonsai tree_ out of a _cornstalk_.
column9: 5) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 11-4-2007(16): Once a year, the Japanese decorate bonsai trees with miniature cornstalks, and **dedicate** them to the Ainu, the indigenous people of Japan. (For the record, I completely made that up, and I don't think corn has anything to do with Ainu, except that it reminds me of natives).

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 3-9-2007(170): _Mr. T_ gets a **stipend** every month if he stays _dedicated_ to his temple training, a very hard thing for the impatient T.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 19-4-2008(28): People who are highly dedicated to their jobs get good salaries/stipends.
column7: 3) [[gavin.schultz-ohkubo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavin.schultz- ohkubo)] 17-6-2010(15): You must be kidding… yet another source of confusion, with [earnings](../v4/893.html) (#893 稼), [salary](../v4/1349.html) (#1349 給), [assets](../v4/473.html) (#473 資), [savings](../v4/194.html) (#194 貯) and [income](../v4/1510.html) (#1510 収). A **stipend** , in English at least, has a connotation of only a small regular payment. Despite a life of _dedication_ , _P_ has to go back to a simple life of tending to _bonsai_ and growing _corn_ after he retires with only a small monthly **stipend**.
column8: 4) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 25-7-2006(12): Mr. T triked the botanic intruction institute into thinking that he dedicated his whole like in bonsai and corn research. He even manage to get a **stipend** from that institute. In fact he's not dedicated at all when it comes to bonsai or corn… he only water them once in a while.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 7-5-2007(10): The **stipend** is given to a _person_ who is very _dedicated_ to his bonsai art so he can study more.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(224): Ha! If you know anything about Buddhist monks, during meditation, they're slapped with _wooden_ **rod** s to stay _dedicated_ to their task.
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 6-9-2007(74): The wood from this _tree_ is _dedicated_ to making **rods** to flog naughty kids.
column7: 3) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 16-1-2008(34): After crafting his **rod** from the finest _tree_ in the land, Moses broke into a battle rap. "I _dedicate_ this _rod_ / To the all mighty God!".
column8: 4) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 10-11-2008(17): A **rod** is a piece of _wood_ that is _dedicated_ to a particular purpose… (use your imagination).
column9: 5) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 25-6-2009(13): I dedicate this tree… to **rod** stuart. fuck knows why.

column5: 1) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 16-1-2008(224): Muttering words of gratitude for a wonderful meal, I **discreet** ly slipped my cabbage under the table for the dog.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 10-2-2008(135): _Cabbage_ primitive: When a _cabbage_ is _growing up_ , you must put it in your _mouth_ before it _flowers_ , because that's when it becomes bitter. Seriously, it's called 'bolting' or something. When you're **discreet** , you try to make your _words_ like a _cabbage_ : well-layered, but in an unassuming way.
column7: 3) [[kodorakun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodorakun)] 6-5-2010(55): HOW TO REMEMBER CABBAGE: it's the flower that is shoved in your mouth while you are growing up (parents force feed you cabbage), note how the "grow up" primitive is pushed into the mouth primitive overlapping. "Muttering words of gratitude for a wonderful meal, I **discreet** ly slipped my cabbage under the table for the dog.".
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 27-12-2006(37): Be **discreet** and don't say to old people that their heads look like cabbages, even if they're all wrinkles.
column9: 5) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 5-1-2009(26): Instead of cabbage here I see the Piranha Plant from Super Mario bros. It's a flower with a mouth and it grows up out of a pipe! Seems to make sense to me. But instead of regular Mario you have Socrates! So here is what is going on. Two Piranha Plants are **discreet** ly discussing when they will come up out of their pipes to hit Socrates. They have to talk **discreet** ly however becuase Socrates is standing right next to their pipes.

column5: 1) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 26-6-2010(45): To MR.T swallowing a whole CABBAGE is no more than a **TRIFLE**.
column6: 2) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 10-10-2011(21): MR. T doesn't look a wee bit scared of the CABBAGE PATCH KID.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-6-2009(15): _Mr. T_ is a **trifle** annoyed when he finds _cabbage_ in his **trifle** (pun – **trifle** is a kind of dessert in UK).
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 5-2-2012(7): The _person_ was such a nerd to concern himself with **trifle** s such as that the cauliflower is really a _cabbage_ with _twenty flowers_.
column9: 5) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 10-12-2008(6): To a big guy like _Mr. T_ , eating a whole _cabbage_ at once is nothing. "What? a _cabbage?_ That's just a **trifle** , foo, where's the meat?".

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-5-2007(140): Growing _cabbages_ takes _muscle_ and **diligence**.
column6: 2) [[lynbroughton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lynbroughton)] 25-7-2007(68): It takes great **DILIGENCE** for a cabbage patch dolly to build up her _muscles_ and win the Miss Universe contest!
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 25-2-2008(66): Careful: [discipline](../v4/1722.html) (#1722 修). The school cafeteria manager decided, on her own initiative, to remove all _cabbage_ from the school menu. This resulted in weakened students with poor _muscles_. Angry parents sued the manager. The main argument was that the manager did not show due **diligence** in researching the effects on _muscles_ of removing _cabbage_ from the diet.
column8: 4) [[Corodon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Corodon)] 28-1-2009(65): With enough **diligence** , Koreans can turn ordinary _cabbage_ into _powerful_ kimchi.
column9: 5) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 5-11-2009(37): Bodybuilder **diligence** : Eat _cabbage_. Build _muscles_. Eat _cabbage_. Build _muscles_. Eat _cabbage_. Build _muscles_ …

column3: _Water_ . . . _scarecrow_. The key word has come to refer to things Chinese in general, including the kanji themselves (for which this character is used).
column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 21-11-2006(200): In the _water_ between Japan and China, the **Sino-** side has put _scarecrows_ in the water to try and keep the Japanese away.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 19-4-2008(107): Take the left to be "kanji" not scarecrow. **Sino-** (Chinese) people had to put a lot of sweat into learning the kanji. See the drops of sweat coming off.
column7: 3) [[Tzadeck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tzadeck)] 13-8-2009(54): _Kanji_ came from across the _water_ , on the **Sino-** side of things.
column8: 4) [[DeadLugosi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DeadLugosi)] 28-9-2008(40): This is the character you have on the left top of this website ,-).
column9: 5) [[aphasiac](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aphasiac)] 9-9-2010(31): **Sino-** (Chinese) people had to put a lot of _sweat/water_ into learning the _kanji_. For right-hand _kanji_ primitive - The dumb Western _husband_ of a Japanese woman buys her _flowers_ to apologise, after he opened his big _mouth_ and said " **kanji** are a stupid writing system"..

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 28-8-2007(245): A **sigh** escapes the _mouth_ of the _scarecrow_ , who laments: "…if I only had a brain, I could learn kanji".
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 19-4-2008(155): I will let out a huge **sigh** of relief from my mouth when I learn the last kanji.
column7: 3) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 5-6-2008(31): A **sigh** escapes the _mouth_ everytime I come across yet ANOTHER _kanji_ i have to learn…
column8: 4) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 11-4-2007(18): A **sigh** escapes the _mouth_ of the _scarecrow_ , who laments: "…if I only had a brain.".
column9: 5) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 27-7-2009(16): When a manga character **sigh** s, out of his _mouth_ comes a _kanji_.

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 8-8-2007(243): It is **difficult** for a _scarecrow_ to scare a _turkey_ or else they would've been called scareturkeys.
column6: 2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 19-4-2008(128): Learning Kanji is **difficult** for Turkeys.
column7: 3) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 8-7-2008(52): It is **difficult** to get back into the _kanji_ learning groove again after going cold _turkey_ for a month or so.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 28-11-2009(12): The _Scarecrow_ is trying to scare some _turkeys_ , but they all just ignore him. He turns to you and says, "Scaring crows is easy, but _turkeys_ – now that's **difficult** ".
column9: 5) [[meredithcat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meredithcat)] 25-7-2010(8): You think it's **difficult** for you to learn kanji? Think about how **difficult** it would be for a turkey!

column5: 1) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 27-6-2006(178): The Queen of England taking a walk round a village: 'Excuse me, I couldn't help noticing the **splendour** of the _flowers_ in your garden. Simply splendid. _Ten_ out of ten.' The villager gruffly replies: 'No it 'aint. It's all muck. An' I'm gonna cut it all down and sell it to the farmer for _silage_.'.
column6: 2) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 21-11-2007(149): Hint: **Splendor** in the Grass. Compare with 草 . This is just a more **splendid** version of that kanji.
column7: 3) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 6-7-2008(50): In all its **splendor** a delicate flower arose from the pile of silage on a single needle-think stem.
column8: 4) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 28-7-2009(36): I couldn't find the _needle_ in the heap of _silage_ but was surprised to find a _flower_ of great **splendor** growing there.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 27-12-2008(21): The tourist marvels at the **splendor** of the jungle _flowers_. Little does she know, the _crosshair_ of a _needle_ -gun is pointing right at her. (As a primitive _silage_ can take the meaning ' **crosshair** '… for blindingly obvious reasons).

column3: _A drop of_ . . . _silage_ . . . _walking stick_ . . . _floor_. The character is written in the order of its elements.
column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(158): For an old man with a _walking stick_ , even a _drop_ of _silage_ to carry on his back will make him _droop_ low down to the _floor_.
column6: 2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 13-9-2008(107): Even a _drop_ of _silage_ is enough to make an old man with a _walking stick_ **droop** low down to the _floor_. (rgravina - fixed up order).
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 21-12-2008(41): Imagine looking through the sight of a hitman's _crosshair_. The bullet hits, a _drop of_ blood appears on the target's shirt. The target drops his _walking stick_ and starts to **droop** … finally hitting the _floor_. (I take ' _silage_ ' to mean ' _crosshair_ ').
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-9-2007(39): Image: a poor shriveled old lady struggling with a "droop"ing load of _silage_ on her shoulders. A _bit_ falls to the _ground_ and she _droop_ s a little further to pick it up.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-10-2005(16): Hint : as a primitive, I used the image of _Droopy_ Dog, the cartoon character created by Tex Avery.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 14-10-2006(113): When some people are sleeping, their _mouths_ _droop_ open, and **saliva** drips out.
column6: 2) [[faneca](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/faneca)] 20-7-2012(6): Easy to remember if you have read the manga -or watched the anime- 謎の彼女 X「なぞのかのじょX」("Mysterious Girlfriend X"): a boy who falls in love with a classmate when he sees her dripping **drool** during a nap (BTW astridtops' story fits in perfectly). **Note** : The boy's name, [椿「つばき」](midori://search?text=椿「つばき」) [camellia](../v4/1569.html) (#1569 椿), is a wordplay: it's one of the ways you can pronounce this kanji ( 唾き ).
column7: 3) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 15-5-2007(4): _Droopy_ the dog with **saliva** drooling from his _mouth_.
column8: 4) [[sulris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sulris)] 18-4-2011(3): When you mouth is drooping **saliva** drools out.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 21-6-2010(3): Obviously, the _mouth_ is where **saliva** _droops_ out.

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(290): Our _eyes_ _droop_ when we are **drowsy**.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-7-2007(37): Hint : the _eyes_ of _Droopy Dog_ (see [droop](../v4/1582.html) (#1582 垂)). When you are **drowsy** you have " _droopy eyes_ ". That is, you have _Droopy's eyes_!
column7: 3) [[fiddle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiddle)] 27-12-2006(15): When you are **DROWSY** your EYE-lids DROOP, but imagine your whole EYES drooping out of their sockets - Urgh!
column8: 4) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 9-11-2009(9): Zzzz. (Really, do you need anything more for this, especially after you've made it this far into the book? :) ).
column9: 5) [[rgon1737](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgon1737)] 1-7-2010(3): Cuando estamos somnolientos, la única manera de mantenernos despiertos es haciendo que el párpado penda de algún sitio, con un hilo o algo por el estilo.

column5: 1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 17-7-2006(280): Wasn't it a cursed **spindle** that Sleeping Beauty pricked her finger on? Therefore the **spindle** was the _metal_ that caused her to _droop_ and eventually sleep for 100 years.
column6: 2) [[Avispa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Avispa)] 10-10-2007(61): **Spindle** : the needle that drops on an LP record player. This is made of metal. It droops. Viola.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-9-2007(51): Think of a **plumb bob** rather than **spindle** (which are the same shape, and this kanji means both). It's a perfectly literal kanji: _droop_ ing _metal_.
column8: 4) [[elmaestrokgb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elmaestrokgb)] 20-7-2009(16): Once people could buy whole **spindle** s of CD-Roms for a few bucks, the number of _gold_ records really started to _droop_.
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 8-2-2007(6): I love this one! It's a classic cartoon episode! The theiving wolf takes the _golden_ **spindle**. Then _Droopy Dog_ takes the **spindle** away from him, thwaks him on the head with it and rolls him up on it.

column3: The simplest way to remember this character is to find the sprig of _wheat_ in it, hidden because it doubles up with one stroke of _silage_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-9-2007(260): It's a _hay_ **ride**! You sit on piles of _silage_ and everyone likes to imitate old-time farmers with a piece of _wheat_ sticking out of their mouths.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 4-4-2007(50): [ride, power, multiplication, record, counter for vehicles, board, mount, join] In the near future, we hope to **ride** on biomass fueled vehicles. Good news for those who have _wheat_ _silage_ surplus.
column7: 3) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 30-9-2009(31): The hardest part about being a farmer is when it comes to the slaughter. "Come on boys, we're going for a **ride**!" "Oh boy, a **ride**!" say the little _wheat_ sprigs, hopping onto the tractor. The farmer then takes them off to become _silage_ , tears in his eyes.
column8: 4) [[zz_alex_zz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zz_alex_zz)] 26-3-2008(17): On a farm first you **ride** the tractor, cut down the _wheat_ , and finally mix the wheat with _silage_ to make haylage. <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haylage>.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 21-12-2008(9): The closest the kids on the farm ever got to a fairground **ride** was pointing the _crosshair_ of their air-rifles at the _wheat_ to see who could take the head off first. (I take ' _silage_ ' to mean ' _crosshair_ ')… ( _continued in next kanji_ ).

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 17-5-2008(118): If you go for a _ride_ and find a _saber_ beside you, perhaps you got into an Army **surplus** jeep.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 7-7-2007(88): Recall the wheat sabers we made a [profit](../v4/906.html) (#906 利) off. We made too many and now there's **surplus** , for sale on this hay _ride_.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(75): We got a **surplus** of people on the _hayride_. _Chop_ 'em off.
column8: 4) [[Asriel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asriel)] 9-7-2009(31): If there is a **surplus** of people on the _ride,_ they may just need to get rid of a few passengers using a _saber_.
column9: 5) [[Tzadeck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tzadeck)] 13-8-2009(25): Hey, wanna take a _ride_ with me to the Army **surplus** store to buy a _saber_?

column3: The final stroke of this kanji is a rare shape, which we have not met before and will only meet in this character and others that include it as a primitive. We are more accustomed to seeing it straightened out as part of other shapes - for instance, as the second stroke of _mouth_. If you need any help at all with this character, you may picture it as two hands of a clock pointing to what time it is **now**. The element above it, _meeting_ , should easily relate to that image.
column4: * We shall use _clock_ as the primitive meaning of this character, in line with the above explanation.
column5: 1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 7-8-2007(230): My MEETING is at 7- but that's **NOW**!
column6: 2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 7-9-2007(32): (re: ruuku35) The _meeting_ is not at _quarter to seven_ but **now**!
column7: 3) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 24-1-2010(12): _Doc Brown_ (primitive) from Back to the Future checks his watch. The meeting with Marty McFly and Biff is **now**. "Great Scott." He's late, so he cuts a corner sharply in the DeLorean. It's such a sharp turn that it's found in no other kanji. Only Doc can pull it off.
column8: 4) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 5-8-2007(10): Looks like a ラ with a hat. Like a cowboy saying "Raaat **now** , pardner.".
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 28-12-2010(3): The _meeting_ is **now** , _6:45_ , according to the _hands of clock_.

column5: 1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 16-3-2006(226): This clock **include** s a mouth that will tell you what the time is now. Hearing impaired people have this kind of watches… now imagine them as a big mouth under the clock.
column6: 2) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 27-6-2006(89): Batteries **include** d with this _clock_. Open the _mouth_ at the back and insert them after purchase.
column7: 3) [[woodwojr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woodwojr)] 24-2-2010(78): #include < _time_.h  >, < _stdio_.h  >//or _clock_.h , _mouth_.h.
column8: 4) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 11-4-2007(39): (Based on erikkusan's story) For today's urban professionals – who are so busy that they don't even have time to look at their watch – this _clock_ **include** s a _mouth_ that will announce the time. Picture the clock, it's in the shape of a face, so the mouth is at the bottom. That should keep it distinct from [versify](../v4/1589.html) (#1589 吟).
column9: 5) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 3-1-2009(19): If you want to be **include** d in the gang, NOW is the time to open your MOUTH and say so.

column5: 1) [[FooSoft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FooSoft)] 1-1-2010(46): "Gimme all your _money_ _now_!" said the **covet** ous criminal.
column6: 2) [[Gaignun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Gaignun)] 24-4-2011(32): One begins one's life **coveting** _money_. One ends one's life **coveting** time – those precious seconds ticking away on the _clock_. Remember to always put time over money (in this kanji and in life).
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 23-3-2010(13): **Covet**. One can **covet** _money_. Money can buy a lot but it cannot buy time. Presiding above all, watch the _clock_ ticking… a countdown to one's grave!
column8: 4) [[Louismi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Louismi)] 2-7-2011(5): Here it shows the two most **covet** ed things. Time and money. You know time is money. Besides people go to work, deceive, kill etc to get money and time goes on top because it's **covet** ed the most. One would buy time when near death but you can. Many have been looking for the elixir of life but they failed. And they go together because many would despise a life without any money.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 14-9-2012(3): **Covet** _time_ over _money_ , for _money_ cannot buy _time_ , as the _clock_ keeps ticking.

column3: As we have already learned characters for _poem_ (Frame 370), _chant_ (Frame 21), and _song_ (Frame 508), it is important to protect this key word with an image all its own. Its elements are the same as those above, only the position has changed: _mouth_ . . . _clock_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-3-2007(353): A rapper is trying to **versify** , but sucks: Hickery dickery dock, the _mouth_ spat out the _clock_. I'm gonna shoot you with my glock, if you don't suck my cock! **Versify**!
column6: 2) [[lunairejam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lunairejam)] 7-10-2007(114): To **versify** , words of rhythm needs to shoot out of your MOUTH with a CLOCK-like regularity.
column7: 3) [[arun90](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/arun90)] 8-4-2008(45): Just imagine a rapper using his _mouth_ to **versify** with a big _clock_ around his neck.
column8: 4) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 9-8-2007(18): On the left-wing, people _mouth_ about de **versifying** , but on the right, they want to turn back the _clock_.
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 29-9-2009(16): **Versify** this kanji as follows: Hickery dickery dock, the _mouth_ ran by the _clock_.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 8-4-2007(214): Someone **wish** ing from the bottom of their heart that the clock would stop. A mid- life crisis perhaps.
column6: 2) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 28-6-2007(87): Remember in the Wizard of Oz when the tin man **wished** for a _heart_ and the wizard gave him that dinky little _clock_ instead?
column7: 3) [[BlackMarsh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BlackMarsh)] 16-2-2006(61): A **wish** is something that your heart desires right now.
column8: 4) [[QuackingShoe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/QuackingShoe)] 6-7-2008(46): I **wish** with all my _heart_ that I knew all the kanji _now_. This studying sucks!
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 12-1-2010(17): I **wish** the _clock_ would give me more time to do the things that my _heart_ desires the most.

column3: This kanji does not refer to the tool but to the act of twisting. Its elements: _fingers_ . . . _wish._
column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 6-10-2008(84): Ever try **WRENCHING** a bolt with just your FINGERS? Trust me, you'll WISH you had a wrench for **WRENCHING** to save your FINGERS.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 26-10-2006(21): "I _wish_ you would accept our friendly offer", the mob guy said, as he started **wrenching** my _fingers_ one by one.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-6-2007(20): I have an unfortunate habit of **wrenching** off other people’s _fingers_ when I pull a _wish_ bone with them.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 17-1-2009(12): The keyword refers to twirling or spinning something. Use your fingers the spin the hands on the clock wishing it would turn 5 and you can go home.
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 14-5-2009(3): After your _finger_ got **wrenched** in the lathe, you only have one _wish_ : a new finger.

column5: 1) [[nyquil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nyquil)] 10-3-2007(319): Two _kings_ were fighting over a beautiful koto (harp). So they had a _clock_ built into it that would measure how long each one played it. That way they could be sure none played it more than othe other.
column6: 2) [[mistamark](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mistamark)] 14-12-2008(38): The _two kings_ want to hear a **harp** right _now_!!
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(13): A pair 0f _kings_ exchange gifts: a _clock_ and a **harp(koto)**.
column8: 4) [[MRT88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MRT88)] 14-12-2009(10): Two _kings_ were fighting over a beautiful koto (harp). So they had a _clock_ built into it that would measure how long each one played it. That way they could be sure none played it more than othe other. _(It helps me to remember that the kings are sitting atop the giant floor clock staring down in anticipation. for placement)_.
column9: 5) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 8-3-2007(7): This is actually the kanji for **koto**. I pictute two mallets with _jeweled_ heads beating on a **koto** in time to a metronome ( _clock_ ).

column3: Just as the _sunshine_ (Frame 1397) represents the masculine principle in nature (Yang), the **shade** stands for the feminine principle (Yin). Its elements are: _pinnacle_ . . . _clock_ . . . _rising cloud_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-3-2007(238): The only **shade** at _The Pinnacle_ is in the shadow of the giant _clock_ tower, or from a _rising cloud_.
column6: 2) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 26-2-2008(40): Frosty the snowman is running around the pinnacle, staying in the **shade**. As he looks at his clock to see how much longer he can last, small clouds rise (steam) from his body. Nooo, Frosty!
column7: 3) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 31-7-2008(33): The _pinnacle_ is in the **shade** , because it has _now_ become _cloudy_.
column8: 4) [[findus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/findus)] 4-6-2009(24): To avoid the confusion with [shadow](../v4/1712.html) (#1712 影), let's use a rhyme : At _The Pinnacle_ , the only **shade** / is that of thinks that are man-made (The giant _clock_ tower, and the _rising cloud_ from a factory).
column9: 5) [[sulris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sulris)] 10-3-2011(18): You are now 75% of the way through the 2136 joyo kanji!

column3: Think of this character as identical to the _halberd_ (Frame 1311) except that the final stroke has been omitted. Return to that character and devise some image to take this difference into account.
column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 28-9-2006(302): **Beforehand** , this was a _halberd_ but I cut it short so it could **be for hand** to hand combat.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 12-9-2006(126): Your _halberd_ doesn't have a handguard? You should have thought of that **beforehand** (i.e., before you were missing your hand).
column7: 3) [[zwarte_kat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zwarte_kat)] 15-2-2009(25): This is the halberd **beforehand** , i mean: before you draw the hand (the last stroke of halberd).
column8: 4) [[nesert](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nesert)] 3-7-2010(9): Be sure to check your _halberd_ **beforehand** to make sure it's not missing its final stroke.
column9: 5) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 10-12-2007(6): As others see it, think of **BEFOREHAND** with Forehand, which easily reminds you of a tennis racket for use as a primitive in later kanji. It even looks like a tennis racket, so all the better.

column5: 1) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 13-3-2007(308): The **preface** to all human history was written _beforehand_ in _caves_.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 29-1-2008(45): Rename the "beforehand" part to be _glove_ (because you have to wear _gloves_ beforehand if you want to wield the halberd, which is why this primitive is an incomplete halberd). The story: a winter morning. A textbook author is holed up in his tiny office, a veritable _cave_. He wants to start his masterpiece textbook by first writing the **preface**. But he can't get started. He sits and stares at empty paper until evening. It gets cold and he puts on _glove_ s, shivering, but still unable to start his **preface**.
column7: 3) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 10-6-2009(41): In the **preface** to his latest edition of RTK, Heisig tells us that until he invented his brilliant kanji-learning method, he was living in a _cave beforehand_. Luckily, the publishing of the book gave him enough money to move out of the _cave_ into an apartment. He could also finally afford to put a handle on his _halberd_.
column8: 4) [[lankydan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lankydan)] 30-11-2007(9): Read **preface** on the _cave beforehand_ or you'll be sorry…
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 24-1-2010(7): I suck at _tennis_ so I picked up a book by Roger Federer. The **preface** tells how he was so awesome that he managed to defeat a _cave wall_ in a one-on-one _tennis_ match. The cave wall eventually gave up and collapsed. The rest of the book was about boring _tennis_ strategies.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 21-2-2007(173): **Deposit** ing money into your savings account is something you do _beforehand_ if you use your _head_. If you're in Japan your passbook says 預金機 （よきんき）when you make a **deposit**.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(118): You bang your _head_ on the ATM, wishing you'd **deposit** ed some money _beforehand_.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 29-1-2008(43): 預血 means to **deposit** blood in a blood bank. Imagine bringing a severed _head_ to the blood bank for a blood **deposit**. Of course, you are wearing _gloves_ when handling the bloody _head_.
column8: 4) [[Hinode](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hinode)] 17-5-2009(24): (RPG) All of you who enjoy playing RPGs every now and then should be familiar with this. When you accept a risky quest like hunting for the _head_ of some evil monster. You should **deposit** your money ( _shells_ ) _beforehand_ , so that when you die you don't lose all of your wealth.
column9: 5) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 6-3-2008(17): In Japan, instead of sending your statements in the mail, you are given a small book that you can insert into the ATMs and all activity will be printed inside. One of the few good things that Japanese banks do. When **deposit** ing money at an ATM, you must open your book to the right _page_ and insert _beforehand_ to have a record of the **deposit** written in.

column3: This character refers to rustic life and rustic fields primarily, and from there gets derived meanings. Its elements: _computer_. . _beforehand_.
column5: 1) [[BlackMarsh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BlackMarsh)] 20-1-2006(240): These days we all work in front of computers. Beforehand we all worked out in the fields, in the **plains**.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 25-2-2007(70): The **plains** are a challenging place to get any work done. Be sure you recharge your _computer's_ battery _beforehand_ , or you won't get anything done.
column7: 3) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 28-4-2009(37): In _windows XP_ , if you don't change the background _beforehand_ , it's that STUPID pitcure of **plains**. You ALL know what I'm talking about. <http://photos.codlib.com/wp- content/uploads/2007/07/bliss_xp.jpg> Now that I look at it on Vista, I actually realized how pretty this place really is.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 29-1-2008(18): Think of **plains** in contrast to hills, mountains, and skyscrapers. A saboteur breaks into the military _computer_ complex. Wearing _gloves_ to avoid leaving fingerprints, he types a few codes into the _computer_ that unleash the nuclear weapons on the target city. The target city, formerly a varied landscape of hills, mountains, and skyscrapers, is instantly flattened into level and barren landscape: **plains**.
column9: 5) [[aerdeyn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aerdeyn)] 17-11-2011(14): If I'd checked Google maps on the _computer_ _beforehand_ I wouldn't be lost out on the **plains**.

column3: At the top we have _the animal horns_ and the single horizontal stroke to give them something to hang onto. Below that, we see one _rake_ with two handles. Finally, we see a pair of strokes splitting away from each of the handles, indicating that they are both splitting under the pressure. The composite picture is of someone holding down two jobs **concurrently** , using the same kit of tools to move in two different directions and ending up in a mess. Take the time to find this sense in the kanji and it will be easy to remember, despite initial appearances.
column5: 1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 29-1-2008(254): Our ninja hero, disguised as a gardener with a _rake_ , is suddenly attacked from both left and right **concurrently** by bulls with _animal horns_. Our hero lets out a blood-curdling scream and tears his rake handle vertically in half, so he now has two wooden staffs ( _split rake handle_ ) to fight with. He grips each staff (left side and right side) and rams it into the horns of the charging bulls. The force of each charging bull causes the tips of each staff to split again ( _split bottom of each rake handle_ ).
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 12-1-2008(68): You decide to take the bull by the _horns_ and do both chores **concurrently** , grabbing your _double-handled rake_ before attempting to clean up both your's and your neighbours' garden. But unfortunately, it's not long until your _rake_ _splits in two_.
column7: 3) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 30-6-2007(26): Special _rake_ , used to hold a bull by both _horns_ **concurrently**. Two handles have V-like ends to set your arms against.
column8: 4) [[zanzibar](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zanzibar)] 31-5-2009(17): I'm going to use CASANOVA as the signal image here. A HORNY RAKE of a man who wants to date many women and/or men **concurrently**. The final four strokes, if you look carefully, turn the HORNY RAKE into a head on a body with arms open wide to embrace you. Run away!
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 24-1-2010(15): **Concurrently** Primitive: Sarah Palin. She's **concurrently** Governor of Alaska and the vice presidential nominee. Quite a job. Some days she's shooting moose and mounting the _horns_ on her wall. Other days she's being a maverick and _raking_ up corruption in her own party. There's so much corruption she needs _two_ rakes. She likes to do this all while wearing a _red skirt_. You can see the skirt flailing out on either side.
