column5: 1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 11-4-2007(293): Naturally, if you're dating more than one _woman_ _concurrently_ , they will certainly **dislike** each other!

column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 4-3-2009(5): _Women_ **dislike** men who date other _women_ _concurrently_.

Made of sturdy _metal_ , it could function _concurrently_ as an apparently harmless farming tool, as well as a lethal weapon in combat, as well as a grappling hook. (True story).
column8: 4) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-12-2008(17): Have you wondered why so many people can die at a particular instant when there's only one Grim Reaper? Wonder no more! He uses a magical _metal_ **sickle** that can kill mutiple people _concurrently_.

column5: 1) [[fiddle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiddle)] 28-12-2006(239): When you are **self-effacing** you use words to concurrently bring yourself down and make yourself look better.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-7-2009(94): Try to compliment a Japanese person and they'll interrupt you by saying **self- effacing** _words concurrently_.
column7: 3) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 14-4-2007(61): Though the man's _words_ were **self-effacing** , his actions _concurrently_ made it clear that his modesty was false.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-10-2005(18): This **self-effacing** guy always _speaks concurrently_ with someone else. That is, he waits for someone to speak, then speaks at the same time. When the other person stops speaking he stops as well, thinking nobody noticed he was speaking, but having said aloud whatever he had to say anyway.
column9: 5) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 27-10-2008(12): Say + Concurrently: **Self-effacing** people _say_ little about their accomplishments even while they are _concurrently_ working on multiple tasks.

column8: 4) [[zanzibar](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zanzibar)] 1-7-2009(15): CASANOVA wanted to take you to a love hotel, but he loves a **bargain** , you ended up with CASANOVA in a CAVE.
column9: 5) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 7-6-2008(12): <Http://youtube.com/watch?v=hfvWz6IzoXw> This clip says it all. The Filene's basement bi-annual wedding dress sale. This year's sale has moved to a _cave_. Hundreds of insane brides rushing in _concurrently_ just for a **bargain**.

column3: To our way of counting directions, the **west** always comes fourth. So it is convenient to find the character for _four_ in this kanji. But since we want only _one_ of the _four_ directions, the **west** adds the _one_ at the top and sucks the _human legs_ a bit out of their _mouth_ in the process.
column4: * As a primitive, the meaning of _west_ can be expanded to refer to the _Old West_ of cowboy-movie fame, just as the meaning of the character for _east_ was expanded into _the East_. Note, however, that in its primitive form the _legs_ are straightened out and reach down to the bottom of the _mouth_. Hence, we get the shape ⻃. With the exception of one kanji, given in the following frame, this element always appears at the top of its relative primitives.
column5: 1) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 9-2-2007(224): The old **west** represented by a completely empty whiskey bottle (compare [sign of the bird](../v4/1427.html) (#1427 酉) whiskey bottle about one third full).
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 3-3-2008(49): Note: this kanji is also used to denote Spain.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 22-12-2008(25): The Spaghetti **Western** movies, typified by _empty bottles of whisky_ , were so- called because it was often an Italian director that shot them. Most of these films however, were actually shot in **Spain** (another meaning this kanji holds).
column8: 4) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 11-2-2009(21): Only _one_ out of every _four_ **west** erns is worth watching. Even that's debatable. The rest are crap.

column3: West . . . St. Bernard dog . . . snake . . . road.
column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 15-5-2007(223): Since the days of the _Old West_ , traveling has **transition** ed from trying not to step on _big snakes_ to driving on _big roads_.
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 5-2-2008(111): The _west_ has gone through quite a **transition** , gone are the days when _dogs_ and _snakes_ roamed the desert, it's all _roads_ and casinos now.

As I made the **transition** between life and death, I scratched this kanji into the sand.

column8: 4) [[BooBooQ88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BooBooQ88)] 11-10-2009(20): On its journey WEST-ward, the cruise ship **CAPSIZE** D and was damaged so bad that they couldn't RESTORE it.

column3: _Belt_ . . . _happiness_. Note how the _belt_ runs through the middle of _happiness_.

column7: 3) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 18-3-2008(27): **Camphor tree** \+ _south_ = _Southern_ Comfort (the liquor) _tree_ (works for me).
column8: 4) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 25-8-2009(15): **Fact:** The **camphor** is known for its effects on the man's sex drive and consequently it is used sometimes in the food served to soldiers. **Story:** you can think of the **camphor tree** as a _tree_ that prevents _happiness_ under the _belt_.
column9: 5) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 4-10-2007(13): There is a _tree_ in the _south_ that legand has if you CAMP under it, you will be visited by a WHORE.

column6: 2) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 30-8-2007(109): If you go to someones place and the food sucks, you lower it down _south_ of the table as an **offering** to their _dog_.

column9: 5) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 26-9-2007(19): "Te ofrezco Taco Bell." Don't forget an **offering** of some Taco Bell, or you'll be in serious trouble.

column3: The pictograph of two swinging **gates** is so clear in this kanji that only its stroke order needs to be memorized. In case you should have any trouble, though, you might doodle with the shapes on a piece of paper, taking care to note the difference in the stroke order of the two facing doors. The **gates** usually serve as an enclosure, and are written BEFORE whatever it is they enclose.
column4: * As a primitive, we shall continue to give it the meaning of _gates_ , but recommend the image of swinging doors (like the kind once common at entrances to saloons) to distinguish it from the primitive for _door_.
column5: 1) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 16-1-2008(175): Heisig's stroke order in the 4th edition (and earlier) is wrong, so be careful – first is the left-most vertical stroke, then draw the rest of the "sun" attachment as you would normally. In fact, if you just wrote it out as two suns with elongated sides, you'll get the stroke order exactly correct.
column6: 2) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 4-9-2006(56): The **gates** to Hell. guarded by Cerebus or … Bill **Gates**?
column7: 3) [[KristinHolly](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/KristinHolly)] 25-11-2008(23): Bill **Gates** is just about to walk into a saloon.
column8: 4) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 11-5-2008(18): The **GATES** of Hell make a great primitive for the following frames.
column9: 5) [[Dustin_Calgary](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dustin_Calgary)] 14-1-2009(9): Primitives, Either **gates** to hell, or the pearly **gates** :D.

column5: 1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 20-9-2006(184): A mouth on the Gates of Hell says "Answer me these **question** s three, or thru the gates ye soon will be".
column6: 2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 12-10-2006(34): You begin to **question** all of the _holes_ Gates leaves in his software.
column7: 3) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 1-4-2007(29): The mouth is the gate from which **question** s are asked.
column8: 4) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 4-8-2008(17): To get access to Bill Gates' supermansion you have to answer several **question** s asked by a weird detached mouth at the entrance. Get a **question** wrong and the mouth will eat you.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 23-12-2008(12): As you walk through the _saloon doors_ , everyone shuts up and stares at you, _mouths_ open… the barman asks the **question** on everyone's mind - "Who the fuck are you son?".

column3: _Gates_ . . . _devil_. Keep the connotation of this key word distinct from those of _inspection_ (Frame 1174), _revise_ (Frame 362), and _perusal_ (Frame 919).
column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 16-1-2008(261): A little _devil_ at the _gates of hell_ **review** s your record to see if you're evil enough to get in.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 22-5-2007(37): As I was **reviewing** for my exam at a quiet saloon, the _devil_ popped out of nowhere and offered to make sure I pass. But I told him no way, since that's cheating. Besides, I'm just **reviewing** things I already know. I won't fail. But he kept insisting, so I kicked him and sent him crashing through the entrance _gates_.
column7: 3) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 20-8-2006(30): _Gates'_ IS the _devil_. He releases software that clearly hasn't gone through any kind of _review_ process.
column8: 4) [[furrykef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/furrykef)] 29-6-2008(22): At the _gates_ of Hell, the _Devil_ greets you with his punishment: to **review** kanji flash cards for the rest of your life! (Not that I think anything is wrong with Heisig, but it does get tiring and I certainly wouldn't want to do it all my life. ,)).
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 2-2-2009(13): At the Gates of Hell: "What did I do to get here?" you ask in disbelief. "Well, let's **review** …" says Satan.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 21-4-2007(154): You set a guard at the gate to fell intruders not of your **clique**.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-9-2007(62): The _felled_ souls of the world, cut down like trees, pass through the _gates of hell_ and join the **clique**.
column7: 3) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 30-8-2007(36): A **clique** is a small exclusive group of people usually gathering around a leader or for a common purpose. Here we see _Mr. T_ 's fan club meeting for a _fiesta_ at a very select club called the 'Perly _Gates_ '.
column8: 4) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 20-8-2006(34): _Bill Gates_ has been known to _fell_ any rival software company that threatens his little **clique** at the top.
column9: 5) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 22-7-2008(22): You only get through the _gates_ into _that person's_ _fiesta_ if you are in the same **clique**.

column3: _Gates_ . . . _sun/day_. This **interval** applies to time and space alike, but the latter is better for creating an image.
column5: 1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 28-6-2007(203): The **interval** between star systems ( _suns_ ) was too large, so the star _gates_ were created to travel between them.
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 16-2-2009(95): We open the _gates_ at regular **intervals** to let a bit of _sun_ in.
column7: 3) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 4-9-2006(51): At regular **interval** s the gates of Hell burn like the sun keeping all within nice and toasty. **Interval** paining.
column8: 4) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 20-8-2006(22): At almost regular **interval** s of a year or so, _Bill Gates_ tries again to take on their rival _Sun_ in the server market, and thankfully UNIX and Linux always prevail.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(13): _Lesbians_ do their thing on one _day_ **interval** s because their _gates_ get so sore.

column7: 3) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 9-7-2010(22): I like to think of a horror movie where the protagonists enter a graveyard when suddenly their flashlights go out and it becomes **pitch dark** , whereupon they hear the _sound_ of the _gate_ creaking shut behind them.

column9: 5) [[Louismi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Louismi)] 19-6-2011(4): I opened the gates and it was **pitch dark**. Only a eerie sound could be heard.

column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 7-7-2007(230): The **simplicity** of _bamboo_ plant is in all its joints being at equal _intervals_.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 28-5-2007(97): [simplicity, brevity] The ししおどし is a _bamboo_ device for scaring birds from the gates of your garden by clacking against a stone at regular _interval_ s. Its design is **simplicity** itself. (Inspired by PepeSeco).
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 25-2-2008(38): Wordplay: **simplicity** - > simcity. You are playing a game of SimCity, a city simulator. You can choose from one of several pre-defined city layouts. One of the city layouts is called " **SimpliCity** (a simple city for SimCity)". This layout has nothing but an empty field with _bamboo_ trees planted at regular _intervals_.
column8: 4) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 9-7-2006(37): In an existence of utmost **simplicity** you spend time listening to the liquid- filled _bamboo_ tube (ししおどし) clacking at regular _interval_ s.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 24-3-2009(22): I imagine one of those little **bamboo** fountains where the bamboo fills with water, tips over and lets out the water, and then tips back to get filled again. In this way, it marks out even **intervals**. THAT is **simplicity**.

column6: 2) [[Proxx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Proxx)] 27-11-2007(65): Remember the two **tower** s from lord of the rings… _each_ has it's own - very difficult to master - entrance _gate_.

The CABINET decides that EACH GATE of a saloon has to have a sign saying that you have to be an adult to be allowed to drink there.

column3: _Gates_ . . . _ear_. Compare the story you invented for the kanji meaning _listen_ (Frame 890).

column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(15): The genius tells me to put my _ear_ up to the _gates_ in order to **hear** the _lesbians_ better (see [closed](../v4/1623.html) (#1623 閉).
column9: 5) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 5-2-2009(9): Your ears are the gates that allow you to **hear**. NOTE: You [hear](../v4/1626.html) (#1626 聞) with your _ear_ alone, but to [listen](../v4/827.html) (#827 聴) you need to engage your _heart_ as well.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 28-5-2007(309): Forgetting about the moat, the king stepped out of his gate and landed in the water. Needless to say he got **wet**.

See the king now, between the gates, all **wet** , dripping _drops of water_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(26): If I was _king_ , I would be **wet** with the _water_ of _lesbians_ rubbing all over me.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-3-2007(21): Some prankster threw _water_ on the _king_ as he came to the city gates. Now he's all **wet**.

Imagine _King_ Arthur standing in front of the _gate_ shortly before the end of the movie. When he demands to be let in by the French, they throw dung on him and Belvedere and they get **wet**. (Think of the dung as _water_ in this case, it's liquid anyway) <http://youtube.com/watch?v=9V7zbWNznbs> The scene I thought of is at the end of the vid.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-9-2007(147): A **column** of text scratched on a black tree beside the _gates of Hell_ : To the _East_ lies The Beast.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 28-5-2007(135): [column, handrail, blank, space] I think about _oriental_ ( _eastern_ ) Torii _gates_ : they have two supporting **column** s made of _wood_.
column7: 3) [[snallygaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snallygaster)] 14-4-2008(107): Ancient morning newspaper **column** , posted daily on a **tree** at the **east gate**. Why the **east gate**? Well, it's a morning paper, and the sun rises in the east, so the morning rays shining through the gate illuminate it nicely. I picture all the ojisan who rise in the wee hours gathering around the tree each, waiting for the sun rise so they can read the paper. "Been coming here every day for 40 years! Can't start the day without my paper!".
column8: 4) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 20-8-2006(25): _Bill Gates_ already dominates the software industry in the West, and now he is turning his attention to the _East_. Trying to gain popularity and a glentler image there he writes a _column_ in newspapers there about how he plans to save the _trees_ using the latest and greatest features of Windows Vista.
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 10-3-2008(20): This is a **column of text** , as used in a newspaper. The trick for this kanji is that to mark the **columns** in the old printers, you place _wooden_ blocks at certain intervals of the paper. Now, look at the right part, it looks as if you had put a _wooden_ block in an _interval_ primitive. That graphical reminder will help you to remember this kanji!!

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 4-6-2007(221): During the saloon brawl, one guy got _glued to a table_ and was tossed out _through the saloon gates_. But he really wanted to **fight** , so he ran back through those gates (with the table still glued to his back) only to be tossed out again. Imagine him repeatedly running in and being tossed back out.
column6: 2) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 12-11-2007(59): Food **fight**! Look, beans are stuck to the gates like glue.
column7: 3) [[snzzbk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snzzbk)] 16-2-2009(35): _Bill Gates_ and _Mr. Bean_ having a _glue_ **fight**.
column8: 4) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 29-7-2009(17): He's **fight** ing to get through the _gates_ , but _Mr. Bean_ doesn't know they are just for show  & have been _glued_ together.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 11-10-2010(15): In any classic bar **fight** scene, someone crawls under a _table_ , someone sits _glue_ d to the piano, and someone gets thrown clear throught the saloon doors ( _gates_ ). 戦闘 せんとう battle, **fight** , combat, 闘うたたかう to **fight** , to battle, to combat, to struggle against, to wage war, to engage in contest.

column3: The single _gate_ is used here not in order to represent one _gate_ , but many of them, indeed a _meeting of gates_. Add _mouth_ (as an entrance here) and you end up with **godown**. That should help keep this character distinct from _warehouse_ (Frame 633).
column5: 1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 5-10-2007(256): (Warning-this one is crude) Imagine a **godown** (dockside warehouse) where you can _meet_ girls who will _godown_ on you with their _mouth_. To keep the place a bit of a secert, they only have one _gate_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-10-2005(56): Hint : the "godown" is like a warehouse, it's on the docks and mostly in Asia. To make an image distinct from that of "warehouse" or "storehouse", etc, I picture the goods stored there, piled up on pallets really high, and thus they have to "godown" before they can be taken outside. The front of this **godown** is a " _meeting of small gates_ ", i.e. a row of gates through which goods come in and out. The _mouth_ can be an opening somewhere in the back, or the top, where cranes lift down the goods.
column7: 3) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 27-3-2008(48): **Note:** this is not _gate_ but actually a variation of _door_ and is written as such, with the vertical stroke last not first.
column8: 4) [[matsuyamakiwi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matsuyamakiwi)] 29-6-2008(30): Imagine a mafia **godown** at the docks where shifty mafia types _meet_ and lots of dodgy deals **godown**. This is a very secret place, so there is only one _gate_ , and to enter you have to say the password with your _mouth_.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-9-2007(22): A **godown** is an old style warehouse where goods were temporarily stacked stacked to the _roof_ (meeting). A series of _gates_ with _mouths_ (doors) were used access them for shipment. (Primitive _EAST INDIA TRADING_ ) <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image>:WarehousesinAmsterdam.JPG.

column5: 1) [[nmkohi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nmkohi)] 23-7-2006(233): Back in the day the people were so excited to get hold of the Sega **genesis** they looted the godown with sabers.
column6: 2) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 17-12-2008(84): I prefer to have girls _Godown_ on my _sabre_ to prevent unwanted **GENESIS** of babies………… 創造 そうぞう (creation).
column7: 3) [[atylmo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atylmo)] 5-2-2009(51): The **genesis** of my hatred of kanji learning is when you get so mad that you have to look up what a _godown_ is, and you end up cutting the book (or even Heisig himself) up with a _saber_.
column8: 4) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 24-3-2007(29): In the story of **Genesis** Adam and Even were kicked out of the Garden of Eden. They had to "go down" out of the garden and the entrace was guarded with sabers to prevent their return.
column9: 5) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 5-6-2007(22): God actually has everything ever conceived in a big _godown_ : if you want to exist, you have to grab a _sabre_ and fight your way out. Such is **genesis**.

column3: This key word, a negating prefix, is a doodle of a heavy iron pole with bars extending in both directions, to create the picture of a jail cell. From there to " **un-** " is but a short step.
column4: * As a primitive, we shall draw on the explanation above for the meaning of _jail cell_.
column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 8-10-2006(142): This looks like a pictogram of 3 fingers from each hand trying to open up a crack in a wall. That's an **un-** believable way to escape from prison OR the **UN-** have a prison in the Hague.
column6: 2) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 1-5-2006(109): People in the jail cell are **un-** friendly, **un-** comely, and **un-** cooperative.
column7: 3) [[firebound12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/firebound12)] 12-1-2009(48): Ever wanted to have an **un** do button in life? Well, when you're in a _jail cell_ , that's when you most want to press that button.
column8: 4) [[Emiko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Emiko)] 18-8-2011(23): **Un-** zipped.
column9: 5) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 10-6-2008(13): This is a pictograph of goatse. Rather **un-** appealing image, huh?

column3: This character is used for the **haiku** , the 17-syllable poem that is one of Japan's best-known literary forms. Its elements: _person_ .. . _jail cell_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-9-2007(275): I pity the fool/ Who put me in this jail cell/ I pity the fool. (Credit taijuando).
column6: 2) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 21-5-2006(119): I pity the fool/ Who put me in this jail/ I pity the fool.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 8-4-2007(56): _Person_ is put in _jail_ for writing a **haiku** with the wrong number of syllables.
column8: 4) [[lunairejam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lunairejam)] 8-10-2007(20): While in jail, some people find Islam, but Mr T finds **haiku**.
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 20-9-2007(20): A person stuck in jail has nothing better to do than to compose **haiku**.

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 21-8-2006(251): When ordered to go to the _jail cell_ , the defendant gave the judge the _finger_ and said he **repudiate** d all that the legal system stood for if they were going to send an innocent man like him to jail.
column6: 2) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 13-7-2008(56): He reached his fingers through the bars of his jail cell, trying to touch his beloved. But she **repudiate** d him and left.
column7: 3) [[FutureBlues](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FutureBlues)] 1-9-2008(31): Once he had his _fingers_ around the _jail cell bars_ he **repudiated** all ties with his former gang!
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 16-2-2008(17): 排他 【はいた】 (n) exclusion, (P) 排日 【はいにち】 (n) anti-Japanese, (P) 排出 【はいしゅつ】 (n,vs) evacuation, emission (e.g. of CO2, etc.), ejection, (P) 排除 【はいじょ】 (n,vs) exclusion, removal, rejection, (P) STORY: Giving everyone the FINGER in a JAIL CELL is a good way to be EXCLUDED by everyone from the next prison break.
column9: 5) [[TomTomHatesCats](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TomTomHatesCats)] 9-9-2011(8): Sarah Palin finally gets thrown behind bars in a JAIL CELL for being a complete disgrace to the country. Indignant, she points a FINGER at the guards, screaming, "I refutiate this! I refudiate it!" Picture the guards and the other prisoners replying, "Don't you mean, **REPUDIATE**?".

column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 20-9-2006(190): **Sad** dness is like having your _heart_ captured and _jailed_ because of some **sad** or terrible event, etc. Here the **sad** _heart_ waits for someone to come and _un_ -lock their _jail cell_ and set them free again.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 21-8-2006(74): Stuck in a _jail cell_ with his _heart_ crying out to see his family again, the prisoner has never felt so **sad**.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 9-7-2007(48): A _jail cell_ will make any _heart_ **sad**.
column8: 4) [[mcbainpc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcbainpc)] 19-8-2008(24): For some reason, this kanji makes me think of some Toni Braxton song, but I change the lyrics to "Un- _jail_ my _heart_ ". Now that mnemonic has stuck in my head.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 23-12-2008(9): Imagine the **sad** image of a prisoner in a _jail cell_ feeling **sad** as he looks at all the little _hearts_ his daughter used to draw for him when she was just a child. Now she wants nothing to do with him.

column5: 1) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 21-2-2008(208): **Guilt** y under the _eye_ s of the law, therefore sentenced to _jail_. [note: 'UNDER the eye of the law' works in [penalty](../v4/833.html) (#833 罰) as well.].
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 7-12-2006(80): It is his **guilt** that is causing them. He is having these nightmares where _the great (sideways) eye_ appears at the top of his _jail_ cell, and is staring down intently at him. **Guilt** is a merciless tormentor.
column7: 3) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 6-11-2007(35): EYE-witnesses helped prove this person's **GUILT** and put them in a JAIL CELL… now constantly under the watchful EYES of the prison guards.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-10-2005(14): A man who is in _jail_ is so full of **guilt** that every night he is having these nightmares where a _great eye_ appears at the top of his _jail cell_ , and is staring down intently at him.
column9: 5) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 22-9-2008(11): He is **guilty**! you can see it in his _eyes_.. Throw that man into a _jail cell_!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-10-2005(316): Some man _jailed_ in Russia, is freed by his **comrade** (from the Communist party perhaps), who crashes into the _jail cell_ with a _vehicle_.
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 17-1-2008(84): (+fuaburisu) But it's the wrong jail cell! Your **comrade** is one floor _above_.
column7: 3) [[smujohnson](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smujohnson)] 1-3-2009(22): When you're in JAIL, your **COMRADE** will come and DRIVE a car through the JAIL CELL, coming FROM BELOW to bust you out.
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 16-2-2008(13): 後輩 【こうはい】 (n) junior (at work or school), (P) 先輩 【せんぱい】 (n) senior (at work or school), superior, elder, older graduate, progenitor, old-timer, (P) STORY: The worst criminals in the world are being transported to a special JAIL CELL in a fortified CAR. There are all nationalities, but one particular Russian criminal did not know who to address "senpai" or "kouhai" amongst the caught Japanese Yakuza. So he just called everyone **COMRADE**.
column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 3-7-2009(7): In Mother Russia, self-stimulation isn't enough for _goatse man_ , so he asks his **comrade** to drive a _car_ into his ass.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 21-5-2007(260): The only way out of a _jail cell_ is to serve your time and walk out the **front door**. There are no other _doors_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-10-2005(64): An old man serving a very long jail sentence painted a life-like _door_ at the back of his _jail cell_ , hlafway open, with the blue sky, clouds, etc, as some kind of symbol of freedom. Every time the prison officers come to take him they ask him to come to the door. The old man with a grin always answers "Which _door_?", looking at his painted door with a grin. And the prison officer always answer, sighing - "The **front door** !".
column7: 3) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 25-10-2010(33): It's a sad reflection on modern times that our **front door** s need to be built like _jail cell_ s to keep us safe. 扉 (とびら) : door, opening.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 27-2-2008(21): A jail cell only has one door. The **front door**.
column9: 5) [[DurablePants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DurablePants)] 27-6-2006(12): Your **front door** leads to a jail cell in order to trick burglers.

column3: _Person_ . . . _key_ . . . _dart_. Hint: the pun suggested by the pronunciation of the key word and the primitive for _key_ may come in helpful.
column5: 1) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 14-9-2007(145): _Mr. T_ is made a **marquis** after he and the A-Team save the life of a duke. The duke also gives Mr. T the key to the gentleman's _dart_ room where one can relax in luxury, smoke a cigar, and play a friendly game of _darts_. _Mr. T_ eagerly accepts the _key_ and places it on one of the gold chains that hang around his neck which acts as a key chain.
column6: 2) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 27-11-2007(62): (Going off various) Mr. T. is made a **marquis** and given the key to the city. But somebody disagrees with it and assassinates him with a dart.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 16-2-2008(28): MR.T had one final challenge before he would be promoted to a **MARQUIS**. He must shoot a DART through the hole of a KEY.
column8: 4) [[kodorakun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodorakun)] 29-7-2009(16): **Marquis** Keydartee (make-believe french name, Key+dart+T).
column9: 5) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 9-6-2008(16): The French government hires _Mr. T_ to bring the **Marquis** de Sade to justice. The **Marquis** runs away frantically. T pronounces himself "The Mar- _key_ de _Darts_ " and throws a bunch at Sade, felling him on the city streets.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 17-10-2006(98): "If the _marquis_ opens his _mouth_ one more time, I'll cut his **throat** ", his rival the baron said.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 29-10-2007(26): The _Marquis de Sade_ was kinda gay. He used to _mouth_ down a lot of deep- **throat** action.
column7: 3) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 17-11-2008(20): I think of "clearing your **throat** ". Some stuffy guy opens his _mouth_ to clear his **throat** so the _marquis_ can speak.
column8: 4) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 8-5-2007(5): "I swear, I'll cut his **throat**! If he opens his _mouth_ one more time, I'll cut the _marquis_ ' **throat** ", his rival the baron said.
column9: 5) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 6-11-2011(3): After MR.T was made a MARQUIS he was given a KEY to the DART room which he put in his MOUTH and swallowed down his **THROAT**.

column3: _Marquis_ . . . _walking stick_. Note where the _walking stick_ is positioned in this kanji.
column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 21-9-2006(162): The _marquis_ has absolutely no interest in issuses of **climate** change. He's old and near death. [Don't forget the _walking stick_ to symbolize his old age.].
column6: 2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 26-7-2008(91): The _marquis_ moves to a warmer **climate** after he gets old enough to need a _walking stick_ to get around.
column7: 3) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 25-10-2007(31): In his old age ( _walking stick_ ) Marquis T becomes Al Gore's **climate** control nemisis.
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 22-4-2008(14): The Marquis de Sade grows old, grabs a walking stick and moves to Florida for the warmer **climate** and to torture older ladies with his darts.
column9: 5) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 12-12-2006(13): As Mr. T drives off the lot in his new Mercury Grand _Marquis_ , the **climate** control screws up, causing him to pull out his _walking stick_ and beat up the dash. "I pity the fool who sold me this piece of junk".

column3: The etymology of **decide** (de-cidere = cut off) will help here, the elements are: _water_ . . . _guillotine_.
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-4-2007(261): " **Decide**!" " **Decide**?! Death by drowning in polluted _water_ or death by _guillotine_. How can I **decide**?" I asked.
column6: 2) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 2-4-2008(108): To **decide** if someone is a witch or not first dunk them in _water_. If they don't drown they are a witch and can be sent to the _guillotine_.
column7: 3) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 17-2-2011(31): (Seriously, do we really need the guillotine primitive? Surely _key_ and _person_ are adequate…) I have **decide** d that drinking more water is the _key_ to becoming a more healthy _person_. 決まる きまる be **decide** d, fixed, certain, 決める きめる **decide** , fix, choose, 決心 けっしん determination, resolution, 決定 けってい decision, determination, 解決 かいけつ settlement, solution, resolution.
column8: 4) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 10-3-2008(31): _Water_ boarding? _Guillotine_? The **Decide** r has **decide** d both these are legal and moral. I keep mixing this up with [choose](../v4/1074.html) (#1074 択). Try associating these negative options with our half-wit "decider" to build a distinction.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 23-5-2007(13): He was sentenced to death, but at least he was granted the ability to **decide** how: either by _guillotine_ , or by _chinese water torture_.

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 5-2-2007(186): A large crowd in a **cheerful** _state of mind_ applaude each criminal as they become victims of the _guillotine_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-9-2007(42): A **cheerful** crowd of insulted aliens applaude as _Data_ 's head is chopped off by _guillotine_.
column7: 3) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 7-4-2009(33): Data is **cheerful** as he goes to the guillotine. That's because he knows he can just solder his head back on afterwards.
column8: 4) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 27-11-2007(27): _Data_ was soo **cheerful** when he was put in charge of the _guillotine_! He can't wait for the next person to commit a crime!
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 17-3-2007(21): If Monty Python had set their movie "Life of Brian" in the time of the French revolution, you can just picture how the characters in a **cheerful** _state of mind_ would sing: "Always look on the bright side of life!" on their way to the _guillotine_.

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 1-5-2006(168): Mr. T is certainly an **ADMIRABLE** PERSON, so much so that parents are buying lockets with his picture in it and having their children wear them like amulets.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 21-2-2008(79): For _locket_ : The _locket_ ( _key_ dangling from something, the vertical stroke) opens like a _mouth_ , but you need a jeweler's _monocle_ to make out the pictures within. —– _Dracula_ survives a staking attempt when the _locket_ with Mina's **admirable** picture deflects the blow. "It was an **admirable** attempt," he admits as he sucks his attacker's blood.
column7: 3) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 21-1-2008(52): **Stroke order:** Heisig says that the added vertical stroke is the third stroke, but it's the first of primitive (so it's the third of _this_ kanji, but in the book he's talking about the primitive).
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 23-5-2007(39): She thought that _Mr. T_ was a tough, heartless guy, but then she found out that he carries around a _locket_ with a picture of his daughter. Suddenly, she found it **admirable** that he had such a soft side.
column9: 5) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 17-2-2007(14): Hint: _locket_ = [I](../v4/17.html) (#17 吾) + _sunglasses with one of the lenses popped out_ with the top line of 五 left off. **えらい** 。.

column5: 1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 30-8-2006(221): You lose your precious _locket_ on the _road_ to somewhere. You ask people if they've seen it, but no luck. "Just buy another one," someone says. "I mean, what's the **difference**?" Then of course you say "Well, it makes a huge **difference**!! Since it has sentimental value, I don't want a different one! " Then of course they understand.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 17-2-2008(68): You loose your LOCKET on the ROAD and report it to the 交番 . They find one, and show it to you. 「これですか？」 But it's the wrong one… You say, 「いいえ。。 **違います** 。。」.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 6-9-2007(46): An odd version of The Road Less Traveled: "I found a _locket_ in the _road_ , and that has made all the **difference**.".
column8: 4) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 4-8-2008(36): You know what the **difference** is between you and me? I find this expensive locket on the road and I look for the owner. You, on the other hand, look for a pawn shop. THAT's the **difference**.
column9: 5) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 21-9-2006(21): Noticing a **difference** between the _locket_ hanging around his lover's neck and the _locket_ he had giver her he rips it off her and throws it in the _road_.

column5: 1) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 31-8-2007(311): Spiderman buys a _locket_ for Mary Jane because he wants to get **HORIZONTAL** with her.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 31-5-2007(54): Spiderman on a boat, marking the Earth's **latitudes**. He first attaches a personal locket to a small piece of thread for ballast and good luck, and shoots with his right hand. After a few minutes (and lots and lots of thread), the _locket and thread_ have flown around the world. Spiderman catches the locket with his left hand, and ties the thread's ends together. Voilà.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-1-2006(27): Hint : this kanji also means "latitude", which are the **horizontal** lines on a globe. Do you remember James Heisig's story for frame 175 "black ink" ? Here a cartographer on a ship, is using his " _thread locket_ " to mark **horizontal** lines on a map. He pulls a chalked thread from the locket, and snaps it to mark **horizontal** lines. Imagine the "thread-locket" in the shape of a globe, filled with dark powder and a little bobbin of thread.
column8: 4) [[scotty28](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scotty28)] 14-12-2009(17): Spiderman gave up being spiderman and promised Mary Jane to live the **horizontal** life like the rest of us. Whenever he starts to feel like he wants to go back to his spidy ways, he takes out his locket with a mary jane picture to remind him that he will forever live **horizontal** y.
column9: 5) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 26-3-2009(13): Imagine yourself tie a _locket_ to the end of a _thread_ and spin it **horizontal** ly..

column3: _Boulevard_ . . . _locket_. Do not confuse with _ward off_ (Frame 1399), _protect_ (Frame 1072), _guard_ (Frame 198), or _safeguard_ (Frame 756).
column5: 1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 28-5-2007(238): [defense, protection] For " _defense_ against the dark arts" class, you go the magical _boulevard_ and buy an enchanted _locket_.
column6: 2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 1-5-2008(95): Since it was in the middle of the _boulevard_ , everyone could see she hit the man only in self- **defense** , as he was trying to steal her valuable _locket_.
column7: 3) [[AryllWind](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AryllWind)] 5-4-2008(66): I think of **defense** as an attribute in video games. Like Final Fantasy, for example. When you go to a new town, you walk up and down the _boulevard_ for shops that will sell you better items. One of the best accessory items for **defense** is a _locket_ that absorbs magical energy. Unfortunately, you can't buy it yet, as it costs over a hundred thousand gil.
column8: 4) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 5-6-2009(24): _Boulevard Locket_. **Defense** +2 when equipped.
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 26-2-2007(11): "It's cheap **defense**. On this _boulevard_ the mafia rules. Your only **defense** is the _locket_ (with the picture of the Don in it) which we will rent for a 'modest fee' to anybody who'd like to keep living. You want some **defense**?" Tony said with a smile.

column3: As with _Italy_ (Frame 1245) and _Africa_ (Frame 1391), this character simply abbreviates the full name of _Korea_. Its elements: _mist_ . . . _locket_.
column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 21-9-2006(174): There's a young **Korea** n male actor, Yon-sama, famous amongst middle-aged Japanese women. Extremely famous. Read about his affect on Japan/ **Korean** relations on Everything2.com. In any case, women just flipped over this guy, traveled to **Korea** to see his home, started taking **Korea** n language classes, etc. So, imagine here the _misty_ eyes of the Japanese women as they clutch their _lockets_ with Yon-sama's picture inside watching his **Korea** n romantic mini series called "Winter Sonata".
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 27-9-2007(113): This character represents the flag of South **Korea** : a _locket_ (circular taegeuk) in the middle of the _mist_ (white background). <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_South_Korea>.
column7: 3) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 2-11-2006(48): Kim Jong II gets all misty eyed when he looks at the locket of his departed mother, I’m rone-ry, so rone-ry (from team America).
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-4-2006(29): The **Korea** n army is wearing " _mist lockets_ ". When the _lockets_ are opened, a _mist_ spreads about a meter over the floor level, which allows the **Korea** ns to advance without being seen.
column9: 5) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 31-8-2007(11): I bomb **Korea** every night, then I send them 10 sunflowers and a locket to apologize the next morning.

column3: It is best to see this kanji as a pictograph of a revolving circular clothesline (viewed from the side). Spin it around quickly in your mind's eye to give it the connotation of to **dry**.
column4: * The primitive meaning is _clothesline_.
column5: 1) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 23-4-2008(168): **Dry** _one_ item in _ten_ minutes on the _clothesline_.
column6: 2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 17-2-2007(57): Note: the book shows the strokes for _potato_ rather than **dry** …dry does not have the hook at the end.
column7: 3) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 26-1-2010(31): _Vampire_ : Upside down samurai. They suck humans **dry**.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(15): A **dry** _water lily_ with no _drops_ on it (see [even](../v4/1484.html) (#1484 平).
column9: 5) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 21-9-2006(14): Heisig's pictograph of a _clothesline_ is fine, but I also see another pictograph here, that of _one_ _needle_ trying to push its way through the **dry** _surface of the earth_ above it but because of a lack of rain the earth is parched and **dry** thus this _one_ _needle_ stays buried in the earth below. Furthermore, you could say that the earth is so **dry** that there's not even _one needle_ left on it.

column5: 1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 5-2-2007(326): Well you all know that the **liver** is the _part of the body_ that would be quite grateful if you led a _dry_ lifestyle (i.e. no alcohol).
column6: 2) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 26-3-2008(21): The slaughterhouse prefers to ship dried **liver** to the supermarkets (can you imagine boxes soaked in blood on the truck that delivers them?). Imagine them lifting the slabs of flesh and hanging them on the clothesline to dry.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 24-12-2008(9): Imagine Hannibal Lecter recounting his _flesh_ -eating days: "I ate his **liver** with some fava beans and a nice _dry_ chianti".
column8: 4) [[scotty28](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scotty28)] 14-7-2009(6): Imagine a beat up **liver** (too much alcohol). The doctor takes your **liver** out of your body, and puts it on a clothes line to dry off. Then puts it back in your body, sealing up the flesh. A dry **liver** is a healthy **liver** he chuckles as he puts it back.
column9: 5) [[BooBooQ88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BooBooQ88)] 27-10-2009(3): The part of the flesh that keeps the blood dry of toxins is the **LIVER**.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(201): The newspaper pages are hung on the _clotheseline_ to dry and then cut down with a _sabre_ to be **publish** ed.
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 31-5-2007(93): The newspaper pages are hung on the _clotheseline_ to dry. This gives the government a chance to censor the news: they cut up unwanted stories with a _sabre_. Therefore, only state-approved stories are **published**.
column7: 3) [[nakome](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nakome)] 20-6-2008(57): The author's work was so _dry_ that he had to threaten the **publish** er with a _sabre_ in order to get them to **publish** it.
column8: 4) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 22-7-2008(24): _Cut_ and _dried_ \- yeah, that sounds like most of the drivel **publish** ed nowadays.
column9: 5) [[mclin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mclin)] 9-4-2009(18): I can't **publish** this. It's too _dry_. Don't you have any stories with people getting attacked with _sabre_ s or something?

column5: 1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 28-6-2007(203): The way **sweat** is supposed to work: it gets your skin _wet_ , and then as it evaporates/ _dries_ , it cools you off.
column6: 2) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 30-8-2006(68): When you **sweat** your clothes become soaked with _water_ , prompting you to hang them to _dry_ on a clothesline.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-1-2006(46): **Sweat** a process to regulate body temperature : _water_ comes out of the pores of the skin, and when it _dries_ it cools you off.
column8: 4) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 12-3-2009(10): When you want to **sweat** , there are 2 kinds of sauna - wet ( _watery_ ) and _dry_.
column9: 5) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 25-10-2007(9): Vampire trivia: _vampire_ s have no **sweat** glands to secrete _water_. Have you ever seen a vampire wet with **sweat**? That is why they can't be in the sun. The **sweat** water can't come out so they will just explode.

column3: This kanji, a counter for houses, is made up of _cars_ . . . _dry_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(231): **Flats** in the city are crowded. You get a space for your _car_ in front, and a _clothesline_ out back. Nothing else.
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 11-7-2007(58): Small **flats** (garages) for _cars_ help keeping them _dry_.
column7: 3) [[matsuyamakiwi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matsuyamakiwi)] 29-6-2008(38): Did you hear about the guy obsessed with his _car_? He keeps it in his **flat** to keep _dry_.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 27-2-2008(17): A flat/house definition: 'The thing that is between the car (in front) and the clothesline (in back) .
column9: 5) [[gavin.schultz-ohkubo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavin.schultz- ohkubo)] 20-6-2010(8): I don't have a garage, so I keep my _car_ in my **flat** to keep it _dry_.

column5: 1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 4-11-2006(255): At the base of _mountain_ _cliff_ s, there is usually a **beach**. You often can see people lying there, _drying_ off after a swim.
column6: 2) [[Pete171](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pete171)] 17-11-2008(91): Three impossibilities for a **beach** : There cannot be a **beach** at the top of a _mountain_. There cannot be a **beach** on the top of a _cliff_. There cannot be a **beach** that is completely _dry_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-1-2006(39): I use a play on words here to help with the similar keywords such as "strand", and "coast". The **Beach** Boys just had a concert down at the **beach** , and they're all wet after the performance. It's not _dry_ enough down at the **beach** so they climb the nearest _cliff_. Still, it's not _dry_ enough there so they climb the nearest _mountain_. Finally, the air seems _dry_ and they take a rest while their clothes _dry_.
column8: 4) [[Mesqueeb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mesqueeb)] 13-4-2009(16): The fastest way to reach the **beach** starting from our mountain cabin is to go down the MOUNTAIN until the CLIFF and slide down the CLOTHESLINE directly onto the **beach**!
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 10-2-2011(11): A nude **beach** is generally sheltered from sight under a _mountains_ or a _cliff_ , where the bathers can _dry_ in privacy.

column3: _Mist_ . . . _umbrella_ . . . _dry_. The meaning of this key word extends beyond **tree trunks** to represent the main stem or line of anything from railway lines to managerial staffs. This should help distinguish it from the stories used earlier for _book_ (Frame 224) and _body_ (Frame 1030), both of which made use of the image of a **tree trunk** , as well as the kanji for _trunk_ (Frame 194).
column5: 1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 12-1-2007(299): A fine _mist_ is falling, and so everyone gathers around near the **tree-trunk** , effectively using the rest of the tree as an _umbrella_ in order to keep _dry_.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 10-5-2007(64): By astridtops - In the rainy _mist_ , Totoro is standing in front of a **tree- trunk** at the bus stop, under the _umbrella_ he just received. Look at him smiling: even when the big drops fall, he remains _dry_! Great story…which I get to by thinking: **tree-trunk** -> **TT** - > **T** onari no **T** otoro. I also imagine Mickey Mouse is there too as the KUNyomi for this kanji is みき.
column7: 3) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 8-10-2009(22): The word that you will sure see with this kanji is shinkansen (bullet train). 新幹線 . STORY: Shinkansen is very expensive, so I only use it when a MIST is falling. I prefer the train than an UMBRELLA to stay DRY.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 6-2-2008(20): There is no tree in this kanji! So think of a cold, bare, dead **tree-trunk** , with the upper branches all cut off. Residents of the neighboring house have run a _clothesline_ from their window to the dead **tree-trunk**. You are filled with sadness, seeing the greatness of nature being destroyed and exploited by mankind. You are walking by this sad scene on a cold and drizzly day with a fine _mist_ descending, using an _umbrella_ to keep yourself _dry_.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 22-7-2006(12): In the rainy _mist_ , Totoro is standing in front of a **tree-trunk** at the bus stop, under the _umbrella_ he just received. Look at him smiling: even when the big drops fall, he remains _dry_!

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(239): If your **potato** s are growing _flowers_ and those little _hooked roots_ , you should either buy less or eat them faster.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 3-2-2008(77): If your **potato** es are growing _flowers_ , you need to store them in a more _dry_ place, like hanging them on _hooks_ so they don't accumulate moisture on the floor.
column7: 3) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 4-5-2008(53): Believe it or not, originally the **potato** was cultivated because of its beautiful _flowers_ rather than for eating the actual " _potato_ " below. (historical fact).
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-1-2006(18): Tip : the bottom primitive ( _potato with hooks_ ) can be thought of as "Mr **Potato** Head", the toy patented in 1952 with which you can make faces. This _potato_ has little _hooks_ onto which you can attach ears, noses, glasses, etc. to make all sorts of faces.
column9: 5) [[Murjab](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Murjab)] 1-12-2008(10): The **potato** plant consists of both flowers and the root below. The root (the part of a plant that hooks into the soil), is all that most people think of when they hear the word "potato." Therefore, while the kanji for **potato** contains all parts of the plant - flowers and roots - as a primitive, only focus on the important part - the roots.

column5: 1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 19-3-2006(187): Under the **eaves** of the house the poor family has potate plants.
column6: 2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 23-4-2006(84): Very good image Erik. To help those who struggleded with this, the **eaves** of a house is usually the bit where you hang the roof gutter along, usually made of zinc or plastic and shaped as a half-pipe. It catches rain water, so it flows to a drain pipe instead of down onto people and windows. And in this family the potato plants grow along the **eaves** so the water pours down on them. They are poor. so no gutter.
column7: 3) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 9-3-2008(45): This kanji means **universe** , seen here as a _roof_ as that was how it was represented back then the _vault of heaven_. Today, we know that seen from the **universe** , our planet has the aspect of a _potato_ , and not a perfect sphere.
column8: 4) [[DurablePants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DurablePants)] 22-6-2006(34): During christmas, since your family is TOO POOR, you hang potatoes off the **eaves** instead of christmas lights.
column9: 5) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 13-2-2009(11): Sam at the beginning of the Lord of the Rings was outside the house in the potato bushes when Gandalf was talking with Frodo, even though he denied it: "I wasn't dropping no **eaves** , sir. Honest!".

column3: _Umbrella_ . . . _potato_ . . . _little_. The last stroke of _potato_ and the first of _little_ coincide in this character.
column4: * Since the phrase " _too much_ " is overly abstract, we shall take the image of a _scale_ whose indicator spins round and round on the dial because _too much_ weight has been set on it. It will help to use this image in learning the kanji itself.
column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 11-7-2007(183): You hang an _umbrella_ upside-down on a hook of the **scales** and fill it with _little_ _potatoes_. No luck: it weights **too much**.
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 7-3-2008(147): This is the kanji for 「あまり Amari」, which means **too little** in negative sentences and **too much** in the rest (always with a negative sense). I take the liberty of using the symbol " >" ( **more than** , another meaning!!) as the _umbrella_ component, and using [two](../v4/2.html) (#2 二) and [little](../v4/105.html) (#105 小) for the _potato_ primitive. So, this kanji either means " _two_ much" (more than 2) or " _two little_ ". (thanks, Virtua_leaf and Thunderball!).
column7: 3) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 2-7-2008(50): I was worried that my _POTATOES_ were getting **TOO MUCH** direct sunlight so I stood over them with an _UMBRELLA_. Now they are getting too _LITTLE_ rain! I clearly have **TOO MUCH** free time on my hands.
column8: 4) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 17-11-2009(25): _Umbrellas_ for _little potatoes_??? That's **too much**!
column9: 5) [[Talka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Talka)] 12-9-2007(11): You're weighing potatoes to take from the market but they weigh **too much**. It's windy, so you hook your umbrella onto the scale hoping to subtract weight by catching the wind's force. Still **too much** weight. Just give up and select some smaller potatoes, man. Won't be **too much** weight then.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(245): To become a member of _The Pinnacle_ , they test you on a _scale_. If you weigh _too much_ , they **exclude** you.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-11-2006(69): You won't make it unless you **exclude** something. The climb to the _pinacle_ cannot be completed if you are carrying _too much_. You just have to decide what you can afford to **exclude**.
column7: 3) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 13-5-2009(16): Before entering _The Pinnacle_ , one must be weighed on a _scale_. The authorities have to **exclude** anyone who is over 300 pds since their weight might damage the floor.
column8: 4) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 17-5-2009(6): Officials at the Acropolis **exclude** access to vehicles that weigh too much. Some gate staff also apply this to people (generally Americans) who weigh over 250 lbs.
column9: 5) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 2-10-2009(4): (insert fat celeb here) is **exclude** d at _The Pinnacle_ because he/she weighs _too much_.

column5: 1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 27-9-2006(166): You can't expect weight loss to happen overnight. You should limit _going_ to the _scale_ to weigh yourself to once a day or once a week, in order to observe the anticipated weight loss **gradually**.
column6: 2) [[slats70](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/slats70)] 10-1-2009(79): I set up a _column_ chart next to my _scales_ so I could record my weight **gradually** changing.
column7: 3) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-11-2007(26): Remember the urban legend of the ARMY COLUMN that weighed TOO MUCH with their rythmic marching that the bridge collapsed? Now ARMY COLUMNS will march **GRADUALLY** across so that they do not bear TOO MUCH on the bridge.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(21): _Flash_ didn't get fat overnight. He **gradually** added a pound on the _scale_ here and there until finally he weighed _too much_ to fit into his snazzy red costume. (Credit: CharleyGarrett).
column9: 5) [[scout](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scout)] 11-2-2008(12): Ever since he's stopped doing Tours, _Lance_ has been **gradually** gaining weight. See him cringe as he steps on a _scale_ and sees it **gradually** go up!

column3: _Scale_ . . _crotch_. The key word has to do with **conferring** ranks, titles, and awards. It should not be confused with _bestow_ (Frame 1335) or _impart_ (Frame 795).
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(251): Amazed at the _weight_ of his _crotch_ , they **confer** red every honor upon him. (Image: guy with his junk on a scale getting a medal pinned to his chest/around his neck/being knighted, etc.).
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 7-3-2008(45): (This kanji stands for **description** in my kanji dictionary) "At first, I thought it was _too little_ , but soon became _too much_ ", is the **description** that my girlfriend gave of my _crotch_.
column7: 3) [[Christoph](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christoph)] 27-4-2007(27): When you **confer** _again_ 又 , you **confer** _too much_ 余 !
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 5-3-2007(17): When the fighter was weighed, the _scales spun wildly_. On closer inspection, it seems he is well-endowed and his _crotch_ was pressing against the scales, adding vastly more amounts of weight. The judges then had to **confer** amongst themselves to consider what should be his real weight division.
column9: 5) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 15-3-2007(14): Having honours **confer** red on him proved to be _too much_! He overbalanced, so instead of kneeling at the queen's feet, he somehow ended up sitting _cross- legged_.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 19-10-2006(244): On this **route** , all trucks have to check in at the scales before they can get on the road.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-10-2008(75): There are _too many roads_ , so you need to plan a **route**.
column7: 3) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 22-4-2007(25): When you’re spending _too much_ time on the _road_ , you’re always en _route_ to somewhere.
column8: 4) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 28-1-2007(24): Truck drivers in the US have to drive the truck onto some massive scales at state borders, for tax reasons. They have to plan their **route** accordingly, there aren't scales on every road.
column9: 5) [[tokyokanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tokyokanji)] 16-9-2009(18): Too much traffic on this road, lets take a different **route**!

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(184): The main bar of an old-fashioned _scale(balance)_ will be very **diagonal** if you place a giant _measuring cup_ on one side.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-7-2009(92): The _scale_ tilts **diagonal** ly when a _measuring cup_ filled with _too much_ is set on one end.
column7: 3) [[sacmaliyorsun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sacmaliyorsun)] 18-2-2008(56): The constellation of libra (meaning " scales" in latin) is **diagonal** to the handle of the big dipper.
column8: 4) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 17-6-2009(23): An old scale with _measuring cups_ on both sides: If you put _too much_ in only one of the _measuring cups_ , the bar will change its position to **diagonal** (one _measuring cup_ outweights the other).
column9: 5) [[davidvance](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/davidvance)] 31-1-2010(10): If you visit **DiagonAl** ley, you'll find a lot of shops measuring out potion ingredients with _scales_ and _measuring cups_.

column5: 1) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 2-10-2007(263): If you add _too much water_ to the **paint** it will drip onto the _ground_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(133): A true artisan mixes his own **paint** from _water_ and _soils_ on a _scale_ in careful proportions.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 28-5-2007(31): People ask why the ground of our backyard is entirely white. Well, my cheapskate dad wanted to add a fresh coat of white **paint** to our house. He bought the biggest, cheapest tub, placed it on a scale in our yard, and started diluting it with water. It was working fine, and he was adding water drop by drop and carefully checking the weight each time. However, his hand slipped, and he added _too much water_ and the _scale broke down violently_ , spilling the **paint** _all over the ground_.
column8: 4) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 12-7-2009(19): The **paint** was WATERed down and TOO MUCH dripped on the GROUND.
column9: 5) [[BooBooQ88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BooBooQ88)] 30-10-2009(5): If you put too much water in the **PAINT** mix in some soil to make it thicker.

column3: In the same way that we were able to see the _sun_ in the _tree_ within the kanji for _east_ , here we see a square container in the shape of a _mouth_.
column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 7-10-2006(184): Mnemonic: **Bundle** of joy. Here I see the proverbial stork with a baby hanging from its _mouth_ fly straight into a _tree_. Painful, but he doesn't drop the **bundle**.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 13-12-2006(126): Unlike in 杏 , this big mouth isn't content to wait for apricots to fall in his mouth, so he has climbed the tree and is taking them in **bundle** s.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-7-2009(46): A **bundle** of some kind has been stuffed into the _opening_ of a _tree_.
column8: 4) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 24-4-2006(18): This is an image of the monster Gojira (AKA Godzilla) that is so mad it has eaten all the trees. So a **bundle** of trees sticks out of Gojiras mouth as it rampages through Tokyo.
column9: 5) [[epangelia2k2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/epangelia2k2)] 10-6-2008(12): Tip: I was looking for a personification for **bundle** man [+fab] and came across this evocative story from the archives (1889) <http://query.nytimes.com/mem/archive- free/pdf?res=9901E5D9163BE033A25755C2A9659C94689FD7CF> Caution: the famous vagrant is known as Leather Man so don't confuse with [leather](../v4/1893.html) (#1893 革). But in the end I couldn't resist both because of the interesting story and the fact one of the possessions found in his mysterious sack (bundle) was an awl as used in subsequent frames 1671-1674!

column5: 1) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 21-4-2007(323): We found a bundle of severed heads in your room, its difficult to **trust** you.
column6: 2) [[Angrybeez](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Angrybeez)] 20-6-2008(28): Don't **Trust** the press just a _bundle_ of lies on every _page_!
column7: 3) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 29-5-2007(26): [trust, request] Do you **trust** anything? Actually we do, as long as a _bundle_ of _heads_ say the same thing. If a _bundle_ of scientist's _heads_ say we live in a 12 dimensions universe, why should we not **trust** them?
column8: 4) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 29-8-2009(12): Even though the stork didn't drop its _bundle_ when it crashed into the tree, I still don't **trust** it to deliver any more babies - the one I got isn't right in the _head_. Must be a result of the stork-tree collision (see also [quick](../v4/1669.html) (#1669 速)).
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 28-2-2008(11): [頼む、たのむ](midori://search?text=頼む、たのむ) Godzilla requested a bundle of heads. If we give it, he will spare the rest. Can we **trust** him?

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(167): You need complete _trust_ in your _water_ guide to attempt Class 5 **rapids**.
column6: 2) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 27-11-2006(60): You can never trust the water in the **rapids** , it will do everything it can to pull you under. Imagine a line of natives with bundles upon their heads all fighting the **rapids** to cross the river.
column7: 3) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 16-2-2009(46): The water in the **rapids** can't be trusted.
column8: 4) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 24-4-2010(29): When I saw a _bundle_ of severed _heads_ floating in the water, I didn't _trust_ the **rapids** , or the guide for that matter…
column9: 5) [[Mary_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mary_K)] 10-8-2009(4): The _water_ of the **rapids** are not to be _trusted_.

column3: In order to keep this character distinct from that for an _imperial edict_ (Frame 366), we must draw again on a pun. Think of the **order** here as a mail **order** or an **order** of pizza phoned in by the Emperor for delivery to the **imperial** palace. Then it will not be hard to put together _bundle_ and _muscle_ to form a story about an **imperial order**.
column5: 1) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 9-12-2007(248): This is an **imperial order** for pizza. To deliver the huge bundle of pizzas to the emperor, the pizza boy needs huge muscles.
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 21-7-2007(64): **Imperial order** carries quite a _bundle_ of executive _power_.
column7: 3) [[Okonomiyaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Okonomiyaki)] 26-6-2008(30): "Did someone have an **imperial order** for pizza?" says the muscular delivery boy with a large "bundle" in the new adult film, "The Emperor's Nude Groove".
column8: 4) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 15-1-2008(12): The emperor makes an **imperial order** : A _bundle_ of seafood pizzas, mainly with _muscles_ for topping.
column9: 5) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 25-7-2008(8): A (written) **imperial order** : a little _bundle_ of paper that carries a lot of _power_.

column3: _Zoo_ . . . _bundle_. Note that the element for _zoo_ is flattened out on the left just as _leg_ (Frame 1372) had been. This is the only time we will meet this form in this book.
column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 24-9-2006(183): [True story] In Osaka the homeless (the **alienate** d) live in large numbers around the city _zoo_. Picture them in winter all _bundled_ up in rags trying to keep warm, **alienate** d from the society, living literally worst than the animals in the _zoo_ who at least are _bundled_ in their natural furs and have pens to live in sheltered from the elements.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 10-7-2007(85): This kanji is so strange that it was **alienate** d at the kanji _zoo_. The _bundle_ of joy stork bundles this kanji up and takes it to a kanji foster home.
column7: 3) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 10-9-2006(49): Think of a Kanji _Zoo_ , where we _bundle_ up all the bizarre and hard to remember kanji, to be ridiculed and _alienated_ from the other more sensible kanji. This kanji definately belongs there!
column8: 4) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 16-5-2008(23): The cleaner at the ZOO felt **ALIENATE** D by everyone. Granted, he was carrying around the BUNDLE of manure he cleaned from the ZOO cages. (Just picture a zoo cleaner carrying a bundle of dung with the crowd avoiding him).
column9: 5) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 20-2-2008(15): Very rarely does this kanji appear in a word meaning "alienate." The better meaning is "sparse," such as not dense, very few, scattered, or spread irregularly. It also appears in words that have to do with "neglect." 疎ら 【まばら】 (adj-na,n) sparse, (P) STORY: at the ZOO BUNDLES of happy animals are SPARSE.

column5: 1) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 15-8-2010(32): **bitter** , _spicy_ , _bundle_ : In a desperate attempt of creating a new drink, they decided to mix a **bitter** drink with a _spicy_ one – now _bundled_ together for the same price of one! However, **bitter** ness didn't go well with the spicy, as seen in the misshape to the left.
column6: 2) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 25-3-2011(24): The **bitter** taste was so awful that I put whole _bundle_ of _spice_ in my mouth to get rid of it.
column7: 3) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 24-12-2010(8): I'm rather **bitter** that someone stole my _spice bundle_.
column8: 4) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 8-12-2009(5): **severe** : When you were forced to put the spicy bundle of Wasabi in your mouth, you experienced severe pain.
column9: 5) [[eri401](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eri401)] 6-7-2011(3): Too many spicy things bundled in a meal will make anyone feel **bitter** towards the cook. 辛辣 , 辛らつ 【しんらつ】 (adj-na,n) **bitter** , sharp, acrimonious 悪辣 , 悪らつ 【あくらつ】 (adj-na) crafty, vicious, unscrupulous, sharp.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-12-2006(245): If you find a bundle of money on the road, pick it up **quick** before anyone notices.
column6: 2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 28-8-2008(55): Uh oh. The stork just dropped the _bundle_ of joy in the middle of the _road_. Somebody save it, **quick**!
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(23): Jack be nimble, Jack be **quick** , Jack jump over the _bundle_ in the middle of the road.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-7-2009(22): A _bundle_ of optic fibers running along the _road_ makes for **quick** internet access.
column9: 5) [[zer0range](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zer0range)] 19-4-2009(11): I banged her **quick** , then bundled up and hit the road!

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 1-11-2006(251): Recycling in Japan, you have to make sure all your _bundles_ are **organize** d _correctly_ otherwise the _taskmasters_ won't accept them.
column6: 2) [[Jasta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Jasta)] 1-7-2008(39): When a _bundle_ of _taskmasters_ **organize** something chances are it won't be done _correctly_ because they are constantly arguing.
column7: 3) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 24-4-2010(30): **Organize** , def: when _taskmasters bundle_ tasks _correctly_.
column8: 4) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 26-5-2010(22): At stork headquarters there is a _taskmaster_ who **organize** s all the outgoing _bundles of joy_. It is very important to **organize** things so that the _correct_ bundle goes to the _correct_ place!!! (Just imagine if the crocodiles opened their bundle to find kittens!!!).
column9: 5) [[Rooboy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rooboy)] 25-3-2009(22): When you have a _bundle_ of things to **organize** appoint a _taskmaster_ to oversee it is done _correct_ ly.

column3: _Awl_ . . . _saber_. As we promised way back in frame 87, here at last is the kanji on which the primitive element of the same name is based.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(140): If it helps, make the awl primitive **ice pick** instead. They're basically the same thing. This kanji is an easy David vs. Goliath story of the **icepick** vs. the _saber_ …
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 2-7-2008(96): Every self-respecting ninja knows the story of "The _Awl and the Sabre_ ". According to the legend, a woman once defended herself by using an _awl_ against a _sabre_! She used to work all day with that _awl_. However, the bandit using the _sabre_ had no skill. And thus the _awl_ beat the _sabre_. And from there the saying goes : "The _sabre_ is powerless against the _awl_ , if one can't use the _sabre_.".
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 20-2-2008(73): ICE PICK primitive: How do you FIT a PERSON into a tight BOX (mouth primitive)? Poke holes in him with a ICE PICK, draining the blood and making the body smaller. STORY: If that does not work, take out your **SABER** and cut them up into neat pieces.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 9-4-2007(58): As a non-native speaker of English, I really couldn't work with the awl primitive, since I can't even imagine what kind of tool it would be. So, I had another look at the primitive and it practically screamed a different meaning: _fit together_ and _person_ , i.e. Frankenstein's Monster. // The crowd came after the monster of Frankenstein with sabres!
column9: 5) [[diracbracket](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/diracbracket)] 13-1-2011(19): My light **saber** has an _awl_ setting. When I toggle the switch, the beam shrinks down to a little spike. My light **saber** becomes a light _awl_.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(203): The edge of _The Pinnacle_ is **precipitous** , so they have a guard posted with an _ice pick_ to poke people and keep them from the edge.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 18-6-2006(30): Well I have someone climbing an inflatable **precipitous** _pinnacle_. Once at the top it is so **precipitous** that the person is afraid to climb down and instead punctures the inflatable _pinnacle_ with an _awl_ to get safely and slowly back to the ground.
column7: 3) [[Floatingweed5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Floatingweed5)] 28-11-2007(23): Frankenstein is chased by the villagers up to the **precipitous** edge of the pinnacle. (ref 1671 astridtops).
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 16-5-2008(19): The _Ice Climbers_ enjoy **precipitous** climbs - and what better place to climb than the **precipitous** _Pinnacle_!
