column9: 5) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 8-4-2009(14): The rock climber trying to get up to the pinnacle is dangling from a **precipitous** edge, hanging only one with his icepick.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 15-1-2007(158): You're giving a TREE an **EXAMINATION**. You take a wood sample from the TREE with an AWL (cmp [exam](../v4/1278.html) (#1278 校)).
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 4-2-2008(112): Don't confuse with [exam](../v4/1278.html) (#1278 校), [test](../v4/354.html) (#354 試), [evaluate](../v4/1487.html) (#1487 評). Think of **examination** as a doctor's **examination**. You're having problems getting _wood_ in bed. You go in for a doctor's **examination**. The doctor shoves an _icepick_ into your manhood as part of the **examination**.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 23-2-2008(50): After intense cross- **examination** from the prosecutor, the _tree_ confessed to murdering the _wood_ -pecker with an _awl_ … "He just kept at it, he kept poking at me with that beak, so I thought I'd see how HE liked it!!" The autopsy **examination** revealed at least a dozen puncture wounds, what a brutal case.
column8: 4) [[kioku3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kioku3)] 13-1-2009(25): The doctor gives a physical **examination** to _Frankenstein's Monster._ The monster is so big the doctor has to use a _tree_ to hit his knee and check his reflexes. (I am using astridtops' primitive of _Frankenstein's Monster_ (fit (together) and person) in place of "awl").
column9: 5) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 12-6-2007(17): Patient goes to see the doctor for an **examination**. he says "Everytime i walk i fart". Doc asks him to take a few steps and he farts constantly. Docs puzzled and has never seen this before. He asks him to repeat and it happens again. So the doc tells him to go to the examinatino area and take his pants off. He then gets out a giant wooden awl slightly hooked at the end. What the f* _k are you going to do with that!? asks teh patient. "Open the windows, it f_ cking stinks in here!" replies the doc.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(285): _Mr. T_ is as **frugal** as they come. He uses his one _ice pick_ for everything: to eat, pick his teeth, clean his toilet, kill people, cook, etc.
column6: 2) [[stshores24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stshores24)] 21-9-2008(13): _Mr. T_ is so **frugal** , he hires _Frankenstein_ as a butler because he doesn't have to pay him.
column7: 3) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 6-5-2006(7): Mr T is a **frugal** person in spite of his brash appearance. He brings an awl with him to fight for the A team, not wasting needless ammo and dynamite, since no one ever gets killed anyway in A team series.
column8: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(4): Some _n00b_ spent all the club's money, so _Haruhi_ teaches him how to be **frugal** (see [sabre/saber](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1671) (#1671 剣).

column3: _Thousand_ . . . _ri_. Note how the long vertical stroke doubles up to serve both elements.
column5: 1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 20-3-2006(321): The first computer in the world was as **heavy** as thousand computers are now.
column6: 2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 21-4-2006(36): To me it looks like a car with two extra wheels, like a truck. As it is a very **heavy** vehicle I suggest an image of a huge mining truck, like the yellow Liebherr T282B. Remember that the first "wheel" is a bit bent. <http://www.primidi.com/2004/06/21.html>.
column7: 3) [[yuriehoshii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yuriehoshii)] 31-5-2011(15): TRỌNG : A CAR 車 WITH DOUBLE WHEELS , TOO **HEAVY** !!! EASY , YEAH !
column8: 4) [[TsunamiEddi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TsunamiEddi)] 29-3-2011(11): _1000_ （ 千 ） _computers_ ( 里 ) are so **heavy**.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-7-2009(8): A **heavy** duty _truck_ with four-wheel drive.

column5: 1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 4-7-2006(132): Even though the furniture is _heavy_ , it'll be easy to **move** with all the _muscles_ that he has.
column6: 2) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 6-7-2008(91): His MUSCLES are so HEAVY, he barely can **move** …thats ironic.
column7: 3) [[CaLeDee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CaLeDee)] 20-9-2008(50): Heavy things can be **move** d with a bit of muscle.
column8: 4) [[francajun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/francajun)] 30-3-2012(16): To **move** something heavy, you need muscles.
column9: 5) [[sskaggs](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sskaggs)] 15-11-2012(12): Everyone knows that (Force x Mass= acceleration), and as is typical when converting western expressions to eastern expressions this kanji gives us the same equation in reverse order and pictorialized: (Heavy x Muscle = **Move** ). ,-p easy peasy.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(74): A **tumor** is a useless _body part_ that is nothing but _heavy_.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 19-1-2010(18): The world's _heaviest_ **tumor** ever removed from a human body was a 300-pound stomach **tumor** , removed in 1991 in Stanford Hospital. Now that's a _heavy body part_!
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 19-1-2007(17): When _flesh_ clumps together and gets _heavy_ , it forms a **tumor**.
column8: 4) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 14-2-2008(6): You've got a **tumor** on your _flesh_? That's _heavy_ , man.
column9: 5) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 17-12-2011(2): The FLESH of a **TUMOR** is HEAVIER than normal FLESH.

column3: _Move_ . . . _oven fire_. So as not to confuse this kanji with the general character for _merit_ (Frame 1369), you may associate the key word with military decorations and medals of distinction, both of which it is used for.
column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 14-4-2007(188): A **meritorious deed**? Like moving a damsel in distress out of a fire, maybe.
column6: 2) [[lunairejam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lunairejam)] 9-10-2007(66): Prometheus did a meritous deed for humanity by MOVING FIRE from the gods to us humans.
column7: 3) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 4-1-2009(39): Oskar Schindler is best remembered for his **meritorious deed** : moving 1200 Jews to his factory so that they could be saved from the fires of Auschwitz.
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 3-4-2010(33): (from Raichu) The classic **meritorious deed** is saving a damsel in distress from a burning building. You hear her sweet voice crying "help! help!" from inside. But when you get inside, you see that she's quite heavy… you'll need some muscles for this deed.
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 21-1-2007(9): You get a medal if you do some **meritorious deed** in combat. When the shooting starts, some freeze and cannot _move_. The normal ones can move under _fire_. But the REAL medal winners are the ones that move over _flames_!. Not that is a **meritorious deed**!

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(149): _Mr. T_ 's real line of **work** is for a _moving_ company.
column6: 2) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 12-6-2007(60): Mr T, move. Mr Ts new exercise video called "Work it suckaz". Here is shouting "move it **work** it move **work** it!".
column7: 3) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 23-4-2008(41): A person who moves something is doing **work** , physically speaking.
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 30-12-2008(10): _Luke Skywalker_ had to **work** hard to become a jedi, being forced to _move_ an X-Wing with his mind before leaving Dagobah.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 16-10-2005(8): In his poor days, _Mister T_ , thanks to his healthy build, used to **work** as a (furniture) _mover_ (Br. "removal man"). He _worked_ 7/7 days, since when he wasn't _moving_ furniture, he was _working_ out !

column5: 1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 28-6-2007(158): After the whole low-carb craze, scientists developed a new low-carb **species** of _wheat_ , so that dieters could eat it without getting _heavier_.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 17-8-2008(155): This kanji also means "Seed." STORY: Scientists have developed a new **SPECIES** of WHEAT that has large HEAVY seeds. Now we can feed the world.
column7: 3) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 31-8-2007(41): The _heavy wheat_ is a special type or **species** of wheat used to fatten livestock.
column8: 4) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-5-2008(14): This is also the word for **seed**. Wheat seeds are sorted by how heavy they are.
column9: 5) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 18-1-2007(10): The hot chick from **Species** has been eating a lot of _bread_ lately, and she's really gotten _heavy_.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(208): Two _heavy trucks_ in a game of chicken **collide** while racing toward each other on the _boulevard_.
column6: 2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 13-11-2009(41): Something _heavy_ rolling down the middle of the _boulevard_ is definitely going to end up **colliding** with something.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 20-2-2008(36): 衝 【しょう】 (n) (1) important point (e.g. on a route), (2) important role (responsibility, etc.), (3) (astronomical) opposition. STORY:Two HEAVY trucks are playing a game of chicken on the BOULEVARD. However, they both missed the IMPORTANT POINT: that they have to turn in different directions. Naturally, they **COLLIDE** when they both turn in the same direction. (ty dingomick).
column8: 4) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 29-5-2008(19): Two heavy sumo wrestlers, in normal clothing while shopping, see each other at opposite sides of the boulevard and suddenly get in their stance and charge at each other until they **collide** , knocking everyone else out of the way.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 21-1-2009(17): The LHC (Large Hadron **Collider** ) is as wide as a _boulevard_ and so _heavy_ that machinery had to be used to assemble the pieces.

column3: _Flowers_ . . . _heavy_ . . . _oven fire_. Do not confuse with _incense_ (Frame 977) or _perfumed_ (Frame 532).
column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 19-12-2006(230): Do you know how they make those **FRAGRANT** air fresheners? Well you take some FLOWERS, compress them with a HEAVY weight, and put them on an OVEN FIRE for a while… (cmp [perfume](../v4/493.html) (#493 芳)).
column6: 2) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 16-3-2008(46): The heavier the flowers the stronger their fragrance when you burn them.
column7: 3) [[squeaky_lill_mk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/squeaky_lill_mk)] 15-8-2010(30): These _flowers_ emit very _heavy_ **fragrance** when burned _over the fire_ (e.g. the **fragrant** jasmine flowers).
column8: 4) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 10-6-2008(24): (クン) Steve Jobs does it again. This heavy duty mac computer has a place for flowers on top. When the computer heats up (the fire on the bottom), the flowers release a beautiful **fragrant** smell.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(13): As the _heavy duty truck_ smolders in _flames_ , the **fragrant** smell of _flowers_ is emitted from the pine tree air freshener still hanging from the rear-view mirror.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 24-12-2007(239): _Caveman_ got **ill** after flying _third class_. The cabin air and food got to him. (Primitive: these all got MUCH easier when using _CAVEMAN_ instead. ).
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 5-2-2007(59): If you hang around a _third class_ hospital, you'll get **ill** with the _sickness_ everyone else has.
column7: 3) [[yorkii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yorkii)] 2-7-2006(27): Note: according to this <http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/>~jwb/cgi- bin/wwwhalsod.cgi?3277_%C9%C2 the stroke order is different to that presented in the Heisig book. 4th and 5th strokes are reversed.
column8: 4) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 12-7-2009(25): I have this female friend who complains about _third class_ type stuff a lot. She'll say stuff like ''That train ride made me **ill**. Seriously,'' and ''Oh my god, sitting next that dirty guy made me **ill**. Seriously.'' Sometimes I just want to kick her in the cunt.
column9: 5) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 28-2-2007(22): Hint: The **ill** in **ill** almost looks like the roman numeral **III**. Use as a hint to 3rd class. The **ill** are more abundant in _third class_ countries ( _third world_ ).

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(206): Of course _caveman_ is **stupid**. He doesn't _know_ anything. He's a _caveman_!
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-1-2006(130): This kanji shows **stupid** ity as a " _knowledge-sickness_ ". Everybody can be **stupid** at times, and it usually happens because of a lack of experience. Hence the **stupid** ity is a " _knowledge sickness_ ".
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 6-5-2008(67): Ever since reading dingomick's story, I've had this dialogue stuck in my head when I come across the keyword: " _Caveman_ not **stupid** , _Caveman_ _know_ things.".
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 9-10-2008(8): You mean you didn't _know_ you'd get _sick_ living in an _icy cave_? Are you **stupid**?
column9: 5) [[ellasevia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ellasevia)] 24-7-2010(6): **Stupidity** is a common _illness_ that afflicts everyone. It is said to cause a lack of _knowledge_.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(158): _Caveman_ has horrible **pox**. They look like edamame _beans_ oozing bight green paste.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 12-9-2006(137): **Pox** is a _sickness_ which symptoms include _bean_ -shaped bumps on the skin.
column7: 3) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 12-7-2009(15): _Mr. Bean_ tries to explain to the _caveman_ that he is covered in chicken **pox** and not to come near him, but the _caveman_ misunderstands and eats him. "THIS CHICKEN **POX** NOT TASTE GOOD.".
column8: 4) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 24-1-2008(8): **Pox** is a very contagious _sickness_ , you'll get it just by sitting at the same table as someone infected.
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 26-1-2010(6): The _Geico caveman_ gets chicken **pox**. The doctor says the only cure is to take a bath in _baked beans_.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-8-2007(193): Once you have all the **symptoms** right, you have _correctly_ identified the _sickness_.
column6: 2) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 28-6-2006(74): A _sickness_ can only be _correctly_ diagnosed if the **symptoms** are identified _correctly_.
column7: 3) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 15-5-2008(69): One of the **SYMPTOMS** of being a CAVEMAN is you don't get much CORRECT in a test.
column8: 4) [[samesong](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samesong)] 8-10-2008(43): Doctor: "let's go over your **symptoms** , _caveman_., shall we? Do you have a stuffy nose?" Caveman: "correct". Doctor: "Does your throat hurt?" Caveman: "correct". Doctor: "well, caveman, it sounds like you have a cold!".
column9: 5) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 9-12-2007(7): Checking the **symptoms** helps to identify the _correct_ _sickness_.

column5: 1) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 27-6-2010(44): The witches _piggy bank_ was cursed with a spell causing any thief who stole it's contents to fall ill. The _illness_ would result in the victim being covered from head to toe in a mass of **carbuncles**. Crime doesn't pay!
column6: 2) [[Asayoru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asayoru)] 10-11-2010(19): _Caveman_ has to open up his _piggy bank_ to receive treatment for his monstrous **carbuncle**.
column7: 3) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 25-1-2011(5): His _sickness_ caused numerous **carbuncle** s, which when emptied by the doctors also emptied his _piggy bank_.
column8: 4) [[Puchatek](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Puchatek)] 9-8-2011(4): In this kanji the _Caveman_ has a _piggy bank_ -shaped **carbuncle** under his skin. Hmm, well, at least it looks kind of unique.
column9: 5) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 2-6-2010(4): There goes the lonely miser, all covered in **CARBUNCLE** s. The local lore says that his hideous _ILLNESS_ is divine retribution for his avarice: the **CARBUNCLE** s are said to be shaped like _PIGGY BANK_ s!

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(87): The _sickness_ that only allows you to eat _monkey crotch_ will surely make you **lose weight**.
column6: 2) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 16-8-2009(34): _Caveman_ want to **lose weight** … but not know how. He sees a lean _monkey_ playing with its _crotch_. Ah! So that's how I **lose weight** , and he imitates the monkey.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 17-2-2010(17): Simian Immunodeficiency Virus, the precursor to HIV, is a _sickness_ that is transmitted by carnal knowledge of a _monkey's crotch_. Naturally, it causes one to **lose weight**. _Cavemen_ used to catch it all the time.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 27-3-2007(15): The poor _monkey_ obviously had a _sickness_. He was scratching his _crotch_ the whole time and when he started to **lose weight** heavily, the caretakers knew they couldn't save him anymore.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 12-5-2012(7): The most horrific way to **lose weight** is from that devastating sickness that came from a monkey's crotch.

column3: Be sure to keep this character distinct from _quick_ (Frame 1799) and _swift_ (Frame 298). Picture a succession of poison _darts_ (the sort that inflict _sickness_ ) flying out **rapid** -fire from a blowgun, so that " **rapid** -fire" can conjure up the proper image.
column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 30-5-2007(187): I picture a sick caveman, and two people **rapidly** blowing darts at him. One is blowing poison darts, the other is blowing antidote darts. Will the sick caveman live or die? Depends on how **rapidly** they fire.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-10-2008(88): If shot with a _poison dart_ , _sickness_ develops **rapidly**.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 4-2-2008(48): Hm, it's getting tougher to differentiate similar kanji: [swift](../v4/280.html) (#280 迅), [hurry](../v4/1146.html) (#1146 急), [quick](../v4/1669.html) (#1669 速). Let's consider **rapidly** as a **rapid** -fire weapon: rat-tat-tat-tat-tat- tat. This weapon fires poison _darts_ **rapidly** in an automatic rapid-fire fashion. The poison darts are not lethal, they merely induce _sickness_ in the victims.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-4-2007(18): The _sick caveman_ is deteriorating **rapidly** from the **rapid** -fire gun that shot hime with _sickening_ poison _darts_.
column9: 5) [[bokuzukuri](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bokuzukuri)] 30-1-2006(9): See book.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 1-3-2007(90): If you go through _women_ _rapidly_ you will be the object of **envy**.
column6: 2) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 19-3-2008(42): Ah, puberty … the girl that starts her journey towards _womanhood_ the most _rapidly_ will become the subject of **envy** from all her classmates.
column7: 3) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 19-2-2010(12): **Envy** (from FMA) is a boy homunculus (though a bit androgynous), but when they dubbed FMA to English, they somehow snipped his pickle and turned him into a _girl_. Wave of protests from hardcore fans emerged _rapidly_.
column8: 4) [[Puchatek](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Puchatek)] 9-8-2011(9): _Women_ get envious very rapidly. Picture one _woman_ walking into a party in a gorgeous dress, and all other _women_ there rapidly getting envious of her beautiful dress.
column9: 5) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 27-4-2008(6): WOMEN are full of **envy**. It's a Cupid thing– when one is hit with a dart of love, another's hit with a dart of **envy** , a kind of sickness that RAPIDLY infects everything she does.

column5: 1) [[nac_est](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nac_est)] 7-9-2007(235): For a country full of pay-per-use public toilets, sudden **diarrhea** is certainly the most _profitable sickness_!
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-4-2007(86): _Caveman_ doesn't have any skills, so he sells his **diarrhea** as _chili_ to peasant wheat farmers for an amazing _profit_.
column7: 3) [[walexander5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/walexander5)] 6-9-2008(38): **Diarrhea** is a _sickness_ that makes _wheat_ go through me like a _saber_.
column8: 4) [[zer0range](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zer0range)] 20-4-2009(34): 1. Give Caveman **diarrhea** 2\. ??? 3. PROFIT!
column9: 5) [[ycomnougue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ycomnougue)] 11-7-2009(21): _Caveman_ sells his **diarrhea** to McDonalds so they can make shit burgers. The _caveman_ turns a huge _profit_ from his _sickness_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 10-10-2007(61): I suffer from _silver-sickness_ , that is, if anything made of silver even touches my skin it leaves a **scar**.
column6: 2) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 18-9-2010(32): _Caveman_ has a **scar** because he was shot with a _silver_ bullet when he was mistaken for a werewolf.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 6-8-2009(7): I got _sick_ and needed surgery, but the _silver_ lining is that now I have these awesome **scar** s I can show off!
column8: 4) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 22-10-2007(5): _silver_ nitrate will burn away _sick_ tissue, but it will leave a **scar**. (<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silver_nitrate#Medicine>).
column9: 5) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 30-8-2009(3): That silverware had cut my skin, it got infected and i fell ill and even when it healed it left a permanent **scar**.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 30-5-2007(208): I picture an **exhausted** _sick caveman_ snuggling up in a _comfy pelt blanket_.
column6: 2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 12-10-2006(97): Your body feels **tired** when you have a sickness. All you want to do is wrap yourself up in a nice warm pelt and get better.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-4-2007(34): _Caveman_ was **tired** after hauling mammoth _pelts_ all day.
column8: 4) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 2-4-2009(29): Being **tired** is a simple _sickness_ that can treated by covering oneself with a _pelt_ and resting well! (Thanks inuki).
column9: 5) [[atarakushi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atarakushi)] 22-6-2010(12): I'm _sick_ and **tired** of all these motherf~~ing _pelts_ in all these motherf~~ing kanji.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 12-10-2005(191): _Sickness-missiles_ are being engineered by bio-terrorists to spread **epidemic** s all over the world. Imagine seeing footage of a place where those _sickness-missiles_ are built : rows after rows of _missiles_ , and if you look closely on each is inscribed in tiny letters the name of different _sickness_ such as "flu", "plague", etc.
column6: 2) [[Chadokoro_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Chadokoro_K)] 18-8-2007(69): SICKNESS / MISSILE ** Hint: True fact about biochemical warfare: in the medieval and ancient world, SICKNESS in the form of the corpses of those who had died from some **EPIDEMIC** or plague were often hurled at the enemy via the crude MISSILE launchers of the time. [C].
column7: 3) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 15-5-2008(39): When CAVEMAN first fashions a primitive MISSILE and kills a mammoth with it, the technique spreads like an **EPIDEMIC** across the inhabited world.
column8: 4) [[delenir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delenir)] 9-12-2009(14): An **EPIDEMIC** is a SICKNESS that hits like MISSLES.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 21-5-2009(12): When a _sick caveman_ sneezes, the germs shoot out of his mouth like a _missile_. Ironically, this biological _missile_ is much more deadly than any spear the _caveman_ could throw, especially if it results in an **epidemic**.

column5: 1) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 6-7-2008(192): The CAVEMAN felt such a **pain** after his POGO STICK got stuck in his butt.
column6: 2) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 3-12-2007(44): When I was feeling _sick_ my mum said I shouldn't go out to play on my _pogo stick_ until I felt better. Well I wasn't strong enough to stay up on it and so fell over and have the **pain** to prove my mum right.
column7: 3) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 29-10-2007(17): _Caveman_ feels no **pain** (since he was frozen for so long his **pain** sensors are numbed). Here we see some kids using a _pogo stick_ to jump on his hand.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 14-2-2008(14): Think of the phrase **pain** in the xxx. Then think of a _pogostick_ up your xxx. That's **pain** ful, right? The real question is why a _pogostick_ is up your xxx. That's _sick_ , dude.
column9: 5) [[cheechuan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cheechuan)] 14-6-2008(11): It causes me great **pain** to _utilize_ my _chopseal_ to pay for all of my wife's bills due to her shopping _sickness_.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(190): _Caveman_ has a bad **mannerism** of putting _ketchup_ on everything he eats. I guess that's ok since raw mammoth can't be too good…
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-9-2006(111): This **mannerism** is a _sickness_ of the modern generation. It was only recently that we started putting _ketchup_ on everything.
column7: 3) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 12-12-2006(37): Building on inuki's idea: Monk, who suffers from OCD (a _sickness_ involving **mannerisms** ) sees a row of _ketchup_ bottles at a restaurant crime scene and spends twenty minutes making the Heinz labels face exactly the same direction.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 4-2-2008(13): Sufferer from OCD (a _sickness_ involving **mannerisms** ) places thousands of drops of ketchup on his food in intricate patterns.
column9: 5) [[bizarrojosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bizarrojosh)] 25-12-2009(8): A SICK **MANNERISM** is putting KETCHUP on everything.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(280): _Young_ kids likes to **hide** in _cardboard boxes_. (Primitive: _CARDBOARD BOX_ , especially kids playing with them.).
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 28-7-2007(61): Note that stroke order with _box_ primitive is as follows: first horizontal line, then enclosed element, and then a hook (it's incorrect in 4th edition).
column7: 3) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 10-6-2009(35): This kanji doesn't really mean **hide** in the sense of **hide** and seek. It is more towards the meaning of hiding one's identity. ————————–AKA **anonymity** ———– Schools are getting so strict now about personal identity, that they make _young_ children keep **anonymity** by making them wear _cardboard_ boxes over there heads.
column8: 4) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 12-6-2008(16): Primitive = Solid Snake. _Solid Snake_ **hide** s in a _cardboard box_ so he wont be detected. He's loved hiding in boxes ever since he was _young_.
column9: 5) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 3-5-2008(5): When I was YOUNG I used to play to **hide** and seek ….Everything was good for that : even and old BOX . I was quite innocent at that time …. Later I learned games of adult : especially lies and conceal one's feelings…. NB : In order to avoid confusion with [conceal](../v4/1313.html) (#1313 隠) **hide** is given a material meaning while conceal will be more intellectual …. The background of youth strenghten this conception.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(178): Most people don't know that one of the most revered **artisan** s in Japan preserves the ancient art of cutting _cardboard boxes_ with an _ax_.
column6: 2) [[sarek05](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sarek05)] 3-10-2008(62): The axe murderer considered himself an **artisan** for how his tastefully chopped up his victims and arranged their remains artfully in boxes.
column7: 3) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 21-3-2006(44): We here have the axe-man who's an **artisan** at making sculptures with his axe… The only thing is, he never shows anyone, keeping all his sculptures inside a box down in the basement. He doesn't want any attention.
column8: 4) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 29-9-2006(30): Hint: **Artisan** /Ax Def: An **artisan** is a skilled manual worker, a craftsperson. Here we see his tools represented by the **artisan** 's _ax_ stored in his tool _box_.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 23-1-2010(13): The tool _box_ of the **artisan** has an _axe_ within.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(269): The **doctor** puts the _cardboard box_ on his head and throws a _dart_ at a chart to determine his patients' illnesses.
column6: 2) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 7-11-2007(72): This **DOCTOR** prefers to use DARTS instead of syringes for injections. Here, he pulls out his BOX of DARTS, and the child on the examination table squirms.
column7: 3) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 31-7-2009(42): The **doctor** is tired of seeing one patient after another wanting vaccinations, so he steps into the waiting room with a big _box_ full of _darts_ loaded with the medicine. Bam, bam, bam, all done.
column8: 4) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 28-7-2008(17): A **doctor** is someone who keeps a _box_ full of poison- _dart_ -like syringes. (Careful not to mix up with [Dr.](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/47) (#47 博), from waaay back in lesson 3. This is "doctor" as a profession, where as "Dr." is a title.).
column9: 5) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 24-1-2009(13): This **doctor** is carrying her _syringes_ around in a nice portable _cardboard box_.

column5: 1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 26-2-2008(176): This kanji is used commonly as a **counter for small animals**. This is a pictograph of a SMALL ANIMAL'S view from inside a CARDBOARD BOX looking out at his masters HUMAN LEGS. He's probably hiding so the master does not COUNT him with the other animals which will probably be eaten (thus he avoids everyones **EQUAL** fate on the farm: the kitchen table).
column6: 2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 21-7-2008(97): Put a _box_ over everyone's heads, letting only the _legs_ show, and we all look pretty much **equal**.
column7: 3) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 30-6-2006(58): Imagine a magician doing that trick where he puts his assistant in a _box_ and proceeds to saw her in half. Don’t the _human legs_ sticking horizontally out of the _box_ remind you of an **equal** sign?
column8: 4) [[alantin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alantin)] 10-7-2008(32): Four minus one stroke is **equal** to..?
column9: 5) [[Tzadeck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tzadeck)] 16-8-2009(28): _4 - 1_ **=** this kanji.

column3: The **ward** referred to here is a subdivision of a large city. Its elements: _box_ . . . _sheaves_. When used as a primitive element, it may be helpful at times to break it up into these same composite elements.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(175): That's the homeless **ward** of the city. _Wolverine_ lives in a _cardboard box_ there.
column6: 2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 31-1-2006(33): In the **ward** office the _sheaves_ of paper of the **ward** registration forms are kept in a _box_.
column7: 3) [[dusmar84](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dusmar84)] 1-2-2010(26): In the Akihabara **ward** , it is mandated that every resident own an X-BOX (well more like a PS3 but you get the point).
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 6-3-2008(14): This is a special **ward** at the hospital for bad crops, where the farmers gently bring in their _sheaves_ tucked away in little _boxes_ for treatment, the poor things.
column9: 5) [[henroski](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/henroski)] 7-6-2008(10): X man lives in a small BOX apartment in Shibuya **WARD**.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(133): The **hinge** on _Wolverine's_ _cardboard box_ is made of wood because he doesn't have enough budget to buy metal **hinge** s.
column6: 2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 2-9-2008(101): You notice a **hinge** on a _tree_ and realize there's a secret door. You open it up to find an _Xbox_!!!
column7: 3) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 25-6-2006(47): The **hinge** in this hospital _ward_ was made of _wood_ because they didn't have enough budget to buy metal **hinge** s.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 5-4-2009(32): I like using "X Box" as the primitive instead of ward. The first _X Box_ had a lot of problems. I guess Microsoft was in a hurry to get it out. I even noticed that the **hinge** s were made of _wood_ … what the hell?
column9: 5) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 22-4-2007(17): Make sure you install the **hinge** the right way. If it opens _treeward_ (= _tree_ _ward_ ), you won't be able to get the fence open, make sure it opens houseward.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(152): The city decides to disperse the _homeless ward_ with a precision _missile_ **assault**. They didn't know _Wolverine_ was living in a _cardboard box_ there though…
column6: 2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 19-2-2008(56): The biggest **assault** on Japan during WW2 is when the _wards_ in Hiroshima and Nagasaki were wiped out by nuclear _missiles_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(28): In this hospital _ward_ , the personnel is **assault** ed by _missiles_. Think of a _ward_ where crazy old people **assault** the personnel because they don't like the food, they don't want to take their medicines, they want to go home, etc. The patients use whatever they can get their hands on as _missiles_.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 5-4-2009(24): Kids these days are just **assault** ed by violent games. Just look at these _X-Box_ games - they all have _missiles_ in them! Even Barbie Horse Adventure!
column9: 5) [[jmcanally](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jmcanally)] 7-2-2010(15): Best game of the year award goes to…. MISSLE **ASSAULT** for the XBOX! What a great game :-D.

column3: _Ward_ . . . _yawn_. Like the kanji of frame 1776, this character is an abbreviation of the name of a geographical region.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(134): " **Europe**? _Yawn…_ I've been to every _ward_ (country/area)," says _Wolverine_ interviewed from his _cardboard box_.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 28-6-2007(117): [Europe] _X-Box_ was first released in America and Japan (the biggest videogame markets). **Europe** had an _X-Box_ _lack_ for a while…
column7: 3) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 11-6-2008(65): Do japanese consider **Europe** like just a _ward_ , boring enough to make them _yawn_?? This kanji is offensive!
column8: 4) [[kodama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodama)] 30-10-2007(28): The **EU** _lacks_ separate economic _wards_.
column9: 5) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 5-4-2009(23): The _X-Box_ wasn't a big hit in **Europe**. They took one look at it and collectively _yawn_ ed.

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 12-9-2006(193): A true _stamp_ collecting nerd won't be able to **repress** the urge to get his _fingers_ on the latest _box_ of collector _stamps_!
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 10-8-2007(102): They would **repress** dissents by cutting off their _fingers_ and mailing them to relatives in _small boxes_ (of course including _stamps_ for proper postage).
column7: 3) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 12-4-2008(49): A chikan (bus-molester) tries to **repress** his _finger_ -groping desire by refusing to travel by bus anymore. Instead, he seals himself in a _box_ , makes sure there are enough _postage stamps_ on the outside, and mails himself. He's a good man at heart , you see… just a bit of a slave to his libido. (I suggest using this same Chikan as the primitive for the "box and stamp" combo on the right side of this kanji, which come up more than once later on).
column8: 4) [[jajaaan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jajaaan)] 30-12-2009(29): I'm just gonna say what we're all thinking. Young women work hard to **repress** their urges to put their _fingers_ in their _boxes_ because if their mothers found out, they could be _stamped_ with a big WHORE stamp across their faces for the rest of their lives. Such a stamping is avoided by severe **repression**.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 29-12-2006(15): The right side is a rabbit ( 卯 ) that has lost one ear. He (I'm thinking of a cartoony rabbit who has lost the ear in some battle with an enemy) has to **repress** (concretely, with his fingers!) his urge to revenge, which is hard to contain in his little head.

column3: This character is used both for lying on one's back **faceup** , and for looking up to someone with respect and awe. Its elements: _person_ . . . _box_ . . . _stamps_.
column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 28-7-2007(139): All _stamps_ in _Mr T_ 's collection _box_ are lied carefully **face-up**.
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 29-2-2008(128): Mr T with the post package at the post office: 'these stamps don't stick to the box, foo' Postguy:' Try it again but this time with the stamp, **face-up**.'.
column7: 3) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 12-9-2006(26): _Chuck Norris_ always plays poker with his cards **face-up** because he can't be beat anyway. Try and cheat and you'll end up the recipient of a roundhouse kick to the head and will leave the room in a _box_ with a _stamp_ addressed to the local morge.
column8: 4) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 12-10-2006(21): A person who is a _stamp_ collector has all of the _stamps_ **face-up** in their box.
column9: 5) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 29-3-2008(16): If you're using "chikan" for the small box + stamp primitive, here's a story for you: chikan's trip in the small box with the stamps all over it is getting boring… good thing he's laying **face-up** though and has a flashlight with him, because he's pasted pictures of Mr. T to the roof of the box. That's his idol who he looks up to in awe, and never grows tired of looking at him (this covers both meanings Heisig mentioned).

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(164): _Stamp-collectors_ sit and wait on the _road_ to **welcome** new mail arrivals.
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 11-7-2007(43): The stamp collector goes out to the _road_ to **welcome** the arrival of his new _stamp box_.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 1-1-2009(36): I found a _small stamped box_ on the _road_ , and figured it wouldn't hurt to open it. As I opened it, I pricked myself on a small needle. Thinking nothing of it, I unfolded a note that read " **Welcome** to the AIDS club!". Fuck!
column8: 4) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 15-11-2006(16): I **welcome** the _box from Amazon_ (a _box_ with _stamps_ on it) that has come a long _way_.
column9: 5) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 18-7-2010(13): Even though she was homeless and living in a _box_ along the _road_ , she _stamp_ ed her "home" with the word " **welcome** ". Hospitality can be found in the humblest of abodes.

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 9-5-2006(283): When an American Indian warrior dies, his body is placed on a TABLE inside a TEEPEE, and a ritualistic ceremony is held to encourage his spirit to **ASCEND** to that big buffalo hunting ground in the sky.
column6: 2) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 4-6-2006(95): When I was a kid I went out camping in a teepee. I ate beans for dinner, and afterwards I produced so much gas that my teepee actually **ascend** ed in the air!
column7: 3) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 28-7-2007(57): Stroke order for _teepee_ primitive is incorrect (in 4th edition), 3rd and 4th strokes should be reversed.
column8: 4) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 25-4-2010(34): _Mr Bean_ **ascend** s a _teepee_ , which then collapses, flattening the American Indians trapped inside.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(22): The smell of a _bean_ fart **ascend** s up, up and out the top of the _teepee_.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 8-11-2007(276): Scuba divers know that when you _ascend_ in the _water_ , your **lucidity** increases (For non-divers, the deeper you go, the more you become mentally impaired by nitrogen narcosis, every 50 feet is like drinking one martini). Scuba divers also know that as you _ascend_ in the _water_ , the **lucidity** of the _water_ improves, too.
column6: 2) [[crayonmaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crayonmaster)] 6-7-2009(26): Lucid dreams allow me to control what is happening. In a drowning nightmare, I forced **lucidity** and allowed myself ascend to the surface.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(22): A few _drops of acid/peyote_ and the Indians obtain **lucidity** on their vision quest, as if they were floating in the **lucid** sky.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-1-2006(12): The keyword refers to limpid _water_ , but also to something that is clear (as in "crystal clear"). In Buddhism the thinking mind is often compared to a pond : if you stir the _water_ , the mud from the bottom mixes with the water, and the mind is "muddy". To attain **lucidity** , one has to let the mud settle, or as in this kanji, take a shortcut and just _ascend_ through the _water_.
column9: 5) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 22-2-2008(9): This kanji is also used for CLEAR WEATHER. Imagine the RAIN/WATER ASCENDING back up into the sky, and the clouds floating away, giving you CLEAR WEATHER. (it's like hitting rewind).

column3: This key word refers to the **discharging** of guns, trains, people, and even words. The elements: _teepee_ . . . _two_ . . . _human legs_. Contrast the writing with frame 63.
column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 13-4-2008(207): I spent some time in her TEEPEE…just the TWO of us…but I looked between her HUMAN LEGS and I saw a nasty **DISCHARGE** …so I made my 出発 rather hastily.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 25-4-2008(101): _Two pairs of human legs_ poking out of a _teepee_ : you know there'll be a **discharge** soon, be it sexual, violent (husband returns home with a weapon), or dishonourable (soldier caught molesting a native), or perhaps all of the above.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(61): The indian chief went into his _teepee_ and found his wife sleeping with a cowboy. He **discharged** his gun at the _two_ people, and left with their _legs_ **discharging** out the door.
column8: 4) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 27-1-2010(32): The soldier was dishonorably **discharge** d when his commanding officer saw _two pairs of legs_ sticking out of a _teepee_ designed for just one soldier.
column9: 5) [[lanval](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lanval)] 14-4-2009(10): Hier sieht man den Akt, der neues Leben **hervorbringen** kann: Ein _Tipi_ , und _zwei_ Paar _Menschenbeine_ ineinander verschlungen.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 9-11-2006(205): I think _discharging_ nuclear weapons should be **abolish** ed. That includes underground tests in _caves_. You listening Kim Jong-il?
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(76): Guns were **abolish** ed, so gun enthusiats left for the hills to _discharge_ their guns in _caves_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-9-2008(48): _Discharging_ guns in _caves_ was **abolish** ed because the ricochets were causing too many injuries.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 5-2-2008(25): When slavery was **abolish** ed, defiant slave owners knew they had lost the war but as an act of spite herded up all their slaves into a remote _cave_ and killed them all by _discharging_ bullets into their heads. (The dead bodies then _discharged_ various substances/fluids as voluntary muscle control was suddenly gone.).
column9: 5) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 7-5-2008(14): Slaves have been _discharged_ from the _caves_ where they were kept thanks to the **abolition** of slavery.

column3: _Person_ . . . _pup tent_. Choose some connotation of the key word that will keep it distinct for you from _companion_ (Frame 19), _friend_ (Frame 760), _consort_ (Frame 1287), and _comrade_ (Frame 1765).
column5: 1) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 18-6-2009(134): Trivia: The right primitive is _kagaribi_ \- 尞 - _fuel used for sacrifices_. I would use _sacred bonfire_ as a primitive . (Mnemonic: Top is a merged image of _big_ and _fire_ \- _big sacred bonfire_ that looks like _little sun_ ). Story: Your **colleague** got fired literally… in a _sacred bonfire_ by Mr.T.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 16-2-2007(100): Some businesses allow pets in the office. Here, my **colleague** is _Mr T_ and he set up a little _pup tent_ for his minidog, then turns around and completes his TPS reports.
column7: 3) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 26-6-2006(80): Mr. T began working in a japanese compagny. As he sees that his **colleague** accept to do some extra work during the week-end and even sleep at the office, he says to them: "I pity da fool who work during week-end! You might as well install a pup tent in the office and forget about your home".
column8: 4) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 11-6-2008(20): (リョウ) When Ned ( _insert male person here_ ) gets a _pup tent_ (i.e. a woody), he calls it his "colleague." (again, sorry for the crudeness of many of my stories).
column9: 5) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 30-9-2006(15): A **colleague** implies someone that you share work with, such as in your company or profession, etc. Here your **colleague** helps you to erect your _pup tent_ during a company outing. Note: **Heisig's warning** to keep this distinct from other similiar kanji such as [companion](../v4/19.html) (#19 朋), [friend](../v4/704.html) (#704 友), [consort](../v4/1203.html) (#1203 伴) and [comrade](../v4/1637.html) (#1637 輩). That is why I chose to have the _person_ element pictured as someone (the **colleague** in this case) helping with the work of building the _pup tent_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-3-2007(58): I paint a huge _eye_ on the side of my _pup tent_. Why? – It’s **obvious** : when I’m at the camping site it makes it **obvious** which tent is mine so I can quickly locate it.
column6: 2) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 18-2-2012(16): RevTKers please, open your _eye_ s!! That's not a puptent you see! It's _kagaribi_ (尞), fuel used for sacrifices. I know it wasn't **obvious** at first, but I hope it's clear to you now! :D.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 6-3-2010(10): It's **obvious** that the _pup tent_ with a huge _eye_ on the side belongs to the dark lord Sauron.
column8: 4) [[fastgolfball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fastgolfball)] 1-10-2010(9): It is **obvious** that you shouldn't be staring into _sacred bonfires_ with your _eyes_.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 21-1-2007(6): Open your _eyes_ , it's **obvious** that not all of us can fit into that small _puptent_!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-11-2007(126): This guy would rather use his _pup-tent_ as a _house_ , than sleep in the **dormitory**. So he effectively turned that _pup-tent_ into a _house_ by getting a postal address for it etc. (just to emphasize house).
column6: 2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 23-11-2006(62): All- male **dormitories** in Japan are really weird, and tend to have a little too much 男気 . Here is a trick they play where if they find that one dorm member has pitched a " _pup tent_ " while sleeping, they make it into a _house_ by putting a little roof on top of it – complete with a lit cigarette for a chimney – and wait for the "fun" to start (fun meaning…lighting their friend's genitals on fire).
column7: 3) [[mfistik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mfistik)] 18-9-2007(48): A **dormitory** room has the same characteristics of a pup tent, meaning that it's small and usually sleeps two people (you and your room mate), however you have an actual roof over your head.
column8: 4) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 18-6-2009(37): To please gods and pass next exams you set a whole **dormitory** ( _house_ ) afire. Wow! What a _sacred bonfire_!
column9: 5) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 22-2-2008(14): A **DORMITORY** HOUSE has all the same characteristics as a PUP TENT, smelly, old, cramped, etc.

column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 24-3-2010(162): In Final Fantasy 4, sleeping in a tent completely **heal** s you and recovers all your HP and MP (and cures any _sickness_ your characters may have).
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 29-2-2008(64): Sick caveman has to sleep in his pup tent. Not the cave because to humid and cold but a nice small pup tent in the sun will **heal** him from his cold.
column7: 3) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 9-5-2006(35): There’s nothing like a little getting away from it all, pitching a PUP-TENT in a scenic place, kicking back, relaxing and drinking in nature’s beautiful medicine. It’s a great way to **HEAL** the SICKNESSes of modern life that afflict us.
column8: 4) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 18-6-2009(29): The _sick caveman_ asks gods to **heal** him (from a hangover) and sets a _sacred bonfire_ in his cave.
column9: 5) [[Delina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Delina)] 9-2-2009(21): On the battlefield, the only place to **heal** from your _sickness_ is inside the medic's _pup tent_. Think of M.A.S.H.

column3: The two primitives here, _circumference_ and _shape_ , belong naturally to the special connotations that differentiate **carving** from _engraving_ (see frame 1639).
column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(187): Start with a _circumference_ and **carve** away until you get the _shape_ you want.
column6: 2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 18-12-2006(74): [My primitive for _shape_ is Mystique, the shape-shifter from X-Men.] _Mystique_ the shape-shifter **carve** s obscure markings around the _circumfrence_ of her blue body.
column7: 3) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 20-7-2008(65): (Primitive: _shape_ \- when you were three you played with _Play-Doh_.) 彫 : Did anyone else use the _circumference_ of the _Play-Doh_ container to **carve** circular _shapes_?
column8: 4) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 25-4-2010(38): HINT: There are a lot of good stories on this website using Bruce Lee as a primitive for [sign of the dragon](../v4/2008.html) (#2008 辰), so you may want to avoid using him for shape. Mystique works well, as suggested by ayoung24.
column9: 5) [[Uncreativity](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Uncreativity)] 28-1-2010(15): HINT: To help me remember that 彡 leans the opposite way as ミ, I am calling that primitive _my evil twin_. It's _mi_ from the mirror universe. You can also think of it as the three strokes of my evil twin's goatee. STORY: I know the witness saw me **carve** the entire _circumference_ of the victim's skin, but it wasn't me, officer, it was _my evil twin_.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 31-5-2007(147): Everyone in the kindergarten came up with fun and interesting **shape** s made out of _Play-Doh_ , except for the kid with the amputated arm. Seems like you _really need both hands_.
column6: 2) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 19-3-2008(78): With your _two hands_ , outline the _shape_ of a curvaceous woman. Is that a universally understood gesture? [Careful: [mould](../v4/680.html) (#680 型) which has two hands and soil/clay].
column7: 3) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 6-12-2007(63): _Mystique_ is in great **shape**! I wanna run my _two hands_ over the **shape** of her body.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 19-11-2006(35): Of coure, a sculptor needs _both hands_ to **shape** his works of art.
column9: 5) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 30-6-2009(14): Two hands can make many **shape** s.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(221): The _sun_ over the _capital_ cast a **shadow** with the same _shape_.
column6: 2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 9-10-2006(57): _Mystique_ the shape-shifter blends into the _scenery_ by transforming into a form that looks like little more than an animated **shadow**.
column7: 3) [[Tzadeck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tzadeck)] 18-8-2009(24): You make some of the famous _scenery_ of Kyoto out of _play-doh_ , even going so far as to add some black play-doh to depict **shadow**.
column8: 4) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 16-5-2007(17): You're out hiking looking at the SCENERY, suddenly out of the corner of your vision you see a large **SHADOW** 's indistinct SHAPE… could it be a grizzly? (cmp [shade](../v4/1592.html) (#1592 陰)).
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 12-12-2008(12): Godzilla attacks! Tokyo's _scenery_ is covered by the _shape_ of Godzilla's **shadow** yet again.

column5: 1) [[gibosi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gibosi)] 5-4-2007(235): **Cedar** is an evergreen tree that keeps its SHAPE all year long. That is, it doesn't loose its needles/leaves in the winter.
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 29-2-2008(34): Mystique leaning against a **cedar** tree for a photo shoot.
column7: 3) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 10-4-2009(24): Why do **cedar** trees keep their shape (don't lose their needles)? Because they're not real trees, they're made out of play-doh.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 31-5-2007(15): Mmmm, **cedar** -scented Play-Doh. Finally, a scent that doesn't make me want to vomit.
column9: 5) [[aphasiac](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aphasiac)] 25-10-2009(10): _Mystique_ is leaning against a **cedar** _tree_ for a sexy photo shoot, holding a lump of _cheddar_ (it's for a cheese advert).

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(102): In Sydney we occasionally get exotic birds. You first notice a **colouring** in a _tree_. You look more carefully and you make out the _shape_ of a bird (here represented by its _claws_ ).
column6: 2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 18-12-2006(77): _Mystique_ the shape-shifter changes the **coloring** of her skin to camouflage tones and perches herself in a _tree_ like a _vulture_ waiting for her pray.
column7: 3) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 25-1-2008(75): **warning:** There is a mistake in the 4th edition, that's not a _fledgling_ primitive on the left. It should be obvious but somehow I didn't notice it when I learned that one yesterday. v__v.
column8: 4) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 14-4-2008(51): A little kid about age 3 is **coloring** something that his teacher can't quite make out. It's just kind of a blob… an unknown shape. She asks, "What's that?" Of course, the child expects the teacher to know what it is and is offended that she didn't recognize what the shape/blob was. "Don't you see it's a vulture in a tree!?" Obviously very upset by this, the child's next drawing is of the vulture flying down from the tree and pecking the teacher to death.
column9: 5) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 23-11-2009(45): When **coloring** something in you _grab_ the crayon of choice to fill in the _shape_ s.

column3: _Badge_ . . . _shape_. The key word is synonymous with  "clear" or "openly expressed."
column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 14-4-2007(206): The _shape_ of a sheriff's _badge_ makes it **patent** who he is.
column6: 2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 18-12-2006(36): _Mystique_ the shape-shifter sneaks into the **patent** office easily after she steals an identity _badge_ from a security guard.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-8-2007(31): Note: the keyword has nothing to do with trademarks and is to be understood in the sense of a "public recognition". However the kanji is not common, so getting the exact meaning is not a big deal.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(30): YOU have the **patent** for _Playdoh_? That's **patent** ly false. See here, I have the _badge_ of proof issued from the **patent** office.
column9: 5) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 31-3-2008(24): It was **patent** ly absurd when the fellow tried to arrest me–his _badge_ was the wrong _shape_ : a _vase_ and a _sunflower_? Come now.

column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 8-10-2006(134): A young **lad** is _standing_ atop a _cliff_ , looking at the writhing _shape_ of his fallen lass below.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(55): A naughty young **lad** stands on the _cliff_ and throws his _Playdoh_ off the edge.
column7: 3) [[kanjiknight](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjiknight)] 12-2-2009(52): A **lad** _standing_ on the top of a _cliff_ , looking into the far, and thinking how to _shape_ his future.
column8: 4) [[Terhorst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Terhorst)] 22-11-2007(39): _Mystique_ sneaks up behind a young security guard foolishly _stand_ ing by a _cliff_. All it takes is a little push, almost playful, and she's free to assume his form. You made it too easy, **lad**.
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(20): (See my story for 産 "products".) Someone is standing at the top of a cliff and urinating. You can tell it's a **lad** by his shape.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 12-7-2007(168): The _lad_ jumps off the cliff, breaks his _head_ , and smashes his **face**.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 10-4-2008(54): When I was a _lad_ , a pretty **face** was all it took for someone to get in my _head_ , and I'd fill _pages_ of lovelorn letters to them.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(25): Ee gads! Look at the **face** on that _lad's head_! <http://www.planet- familyguy.com/pfg/images/characters/freak.jpg>.
column8: 4) [[Raschaverak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raschaverak)] 15-2-2009(23): Normally, lads have a pretty **face** , but an empty head….
column9: 5) [[elanlan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elanlan)] 26-9-2009(10): The _lad_ likes to get _head_ from ladies with a pretty **face**.

column3: _Shape_ . . . _head_. This is the only time that _shape_ is placed to the left of its relative element, the _head_.
column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 28-7-2006(140): Why, I **OUGHT** to RESHAPE your HEAD…
column6: 2) [[Airymon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Airymon)] 15-4-2008(101): Since this Kanji is exceptional, the _shape_ **ought** to be on the left side. Got that into your _head_?
column7: 3) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 9-1-2008(57): You **ought** to like the _shape_ of your _head_ because you can't change it.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 31-5-2007(25): A little kid decorates his sleeping grandpa's _head_ with _Play-Doh_ : horns, moustache, boogers, earwax, moles. He knows mommy will come along and tell him he **ought** n't do it, but he does it anyway.
column9: 5) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 15-12-2006(14): _Mystique_ the shape-shifter [[carve](../v4/1710.html) (#1710 彫)] **ought** to use her _head after_ choosing a form, otherwise she might forget who she is.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 30-1-2007(202): An injured _body part_ may **swell**. It will begin to throb like a bass _drum_ and will change _shape_.
column6: 2) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 10-5-2006(62): If a PART OF your BODY begins to **SWELL** and resembles the SHAPE of a bass DRUM, you’re either pregnant or in desperate need of a diet.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 23-2-2008(38): This kanji does not mean **swell** as in a inflammation. There is a different kanji for that meaning ( 腫れる ). This kanji means **swell** as in, a tire **swell** ing/expanding, your income **swell** ing/expanding, dough **swell** ing/expanding, etc. Johnskb's story is best b/c it does not involve **swell** ing in the sense of inflammation, just general expansion of the stomach. STORY: "If a PART OF your BODY begins to **SWELL** /EXPAND and resembles the SHAPE of a bass DRUM, you’re either pregnant or in desperate need of a diet.".
column8: 4) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 9-3-2008(22): Which part of your body can change shape and, when it does, **swell** s up and throbs like a drumb? Hmmm…
column9: 5) [[Terhorst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Terhorst)] 22-11-2007(15): _Mystique_ 's tummy **swell** s into a big _drum_. Pounding on her _flesh_ can be heard for miles around. __boom ba-ba-boom ba-ba-boom ba-ba-boom!__.

column5: 1) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 13-6-2008(137): I'm going to **visit** my grandpa in the hospital. He broke his _elbow_ , and it became really _big_ and contorted into a weird _shape_. I hope he will be all right!
column6: 2) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 22-3-2006(89): Whenever the postman has to pay a **visit** to this place, he brings an elbow- shaped thingy that he throws to the St. Bernard.
column7: 3) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 7-8-2008(43): I paid a **visit** to my neighbour, but I forgot he had this huge _St. Bernard dog_. The doctor said my _elbow_ will never be the same _shape_.
column8: 4) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 22-2-2007(33): I was a little nonplussed by the inappropriateness of this keyword, so I decided to use "the three kings" instead, they are a threesome, and they make a religiously-motivated **visit** , right? Anyway, they travel by night, so they're just these three shapes moving through the gloom. They can't see well, so a St. Bernard dog noses their elbows whenever they start to go the wrong way.
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 19-3-2008(32): Hint: This is the humble/old kanji of the verb "to go/to come", and also is the kanji for "three" on legal documents. I suggest using the "three musketeers" for this primitive, raising their three blades with the elbow. (the elbow primitive could be viewed as a pictograph of the musketeer's hat, with a feather on the side, too).

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 27-9-2006(200): Whenever I have to _visit_ the relatives… that puts me in one hell of a **wretched** _state of mind_.
column6: 2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 24-7-2008(39): Data feels **wretched** because he has no family to visit.
column7: 3) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 26-7-2006(17): I don't know about you, but it seems to me that whenever I'm in a **wretched** _state of mind_ and just want to be left alone, that's the time that other people always seem to decide to _visit_ me!
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 6-1-2007(14): Your state of mind at the end of the previous frame.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(11): _Data_ felt **wretched** his visit to a "third-world" and seeing how **wretched** the people lived.

column5: 1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 1-10-2007(152): _Mr. T_ is a harsh _taskmaster_ who will **discipline** you (beat you into _shape_ ) with his _walking stick_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 29-1-2008(30): Note : the meaning is in the positive sense, to cultivate one's character or interests. To work to make yourself or something better.
column7: 3) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 2-8-2007(24): You may not have known it, but Mr. T is into discispline. Not just self **discipline** , in order to get into shape, but what he really likes is when the Task master spanks him with her walking stick. Don't tell Mr. T I told you. I pity da fool, and da fool would be me!!!
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 5-2-2008(17): Compare with [permanence/remote](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/958) (#958 悠). _Mr. T_ went to visit his old _taskmaster_ who had a _walking stick_. Halfway on the way to that remote region, _Mr. T_ was about to give up because of the long and difficult journey when he ran into _Bruce Lee_ , who told him that **discipline** is needed to reach your goal.
column9: 5) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 13-2-2009(13): _Mr. T_ joins the X-men. When they catch _mystique_ , he beats her with a _walking stick_ like a true _taskmaster_ to **discipline** her. But it turns out mystique has taken the shape of the walking stick, and she then beats him.

column5: 1) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 3-4-2007(196): The king has a really **rare** umbrella, it can change shape.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(60): Tip: _umbrella_ \+ _shape_ : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it may be worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest " _parasol_ " (because it is the same _shape_ as an _umbrella_ ). REF: _rare_ (FRAME 1723) , [check-up](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1724) (#1724 診), [measles](../v4/2574.html) (#2574 疹), [fallible](../v4/2720.html) (#2720 謬).
column7: 3) [[samesong](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samesong)] 13-10-2008(29): _Mystique_ stole the **rare** _jewel_ -encrusted _umbrella_ by simply morphing into a _king_ , marching into the palace and taking it. "I'll be back, I'd like to take a quick stroll in the rain!' S/he said, and casually strolled off holding the umbrella (pictograph - you can see the umbrella over Mystique).
column8: 4) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 15-6-2009(26): It's **rare** to see the _king_ carrying his own _parasol_ \- typically he gets one of his attendants to do it for him (thanks to Katsuo for _umbrella + shape = parasol_ and to Peppi for the story idea).
column9: 5) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 31-10-2007(22): The ancient _jewel_ that is _shaped_ like an _umbrella_ is extremely **rare** , and so is hung from the chin (ちん) of the royal _king_ of Mezura (めずら) to signify his importance.

column3: _Words_ . . . _umbrella_ . . . _shape_. The key word refers to a medical examination.
column5: 1) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 14-2-2007(116): The doctor at my checkup was expressing words of concern about my umbrella shaped gut.
column6: 2) [[jotun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jotun)] 23-6-2008(73): At a **check-up** the proctologist views an X-Ray. I _say_ , is that _shape_ an _umbrella_?
column7: 3) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 31-12-2008(42): Mystique goes to get a **check-up** and the doctors words cut her to the bone, "I'm sorry Mystique but you've changed shape too many times, you'll be stuck as an umbrella forever".
column8: 4) [[libsrone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/libsrone)] 18-8-2008(24): (Using Katsuo's umbrella+shape=parasol suggestion). The words giving the results of the STD ridden geisha's **check-up** are discreetly written on her parasol.
column9: 5) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 25-2-2007(18): **Check-up** _result_ : your blood is infested with an _umbrella shaped_ parasite.

column3: Under the familiar _top hat_ we see a crisscross pattern or design, like that found on woodwork or garments. This should make an ugly enough image to help remember it. It can be associated with **sentence** by thinking of a **sentence** as a grammatical pattern.
column4: * The primitive meaning for this character will be _plaid_ , the familiar crisscross pattern frequently used in textiles.
column5: 1) [[mhheie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mhheie)] 4-1-2007(183): A twist on greenapple: The teacher puts a tophat on all pupils with gramatically correct **sentence** s, while the rest are left with a big red X on their homework.
column6: 2) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 2-5-2006(60): The teacher in the tophat puts an X on all the grammatically incorrect **sentence** s.
column7: 3) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 31-3-2008(34): I celebrated finishing the Heisig books by buying myself a _plaid top hat_ ( _top hat_ with _criss cross_ pattern to symbolize the crisscrossing flashcards) and then I began the AJATT **sentence** method.
column8: 4) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 26-10-2007(14): It should not be a problem to see this as **SENTENCE**. For the primitive, think in a Scottish accent and say "PLAID kilt". Guess it can look like a Beret wearing scot.
column9: 5) [[meredithcat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meredithcat)] 28-7-2010(10): I'm making **sentence/plaid** into a new primitive: **Catholic schoolgirl**. (This should be fun.) // All of the Catholic schoolgirls wear uniforms with _top hats_ and _plaid_ skirts, and sit in school practicing their **sentence** s.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(205): When sitting **vis-a-vis** , _Scots_ will _glue_ their _kilt_ down to avoid embaressment.
column6: 2) [[laxxy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laxxy)] 8-10-2006(81): This is a character that is used in Japanese for "vs." (as in, "Alien vs. Predator").
column7: 3) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 2-6-2006(45): This isn't plaid, it's tophat and sheaf. In the tophatted wheat cutting competition, one contestant gathered more sheafs than anyone else, he had an advantage **vis-a- vis** the rest because he had glued his tophat on, everyone else's hat kept coming off.
column8: 4) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 8-4-2007(33): The word **vis-a-vis** is like _sentence glue_ , it kind of joins sentences together.
column9: 5) [[netsplitter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/netsplitter)] 15-12-2008(21): _Wolverine_ has to _glue_ a _top hat_ to his head when sitting **vis-a-vis** on a train so no one recognizes him.

column5: 1) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 9-12-2007(168): Who knew that _Spiderman_ was _Scottish!_ He has sewn his **family crest** onto his uniform.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(61): A **family crest** sown on to a garment with _thread_ sometimes has a Latin _sentence_ as a motto.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 23-2-2008(49): If you look closely, you can see that on SPIDERMAN'S CREST, there is sown in his favorite SENTENCE, "with great power, comes great responsibility.".
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 8-1-2009(20): On _Spiderman's_ **family crest** reads the _sentence_ "With great power, comes great responsibility"… in Latin of course.
column9: 5) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 11-5-2008(13): The scotsmen proudly display the **family crest** _threaded_ into their _kilts_.

column5: 1) [[wonk2001](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wonk2001)] 5-1-2008(253): The **mosquito** (an _insect_ ) knows only one _sentence_ : Bzzzzz.
column6: 2) [[Okonomiyaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Okonomiyaki)] 29-6-2008(141): **Mosquito** es are the _insect_ who love _Scots in plaid kilts_ because it makes for easy access to the best parts.
column7: 3) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 8-10-2007(24): How to tell a scottish **mosquito**? Easy. They are the _insects_ with the _plaid kilts_ on. (imagine a far side comic strip with a bunch of **mosquito** s at a house party).
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 31-5-2007(16): Just when I thought there was no effective **mosquito** repellent, I found out they seem to really hate plaid sweaters!
column9: 5) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 5-7-2006(11): The west coast of Scotland is one of the most beautiful places in the world. Unfortunately, there is one thing which can really 'bug' you while you're there - midges (like a small **mosquito** ). Imagine them getting under a Scotsman's _tartan_ kilt and having a feast.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 24-5-2008(30): Two kings, kilt: After an hour in the onsen, the two scottish _kings_ , both heavily **speckled** like the scottish are wont to, decide to get out. However, in the mean time one of their _kilts_ was stolen and only one was left.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 21-11-2008(22): Wolverine was easily able to join the [squad](../v4/1229.html) (#1229 班) when he was seen wearing a _top hat_ **speckled** with _jewels on the sides_. (thanks mantixen).
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 17-2-2010(18): The _Scotsman's balls_ ([squad](../v4/1229.html) (#1229 班)) were **speckled** like quail eggs.
column8: 4) [[Apple_Head](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Apple_Head)] 19-7-2011(8): This _squad_ **speckles** _sentences_ all over town (graffiti).
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(6): _Tenacious D_ (the _two kings_ ) **speckled** the _death row inmate_ from both sides with their pearl juice.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(182): The _Scotsman goalkeeper_ **adjusted** himself. He reached down and **adjusted** the _two things_ between his skinny fencepost _legs_.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 23-2-2008(49): This kanji means "symmetry" not "adjusted." STORY: The TWO FENCEPOSTS need to be SYMMETRICAL in size, otherwise you may smash your mouth into the lower side and start saying naughty SENTENCES.
column7: 3) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 2-8-2007(31): You are trying to stretch a _plaid_ between _two_ _fenceposts_. It's not easy, as for all wrinkles to go away posts' positions must be carefully **adjusted**.
column8: 4) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 26-4-2007(28): HINT: this kanji as a primitive can mean _goalkeeper_. The "fence posts" are goalposts, and the two goalkeepers wear plaid uniforms (this kanji also means **uniform** as in even), making them uniform with each other and distinguishing them as goalkeepers from the rest of the team.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 19-12-2007(20): [+dingomick] The _Scottish goalkeeper_ has lost both of his legs and was forced to replace them with two bent _white picket fenceposts_ nailed together with two boards, but that hasn't stopped him from playing his favorite sport: soccer. Imagine the camera zooming in on him after he makes a great play: "Great save! Ah, there he is reaching under his _kilt_ \- he just **adjusted** his fencepost legs. There he goes again, oop, looks like he just **adjusted** something else as well!".

column3: _Adjust_ . . . _saber_. Think of this as a **dose** of medicine.
column5: 1) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 3-4-2007(193): When my medicine **dose** is way too large, I adjust it by cutting it into smaller pieces with my saber.
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 21-1-2008(119): We had to _adjust_ his **dose** slightly, after he went on a rampage with a _sabre_.
