column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 1-1-2007(19): Just like a daughter ( 娘 ) is good woman, **son** is good too, and stays safely inside city walls so as not to give his parents reason to worry.
column7: 3) [[nath04](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nath04)] 1-12-2009(12): Twin **son** s that were switched at birth.. the bad **son** lived in The Pinnacle, while the _good_ **son** lived in the _slums_.
column8: 4) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 30-9-2007(9): Jesus, God's **son** , comes down to the _Wailing Wall_ wearing a _halo_ to preach to the hassids, but the they're too busy praying to notice anything out of the ordinary.
column9: 5) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 8-10-2006(8): In the story of the Prodigal **Son** , the _good_ **son** stays within the _city walls_.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-7-2007(271): Your _son_ plays in the **corridor** pretending he's exploring a _cave_.
column6: 2) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 17-8-2008(39): A **corridor** is a bastard _son_ of a _cave_. **Corridors** dream too, hoping one day they'll be as great as their father, the cave.
column7: 3) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 18-6-2008(30): (ロウ) I think of the **corridor** found in the _cave_ that Yoda made Luke Skywalker walk through as part of his Jedi training in Empire Strikes Back. It was in this **corridor** that Luke met Darth Vadar, cut off his head and found himself behind Darth Vadar's mask. An early little hint that Luke was Darth Vadar's _son_.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 18-2-2008(26): When I hear **corridor** , I think of a long, lonely hospital **corridor**. Imagine a war scene. Bombs are dropping from overhead. The good _sons_ , who defended the city walls, are dropping like flies. The wounded _sons_ are taken to the underground bomb shelter and hospital, in a _cave_. There are too many wounded _sons_ for the hospital, so the wounded lie sprawled in the **corridor** , as the cave is still rocked by overhead bombs.
column9: 5) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 5-11-2007(9): It would sure piss off superman if he found his _son_ playing in the **corridor** pretending he's _batman_.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-9-2007(236): This is a magic **shield** with _ten eyes_ which have the power to _drag_ the victim towards it.
column6: 2) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 16-8-2006(52): You paint 10 huge eyes on your **shield** to scare the enemy, but consequently your **shield** is so big and heavy that you have to drag it.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 10-6-2007(45): From Wikipedia: "If a Spartan hoplite were to return to Sparta alive and without his **shield** , it was assumed that he threw his **shield** at the enemy in an effort to flee, an act punishable by death or banishment." Picture the enemy of a Spartan soldier poking his _eyes_ out with a _sewing needle_ and trying to steal his **shield**. However, the Spartan desperately clutches on, and is _dragged around_ for a while, preferring to die than to lose his **shield**.
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 5-7-2008(12): TEN EYES = BEHOLDER. You use your **SHIELD** to block the BEHOLDERS rays and bounce them back on him. You DRAG his head home victorious. .
column9: 5) [[Renaissance](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Renaissance)] 12-3-2010(8): Girls are being taught that if someone tries to drag them away, they should poke the harasser's eyes out with a needle. This type of precaution is well known, so harassers nowadays prepare themselves by carrying eyeshields, in order to deflect the needles.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(216): This is mostly used in the word 循環 , "circulation" (of buses through their routes, of blood, etc). So I think of a column of little Roman soldiers with their shields marching **sequential** ly through the veins of a person, as an anthropomorphization of the immune system.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 20-4-2007(61): A _column_ of _shielded_ soldiers advancing **sequential** ly to avoid revealing the size of their army (Think "Sandpeople always ride single file to hide their numbers" from Star Wars).
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(15): _Flash_ can defeat the protection of the _shield_. The _ten_ _eyes_ open momentarily, but one after the other. He can blind them in a **sequential** fashion, and then attack an effectively blind opponent who cannot then _drag_ the shield to meet the attack.
column8: 4) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 10-2-2010(14): An army's _column_ of marching _sheilds_ , are lined up in **sequential** order.
column9: 5) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 4-1-2009(12): The adventurers go in **sequential** order, with the shield bearing warrior in front to shield the other party members.

column3: _Water_ . . . _drag_ . . . _rag_. Back in frame 1127 we indicated that this latter radical would come up once again, as it does in this and the following two frames.
column5: 1) [[revenantkioku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/revenantkioku)] 10-12-2007(321): Drag + rag gave me trouble until I came up with zombie for it. The zombie population became more diverse, separating into different **faction** s. One of them being the water Zombies.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(48): The radical **faction** is almost eliminated, sir. They're living in the _sewers_ dressed in _rags_ and _dragging_ their supplies.
column7: 3) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 16-4-2008(16): The right hand side means _tributary_ , and the _rag_ part of it doesn't have the usual overlap with the first stroke. **Factions** split off from the main group like _tributaries_ do from the main _water_ course. **Veins** are the _tributaries_ of your _body_.
column8: 4) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 8-5-2006(10): WAter drag rag. The red **faction** must live underground in the watery sewers to avoid persecuption. They drag their supplies with them through the tunnels, each and every one clad in dirty rags.
column9: 5) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 7-1-2009(8): DRAG + RAG = ZOMBIE (walking around slowly, dragging feet, tattered rages…) In "Left 4 Dead" there are "normal" zombies and also some **FACTION** S of specialized zombies: Smoker, Hunter, Boomer, oh, and the WATER-spraying "Soaker" ZOMBIES. Thanks to revenantkioku for the zombie idea.

column5: 1) [[Floatingweed5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Floatingweed5)] 12-12-2007(220): The **vein** is the part of the body most lusted after by the flesh hungry zombies (drag  & rag - see revenantkioku frame 1855).
column6: 2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 2-11-2006(60): To get blood drawn from a **vein** you present the part of the body to the nurse, and they drag an alcohol swab (rag) across the **vein**.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 16-1-2009(36): The _part of the body_ _zombies_ hunger for is the brainzzz, not the **veinzzz**!
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 28-2-2009(32): Japanese zombies have trouble pronouncing v/b and r's, so they sound like they're saying "Veeeeiiinns….. Veeeeiinnns…." instead of a completely different part of the body.
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 8-2-2007(8): To poke a **vein** , the nurse asks you to expose some _flesh_. It's the way she asked that aggravated—" _drag_ that _rag_ up a bit!" she said.

column5: 1) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 5-3-2008(217): **Masses** of zombies, splattered with blood. (any zombie movie).
column6: 2) [[volfy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/volfy)] 15-5-2006(43): The stroke order is tricky. Draw the first two strokes of _rag_ and then draw _drag_ and then the last two strokes of _rag_ , or at least so says WWWJDIC.
column7: 3) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 28-8-2006(42): When the **masses** are hurt, say in a natural disaster like an earthquake, they can be seen everywhere dragging their bloody rags.
column8: 4) [[mistamark](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mistamark)] 20-1-2009(25): There was a lot of _blood_ over the **masses** of _squashed zombies_ I use 'squashed zombies' for the form of rag/drag with the two lines at the left.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 28-12-2006(19): The **masses** are a lynching mob. They're _dragging_ a _bloody_ victim in _rags_ behind them.

column5: 1) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 23-1-2008(211): (I prefer _2 towels_ over cornstalk and belt) - Have you ever wondered why your parcels always end up in such bad condition when you get them? Or why you never get them at all? That's because you've never looked at how they're actually delivered - each postman is given a load of **parcel post** and _2 towels_ to _drag_ them down the _road_ on.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 11-1-2007(109): In the ancient **parcel post** , they just would _drag_ the packages behind them tied to _cornstalks_ woven into a long _belt_ down the _road_. It was a wonder than anything arrived intact.
column7: 3) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 1-9-2008(73): People complained about the delivery methods of UPS after finding out that they loaded **parcel post** onto a _towel_ and _dragged_ it down the _road_. As a result, UPS have completely revamped their delivery system. Now they use _two towels_. (thanks Virtua Leaf).
column8: 4) [[bexinkyushu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bexinkyushu)] 24-8-2011(13): According to Jim Breen (whom I'm always inclined to trust more than Heisig) the keyword for this kanji should be **relay** (as in to send something). Story: when amazon.com get a complaint about their **parcel post** , they **relay** a message of apology to the customer with a gift of _belted up cornstalk_. The message attached says "this gift of cornstalk has been _dragged_ a long _road_ straight from the amazon to your door"..
column9: 5) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 8-5-2006(11): In the days before UPS and suchlike the **parcel post** had to walk on the long country roads from town to town. This one is dragging behind him a sled full of packages and for himself he has a cornstalk hanging from his belt, as supplies.

column3: The kanji connoting rank or class shows us a new element on the left: the familiar primitive for _staples_ with an additional stroke cutting through the vertical stroke. It is easiest in these cases to make a primitive related to what we already know. Hence, we call it a _staple gun_. To the right, _missile_.
column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 25-8-2007(268): This is a military- **grade** _staple gun_! It can be loaded with real _missiles_.
column6: 2) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 24-9-2007(50): In order to get your 1st **grade** , or first-dan (だん) black belt, you have to learn hand to hand combat with new weapons - first the grapple involving the _staple gun_ , and then the _missile_ deployment technique.
column7: 3) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 8-4-2008(39): Imagine a really mean teacher who **grade** s papers with a staple-gun that shoots out staples (in a missile-like fashion) onto the paper to form the letter "F". She even uses such an opportunity as target practice. She gets way over to the other end of the class and shoots the little "staple missiles" onto the paper, cackling all the while.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 6-3-2008(26): When you are first dan, your punches hurt like a staple gun. When you are 10th dan, like a missile. So 1st **grade** is staple gun, 10th **grade** is missile. OR The first dan fellas are training with staplers. The 10th dan are whirling around rocket launchers (trick is not to set it off when you are doing all kind of fancy tricks. That is why there are so few 10 dans).
column9: 5) [[Jasta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Jasta)] 10-1-2009(9): First **grade** rs in the army can use _staple guns_. Only when you are of high rank can you fire a _missile_.

column5: 1) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 18-3-2007(206): As a discriminating metalsmith, I use the highest grade metals when forging such precision devices as staple guns and missiles.
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-10-2005(66): Metal has to be **forge** d many times over in order to reach a high grade.
column7: 3) [[Mary_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mary_K)] 19-6-2009(24): _Metal_ is _graded_ depending on how it was _forged_.
column8: 4) [[LordGolem](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LordGolem)] 19-8-2007(15): Gassan Sadatoshi uses only high _grade metal_ to **forge** his swords. <http://www.nihonto.ca/ko-gassan/>.
column9: 5) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 7-5-2008(12): You must use only the highest grade metals when you **forge** missile-loaded stapleguns.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 10-6-2007(186): The **empress** is cruel. Normally she'll violently pull her servants by the ear when they've failed to follow orders. But _one time_ she _dragged_ this one guy around the palace by the _mouth_. She must have been really angry—ever since that moment, he's never been seen again.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-9-2008(110): The _F_ word often comes out of the _mouth_ of the **empress**.
column7: 3) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 1-10-2007(61): This is _ax_ with the last stroke replaced by a _mouth_ , thus forming a pictograph of someone about to have his _mouth_ chopped off for spreading rumors about the **empress**. "Off with his _mouth_!" [Thanks raulir!].
column8: 4) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 5-8-2009(23): The **empress** can have you _dragged_ out of the room with just _one_ word from her _mouth_.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 18-12-2008(22): We know the **empress** is really a _drag queen_ because she only has _one mouth_ Think about it….

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 1-10-2007(186): After the play, The **Phantasm** of the Opera hangs up his cape on a _clothes hanger_ and returns to his _cocoon_ to sleep.
column6: 2) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 12-7-2006(107): You open your closet and find strange, glowing cocoons sitting on your clothes hangers… definitely a **phantasm**!
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 4-9-2009(38): The mother who has undergone a back-street abortion using a _clothes hanger_ is having **phantasm** s (hallucinatory visions) of her dead baby hatching from a _cocoon_. The _cocoon_ looks like the facehugger eggs from the original Alien movie poster. まぼろし, hallucination/vision/mirage.
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 29-12-2010(14): After the opera, The **Phantasm** hangs up his tuxedo on a _clothes hanger_ and returns to his sleeping bag ( _cocoon_ ) to sleep. (Didn't want to start sticking _cloak_ in there by mistake). 幻 まぼろし phantom, vision, illusion, dream, 幻影 げんえい phantom, vision, illusion, 幻怪な げんかいな strange or mysterious and troubling.
column9: 5) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 19-4-2008(14): The _cocoon_ ed phetuses from back-alley _clothes-hanger_ abortions turn into **phantasm** s.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(196): The porn **director** has _one_ big _mouth_. "Don't bother putting your clothes on a _hanger_ , just get started.".
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-7-2008(92): The **director** sticks a _clothes hanger_ in each actor's _mouth_ and hangs them from the _ceiling_ until he needs them.
column7: 3) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 19-7-2007(69): I think of this one as a pictograph of a guy talking on one of those headsets with a microphone attached - he's **directing** a movie, so he has to be constantly in touch with everyone!
column8: 4) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 24-5-2009(30): Every **director** is the _same_ ( 同じ ). But this **director** , this one, he's different.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 1-1-2006(21): This **director** is filming an ad for some washing powder. A bunch of kids are hanging from a clothes line, on _clothes hangers_. They aren't quiet and are making a lot of noise. Only one of them, at the center, is facing the camera and needs to deliver a line. The **director** becomes hysterical and using his megaphone yells at them "SHUT UP! I WANT TO SEE ONLY _ONE OPEN MOUTH_ !".

column3: This honorific form of _call on_ (Frame 534) is made up of: _person_ . . . _director_.
column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 21-8-2007(167): _Mr. T_ is the _director_. You better **pay respects** to him!
column6: 2) [[paramausi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paramausi)] 24-7-2009(73): If _Mr. T_ gets a role in a film, he doesnt **pay respects** to the _director_ , the _director_ **pays respects** to _Mr. T_.
column7: 3) [[saizen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saizen)] 3-10-2008(24): _Mr. T_ **pays repsects** to the _porn director_ for casting him in his first movie role in 15 years.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 4-1-2008(14): _Mr T_ always wanted to be in an _Alfred Hitchcock_ film, but by the time the old bean passed on in 1980, _Mr T_ wasn't a big enough star to warrant working on a film with. Here, we see _Mr T_ **paying respects** to an effigy of _Alfred Hitchcock_.
column9: 5) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 2-4-2011(10): He may have turned out to be a lousy _director_ , but you have to **pay respects** to George Lucas for having come up with the idea of _Jedi_ in the first place. 伺う (うかがう) : (polite) visit, ask, inquire, hear, be told, implore (a god or an oracle), 伺候 しこう atttendance.

column3: The key word, **parts of speech** , refers to nouns, verbs, adjective, adverbs, and so on. The elements: _words_ . . . _directors_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(206): The big mouthed _diretor_ is even picky about the **parts of speech** you use, shouting, "More verbs! Less adjectives!" and such all the time.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 4-12-2006(49): A Grammar is basically a _word director_ that tells us what part of speech each word is.
column7: 3) [[fergal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fergal)] 11-10-2009(24): This kanji is the ending of lots of **parts of speech** like noun, verb, adverb: 名詞 , 動詞 , 動詞 . People are messing around with **parts of speech** all the time now. _Company directors_ are the worst, making up new _words_ by verbing nouns and nouning verbs. "please action that", "what is the take-home from that?".
column8: 4) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 19-7-2009(9): This _director_ speaks very fast. So fast that you can understand only **parts of** his **speech** (some of the _words_ ). To make it even more memorable, imagine that this _director_ speaks in Japanese and you are his interpreter. All you can understand at your current level is only **parts of speech**. You think to yourself: "Probably this word was a noun and that word was a verb, but what the hell is he speaking about?".
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 4-1-2008(9): A lot of the keywords in this book are a little difficult to figure out because you don't know the actual part of speech. Imagine a new edition with a friendly, chubby little _Alfred Hitchcock_ holding a sign up telling you exactly which part of speech each word is.

column3: _Eat_ . . . _director_. The sense is of rearing of animals.
column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 23-12-2006(243): After a pride of hungry lions _ate_ the _director_ , the producer decided to tone down his documentary and film **domesticate** d cats instead.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 10-3-2008(114): When you **DOMESTICATE** a animal, you are the DIRECTOR of it's life and what it EATS.
column7: 3) [[ReNka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ReNka)] 21-4-2010(22): We thought that the lion was **domesticate** d but it ate the Director !!!
column8: 4) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 1-10-2007(8): _Alfred Hitchcock_ really thought the pigeons in Birds were **domesticate** d, that was before they swooped down, carried of his star to _Mc Donalds_ and _ate_ him…
column9: 5) [[kaeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kaeru)] 13-6-2010(7): In the film "Grizzly Man" the DIRECTOR tries to **DOMESTICATE** the bears but ends up being EATEN alive.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(158): The _director_ 's _mouth_ dropped open as he flipped through the _scrapbook_ of properties he was about to become **heir** to.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 27-2-2008(78): Careful with [inherit](../v4/1370.html) (#1370 継). The egoistic _director_ leaves instructions about what shall be handed down to his **heir** upon the director's death. First, the director's _mouth_ should be surgically removed and preserved, to be handed down to his **heir**. Second, a scrapbook of the director's proudest scenes should also be handed down. The _mouth_ reminds the **heir** that the _director_ must be a loudmouth, the _scrapbook_ reminds the **heir** of how to be a good director.
column7: 3) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 15-7-2008(41): This kanji must be referring to Harry Potter. Is he the **heir** to Slytherin? Who knows? His _mouth_ speaks parseltongue though, and Voldemort is trying to kill him from a magical _scrapbook_.. (or was that a diary? haha). Oh, and the _director_ of the potions department hates him. Poor harry!
column8: 4) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 17-8-2008(21): The _director's_ son will be **heir** to a big _mouth_ and a _scrapbook_ full of directing instructions.
column9: 5) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 21-8-2010(10): The **heir** opened his _mouth_ in shock when the _director_ of the estate told him he was only getting a _scrapbook_.

column3: After the _drop_ and the _glass canopy_ , we come to a combination of three strokes that we met only once before, in the character for _mama_ (frame 105). The pictographic meaning we gave it there has no etymological relationship to this character, but use it if it helps.
column5: 1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 29-6-2006(188): I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story **boat** seen from the front. The _glass canopy_ is the body of the **boat**. The _drop_ on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the _ceiling/floor_ between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the _two drops_ in the middle are the lights on the decks.
column6: 2) [[jajaaan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jajaaan)] 1-1-2010(54): Pictograph of a **boat** seen from above. The middle line is the oars. The drop on top is the rudder (at the back of the **boat** ). The two drops inside represent the passengers: one is bent over with the effort of rowing and the other is sitting up straight, in the front of the **boat** , looking at the horizon for any signs of land.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(29): Cinnabar ( 丹 ) colored **boat** , the extra drop signifying that the paint hasn't dried yet. The stick represents the oars.
column8: 4) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 21-1-2009(26): I _dropped_ a **boat** on your _mom_.
column9: 5) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 17-2-2010(9): New Primitive: _Titanic_ with Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet.

column3: The type of _boat_ connoted by this key word is a large oceangoing **liner**. The important thing here is to work with the elements _boat_ and _dove_ to make an image distinct from that of the former frame. Don't count on size alone to distinguish the _boat_ from the **liner**.
column5: 1) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 28-4-2008(170): The most famous **LINER** is the Titanic, which struck an iceberg and sunk. Just imagine that huge **LINER** strucking an even huger mass of **white** ice.
column6: 2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 1-7-2006(92): A **liner** is to _boat_ as an [emperor](../v4/261.html) (#261 皇) is to a [king](../v4/255.html) (#255 王), or a [chief](../v4/967.html) (#967 伯) is to a [person](../v4/951.html) (#951 人): in each case we need only add _white_ to the latter in order to get the former.
column7: 3) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 20-6-2008(57): Cruise **Liner** s are huge _boats_ that always seem to be _white_.
column8: 4) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 29-8-2007(44): Titanic was a big _boat_ built by the _White_ Star _Line_.
column9: 5) [[DeKleft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DeKleft)] 5-12-2007(9): Noah's Ark was probably the first _boat_ ever that might be considered a **liner**. Hey! there's the _white dove_ that Noah sent out, and he has an olive branch in his beak!

column5: 1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 28-2-2007(207): To **navigate** a "boat" through a "whirlwind" takes a skilled **navigator**.
column6: 2) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 21-7-2008(92): In Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, you can **navigate** your _boat_ by summoning _whirlwinds_.
column7: 3) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 1-10-2007(22): Forrest Gump, being the fool that he is, decides to **navigate** his shrimping _boat_ into the _whirlwind_ instead of around it. Though through his perpetual dumb luck, he manages to be the only boat that survives the _whirlwind_ ….
column8: 4) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 17-2-2010(12): The _Titanic_ had a GPS **Navigation** system. The device saved the boat from a _whirlwind_ , but it directed it towards an iceberg instead.
column9: 5) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 31-7-2009(7): "Sir, the possibility of successfully navigating through a _whirlwind_ in a _boat_ is approximately 3,720 to 1!" "Never tell me the odds.".

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(79): The **gunwale** is perhaps the most _mysterious_ part of a _boat_ for it is neither a **gun** nor a **whale**.
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 24-10-2007(17): **Gunwale** (rhymes with "tunnel") is the top edge of the side of a _boat_ , for example the widened lip on the sides of a canoe. The _mysterious_ origin of this part of a _boat_ comes from the strengthened sides of warships that used artillery (it means "gun ridge").
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(9): Boat, gandalf: The _boats_ obtained from Lady Galadriel were retrofitted with magic **gunwales** made by _Gandalf_. Now, nobody could fall overboard.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 24-1-2009(3): Gandalf always hangs out on the boat's **gunwale** , it's a mystery how the old bastard manages not to fall off.
column9: 5) [[Norman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Norman)] 21-2-2013(2): The meaning of **GUNWALE** is MYSTERIOUS for everyone, except BOAT enthusiasts.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(165): **Carrier**?! This means "general" (as in the general public or generally). OK.. **Carrier** s, i.e. boats with missiles, are not available to the general public.
column6: 2) [[PrettyKitty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PrettyKitty)] 13-5-2008(101): In general, **carrier** boats have missiles.
column7: 3) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 26-5-2009(55): For those who have the greasemonkey script, this kanji's keyword should be changed. I use **run of the mill** to avoid conflict with [general](../v4/1366.html) (#1366 総). Story: Nowadays, even a **run of the mill** _boat_ has _missile_ launchers to protect themselves from pirates.
column8: 4) [[Mary_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mary_K)] 19-9-2009(32): **Generally** speaking, aircraft **carrier** s are _boats_ with _missiles_.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 10-6-2007(18): Be sure to protect the **carrier**. It's the boat with all our missiles, so if the enemy strikes it, it will explode VERY easily.

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 17-5-2006(288): What do you call a "CARRIER" of DISHes? A **TRAY**.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-2-2006(35): Imagine a restaurant set in Disney's Fantasia or maybe in Harry Potter's university, where _dishes_ are magically landing and taking off of a _carrier_ **tray**.
column7: 3) [[SimHuman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SimHuman)] 16-1-2010(20): "This, my friend, is no run of the mill dish! Look at its finely crafted handles, its size great to hold dishes itself! No, my friend, THIS is a **TRAY**!" [See Cheesemaster64 for [carrier](../v4/1871.html) (#1871 般)].
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 10-3-2008(16): (see 1871) GENERALLY, **TRAY** 'S are used for carrying DISHES/PLATES, but sometimes, poor kids use them a sleds.
column9: 5) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 24-5-2009(6): And What do you call a "general purpose dish"? A **tray**! (johnskb).

column5: 1) [[laxxy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laxxy)] 16-10-2006(175): When workers neglect workplace safety, their fingers get cut off and carried away by the **conveyor** belt, which looks like a 'finger carrier' in that case.
column6: 2) [[Ikeda_kat2007](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ikeda_kat2007)] 23-3-2008(73): During WWII, morse code was the primary means of communication from sea. The morse code specialist was the **conveyor** of messages to and from the crew of the carrier, using his fingers to tap out the secret messages. (This works especially well for 搬送周波数 carrier frequency and 搬送波 carrier wave, being the radio waves/frequencies used in morse code).
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-9-2008(49): _Fingers_ take food from the sushi _carrier_ , a **conveyor** belt.
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 10-3-2008(20): This is not used in kaitensushi. It means more like, "carry out/in, delivery." STORY: GENERALLY, you can use your FINGERS to CARRY some take-out home.
column9: 5) [[Balaam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Balaam)] 2-2-2008(15): A **conveyor** belt carries sushi to your waiting fingers.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(206): A boy floats his toy _boat_ in a _gully_ and imagines it as an immense **ship**.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 19-2-2008(39): Aargh, hard to keep this separate from boat. How about this: the phrase "shape up or **ship** out!" This phrase originally meant that a soldier had better get his act together, or else face being **ship** ped off into a combat zone. Here we see a poor WW-I soldier who has been **ship** ped off to a combat zone. He's riding in the _boat_ overseas to fight in the _trenches_ ( _gulley_ ).
column7: 3) [[snallygaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snallygaster)] 27-5-2008(29): A **ship** is a **boat** so big, it makes a river look like a **gully**.
column8: 4) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 5-7-2008(23): A _boat_ in a _gully_ looks like a huge **ship**.
column9: 5) [[yuriehoshii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yuriehoshii)] 1-6-2011(8): THUYỀN : A **SHIP** IS A BIG BOAT HAS AT LEAST 8 BOXES (CARGO HOLD ).

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 11-2-2007(186): The **warship** towers over the smaller benign _boats_ , _overseeing_ their safe path from port to port.
column6: 2) [[lawton992](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lawton992)] 9-4-2009(95): A **warship** is a _boat_ that _oversees_ the seas. Think of it as the patroller of the ocean.
column7: 3) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 13-3-2007(28): On a normal boat, you do what you want: play shuffleboard, pig out at the buffet, sunbathe. On a **warship** though, there's an overseer making you swab this, batten that, and hoist the other thing.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 7-3-2008(19): On the **warship** (antique one) there are slaves, the losers of battle. They are overseen by the slave master in a reclyner who oversees the slaves eating all from one plate. As soon as the slaves have finished eating from the one plate, back to work again.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 18-12-2008(9): A _boat_ that _oversees_ destruction is a **warship**.

column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 23-12-2006(200): In venice, the _boat_ used by the _courts_ to transport criminals is a **rowboat**.
column6: 2) [[Weber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Weber)] 28-2-2007(98): Courts in olden times would often punish convicts by sentencing them to a life of being the rower crew for large **rowboat** ships (there were no engines or boilers back then)… Yo ho, Yo ho….
column7: 3) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 11-10-2007(35): "Row, row, row your _boat_ …..". Imagine someone who goes to _court_ , claiming they wrote this song first.
column8: 4) [[foodcubes](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/foodcubes)] 7-11-2010(14): Sometimes abstract imagery works very well. Imagine someone showing up to **court** in a **rowboat**. Really imagine them rowing it across the floor and you won't forget this Kanji.
column9: 5) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-10-2005(13): There's a phrase in English to "send you up the river," meaning to be sent to jail. If you think of this then all you have to do is picture the courts sending you up the river in a boat… a **rowboat** to be precise. If it helps, you can also think of your state then as being "up the creek without a paddle.".

column3: The only thing that distinguishes this from the _claw_ is the addition of the _elbow_ , made by doubling up the third stroke and adding a fourth.
column5: 1) [[yorkii](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yorkii)] 8-7-2006(312): 何これ ???? ok, sorry to be crude… if you claw at a girls **melon** s, she is gonna give you the elbow.
column6: 2) [[Christoph](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christoph)] 14-2-2007(62): M for **melon**. 瓜 elon.
column7: 3) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 25-8-2007(33): Vegetarian _vultures_ are fighting for a **melon** , each trying to _elbow_ its way to it with _claws_.
column8: 4) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 3-1-2009(25): The housewives _CLAW_ ed and _ELBOW_ ed each other to buy the first **MELON** of the season.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(15): To top yorkii's crudeness: while girls have juicy **melon** s on them, they are well protected with claws and elbows.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-5-2008(146): Joan of **Arc** ("arc" also means "bow" in french) is practicing with a _bow_ , shooting at _melons_ in a distant field.
column6: 2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 14-4-2008(107): When you use a _bow_ to shoot a _melon_ , the **arc** varies depending on how far away you are.
column7: 3) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 13-8-2007(47): **Arc** –>arch–> a girl **arches** her back as _Legolas_ strokes her _melons_.
column8: 4) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 21-3-2009(26): You'll make a very short, steep **arc** if you shoot a melon from a bow. And then the melon will break, which is sad. And then your mouth will likewise be an **arc** (of sadness)–frown. :(.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(24): Both a bow and a melon are **arc** -shaped.

column5: 1) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 2-6-2008(272): An **orphan** will never know the joys on sucking on his mother's melons……..
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 27-12-2008(95): Unlike the celebrated story of Momotaro the peach boy, no one knows the story of the melon boy who was left an **orphan**.
column7: 3) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 12-4-2008(60): This is the happier version of Oliver Twist. Here the **orphan** ed _children_ are served fresh _melon_ with every meal. "Please, sir, may I have some more _melon_?" "Why, of course, help yourself!".
column8: 4) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 21-8-2008(25): The **orphan** CHILD popped out of the MELON.
column9: 5) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 7-7-2009(12): Adopt an **orphan** child today and receive a free melon.

column3: Though it's a good thing that the primitive for **cocoon** has been radically abbreviated from this, its full form as a kanji, the story it holds is a charming one. The silkworm ( _insect_ ) eats the leaves of the mulberry bush (the _flowers_ ), digests them and transforms them into _thread_ with which it spins about itself, in mystic wisdom, its own coffin (the _hood_ ). The dividing line that separates the two elements helps the picture of the little worm cutting itself off from contact with the outside world, but as a character stroke, it is a clear exception.
column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 27-7-2008(190): This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a **cocoon**. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar ( _insect_ ). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the _insect_ covered with _thread_ , making a beautiful **cocoon**.
column6: 2) [[eightyd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eightyd)] 15-8-2009(172): I dont like lesson 51 so far.
column7: 3) [[gdaxeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gdaxeman)] 14-1-2008(82): The magic _flower_ is the reason why _Spider-Man_ ended up miniaturized and confined inside a _hood_ -like **cocoon** together with an _insect_. Now, only a _walking stick_ separates them both.
column8: 4) [[Alucard](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Alucard)] 19-1-2007(45): See book, one of the good stories you can remember from there.
column9: 5) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 20-11-2009(31): _Spider-Man_ bent over to pick up a pretty _flower_ when a giant _glass hood_ dropped over him- it's a trap! Now he's stuck inside, fending off a swarm _insect_ with his _walking stick_ as they try to wrap him in a **cocoon**. Could this be the end of _Spider-Man_?!

column3: Poised over the _dish_ here is a pair of _animal horns_ that are attached to a pair of _animal legs_ by a single horizontal stroke.
column5: 1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 19-7-2007(279): The **benefit** of having sharp _horns_ and fast _legs_ is that an animal can get to the food _dish_ first.
column6: 2) [[QuackingShoe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/QuackingShoe)] 23-7-2008(110): The **benefit** of being an animal with _horns_ and fast _legs_ is in keeping it from becoming a _dish_ for the other animals! (shaydwyrm).
column7: 3) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 11-10-2007(29): The resturant I worked at had no real **benefit** s (vaction time, sick leave, etc), except for one-free meals. However, the meals sucked. Basically, we were given left overs, consiting of _animal horns, and animal legs_ , on a plain _dish_.
column8: 4) [[mr_hans_moleman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mr_hans_moleman)] 15-12-2008(22): Friends with **BENEFIT** S, is basically a HORNY friend who spreads their LEGS and offers themselves on a silver PLATE.
column9: 5) [[lisbet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lisbet)] 6-1-2012(17): ( ノಠ益ಠ )ノ彡┻━┻ THEESH KANJI HAS NO **BENEFIT** TO ME!!!!!!!!! RAGE!!!!!!

column3: The element for _day_ on the left is logical enough. Next to it we see _staples_ being held in _mouth_ (one stroke is doubled up), indicating working in one's hobby or handicrafts at home on one's **spare time**. The small _box_ at the top right is facing backwards, or more properly  "inside out." Finally, we have the _crotch_ at the bottom.
column5: 1) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 5-4-2007(314): Some jackass-like people have way too much **spare time**. You can find video's of them all over the internet, if you like such things, you can watch it all _day_. You see them _stapling_ their _mouths_ shut, or throwing eachother _upside down in boxes_ or kicking each other in the _crotch_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(94): Tip: The complex right side of this kanji appears twice more in Heisig. He later names it "hobby". REF: [shrimp](../v4/2689.html) (#2689 蝦), [haze](../v4/2779.html) (#2779 霞).
column7: 3) [[snallygaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snallygaster)] 18-6-2008(48): I avoid using "mouth" here because it makes me mess up the stroke order. Instead I use a flag/staple combo. Hopefully you've seen the Justin Timberlake "dick in a box" spoof. Someone has a lot of **spare time** , so he decides to spend the _day_ making an especially elaborate dick in a box. There's a _flag_ _stapled_ to the box as decoration (like wrapping paper). He rigs it up so he can instantly flip the _box inside-out_ to reveal his _crotch_. Well, it's a vivid image once you get it. He's my hero.
column8: 4) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 17-9-2009(23): A pervert's **hobby** (see Katsuo): He turns _two boxes_ upside-down ("コ") and _staples_ them together - that makes them look like a bench. Then he hides in it and waits until some girls come and sit down. What can he see? Of course their _crotches_! If he does that all _day_ he won't have **spare time** for anything else.
column9: 5) [[inaka_rob](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inaka_rob)] 17-4-2012(13): WARNING EXPLICIT!!! In my **spare time** , basically all DAY long, I STAPLE a few things to the wall. a picture of a woman's mouth and outward facing "box". I think you know what I do with my crotch.

column3: At the top we have the _arrowhead_ whose vertical line joins it to the _rice field_ (or _brains_ ) below it. Beneath it, the _compass_ , and to the right, the _taskmaster_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(201): _Arrowheads_ are **spread** all over the _field_. The _taskmaster_ profiteerer forces you to find them all using a _compass_.
column6: 2) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 23-3-2009(129): Instead of being glued to one [specialty](../v4/46.html) (#46 専) 専 , I decided to **spread** my attention in many directions 方 , and be a taskmaster at none.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-7-2007(67): Gory story: Instead of _setting you free_ , the taskmaster said "Spread em!", raped you, and drove an _arrowhead_ into your _brain_.
column8: 4) [[sarek05](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sarek05)] 14-10-2008(36): I assasinated the _taskmasker_. When the arrowhead hit his _brain_ , bits and pieces **spread** out in all _directions_.
column9: 5) [[karmatheif](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/karmatheif)] 19-1-2010(13): This is the （しき）used in ふろしき 風呂敷 , which is when the Japanese bundle something in a large cloth, then gather the ends togther and tie it at the top to carry it around. Story: Imagine an eccentric _taskmaster_ who feels the need to carry a gigantic ふろしき everywhere for his picnics, so he can **spread** it in all _directions_ , cover a whole _field_ and pins the corners to the ground with stone _arrowheads_.

column3: This odd but common kanji is built up of the character for _not yet_ into which a pair of _animal horns_ has been inserted.
column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 22-2-2007(346): You _horny_ bastard, don't **come** , at least _not yet_!
column6: 2) [[volfy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/volfy)] 12-5-2006(72): When I **come** home, there's nobody and no dinner waiting for me. Sigh… _rice_ for _one_ again.
column7: 3) [[dilandau24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dilandau24)] 19-4-2007(55): Here I see, of all things, Bambi. His _animal horns_ have _not yet_ **come** out. (As we can see in the kanji, the _animal horns_ are not at the top, not "poking through". ) Remember: Bambi will soon **come** to have a great set of _animal horns_ but they have _not yet_ **come** out.
column8: 4) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 13-10-2007(14): Last words of the Bible: "Come, Lord Jesus, **come**." The Devil pokes his HORNS up and says: NOT YET!
column9: 5) [[baylin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/baylin)] 7-8-2009(9): One bowl of rice comin' up.

column3: The **spirit** in this character refers to the changeable moods and airs of one's personality as well as to the more essential combination of vital forces that distinguish things and individuals one from the other. Its elements are: _reclining_ . . . _floor_ . . . _fishhook_ . . . _sheaf_. Do not confuse with _spirits_ (Frame 1930).
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(130): _Captain Hook_ , his **spirit** crushed, is lying on the ground cursing _Wolverine_ who has defeated him with his far superior claws.
column6: 2) [[Balaam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Balaam)] 2-2-2008(57): You're reclining on the floor trying to hook a sheaf with a small hook through the cracks. That you've been doing this for seven hours without success shows your burning **spirit**.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 11-7-2009(34): _Wolverine_ has a fighting **spirit** , and even while _reclining_ on the _floor_ sharpens the _hooks_ on his claws.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 30-5-2006(27): Hint : the first four strokes may be seen as _Captain Hook_ : _reclining on the floor_ , shaking his _hook_ in the air and moaning "Peter Pan! Why did you elude me again! Whyyy!". Se here we have Captain Hook having one of his fits, and about the only thing that will bring him his **spirit** back is a _sheaf_. The last part probably won't make sense but I am French speaking and somehow I settled onto the image of a "bouquet" of flowers for the word "sheaf".
column9: 5) [[Hujis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hujis)] 22-5-2009(18): Someone is _lying_ on the _floor_ , a huge _x_ ripped into their stomach with a _fishhook_. A passer by says "Gen **ki** desu ka".

column3: Think of this character as a sibling of that for _spirit_. Simply replace _sheaves_ with drops of _water_ on the left in order to get _vapor_.
column5: 1) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 1-12-2006(197): Water **vapor** almost looks like a spirit but has no soul.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 25-2-2007(44): Wolverine disappears into _water_ **vapor** , seemingly his _spirit_ dissipating into nothingness.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 11-3-2008(31): In this scene, Captain Hook is RECLINING on the FLOOR with his HOOK in the air in the desert. He is drying up dying, you can even see the WATER **VAPOR** being sucked right out of him.
column8: 4) [[narazumono](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/narazumono)] 20-1-2009(12): **Vapor** is the _water's_ _spirit_ with no _x_ , the unknown quantity for soul.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 18-1-2009(8): _Captain Hook_ enjoys nothing more than to _lie on the floor_ of his ship while the cool _water_ **vapor** from the ocean waves sprays his face.

column3: The two _large hooks_ have little propellers (the two _drops_ on each _hook_ ) attached to them for **flying**. Beneath is the _measuring box_ , which serves as the body of this **flying** contraption. The stroke order will cause some problems, so take care with it.
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 1-1-2007(267): Hooks with small wings attached look like hummingbirds with a long beak. Two hummingbirds are trying to **fly** away with our little measuring box. What do they want it for?
column6: 2) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 5-2-2009(36): Two _hummingbirds_ **fly** ing to feed at a _measuring box_ filled with sugar water. **This kanji is famous for having hard-to-remember stroke order.** Try it this way: first a _hummingbird_ **flies** over the _measuring box walls backwards_. But finally the other _hummingbird_ manages to stick its beak right through them.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-7-2007(26): Captain _hook_ **fly** ing in a _measuring_ box with two _propellers_.
column8: 4) [[tharvey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tharvey)] 6-8-2009(19): (To keep the stroke order) **Fly** ing by, you see a _hummingbird_ land on a _walking stick_. The bird looks around and sees a _person_ nearby bending over, and gives the signal to attack. In swoops a second _hummingbird_ , poking it's beak right into his back. Ouch!
column9: 5) [[ktcgx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ktcgx)] 3-12-2012(8): I learnt this Kanji a long time ago, when I was a kid, and the image I had for it is so vivid it's served me well, and I thought I'd share it. This Kanji is _two hummingbirds_ **fly** ing over a field of _asparagus stalks_. But one flew too low, and got its beak stuck through two stalks.

column3: The technique for **sinking** used in this kanji is unique. Rather than the biblical image of tying a millstone about the victim's neck, here we see a _crown_ tied about one _leg_ before the unfortunate party is tossed into the _water_.
column5: 1) [[jreaves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jreaves)] 20-7-2007(178): (thx geezer) The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a cement crown to make sure she **sink** s. She shouldn't have been so nosy about her yakuza-boyfriend's schemes.
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 10-2-2007(87): This is the famous story of Archimedes and the Crown, where buoyancy was discovered. Watching the _crown_ **sink** in the _water_ , Archimedes detected the fraud and ran naked through the city ( _human legs_ distorted from running) yelling "Eureka! Eureka!" See <http://math.nyu.edu/>~crorres/Archimedes/Crown/CrownIntro.html and <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eureka_%28word%29>.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-11-2007(57): A mob of peasants throws a noble into the _waters_ , his _human legs_ stuck into the _crown_ he was wearing proudly just a minute before (this later image for the special primitive combo on the right). The poor guy **sink** s to his death, unable to swim back up. Sunk by his _crown_!
column8: 4) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 1-7-2007(23): The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a heavy crown to make sure she **sink** s.
column9: 5) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 14-10-2009(13): If you're in the _water_ and your _legs are squeezed together inside a tight crown_ you won't be able to swim properly - you'll just **sink**.

column3: Tree . . . crown tied around leg of person.
column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 3-8-2008(103): The guy who was thrown into the river to sink was given one last request. "If I'm gonna be sleeping with the fishes," he said, "can I at least have a **pillow**? I'm real sensitive." The mafia bosses laughed. "Look, my doctor said I can only use _wooden_ **pillow** s, I have a real serious condition. Can I at least die comfortable-like?" The mafia dudes said fine, and let him have his **pillow**. They tossed him the river and drove off…and after a minute, he bobbed to the top, thanks to his floating _wood_ **pillow**.
column6: 2) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 28-6-2010(38): WOODEN **PILLOW** S do not [sink](../v4/1888.html) (#1888 沈) in water.
column7: 3) [[Corodon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Corodon)] 11-8-2009(20): (Mature audiences only) As my _wood_ began to _sink_ into her, she moaned into the **pillow** , not wanting to awaken the neighbors with screams of ecstasy.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 16-12-2009(7): Some Japanese people sleep with a **pillow** made of _wood_ , in case there's a flood in the middle of the night. Because **pillows** made of _wood_ do not _sink_ , they need never fear falling asleep without a flotation device nearby.
column9: 5) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 15-11-2010(4): (Mature audiences only) As my _wood_ began to _sink_ into her, she moaned into the **pillow** , not wanting to awaken the neighbors with screams of… pain. It was her first time, and **she wasn't wet!!** (Thanks Corodon).

column5: 1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 30-8-2007(203): Ten rakes woman. your **wife** digs her fingernails into you and it feels like 10 rakes when she finds you ontop of another woman.
column6: 2) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 8-11-2007(139): (I'm really not sexist, this just helps me remember the kanji): I make my **WIFE** do all the yard work, and as a really mean joke, I bought her TEN RAKES for her birthday this year. "Do the yardwork, WOMAN! You have TEN perfectly good RAKES to choose from!".
column7: 3) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 23-7-2006(60): Your **wife** 's fingernails are like ten rakes clawing into you. What a savage woman.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(17): I have multiple **wives**. _Ten_ to be exact. It makes it mighty easy to _rake_ leaves in the fall.
column9: 5) [[mistamark](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mistamark)] 22-1-2009(13): Your **wife** hit you _10_ times with a _rake_ when she found you on top of another _woman_!

column5: 1) [[danie115](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/danie115)] 21-11-2008(72): Sugoi! Sugoi! Ice Wife Sugoi!
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 15-12-2006(48): His _wife_ has a **nifty** way of making all types of _ice_ cream in her home freezer.
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 20-11-2008(40): I prefer keyword "terrific" for this as the Japanese meaning can be either "great" or "dreadful". Story: freezing your wife is a terrific idea, she can still look pretty and you don't have to listen to all the nagging.
column8: 4) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 12-11-2008(28): A word like **nifty** makes you think of the 50's, and a _housewife_ so impressed with the new _freeze_ r that she says "oh, how **nifty**!".
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 8-7-2012(12): My _ice-cold wife_ would beat me down if I ever insulted her, so I often tell her she's **凄い** (sugoi), which she takes to mean amazing but what I actually mean is dreadful. ————————- (I use すごい (sugoi) as a keyword because I already know it, but if you wanna use an English keyword, I like herman's suggestion of "terrific.").

column3: Let this key word connote the **decline** and fall of the Roman Empire. It shows a fellow in a _top hat_ and _scarf_ , trying hard to look happy by putting a _walking stick_ in his _mouth_ sideways to twist his face into a grotesque but semi permanent smile.
column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(385): If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven't seen him after his **decline**. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, begging people to throw it for him. Note that the mouth is closed only after the stick goes in, as is only logical.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-10-2008(44): My kanji writing ability has **decline** d so much even my _one_ looks _pathetic_.
column7: 3) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 4-10-2007(34): If you thought that the dude in 哀 was _pathetic_ , you haven't seen him after his **decline**. Here he is carrying a _stick_ around in his _mouth_ like a dog, allowing people to rent him and play catch with him for money!
column8: 4) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 22-12-2006(25): _One pathetic_ decision after another led to the **decline** and fall of the Roman Empire.
column9: 5) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-7-2007(5): Ever since the guy from [pathetic](../v4/401.html) (#401 哀) got a **decline** d by a girl and a _walking stick_ rammed in his mouth sideways, his life has been in **decline** , a downward spiral.

column3: Between the _top hat_ and the _scarf_ you will see the character for _in_ which is truncated at the bottom so as not to interfere with the _scarf_. You can think of this character forming as a pair with that of the former frame: there the _in_ (the _walking stick_ in the _mouth_ ) was set on its side, here it is set upright.
column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-7-2007(267): The guy from [pathetic](../v4/401.html) (#401 哀) shared his **inmost** feelings with a girl and she rammed a _walking stick_ down his throat. It ruptured his **inmost** organs.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 4-10-2007(59): Besides making money from acting like a dog (see decline), the _pathetic_ man has risked his **inmost** internal organs by becoming a _cane_ swallower!
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(45): I'm going with 9 strokes: the magician pulled _10 scarves_ from the **inmost** part of his _mouth_.
column8: 4) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 18-4-2008(35): **Note** : Incorrect stroke order and count in book. Is written _one_ , _mouth_ , _walking stick_ , _scarf_ , with 9 strokes. [It evolved from a combination of _garment_ and _in_ (meaning undergarments), so maybe it used to be written as described in the book…].
column9: 5) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 22-10-2008(11): The _pathetic_ emo guy is always talking about his **inmost** feelings. Sometimes I want to shove a _walking stick_ in his _mouth_ to stop him talking.

column3: Imagine a **mask** over your head with _eyes_ peeping out from all over the head, a _hundred_ in all (the element for _eye_ displacing the fifth stroke of that for _hundred_ ).
column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 4-10-2007(147): When Jim Carrey puts on **The **Mask**** , he can make it seem like he has _100 eyes_ popping out of his head.
column6: 2) [[phauna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/phauna)] 27-2-2008(106): If you're wearing a **mask** , a _hundred_ _eyes_ can look at you but none of them will know who you are.
column7: 3) [[Monkeys_Spiders](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Monkeys_Spiders)] 18-2-2010(46): I see this as the comb primitive combined with the kanji for 3 giving the same stroke order :). So picture a person wearing 3 combs on their face as a **mask**. メン.
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 7-3-2008(18): A **mask** with one big eye in the middle. (and a funny haircut on top).
column9: 5) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 7-7-2009(11): A **mask** with a hundred eyes.

column5: 1) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 2-12-2008(58): There is a certain restaurant in West-Shinjuku that serves its **noodles** made of BARLEY in a MASK instead of a plate. I love these theme-restaurants!
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 3-2-2010(38): I always eat _barley_ **noodles** with a _mask_ on - it stops them splashing in your face.
column7: 3) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 9-6-2008(18): Don't be fooled! That's just _barley masq_ uerading as **noodles**.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 22-10-2010(5): 素麺 , 老麺 , 麺 (麵)[noodles](../v4/2752.html) (#2752 麺) メン … Parts: 麦 , 面 … The most common use for this, Ramen, is actually written in Kana exclusively. The Kanji is used to talk about the **noodles** themselves before they are cooked into a dish. … Story: How did _Chris Barley_ get so fat? He lived near an all-you- can-eat **Noodle** shop (Ramen, Somen, etc.). Even after they banned him, he would just put on a mask and keep coming back. Richard Nixon mask? Check. Tony Blair Mask? No good, that mouth is too small.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(5): A _mask_ made entirely of _barley_ **noodles**.

column3: After the _flowers_ at the top (painted on the **leather** for decoration), we see the element for _car_ with the middle stroke left out. Think of the seats having been taken out so that they can be reupholstered with this decorated **leather**.
column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 12-10-2006(218): You can feed _twenty mouths_ for a year for the price of _ten_ **leather** coats.
column6: 2) [[jesslawnz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jesslawnz)] 14-11-2008(145): I asked the street vendor the price of the **LEATHER** jacket. He said TWENTY, but with my MOUTH, I talked him down to TEN. (correct stroke order).
column7: 3) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 2-9-2008(28): This kanji depicts a **leather** jacket wearing gang of _20_ people. To make themselves look even tougher, they all have _needles_ in their _mouths_ (i.e. piercings, but here of a specific kind).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-10-2008(15): My **leather** belt has _twenty openings_ for the _needle_ of my buckle to go through.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 13-1-2010(10): In this **leather** belt there are _20_ ( 廿 ) small holes or _openings_ ( 口 ) made with a _needle_ ( 十 ) to compensate for increases in girth.

column5: 1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 19-7-2007(218): _Leather_ **shoes** are nice because they _change_ shape to fit your foot.
column6: 2) [[xiaoma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xiaoma)] 25-3-2009(71): _Leather_ is often _changed_ into **shoes**.
column7: 3) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 2-7-2009(19): If you buy _leather_ **shoes** , you have to "break them in" - wear them so that they _change_ shape to fit your foot.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-1-2008(15): I wear my nice _leather_ **shoes** whenever I go out dancing. I hate wearing too much in my pockets when I dance, so if I ever need _change_ , I just reach into my **shoes** where I've stashed a bunch of spare _change_.
column9: 5) [[channi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/channi)] 28-4-2009(10): **SHOES** used to be made out of LEATHER, but that has CHANGED.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(253): In the _Old West_ , cowboys had **hegemony** OVER the Indians despite their _leather_ craft and ability to navigate by the _moon_.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(51): In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete **hegemony** over them. All your base are belong to us.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 27-2-2008(33): In the _Old West_ , **hegemony** over Indians was ensured by binding and whipping the Indians' _flesh_ with _leather_ straps.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 23-11-2008(32): Leather + flesh = scalping. It's commonly believed that the Indians invented scalping but in fact it was the American colonists that created the practice of cutting off a dead Indian's hair + skin as proof of the kill. In response the Indians started doing the same to them, but history is written by the winners so most people blame the Indians for this barbaric practice. (true story) In the Old West, colonists exercised their **hegemony** by scalping the Indians.
column9: 5) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 31-3-2010(13): In the _Old West_ , the colonists asserted **hegemony** over the Indians by killing all the bison and depriving the Indians of their much needed _leather_ and _meat_.

column3: The _samurai_ at the top is familiar enough. The combination beneath, which looks like a _flag_ with a line running through it, is not. Try to devise some way to take note of it, and pay attention to the writing.
column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-7-2007(256): When an enemy's _flag_ is raised, a true _samurai_ can _split_ it in half with just his **voice**.
column6: 2) [[bananarama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bananarama)] 2-3-2008(65): Having lost his **voice** , the samurai comunicated to his troops with a striped flag.
column7: 3) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 30-7-2009(53): The lower element is easier to remember as: _venetian mask with stick_. Story: During carnival time you try to guess who is that _gentleman_ hiding his face under _venetian mask with stick_. You definetely heard his **voice** before.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(23): The _samurai_ stepped on his _Rubik's Cube_ and _bent_ it. His **voice** of pain and grief rang out.
column9: 5) [[jcdietz03](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jcdietz03)] 29-8-2010(12): In ancient Japan, after winning a battle, a SAMURAI might rip the opposing FLAG down the middle (represented by the vertical line of flag) and bellow a victory cry in his loudest **VOICE**.

column3: The _flag_ here has an extra vertical stroke in it. Think of it as an **eyebrow** pencil stuck in the _eye_.
column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 2-12-2006(79): The **eyebrow** s hover over the _eyes_ like a _divided flag_.
column6: 2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 29-3-2007(18): Pictograph: opera glasses over eyes ビ ミ まゆ.
column7: 3) [[dancingblade](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dancingblade)] 19-8-2010(16): (+astridtops) **Eyebrows** are like _flags_ that are raised above your _eyes_. The _flag_ is divided because otherwise that would be a monobrow.
column8: 4) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 27-3-2010(9): The _venetian mask with stick_ covers the _eyes_ but I can recognize his bushy **eyebrow** s above it.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 9-3-2012(3): She painted _Japanese flags_ above her _eyes_ as **eyebrow** s.

column3: The complex of strokes in this kanji is unusual and difficult, because of the fourth stroke, which is rare (see frames 33 and 34). The _mouth_ and _tool_ are already familiar.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(262): As a present, I **gave** my dentist a _hand-crank tool_ for spreading _mouths_. He was so happy since it makes his job easier.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 27-10-2006(66): I see this as a pictograph of an old-style phonograph - a stand, record, crank and bell (the mouth). Even the primitives work out - a _tool_ with a _crank_ which plays music out of the bell _mouth_. Imaginge **giving** one of these old and beautiful phonographs to a classical or jazz music buff!
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 11-3-2008(55): This kanji does not mean "give" as in "give to someone." It means "give" in the sense that someone gave you something, or did something for your benefit when combined with a gerund (-te/-de form) of a verb. STORY: Your working in a factory and your hand gets stuck in one of the gears. You yell with a big MOUTH, "HELP!" and one of your co-workers runs over, **GIVE** S YOU a HAND- CRANK TOOL, and goes back to work. =(.
column8: 4) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 5-12-2007(10): Some dude is changing a flat tire. He opens his _mouth_ to say, "GIVE me that _tool_ ,…what was it called again? Oh yeah, a _tire iron_." (The forth stroke looks like a tire iron to me.).
column9: 5) [[hunchbag](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hunchbag)] 20-11-2009(8): I was going to **give** you a _hand-crank tool_ but I eated it. :(.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(156): A man from a less enlightened society comes for a visit, and asks the host to give him a woman for some **recreation**.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(59): While at the dentist's office _giving_ him his _hand-crank tool_ , one of the assistant's asks me if I'd like to join her in the back for some **recreation**.
column7: 3) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 23-12-2006(42): A _woman_ _gives_ up her **recreation** time in order to raise a family.
column8: 4) [[jackwarne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackwarne)] 16-4-2009(37): God gives Adam a woman for **recreation** al purposes…
column9: 5) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 6-1-2010(28): "Give me a woman ( [女を呉れ！](midori://search?text=女を呉れ！) ) for my **recreation**!".

column5: 1) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 24-5-2007(231): It is a rookie **mistake** to believe the _words_ when your sweetie says "You don't have to _give_ me anything for my birthday." Trust me, your sweetie wants something, something shiny, and if you disappoint, you will suffer.
column6: 2) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 7-7-2008(76): You must _give_ _words_ of apology when you make a **mistake**.
column7: 3) [[Tobberoth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tobberoth)] 20-4-2009(43): "I GIVE you my WORD that I won't make the same **MISTAKE** twice".
column8: 4) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 18-7-2006(20): In a debate the smallest **mistake** (even a slip of the tongue) makes your _words_ into a _gift_ to your opponent.
column9: 5) [[kame3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kame3)] 3-12-2009(17): When the dentist makes a **mistake** in your _mouth_ with his _hand-crank tool_ , you scream out _words_ of pain.

column3: The _flower_ at the top and the _floor_ with the _oven fire_ beneath are familiar. The problem is what comes in between. It is formed by the character for _complete_ , whose vertical stroke doubles up as the first stroke of _water_.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 31-12-2005(181): This kanji is used in compounds for the **steam** ing of food and also for smoking/fumigation. Here we have the Japanese once again trying to replicate the French cuisine, only with a twist, **steam** ing food with flowers (think of flower-smoked ham for example). Flowers must first be _completely soaked in water_ , and then poured over a thin piece of _flooring_ under which there is an _oven fire_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-3-2008(136): Note: _complete + water + floor_ are later combined into 丞 [helping hand](../v4/2919.html) (#2919 丞). Story: The driver of a **steam** train asks you for a _helping hand_ and explains that your job is to throw _flowers_ on the _fire_ to make the **steam**.
column7: 3) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 14-10-2009(63): (EASY KANJI!) At the top we see hot **steam** forming FLOWERS. At the bottom we see the STOVE FIRE heating the bottom of a pan. So what's in the middle causing all this **steam**? Its all COMPLETELY WATER.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 28-4-2008(31): I keep forgetting this primitive, so _completely_ / _water_ for me will be a sort of _water sprite_ or elemental, a _child-like_ creature _completely_ made of _water_. ——– It used to be thought that to create **steam** , you had to trap the _water sprite_ (using some sort of magical _flowers_ as a lure), and place them over a thin piece of _flooring_ under which there's an _oven fire_. The **steam** then _flowers_ from the _water sprite_ (re: fuaburisu).
column9: 5) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 10-12-2006(16): When you want to **steam** some _flowers/vegetation_ you don't cover them _completely_ with _water_ , rather you have just a little at the _floor_ of the saucepan and then _heat_.

column3: The sense of passive acceptance or reception of information is contained in this key word. The form is based on the middle portion of the preceding character, with three additional strokes, best thought of as the kanji for _three_.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(222): To get someone to _completely_ **acquiesce** it takes _3_ dunks in the _water_ before they give.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-10-2007(87): To get someone to **acquiesce** , duck them _completely_ in _aqua_ (= _water_ ) _three_ times. (variation on dingomick's).
column7: 3) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 8-7-2008(42): Warning, Obscene!! I finally got my girl to **acquiesce** to a lewd act.. But it took _3 times_ to get it in _completely_ and lots of _water_ to clean up afterwards.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 28-4-2008(17): You must ask the trapped _water sprite_ not once, not twice, but _thrice_ (a line from Samuel Taylor Coleridge's "Kubla Khan" comes to mind) before it will **acquiesce** to your requests. It's not for any mystical reasons, it's just that it hates being asked the same thing _three_ times, like that character from Austin Powers.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 30-11-2009(16): Waterboarding: To _completely_ **acquiesce** it usually takes just _three_ sessions with _water_. (Thanks to dingomick for the idea.).

column3: This is the character from which the element for _shovel_ derives. Within it comes the element for _snare_ , with the _sparkler_ surrounding it.
column5: 1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 1-7-2007(206): Damn racoons ill show them. I put a snare in the **bin** as well as a few phosphorous sparklers so as to scare the shit out of the buggers as they rummage through my **bin**.
column6: 2) [[smujohnson](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smujohnson)] 2-3-2009(135): (thegeezer3) Damn racoons… I'll show them. I'll put a SNARE in the **BIN** as well as a few SPARKLERS so as to scare the shit out of the buggers, then hit them with a SHOVEL.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 12-6-2007(40): A typical German apartment has five different kind of trash **bin** s: paper, plastic, glass, biodegradable, and everything else. Don't you dare throw your trash in the wrong **bin** , or else you'll find yourself on the wrong side of a booby trap: hung by a _snare_ , burned by _sparklers_ , and knocked out cold by a _shovel_.
column8: 4) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 24-12-2006(25): (Reformatted from erikkusan) The Windows Recycle **Bin** is like a _snare_ holding onto your trash. When you empty it, a window displays little _sparkles_ as the files are _shoveled_ off of your hard drive.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(14): This is alternative way of writing 箱 , used in e.g. 函館 (はこだて) and sometimes as is. This **bin** is actually a snare with a powerful sparkler in it that kills rats that enter it, the remains of which are then shoveled away (to a "recycle **bin** " perhaps).

column3: The **poles** this key word refers to are the extremities of the earth or the terminals of an electric field. The elements are: _tree_ . . . _snare_ . . . _mouth_ . . . _crotch_ . . . _floor_.
column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 13-4-2007(362): Can simplify this using [decay](../v4/1243.html) (#1243 朽). Then: The expedition to the **poles** is bad for your health, and the _decay_ that started in your _mouth_ spreads to your _crotch_ – at which point you fall to the _floor_.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(101): (modified Katsuo) Can simplify this using [decay](../v4/1243.html) (#1243 朽). You travel to the _poles_ , a frozen wasteland. In desperate need of food you try to set up a snare but the tree is _decayed_ (see story for [decay](../v4/1243.html) (#1243 朽)) so you catch no prey. The brutal cold first attacks your _mouth_ as your lips turn blue, then your _crotch_ also gets cold as your body fails, finally you fall to the _floor_.
column7: 3) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 24-12-2006(20): Santa Claus (from the North **Pole** , of course), has a _wooden_ sled led by reindeer _snared_ at the _mouth_. One unfortunate night, he jumps down a chimney and burns his _crotch_ on a piece of coal as he hits the _floor_.
column8: 4) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 12-6-2007(7): The diverging magnetic fields at the **poles** actually attract cosmic radioactive _decay_ , particularly the kind that causes cancer in the lips or the testicles. But don't worry, you can protect either your _mouth_ or your _crotch_ by digging a hole in the _ground_ and covering it up. Which part do you protect? Imagine coming back home with cancer in the other, unprotected part.
column9: 5) [[Aeryon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aeryon)] 16-1-2012(4): I remember sharing this joke on the playground back in 1986. "Did you ear about the dumb polak who climbed a tall tree to see both **poles**? On the way up, stepped in his own snare, fell to the floor and ended up with his crotch in his own mouth. Then he said seeing his own crotch in his mouth… that's not the pole I wanted to see!".

column3: If you play with this primitive's form with pencil and paper, you will see that it begins with a _box_ -like shape, and ends with the final two strokes of the _halberd_ , a convenient combination for the **tusk** protruding from the mouth of an animal.
