column4: * Since this kanji has 4 strokes, you would expect that as a primitive it would also have 4 - but in fact it has 5 in the following two frames (the second stroke between divided into 2 strokes) and reverts to 4 again in frame 2056.
column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 20-12-2008(142): The kanji looks like an elephant with **tusk** s. the box is the elephant's eye. The final stroke is the **tusk**.
column6: 2) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 2-7-2006(87): He stored the **tusk** s into a _box_ , along with the _broken halberds_.
column7: 3) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 28-12-2009(26): You can save yourself a lot of trouble because Heisig is correct on [tusk](../v4/1904.html) (#1904 牙) (4), [bud](../v4/1905.html) (#1905 芽) (8), [wicked](../v4/1906.html) (#1906 邪) (8) but not [gracious](../v4/1907.html) (#1907 雅) (5th edition says 12, but WWWJDIC says 13). So: In it's Kanji form, it has four (4) strokes, in it's primitive form (I suggest: ivory because that's what elephant **tusk** s are made of) it has always five (5) strokes for all Kanji in RTK1.
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 3-3-2008(21): The _waitress_ was charged by the elephant who skewered her legs with its **tusk** s. As a result her right leg had to be amputated ( _missing right leg_ ), her left leg is crippled, stiff, and limp ( _straight left leg_ ), and the **tusk** is still embedded in her left leg ( _final stroke attached to waitress's crippled left leg_ ).
column9: 5) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 10-6-2007(13): This actually reminds me of _waitress_ more than anything, but that doesn't help much.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2007(217): Zoo keepers are baffled as to why the tips of the elephant's _tusks_ keep **budding** into _flowers_.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 22-10-2007(57): **Bud** s while they're still small tend to be tusk-shaped.
column7: 3) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 25-1-2008(31): An elephant places a big _flower_ on the other elephant's _tusks_ , to show they're best **bud** s.
column8: 4) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 28-12-2009(13): Unfortunately, this must be a sad story. Poachers lure the elefants with **buds** (of _flowers_ ) so they can kill them to get their _ivory_.
column9: 5) [[eightyd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eightyd)] 5-4-2010(12): Lets smoke some flower **bud** out of my tusk bong.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(191): The **wicked** queen builds her _city walls_ out of menacing _tusks_.
column6: 2) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 19-5-2006(66): As everyone knows, rhinoceroses and elephants are often killed for the value of their TUSKS. Here we see a **WICKED** city mayor who has had countless elephants killed just to make his CITY WALLS out of TUSKS.
column7: 3) [[Biene](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Biene)] 14-6-2008(19): The battle of Pelennor Fields (Lord of the Rings): The _Mumak/Oliphant_ s are driven by their **wicked** riders to attack the _city walls_ of Minas Tirith. It's easy to say who were the **wicked** ones and who were the good guys. (<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q_EY4JYruC8>).
column8: 4) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 7-3-2009(17): You can see this is the city of the **wicked** just by the huge _tusks_ adorning the _city walls_.
column9: 5) [[jmcanally](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jmcanally)] 14-2-2010(12): Considered a **WICKED** trade by most of the modern world, the TUSK trade is still often carried out in the SLUMS, outside of the influence of the police and government.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 16-7-2007(220): "Goodness **gracious**! Such an **elegant** _turkey with a tusk_." This mnemonic is meant to join RtK's keyword with a better proposition. Heisig could have used " **elegant** " here, which is not confounded so easily with [graceful](../v4/721.html) (#721 淑), and accurately represents the character's meaning (it is also the chosen keyword in Kodansha's Kanji Learner's Dictionary).
column6: 2) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 5-4-2007(47): To not confuse it with [grace](../v4/606.html) (#606 恩) or [graceful](../v4/721.html) (#721 淑), think of the phrase "Goodness **gracious**." Like: "Goodness **gracious**! A _turkey_ with _tusks_!".
column7: 3) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 13-2-2007(16): Be **gracious** around the large- _tusked turkey_. They're emotional at the best of times, so don't excite them with a big weapon like that.
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 30-4-2009(15): "Goodness **gracious**! A _turkey_ with _tusks_!" screamed the **elegant** lady walking through the GM farm.
column9: 5) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 26-5-2010(8): WARNING: there's a kanji for [elephant](../v4/1976.html) (#1976 象). ………………………….. _Elephant Tusks_ are very **gracious** , _Turkey wattles_ aren't. ……………… <http://images.google.co.uk/images?q=turkey>+wattles .

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(172): Mrs. Badger follows the _animal tracks_ to the den where she finds her husband getting a _blowjob_ from a fox. "I have a good **explanation** for this. Really!".
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 14-10-2009(103): **Animal track** primitive: As expected, **animal tracks** were left in place of the trail of _rice_ I'd purposely _drop_ ped the night before. EDIT - also try **the footprint** for a primitive meaning, the classic symbol of detective films. STORY: This _shakuhachi_ player is so talented, he can do **interpretation** s of animal noises too. They're so realistic he soon has _animal tracks_ leading straight to wherever he's playing.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(65): The magical shakuhachi can easily give explanation for any animal tracks, just like it can be used to translate words ( 訳 ).
column8: 4) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 22-6-2008(40): Mrs. Badger follows the _animal tracks_ to the den where she finds her husband getting _shakuhachi_ from a fox. Now, I don't speak badger but judging from the screeching and the gestures, my **interpretation** of the situation is that Mrs. Badger is not pleased. (thanks dingomick! Just trying to use this new keyword).
column9: 5) [[furrykef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/furrykef)] 5-7-2008(17): An **interpretive** dance of some kind where somebody follows _animal tracks_ , a _shakuhachi_ providing the soundtrack, suggesting the tracker's thoughts and intentions.

column3: This key word has been chosen for its overlay of several meanings similar to those of the kanji: a **turn** of duty, a round, a number, and so forth. Its composite elements: _animal tracks_ . . . _rice field_.
column4: * As a primitive element, we choose the image of a pair of _dice_ which it is your _turn_ to throw.
column5: 1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 1-7-2007(211): The famers take it in **turn** s to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field.
column6: 2) [[Biene](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Biene)] 4-5-2008(38): (modified thegeezer3) _Animal tracks_ were found in the _rice field_ , now the kids of the farmer take it in **turn** s to keep watch and hinder the animals to make more _animal tracks_ in their precious _rice field_. They roll the _dice_ to decide in what order they have to keep watch and when everyones **turn** is.
column7: 3) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 7-7-2007(32): [turn, number in a series] Ok, I'm done - now it's your **turn** to count the _drops_ of _rice_ in the _rice field_ …
column8: 4) [[gavin.schultz-ohkubo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavin.schultz- ohkubo)] 20-11-2010(26): I find "turn" alone is too generic to remember, so I add an additional keyword, **numerical order**. This is perhaps the most common context in which this kanji is found, e.g. 1st, 2nd = [一番、二番](midori://search?text=一番、二番) . Story: I see _animal tracks_ leading to the _rice field_ and start to worry, but then see the **numerical order** in which the tracks are made: 一番 mouse tracks, 二番 cat tracks, 三番 dog tracks, then 四番 lion tracks. Looks like the rice is safe.
column9: 5) [[jimitha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimitha)] 3-11-2009(11): (I use _animal droppings_ instead of _animal tracks_ to avoid confusion.) Story: Workers slack off in the _rice field_ taking **turn** s at a dice game, using _animal droppings_ as the dice (for lack of other implements). What game are they playing? Craps, of course.

column3: The **hearing** referred to in this character relates to trials in the courts. The elements: _house_ . . . _dice_.
column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 22-10-2007(310): At your divorce **hearing** the judge tells you to roll _dice_ to see who keeps the _house_. ("I can't believe what I'm **hearing**!" you say).
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(37): In the court _house_ the judge decides your **hearing** with a roll of the _dice_.
column7: 3) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 8-2-2007(27): The **hearing** was quite informal. We had it at the judges' _house_. Each party took a _turn_ relating their side of the issues, then the judge concluded the **hearing** with his decision.
column8: 4) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 20-12-2008(10): In the _house_ of law, both sides take _turns_ during the **hearing**.
column9: 5) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 19-12-2007(7): If you operate a _house_ of _dice_ , you can expect to end up in front of a Judge at a **hearing**.

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 20-2-2008(170): Don't play _dice_ with birds. When you're not looking, they'll **flip** the _dice_ with their _feathers_.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 29-4-2007(77): When the birds out the back are playing _dice_ , they **flip** their _feathers_ (not their finger) at their opponents.
column7: 3) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 28-3-2008(38): According to my books, this **flip** is related to **flip** ping food in a frying pan or something like that. To _flip_ an omelette, you need first some eggs. But you said it aloud, and when you go to the _field_ , you find it empty except for some _animal tracks_ and some missing _feathers_. The chickens have escaped!! _(music from "Chicken Run")_.
column8: 4) [[torabi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torabi)] 1-6-2008(36): It's your _turn_ to **flip** the chicken _wings_ on grill.
column9: 5) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 28-8-2007(30): These are crooked _dice_ , modified using the latest robotic technology. To **flip** right in flight, they momentarily stick out tiny _feathered_ wings to perform few deft flaps.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(165): This character refers to feudal **clan** s that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures ( 廃藩置県 ), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落 , flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that **clan** s' location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall: at random. See <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_%28country_subdivision%29>.
column6: 2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 17-3-2009(132): In the particular **clan** depicted by this character, each member has to take his or her _turn_ _watering_ the _flowers_.
column7: 3) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 20-2-2008(83): Each member of the **clan** has to take his _turn_ at _water_ ing the _flowers_. The order they do it in is decided by a roll of the _dice_. (tweaked Matthew's story).
column8: 4) [[laxxy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laxxy)] 30-10-2006(27): This yakuza **clan** controls the "flower" trade, the 'water business' ( 水商 ) and the dice gambling.
column9: 5) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 5-4-2006(19): This is what members of Ku Klux **Clan** is doing when not meeting: pretending to live normal life by watering flowers during the day and playing dice-games with their families at night. What a double-life.

column3: This character simply reverses the direction of the final stroke of _hand_ to produce **fur**. If you reverse your _hand_ and put its palm down, you will have the side on which **fur** grows.
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-12-2006(179): I've heard of people having hair on the back of their hands, but this is ridiculous! That's not hair, that's **fur**!
column6: 2) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 31-7-2008(63): Be careful not to pet a cat the wrong way - most cats don't like you rubbing your _hand backwards_ over their **fur**.
column7: 3) [[shirish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shirish)] 24-12-2008(24): **Reverse** stroke of _hand_ disturbs the **fur**.
column8: 4) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 26-3-2009(6): I touch the **FUR** of the animals only with the reverse of my HAND . Be careful, strokes are not horizontal.
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 17-10-2009(3): I have a lot of **fur** on the back of my hand.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(157): The amount of "fur" (needles) on a Christmas tree **decrease** s, until it doesn't look all that good.
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 8-3-2008(115): Real fur coats and real christmas trees are dereasing the last couple of years. Plasctic chrismas trees and fake fur it is nowadays.
column7: 3) [[kusterdu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kusterdu)] 30-4-2008(41): A marketing survey shows that there has been a **decrease** in Christmas trees sales. It turns out, many very stupid people confused a fir tree with a "fur" tree, and because "fur is murder" stopped buying the trees.
column8: 4) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 20-12-2008(36): Christmas Tree + Fur: The **decrease** in the purchases of _furry christmas trees_ is a result of protest from animal rights activists and nature lovers.
column9: 5) [[dtstutz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtstutz)] 15-2-2009(27): Sorry, **decrease** is too generic to remember… I bought my sister a **de-creaser** (a clothing maintenance device similar to an iron) after she complained about her **fur coats** getting all **creased** and wrinkled. But it was only November, so it had to sit for a while under the **Christmas tree** in a wrapped box waiting for someone to open it up and use it to **de-crease** something.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(257): A dog waves its furry **tail** like a flag.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-3-2008(50): A FLAG of FUR is a **TAIL**.
column7: 3) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 22-6-2008(17): I taught my dog to use the toilet. Great, right? Problem: Her **tail** is too long. It dips in the toilet as she tries to sit and now the _fur_ smells like _pee_. Plus she splatters everyone with pee water when she wags her **tail**. Ew! (Note: I use "pee" for the flag primitive).
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 8-5-2008(11): Animals wave their furry **tail** s like flags, indicating their mood.
column9: 5) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 16-9-2008(7): A _flag_ -loving nationalist paints the _fur_ on the **tail** of his _furry_ dog in the colors of the national _flag_ , and together they go to watch the military parade. The nationalist waves his _flag_ , while the dog wags his _furry_ **tail**. 尾 (お): **tail** , ridge, caudal 尻尾 (しっぽ): **tail** (of an animal) 追尾 (ついび): following, pursuing, tracking, **tail** ing 尾骨 (びこつ): coccyx (tailbone) 水平尾翼 (すいへい びよく): **tail** plane (of an airplane).

column5: 1) [[naniwa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/naniwa)] 18-3-2007(277): This kanji is, of course, pronounced "taku", and it seems the owner of this **home** is a little bit otaku himself. He has hung up _locks of hair_ suruptitiously obtained from various females all over his _house_. A veritable hair fetishist, and certainly someone whose **home** you wouldn't want to visit.
column6: 2) [[Terhorst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Terhorst)] 13-2-2008(61): " **Home** is where the _hair_ is".
column7: 3) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 29-6-2006(43): At **home** , all the drains in my _house_ are clogged up with _locks of hair_.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 16-4-2008(20): I'm very paranoid when I finally call my _house_ a **home** , so whenever I leave, I cut a _lock of hair_ , divide it into strands, and place it at all the entrances. If one is displaced, then I know someone has been there! Saw that in a James Bond movie.
column9: 5) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 1-7-2007(16): House and locks of hair (goldilocks) = goldilocks broke into the bears house and treat it like her own **home** the selfish bitch.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(264): When you **consign** a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don't keep their word).
column6: 2) [[ivandiaz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivandiaz)] 4-3-2007(53): In "The Lord of the Rings", Galadriel **consign** ed a lock of her hair to Gimli the dwarf, along with some wise words.
column7: 3) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 8-12-2006(25): Through _words_ and a _lock of hair_ the voodoo priestess **consign** s you to a life of pain.
column8: 4) [[delbertmon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delbertmon)] 26-1-2010(24): ENGLISH DEF.: give over to another for care or safekeeping, "consign your baggage" /// When you **consign** a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don't keep their word).
column9: 5) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 30-3-2008(14): Found at a _consign_ ment shop: a _lock of hair_ _said_ to belonging to _Socrates_. [Using **consign** ment shop helps to distinguish **consign** from [entrust](../v4/1954.html) (#1954 嘱), especially if you use 'say', 'word', etc. in both stories].

column3: This character rightly belongs to the previous lesson, but we held it until now because of the final element, the _tail feathers_. After the _drop_ at the outset, the next three strokes are completely novel and should be given special attention.
column5: 1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-3-2008(392): In this kanji, you can see 3 katakana characters: ソ, ユ, and then ユ again followed by TAIL FEATHERS. STORY: "So (ソ) you (ユ) wanna **DO** it?" "Only if you (ユ) **do** " says the female bird as she raises her TAIL FEATHERS.
column6: 2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 12-10-2007(42): **Do** me _from_ behind, says the bird, as she shakes her _tailfeathers_.
column7: 3) [[Alunalun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Alunalun)] 11-8-2009(20): Tell a story - a reluctant magician is asked to **do** a trick. The audience chant 'Do it, **do** it!', so eventually he **do** es one. He takes a _drop_ of water (stroke 1), drops it on the ground where it runs **do** wn and smears out (stroke 2). It drops **do** wn two steps (strokes 3 and 4) (imagine some nice setting with steps), growing and becoming multicoloured, like a petrol drop, as it goes. Then at the bottom the magician touches it with his wand and you see it has turned into a set of peacock's _tail feathers_.
column8: 4) [[gavin.schultz-ohkubo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavin.schultz- ohkubo)] 20-11-2010(12): The keyword "do" is just too generic for me, so I use " **for the sake of** ", which is perhaps a more common reading, for those familiar with the phrase ために, I believe this is the kanji for ため.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 18-1-2009(9): "I **do**!" says the bride before tripping over a _spear_ , falling **do** wn the stairs and into the _flames_.

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 19-5-2006(165): Mr. T doesn’t "DO" **FALSEHOOD**. It goes against everything he stands for. “I pity da foos who revel in **FALSEHOOD** s!”.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2007(69): "It depends on what your definition of _do_ , uh, is," says _Mr. T_ giving **falsehood** about his affair with a peacock.
column7: 3) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 5-2-2008(40): Not really a story but I believe that giving special attention to a kanji is also a good way to remember it and this one was selected as **"Kanji of the year 2007"**. <http://www.japanprobe.com/?p=3368>.
column8: 4) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 7-7-2007(21): [falsehood, lie, deceive, pretend, counterfeit, forgery] A _person_ who claims to have seen a living _Dodo_ bird is telling a **falsehood**. (based on astridtops,17-10-2006).
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 17-10-2006(13): A _person_ who claims he didn't _do_ something while he actually did, is telling a **falsehood**.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 5-6-2007(68): The man being tortured was **apprehensive** as he saw his tormentor approaching with a _hairpin_ poised to pierce his _brain_!
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-6-2007(14): I’m feeling **apprehensive** because I’m wading barefoot in a _paddyfield_ and I've just dropped my _hairpin_.
column7: 3) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 30-12-2009(12): I was a little **apprehensive** before _brain_ surgery, and when the surgeon took my brain out and stuck it atop a _hairpin_ , my apprehensions were confirmed! Put my brain back right away, I bellowed. [畏まりました！](midori://search?text=畏まりました！) said the surgeon. (thanks Meconium).
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-12-2009(9): My _brain_ was exposed when they were about to perform conscious _brain_ surgery on me. I started to get a little **apprehensive** when the neurosurgeon approached with a long _hairpin_ and a maniacal look in his eyes… [畏まりました。](midori://search?text=畏まりました。) かしこまりました。.
column9: 5) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 18-2-2012(8): "Dear Heisig, if I see you misname another kanji I'm going stab you repeatedly in the _brain_ with a _hairpin_. **Your's truly** , a pissed off member from RevTK".

column3: In line with the story of the preceding frame, the _hair_ that needs the _hairpin_ is **long**.
column4: * The primitive of this kanji has two more shapes in addition to that of the kanji itself. Above its relative primitive, it is abbreviated form will mean _hair_. Further abbreviated, it will mean the long, mangy _mane_ of an animal.
column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 7-10-2007(152): The Geisha with **long** _hair_ uses an ornate lacquered _hairpin_ to bundle it all up.
column6: 2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 22-6-2008(74): The top of this one reminds me of the staple primitive. So here's my story: The girl's hair was so **long** that she had to use _staples_ instead of _hairpins_. It worked, but stapling her hair to her head was kinda painful.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 5-1-2006(25): As a primitive I use the image of (very) **long** hair. Let this kanji represent a "Swiss Hairpin" (similar to a Swiss army knife) : the top part being a pictogram for _half a comb_ , and the lower part being the _hairpin_. Just make sure not to confuse with the kanji for "comb". Think of this one as a " _half a comb_ " that can be pulled from the "Swiss Hairpin".
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-3-2008(14): HAIRPIN: This is rather similar to that for SCARF. Both a HAIRPIN and a SCARF can be used for holding back **long** hair. STORY: The first 4 strokes could be a pictograph of hair blowing in the wind. It's too **LONG** and getting in your way, so you pin it back.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 30-11-2009(8): The **long** haired Geisha _staples_ on an ornate _hairpin_ so it won't slip. (Thanks to Zactacular for the idea.).

column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 29-10-2006(238): The longbow is follows the design of a standard _bow_ , only it has been **lengthen** ed.
column6: 2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 14-8-2007(71): _Legolas_ recieves spam telling him that his can **lengthen** his "bow"…he smirks…he know's it's already _long_ enough.
column7: 3) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 28-2-2007(18): Wanna **lengthen** the distance you can shoot? Use a _longbow_!
column8: 4) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 7-10-2007(13): In desperation, after the _Geisha_ (see long) broke the string on her _bow_ , she **lengthen** ed out one of her own hairs and strung the bow with it.
column9: 5) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(10): To make your _bow_ into a _long_ bow, just **lengthen** it.

column5: 1) [[nac_est](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nac_est)] 12-9-2007(234): In ancient China books were rolled-up scrolls of paper. So **notebook** s were nothing more than _long towels_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(75): Students, for this class, your **notebook** will be a _towel_. Make sure it's extra _long_ though, we'll have a lot of writing.
column7: 3) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 12-10-2010(32): The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is the **notebook** computer to bring when you're going on a (really!) _long_ trip (Also, used by _long haired_ hippy type galactic hitchhikers). Don't forget to bring your _towel_!
column8: 4) [[jrkester](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jrkester)] 20-4-2009(11): What an unusual student, that person is using a _long towel_ for a **notebook**. Guess it would be convenient for studying after a shower.
column9: 5) [[felwiz1602](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/felwiz1602)] 21-8-2012(6): The movie the **notebook** was so _long_ and full of crying that by the end of it you had soaked through an entire _towel_ [手帳：てちょう](midori://search?text=手帳：てちょう) 帳 / とばり : n 1）curtain.

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 14-8-2007(246): Taking Viagra let's your blood vessels **dilate** …resulting in a _body part_ getting _long_.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 22-10-2007(70): Staying out in the dark moonlit sky for a long time, your pupils **dilate**.
column7: 3) [[fergal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fergal)] 31-10-2009(35): Your girldfriend's pupils **dilate**. She's never seen a _piece of flesh_ that _long_!
column8: 4) [[eightyd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eightyd)] 15-5-2011(21): My dick is **dilate** d.
column9: 5) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 8-5-2008(16): When the moon comes up, your pupils **dilate** –they become longer on all sides–because the moon produces less light than the sun.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 7-12-2006(282): Japanese teenage girls consider the style of the **hair of the head** very important. If a particular style is trendy, soon they all want their own _hair_ in the same _shape_ as that of their _friends_.
column6: 2) [[kodama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodama)] 8-11-2007(49): _Friends_ influence the _length_ and _shape_ of each other's **hair**.
column7: 3) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 30-4-2010(14): When Rachel from _Friends_ _hair_ got popular, even _Mystique_ changed her **hair of the head** to that style. Didn't need to cut it of course….
column8: 4) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 22-10-2007(13): My daughter has _long_ **hair** which she _shapes_ in various ways depending on which _friend_ she's going out with.
column9: 5) [[Tzadeck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tzadeck)] 22-8-2009(9): I put _Play-Doh_ in the _hair_ of my _friends_. I learned that the **hair of the head** does not go well with Play-Doh.

column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-11-2005(218): You use an American flag to wrap up a salad for a picnic and bind it with a hairpin. Now imagine **unfold** ing it to open up the bounty you've fixed up for yourself.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 25-5-2007(125): **Unfold** _flag_ , take out the _salad_ , pin the flag down with _hairpins_ and have a picnic.
column7: 3) [[ivantolearnkanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivantolearnkanji)] 9-7-2008(31): You **unfold** the Stars and Stripes _flag_ in order to hoist it high, but there's a problem! One of the stars has fallen off! With some quick thinking, you pin a _flower_ to the _flag_ using a _hairpin_ , and you're all set. Good thing you don't have to refold the flag once **unfold** ed.
column8: 4) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 8-3-2009(10): The farmer girl has made some ready-to-eat salad packs, but has no way to take it to the market. She takes down the _flag_ , wraps the _salad_ packs and ties the bundle with her own _hairpin_. So she arrives at the market and **unfolds** the bundle to **exhibit** her goods. (Based on "darg_sama"'s story).
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 13-12-2009(4): The _flag_ had been used for a picnic so when I **unfold** ed it, bits of _salad_ and _hairpins_ fell out of the folds.

column3: _Soil_ . . . two _mouths_ . . . _hairpin_. Hint: see _spit_ (Frame 162). The key word carries the wide range of meanings readily associated with it: error, loss, absence, and so on.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2007(188): I **miss** my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big _cross_ , their _mouths_ side by side. I stick _hairpins_ in their graves. CAREFUL: the stroke order/primitive order is: ten, L mouth, R mouth, hairpin. "Soil" is not drawn in its stroke order.
column6: 2) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(104): _Ten_ days ago, our _two mouths_ met for the last time… then she gave me her _hairpin_ as a sayounara gift. How I **miss** my Geisha girl…
column7: 3) [[laxxy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laxxy)] 30-10-2006(76): This kanji means **miss** as in "miss a (dearly departed) person", not as in "miss a target". Here the dearly departed has been buried in the ground, with her favourite hairpin in place of a gravestone, and two mourners stand around crying with open mouths.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-1-2006(15): The miner **miss** es his **miss** (his sweetheart). So much _soil_ is separating his _mouth_ from hers (working as a miner deep below the ground). She left him a _hairpin_ as a good-luck trinket.
column9: 5) [[BooBooQ88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BooBooQ88)] 15-12-2009(12): We tried to kiss ten times but our 2 mouths **MISS** ED every time. She got upset and threw her hairpin at me.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 7-3-2007(198): _Owls_ only **nest** in _fruit trees_.
column6: 2) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 10-8-2007(92): The wise old OWL makes her **nest** out of FRUIT, carving out the middle for her chicks, because then it's less work: no running back  & forth to get food!
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 19-1-2009(34): If only there had been a wise _owl_ **nesting** in the tree of forbidden _fruit_ to warn Eve about the snake.
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 15-5-2008(12): The _owl_ with the biggest _brain_ will **nest** at the very top of a _tree_.
column9: 5) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-6-2007(5): All the little forest creatures bring _fruits_ to the _owl's_ **nest** so they don't get eaten.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 20-12-2006(208): Owls are smart…for this _owl_ everything is **simple** coz his _brain_ is _ten_ times more powerful than mine.
column6: 2) [[nekoyaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nekoyaki)] 8-6-2009(31): For _owl_ s, finding a _needle_ in a _rice field_ is **simple** (much better eyesight than us humans).
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-1-2006(26): A girl who was working at _Hooters_ thought she was going to be fired because her breasts were too small. She went to an acupuncturist who convinced her that planting _needles_ into her _brain_ would increase the size of her breasts. Of course, all that did is she was fired and although she wasn't very smart to begin with, now she's **simple** -minded for life. As a primitive let this kanji be "simple-minded blond girl" (ex- _Hooters Girl_ ). Keep the image distinct from "Hooters Girl" (top 3 strokes).
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 20-3-2008(17): Careful: [simplicity](../v4/1621.html) (#1621 簡). There was an 80's pop group called "Simple Minds" (simple _brains_ ). Their most famous song was "Don't you forget about me" which started out with, "Hey hey hey hey, oouuh oouuh wooah ho-ooh", which kind of sounds like an _owl_ 's "hoo hoo" call. The song became a top _ten_ hit. <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_Minds> Primitive meaning: imbecilic guards from Monty Python/Holy Grail (who can't even understand the **simple** instruction to "stay here and guard the prisoner").
column9: 5) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 6-10-2007(12): "How do you perform a labotomy, _Owl_?" Pooh asks one day. In his characteristically supercilious tone, _Owl_ replies, " **Simple** , my **simple** friend. I shall show you by performing one on myself. You see one just has to remove one's _brain_ , like so, and put it on a _needle_ and then…oh, Pooh, I don't feel very well…." Alas, Pooh is no longer paying attention, because he's currently watching The **Simple** Life, the primitive reading for this kanji.

column5: 1) [[Dragg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dragg)] 22-3-2008(236): George W. Bush's plans for **war** were so SIMPLE. To him, its all just a big FIESTA.
column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 19-1-2009(71): What started out as a _simple fiesta_ , turned into a full-scale **war** after arguments about whose potato salad was the best.
column7: 3) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-10-2005(38): So there's this fiesta in downtown Compton. It's a simple party, but someone invited people from the wrong gangs and the simple fiesta turns into an all- out turf **war**.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-1-2006(27): _Simple-minded blond girl_ (see previous frame) is going to a _fiesta_ , and boy… is this **war** ! She may be simple-minded but she could easily have written The Art of **War**. Only, the woman's version. She has just arrived at the fiesta, she has quickly apprehended the battlefield, taking note of the other competing girls who may pose a threat, and where the good looking guys are. Just watch her dividing the girls, and conquering the boys. I told you, this is **war** !
column9: 5) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 27-6-2012(14): Think Iraq **war** \- Rumsfeld thought it would be _simple_ , but it was no _fiesta_. セン 戦争 せんそう.

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 22-5-2006(203): Knowing **ZEN** ’s emphasis on “nothingness,” it’s not hard to envision a **ZEN** ALTAR being quite clean and SIMPLE.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-1-2006(42): _Simple-minded blond girl_ (see frame 1928) is very good at **Zen** , which isn't surprising since she doesn't think much. She has this bad habit of meditating perched on the main temple _altar_ , which infuriates the **Zen** buddhists. When they get up to her and tell her rudely to step down the _altar_ , she just smiles and teases them : "Not very **zen** are you ?". Who would have thought _simple-minded blond girl_ would teach the **Zen** buddhists a lesson !
column7: 3) [[mairov](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mairov)] 13-3-2008(27): The **Zen** altar is really simple.
column8: 4) [[jonny_wonny](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jonny_wonny)] 23-6-2009(22): Because **Zen** is so _simple_ , you don't need an _alter_ , just a quiet place to sit.
column9: 5) [[Hoticehunter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hoticehunter)] 16-3-2012(8): Guys, if you're just going to make your story some variation of "Zen altars are simple", do you really need to share it publicly? There's 100 other stories saying exactly the same thing. You don't need to check the "share this story" box for every story you make. Don't make people wade through 100 stories that are exactly the same just to find the one that's different and works for them.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 30-3-2007(215): Hunting with a _bow_ is too complicated. I'm switching to something _simpler_ –using a **bullet**.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-2-2007(55): The _bow_ was a weapon for _simple_ times, but nowadays it has been replaced by **bullet** s.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-1-2006(36): Give a _bow_ to _simple-minded blond girl_ (see frame 1928), and she'll try to shoot **bullet** s with it ! When she joined this local archery club she was told she needed some equipment, and guess what she did ? She went to the grocery store and bought some **bullet** s.
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 8-5-2008(16): Bows are rather simple devices compared to things that use **bullet** s.
column9: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 2-7-2009(6): **Bullet** s make _bows_ look _simple_ and obselete.

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 7-10-2007(223): I was taking a picture of my _girlfriend_ under the **cherry tree** during 花見 , when an _owl_ happened to poop on her at the exact moment the shutter snapped. It's really my favorite picture , just don't tell her that.
column6: 2) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 16-2-2008(138): The _tree_ in Japan that represents both wisdom (the _owl_ ) and femininity (the _woman_ ). This is a sakura (さくら), or **cherry tree**.
column7: 3) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 8-9-2007(40): Athena seating against a **cherry tree** with her owl on her shoulder. She is picking cherries and feeding her owl.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 13-4-2007(18): The _woman_ has trained her pet _owl_ to fly to the _tree_ (a **cherry tree** ) and bring her back cherries.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 3-6-2012(11): "There is a _tree_ ," said the wise _owl_ , "where a _woman_ may regain her virginity: the **cherry tree** ".

column3: Owl . . . rice field . . . one . . . mouth . . . chihuahua.
column5: 1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 30-10-2006(311): The _owl_ looks for its prey in the _rice field_. It sees so many potential **animal** s to eat but since it only has _one mouth_ , it decides that the tasty looking _chihuahua_ will be its meal for tonight. (adapted from Copycatken,1-9-2006).
column6: 2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 13-10-2007(77): I have a strange story for this one but it works. I imagine a _owl_ getting into a _rice field_ which serves as a boxing ring. His opponent is a little _chihuahua_. The fight starts, the _owl_ takes _one_ punch to the _mouth_ and is out cold. In the _chihuahua's_ corner is that coach from Rocky saying "Your an **ANIMAL**!!". A vivid image of this story works pretty well for me.
column7: 3) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 1-9-2006(32): The _owl_ looks for its prey in the _rice field_. It sees so many potential **animal** s to eat but since it only has _one mouth_ , it decides that the _dog_ will be its meal for tonight.
column8: 4) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 21-7-2009(22): An OWL in the FIELD looks for an **animal** for dinner, and with ONE MOUTHful consumes a CHIHUAHUA. (simplified from others).
column9: 5) [[eri401](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eri401)] 2-7-2011(16): This kanji is used for sort of monstrous beasts. Imagine a mythical **animal** with an _owl_ 's head and a _dog_ 's body. It is so large that it can devour an entire _rice field_ with _one mouth_. 怪獣 【かいじゅう】 (n) monster, 獣 【けもの(P), けだもの(P), じゅう】 (n) beast, brute.

column3: _Part of the body_ . . . _owl_ . . . _villain_. By way of exception, the kanji for **brain** has no connection with the primitive for _brains_.
column5: 1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 8-9-2007(178): The **brain** is the part of the body that can give you the wisdom of the owl… or the wickedness of the villain.
column6: 2) [[adhmm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adhmm)] 20-6-2008(44): This villain is really messed up. He lets his pet owl eat various pieces of flesh from his body. Right now the owl is on his head, picking out pieces of the villain's **brain**.
column7: 3) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 9-2-2010(18): The **brain** is the _part of the body_ that can make you wise like an _owl_ or devious like a _villain_.
column8: 4) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 17-2-2008(9): While Superheroes and stupider animals rely on brawn, the _part of the body_ that _owls_ and diabolical _villains_ rely on is their **brains**. I know which I like more.
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 8-5-2012(7): Every full _moon_ the _owl_ swoops down on _villains_ , tearing out their **brain** s.

column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-10-2005(123): The owl villain is the one that **trouble** s me most of all the super- villains. He's just so smart… you never know what he'll do! Definitely enough to put you in a **trouble** d state of mind.
column6: 2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 24-12-2007(41): _Data's_ brain quickly allerts him to the state of **trouble** when he see's the _brainy owl villain_.
column7: 3) [[samueruht](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samueruht)] 17-2-2008(39): You have **trouble** s in the _brain_ , not in the _part of the body_ but in your _state of mind_. (see [brain](../v4/1934.html) (#1934 脳)).
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 4-3-2008(29): _Data_ has a solution to the _trouble_ with tribbles. He releases _owls_ which are natural predators of the _villains_ : the tribbles and the Klingons who smuggled them in.
column9: 5) [[Balaam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Balaam)] 5-2-2008(24): We're all in **trouble** if a wise owl has a change in it's state of mind and becomes a villian.

column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 2-11-2005(158): This represents a **stern** looking owl, perched up on a cliff. This cliff is quite famous for daring individuals to cliff dive off of, but is any of them daring enough to threaten the owl?
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 9-3-2008(70): ( 厳しい strict, **stern** ) You remember of course the daring fella who had his ear pierced and went standing in front of the taskmaster. The taskmasters punishment was very **stern** /strict. Fella thrown of the cliff, where the owls are ready to feast. No funny guy doing that anymore.
column7: 3) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 22-1-2008(29): The owl gives a **stern** warning to any animal that dare pass under the cliff.
column8: 4) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 18-7-2007(17): The _owl_ said to Howard **Stern** , "I _dare_ you to jump off this cliff!" **Stern** , with spike in ear, accepted the dare.
column9: 5) [[zanzibar](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zanzibar)] 3-5-2009(11): The **stern** OWL parent throws his young off the CLIFF to test their DARING.

column3: _Metal_ . . . _little_ . . . _shells_. We have saved this character until no win order to draw attention to the visual difference between the _owl_ and _little_. By now your eyes should be so accustomed to these apparently infinitesimal differences that the point is obvious.
column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 18-7-2007(180): The **chain** on this **chain** saw is made of _little_ _metal_ _shells_.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-10-2007(100): A gold **chain** with small seashells hanging on it is in fashion these days.
column7: 3) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 1-11-2008(57): The _metal_ **CHAIN** holding an anchor is covered with _small_ _shellfish_ after being in dock for a while.
column8: 4) [[Corodon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Corodon)] 17-6-2009(26): A _gold_ **chain** costs a _little_ _money_.
column9: 5) [[xingji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xingji)] 11-11-2009(5): The biggest **CHAIN** restaurant manager makes tons of GOLD by taking a LITTLE MONEY from each restaurant of the **CHAIN**.

column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 30-8-2007(245): This is a special _owl_ -luring _tool_. All you need is to **raise** it in your _hand_. _Owl_ will come flying and perch on it right away.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 21-9-2006(77): The _owl_ was asked to **raise** his _hand_ if he needed anything, but he had a wing, not a _hand_! So he made a _tool_ that looked like a _hand_ which he used when he needed to **raise** his _hand_. For **raise** ing, _owl_ has a _tool_ _hand_.
column7: 3) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 30-4-2010(30): When Harry Potter **raise** s his _hand_ , _Hedwig_ brings him a magical _tool_.
column8: 4) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-12-2008(20): "Does anyone know the value of _π_?" Only the _owl_ **raise** s his _hand_.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 19-4-2012(12): What **raise** s mankind above others is the wisdom of an _owl_ , the use of _tools_ , and his _hand_ with an opposable thumb.

column5: 1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 25-8-2006(228): This _owl_ 's **reputation** skyrocketed after he created a _tool_ in order to speak human _words_.
column6: 2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 30-8-2007(62): By _word_ of mouth, _owl_ -luring _tool_ ([raise](../v4/1938.html) (#1938 挙)) gained a **reputation** of amazingly effective and reliable device.
column7: 3) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 30-4-2010(39): Stephen Hawking has a **reputation** of being as smart as an _owl_ but using a _tool_ to _speak_.
column8: 4) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 3-11-2012(9): The wise _owl_ earns its **reputation** not by its use of _tools_ but by its famous _words_ : who, who.
column9: 5) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 7-7-2008(9): The _owl_ is reputed to be a huge f@ &%ing _tool_.

column3: Pack of wild dogs . . . owl . . . wind . . . cornstalk.
column5: 1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 7-7-2007(158): [game- hunting, shooting, game, bag] According to unicode.org and wwwjdic, 鼡 and 鼠 ([mouse](../v4/2065.html) (#2065 鼠)) are variants. So, for 鼡 (which I'll call **rat** ) I have: an _owl_ , flying in the _wind_ , can easily spot a **rat** even if it's hiding in the _cornstalks_. Now 猟 is easy: _wild dogs_ are having fun by **game-hunting** _rat_ s.
column6: 2) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 17-8-2007(129): The WILD DOGS are GAME HUNTING the OWL who flies like the WIND through the CORN STORKS.
column7: 3) [[shakkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shakkun)] 1-7-2008(25): The hunter, with his WILD DOGs to sniff out prey and his trained OWL to scout from the sky, is out **game-hunting** among the CORNSTALKS in a fierce WIND.
column8: 4) [[Mary_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mary_K)] 10-7-2010(12): A _pack of wild dogs_ chases an _owl_ gliding on the _wind_ , who drops _cornstalks_ on them. It's hard to tell who's doing the **game-hunting**.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(11): The right side is also used in 蝋 , meaning "wax" (used in e.g. candle, 蝋燭 , and wax doll, 蝋人形 ). The lower right is 用 with wind instead of canopy. The true meaning of the right side is "many gathering together", and meaning for 蝋 comes from bee nests (bee wax). So, right side: utilization of a multitude of owls in the wind ==> multitude. Multitude of hunting dogs is used in **game- hunting**.

column3: _Dove_ . . . _one_ . . . _tail feathers_. This is, of course, the character from which we derived the primitive meaning of _dove_. Note the lengthening of the second stroke.
column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 18-7-2007(178): There is only _one_ **bird** with such beautiful _white_ tail feathers: the albino _peakcock_.
column6: 2) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(87): The **BIRD** let loose a _WHITE ONE_ from it's _TAIL FEATHERS_ …right on my new car!
column7: 3) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 26-5-2010(53): … tori! My kanji!!!! Finally!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
column8: 4) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 23-11-2009(28): A _white_ **bird** with _one_ massive _tail feather_.
column9: 5) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 1-7-2007(14): Dove one tailfeathers. there is only one **bird** with such beautiful white tail feathers - the dove.

column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 25-10-2005(219): A **chirp** is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds.
column6: 2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 24-7-2008(91): This kanji is not limited to the **chirp** of a _bird_ , but stands for the sound of any kind of animal. Picture a very weird bird that can imitate with its _mouth_ (a bird with mouth, heh) the voice of many different animals: Meeow! Woof! Mooo! Cuack!!! (Maybe the bird has Kirby powers and obtains the abilities of the animals it eats).
column7: 3) [[wilsoncb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wilsoncb)] 4-3-2010(55): Just 100 left to go! [頑張れ！](midori://search?text=頑張れ！) .
column8: 4) [[testoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/testoman)] 23-9-2008(15): Addition to DrJones' story: the bird that can mimic other animals (and then some!) is a Lyrebird. Check <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjE0Kdfos4Y> to see one in action.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 27-7-2011(4): **Chirp** is the sound which comes from the _mouths_ of _birds_.

column3: _Turkey house_ . . . _bird_. The first element appears on only one other occasion, back in frame 609.
column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 2-3-2007(202): The original version of the "Ugly Duckling" was about a **crane** who grew up in a _turkey coop._ All the other _birds_ made fun of it for not having a wattle or a snood or fanning its tail…
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(72): I ordered a **crane** to move my _turkey coop_ , but they sent me this damn _bird_ instead.
column7: 3) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 13-2-2008(47): Do you know how **crane** s came to be? Well, they used to keep the poor _bird_ _cooped_ all the time. But the **crane** really wanted to be free, so it would always streatch its head and neck out of the _coop_ trying to be free.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 5-1-2006(22): The **crane** was the only _bird_ allowed to sleep in the _coop_ (the _turkey house_ ). See, the old turkeys deemed the chicken and most of the other _birds_ inferior… but they wouldn't mess with a majestic **crane**.
column9: 5) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 15-2-2007(18): During the construction of the _Turkey house_ , there was a mistake and instead of ordering a metal **crane** , they got a _bird_ **crane**! Nonetheless, it was happy to help wherever it could.

column3: The only thing that distinguishes this character from that for _bird_ is the omission of the one stroke that makes it _white_. Which is logical enough, when you consider that there are no **crows** of that color.
column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(184): The book's story is just fine, but I found a kanji dictionary explanation also interesting: As **crow** s are all black, it's hard to see where their eyes are (black on black), so a stroke is removed from the part in the pictograph where the eyes would be.
column6: 2) [[squeaky_lill_mk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/squeaky_lill_mk)] 30-6-2009(59): A **crow** is a _bird_ , but _not a white one_. MEANING: write _bird_ , but skip writing _one_ in _white_.
column7: 3) [[dusmar84](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dusmar84)] 11-2-2010(23): When God made **crow** s he took away their _whiteness_ and gave them big _mouths_ instead.
column8: 4) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 21-11-2008(6): The **crow** is a bird with a big mouth (caw! caw!) and no white feathers to be seen.
column9: 5) [[Nick65765](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nick65765)] 16-6-2012(4): **Crow** s are not white birds. brilliant.

column5: 1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(166): In the jungle there is a flowery **vine** called hedera rhombea that attracts humming birds by the dozens. They scoot around the flowers sucking up nectar off the **vine**.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(104): Note : if you'll remember we already have a primitive for "ivy", but it was completely made up from the "square jewel" kanji. The kanji here refers to ivy, or **vine** , and is used in a particular compound for "Hedera rhombea", which is a type of ivy native to Japan. This **vine** here produces a lot of flowers, and attracts many small birds, which is sure to cheer up even the most depressed Japanese gardener.
column7: 3) [[Christoph](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christoph)] 21-2-2007(35): It's strange that you don't often see _flowers_ on **vines** , that's because those sneaky _birds_ keep swooping in and stealing them!
column8: 4) [[Talka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Talka)] 17-9-2007(21): "I heard it through the grapevine" and "a little birdy told me" are actually the same metaphor, linked together by a proverbial flower that's since dropped from both expressions! Or so a bird on a flower grapevine told me…
column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 5-4-2009(8): The _flowery_ **vine** is the one that _birds_ gather around.

column5: 1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 1-3-2008(94): **Pigeon** s are the birds that come in hordes after baseball games to eat all the trash left by fans.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 30-10-2006(47): Imagine some **pigeon** s going to see a _baseball_ game. They would surely be the only _birds_ there!
column7: 3) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(30): A **PIGEON** defecates _NINE_ times as often as other _BIRDS_. Or so it seems.
column8: 4) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 28-5-2009(28): A **pigeon** is a _baseball-bird_. You probably all now the "pigeon explosion", don't you? <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ZdgOQvKaHU>.
column9: 5) [[bananarama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bananarama)] 2-3-2008(25): **Pigeon** s are birds that say "ku" or く . And 九 can be read as く.

column5: 1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 14-8-2007(211): The _vulture's_ _husband_ is a **chicken** …heck…who am I to judge their interspecies love? They're both _birds_ so its cool.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-4-2006(84): A continuation of [mountain stream](../v4/840.html) (#840 渓) (which happens to have the same chinese pronunciation) : the _husband_ who was saved by the _great eagle_ says to his wife that from now on, they will eat **chicken** ! No more fishing hardships and falling in the water.. just raising _birds_. Every now and then the _great eagle_ comes to visit and the man offers one of his **chicken** to the great eagle who had saved his life.
column7: 3) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 29-9-2007(66): Ever since that _eagle_ attacked my _husband_ from above, he acts like a **chicken** whenever he sees a _bird_ , fearing that it might be the eagle who has come back to finish the job.
column8: 4) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 7-10-2007(28): _Homer Simpson_ chases after the _vulture_ who stole his roasted **chicken** dinner.
column9: 5) [[testoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/testoman)] 23-9-2008(8): _Homer Simpson_ circles like a _vulture_ around Marge when she's preparing his favourite bird, **chicken**.

column3: The _bird's tail_ is tucked under here, because it has come to stop on a _mountain_ to rest from its journey across the waters. Thus the kanji comes to mean an **island**.
column5: 1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(176): This **island** is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.
column6: 2) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 8-7-2009(27): On the mountain of the **island**.. there were birds with no tail feathers.
column7: 3) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 4-9-2009(17): From the _bird_ 's point of view, an **island** is a _mountain_ in the middle of water and it is very suitable for resting its tired _tail feathers_.
column8: 4) [[kazelee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kazelee)] 29-8-2008(6): Tweety bird looses his tail feathers and gets stuck on a mountainous **Island**.
column9: 5) [[MisterM2402](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MisterM2402)] 22-2-2011(5): Dragon Roost _Island_ (a _mountain_ -based **island** from The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker) is where the _bird_ -people (Rito) live. You could also think of Valoo perched on top of the _mountain_ **island** like a _bird without feathers_.

column3: Unlike the character for _warm_ weather learned earlier (Frame 1560), this kanji and its key word can also refer to the **warmth** of human congeniality. Its elements are: _sun_ . . . _migrating ducks_.
column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 25-10-2005(240): Ducks migrate south for the winter… they follow the **warmth** of the sun.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-2-2008(58): A massive group of _migrating ducks_ is blocking the **warmth** of the _sun_ as they pass over your house/barbecue/picnic. Their formation is so humongous they block the **warmth** for a good 10 minutes while they pass over. Mnemonic for the _migrating ducks_ primitive : the migrating ducks stick together like the best of _friends_ , flying together _as one_ (fifth stroke), they are not easy prey for the _great eagles / vultures_.
column7: 3) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 19-3-2009(53): Mnemonic for migrating ducks: ducks always migrate together in pairs to protect themselves from vultures–they become friends in the process.
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(22): This is **warmth** of the weather, opposite of 寒 . 温 is of things and feelings, opposite of 冷 . So darg_sama's story is just fine. For more details, see e.g. <http://utuzawa.hp.infoseek.co.jp/sannko.atatakai.htm>. Koujien says [「暖」は気温・空気などに、「温」は身体・料理・気持などに使うことが多い。](midori://search?text=「暖」は気温・空気などに、「温」は身体・料理・気持などに使うことが多い。) .
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 19-9-2008(10): If _ducks migrate_ in search of **warmth** , I wonder why they don't just migrate to the _sun_.

column5: 1) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 17-4-2008(206): You want to know about a **beautiful woman**? There's a _woman_ that's so beautiful, the _birds migrate_ to her instead of the sun!
column6: 2) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 23-7-2006(142): As I saw the most **beautiful woman** on Earth, a flock of _migrating ducks_ passed by and let their poop fly. That just ruined the moment…
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-6-2007(35): Ever seen Fly Away Home? It's the true story about a girl who took in a flock of baby ducks whose parents died, and taught them how to migrate by flying an airplane over their usual migration route. I imagine this girl has become a **beautiful woman** , inside and out.
column8: 4) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 9-9-2007(24): Helen of Troy was known for her beauty – as the "face that launched a thousand ships." In this slightly mangled version of the story, she's the _woman_ who launched a thousand _migrating ducks_.
column9: 5) [[Mary_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mary_K)] 28-7-2010(18): **Beautiful women** are like _migrating ducks_. (They come and go.).

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(225): You **abet** the escape of migrating ducks by pointing them the way.
column6: 2) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 7-7-2008(53): "Aiding and **abet** ting:" You are accuse of **abet** ting a drug dealer, by smuggling drugs in _migrating ducks_. Of course, this means you have to stick your _fingers_ in their mouths.
column7: 3) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 27-10-2009(41): This kanji is in the word 援助 (えんじょ) which means to **support** or assist. The word **abet** suggests that you are helping or **support** ing something that is morally wrong. **Support** is a much better choice for this kanji. Story: The _migrating ducks_ left a little early this year, leaving one duck behind. He gives them the finger and says thanks "Thanks for the **support** , assholes!".
column8: 4) [[coverup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/coverup)] 21-4-2009(23): **Abet**? Nobody uses that word. **Abet** is an onomatopoeia for when you stick your fingers down migrating ducks' throats. That's the noise they make as they gag: "aBET! **aBET**!" Bet you won't forget this now.
column9: 5) [[Dustin_Calgary](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dustin_Calgary)] 20-1-2009(13): Bird Criminal!! Wanted for: Aiding and **ABET** ting, the wrongful MIGRATION OF DUCKS by pointing them in the wrong direction with his FINGERS.

column5: 1) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 11-10-2007(246): Oh no _Spiderman_ has some _migrating ducks_ stuck in his web, he has to **slacken** it so they can get out.
column6: 2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 8-7-2007(35): [slacken, loosen, relax, lessen, be moderate, ease] The _thread_ in this story is a cable line, something like a power or phone line. The _thread_ was tense with all the _migrating ducks_ perched on it, but got back to being **slacken** ed when the entire flock flew away. (darg_sama- modified,2-11-2005).
column7: 3) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 15-6-2006(16): A flock of migrating ducks has been complaining that their leader is flying too fast. So they attach a thread to him, whenever they want him to **slacken** his pace they just give a tug on the thread.
column8: 4) [[jimitha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimitha)] 5-11-2009(13): _Spiderman_ is flying a flock of _migrating ducks_ as one would fly a kite, using his web lines as the _thread_. But he notices the ducks are pulling away hard, threatening to break the line. Then he remembers the advice of dear Aunt May, a noted kite freak: you've gotta **slacken** it. Put some **slack** in it!
column9: 5) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(6): When _Daffy_ and _Spiderman_ go rock climbing, _Spidey_ **slacken** s the rope too much, so that when _Daffy_ falls, he slams on the ground. "Your desp-p-p- picable!", he yells.

column5: 1) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 12-9-2006(188): These bugs **BELONG** TO an extremist group promoting insect independence. They are parading the FLAG of their group, the Nationalist GNATS, and wearing explosives BELTS for their planned terrorist war.
column6: 2) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 14-3-2008(133): [WARNING: violent story] Two teams of **insects** are playing “capture the **flag** ” (ala Unreal Tournament). All of them wear ammunition **belts**. Here you try to take the **flag** of the opponent team, when you are faced by an **insect** : “You’ll get our **flag** over my dead body!”. You reply: “All your base are **BELONG** to us!”, shoot him on the head, take the **flag** and run away. See the **drop** of blood flowing from his head?
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 29-6-2008(77): This kanji is often used like this: The frog **BELONG** S to the amphibian species. STORY: A scientist is trying to classify all the different INSECTS in the forest to find out which species they **BELONG** to. He does this by going from rock to rock, tree to tree, putting a FLAG where he already went, while taking INSECT sample DROPS (small insects/beetles look like DROPS) and DROPPING them into his BELT which is rigged with little jars.
column8: 4) [[fergal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fergal)] 25-11-2009(27): Great picture with a story: <http://forum.koohii.com/viewtopic.php?pid=64390#p64390>.
column9: 5) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 11-12-2007(27): "You don't **BELONG** here!", cried the crowd to the stranger they tied to the FLAG pole with a BELT as swarms of GNATS ate at his flesh. "You don't **BELONG** here!" At that moment, the man began to believe them ^_^.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(184): The commando gnats **entrust** ed their _mouths_ to the translators and what came out was "All your base are _belong_ to us!".
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 25-11-2006(81): If you **entrust** me with something, my _mouth belongs_ to you.
column7: 3) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 7-7-2008(49): You should only open your _mouth_ to **entrust** someone with a secret if they _belong_ in your family.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-9-2009(22): "I have to go out for a few hours. Can I **entrust** you with my two-year- old?" "Okay, sure!" …three hours later… "I'm back … HEY!! Get that thing out of the baby's _mouth_! It doesn't _belong_ there!" (try to make a vivid picture of whatever object you decide the baby is chewing on - pen, razor blade, drill, Picasso painting, whatever… but be careful so that it doesn't get confused with another primitive.).
column9: 5) [[vengeorgeb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vengeorgeb)] 21-5-2009(14): **Entrust** is to confer trust in someone else. My _mouth belongs_ to you and your secret is safely **entrust** ed with me.

column3: The _person_ on the left is familiar. As for the right side, we may combine the _insect_ with a _brain_ (observe the writing) and a _belt_ to create the _Talking Cricket_ who served as Pinocchio's conscience. ( _The belt_ is there because he pulls it off to give unrepentant little Pinocchio a bit of  "strap" now and again.)
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(165): _Mr. T_ **accidentially** stepped on _Jiminy Cricket_ (a brainy insect, with a belt sort of sash to hold his "conscience" badge).
column6: 2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(69): _Mr. T_ **accidentally** steps on _Jiminy Cricket_. // Primitive: right side: _Talking cricket_ = _Jiminy Cricket_ , a _brainy insect_ with a _belt_ to whip little kids who misbehave.
column7: 3) [[jrkester](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jrkester)] 22-4-2009(33): _Mr. T_ **accidentally** the whole _Jiminy Cricket_.
column8: 4) [[nakome](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nakome)] 9-7-2008(30): 禺 is actually a kanji itself, albeit a rarely used one. Despite its several meanings, the most common seems to be a red-eyed, long-tailed, big-headed monkey. Since we already have a primitive that means monkey, I'm going to call this one the _long-tailed, talking monkey_ (borrowing from Heisig a little). STORY: After suffering a slow period of work, _Ace Ventura_ **accidentally** discovered the rare _long-tailed, talking monkey_ and life has been good to him ever since.
column9: 5) [[findus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/findus)] 13-1-2009(12): _Mr. T_ **accidentally** _Jiminy Cricket_.

column5: 1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 15-6-2007(119): I was finally able to score an **interview** with the wisest being around: _Jiminy Cricket_. However, his schedule is really packed, so they had to squeeze me in while his tour bus rode between gigs. In fact, it was really short—after a few miles I was kicked out of the bus and stranded in the middle of the _interstate_. But man, it was worth it!
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(96): On the _road_ to my **interview** I _accidentally_ bump into _Jiminy Cricket_ who gives me some good advice.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(40): "Interview" is a bit of a stretch, as this means "to meet accidentally". The place where person accidentally met the crickety fellow was on the road somewhere. It was, in a way, like a sudden **interview** : in both cases person just wants to get away fast.
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 16-3-2009(19): I see Jiminy Cricket standing on the side of he road, holding out his thumb. "Where are you going?" I ask. "To a job **interview**!" he says. Even conscience's are losing their jobs lately!
column9: 5) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 12-9-2006(12): JIMINY CRICKET is on the ROAD doing a promotional tour. He's doing lots of impromptu **INTERVIEW** S, smoking lots of dope, and having lots of chance encounters with hot groupie bitches.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 15-3-2007(190): "Don't be **foolish**!" says _Jiminy Cricket_ as he lashes you with his belt. Follow logic, like me, not your _heart_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 20-3-2007(39): I simply imagine _Jiminy Cricket_ jumping all over the place, like a mad man, yelling "yeeeeehaaaaa!". Maybe he just fell in love? Mnemonic - " _Jiminy Cricket_ has a **foolish** _heart_ ".
column7: 3) [[redskatz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/redskatz)] 8-4-2009(31): It'd be **foolish** to follow _Jiminy Cricket's_ advice in matters of the _heart_. After all, you never see him around any girl crickets, do you?
column8: 4) [[busaiku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/busaiku)] 7-1-2010(11): "Do you think I'll ever have an _heart_ like a real child" asks Pinoccio to _Jiminy Cricket_. In an unexpected reaction, he laughs at him:"My dear child, that's the **foolish** thing I ever heard". Boy, those old fairy tales sure were crude.
column9: 5) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 2-5-2009(10): I know you think it was **foolish** of me to give my _heart_ to a _long tailed monkey_ 禺, but we have a healthy relationship based on mutual love and trust! … Okay, maybe we're both just idiots.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(153): _Jiminy Cricket_ has a favorite **corner** he likes to slip into at _The Pinnacle_ for a long drink.
column6: 2) [[Angrybeez](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Angrybeez)] 20-5-2008(51): Oh how the pious fall from their lofty _pinnacles_! _Jiminy Cricket_ now deals drugs on the street **corner**.
column7: 3) [[zanzibar](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zanzibar)] 3-5-2009(38): If you behave badly at THE PINNACLE, JIMINY CRICKET will send you to sit in the **corner**.
column8: 4) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 8-8-2010(17): Long- tailed monkeys are showing up in every nook and **corner** of the Acropolis. Thanks to laxxy for the following distinction: [隅々・に](midori://search?text=隅々・に) 「すみずみ・に」： "(in) every n0ok and **corner** ", vs. 角 「かど」 for "street **corner** , desk **corner** , etc.".
column9: 5) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(10): In the **corner** of the _Acropolis_ lives the famous sooth sayer _Jiminy Cricket_ , who people from all over come to visit to hear their fortune.

column5: 1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 25-10-2005(215): There's a road that's been **inverted** \- it's gone from horizontal to directly vertical! The only beast that could possibly climb it is a mountain goat of course.
column6: 2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(94): This reminds me of a cartoon I saw once, perhaps it was with Donald Duck. he is startled and furious when he chases this mountain billygoat further and further up the mountain road, untill the angle is so steep that he finds himself **inverted**. And falls down, while the goat stands solidly placed **inverted** and laughs a goaty laughter as Donald plumments and makes that typical Donald shaped cartoon crater at the bottom.
column7: 3) [[lankydan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lankydan)] 28-9-2007(30): _Mountain goat_ **inverted**. _Horns_ stuck in _road_.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 13-4-2007(26): You see a _mountain goat_ on the _road_. Suddenly it is hit by a vehicle. The _mountain goat_ somersaults through the air and lands back on the _road_ **inverted**.
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 25-10-2009(12): The _mountain goat_ had been hit by a car and lay **inverted** on the _road_.

column3: This kanji depicts the art of **modeling** clay or wood into a figure of your choice. The elements for composing it are: _mountain goat_ . . . _moon_ . . . _soil_.
column5: 1) [[samueruht](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samueruht)] 15-2-2008(215): A legend says that if you **model** a _mountain goat_ (with tail and everything) from dirt and leave to the light of the moon on the [first day of the month](../v4/2846.html) (#2846 朔), the _dirt_ will became _flesh_. (blackstockc).
column6: 2) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 28-1-2008(74): If you **model** a mountain goat from "soil" and leave it under the full "moon," it will come to life.
column7: 3) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 15-6-2007(36): Think of a Chia Pet. One of the very first **model** s was a _mountain goat made entirely of soil_ , but it wasn't stable at all. The soil would crack and dry up in sunlight, so the only way to give a soil-based Chia Pet some light was to leave it in the _soft glow of the full moon_. They were spectacular, but the clay **model** s soon proved to be easier to sell.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 22-11-2007(35): Tip: _mountain goat_ and _moon_ are later combined into [first day of the month](../v4/2846.html) (#2846 朔).
column9: 5) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 26-12-2008(9): The _mountain goat_ , who has the cow as its role **model** , also tried to jump over the _moon_. Unfortunately it couldn't even lift itself off the _ground_.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(56): On the _first day of the month_ , all the salmon **go upstream** , up the _road_ , to the mating grounds.
column6: 2) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 29-7-2010(22): You accidentally ran over and killed the holy _mountain goat_ on the _road_. Frightened by the view of the dead _body_ and to save your own _body_ from the angry villagers, you decide to run away from your bloodstained vehicle, jump into the river, and **go upstream** to hide your tracks.
column7: 3) [[manubear](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/manubear)] 10-8-2012(7): You decide to go salmon fishing, so you ride a _mountain goat_ to the top of the _road_. Under the light of the _moon_ , as it's illegal, you catch the salmon **going upstream**.
column8: 4) [[Puchatek](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Puchatek)] 12-8-2011(5): In this kanji we see a _mountain goat_ that decided to **go upstream** along a _road_ , but for some reason it will only **go upstream** when the full _moon_ is up. It's actually stubborn like a _mountain goat_ about not going upstream along the _road_ at any other period of time. The _road_ itself is also very confused about this.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(5): On the _first day of the month_ the _road_ to **go upstream** is opened for salmon fisherman.

column3: Here we see a _mountain goat_ " **mounted** " under a _glass canopy_. In this and the following frames, think of a particular **Mount** you know.
column5: 1) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 16-2-2008(235): White **mount** , Fuji **mount** , olympus **mount** whatever ….The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir : under a GLASS HOOD you can see the **mount** with a MOUTAIN GOAT standing on top of it …. So kitsch you just can't forget it .
column6: 2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 22-3-2007(50): Note: Stroke order is belt..horns..mountain, not the same as _mountain goat_.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(39): This has the same meaning as 丘 , so my "Mount" is a hill with **mount** ain goats on it under a glass canopy. It's obviously an effort by the locals to add some **Mount** atmosphere to their hill. As a primitive, it has the meaning "sturdy" (really), which Heisig has not used for some reason, but I will. The glass canopy must be pretty sturdy to keep the goats inside (bulletproof glass, I'm sure).
column8: 4) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 31-3-2008(17): Goat + belt = _S &M goat_. Don't think too much on the image or you'll regret it forever. The goat loves the **mount** and it also loves to **mount**.
