column9: 5) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(13): My **Mount** is the **Mount** in Dun Morogh where the dwarven capital of Ironforge nestles inside. At the gates to Ironforge you see a bronze **mount** ain goat guarding the entrance, in glass canopy for visitors to watch. This particular goat is the first goat of king Magni Bronzebeard.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(117): _Mount_ Fuji is completely made up of a _metal_ known as **steel**.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(46): Sturdy metal is obviously **steel** (see previous frame).
column7: 3) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 30-10-2006(35): On the trail up _Mount Fuji_ , the curators have put up _metal_ railings for safety in some of the otherwise hazardous parts of the climb. The particular metal they used was stainless _steel_ , so that it wouldn't rust in the rain and snow.
column8: 4) [[nexirae](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nexirae)] 11-6-2009(26): **Steel** is the METAL forged in the fires of MOUNT DOOM.
column9: 5) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(9): A giant **steel** Mecha-Godzilla, made entirely of _metal_ climbs atop _Mt. Fuji_ and lets out a furious roar.

column5: 1) [[Terhorst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Terhorst)] 21-12-2007(183): _Spiderman_ saves Japan from floating away by tying _Mt. Fuji_ to mainland Asia using a **hawser** made of web.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(46): A sturdy thread is equally obviously **hawser** (heavy rope). (see previous frame).
column7: 3) [[burento5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/burento5)] 25-6-2008(38): Easy. In order to climb Mount Fuji you're going to need a strong type of thread, a **hawser** (heavy rope).
column8: 4) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(16): After _Spiderman_ landed his ship in Japan and used his webbing as a **hawser** to tie the boat to the dock, he looked p and caught his first glimpse of the majestic _Mt. Fuji_.
column9: 5) [[mistamark](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mistamark)] 25-1-2009(8): Using a _thread_ to climb that _Mount_. isn't a good idea, you need a **hawser**.

column5: 1) [[adhmm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adhmm)] 25-11-2007(188): Mount everest is very **sturdy** , you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble.
column6: 2) [[samusam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samusam)] 17-2-2008(54): Anything **sturdy** in Japan is associated with _Mount_ Fuji. Perhaps this is because it's symmetry is believed to make it rather **sturdy** itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see **Sturdy** -brand _sabers_ with _Mount_ Fuji engraved on the blade.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(31): This is the full character for **sturdy** , to which saber is added as an example of a **sturdy** thing. (the true etymology of 岡鋼綱剛 is a bit more messy, but I don't really care, this way it's easy to remember, and isn't far from the truth anyway).
column8: 4) [[Hujis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hujis)] 26-5-2009(15): Remember the sword in the stone. This is the _saber_ in the top of _Mt —_. It's so **sturdy** almost no one can pull it out.
column9: 5) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(12): The most **sturdy** _sabers_ are made on **sturdy** _Mount_ Fuji.

column3: Though the meaning has no reference to animals, the parts do: _horse_ with a _mountain_ underneath.
column5: 1) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 13-7-2006(245): Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this **tin can** would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(62): The starving _horse_ , stranded on the _mountain_ , is forced to eat a tasty **tin can**.
column7: 3) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 1-5-2010(33): Hint: pictograph of a _horse_ standing in a _tin can_. No need for mountain.
column8: 4) [[ezmoreldo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ezmoreldo)] 3-7-2008(32): Mountains can be pretty rough on horses' hooves so it might help to put **tin can** s on each hoof as an extra horseshoe.
column9: 5) [[Mary_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mary_K)] 19-6-2009(18): By _noon,_ the _mountain_ is covered with _tin cans_.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(145): At _The Pinnacle_ , traditional **pottery** is done by _binding_ up a bunch of _tin cans_ into whatever pot shape desired.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(54): In order the get clay up to the _Acropolis_ for the **pottery** class, clay is packed into _tin cans_ , _bound_ in huge loads, and lugged up there by some unfortunate soul.
column7: 3) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 11-3-2008(45): **Pottery** is an obsolete art up in the super-modern Utopia of _The Pinnacle_ … instead, they _bind up_ everything they need to preserve in high-tech _tin cans_.
column8: 4) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 11-10-2007(24): At _The Pinnacle_ they refuse to use _tin cans_ and so they have been _bound up_ , they will only use **pottery**.
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 7-1-2006(22): This chinese man was making the best china **pottery** in all of … China. For some reason he insisted on working at the top of a _pinnacle_ , away from the distractions of the world. He kept in touch with the local people, and took orders, through _bound tin cans_ (tin cans bound with rope, the children's version of the telephone).

column5: 1) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 4-9-2008(174): For the _condor_ primitive: A **condor** is like a _vulture_ , but _twice_ as big and it lives near _mountains_ (a suitable place for such a majestic bird). For **swing** : I'm sitting on a **swing** when a _condor_ comes by and picks up the whole **swing** set with its big _finger_ -like claws and now I'm **swing** ing in mid-air. Weeeeeeeee!!!!!
column6: 2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 15-6-2007(141): I keep **swing** ing gleefuly on the talons of the _soaring condor_ until he slices off my _fingers_ and sends me plummeting.
column7: 3) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 8-2-2008(27): I don't recommend using king as a primitive for condor, the stroke order is wrong. Vulture Dry Mountain or even Vulture Two Mountains should work better.
column8: 4) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 31-3-2008(22): This kanji is for **tremors** and **shakes**. It perfectly illustrates the good ol' joke of **shaking** a beverage _tin can_ in your _fingers_. And then laugh when another person opens the can with his/her _nails_ (claws) and gets totally soaked! ( _Tin can_ loses the left stroke because it has no pull tab).
column9: 5) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 18-3-2008(13): I am sure you have heard this on the trains in Japan: [「これから揺れますので、ご注意ください」](midori://search?text=「これから揺れますので、ご注意ください」) So imagine that the train does **SWING** and SHAKE. This gives ちかん's the opportunity to pretend like they fell and grab a feel on a nearby girl like a CONDOR would with their claws.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 26-4-2007(280): **Noh chanting**?!? I meant "NO CHANTING!" Now all you, just shut up! Not another _word_! Don't you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local _condor_? So, no chanting, and especially no **Noh chanting**.
column6: 2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 25-11-2008(42): Picture guy dressed in a condor mask up on stage during Noh performance chanting some words nobody understands.
column7: 3) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 18-5-2006(15): In the Andes flies the mythical **Noh Chanting** condor. You can barely spot this king of birds high up in the sky yet you hear its chanting words flow down to the ground.
column8: 4) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 10-12-2009(12): **Noh chanting** is simply _words_ which sound like that a _vulture_ would make.
column9: 5) [[colinsky](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/colinsky)] 21-1-2009(5): **noh chanters** chant their _words_ in masks that look like _condors_ (condor = the vulture king of the mountain.).

column3: Learning this character will take a little doing. Before we start, it is a good idea to keep the key word distinct from _melancholy_ (Frame 663), with which it combines to create the psychological condition of depression (a metaphor based on the hollow or sinking of the material _depression_ we met in Frame 1421). The picture of **gloom** begins with a small _grove_ of trees, under which we see a _crown_ made out of used _tin cans_. Next (the lower half of the kanji) we find a combination that appears only a few times in modern characters and only once in those treated in the volumes of _Remembering the Kanji_. It is composed of a _shovel_ with a _sheaf_ dotted with small _drops_ on all sides. Think of it as a large scoop _shovel_ attached to the front of a bulldozer, whose driver is singing: ♪  "Bulldozing in the _sheaves_ , bulldozing in the _sheaves_... " ♪ The _drops_ represent the chaff flying about as the _sheaves_ are tossed about by the heavy machinery. There is _someone sitting on the ground_ alongside, watching as the machinery makes its way around the neighboring farmland - and it's you, wearing your _tin-can crown_. You feel overwhelmed by the impending doom as the invasion of agro- business draws closer and closer to the _grove_ , the only patch of woods that remains of what once was a vast forest. The whole scene represents a re- _shaping_ of the natural environment that brings the heavy weight of **gloom** down upon you. A bit much, perhaps, but there are enough elements to allow for any number of other combinations.
column5: 1) [[mcbainpc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcbainpc)] 26-4-2010(76): I'm depressed that this kanji has 29 strokes.
column6: 2) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 1-3-2012(49): In the middle of the GROVE you find a TIN CAN. There's a CROWN inside! You are very excited with your finding, but then a figure appears behind you: "Hey, gimme that kid!" You turn back and it's WOLVERINE, with a SHOVEL on his back and all COVERED IN [rocksalt](../v4/2866.html) (#2866 鹵) "I found that crown in the rocksalt mines over there, so hand it over!" Unless you wanna die, you hand him the crown and he goes away. Then you SIT ON THE FLOOR, feeling impotent, and the SHAPE of your face becomes all **GLOOMY ☹ (The 終 !)**.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 2-6-2011(22): A popular mnemonic device for this character is: リンカーンはアメリカンコーヒーを３杯飲んだ . Here's how it works: [リンカーンは⇒林＋缶＋ワ](midori://search?text=リンカーンは⇒林＋缶＋ワ) [アメリカンコーヒーを⇒米＋コ＋ヒ](midori://search?text=アメリカンコーヒーを⇒米＋コ＋ヒ) [３杯飲んだ⇒ノ＋ノ＋ノ](midori://search?text=３杯飲んだ⇒ノ＋ノ＋ノ) .
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 3-11-2009(16): Note: 鬱 and 欝 [depressed](../v4/2856.html) (#2856 欝) are variants. In such cases it may be easier to use the same keyword, calling the other kanji "keyword (alt)". 鬱 is the more common of the two and is in the new Joyo kanji list.
column9: 5) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 14-11-2009(8): **Sulky** : let the bottom left 鬯 (rock salt + spoon) = salt shaker: The kid in the restaurant is **sulky** when the _salt shaker_ and _can_ of coke spills all over his cardboard ( _wooden_ ) birthday crown, creating a massively _shaped_ sticky puddle all over the floor.

column3: _Capital_ . . . _chihuahua_ with a _human leg_ in place of one of its paws.
column5: 1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 8-12-2006(279): In the _capital_ they have been having hearings **concerning** bioethics and bioengineering they call as their first witness a _chihuahua_ with _one human leg_.
column6: 2) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(58): Ahem… **CONCERNING** your recent science fair project, it was a _CAPITAL_ idea, but the _CHIHUAHUA with a HUMAN LEG_ is freaking out the other contestants!
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 2-5-2009(44): Note: [understandably](../v4/2087.html) (#2087 尤) In the capital, there are hearings **concerning** bioengineering. Understandably, the piece of evidence that those in attendance found most shocking was the chihuahua with a human leg. Adapted from taijuando's version.
column8: 4) [[Tornadic_Indignation](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tornadic_Indignation)] 31-7-2009(17): OBVIOUSLY IT'D BE **CONCERNING** IF SOME GUY CUT OFF ONE OF HIS CHIHUAHUA'S LEGS AND TRADED IT WITH ONE OF HIS OWN AND THEN POSTED THE PICTURES ON SOME INTERNET FORUM USING ALL _CAPITAL_ LETTERS LIKE THIS WHILE TYPING. I WOULD BE VERY MUCH AFRAID. YES.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 8-4-2007(11): In **Concerning** Hobbits, Tolkien writes about Hobbiton, which is sort of the _capital_ of the Shire. Understandably, they keep chihuahuas as dogs, and one of them has a human leg. Magic, probably.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(85): The soccer player was _concerned_ that his _peg leg_ would affect his ability to **kick**.
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(17): It wasn't **kick** boxing at its finest, me in one corner with my _wooden leg_ and my opponent the _chihuahua with one human leg_ in the opposite corner. _Understandably_ the hoi polloi were fascinated, but how we got a venue in _the capital_ I'll never know.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 10-8-2009(10): We are here _concerning_ your animal cruelty. Because you **kick** ed all the chihuahuas in the capital, we are going to remove your _foot_ as punishment.
column8: 4) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 14-12-2008(10): I **kick** with my FEET in the CAPITAL of all the ONE LEGGED CHIHUAHUAS. It is such a great fun, since they cannot **kick** me back! lol.
column9: 5) [[halfdam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/halfdam)] 30-6-2011(7): The pirate was reading the manual for his new wooden leg, and there was a whole section concerning how to use the wooden leg for **kick** ing.

column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 15-10-2006(181): The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He's a very **sociable** skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love).
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-11-2005(89): The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He's a very **sociable** skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver.
column7: 3) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 23-6-2008(62): (コン) Skunk and silver appear together in a few kanji so I combined them to make a _silver skunk_ character. This skunk, due to a random fluke, is not black and white, but actually silver colored. Which means this skunk can pass, say for, a cat (aka Over the Hedge). When the skunk realized the odd coloring wasn't a curse but actually a blessing, it realized in it's _heart_ that it could be **sociable** with all sorts of animals that normally would run away from smelly skunks.
column8: 4) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(18): The skunk is very **sociable** at the party, telling everyone all about his _silver_ _heart_. // Primitive: top left: _skunk_ = a skunk _clawing_ at a _sow_. The 3rd claw gets broken.
column9: 5) [[mentat_kgs](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mentat_kgs)] 19-7-2008(14): I'm using the top of the kanji as a lawyer: The lawyer is nothing but a skunk dressed in a silver suit. Also lawyers have no heart, they only fake it to be **sociable**.

column3: The **groundbreaking** referred to here is not for the erection of new buildings but for the opening of farmlands. The elements: _skunk_ . . . _silver_ . . . _soil_.
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 25-5-2007(178): It was the **groundbreaking** of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous _skunk_ , the one with the familiar _silver_ stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the _soil_ very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the **groundbreaking** was a great success.
column6: 2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 2-1-2007(39): I got sprayed by a skunk, so no one is helping me with the **groundbreaking** of my farm. On a positive note, I found silver laying all over the soil. Mine all mine!
column7: 3) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 23-6-2008(30): (コン) The [sociable](../v4/1970.html) (#1970 懇) _silver skunk_ might not look like a skunk, but when it lets it smell fly, it's so bad it actually leaves craters. That's right - it's **groundbreaking**.
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 21-1-2009(24): _Pepe Le Pew's_ **groundbreaking** idea to fertilize _soil_ with skunk fumes didn't really take off - the crops grew better than ever before, but nobody could stand the smell.
column9: 5) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 10-12-2009(6): The _silver tailed skunk_ has discovered a **groundbreaking** way to make skunks not smell, maybe that's explains why he's so [sociable](../v4/1970.html) (#1970 懇).

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 1-6-2008(54): Skunk, white, human legs: You should have seen the shocked **countenance** on the girls' face when she saw the _skunk_ nibbling away at the _white human legs_ of the corpse she found in the woods. (Because of that, and the smell of course).
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-7-2007(21): He counters, "Your _legs_ are so _white_ , all I would have to do is apply some black and they would be the perfect **countenance** of a _skunk_!".
column7: 3) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 17-10-2008(13): The shocked **countenance** on girl's face when Pepe started to hump her white legs.
column8: 4) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 14-9-2009(9): Anyone who watched a looney tunes cartoon know those kind of scene : pepe embraces a poor kitty mistaken for a SKUNK and the smell of pepe make the unfortunate girl loose all **countenance** : she turns WHITE then runs as fast as her LEGS can carry her . So much for cat s dignity and **countenance**.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 10-11-2010(3): _Pepe LePew's_ **countenance** isn't so bad, it's the smell that makes everyone turn _white_ and dash off on their _human legs_!

column3: This character is used for **excusing** oneself for a failure of courtesy. The elements are: _bound up_ . . . _sun_ (oddly enough, laid on its side) . . . _human legs_.
column4: * For the primitive meaning, we shall refer to this character as a _rabbit_ , for which the old form of the character is 兔.
column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(203): Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in [rabbit](../v4/2093.html) (#2093 兎).
column6: 2) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 7-1-2008(48): What is the rabbit's **excuse** for being such a jerk? Well he was b _ound up for a whole day_ while being stepped on by peoples _human legs_ in some make-up labratory. Yeah I think I can **excuse** him after knowing that.
column7: 3) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 3-7-2009(43): '' **Excuse** me.'' Jessica **Rabbit** walks past you, _bound up_ in a red sequinned dress in which her voluptuous _tatas_ are sublimely complemented by her long _legs_.
column8: 4) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 7-12-2006(18): The _rabbit_ always thinks that "Trix are for kids!" is a terrible **excuse** for stealing his breakfast.
column9: 5) [[tinonet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tinonet)] 30-1-2010(15): This is a _Bugs Bunny_ with _bound_ up ears and big _teeth in the mouth_. As you know, he has kinda _human legs_ as well….So he says: Eeeeh, **EXCUSE** me, what's up Doc?

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(114): Tip : as a primitive _rabbit_ becomes Bugs Bunny of Looney Tunes fame. Here _Bugs Bunny_ **elude** s Elmer Fudd the hunter, once again.
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 5-2-2008(100): _Bugs Bunny_ **elude** s Elmer Fudd by pretending to be _road_ kill.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(55): Word play to differentiate **elude** /evade: **elude** ~= e-lewd. Alice is following Mr. _Rabbit_ on the _road_. Mr. Rabbit flashes her in a lewd way and disappears, completely **eluding** her.
column8: 5) [[b0ng0](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/b0ng0)] 17-2-2009(15): A _rabbit_ on the _road_ has a hard time **eluding** cars.

column5: 1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 9-9-2007(233): At **nightfall** the _sun excuses_ itself and goes to sleep.
column6: 2) [[Asriel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asriel)] 13-7-2009(93): This is EASY!!! Japanese people see a RABBIT ON THE MOON (<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_rabbit> ) and so **nightfall** is when the _sun_ leaves to make way for the _rabbit_.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 5-2-2006(59): Imagine _Bugs Bunny_ halfway sticking out of a _rabbit_ hole, somewhere in Japan, taking in the _sun_ , when all of a sudden, night falls. Our " _sun- loving rabbit_ " burrows his way into the earth and pops out on the other side of the planet (say somewhere in America) and there it is, the _sun_ high and bright in the sky! Thus, whenever it is **nightfall** you can be sure our " _sun-loving rabbit_ " is taking in the _sun_ somewhere else accross the globe.
column8: 4) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 10-3-2008(34): _Bugs Bunny_ watches the _sun_ go down at **nightfall**. "Eeeeh…That's all folks!".
column9: 5) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(9): Mr. _Rabbit_ watches the _sun_ go down. **Nightfall** is coming and he hasn't made it to the queen's yet!

column3: _Rabbit_ . . . _muscle_. Notice how the last stroke of _rabbit_ is stretched out to underlie the element for _muscle_.
column5: 1) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 14-9-2006(149): Notice how BUGS BUNNY's legs (hint about stroke extension) are starting to get big MUSCLES? It must be because he's always EXERTING himself on the run from Elmer Fudd (or from kicking the shit out of Elmer Fudd when he catches up!!).
column6: 2) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 8-2-2008(89): Hint: Energizer bunny.
column7: 3) [[raseru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raseru)] 16-6-2008(38): The energizer bunny's **exertion** of power keeps going and going…
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(12): _Bugs Bunny_ spares himself the **exertion** of _muscle_ power. Instead, he **studies** and tricks Fudd every time.
column9: 5) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 21-6-2008(10): The _trix rabbit's_ latest scheme to get the trix: Dress up with fake _muscles_ like a body builder and amaze the kids as he lifts dumbbells. He accidentally uses real dumbbells though, and despite all his **exertion** , the kids discover his disguise. Geez, he really **exerts** himself in all these weird schemes… you'd think it would just be easier to go to the store and buy a box.

column3: A _rabbit_ 's head with the body of a _sow_ represents an **elephant**. Little wonder that the kanji also means  "phenomenon"!
column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 14-10-2006(288): An **elephant** has huge ears, like a _rabbit_ , and a big, fat body, like a _sow_.
column6: 2) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 7-3-2008(28): An animal with huge **ears like a rabbit** , and **a body fat like a pig** … ¡An **ELEPHANT**! For the "phenomenon" connotation you could use Dumbo, or Joseph Merrick (the "elephant man") ( <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Merrick> ).
column7: 3) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 17-10-2007(16): With huge _rabbit_ ears, and a body fat like a _pig_ , the **elephant** has an **image** problem for sure (しょう)! NOTE: This kanji also means 'image'.
column8: 4) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 23-1-2008(8): See book.
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 13-3-2011(4): An **elephant** has the head and ears of a _hare_ and the body of a _pig_ , at least in proportion.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(226): The **statue** of liberty is being replaced by a **statue** of _Mr. T_ riding an _elephant_.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 1-10-2006(61): In India, you see a lot of **statue** s of the Hindu god Ganesha. Easy to recognize: he's the _person_ with the _elephant_ head.
column7: 3) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(24): Mr. T is shocke of this bizarre **statue** of an elephant with rabbits floppy ears and the tails of a sow. I pity da fool who made this bullshit **statue**. What is it supposed to look like?
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(11): _Haruhi_ made a **statue** of her riding an _elephant_ for Indian people to worship.
column9: 5) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 8-2-2008(11): The famous hachiko **statue** ( ハチ公像 ) has been replaced by a **statue** of _[insert your person here]_ riding an _elephant_ causing the outrage of millions of japanese.

column3: Let the extra vertical stroke in the _mane_ combine with the first vertical stroke to give an image of the **horse's** long neck. The only odd thing is the _tail feathers_ at the end, but that should present a good image to remember the character by. The fact that the last stroke of _mane_ and the first of _tail feathers_ coincide should no longer surprise you.
column4: * As a primitive, this kanji will mean a _team of horses_ as distinct from the single _horse_ whose primitive we met earlier.
column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(124): Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then **horse** s are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail "feathers". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.
column6: 2) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 18-1-2012(42): **FINALLY!! Geeeeeeeeeez!!!**.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 9-1-2006(36): The top part is _half a comb_ (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a **horse** mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the _Trojan **Horse**_. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden **horse** which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live **horse** ), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the _horse_ primitive that came in frame 568 ("noon").
column8: 4) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 10-3-2008(24): 4 dots = 4 limbs, the hook = tail, top part = manes.
column9: 5) [[jotakami](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jotakami)] 7-4-2010(13): This kanji needs no mnemonic, really. It's used often enough as a primitive that you would have to have Alzheimer's to forget it. If you write each kanji once, as Heisig recommends, then the stroke order will also come naturally.

column3: _Team of horses_ . . . _phrase_. In American slang, a **pony** is an underground translation of a classical text, which students who cannot manage the difficult _phrases_ of the original language consult and pass on from one generation to the next.
column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(207): The cute little innocent-looking plastic **pony** on the desk of a student is in fact a _trojan horse_ , hiding _phrases_ in its belly which are used for cheating during an exam. No **pony** will be permitted on desks during tests!
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-10-2007(94): A particular My Little **Pony** has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like "I love you".
column7: 3) [[Balaam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Balaam)] 7-2-2008(28): A phrase used to insult horses - is **pony**. They hate that.
column8: 4) [[WithLoveFromExIA](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/WithLoveFromExIA)] 20-6-2009(15): Lisa Simpson often utters the _phrase_ "Can I have a **pony**? Can I have a **pony**? Can I have a **pony**?". Finally Marge snaps "No, not until you're older!" "But mum, it will be a _horse_ by then.".
column9: 5) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(12): The **Pony** Express was a quick mail delivery service in old America. It actually used horses, not ponies, but the _phrase_ "Pony Express" sounded better than "Horse Express", and so they chose the better-sounding phrase as a marketing gimmick.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-3-2007(211): We just **verification** that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan _horse_. We're just gonna stab it in the belly with this _awl_ to check.
column6: 2) [[raseru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raseru)] 16-6-2008(40): The **verification** proves the horse is real by poking it with an ice pick.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 9-1-2006(20): Here we have a French _trojan horse_ undergoing **verification** by the British police, or immigration, or other authority. The British police are punching into the _trojan horse_ 's sides with an _awl_ , to try and find if it is concealing people. Of course they aren't going to find much by using an _awl_ for that purpose (the _awl_ having such a short tip), but the sillyness of it should be enough to remember it.
column8: 4) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 23-1-2008(13): Verify the horse is genuine by poking it with an awl.
column9: 5) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 26-11-2008(11): They finally came up with a **verification** system to make sure that giant wooden horses weren't _trojan horses_. _Frankenstein_ comes up and slaps the hell out of the side of each wooden horse. If it's hollow and soldiers are discovered inside, the **verification** process is complete and the _trojan horse_ is destroyed before it's brought into the city.

column5: 1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(153): If the **equestrian** team used _trojan horses_ , it would be really _strange_.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-10-2007(103): **Equestrian** events are where you get horses to do strange things.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(37): **Equestrian** is a _strange_ word that just means _horses_.
column8: 4) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 31-5-2009(15): I always thought it was STRANGE that **EQUESTRIAN** was in the Olympics. Why don't we give the HORSES medals? They do all the work.
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 10-3-2008(8): The St Bernard with his mouth nailed shut is ready to participate in the equesterian race. But he is sitting on a Torjan horse that wont budge.

column5: 1) [[ithil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ithil)] 5-4-2007(133): **Parking** in the dark may be difficult…specially if you're **parking** a _trojan horse_. To lend you a tiny bit of help, take this _candlestick_ with you, and at least you'll have some light.
column6: 2) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 21-1-2007(63): In the olden days **parking** lots used to have reserved spaces for where the _lord_ (of the set of houses, shops, whatever) could park his _team of horses_. nowadays it's pretty much the same…reserved **parking** in front for the big bosses' cars….
column7: 3) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 25-4-2008(45): (Heard inside the belly of the trojan horse) "But the sign says No _Trojan Horse_ **Parking** , m' _lord_ ." (Think monty python skit).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(29): A _lord_ gets valet **parking** for his _horse_.
column9: 5) [[zodiac](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zodiac)] 22-8-2009(21): In the olden days you had to park your _horse_ next to a _candlestick_ , a primitive **parking** meter that you start by lighting a fire and tracks the time by burning down.

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 9-10-2007(119): You have to be craaazzzzyy to **drive** a buggy led by a _team of horses_ through a _ward_ of Tokyo!
column6: 2) [[cords](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cords)] 13-7-2008(62): Wolverine **drive** s his box by having a horse drag him around. He seems to really be losing it after coming to the homeless ward…
column7: 3) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 10-7-2007(37): [drive, run, gallop, advance, inspire, impel] You thought you were downloading a **driving** game into your _X-Box_ hard **drive** , but it was actually a _trojan horse_!
column8: 4) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 15-4-2007(33): The kiddie uses a mini _Trojan horse_ to **drive** around the hospital _ward_.
column9: 5) [[melchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/melchan)] 28-7-2009(22): In this new _Xbox_ game you have to **drive** a _trojan horse_ through the _wards_ of Tokyo.

column5: 1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(215): Anyone living in Japan knows that train **station** s play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when _horses_ and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his _shakuhachi_ to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next **station**.
column6: 2) [[jreaves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jreaves)] 23-7-2007(160): This reminds me of those infamous Mexican porn movies in which shakuhachi is performed on a horse. Here the deed is being done at a train **station**. As the passengers get off, so does the horse.
column7: 3) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(27): I got off at the **station** and saw a _trojan horse_ getting a _shakuhachi_ (blowjob).
column8: 4) [[melchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/melchan)] 28-7-2009(11): In this train line the wagons are _trojan horses_ and at each **station** the driver plays a little melody on his _shakuhachi_ to let the passengers know they arrived at the next **station**. [thanks rtkrtk].
column9: 5) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 28-1-2008(11): A homeless horse playing the flute at the **station** to make a dime.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-8-2006(266): The hidden Greeks inside the _Trojan Horse_ are getting **boisterous** as one of them is bitten in the _crotch_ by a nasty _insect_. If they don't shut up, the Trojans will hear them…
column6: 2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 9-5-2006(76): Or more precisely: the team of horses are getting **boisterous** because one of them got bitten in the crotch by a horse fly. The kanji also means to roar, make up noise, to kick up a fuss and to make merry. Perhaps it is exactly the etymology behind this kanji.
column7: 3) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 7-4-2009(27): My _horse_ was **boisterous** because of nasty _bugs_ in his _crotch_.
column8: 4) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 28-1-2008(10): When a man is hung like a horse his love life often becomes so **boisterous** that he gets crabs (crotch insects).
column9: 5) [[Apple_Head](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Apple_Head)] 10-7-2010(5): You'd be **boisterous** too if you had a _horse_ -sized _bug_ up your _crotch_!

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 5-2-2006(166): The Greek warriors inside the _Trojan Horse_ are complaining about this **burdensome** _plump_ warrior who is not helping at all (say, just eating candies and watching). - "You know you're such a burden!". Note : be sure to keep "plump" distinct from the primitive meaning of "round" ("fat man").
column6: 2) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 23-1-2008(96): If a passenger is too plump and heavy, its too **burdensome** for the horse.
column7: 3) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 28-12-2008(30): [太っちゃた馬は駄目だよ！](midori://search?text=太っちゃた馬は駄目だよ！) .
column8: 4) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 31-5-2009(17): HORSES find PLUMP riders **BURDENSOME**.
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-5-2007(15): This is going to be **burdensome**! This _Trojan Horse_ is so _plump_ that it'll never fit thru the front gate! We're going to have to demolish part of our gate to be able to get it inside…It's too **burdensome**! I say, let's leave it on the beach.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 19-4-2007(219): You stand in AWE at the 8th **WONDER** of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE.
column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-9-2009(79): This is another word for surprise. [驚く＝おどろく](midori://search?text=驚く＝おどろく) = surprise. The Trojans stood in _awe_ of the magnificent Trojan Horse that they thought was a gift. But imagine their **surprise (wonder)** when a bunch of Greeks came rushing out of it! (To further cement the connection between the primitives, if needed: It's a **wonder** that the Trojans managed to speak _keigo_ 敬語 even then, saying " わたくしたちを殺さないでください !! お願い致します !!").
column7: 3) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 23-1-2008(28): The horse **wonder** s why it is being addressed in keigo 敬語 after all it is only a horse.
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 7-1-2007(15): A lowly farmer is staring in **wonder** at a prince and a team of horses who has appeared before him, and uses the flowery phrases beaten into him by a taskmaster ( 敬語 , honorifics) to avoid being beheaded for rudeness.
column9: 5) [[blaked569](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blaked569)] 7-4-2009(14): I stood in _awe_ as **Wonder** Woman revealed that she was hung like a _horse_.

column5: 1) [[DurablePants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DurablePants)] 2-8-2006(159): A **fervent** horse doesnt need to be whipped with a bamboo stick during a race, it will go fast by itself.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 1-12-2006(132): A **fervent** history otaku rebuild the the _Trojan Horse_. But since he was Japanese, he used _bamboo_ instead of normal wood.
column7: 3) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 8-12-2006(62): The **fervent** soldiers used _bamboo_ **for vents** to breathe while crammed inside the _Trojan horse_. —— Using punnery to avoid confusing with [ardent](../v4/814.html) (#814 烈).
column8: 4) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(34): Careful: [ardent](../v4/814.html) (#814 烈). According to WWWJDIC [ardent](../v4/814.html) (#814 烈) seems to emphasize a fanatical or violent aspect, while **fervent** is more deep, serious, or kind. Story: the **fervent** believer in healthy vegetarian food would only feed his _horses_ the finest _bamboo_ shoots.
column9: 5) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 29-10-2008(16): Imagine a guy in a horse race, the gates go down and all the horses start galloping… except for this one guy, who is sitting on a _trojan horse_ , hitting it **fervent** ly with a _bamboo_ stick but it just wont move.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 24-7-2007(53): In ancient Japan, the most grievous **insult** was to poke a rival's _horse_ in the _eye_ (consider how rare an expensive a steed was in those days). It was the final step in preparation for a duel to the death.

column3: The kanji in this frame recalls the famous Bengali fable about the group of magicians (the _magic wand_ ) who decided to make a **tiger**. It seems that each of them knew how to make one part of the beast, so they pooled their talents and brought all the pieces ( _diced_ into pieces) together, at which point the fabricated **_tiger_** promptly ate its makers up (the bodiless _human legs_ ). Whatever the parable's significance for modern civilization and its arsenals, it should help with this kanji. Oh yes, we should not forget that cliff-like element. Think of it as an abbreviation of the primitive for _zoo_ (the first and fourth strokes, actually), in order to fit the **tiger** somewhere into the picture. In fact, the abbreviation is perfectly logical, since the bottom elements usurp the room for the rest of the primitive for _zoo_.
column4: * As a primitive element itself, the _human legs_ are also swallowed up, but the meaning of _tiger_ is kept, and the whole serves as a roof for what comes beneath 虍, giving the _tiger_ something else to eat.
column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 9-4-2007(122): Magic wand + first two strokes of pelt ( 皮 ) + diced + human legs. A wizard who turns people he doesn't like into newts with his magic wand goes for variety - he has always wanted a **tiger** pelt - but things go awry when the **tiger** promptly dices and eats him, leaving only a pair of legs. (a fitting end for a wicked wizard).
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(107): **Tigger, the **tiger**** , (from Pooh stories) is happy to have found a _magic wand_. Using it he can bounce up to a the top of a _cliff_ , _seven_ times as high as some _human legs_ could bounce. **Tigger** thinks "Its great to be a **tiger**!
column7: 3) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 10-3-2008(50): The 7 very smart magicians were standing on top of a cliff. The 7 very smart magicians wanted to create a **tiger**. The smart **tiger** ate 6 and a half magicians, leaving a pair of human legs as a snack for later. The smart **tiger** hang the pair of human legs on a tiny hook, so that no other predator could reach it. Moral of the story: **tiger** wins.
column8: 4) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 18-12-2010(16): This kanji is symbolic of the **tiger** Hobbes: he's sort of magical, a toy come to life, hence the _magic wand_ , he and Calvin are always riding their go-cart off the kicker (hence the little hook) at the edge of the _cliff_ , Hobbes and Calvin are both about _seven_ years old, and Hobbes often walks and stands as though he has _human legs_. 虎 (とら) : **tiger**.
column9: 5) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 10-7-2009(10): The magic wand on top of the cliff spawned 7 **tiger** s that ate human legs.

column3: Drawn on the walls of a complex of _caves_ near Niaux in southern France are a number of animal likenesses dating from the Upper Paleolithic period. Among them we find pictures of **deer** , some of them showing men in **deer** masks. By _comparing_ their drawings to real **deer** , Stone Age people hoped to acquire power over the animal in the hunt, and by _comparing_ themselves to the **deer** , to take on that animal's characteristics. But time has locked with a "double- _key_ " (the extra stroke through the element for _key_ ) the real secret of this art form from us, and we can only surmise such meanings. But more important than the enigmas of the troglodytic mind is the way in which _caves_ , a double- _key_ , and _comparing_ gives us the kanji for **deer**.
column4: * As a primitive, this kanji is abbreviated much the same as the _tiger_ was: the lower element is dropped to leave room for a replacement. Its meaning, however, remains the same. There are a very few cases (see frame 2158) in which there is no abbreviation. When this happens, we may keep the image suggested by the above explanation: _painting of a deer_.
column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 1-5-2007(300): _Bambi_ wanders into a _cave_ and sees a _side order of salad_ and _2 spoons_ …but what's the main course?

It's popular with all the **deer** and rein **deer** in the world. The _cave_ speciality is a _salad w/ dressing on the side_. There is no other **deer** club that can _compare_. How many other **deer** nightclubs are there?
