column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(65): Many _deer_ can be found in the _grove_ at the **foot of a mountain**.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(18): _Deer_ are well known for frolicking in _groves_ of _trees_. However, they are not well known for actually watching where the heck they are bounding about. Here we have a bunch of dead _deer_ bodies that you find at the **foot of a mountain**. You are trying to figure why there are so many dead _deer_ in one spot, and then you trace a line up the mountain - leaves and such are scattered all the way up…to a grove. Looks like they hopped through some leaves to their doom.
column7: 3) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 30-7-2008(8): The cave with the _deer_ painting was found at the **foot of a mountain** hidden behind a _grove_. That's why it took centuries to discover.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 18-3-2010(5): _Deer_ live in the **foot** hills **of mountains** where they can hide and shelter in _groves of trees_. Consequently, you won't find them ABOVE the 'tree line'. Note: To avoid confusion with _mountain goat_ 屰, remember those wild goats are way up above the tree line on steep rocky slopes. Deer thrive in leafy green woods and pastures.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 22-12-2009(4): Sacred _deer_ live in the _grove_ at the **foot of the mountain** , foliage so thick that one cannot see the mountain itself.

column3: _Flowers_ . . . _deer_ . . . _one_ . . . _tail feathers_. Note the doubling up in these last two elements as in frame 2091.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 3-11-2006(150): Picture an ad in which Uncle Jimbo (of "South Park" fame) **recommend** s the latest craze in deer hunting : a high tech _slingshot_! The ad begins with Bambi prancing around, smelling the _flowers_. Then, all of a sudden, Bambi is brutally murdered with the _slingshot_ , put on the _cooking fire_ , and the camera pans to Uncle Jimbo happily munching on crispy cooked Bambi! Note: the _slingshot_ is strokes 11-12.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 7-1-2007(142): It is **recommend** ed that deers stick to eating flowers. If they try to eat birds, they may end up choking on them, like this one here. Note that the head ( 白 ) is gone and the visible part of the body which is normally written with a stroke of the head must by necessity be drawn with a stroke of the tail.
column7: 3) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 4-11-2007(102): For tonight's dinner (says the waiter) I would **recommend** the Deer. It is very special because it has been fed with flowers all it's life, has been killed with a slingshot (so there is no gun powder in it) and right now it is in the cooking fire. The meaning: **recommend** , mat, advise, encourage, offer.
column8: 4) [[errtu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/errtu)] 4-5-2010(67): Wow 2000 baby, almost there doubly happy now.
column9: 5) [[gdaxeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gdaxeman)] 16-1-2008(36): One deer hunter to another: "I **recommend** you to use _flowers_ to attract the _deer_ then use a _slingshot_ to fire _tail feathers_ at it".

column3: _Deer_ . . . _crown_ (note the doubling up) . . . _heart_ . . . _walking legs_. You may recall that we met the relative primitives at the bottom here before, in the kanji for _melancholy_ (Frame 663).
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 12-1-2006(112): In this kanji, " _deer_ " replaces the "head" primitive from the "melancholy" kanji. Poor Ned is feeling melancholy so Uncle Jimbo (of South Park animated series) suggests a good _deer_ huntin' trip to fix that and turn that _melancholy_ into **jubilation**.
column6: 2) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 5-9-2007(96): _Bambi_ was _melancholy_ at the death of his mother, but is now in **jubilation** as he's made friends with thumper.
column7: 3) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 18-9-2006(60): This kanji shows the **JUBILATION** that accompanies the modern holiday of Christmas. Rather than focus on the MELANCHOLY events of Christ's crucifiction (as we do on Easter), on Christmas we focus on the arrival of RUDOLPH to bring us lots of presents. Oh yeah, I guess there's a small bit of **JUBILATION** about Christ's birth too, but fuck that shit, I just want presents.
column8: 4) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 25-11-2008(47): Hamlet's melancholy turns at once to **jubilation** when he discovers that his head has transformed into that of a deer's. No more will human tragedy be his source of suffering!
column9: 5) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 7-8-2008(25): The **Jubilation** of Haruhi Suzumiya. Here we have Haruhi, from [melancholy](../v4/616.html) (#616 憂) of Haruhi Suzumiya feeling so **jubilant** (for a change) she's wearing an absurd _deer_ mask over her head. (she only needs some horse costume to go with it, and the image of 馬鹿 is complete).

column3: The painting of a _deer_ itself with its form and color is enough to fill the bill for an image of something **lovely**. But to give a bit of contrast, we see two _mediocre_ drawings from a later age on two patches of _ceiling_ above. Note that the drop in _mediocre_ has been lengthened somewhat and the second stroke drawn down straight.
column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-4-2007(153): The anthropologist made an exact _deer painting_ from the cave _ceiling_ on the _ceiling_ of his house. Too bad they're both _mediocre_. All his wife could say was, "How… **lovely**.".
column6: 2) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 16-2-2008(107): **Lovely** bambi…. pictographe : just take a look at those innocent open eyes (part 1 it's not more far fetched than seeing mediocre in it) with thin eyebrows what a **lovely** deer …(part 2).
column7: 3) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 6-12-2007(52): The _deer painting_ is so **lovely** , when compared to the two _mediocre_ paintings on two sections of _ceiling_ above.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(17): A _crocodile with raised eyebrows_ eyes a **lovely** _deer_ it might have for dinner.
column9: 5) [[Hujis](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hujis)] 28-5-2009(12): A creepy deerophile peers with his _beedy eyes_ over the top of a _deers_ back, and whispers **lovely** to himself.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(264): Most don't know it, but **bear** s have the _ability_ to walk on _fire_. They're invincible creatures!
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 12-1-2006(154): Note : I don't know why James Heisig put "bear" ahead of "ability" (next frame), but I sugget to skip this, learn the next kanji ("ability") then go back here and use _ability_ as a primitive.
column7: 3) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 23-6-2008(78): **Bear** s have the **ability** to smell food cooking on a camp **fire** from over 30ks away (true).
column8: 4) [[cgillz34](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cgillz34)] 24-2-2009(25): Smokey the **Bear** says: Only you have the ability to prevent forest fires.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 6-5-2007(19): Well, this is obviously the story of Goldilocks, who came to the **bear** house. She _elbows_ her way in, throws her _flesh_ into a chair, notices the porridge on the _oven fire_ , takes one _spoon_ full from one plate, then another _spoon_ full from another plate.

column3: Try relating this kanji to that of the previous frame. For instance, you might imagine that the test of **ability** envisioned here is removing the _bear_ from the oven fire.
column5: 1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(246): The amputee has no hands but only stumps of _flesh_ beneath his _elbows_. To give him the **ability** to eat he has _two spoons_ implanted in his arm stumps, one in each side.
column6: 2) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 16-7-2007(57): Kid from the Oracle's place in the Matrix (whose head is shining like the moon) is holding a a spoon and making it bend using his special **ability**. When Neo asks to learn this **ability** the child replies, " Remember the truth Neo, there is no spoon." Neo Proceeds to the kitchen pondering these words of wisdom. The Child smiles mischeviously and pulls a second spoon hidden up his sleeve in the crook of his elbow. "That's right Neo," the child laughs, "there is no spoon…there are two spoons!".
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(31): This man may have the dis- **ability** of no _flesh_ below the elbows, but he can eat with _2 spoons_ , on in each foot.
column8: 4) [[Terhorst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Terhorst)] 24-12-2007(26): I have the **ability** to use my _elbow flesh_ to juggle _two spoons_.
column9: 5) [[activeaero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/activeaero)] 12-12-2008(12): I have the **ability** to bend two spoons. I bend one spoon with my elbow and one with my body.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-4-2007(308): This guy has an **attitude** problem – lots of _ability_ , but his _heart_ 's not in it.
column6: 2) [[redskatz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/redskatz)] 9-4-2009(113): Having a good **attitude** means believing in your _heart_ that you have the _ability_ to do anything - like memorizing more than 2000 kanji, for example.
column7: 3) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 16-10-2006(13): If you had the _ability_ to read people's _hearts_ (especially women's hearts), it'd be so easy to find out why they have such an **attitude**.
column8: 4) [[morganandrew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/morganandrew)] 12-4-2010(11): "It's an **attitude** problem I'm afraid," says the teacher at parents' evening. "He has the ABILITY to be a great but his HEART is not in it." "What should we do?" says the concerned parent. "Let's try this HEART, shall we?" says the coach, handing over a HEART that will give their child a better **attitude**.
column9: 5) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 1-4-2008(8): Hint: Carebears (trading fire for heart-power).

column3: _House_ . . . _ceiling_ . . . _sprout_ . . . _animal legs_. Compare, and do not confuse with, the kanji in frame 1887.
column5: 1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 16-10-2006(230): If you draw the **sign of the tiger** on the ceiling of your house, you will sprout tiger's legs (animal legs) and be able to run and pounce like the big cats yourself.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 11-4-2007(75): The **sign of the tiger** is that he's eaten all of the [yellow](../v4/1750.html) (#1750 黄) salad in the _house_.
column7: 3) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 8-1-2008(57): I don't know why but when I read **sign of the tiger** I get the "eye of the tiger song" stuck in my head. So I see rocky training in his house. Hes hitting the _ceiling_ (no punching bag) eating _brussel sprouts_ to keep in good health and running with only the _animal legs_ his dog.
column8: 4) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(37): The zebra, at the first _sign of a tiger_ , jumped into [mid- air](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1109) (#1109 宙). Unfortunately, he was in his _house_ , got stuck in the _ceiling_ , leaving only his _legs_ poking out.
column9: 5) [[violetize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/violetize)] 24-8-2009(27): Sung to the theme Survivor (Eye of the Tiger) from Rocky: It's the **sign of the tiger** , it's inside of a _house_ , rising up to the _ceiling_ , _sprout_ ing higher. Yes, on _animal legs_ , it's getting ready to pounce, and it's watching us all, it's the **siiiiiiign of the tiger**.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 7-12-2006(201): That was some great **performance**! He caused the _water_ to shoot up into the air and form the _sign of the tiger_ in airborne droplets. You sure missed a great **performance**!
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 7-4-2007(51): I remember seeing advertisements growing up with the _sign of the tiger_ saying to "Put a tiger in your tank", meaning that it would increase the **performance** of the _drops_ of gasoline you put in.
column7: 3) [[spoonsman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/spoonsman)] 9-4-2009(30): At the end of Rocky's **performances** , set to the _Eye of the Tiger_ of course, he was quite exhausted and dumped _water_ all over himself to cool down.
column8: 4) [[ahuvia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ahuvia)] 14-12-2009(27): _Tiger Wood_ 's **performance** has been _watered_ down by recent scandal.
column9: 5) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 5-8-2008(26): You watch a tiger do a flip into a small pool of _water_ at a circus. "What a great **performance**! I need to get my shirt _signed by that tiger_ ," you say to your friend.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(273): **Bruce Lee** is such a badass he climbed a sheer vertical _cliff_ using only _2 hairpins_.
column6: 2) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 6-3-2010(39): The kid said "I don't believe you! Dragons don't exist!" so we made a little surprise for him: we pinned a huge **dragon** (it was just a **sign** really) on a nearby _cliff_. "Whoaaa! Dragon!" the kid said. "But why won't it move?" "I tell you why, cause it's pinned there with _two hairpins_ " I thought to myself.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-1-2006(31): As a primitive I use the image of _Bruce Lee_ .
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 20-3-2009(20): This is the image(sign) of a dragon carved into a **cliff** face. However, the dragon has no eyes. Legend has it that there are **two** magical **hairpins** that can be inserted into the eye sockets to make the dragon come to life.
column9: 5) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 29-12-2008(11): Cliff + two + Hairpins: The **sign of the dragon** was carved into the _cliff_ face with _two hairpins_ that were abandoned in the sand below.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-1-2006(190): During the shooting of one of his first movies in China, _Bruce Lee_ fell through the cheaply built movie set, and into a barrel of _glue_. As you can imagine, to put _Bruce Lee_ in that position must have caused great embarass to the chinese producer. Note the hints in the story for the position of the primitives.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(90): _Bruce Lee_ is **embarrass** ed when he does a high kick and splits his pants. He has to _glue_ them back together.
column7: 3) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 7-8-2008(26): The _sign of the dragon_ falls off the cliff, to our great **embarassment** (see [sign of the dragon](../v4/2008.html) (#2008 辰)) We should have _glued_ it there!
column8: 4) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 20-6-2008(13): Bruce Lee was **embarrass** ed when his glue huffing addiction became public.
column9: 5) [[cerulean](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cerulean)] 28-5-2009(10): Frieza has finally brought together all the _Dragon Balls_ , but he doesn't know how to summon the Dragon.. He's tried everything now, including _Gluing_ the _Dragon Balls_ together, and is starting to feel **Embarrass** ed about the whole thing.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(151): _Bruce Lee_ has magical abilities in his newest movie. He can conjure _rain_ and earth **quakes**.
column6: 2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(77): A la Kung Fu Hustle, _Bruce Lee_ descends from the _storm_ and causes an earthquake by smashing the ground.
column7: 3) [[Floatingweed5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Floatingweed5)] 18-12-2007(31): Bruce Lee looks up and sees rain clouds gathering, so he decides to abandon filming and play **Quake** III instead.
column8: 4) [[Monkeys_Spiders](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Monkeys_Spiders)] 24-1-2010(29): It is said that earthquakes are caused when Bruce Lee gets rained on, he just hates it and punishes mother earth, punching the ground. The popularity of the legend lead to the kanji meaning anything that **quake** s.
column9: 5) [[Harrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Harrow)] 21-3-2009(27): Instant mythology: When heavy rains disturb a dragon hiding under the earth, an earth **quake** may result.

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 3-6-2007(149): _Bruce Lee_ **shake** s the confidence of his opponents by simply waving his _fingers_ in front of them, they know that each of them is a deadly weapon in their own right. Hwwaaaa…
column6: 2) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 7-1-2009(116): Your fingers will be crushed if you **shake** hands with Bruce Lee.
column7: 3) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-1-2006(21): Here someone **shake** s hands with _Bruce Lee_ and then asks for his _fingers_ back. Note : my first idea was the "finger-shake", Shrek the ogre's favourite milk-shake, I couldn't fit _sign of the dragon_ into the story though.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-7-2009(13): _Bruce Lee_ **shake** s his _finger_ at an opponent who thinks they're a match for him.
column9: 5) [[jabberwockychortles](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jabberwockychortles)] 31-10-2009(12): If you're talking to someone and notice that their _fingers_ are starting to **shake** , it's often a _sign of the dragon_ being behind you where the other person can see him coming.

column3: _Woman_ . . . _sign of the dragon_. The key word is a synonym for _pregnant_ , whose character we met earlier (Frame 546). Although the two kanji are often used together, they should be kept distinct.
column5: 1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 5-9-2007(254): Any _woman_ spending a night with the virile _Bruce Lee_ is bound to end up **with child**.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-3-2008(54): BRUCE LEE'S WOMAN was **WITH CHILD** and it really upset her stomach because little Brandon Lee was kicking ass from the inside.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 27-10-2007(24): A _woman_ who is **with child** can't be sacrificed to the _dragon_ , virgins only need apply.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(11): _Bruce Lee_ can make a _woman_ **with child** before they even know what happened.
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 4-9-2008(10): The _woman_ hides the dragon from poachers under her shirt, pretending she's **with child**. "Seen any _sign of the dragon_?" ask the poachers. "Nope, haven't seen him," replies the woman.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(298): I love _Bruce Lee_ dubbing. His **lips** move, but sometimes words don't come out of his _mouth_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-7-2009(47): _Bruce Lee_ says "Read my **lips** …", but when I try to, his _mouth_ isn't moving with the dialogue.
column7: 3) [[rich_f](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rich_f)] 16-8-2007(21): As I approached her **lips** , I began to sense _the sign of the dragon_ breath coming from her _mouth_ , and I almost fainted.
column8: 4) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 30-12-2009(12): (Positioning) _Bruce Lee_ prefers the **lips** of his girlfriend's _mouth_ "down below". Lucky bastard!
column9: 5) [[Aeryon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aeryon)] 20-1-2012(5): Bruce Lee comes flying out of nowhere and kicks you right in the mouth… leaving you with fat **lips**.

column5: 1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(146): The most unlikely persons in the world to take up **agriculture** must be Bender and Bruce Lee. An awkwared moment as they stare on the various farming utensils, hoe, plow. Both with straw hats on and blue overalls, and drawn in Groenigs irrevent style.
column6: 2) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 22-5-2006(99): Bruce Lee is tough. But so is agricultural work. If Bruce took it up, even he would hurt his back from all the bending.
column7: 3) [[DavidZ](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DavidZ)] 12-12-2009(29): (combine Immacolata & mattimus:) The most unlikely duo to take up **agriculture** must be _Bender_ and _Bruce Lee_. An awkward moment ensues as they stand in straw hats and overalls, staring at the various farm implements. But soon Bruce Lee is spinning Bender above his head while Bender's arms and legs perform all sorts of **agricultural** tasks like pruning, watering, sowing… 農業 [のうぎょう] [、農場](midori://search?text=、農場) [のうじょう].
column8: 4) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 20-4-2008(22): It's a good **agricultural** sign when, as the farmer is _bending_ down, he discovers some plants arranged in the _sign of the dragon_. It means the weather and earth will be supportive of the crops.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(10): _Bruce Lee_ developed a _bend_ in his back from doing **agriculture**.

column3: Among other things, the key word refers to the thick consistency of liquids. Its elements: _water_ . . . _agriculture_.
column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(168): The _agriculture_ of Florida is **concentrated** on making **concentrated** orange juice. Just add _water_! Imagine a can of FCOJ, dumping it into a pitcher and adding _water_.
column6: 2) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 15-2-2008(124): **Concentrated** _water_ is going to revolutionize the _agriculture_! Just add water… oh wait…
column7: 3) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 6-6-2008(68): History has shown that agriculture usually is **concentrated** around bodies of water.
column8: 4) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 18-11-2006(20): Those who work in _agriculture_ like their coffee strong and **concentrated** to help them wake up at the crack of dawn. Almost any guest to their breakfast table will want to _water_ it down. (adapted from darg_sama, because I like strong coffee).
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 30-6-2012(7): _Water_ extracted from _agricultural_ products makes them **concentrated**.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(188): After worshipping the _golden calf_ , God sent the Jews on a long _road_ through the wilderness.
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-3-2008(92): The problem with the "gold calf" primitive is that the first vertical stroke of "heavenly" is shorter than the second stroke. But as we know, "heavenly" clearly has the FIRST stroke longer, not the second. The primitives we really have here are "animal horns (first 3 strokes)" and "big/dog (last 3 strokes)." What are the BIGGEST ANIMAL HORNS that you can think of? For me its a MASTODON. STORY: In caveman times, you SENT OFF packages with the MASTODON express.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-7-2009(28): I couldn't stand the _horny St. Bernard_ any longer, so I **escorted** it to the _road_ and gave it a **send off** to go get neutered.
column8: 4) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 22-5-2008(14): (note: I changed golden calf to Satan: came from heaven and grew horns) Satan was escorted by Michael during his **send off** down the roads of heaven.
column9: 5) [[slats70](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/slats70)] 10-4-2009(12): Primitive: Animal horns + big = _Wooly Mammoth_. Story:There was a big **send off** for _Wooly mammoth_ and all his friends waved goodbye as he left down the _road_.

column5: 1) [[Rakushun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rakushun)] 27-12-2007(150): The _golden calf_ is sent to the _gates of Hell_ for it's **connection** to false idols.
column6: 2) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 8-7-2008(75): There's a weird **connection** between worshipping the _golden calf_ and visiting the _gates of Hell_.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-3-2008(30): See my story for 2016. The **CONNECTION** between the GATES OF HELL and MASTODONS is that the GATES were made out of MASTODON horns (b/c they so big and old).
column8: 4) [[spoonsman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/spoonsman)] 9-4-2009(23): At the airport, the _woolly mammoth_ was too big. When he tried to go through his flight's _gate_ he got stuck and missed his **connecting** flight.
column9: 5) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 26-11-2009(17): _Bill Gates_ and the _woolly mammoth_ gazed longingly at one another. Bill squeezed her hand gently, "Do you feel it? The **connection**? It's… electric." The mammoth blushed, twinges of anticipation and fear coursing through her heart. Could they really start over? She didn't want to get hurt again, but the **connection** was still so deep, so real. She looked Bill in the eyes: "Don't you break my heart again Bill." "I love you, baby. Let's go back to my place. I'm going to get Pleistocene on your fat ass.".

column5: 1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 9-1-2007(174): Evil **blossom** s from the _mouths_ of those who worship the _golden calf_. (Playing it safe and avoiding the image of a flower completely).
column6: 2) [[spoonsman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/spoonsman)] 9-4-2009(29): It's the circle of life. The _woolly mammoth_ died, but the mammoth's body was able to provide nutrition to the new plants, **blossoming** out of the _mouth_ of the dead _mammoth_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-7-2009(16): A _horny St. Bernard_ so desperate, it tries to use the _opening_ in a flower **blossom**.
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-3-2008(16): See my story for 1016. Caveman magic: making flowers **BLOSSOM** out of the MOUTH of a MASTODON.
column9: 5) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 2-8-2008(10): Remember that TV show **Blossom**? It was about a girl with a big _mouth_ and a nose the size of a _mastodon_ 's!

column3: Drop of . . . brains . . . human legs . . . elbow.
column5: 1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 6-4-2007(189): A **ghost** , or **oni** , wandering slowly on its _human legs_ , searching for _brains_ to eat. What looks like an _elbow_ here is actually a pictoral representation of the _forked tail_ protruding out of its rear.
column6: 2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 18-11-2006(95): **Ghost** s aren't very intelligent - they have but a _drop_ of _brains_ \- so can't tell the difference between an _elbow_ and a pair of _human legs_.
column7: 3) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 7-11-2007(69): Building on Matthew's excellent image, the _drop_ can be the single horn sticking out of the **oni** 's forehead.
column8: 4) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 8-1-2007(49): 鬼 (おに) is not a **ghost**. An ogre or a troll would be a more fitting translation. Such a thing has but a drop of brains and uses its legs and elbows as deadly weapons (a concept which should be familiar from the [license](../v4/765.html) (#765 允) to kill). I'll use "ogre" for this.
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-11-2008(22): This **ghost** had only a _drop of brains_ , his _legs_ and _elbow_ were easily visible from under his sheet.

column5: 1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(204): The **ugly** _oni_ can't get a date so he drinks _sake_ by himself at the bar.
column6: 2) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 9-2-2009(64): Drink enough _whisky_ and not even an _oni_ looks **ugly** any more…
column7: 3) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 30-12-2007(64): Drinking too much _whisky_ can make you as **ugly** as an _oni_.
column8: 4) [[torabi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torabi)] 29-5-2008(16): In the movie 'The Shining', Jack Nicholson is so drunk on _whiskey_ that he doesn't realize the woman he's dancing with is an **ugly** _ghost_.
column9: 5) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 11-3-2008(8): A demon with a horn and a forked tail enters the bar. Everybody runs away, except one drunken fella who is drinking straight from the whiskey bottle. The demon apporaches him. The fella turns around. While sipping some more whiskey his famous last words: ' You are the ugliest demon I have ever seen'.

column5: 1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 13-3-2008(141): When we die, our **soul** rises up in a _ghost_ like _rising cloud_ of mist up to heaven (we hope) (Adapted from darg_sama,28-10-2005).
column6: 2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 30-3-2008(133): When you die, your **SOUL** either goes to the RISING CLOUDS (heaven) or to the ONI (hell, the devil).
column7: 3) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 28-10-2005(30): There exists a **soul** within us all. When we die, our ghost rises up like a rising cloud out of our bodies.
column8: 4) [[WithLoveFromExIA](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/WithLoveFromExIA)] 20-6-2009(21): After death, your **soul** may go up like a _rising cloud_ , or stay as a _ghost_.
column9: 5) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 9-2-2009(19): Just as a sidenote, [魂＝だましい](midori://search?text=魂＝だましい) , from Katamari Damacy ( 塊魂 ).

column3: _Hemp_ . . . _ghost_. Take care not to confuse with the primitive of the same name we learned earlier (Frame 458).
column5: 1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 10-12-2006(230): The **witch** sold me some _hemp_ that made me see _ghosts_ don't do drugs.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 7-7-2006(62): This modern version of the **witch** lives in some hippie community. She smokes a lot of _hemp_ , and spends the day talking to _ghosts_ , which not surprisingly appears only to her.
column7: 3) [[shakkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shakkun)] 2-7-2008(43): The **witch** inhales her special HEMP herb which sends her into a trance state in which she can commune with ONI (or ghosts or demons whatever your fancy).
column8: 4) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 18-6-2008(20): This is a **WITCH** which is making a MAgic potion (this character is read ま and is heavily related to magic). The ingredients? Some **hemp** and an **ogre's** corpse. (yuck!).
column9: 5) [[manubear](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/manubear)] 5-5-2012(8): The **witch** and the _oni_ sit around smoking _hemp_. Getting high without a broomstick! ( 魔女 ).

column5: 1) [[phauna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/phauna)] 28-2-2008(201): _Ghosts_ have _not yet_ left the world, they must still have a deep **fascination** with their past life on Earth.
column6: 2) [[bananarama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bananarama)] 3-3-2008(53): Even in these modern times our **fascination** with ghosts has not yet ended.
column7: 3) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 16-2-2011(37): The only people who have a **fascination** with _oni_ are those that have _not yet_ met one. 魅力 (みりょく) : charm, **fascination** , glamour.
column8: 4) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-1-2006(33): Here the "Ghostbusters" founder talks about his **fascination** for _ghosts_ (picture Dan Arkroyd in the movie if that helps). He says he has a **fascination** for ghosts ever since he saw one as a teenager. Since then he's been scouring all of the world, trying to capture them on tape, on video… A journalist asks "When will it end ? Aren't you tired of chasing ghosts ?" "Oh no, _not yet_ ! Not until I become a _ghost_ myself anyway !".
column9: 5) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 6-3-2010(30): Your **fascination** with _ghosts_ is because you have _not yet_ seen one. When you do, you'll do your best to get as far from them as possible…

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 12-4-2008(88): This word somehow reminds me of a golem… an _oni_ made from _soil_.
column6: 2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(73): Without any weapons, our only defense was to throw **clod** s of _dirt_ at the advancing _zombie_ horde.
column7: 3) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 9-2-2009(56): [塊＝かたまり](midori://search?text=塊＝かたまり) , from Katamari Damacy ( 塊魂 ). Imagine playing Katamari Damacy, on this level you start with a **clod** of _dirt_ , and roll up _demons_ into it.
column8: 4) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 12-12-2006(55): Easy: <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golem> (or if you prefer, <http://schwicky.net/xfiles/episodes/4/kaddish/>).
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 2-12-2006(21): Remember the whole ghost of Mars debate? When they first took pictures of the Martian _soil_ , the picture looked like it contained a _ghost_. But later photographs showed it was a mere **clod** of soil.

column3: _Vase_ . . . _meat_ . . . _slingshot_ (doubled up with) _snake_ . . . _three_ . . . _garment_. The top half of this character is the old form for the kanji in frame 575.
column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-1-2006(250): The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for "dragon". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji "imperial dragon". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a _slingshot_ (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our _imperial dragon_ here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare "three-headed slingshot- snake" kept in a _vase_ and fed with _meat_. When the emperor **attack** ed neighbours, his army wore the _imperial dragon garment_.
column6: 2) [[jackswitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackswitch)] 31-3-2009(99): Fuaburisu's story is incredibly good, but I made it a bit simpler: The _imperial dragon_ is a rare " _three-headed slingshot-snake_ ", kept in a _vase_ and fed with _meat_. It's very aggressive, so at feeding time you need to wear the special _garment_ or it will **attack** you.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-2-2008(65): You **attack** an _old dragon_ 龍 and take his _clothes_. REF: [dragon [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2981) (#2981 龍).
column8: 4) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 27-11-2009(21): You **attack** the _Ancient Chinese dragon_ 龍 with the help of your fire-proof _garment_. Ref: [dragon [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2981) (#2981 龍).
column9: 5) [[plumage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/plumage)] 23-5-2009(15): Legend of Zelda: Link **ATTACK** S by throwing a VASE at the FLESH of the boss, fires his SLINGSHOT, uses his HOOKshot 3 TIMES, and wears a magic GARMENT, all to try to find its weakness.

column5: 1) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 18-10-2007(193): To **upbraid** someone, you criticize them in a menacing way. In other words, you jaw at them with your MOUTH until both sides of their face turn RED (hence the double-red).
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-2-2008(77): Tip: Heisig later names 赫 "red + red" as [incandescent](../v4/2908.html) (#2908 赫). Story: "So the boss **upbraid** ed you, huh?". "Yep, his _mouth_ was _incandescent_.
column7: 3) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 8-11-2007(30): Halpern's dictionary goes with **intimidate** , so I'll stick to **menacing**. The kanji for red ( 赤 ) is usually only fully formed when it is on the left, as in 赦 , so as a primitive, fully red on the left = _commie_. This kanji is unusual in that the commies (2 of them!) have moved over to the right and taken over this entire kanji. The little mouth on the left is protesting what can only be a pictoral representation of the **red menace**.
column8: 4) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-4-2007(16): A father **upbraid** s his daughter for the _red_ lipstick and little _red_ dress. "You're not going out like that!".
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-1-2006(11): Kanji meanings : to reproach, to scold (note the _mouth_ to the left). This english word is unusual for me, as I thought it referred to braids. So to tie it all up together I imagine two women of the middle-age playing cards. One of them puts down _a pair of reds_ (the _red_ cards, to avoid the primitive _two_ , which is not the same). The other woman thinks she is cheating, and they start scolding each other (that is **upbraid** ing, with their _mouth_ ), and pulling each other's braids up.

column5: 1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 8-3-2008(151): The king says "Only **We** are allowed to partake of the _flesh_ of the _golden calf_.".
column6: 2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 25-2-2007(46): The _golden calf_ is about the difference between monotheism (one king) and paganism (majestic plural). By giving a _flesh_ offering to the _golden calf_ , the rebellious Israelites showed they still believed in the **majestic plural**.
column7: 3) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 11-3-2008(29): ( [朕はおもしろうない。](midori://search?text=朕はおもしろうない。) We are not amused.) A jester does an act with meat in front of royalty and their pet, the Golden Calf. After a short while, the Calf looks at the royalty and then back at the jester : ' WE are not amused'.
column8: 4) [[Rooboy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rooboy)] 16-4-2009(27): The queen is not happy. " _We_ (majestic plural) are not amused that the hunger for the _flesh_ of the _wooly mammoth_ has caused it's extinction. Poor Charles is particularly upset.
column9: 5) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-5-2009(15): God and Moses take one look at the masses who are engaged in sinful activities, such as bearing their _flesh_ and worshiping the _golden calf_ , and say, in the **majestic plural** , "We are not amused.".

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(205): (This is **atmosphere** as in ambiance, mood). _Rain_ is only _part_ of the **atmosphere** for a romantic porch date. Food, music, and candles are the rest.
column6: 2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 22-6-2006(43): The part of the sky that is responsible for weather and rain is known as the **atmosphere**. It only occupies part of the sky though.
column7: 3) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 22-5-2008(27): The rain isn't a bad thing–it provides a part of the romantic **atmosphere**.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-7-2009(19): _Rain_ plays a big _part_ in the **atmosphere** of an event.
column9: 5) [[igordesu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/igordesu)] 21-3-2009(16): Our rain only comes from part of the **atmosphere** at the bottom called the troposphere.

column5: 1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-1-2006(195): You've entered in a chinese shop where apparently the only **item** in sale is old, dusty, _hardened bamboo_ (for construction for example). It looks like these **item** s have been there forever. Asking the clerk if anything else is available, he doesn't understand and instead asks - "Two **item** s? Three **item** s?" (the kanji is a counter for **item** s) - thinking you want to buy something.
column6: 2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 30-1-2008(96): Dragon Quest - You find a _hardened bamboo_ stick, perfect for a weapon, but you can't pick it up because your **item** s are full.
column7: 3) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 2-1-2008(23): When I checked the **items** on the shopping list my wife gave me, I did a double take when i saw _hardened bamboo_. What the hell kind of **item** is that and what could she want with it?
column8: 4) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 22-9-2010(18): When she saw my _BAMBOO HARDEN_ we became an **ITEM**.
column9: 5) [[BooBooQ88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BooBooQ88)] 20-12-2009(9): Bamboo **ITEM** S will become hard and brittle over time.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-4-2007(175): **Tempering** should be done with the _metal_ facing _east_. (If not, the metal may pick up the earth's magnetic field).
column6: 2) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 16-12-2006(97): In the East, especially Japan …there are masters of **tempering** _metal_ to great strength….on the Spring of Trivia show in Japan I saw how a Japanese sword …actually split flying bullets…all because of special Eastern **tempering** techniques.
column7: 3) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 2-1-2008(36): The old sword smiths of the _East_ were rightly famous. The secret of course was in how they **tempered** the _metal_.
column8: 4) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 9-11-2005(10): **Tempering** metal in the East… sounds like Pittsburgh to me! After all, Pittsburgh is a city in the eastern region of the US and is famous for steel working, or **tempering** of metal.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 6-10-2008(9): The **tempering** of _metal_ was mastered in the _East_ for the making of swords.

column5: 1) [[Weber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Weber)] 1-3-2007(223): You must **abide by** the revered rules of the road! No devil's brew and stay glued to your lane in the road!
column6: 2) [[furrykef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/furrykef)] 9-7-2008(97): Even the most _revered_ person must still **abide by** the rules of the _road_ – no exceptions are granted to anyone.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 18-3-2008(21): The _revered_ sins of horniness, whiskey, and sniffing glue must be discarded if you are to **abide by** the righteous, but difficult, _road_.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-5-2009(13): The _revered chieftain_ says to **abide by** his rules or hit the _road_!
column9: 5) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 17-7-2009(4): **Abide by** the rules of the REVERED one as you make your pilgrimage on the ROAD.

column5: 1) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 9-7-2008(96): Hey, screw you! Don't you _look_ down on me! I have the _ability_ to **quit** anytime I want!
column6: 2) [[takoman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/takoman)] 25-6-2008(48): (no important on yomi) When I gamble, my _mind's eye_ has the _ability_ to "know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em, know when to walk away." That last bit is the most important part for any successful gambler - knowing when to **quit**.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 26-10-2007(21): Clint Eastwood as Dirty Harry: "A man's gotta know his limitations." In other words: keep an _eye_ on your _abilities_ , and you'll know when to **quit**.
column8: 4) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 12-7-2010(19): I won't **QUIT** studying until my _EYES_ have the _ABILITY_ to read kanji!
column9: 5) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 17-8-2007(15): _sauron_ doesn't have the _ability_ to **quit** being evil.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(163): The game characters from _Worms_ sleep in their **barracks** at night.
column6: 2) [[wingedge](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wingedge)] 31-12-2007(86): Earthworm jim sleeps in a **barracks** because he is a soldier… apparently.
column7: 3) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 30-1-2007(44): _drop_ your _shovels_ and put them neatly on the _hooks_ …it's time to head back to the **barracks** …now move it!!!!!!!!
column8: 4) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 10-2-2008(26): Obviously, the **barracks** are where the _maggots_ are :).
column9: 5) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 13-3-2011(9): The **barracks** were crawling with _earthworms_.

column5: 1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 4-12-2007(145): _Moreover_ is a literary term to _shelve_ what you had just been talking about, to come back to it later.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-1-2006(91): Same as darg_sama. Play on words. I imagine visiting someone who has an impressive collection of medals and trophies (chess champion, for example). After spending an hour showing you all the trophies in the _glass shelf_ , you think "Whew! It's over." … but the person says "… and wait, there's "moreover" !", pointing at more trophies lined atop the _glass shelf_.
column7: 3) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 30-12-2007(62): _Shelves_ are useful for storing things, and **moreover** they are responsible for splattering the brains of monarchs on tatami mats.
column8: 4) [[Boeso](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boeso)] 8-5-2008(22): I love Ikea SHELVES. "MOREOVER here please!" I shout to the assistant at the store so I can put all my new Japanese texts into them!
column9: 5) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 18-3-2008(14): Imagine an impossibly pedantic rulekeeper (e.g. a judge, or a teacher, or a parent) who is lecturing you about everything you have done wrong. He stands before the _bookshelf_ of rule books and starts at the bottom, pulling out a book. "First of all, you did this wrong," he says, pointing at a rule in the first book. " **Moreover** ," he says, pulling out the next book, "you also did this wrong." **Moreover** , and **moreover** , and **moreover** , he continues, pulling out each rulebook in turn and pointing out your errors.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(204): Let _wood_ en _goods_ = _furniture_. Then: Walking along the sea shore you see some washed-up _furniture_ with _water_ (waves) splashing against it. From a distance it looks like _flowers_ are growing out the top, but as you get closer you see it is in fact **seaweed**.
column6: 2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 30-12-2007(50): Take **seaweed** ( _water_ \+ _flower_ ) and hang it to dry in a _tree_ to produce nori _goods_.
column7: 3) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(30): **Seawood** is the _flower_ of the ocean. When you pile as _goods_ on a _pallet_ they drip _water_.
column8: 4) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 22-6-2006(16): Goods + wood = paper. You know how nori, ie: **seaweed** , comes in sheets for putting in your ramen or for your sushi? Well that's because it's water paper! **Seaweed** is also a sea flower of sorts, so it all just works out.
column9: 5) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 28-4-2009(10): Real **seaweed** serves as furniture for all the sea creatures.

column5: 1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(215): The _samurai_ sits on the _altar_ and watches the **slave** _rake rice_ all day.
column6: 2) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 2-1-2008(95): The samurai from [goodwill](../v4/1097.html) (#1097 款) maintains his good mood on his wedding day. He tells his **slave** that he can keep all _rice_ (used for confetti) that he _rakes_ up after the ceremony. Generous Man!!
column7: 3) [[playadom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/playadom)] 16-1-2009(28): The _samurai_ sits on the _altar_ and watches the **slave** sieve rice through a sieve all day.
column8: 4) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 22-4-2008(11): This is what happens if you anger the gods by jumping up and down the _altar_ (see [goodwill](../v4/1097.html) (#1097 款)). The _samurai_ is _apprehended_ ([apprehend](../v4/1160.html) (#1160 逮)), turned into a **slave** and made to _sieve grains of rice_ all day, as a punishment for losing his _sanity_ ([ease/sane](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1159) (#1159 康)).
column9: 5) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 24-11-2007(11): Hmm, SAMURAI and ALTAR makes a good primitive called PALADINS (or Knights Templar if that's your thing). SIEVE was already set up. So, the PALADINS went on a quest to the holy land, there they caught in a SIEVE set by the moors and became **SLAVE** S in the holy land (picture Costner at the beginning of Robin Hood).

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 8-3-2007(135): At the _butcher's meeting_ , all the butcher's who have a _heart disease_ attend the faith **healing** workshop.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 1-12-2009(90): Note: _meeting of butchers + heart_ are later combined into 愈 [in the nick of time](../v4/2433.html) (#2433 愈). Story: For **healing** to take place, you must catch the _sickness in the nick of time_.
column7: 3) [[Hinode](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hinode)] 22-3-2009(61): (Think rpg!) We were in dire need of **healing**. Our party was fighting the _cavemen_ , but we didn't fare too well. It was more like a _butcher's meeting_ than a fight… just as they were about to pierce my _heart_ , luckily a priest came along and used his **healing** spell [in the nick of time](../v4/2433.html) (#2433 愈).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-7-2009(31): **Healing** from _sickness_ often comes just [in the nick of time](../v4/2433.html) (#2433 愈), especially during boss battles.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 23-12-2008(22): A _caveman_ **healing** _butchers_ with _heart_ disease by pulling their _hearts_ out.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 11-10-2008(65): If you find a _jewel_ with the **imperial seal** on it, just _let it be_. You wouldn't want to be accused of stealing the royal family _jewels_.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 14-12-2006(53): This aquatic mammal belongs to the emperor, so it's an **imperial seal**. Nobody is allowed to mess with it. They have to _let it be_ wherever it wants to go. You can spot it from the other seals by the _jewel_ studded collar around the neck of the **imperial seal** , but above all, remember to _let it be_.
column7: 3) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 1-5-2007(11): You might not like the **imperial seal** but the boss man designed it himself so it's a _jewel_ that you should just _let be_. This is apparently the only 常用漢字 not included in RTK1.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 30-8-2006(10): The **imperial seal** is carved from a big _jewel_. The emperor uses it to seal new laws, while positioned over it, saying _"Let it be"_.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 6-9-2011(2): 剣璽 , 璽符 , 御璽 , 国璽 , 玉璽 , [imperial seal](../v4/2075.html) (#2075 璽)ジ( 爾 ) … Parts: 爾 , 玉 (cf: 爾 [let it be](../v4/2074.html) (#2074 爾), 彌生 /弥生[more and more](../v4/2241.html) (#2241 弥)) … Story: なんじ( 爾 ) is the imperial _Ball_ at? My invitation with the **Imperial Seal** on it had the time written on it. But what with the **Imperial Seal** dripping on it, I no longer know なんじ it is at. Better to put なんじ on top next time.

column5: 1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 2-9-2007(139): Right part: _mortar_ _bound up_ over _oven fire_ , comprising _boiling cauldron_. **Lagoon** is a shallow pond, thus easily warmed by sun, large-scale equivalent of a _boiling cauldron_.
column6: 2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-1-2006(44): The top right primitive appears in Remembering the Kanji, Volume 3 : _mortar_ = _back-to-back staples_ [6] ("The mortar referred to here is a stone or wooden basin used for grinding with a pestle."). Thus we have _water . . . mortar . . . bound up . . . cooking fire_.
column7: 3) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 18-3-2008(43): In an effort to appease the hideous monster from the black **lagoon** , nearby villagers grind up _tail feathers_ of local birds in a _mortar_ and sprinkle the powder in the _water_ , in a primitive magic ritual that they hope will appease the monster. Note the first drop before the tail feathers, as the hook stroke of tail feathers always requires a vertical-like stroke to attach to (compare with do, bird).
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 3-3-2007(18): While visiting Niigata ( 新潟 ) I come across a **lagoon** and notice big splashes of _water_ occurring every few seconds. It is their mortar-throwing contest where they bind up a _mortar_ with _tail-feathers_ (to make it fly better) and then see who can throw it furthrest across the **lagoon**.
column9: 5) [[ellasevia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ellasevia)] 4-8-2010(15): PRIMITIVE: The new element here (top right) is what I am calling _gray_ , because it is similar to white, except that it has a leak at the top which lets darkness in. Therefore, the white turns to gray. STORY: The _gray_ _water_ of **lagoons** is due to the _gray_ ashes of _bound up_ _oven fires_ (campfires) that some people have on the shore. Then the waves and wind move them into the _water_ making it look filthy.

column5: 1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 11-12-2006(215): How about a rusty **cinnabar** colored dilapidated boat, found abandoned somewhere. The smoke-stack and the keel have fallen off…
column6: 2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 9-9-2008(95): **Rusty** old _boat_ with the bottom and top missing.
column7: 3) [[harusame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/harusame)] 25-6-2009(23): I always remember **Cinnabar** Island from Pokemon. Ash finds himself stranded on **Cinnabar** Island. He comes across an abandoned, **rust-colored** [boat](../v4/1868.html) (#1868 舟) on the beach which is clearly falling apart: the smoke-stacka nd the keel have fallen off! (thanks ergerg).
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 17-2-2007(23): Under a _glass canopy_ , _one drop of_ **cinnabar** is shown to the young chemists. **Cinnabar** is a source of mercury and should not be exposed to the same air that we breathe.
column9: 5) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 10-8-2007(10): Inspired by Philip K Dick (and Immacolata) - Stay inside the _Glass canopy_ (Total Recall) and don't risk breathing _one drop_ of Mars (the **cinnabar** planet) "air". Also there is a milk factory near me called 丹那 （たんな）and we all know that they put various たんins (tanin makes me think of a **rust colour** ) and other various chemicals into the milk we drink!

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 25-5-2006(117): Pictograph of a stanchion, which includes two vertical posts to restrain cows so they can be milked, with a horizontal stroke showing the number of cows per stanchion: one. A stanchion is a great symbol for the **SIGN OF THE COW** , since modern, domesticated cows are often stanchioned in barns.
column6: 2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 11-3-2008(106): 77 cows behind a fence.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-4-2007(68): There's no **sign of the cow**. She saw those _daggers_ – _two_ of them – and ran off.
column8: 4) [[furrykef](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/furrykef)] 9-7-2008(48): (Slight adjustment of raseru's story.) You pull out two 二 daggers 刀 and carve this **sign of the cow** into the poor cow. Hint: imagine using the two daggers in place of a branding iron to brand the cow. The stroke order is the same as "dagger, two".
column9: 5) [[Perry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Perry)] 21-7-2009(21): No **sign of the cow** , because the _7 Samurai_ ate her.

column5: 1) [[FooSoft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FooSoft)] 2-1-2010(42): The _sheep_ is **ashamed** of it's sheepish nature, and _dons_ the _sign of the cow_ as a disguise.
column6: 2) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 29-2-2012(27): Once I 到 to this 所 (TWICE!!) I 思 that Heisig and Sienko would 賀 and 擁 me, that Fabrice would 呉 me a 賞 , and that 皆 would 祝 with 楽 and 鮨 … but 却 these 三 guys 結 me up 中 a **wool** 俵 stamped with the **sign of the 牛** , and 孟 to 舞 and 歌 : ♫Kanji 牛 , kanji 牛 , 誰 's a 痴 kanji 牛 !!♫ 而 , they 投 me into an 淵 full of 骨 and 糞 ! I felt 鬱 after being **HUMILIATE** D 是 … but oh well, 今 it's 時 to practice 文 and finally 習 how to 読 in 日本語 **GRACIAS 皆 !!**.
column7: 3) [[eri401](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eri401)] 6-7-2011(13): They said the _woolen_ sweater I donned made me look like a cow - like I was the very [sign of the cow](../v4/2040.html) (#2040 丑). I've never been so **humiliate** d in my life. 恥ずかしい (P), 羞ずかしい 【はずかしい】 含羞 【がんしゅう】 (n) shyness.
column8: 4) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 31-12-2011(9): [+melchan] The _sheep_ was **humiliated** by being branded with the _sign of the cow_ (which is a major insult to anyone, even _sheep_ ) and tries to cover it up with it's _wool_.
column9: 5) [[jbuverud](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jbuverud)] 18-10-2011(7): 18/10/11: RTK + supplement is DONE! やった!! It would be humiliating if I'd forget this kanji, now, wouldn't it..

column5: 1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 25-5-2006(126): You know how missing childrens' pictures often appear on milk cartons? Well here we have a missing hare. His concerned family is having his picture printed on the backs of receipts and even on stamps. So far, however, there has been no **SIGN OF THE HARE**.
column6: 2) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 8-11-2007(118): _rabbit ears_.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 10-9-2007(65): Identical to _egg_ , without the "yolks." Both hares and eggs are used for Spring celebrations because they are symbols of fertility.
column8: 4) [[TheSlakey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSlakey)] 8-1-2009(48): The **sign of the hare** is an Easter Bunny, with it's eggs that have no yoke (instead, they have candy).
column9: 5) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-7-2006(9): In this version of the story of the "Turtle and Rabbit Run a Race", the rabbit stops on his way to a shop where they sell _stamps_ , just meters away from the finishing line. In the shop, the rabbit quickly forgets about time and spends hours looking at stamps, finally after choosing a good hundred _stamps_ to buy, he receives a very long _receipt_ , and pays for them. He leaves the shop with stamps in one hand and the receipt in the other, and you guessed it… the turle won the race.

column5: 1) [[phauna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/phauna)] 28-2-2008(472): Haha! If you are reading this then I beat you. You went too slow, browsed the forum too long, or stayed out too late with your Japanese girl/boyfriend, whilst I, Kanji Master (you may call me 'sir'), sat alone in my room with a leaky pen and a clawed grip. column6: 2) [[Sleepyhead](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Sleepyhead)] 27-4-2009(317): The 巳 nd!!! =D.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-4-2007(296): The snake likes stealing pieces from mosaics, so if you notice your _mosaic has a piece missing_ , that’s a **sign of the snake**.
column8: 4) [[andresito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andresito)] 23-5-2009(256): **From now on THE **SIGN OF THE SNAKE** means YOUR SUCCESS on staying until the end, no matter difficulties or headaches, enjoyed more creative dreams, became a close fan of Mr. T and being accomplished.** The journey of mastering the kanji begins here. Add a +star to everybody here ^^.
column9: 5) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 29-12-2008(256): I was kinda expecting balloons to fall from the ceiling when i got here…

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 5-8-2006(120): I'm not going to use 'this here' as a primitive because it's too vague. But 'stop and sit down', usually tied to a tour guide explaining scenery works for me.// _Stop_ and _sit down_ to have a look at **this here**.
column6: 2) [[Tommy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tommy)] 15-6-2008(33): A wildlife explorer, let's call him Steve Irwin, the sadly passed away wildlife expert, is tracking down an animal in a forest. He finds a _footprint_ , and gets out a _spoon_ to taste it. He scrapes the spoon over the floor and tries it. "Now, **this here** is a crocodile footprint" he announces.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 21-7-2009(21): I'll _stop_ and _sit down_ on **this here** , whatever it is.
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 16-2-2010(16): Welcome to RtK3. I'll be your guide for a few stories along the way. astridtops wisely advises you to 'stop & sit down' here. The combo occurs only 4 more times, not counting 2 you already know, but still, he's right: _stop_ , _sit down_. My best advice going forward is to follow your 雌 [feminine/female](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/563) (#563 雌) instincts, but _kill the turkey_. He'll require resuscitation 14 times, but invariably will be done in by other primitives anyway,  & so _stop, sit down_ , ponder **this here** beginning, _kill the turkey_ , & bon voyage!
column9: 5) [[KristinHolly](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/KristinHolly)] 9-12-2008(11): Stop and get a spoon because **this here** is the best pudding you've ever tasted!

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-11-2008(75): (From mantixen's) I'll _stop_ and _sit down_ on _this here tree_ , which happens to be **brushwood**. Now I have to _brush wood_ off my butt.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(31): I'll _stop_ and _sit down_ on _this here tree_ , which happens to be **brushwood**.
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 15-8-2006(13): On our journey, we wanted to _stop and sit down_ near a _tree_ below, so we gathered some **brushwood** to make a camp fire.
column8: 4) [[Proxx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Proxx)] 9-1-2010(11): The Shiba- inu ( 柴犬 ) is looking for a _tree_ to _stop and sit down_ to poop but all he can find is some **brushwood**. Well, better than nothing!
column9: 5) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 2-3-2008(6): Remember that old gem of a movie, "A Christmas Story"? Ralphie goes with his father and little brother to pick out a tree for the living room, and the salesman continually tried to push sub-par specimens on them … though most were little more than **brushwood** , he kept repeating the phrase, "Now, this _tree, this here_ is a _tree_.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 7-4-2007(71): Those two tourists from my tour group don't have a **whit** of common sense. They never _stop and sit down_ when the tour guide tells them to!
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 16-9-2007(16): _Two_ -year-olds don't have a **whit** of interest to _stop and sit down_. They'd likely explode with all that energy.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 6-1-2007(8): Also means "just a little bit", so I won't care about positive/negative here. As the turkey is being chased after when it's fleeing to the safety of the fort, a tracker notices that the footprints are a **whit** ( 些か ) peculiar, and realizes that there are actually two turkeys, one walking on another's footprints. A truly small ( 本の些細な ) mistake.
column8: 4) [[nesert](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nesert)] 6-5-2011(6): _This here_? I don't give a **whit** about it..No, I don't give _two_ **whit** s about it!
column9: 5) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 25-1-2009(5): THIS HERE are TWO small **whit** tits, says my TOUR GUIDE, when she shows me them.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-8-2006(87): _Stop and sit down_ to listen to the tour guide's story. "These _stones_ down there used to be a **fort** , but the enemy came and tore the place down. It has never been rebuild".
column6: 2) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 24-8-2009(22): (Grammar and story adjustment from astridtops story) You STOP AND SIT DOWN to listen to the tour guides story. "These STONES are remnants of what used to be a **fort** long ago, but the enemy came and tore the place down. It has never been rebuilt".
column7: 3) [[delbertmon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delbertmon)] 28-1-2010(3): In a European **fort** ress you _stop and sit down_ on _stone_ floors. This is different from Japanese in which you would rest on the tatami floors.
column8: 4) [[KristinHolly](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/KristinHolly)] 4-1-2009(3): This here rock right below us is all that remains of the mighty **fort**.
column9: 5) [[Christoph](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christoph)] 11-3-2007(3): "You'll never get into this **fort**!!" the massive _stones_ that surround it will _stop_ you and force you to _sit_ helplessly outside!

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 14-8-2006(62): "Please _stop and sit down_ to look to the painting up there", the tour guide says. "We don't know exactly who is on the painting, but from the _shape_ of the _hair_ and the distinctive _beard_ , we think they meant to depict President Lincoln.".
column6: 2) [[Yozora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Yozora)] 21-9-2009(23): A **beard** is hair that, instead of wanting it SHAPED like your friends, you grow it LONG so that you can STOP, SIT DOWN and scratch it thoughtful while considering this here and that there.
column7: 3) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 7-7-2008(12): If you remember hair on the head is 髪 . But when my mother sees the state of my **beard** , she says, "What is _this_!?".
column8: 4) [[Shingo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shingo)] 7-9-2010(5): The hair that you shape (with your hand) when you stop and sit down is your **beard**.
column9: 5) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 19-1-2012(4): I was eating my soup when I saw a _hair_ y _shape_ in it. I _stop_ ped my _spoon_ immediately, and yelled outraged "What's _this here_?!! Then the cook arrived and said: "Oh, that's my detachable **beard** … sorry, my bad :(" (+jabberwockychortles).

column5: 1) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 15-10-2007(26): Being a Terrorist on the FBI most wanted list, _Bin Laden_ must constantly move from place to place and is never quite certain where is going to sleep. Sometimes he can count on a loyal supporter to let him stay in a spare room, but when traveling to more remote parts of Arabia, he is sometimes forced to sleep under an _umbrella_ with the **fowl**. (which consequently, makes him smell rather foul).
column6: 2) [[Pauline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pauline)] 11-2-2007(19): The villain from [detach](../v4/1492.html) (#1492 離) and [crystal](../v4/2048.html) (#2048 璃). Now, hidden under an _umbrella_ (don't want to be recognised), he is after any **fowl** for dinner. (fowl = birds such as chicken, duck and turkey).
column7: 3) [[gdaxeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gdaxeman)] 19-1-2008(14): Disguised under an _umbrella_ , _Sheik_ carefully tries to approach and capture a **fowl** nearby.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 11-10-2008(13): _Michael Jackson_ stands under an _umbrella_ feeding some **fowl** on his ranch.
column9: 5) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 9-2-2009(12): Odd Job uses an _umbrella_ to protect his elegant _top hat_ from the droppings of the _fowl_ flying overhead.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(103): A flying _fowl_ smashes into a _tree_ and all the **apple** s drop off. "Eureka!" shouts Newton, who happens to be watching.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 21-7-2009(10): _Michael Jackson_ stands under an _umbrella_ in case an **apple** falls way off the _tree_ like he did.
column7: 3) [[delbertmon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delbertmon)] 28-1-2010(6): A _tree_ is struck by a flying _fowl_ and all it's **apple** s fall to the ground. "Eureka!" shouts Newton, who happens to be watching. (mod of Katsuo).
column8: 4) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 22-1-2008(5): The SHIEK uses an UMBRELLA to knock **apple** s down from the TREE.
column9: 5) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 1-1-2009(2): **Apple** s have a tendency to _detach_ themselves from their _tree_ all by themselves, so if you're sitting underneath an **apple** tree, you'd better have an _umbrella_ set up over you!

column5: 1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 1-11-2007(77): Tom Cruise - American with sunglasses (thanks synewave). I can't **sympathize with** Tom Cruise's _state of mind_ regarding scientology.
column6: 2) [[saizen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saizen)] 5-11-2008(15): Have you ever seen the really poor looking children on the corner block with a _shoe shine_ stand? I can't help but to **sympathize with** them and give them some extra money. It eases my _state of mind_.
column7: 3) [[delbertmon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delbertmon)] 28-1-2010(8): Tom Cruise - American with sunglasses (thanks synewave). _Data_ can't **sympathize with** Tom Cruise's regarding scientology because it's illogical.
column8: 4) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 27-4-2008(8): Data, shoeshine: _Commander Data_ travels back in time with the Enterprise, to 19th century London. After seeing a poor street urchin rubbing _shoeshine_ on a rich man's shoe, he **sympathizes with** the poor people of this era.
column9: 5) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 15-10-2007(5): (right primitive = shoeshine. A poor blind man wearing _sunglasses_ is offering to provide professional quality **shoeshines** in exchange for some _rice_ to feed is poor family). Professional lobbyists know that they can manipulate the president's _state of mind_ to **sympathize with** their cause by getting a _shoeshine_. They know that the president is attracted to shiny things.

column5: 1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 17-2-2008(51): Tom Cruise's shoes caught on fire, because he was using phosphorous to shine them.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-10-2007(16): The _shoeshiner_ always starts by cleaning the shoes first with **phosphorus**. This is a bit risky, though, and he sets himself on _fire_ (picture him running around in flames).
column7: 3) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 20-5-2010(11): A **phosphorus** _fire_ engulfs _Tom Cruise_ during a bizarre scientology rite.
column8: 4) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 15-10-2007(6): For really high quality _shoeshines_ , the shoe shiner will rub **phosphorus** into your shoes. Afterwards, they will be so bright that they will appear to be on _fire_.
column9: 5) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 18-12-2006(6): When you see that someone's American sunglasses are on fire, he's probably put some **phosphorus** on them to for added Coolness(TM) effect (like 隣 is a neighbor who thinks American sunglasses are the pinnacle of coolness).

column5: 1) [[jesslawnz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jesslawnz)] 13-1-2009(43): As a scientologist, A DEER to TOM CRUISE, is not just a deer. It is actually a descendent of a **camelopard** that was sent by extraterrestrials.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 15-10-2007(26): You saw a **camelopard**!? Bullshit! Next your going to tell me that you saw a _deer_ getting a _shoeshine_. (Actually I saw a **camelopard** getting a _shoeshine_ , but now that you mention it, his body did look like a _deer_ …).
column7: 3) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 5-3-2008(16): Soaking wet with rain, Tom cruise comes riding in on a giraffe/camelopard running along with a team of deer during the pivotal scene in the very serious film, "The last samurai".
column8: 4) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 25-1-2010(6): Hint: if you didn't already know, 麒麟ビール = kirin beer. Second kanji. That's what this guy is for: <http://www.kirin.com/images/the_kirin.gif>.
column9: 5) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 13-9-2007(6): Like any mythical creature (bigfoot, Loch Ness monster, etc.), the **camelopard** would be an instant celebrity if seen in public. So he goes out incognito – dressed as a _deer_ and wearing _American_ _sunglasses_.

column5: 1) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 1-12-2008(53): Little known fact: _Tom Cruise_ turns into a merman at night, **scaled** like a _fish_ and everything. Weird.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 15-10-2007(39): A **scaled** _fish_ goes to a _shoeshine_ place to get his scales shined up to impress the lady fish. (Shoeshines will shine up any type of **scaled** creature, including but not limited to fish and dragons).
column7: 3) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 1-11-2007(8): _Tom Cruise_ **scaled** down his public display of affection after his appearance on Oprah looked a bit _fishy_.
column8: 4) [[zanzibar](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zanzibar)] 22-3-2009(5): TOM CRUISE has to wear the **scaled** costume of a FISH for his next role.
column9: 5) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 3-3-2008(3): _Fish_ are often served completely whole, head and all, in Japan … this tends to make trendy _Americans in sunglasses_ squeamish, however, as it makes it plainly obvious that the animal was **scaled**. Chopped up and deep-fried into unrecognizable nuggets … that's how we like our meat!

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 5-8-2006(50): Can't work with the Heisig primitive of Dachshund, as the all **encompassing** _big eel_ is obviously the mythical Norse Midgard Snake.
column6: 2) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 23-1-2008(48): The DACHSHUND is so long he can stretch himself around the circumference of the earth, **encompassing** the whole globe. (It might help to think of the dachshund as the slinky dog from Toy Story.).
column7: 3) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 15-10-2007(12): The _St. Bernard_ swallowed a live _eel_ in one piece. Now its stomach is **encompassing** the entire _eel_. Actually, the _eel_ is getting pretty pissed off and is shocking the _St. Bernard_ from the inside. (As a primitive this will be an Asian McDonald's Big Mac made with eel and dog instead of beef and worm.).
column8: 4) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 25-1-2010(9): According to Jim Breen (and cross-checked in Nelson's Modern Dict) the most "common" usage of this kanji is [奄々、エンエン](midori://search?text=奄々、エンエン) , meaning breathing, covering or obstructing. Or this idiom: " 気息奄奄 【きそくえんえん】 gasping for breath, on the brink of death, more dead than alive." I've chosen to call this "obstructed breath." (although I like astridtops big eel as a primitive) SO The big eel wrapped my neck and obstructed my breath - like that scene in the Princess Bride =).
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 11-10-2008(5): _Colossus #7_ (a _large eel_ from the game Shadow of the Colossus) is **encompassing** the whole screen with its mass.

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 23-1-2008(41): The hermit's home, his **hermitage** , is a simple CAVE where he lives with his pet DACHSHUND.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 4-2-2007(23): At the famous **Hermitage** museum in St. Petersburg, they have a _cave_ below the museum with a big sculpture of the _Midgard Snake_.
column7: 3) [[kanjiknight](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjiknight)] 17-4-2009(9): Are you looking for **hermitage**? Look no further! This _encompassing_ , all- inclusive _cave_ is all you need.

column5: 1) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 17-10-2007(31): A real **rabbit** always leaves DROPs of poo pellets behind, and his ears are no longer bound up (compere [excuse](../v4/1972.html) (#1972 免)), so they flap above like helicopter blades (pictograph), and his MOUTH still is wide-open with the STAFF-like tongue, and his powerful LEGS still look like a human's.
