column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 11-4-2007(9): Also written 兔, which differs from 免 by the combining of the fifth and seventh strokes (written bound, mouth, legs, dot). According to kakijun.main.jp, the center of 兎 is written open mouth+stick+closing stroke of mouth. The binding day schedule of the excuse-making Alice **rabbit** ( 晩 ) is gone, and only ears, mouth, (powerful, almost human-like) legs and drop-tail remain. In 兔 there's a foot in the mouth and in 兎 an ear tip. Strange **rabbit** ses.
column8: 4) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 24-4-2007(7): This beautiful **rabbit** is _Bugs'_ girlfriend. She's got her ears done up different on top, so the ends _drop_ down along the side of her _mouth_ , just like a pretty girl's hair. Of course, the _walking stick_ between the eyes isn't so cool, but the _Bugs-like_ _human legs_ are cool. Looks like she's gonna _drop_ that hanky, so that Bugs can try to win the heart of this vamp **rabbit**.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 16-3-2010(4): This is the killer **rabbit** from Monty Python (and The Holy Grail). Not content with a bit ( _long top drop_ ) of carrot, here we see _human legs_ in its _mouth_. And there's a _drop_ of blood dripping from it's _mouth_! On a final note, the victim had tried to ram a _walking stick_ in the **rabbit** 's mouth in a vain attempt to avoid his fate.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 14-11-2006(47): This is the kanji for the classical form of "is". I think Heisig's keyword "est" is the old english or latin word for "is". The Scorpion this **est**!
column6: 2) [[this_is_douglas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/this_is_douglas)] 3-7-2009(23): "Est" is the latin third person singular of the verb "esse" (to be) in Latin. So, this word has been chosen to point out that this character is found chiefly in Classical Japanese (also names). I imagine an incredibly haughty Latin _Scorpion_ , looking down at his vast **est** ate and saying "Mihi **est** ". This literally mean "It is to me" and means "It's mine" … this is gramatically similar to how Japanese express possession too, incidentally.
column7: 3) [[Regular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Regular)] 21-10-2010(11): C' **est** un _scorpion_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(8): A _scorpion_ this **est**.
column9: 5) [[eatyoda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eatyoda)] 10-12-2008(5): **Est** …eastern standard time. "The _Scorpion_ King" **est** showing only on **eastern standard time**.

(cf. 謹む [discreet](../v4/1576.html) (#1576 謹), 勤める [diligence](../v4/1577.html) (#1577 勤), 僅か [trifle](../v4/2116.html) (#2116 僅), 飢饉 [Unicode-0x9949](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/39241) (#39241 饉)) … Story: This kanji refers to the _Flower_ **Violet** , not to the color **Violet** , even thought the clever way to remember it is as **Violet** _Cabbage_ with a little extra.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-11-2006(39): Spending the _day_ with your _eye_ on your _crotch_ as you meditate on the **mandala**.
column6: 2) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 28-2-2008(17): Citing my story for [ridicule](../v4/829.html) (#829 慢): "It's clearly an Indian **mandala** , with the Buddha _sitting cross-legged_ , _eyes_ closed as in trance, beneath the _sun_ , a symbol of the enlightenment which one can reach by practicing His teachings.".
column7: 3) [[eatyoda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eatyoda)] 10-12-2008(9): Same as primitive: a **mandala** has three circles centering on one point. The outer circle is the _sun_ which represents the spiritual, what we can't comprehend, the middle is the _eye_ which represents the feelings of man, the inner is a _crotch_ that represents our carnal instincts.
column8: 4) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 15-1-2008(8): <Http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandala> People usually mediate with staring at the sun with their eyes, cross (crotch) legged. Here, sun=mandala.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 1-6-2010(7): The **mandala** is a graphic representation of the universe: the _sun_ representing the cosmos, the _eye_ represents the human observer, and the _crotch_ represents animal instincts. (Thanks for original story by Codexus.).

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 16-2-2008(28): Mr. T was selected to head up the committee studying the **Yamato** period.
column6: 2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 13-10-2007(21): There's always a _person_ named **Yamato** on every _committee_. And I always hate them.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 14-7-2009(12): This kanji was originally used as the Chinese word for Japan, and its etymological meaning is that of a "supplicating people". In the 8th century the use of this kanji to describe Japan (read as "Wa" or "Yamato") was changed to the kanji for [harmony](../v4/897.html) (#897 和), which was popular because the Japanese liked to believe that their society was based on harmony (not on being submissive and dominable as this kanji suggests). Story: _Dad_ joined the **Yamato** _committee_ to foster international cooperation.
column8: 4) [[gdaxeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gdaxeman)] 23-1-2008(12): The _committee_ decided that _Mr. T_ 's Japanese name is going to be **Yamato** , and he agrees.

column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 26-6-2008(25): _Mr. T_ believes in **chivalry** \- so whenever he plays a game of rock, paper, scissors, he always throws _scissors_ to let the other person win. column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 26-6-2008(15): The first television show that _Mr T_ ever worked on was a slavery period drama. Operating on the assumption that all black people look alike, the director decided to save on his budget by just hiring one black person. In each scene requiring slaves in the background to **work a field** , he would put _Mr T_ in the rice paddy in the background. Then when they changed the scene, he would simply put _Mr T_ there too - no changing clothes, no CG - just the same dude in the background of EVERY scene.

column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 7-11-2008(4): Since the A-Team ended, _Mr. T_ has been trying to **make a profit** by appearing in _various_ television commercials. Has anyone seen that snickers ad? Reminds me of kanji…

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 30-4-2008(40): Mr T, angel: Believe it or not, but _mr T_ is actually an _angel_. He **emigrated** from heavens to right the wrongs on planet earth.

column7: 3) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 4-10-2007(10): The pearly white _angels_ of heaven don't accept black **emigrants**. Not even a man of _Mr T_ 's stature would be allowed in.
column8: 4) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 13-1-2009(5): Back in the day, any _person_ who was an **emigrant** to the U.S. considered the Statue of Liberty an _angel_.
column9: 5) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 12-6-2010(2): (NB: For 僑 I use the alternative keyword **TEMPORARY HOME**.) The **TEMPORARY HOME** of _MR T_ is, of course, in Los _ANGEL_ es, as required by his work in showbiz.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 22-5-2007(50): _Mr. T_ is a man of **integrity**. Every time he opens his _mouth_ , **integrity** just seems to _stream_ out.
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 4-10-2007(16): _Mr T_ 's structural **integrity** has been compromised. Blood and guts is _flowing_ from his _mouth_.
column7: 3) [[Weber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Weber)] 2-7-2007(7): **Integrity** is when only one current comes from a person's mouth.

He could use violence to get what he wants, but he shows **integrity** and just talks.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(3): _Haruhi_ maintains her **integrity** even as a _flood_ of vomit comes out of her _mouth_.

column5: 1) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 25-7-2009(34): At a **memorial** service for _Mr. T_ , everyone is _thinking_ "I pity that foo".
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 15-4-2007(32): A **memorial** service is something that makes you _think_ about a _person_ who has died.
column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 17-4-2007(6): A **memorial** service is held for the recently departed Mr. T. "I know that even long after he is gone, we will all continue to hold him in our hearts and minds." weaps the preacher adorned with gold chains.
column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 21-4-2010(4): At a **memorial** service, _Mr. T_ tones down his usual "I pity da foo" by saying "I _think_ I pity da foo". （ 人 ）を 偲ぶ (しのぶ): honor the memory of ( 人 ) ( 人 ）を 偲ぶ便 (よすが): memento to remember someone by 偲ぶ音楽 (しのぶおんがく): **memorial** concert, **memorial** music performance 故人を偲ぶ (こじんをしのぶ): to think of the dead 昔を偲ばせる品 (むかしをしのばせるしな): things reminiscent of bygone days.
column9: 5) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 10-12-2008(3): _Mr. T_ goes to the 9/11 **memorial** to just sit and _think_.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 7-11-2008(33): _Mr. T_ is _exhausted_! **As is** the woman who just gave him _shakuhachi_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 5-10-2007(16): You see _person_ holding the _exhaust_ pipe which has just dropped off their new car, and say, "You should return that and get your money back!". "Trouble is," they reply, "I bought it **as is** ".
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-6-2008(11): _Mr T_ buys a used car **as is** and gets a great deal. As soon as he gets it off the lot, though, the _exhaust_ _freezes_ and falls off. He stops the car and yells out the window - "Hey, fool, you better give me a refund!" "No, " says the salesman, "you bought that **as is**!". _Mr T_ calmly steps out of the car, picks up the _exhaust_ , walks over to the salesman, and wraps the _exhaust_ pipe around his neck (causing his neck to _freeze_ from the cold). I pity the fool that runs an **as is** scam.
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 5-10-2007(9): " _Mr T_ is _exhausted_. I will leave these fools **as is** ".
column9: 5) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 4-12-2009(4): Note: This is a simplified and far less used form of the character 儘. Heisig loves simplified characters for some reason.

column5: 1) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 12-5-2009(26): Once again, _Mr. T_ ventured out into the remote area to visit his _old taskmaster_ (see [permanence/remote](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/958) (#958 悠)). However, the _old taskmaster_ has become very weak. His _flesh_ looks like **dried meat** and his heart almost stopped (no heart). He stayed a whole _month_ to take care about his former teacher.
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(11): _Mr. T_ doesn't like **dried meat**. He's been known to take a _walking stick_ to the _taskmaster_ trying to hand him a piece of _meat_ that had been dried out. No, _Mr. T_ doesn't like **dried meat** a-t a-l-l!
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-6-2008(4): If you recall from [discipline](../v4/1722.html) (#1722 修), _Hitler_ was standing on top of _Ditto_ trying to discipline him (read: smacking him repeatedly with a _walking stick_ ) into being able to faithfully reproduce a likeness of _Mr T_. _Hitler_ keeps whacking and whacking, and whacking! He actually forgets to look down to see if _Ditto_ is handling this okay - and when he finally does, _Ditto_ has lost his flexibility and has turned into a small piece of **dried meat**. "Oh vell," thinks Hitler, "I vas hunkry anyvay.".
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 28-10-2010(3): 束脩 [dried meat](../v4/2130.html) (#2130 脩) シュウ, おさむ … Parts: 修 -彡, 月 (cf: 悠 [permanence/remote](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/958) (#958 悠), 修 [discipline](../v4/1722.html) (#1722 修), 篠 [slender bamboo](../v4/2639.html) (#2639 篠) … Note: Usually the male name おさむ … Story: Historically the offering of **dried meat** ( 束脩 ) given by an apprentice to a master when coming for training. So to get 修 [discipline](../v4/1722.html) (#1722 修), an apprentice must bring meat. Then over time that meat is Shaped into Discipline.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 30-4-2009(2): Here, we see _Yoda_ with his _walking stick_ in hand, playing the _taskmaster_. This time he's conjuring up images of **dried _meat_** to test the willpower of a starved Luke Skywalker.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-12-2006(43): " **My son** ", sniffs _Mr. T_ , "I'm so glad that you are now a college _graduate_ " he said.
column6: 2) [[Nuriko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nuriko)] 7-5-2011(11): Important note: Instead of the keyword "my son," the keyword "good for nothing son" may be more appropriate. This word is one of the examples of depreciating titles for family members. This word is used to refer to your son when you especially want to lower his status. So, keep that in mind when deciding on a story or when making your own. I suggest CountPacula's story, since it involves that "good for nothing son" meaning a little more.
column7: 3) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 17-1-2009(9): I won't consider _that person_ to be **my son** until he actually manages to show he's capable of something and _graduates_!
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 30-4-2009(5): Only after _Luke Skywalker graduates_ as a fully-fledged jedi does Vader finally tell him the big secret - "I'm your father… you're **my son** ".
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-6-2008(2): My dad had a hard time picking me out of the crowd at my high school _graduation_ , so at my college _graduation_ , I taped a magazine cutout picture of _Mr T_ to my cap (we have both been fans of the _A-Team_ series since it came out). I didn't tell him, though, so as to surprise him. When I came out in the big line, I could hear my dad's love and surprise as he shouted - "hey, there, that young man in the _Mr T_ cap! That's **my son**!!!".

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 10-12-2012(53): Note that the meaning of this (rare) kanji is " **make** (something) / **do** (something)", not "get by with". Story: _Mr. T_ doesn't rely on _happenstance_ , he **makes** things **do** what he wants. Edit: In fact three Japanese kanji dictionaries I checked all list 做 as an alternative to 作 [make](../v4/1142.html) (#1142 作), so " **make (alt)** " might be the best keyword. Story: _Mr. T_ by _happenstance_ found an **alt** ernative way to **make** things. (See also bennyb  & faneca's notes).
column6: 2) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 4-4-2010(7): (food for thought) I know this is RTK3 and all, but this kanji seems almost completely useless. The two most common phrases it's included in are 言い做す to speak as though something were actually the case and 見なす to regard (as equivalent). Both of which USUALLY just write なすin kana, and neither of which have anything to do with the meaning. In fact I can't find any trace of Katsuo's suggestion of this meaning. Anyone care to enlighten me? Perhaps this one's worth skipping.
column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 17-4-2007(6): _Mr. T_ is an _old_ -school _taskmaster_. He **makes** all his little T's **do** their chores and **do** their homework before bed. "I ain't gonna let those kids slide!".
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 7-1-2007(6): A _person_ should try to make his own luck, but sometimes you have to **make do** with _happenstance_.
column9: 5) [[faneca](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/faneca)] 14-7-2012(4): @bennyb: As much as I usually love katsuo's contributions, I agree with you this time. For the sense you mention, I guess " **figuratively** " would be a better keyword. See [1]: [「見做す」](midori://search?text=「見做す」) "to regard [figuratively] as", [「思い做しか」](midori://search?text=「思い做しか」) "imagination (to think [figuratively])", etc. On the other hand, look at the Chinese compounds at [2]: it clearly means "make"/"do" ( 做爱 to make love, 做梦 to dream). [1] [ <http://tangorin.com/general/>做 ] [2] [ <http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/>做 ].

column5: 1) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 12-12-2008(50): (Note that per Heisig, this doesn't mean 'able to cut', it means mentally **sharp** , adept, or 'on your toes'!) During the _Ice_ Age, cavemen had to be especially careful around the woolly mammoth, because they were more mentally _sharp_ than they looked. If the cavemen weren't careful, they could end up impaled on the mammoths' _tusks_!
column6: 2) [[shirahime](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shirahime)] 10-1-2008(18): A **sharp** tusk pointing out of the ice. Probably belongs to a mammoth.
column7: 3) [[Pauline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pauline)] 23-5-2007(12): The _ice_ -age mammoth was very **sharp** and knew how to make use of its _tusks_.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 15-7-2009(7): "That boy's as **sharp** as an _iced tusk_ ," went the popular expression back in the days when kanji were being invented. _Ice_ of course can be **sharp** to the touch at times, as can _tusks_ , so naturally an _iced tusk_ was one of the **sharp** est things around back then (hence the simile).
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(5): A _tusk_ **sharp** enough to cut _ice_.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 24-4-2007(48): You don't want the lettuce to **wilt** , do you? So, you put _ice_ around the _circumference_ of the serving tray, and then the lettuce on top of that, so it cannot **wilt**.
column6: 2) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 10-12-2008(17): Plants **wilt** , wither and die when _ice_ envelopes the _circumference_ of their roots.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 22-7-2009(7): If _ice_ forms around the _circumference_ of a plant, how can it **wilt**?
column8: 4) [[morganandrew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/morganandrew)] 28-4-2011(3): Put an ICE CUBE around the CIRCUMFERENCE of a dick and it will soon **WILT** , shrivel up and become useless.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 18-12-2006(3): They put a _circumference_ of _ice_ around the room where the flowers for the wedding were stored, to prevent them from **wilt** ing.

column5: 1) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 10-3-2008(42): On their _walk_ to the Promised Land ([land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸)), our brave _rice-seedlings_ are faced with an unforeseen obstacle: An _ice_ glacier the size of a rain puddle. Will they be able to **pull through**?
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-10-2006(17): In a very harsh turn of the weather, the water of the rice fields has turned to _ice_! The farmers are strutting around the little _rice seedlings_ anxiously on their _walking legs_ , hoping that the plants will **pull through** and survive!
column7: 3) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 12-12-2008(10): [dramatic music] The _ice_ comes, and we wonder if the little _rice seedlings_ will **pull through** , or their tiny little _walking legs_ will freeze first…
column8: 4) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 10-6-2010(3): With cryogenics they can **pull through** , _ice_ has replaced The Pinnacle horrors for those in the [mausoleum](../v4/1518.html) (#1518 陵)and saved them!
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 11-1-2009(3): During the winter the line to Lenin's mausoleum is very difficult to bear. But if you're patient you'll **pull through** , even if slightly frozen.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 24-4-2007(45): Much more **stately** than that soil podium, this is made of _ice_. You can still see the dude standing behind it in his _top hat_ , and he still spouts pretty much nonsense as many _times_ as he can, but you have to admit his _showy altar_ is quite **stately**.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 3-1-2007(13): This **stately** home in Brittain has been used for winter weddings _many times_. A reverend in a _top hat_ stands behind the _altar_ in the home's chapel, which is adorned with _ice_ sculptures. Very romantic.
column7: 3) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 11-10-2009(6): One can have a **STATELY** wedding in Hell, Norway. Stunning ICE sculptures all around, a TOP HAT clad wedding chapel reverend performing weddings many TIMES a day behind a frozen ALTAR. (Thanks astridtops) See <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hell>,_Norway for more info.
column8: 4) [[kioku3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kioku3)] 19-7-2009(3): Abe Lincoln visited the state of Minnesota in January 1863, and decided to give his speech from an _ice altar_ at an unheated but **stately** church instead of a soil _podium_. It was a **stately** speech in the coldest state of the Union.
column9: 5) [[faneca](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/faneca)] 14-7-2012(1): [See 禀[Unicode-0x7980](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/31104) (#31104 禀), 稟[Unicode-0x7a1f](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/31263) (#31263 稟): Chosen keywords: **Salary in rice** , **disposition**. Willy Wonka holds a **meeting consultation** with the oompa loompas to inspect their **disposition** to earn their **salary in wheat**. But they don't seem very eager: they drop the wheat and put Willy Wonka over the _evil altar_ …]. Wonka then uses his baton to press a button and lower the temperature: the oompa loompas stay _iced_ while he gets himself up on the altar and pretends to look _stately_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-2-2007(56): I'm drying myself at the 露天風呂 (outdoor hot spring) when a sudden gust of _wind_ catches my _towel_ and blows it into the air. I chase after it and onlookers remark, "Look, he's flying a **kite**!".

column5: 1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 26-10-2007(38): Souring in the _winds_ there is only _one bird_ left. The **phoenix**. It scorched the other birds, never to return…
column6: 2) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 26-1-2010(17): (The extra stroke combines with _white_ in the bird component to make a _hundred-year-old bird_ ) The **Phoenix** – the bird made famous in myth, that after it reaches _hundreds_ of years of age, is reborn and rises again on the _wind_.
column7: 3) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 24-4-2008(15): The famed **Ho-oh** rides the wind above all other birds. 鳳 appears to refer to the male bird, while 凰 refers to the female, presumably one whose beauty is coveted by emperors. (The generic word Ho-oh is the compound 鳳凰 . Note that technically this is not the **Phoenix** but shares some similarities.).
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 31-12-2006(6): The **phoenix** is a legendary _bird_ , that when the _ceiling_ of its existence is reached, goes up in the flames of spontaneous combustion. However, when his ashes are thrown into the _wind_ , the **phoenix** will be reborn.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(4): The **phoenix** is a _bird_ that can reach the _ceiling_ of the _wind_.

column6: 2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 5-5-2009(21): The _ransom note_ explained that if the _gold_ was not received by the following morning, the victim would be **slaughtered** with a _saber_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(10): A guy brought a _receipt_ and a _sword_ to Wal-Mart customer service asking for a refund in _gold_ , but when they didn't give it to him, he pulled out another _saber_ and **slaughter** ed all the employees.
column8: 4) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 11-4-2010(6): Xtra info: In case anyone's wondering about the actual relevance of this character: Nelson's Dict. lists it as meaning "axe" or "kill," and only gives りゅう as a reading. RTK3 book lists the compound 劉封 りゅうほう, the "name of an early Han- dynasty emperor." I bet your best chance of seeing this in "the wild" (outside rtk3) would be in a name, esp. a samurai-drama ( 時代劇 ).
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 13-11-2008(4): Officer: "Do you have a receipt for that _dagger_?" Boy: "Well, no.. It's just a piece of scrap metal" Officer: "In that case I'm gonna have to **slaughter** you with my _sabre_!".

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 9-10-2006(89): The _younger brother_ wants to look cool and **shave** s himself with a _saber_ instead of a razor.
column6: 2) [[Fishface](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Fishface)] 28-1-2010(9): My _little brother_ kept asking me to teach him to **shave**. I got a little tired of his requests so I told him to try it himself using a _sabre._ Long story short, he won't be annoying me anymore.
column7: 3) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 13-11-2008(6): Your _younger brother_ wants to **shave** too, so he takes his toy _saber_ since you won't give him a razor.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(4): My _younger brother_ looks like _Sabre_ tooth and needs to **shave**.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-6-2008(2): Your _little brother_ has been trying to sneak into Dad's medicine cabinet and **shave** with his razor. Dad is worried he'll cut himself, so he locks it up. Determined to be cool like the big kids, _little bro_ goes to the mantle and takes the _saber_ off and starts **shaving**. You walk in on him while he's doing this and he cuts up his face!

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 19-8-2006(73): The poor _chihuahua_ who had fallen down a _cliff_ was totally **despondent** about his position. He saw the _sun_ and the _moon_ pass by, but expected no rescue any more.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-6-2008(7): While you may know the story of Hachikou, this is about a _chihuahua_ that lost its master. They used to play a game - _Sun_ and _Moon_ \- where the master would stand at the top of a cliff and wave his hands as if to resemble sunrays, and the dog would lie on the ground in a crescent shape - then they would switch. But one day the master fell! The dog, for years after, would go to the spot where he fell at _sun_ and _moon_ rise and look **despondent**. Imagine the **despondent** puppydog eyes.
column7: 3) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 21-6-2010(3): Under a _cliff_ , the _sun_ beating on its _flesh_ , our _chihuahua_ is **despondent** realizing there's no Taco Bell around here.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(2): A **despondent** _chihuahua_ sits at the base of the _cliff_ and watches the _sun_ and _moon_ cycle around.
column9: 5) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 15-1-2011(1): The _chihuahua_ had become **despondent** as the _sun_ was going down and the _moon_ was coming p and he was still stuck at the base of the _cliff_.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(23): I've been sent to chase the **wild goose**! I'm here at the top of the _cliff_ , and I can hear _Mr. T_ and that tricky _turkey_ down there sniggering about sending me on a search for the **wild goose**.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-6-2008(22): _Mr T_ is sent on a mission to find a **wild goose** that swallowed some important, top-secret chemicals (they were in a baggie, so he has to find it before it dissolves!). After searching for clues and tracks, he finds it - and backs it up against a cliff. In a heroic move, _Mr T_ jumps off the _cliff_ , grabs the **wild goose** , and lands on the ground on his back, protecting the volatile **wild goose**. He then looks at it - wait - this isn't the **wild goose** , this is a mere _turkey_! Sent on a **wild goose** chase!
column7: 3) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 7-1-2009(11): MR.T wanted to catch a **wild goose** for dinner but all he found was a TURKEY that fell off a CLIFF.
column8: 4) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 10-6-2010(5): Sent on a **wild goose** chase by the A-Team, we find _Mr. T_ has cornered a _turkey_ under a _cliff_. "I pity da foo sent me on this **wild goose** chase only to corner a turkey under this damn cliff! says Mr. T.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 16-4-2010(3): A **wild goose** chase that leads directly to the 2nd of 14 _turkey_ fatalities in RtK3. The _person primitive_ chasing the _turkey_ s/he falsely believed to be a **wild goose** came to a sad end, along with the _turkey_ , of course (they can flutter but not fly), r.i.p., over the _cliff_ , sayonara. Careful 鴻 [large goose](../v4/2313.html) (#2313 鴻).

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 19-8-2006(49): The police hoped to catch the crooks making **counterfeit** _money_ , but it all turned out to be a _wild goose_ chase.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 11-5-2009(27): You catch a _wild goose_ that lays _money_ ( _shells_ ) instead of eggs. Unfortunately the bank declares it **counterfeit**.
column7: 3) [[Machine_Gun_Cat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Machine_Gun_Cat)] 8-7-2009(8): Some criminal is trying t0o make **counterfeit** １０００円 notes but the dumb shit puts a goose picture on the back instead of a 鶴 .
column8: 4) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 20-1-2009(3): The mob distributes its **counterfeit** _money_ by stuffing it into _wild goose_ dolls which they sell as a front to real business in the back.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(1): Perhaps deservedly, the _money Haruhi's_ club made from selling the [wild goose](../v4/2150.html) (#2150 雁) was **counterfeit** , just like their _turkey_.

column5: 1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 1-6-2007(51): If someone's **whisper** ing you'd need three ears close to his mouth to be able to hear it.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 22-7-2009(43): It's funny how if I just talk, no one listens, but if I **whisper** , _many ears_ are eager to hear what's coming from my _mouth_.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 29-4-2006(10): People are curious beasts. If you **whisper** something out of your mouth, there will be many ears listening. Or alternatively, think in terms of power levels: In kanjis, the same element can appear in groups of 1-3. Here we see mouth power level dropped to the minimum (whisper), which means that ear power level has to be raised to the maximum. (like mobile phones, which need more power when the bars indicating signal strength drop).
column8: 4) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 29-6-2009(7): What _one mouth_ **whisper** s, _three ears_ will overhear…
column9: 5) [[delenir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/delenir)] 4-6-2012(1): You would need 3 ears to hear a **whisper**.

column8: 4) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 16-1-2009(3): **Chewing** involves putting food in your _mouth_ and crushing it with your _teeth_. 生噛じり (superficial knowledge). 苦虫を噛みつぶしたよう (sour expression, as if having consumed a bitter bug). 噛み分ける (taste, distinguish, understand).
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 16-6-2010(2): If you put **chew** (tobacco) in your _mouth_ , you may lose your _teeth_.

column5: 1) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 2-1-2009(68): "come true" is a better keyword IMO. If you speak your wish 10 times it will come true.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 22-10-2006(32): With his big _mouth_ he claims he can do _ten_ things at once. "It's all **within my ability** ", he boasts.
column7: 3) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 21-7-2008(10): 叶う (P), 適う , 敵う 【かなう】 (v5u) (1) (esp. 叶う ) to come true (wish), (2) (See 道理に適う ) (uk) to be suited, (3) (esp. 敵う ) to match (implies competition), to rival, to bear (e.g. I can't bear the heat), (P) 叶える 【かなえる】 (v1,vt) to grant (request, wish), (P) STORY: Christians say that if you pray with your MOUTH to the CROSS all of your WISHES will COME TRUE. Yeah right…

(Note: Proboscis is the more accurate keyword assigned by Heisig in the supplemental kanji list he recently released.).

column5: 1) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 31-10-2007(39): **Miso** is full of active microbial cultures, so when you put it in your MOUTH, those bacteria just INCREASE and INCREASE until your mouth is overflowing with **miso**!
column6: 2) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 10-6-2010(24): The みそ汁 in your MOUTH was FORMERLY soy beans.
column7: 3) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 25-1-2009(8): My hunger _increases_ as the **miso** gets closer to my _mouth_.
column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 27-4-2010(5): **Miso** _increases_ the tastiness of the foods that you put in your _mouth_ (e.g., grilled pork marinated in **miso** ). 味噌漬け (みそづけ): meat, fish, or vegetables preserved in **miso** 味噌汁 (みそしる): **miso** soup 糠味噌 (ぬかみそ): salted rice-bran paste for pickling 糠味噌臭い (ぬかみそくさい): having an air of domesticity 手前味噌 (てまえみそ): self-flattery, singing one's own praises.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-2-2007(5): _Prince_ opens his _mouth_ to drink **miso** soup when he's in Japan.

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 19-2-2007(34): The **city walls** are beautifully built. High above you, shows you the famous _mouth_ s of former city mayors, all smiling down at you, integrated into a total _mosaic_ making the **city walls** a unified beautiful work of art.
column6: 2) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 25-7-2009(21): I stand outside the **city walls** , requesting permission to enter. The guard hands me a Rubik's cube and tells me ill only be allowed in after I fit the whole thing in my mouth…
column7: 3) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 12-1-2009(4): The only way to pass through these **city walls** is through this secured _mouth_ here. You have to solve a _rubik's cube_ for it to open.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 13-3-2010(3): The **city walls** had a lovely _mosaic_ design. However, they also had defensive features including _openings_ above through which boiling oil could be poured or cannons fired.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 15-5-2009(2): In Murakami's 'End of the World' scenario, the only way to escape the **city walls** was via the _mouth_ of the river, which the Dreamreader found by piecing his thoughts together like a _mosaic_.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 12-10-2006(92): His _mouth_ fell open **dumbfounded** when he woke up and found himself on top of a _tree_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-10-2007(55): The first time I saw an Australian apricot tree ( 呆 vs. 杏 ) I was **dumbfounded**.
column7: 3) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 2-4-2009(8): My MOUTH fell open **dumbfounded** when she told me that it is ok that I put my WOOD into her MOUTH.
column8: 4) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 6-8-2009(6): You'd be **dumbfounded** too if you found a _tree_ with a _mouth_! The damn thing can talk, and no it's not dumb, it's quite intelligent!
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 30-6-2008(5): [+katsuo] A certain tribe of people live entirely on _apricots_ \- but they constantly cut the top of their _mouths_ on the stems (cutting fruit is against their religion). An English anthropologist happens upon them one day and sees their dilemma - and suggests that they turn the _apricot_ upside down ( 杏 – > 呆 ). They are **dumbfounded** , and overjoyed at not having bleeding palettes anymore - but this new way cuts up their vocal cords and leaves them literally **dumbfounded**!

column5: 1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 2-12-2006(41): **Ingest** is a fancy word for what you do with your _mouth_ as you _eat_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-10-2007(19): Note: This is a colloquial word for "eat", so the formal keyword "ingest" might better be replaced with something like "scoff" or "tuck in", etc. Suggested story: "Yeuk! I can see the _food_ rolling around in your _mouth_ when you **scoff** it like that!".
column7: 3) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 21-5-2008(5): It's too simple! MOUTH & FOOD eatquals– **ingest**! You **ingest** so much food you **ingest** your own mouth. Slow down, champ.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-4-2011(2): **Ingest** implies something that goes in your _mouth_ and you swallow it, not necessarily something you deliberately _eat_. If you stick your head out the window of a car and **ingest** a fly, it's not the same as deliberately _eat_ ing a fly at the dinner table. [Note: what Katsuo says is true, this kanji means **OM NOM NOM NOM**. My elaboration of the keyword "ingest" stops me from confusing it with [repast](../v4/2798.html) (#2798 餐).].
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 29-11-2010(1): 喰らう , 喰う , 面喰らう , ビンタを喰う [ingest](../v4/2182.html) (#2182 喰) 国字 , くう, くらう … Parts: 口 , 食 … Similars: 喰う [ingest](../v4/2182.html) (#2182 喰), 食う [eat](../v4/1472.html) (#1472 食), 喫煙 [consume](../v4/1550.html) (#1550 喫) … Note: Means the same thing as 食う .

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(50): This one rhymes: "If you fights wiz Cassius **Clay** , you'll hit the _soil_ , boy, _straightaway_!".

column9: 5) [[eckbw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eckbw)] 4-7-2011(1): **Clay** comes from the soil and you need to form it into something straightaway or it´ll dry up and become unusable. Onyomi ショク.

column5: 1) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 17-3-2008(57): While " **autochthonous** " can mean "indigenous" in ENGLISH, that is NOT one of the potential meanings of this character (thus, the majority of these stories will not help you with meaning). Rather, the kanji is "autochthonous" in the sense of being Earthly, mystic, and portentous (the ancient, primitive, sacred power of DIRT and SOIL). A vague, poorly-chosen keyword all around. Mantixen's story does the best job of conveying accurate meaning–> "A _monkey_ likes the **earthy/autochthonous** feel of _soil_ ".
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(33): A _monkey_ likes the **earthy** feel of _soil_.
column7: 3) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 16-2-2009(9): When it saw the keyword for this kanji, the _monkey_ _soiled_ itself…
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 29-8-2010(5): I've never seen this word before, so I'm just going to say it's the name of a Pokemon. **Authochthonous** is a giant monkey made of dirt with all sorts of "earthy" attacks.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 15-1-2009(5): Heisig explains this has meaning of "earthly" in Chinese astrology. Replace the altar with soil in 神 and you have **authochthonous** diety.

column5: 1) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 16-12-2009(33): A **DUGOUT** is a dry moat found around Japanese castles. The SOIL is arranged so as to OVERPOWER (or give the advantage to OVERPOWER) an attacking army. If dug in a low lying area it fills with water and becomes a moat ( 濠 [moat](../v4/2306.html) (#2306 濠)).
column6: 2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 15-4-2008(14): As they constructed the visiting team **dugout** , they removed a quantity of _soil_ when there was an _overpowering_ stench. Nobody will want to use this **dugout**!
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 18-5-2009(10): Too scared to go up to bat, one of the players _soils_ himself in the **dugout**. The smell is so _overpowering_ , the other players have to step out for air.
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 7-11-2008(10): We needed to create a **dugout** in the _soil_ in order to avoid the _overpowering_ attacks coming from the sky.
column9: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 8-8-2009(5): Hiding in a **dugout** , below the _soil_ is the once _overpowering_ Sadam Hussein.

column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-10-2008(21): The _empress_ gets a _soil_ mask at the spa to treat a **blemish**.

If that doesn't help, try this: The _empress_ is actually using the services of akaname to clean **blemish** off her face. As for the poison, well it works like botox..

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 4-5-2008(49): Soil, box, sun, woman: In Peru, they were constructing a **dam** and to this end, _soil_ was gathered from the surrounds. A nice archeological find, but detrimental for the **dam** building efforts, since the work was to be halted.
column6: 2) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 11-8-2009(18): To build the **dam** , _soil_ was collected and carried in _cardboard boxes_. And when the _sun_ got hot, they made the _women_ do it.

column8: 4) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 14-2-2008(6): This is a picnic: a 宴 [banquet](../v4/191.html) (#191 宴) outside of the house, sitting on a flattened _box_ on the _soil_. column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 22-7-2009(4): Workers constructing the **dam** bring a _boxed lunch_ (a _banquet_ in a _box_ without a house under which to eat it) and try not to get _soil_ in it.

column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 31-10-2010(2): 嬰児 , 退嬰 , 退嬰的 , [suckling infant](../v4/2193.html) (#2193 嬰)エイ, みどりご … Parts: 貝 , 貝 , 女 (cf 櫻[Unicode-0x6afb](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/27387) (#27387 櫻), 鸚 [parakeet](../v4/2830.html) (#2830 鸚) … Story: Old 桜 is 櫻. column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 21-3-2011(3): 宍 , [venison](../v4/2216.html) (#2216 宍) ニク, しし … Parts: 宀, 六 (cf 冥土 [Hades](../v4/2841.html) (#2841 冥), 暝 [murky](../v4/2843.html) (#2843 暝)) … Note: Only two 漢字 read ニク: 肉 [meat](../v4/1022.html) (#1022 肉), and 宍 [venison](../v4/2216.html) (#2216 宍) … Aerin Story remix: The _deer_ I kept in my _house_ for **venison** is named _ロク six_ It's a joke, because after I hunt him, in my _House_ and kill him, I eat _ロク ( 鹿 )_ for _ロク-(6)_ days.
column9: 5) [[theasianpleaser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/theasianpleaser)] 28-1-2009(3): A _house_ with the number _666_ and strips of **venison** hanging out front.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 10-10-2007(80): You aren't supposed to throw an American _flag_ out with the **rubbish**. The proper way to get rid of a flag is to burn it, shown here by holding a _candle_ underneath it.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 27-7-2008(7): Japanese society has always been quite environmentally conscious. Even back in the Edo period, they had an ingenious method for punishing people that didn't properly separate their **rubbish**. If, for example, you threw your ペットボトル into the paper can, a large _Semaphore Flag_ would fly up out of nowhere and alert people, and a _candle_ would fly out of the can and catch you on fire, so that people would know immediately who the perpetrator was.
column7: 3) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 2-10-2010(3): Protestors treat the _flags_ like **rubbish** and set them ablaze using _candles_.
column8: 4) [[jesse](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jesse)] 27-2-2011(2): Burning a _flag_ with a _candle_ is a **rubbish** idea. Why would you want to do that?
column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 12-5-2007(2): Lately, the dustman has been leaving my **rubbish** at the curb. This time, I've put a _flag_ there, and for good measure I've added an item of fireworks which emits _sparks_. He shan't overlook my **rubbish** this time!

column9: 5) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 2-8-2010(3): I'm **FREQUENTLY** forced to FLAG lazy WOMEN because they are not hauling their share of RICE.

column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 9-10-2011(7): 屍 , 屍体 =死体, 屍蠟 =屍蝋, [corpse](../v4/2222.html) (#2222 屍) シ, しかばね, かばね … Parts:尸, 死 (cf 死亡 [death](../v4/815.html) (#815 死), 葬式 [interment](../v4/816.html) (#816 葬), 骨 [skeleton](../v4/1288.html) (#1288 骨), 躯 [body [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2986) (#2986 躯), 骸 [remains](../v4/2874.html) (#2874 骸)) … Note: This kanji is why the 尸 **Flag Primitive** is actually called the **Corpse Radical** (しかばね) … Story: I _Pee_ on your _Dead_ **Corpse**.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 14-2-2010(5): After an heroic _death_ , the **corpse** was draped in a _flag_ for burial.

column5: 1) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 23-3-2008(29): The next step on the _sentient rice-seedlings, journey_ , after their miraculous [pull through](../v4/2136.html) (#2136 凌) from being trapped: mountains in the distance, extremely **rugged mountains** , and nowhere to go next but through them.
column6: 2) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 15-11-2009(8): When trying to cross **RUGGED MOUNTAINS** you'll feel like you have RICE SEEDLINGS for WALKING LEGS.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 14-2-2008(7): **Rugged mountains** are _mountains_ which have "black _diamond_ " (expert level) ski slopes, and no _flowers_ can grow there. (The part on the right is 菱 [diamond](../v4/1517.html) (#1517 菱), minus flowers.).
column8: 4) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 5-7-2008(2): Ah, **RUGGED MOUNTAINS** were too much MOUNTAIN for FRODO and the FELLOWSHIP to go over. In the Kanji story, they went beside the MOUNTAINS and not under them.
column9: 5) [[lankydan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lankydan)] 13-9-2007(2): _Diamonds (whole thing on right)_ scattered at the **rugged mountains**. Check out all these diamonds.

And would you believe it, one of them gained jurisdiction over the base, and the other over the **mountaintop**.
column6: 2) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 15-11-2009(9): In war whoever seizes the **MOUNTAINTOP** can use their firepower from the MOUNTAIN to control the surrounding JURISDICTIONs.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 28-7-2009(6): At the top of the _mountain_ , Bill Clinton found an intern and said "This **mountaintop** is my [jurisdiction](../v4/1405.html) (#1405 領). column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 18-11-2007(4): Most hierarchies are shaped like a _mountain_ , to so who has _jurisdiction_ over what. So, everyone wants to be on the **mountaintop** , because as they all say: the shit in this company always rolls downhill.
column9: 5) [[wilsoncb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wilsoncb)] 23-8-2010(1): Law enforcement officials who don't want to climb the mountain say that their jurisdiction is only up to 5000 feet, so the top of the mountain is out of bounds.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-10-2007(55): The _fortune teller_ tells me that in the future I will have my own **quire**. "Is that choir as in 'group of singers', or **quire** as in 'sheets of paper'?" I ask. She can't tell because her crystal ball is too misty, so I rush to the bathroom, grab a _towel_ , and use it to wipe the crystal ball. Turns out to be **quire** as in 'sheets of paper', of course.
column6: 2) [[kusterdu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kusterdu)] 20-9-2008(37): (25 sheets of paper) – the fortune teller orders a **quire** of paper but receives a **quire** of towels. She calls to complain, but customer service tells her, "Why didn't you see it coming?".
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-11-2006(5): A **quire** in English means a set of 24 sheets of paper. In Japanese, it means 25 sheets. Well, rumor has it this is because on the 24 sheets needs to a _towel_ (the 25th sheet), to ward off evil spirits, according to a famous _fortuneteller_.
column8: 4) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 2-8-2010(4): They put a _towel_ over the _fortune teller_ 's head and had her guess how many pieces of paper were in each **quire** in front of her. "How many in this **quire** of rice paper?" "Twenty." Amazing! "How many in this **quire** of nori?" "Ten." Wow! - (Note: "Quire" means a collection of 24 or 25 sheets of paper, but this kanji is actually used as a counter for bundles of several types of paper-like objects, and the amount in one bundle differs for each object (1 **quire** of rice paper = 20 sheets, nori = 10 sheets, etc.)).
column9: 5) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 24-1-2011(2): If there is a _towel_ and written on it is "quire", then you don't need a _fortune teller_ to tell you that there are 25 sheets of paper in it.

column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 3-1-2007(6): _Meanings acc. to kanji dictionary: enclosure, quarter, large, empty, red- light district)_ //This city's red light district can be found in _tall caves_ within the _city walls_. column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 13-11-2010(5): 遊廓 =遊郭, [licensed quarters](../v4/2235.html) (#2235 廓) カク( 郭 ), くるわ( 郭 ) … Parts: 广, 郭 (cf: 醇朴 , 淳朴 ) … Note: Now replaced by 郭 [enclosure](../v4/1842.html) (#1842 郭) … Story: As the old form of 郭 , this is just _Old Enclosure_ written as it was in the old days- on _Cave_ walls. **Licensed Quarters** means whorehouse. column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 1-8-2008(10): You go with a friend into a deep, dark cave for a really dangerous (and stupid) contest - the **overhang** contest. You and your friends take turns **overhang** ing off the **overhang** \- and whoever can stand to **overhang** into the pitch dark the longest (did I mention that there are strange animal-like noises coming from the bottom?), wins - and you _compare_ times on a score sheet.
column8: 4) [[melchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/melchan)] 30-1-2011(3): The _cave_ **overhang** is composed of two giant _spoons_ at the entrance.

column7: 3) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 15-11-2009(4): In ancient times, a **SHIRE** (feudal village) began as a CAVE divided by walls of SOIL for each family's dwelling area (as in Clan of the Cave Bear).
column8: 4) [[Chadokoro_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Chadokoro_K)] 1-8-2007(4): **feudal village […farm…, hamlet or district in Edo period]** —– CLIFF-HOUSE- CAVE / SOIL ** Hint: … within this Khâz-Modan CLIFF-HOUSE CAVE is the SOIL used in the finest makeup and cosmetics [923]. It has been worked under a **FEUDAL VILLAGE** system since the Edo period. … It is such a lucrative **FEUDAL** farm **VILLAGE** that everyone plans to stay in this hamlet! [C] [N].
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 9-11-2008(3): In the **Shire** of Coober Pedy, everybody lives under _ground_ in _caves_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(40): With few visitors, the **tomb sanctuary** in the _cave_ is only open in the _morning_.
column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 27-4-2007(22): The **tomb sanctuary** of the Egyptian pharaohs is only open in the _morning_. At night they seal the _cave_ to keep the spirits from escaping!
column7: 3) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 15-3-2010(8): Come _morning_ , vampires must seek sanctuary. Of course, **tomb sanctuary** would be ideal, but any _cave_ will do.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 22-10-2009(3): Perhaps a better keyword, practically synonymous with **tomb sanctuary** , would have been **crypt** (since mausoleum has already been used). The **crypt** at Canterbury Cathedral is the largest **crypt** in England. Its _cave_ -like interior is unfortunately only open in the _morning_ , however, so make sure you head down early!
column9: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 13-8-2009(2): The **tomb sanctuary** is in a bat _cave_. People are only allowed to visit in the _morning_ , because of the vampires.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-10-2008(39): If you can't pull your _bow_ all the way back, you need to **strengthen** yourself by eating a _stack of pancakes and waffles_.

column9: 5) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 12-12-2007(3): You need to **strengthen** up to handle a _bow_ properly. So they put you on a strict diet of _three rice-fields_ worth of food every (insert period of time here). Can't get strong with an empty stomach.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 28-12-2006(35): The _scorpion_ nibbled on the string of my _bow_ and **loosen** ed it. Now I have to string the bow again!
column6: 2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 12-12-2007(26): My grip on the _bow_ **loosen** ed, and I felt myself slowly slipping away. The last thing I remember seeing was the _scorpion_ quietly scuttling away from my trouser leg, where it has delivered it's poisionous blow.
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 12-1-2009(5): Legolas **loosen** ed his bowels when seeing a scorpion.
column8: 4) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 3-1-2009(3): Despite having a bad-ass _bow_ to defend himself with, the level 1 ranger's bowels **loosened** when he saw a _scorpion_ for the first time.
column9: 5) [[Chadokoro_K](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Chadokoro_K)] 10-9-2007(3): **loosen [relax, slacken]** —– BOW, SCORPION [である] ** Hint: The BOW string **LOOSEN** ed when the SCORPION stung it. … Wow, now I know why its venom is a powerful muscle **relax** ant, the way that bowstring **slacken** ed! [D3425].

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(52): **_Rice_ gruel** gives you the strength to use _two bows_ at once.
column6: 2) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 12-5-2010(8): The 50-kg bodybuilder-wannabe submits himself to a " _grueling_ regime": **RICE GRUEL** for every _meal_. He's tired of being _WEAK_ ( 弱 ). He wants to "scrape the _ICE_ off his _BOWS_ ", so to speak, by _injecting_ massive quantities of _RICE_ calories into his diet, and there's no cheaper, simpler way to do this than by gorging himself with **RICE GRUEL**.
column7: 3) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 9-1-2009(6): Kill me now with 2 BOWS, I'm sick of eating **RICE gruel**.
column8: 4) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 27-7-2009(3): Legolas and his weakling twin brother fight over the **rice gruel** set inbetween them.

column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-10-2008(5): The _finger_ of the _juvenile_ **bumps into** you, but he actually tried to give you a kancho.
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 24-12-2007(5): Puberty is an interesting time for _juveniles_. They get their _fingers_ out ready to "accidentally" **bump into** each other (usually of the other gender, but that's a personal thing).
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 25-8-2006(2): _Juveniles_ are well known to have not entirely well coordinated bodies, so they **bump into** anything, and use their _fingers_ to steady themselves. column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 10-10-2007(46): Reminds me of a Star Wars quote, Leia: "The more you tighten your grip, Tarkin, the more star systems will slip through your _fingers_." (i.e., the tighter you **clutch** , the more _countries_ you'll lose).

This kanji does not refer to the automotive component "Clutch" pedal, rather it means to grasp and hold tightly.(That many stories below have fallen victim to, **Clutch** is rendōki 連動機 ) Story: Their Country has invaded our territory, our leader fallen into their **CLUTCH** ES while everyone is looting anything they can get their FINGERS on.
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 10-11-2008(14): In _countries_ such as Japan and Australia, the **clutch** is operated by using the _fingers_ on the left.
column9: 5) [[eggcluck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eggcluck)] 28-2-2011(3): An iron fist rule cluthces a country tightly in its fingers.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 1-5-2007(41): In _Nara_ , they do not accept はんこ, in fact their seals are done by simply **impressing** _fingers_ into hot melting wax (fingerprints are unique!).

column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-7-2008(2): [+ikmys] _Fingers_ the thief is hiding from the law and needs to create a new identity for himself. He flees to _Nara_ , where he hears that they don't have hanko - just finger **impress** es in wax. First he needs a new finger **impress** though - so he sneaks into a _Nara_ _altar_ and cuts off one _finger_ of the holy _dog_ that sits on top. He attaches that to his own finger and goes to city hall, getting his own wax finger **impress** and thus his new (doggy) identity.

column5: 1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 6-10-2008(40): DEVOTE (new rtk3 keyword). Think of the Yakuza. To show their DEVOTION to the clan, they must be **DEDICATE** D enough to cut off their FINGERS if they fail a task.
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 10-1-2007(15): _Dedicated_ people who **dedicate** themselves to growing bonsai cornstalkes have to have very fine _fingers_ to work the bonsai cornstalk.

column9: 5) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 21-8-2008(3): They tried **dedicate** the grave, but _Fingers_ , the thief, swiped the bonsai and cornstalk set apart to adorn the grave they were to _**dedicate**_ , so they couldn't **dedicate** it. (ah, now I know why I missed this one….Heisig reused this RTK3 keyword in a later revision of RTK1, so "observance/ **dedicate** " 1573 is the RTK1 keyword). In the 2nd edition of RTK3, the keyword for 2265 is " **devote** ".

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(30): The _courts_ use their _fingers_ as a **counter for tools** used in murder cases.
column6: 2) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 24-6-2010(13): (+ikmys) In _court_ , the serial killer was asked how many different tools he had used in the murders. A bit of dolt, he counted on his _fingers_ "one, tooo, twee, foe " as the judge shook his head in disgust. _Fingers_ are indeed used as a **counter for tools** in _courts_ , especially by dolts. 挺身する (ていしんする): to volunteer 空挺降下地域 (くうていこうかちいき): drop zone 空挺部隊 (くうていぶたい): airborne troops 挺 (ちょう): counter for guns, jinrikishas.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 17-1-2010(6): In a _court_ room, there's a specific **counter for tools** which might have been used to commit a crime. The **counter** is located in front of the witness stand. The witness must use his or her _fingers_ to identify which **tools** were used in the crime, and use this kanji to **count** how many were used in all.
column8: 4) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-2-2008(5): _Fingers, the thief_ doesn't know the Japanese **counter for tools**. They took _Fingers_ to _court_ for repeatedly using the wrong **counter for tools**. It's a federal offense.
column9: 5) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 1-5-2007(2): Summoned to appear before the _court_ , the defendant was asked how many times he was arrested prior to this latest offense. A simpleton, he counted out on his _fingers_ "one, tooo, twee, foe, " as the judge shook his head in disgust. _Fingers_ are indeed the **counter for (human) tools**.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-6-2007(24): My _turkey_ suit, complete with actual _feathers_ , was so **outstanding** that farmers tried to hunt me down with hatchets: I promptly gave them the _finger_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(13): Tip: _feathers_ \+ _turkey_ : This combination of primitives appears six times in Heisig, so it's worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest " _futon_ " (your _futon_ is made from _turkey feathers_ ). column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 6-1-2007(10): His _turkey_ costume was really **outstanding** : it was full of real turkey _feathers_ , and he even managed to make convincing bird claws of his _fingers_.

column5: 1) [[shirahime](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shirahime)] 17-1-2008(41): Someone tries to lay their fingers on your **spoils** , and you run after them hitting them with a broom as they run from you.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 28-5-2007(11): As my share of the **spoils** of war I grab a _running-broom_ that has _fingers_ (just like the one in Disney/Mickey Mouse/Fantasia). It _runs_ round cleaning up with its _broom_ and uses its _fingers_ to press buttons etc and operate household appliances. But also like Mickey’s it gets out of control and **spoils** everything it touches. So much for the **spoils** of war.
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 4-3-2007(5): Every morning, the street cleaners are _running with their brooms_ , to pick up the **spoils** of their profession up with their _fingers_.
column8: 4) [[dancingblade](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dancingblade)] 12-7-2010(3): **Nimble** : In my _fingers_ I equip my _Broom of Running_. It can't fly, but it gives me +5 **nimbleness**. column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 20-10-2009(3): A mean old man leaves a bunch of _rakes_ out on the footpath, so that when early morning joggers, trying to get some bleary-eyed exercise in at dawn, _run_ past, they step on a _rake_ and smack themselves in the head, knocking them out. The mean old man then comes out, cackling evilly, and reaches his _fingers_ into their pockets, trying to steal their wallet, keys and whatever other **spoils** of some value they might be carrying.

column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 23-1-2010(1): **Ponder** the _state of mind_ of a _turkey_ **ponder** ing _turkey_ -fate in RtK3. column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 18-2-2007(58): **Infatuation** is the _state of mind_ that makes a _knot_ form in your _heart_.

column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 22-3-2007(7): **Infatuation** is a _state of mind_ where you should know that what you feel probably is _not_ something that touches your _heart_ for real.
column8: 4) [[terozen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/terozen)] 9-2-2012(3): **Infatuation** is the _state of mind_ when you _[instantaneously](../v4/2431.html) (#2431 忽)_ fall in love.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-7-2008(3): (cross generation, but who cares) _Data_ finally gets the _heart_ transplant he has been wishing for - now he can feel emotion! The first emotion he feels, though, is **infatuation** for Seven of Nine…he can't get her out of his _heart_. It starts to interfere with his work, and he decides that enough is enough. He can't very well throw away the _heart_ (it would offend the captain), but he has to do something…so he pulls his new _heart_ out of his body, and ties it in a _knot_. No more **infatuation**.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 4-3-2007(26): The commando team under _orders_ need to be **quickwitted** and are always in the right _state of mind_ for action.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 10-5-2008(16): Data, orders: Commander _Data_ is as **quickwitted** as they come. While Picard is still in the process of uttering an _order_ , _Data_ is already executing it!
column7: 3) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 19-11-2008(9): The commander has to be **quickwitted** during war-time. If for example some of his men die, he must not be confused by his STATE OF MIND and still be able to give the right orders.
column8: 4) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 23-11-2009(4): A field commander must be **QUICKWITTED** in order to have a clear STATE OF MIND to issue decisive ORDERS during the heat of battle.
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 11-11-2008(1): A friend who is **quickwitted** can easily _order_ your _state of mind_ to become cheerful again.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 1-5-2007(29): The _state of mind_ of the _tall child_ whom _receives_ all of the attention is often surprisingly **considerate**. They have known nothing but kindness in their life, and thus act the same in return!
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 23-7-2009(14): A **considerate** _state of mind_ is open to _receive_ others' input.
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 14-1-2009(10): Data is only **considerate** of tall children, he's a real dick to short kids.
column8: 4) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 6-4-2010(3): Being **CONSIDERATE** means to always be in a _STATE OF MIND_ that is _receptive_ , i.e. ready to _RECEIVE_ what others communicate, either verbally or more subtly. (thx nolusu, mantixen, n1williams).
column9: 5) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 31-5-2009(3): Whenever I'm in a **considerate** _state of mind_ , the beggars always _receive_ something from me. (OK, not exactly true ,P).

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 12-10-2007(25): I was in a _state of mind_ to ask my wife if some slinky outfit from the closet _fit_ her. " **As if**!" she yelled, "that belonged to your previous girlfriend!".
column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 30-10-2006(14): My husband and I often have the same _state of mind_. We believe that's why we _fit together_ well, **as if** we are meant for each other.
column7: 3) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 11-7-2010(8): _Data_ 's dream is to _fit_ in with the rest of the Enterprise crew **as if** he was human.
column8: 4) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 1-8-2009(5): **As if** there was there was even the slightest chance that data could really fit in with the rest of the crew.

column6: 2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 24-1-2007(17): He was in a terrible _state of mind_ when his home that he was **enlarging** was consumed by a fire and everything he had build up was turned to _ashes_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-10-2008(30): The _state of mind_ of a _younger brother_ has **respect for elders** , including you if you're the elder brother.
