column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 29-1-2007(24): **Crabgrass** is _lowly_ wild grass, quickly spreading with nasty roots, and difficult to remove out of your _wheat_ field.
column6: 2) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 18-8-2009(7): **Japanese barnyard millet** (Echinochloa utilis). In Japan's past, this type of millet was grown where conditions were not suitable for rice paddies. It was far more common than _wheat_ and helped to alleviate starvation when rice was damaged by cold weather. However since then it has become quite a _lowly_ grain and is only grown in northern Iwate-ken.
column7: 3) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 18-1-2009(7): A _lowly wheat_ field only grows **crap grass**.
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 7-9-2009(3): **Crabgrass** ( **Japanese millet** ) is a _lowly_ grain, not unlike _wheat_ in flavour, but so _lowly_ that you have to get right down on the ground to find the crabs in it.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 30-10-2010(2): 稗 , 稗史 , 稗麺 [crabgrass](../v4/2608.html) (#2608 稗) ハイ, ひえ … Parts: 禾, 卑 … Note: Spahn - 5d8.2. Comes with either version of lowly depending on the font. … Story: Not actually **crabgrass** , but the keyword millet was taken and it had lowly as an element, so _Lowly_ crappy _Wheat_ , that tastes bad and yields low = **Crabgrass**. … cf: Lowly Ver. 1: 卑しい [lowly](../v4/1511.html) (#1511 卑), 歌碑 [tombstone](../v4/1512.html) (#1512 碑), 稗 [crabgrass](../v4/2608.html) (#2608 稗), 金牌 [mahjong tiles](../v4/2873.html) (#2873 牌). Ver2: 奴婢 [handmaiden](../v4/2196.html) (#2196 婢), 痺れる [paralysis](../v4/2579.html) (#2579 痺).

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 29-1-2007(16): A **bumper crop** is a very full crop. In this particular case, the **bumper crop** is a _wheat_ crop, grown by this excentric guy in a _grass skirt_ , who has gone completely native, but knows the secrets of how to get a good crop!
column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 7-8-2009(10): On the _tropical island of JOU_ , lots of crops are grown - coconuts, bananas, pineapples, etc - but these are really just for show to get lots of tourists. The real **bumper crop** that feeds the islanders is _wheat_.
column7: 3) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 7-3-2009(8): The _hula girl_ dances around the _wheat_ , and this appeases the deities so they give them a **bumper crop**.
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 21-12-2009(4): It was a **bumper crop** indeed the year we sewed _wheat_ but reaped instead a field of beautiful women in _grass skirts_.
column9: 5) [[wilsoncb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wilsoncb)] 27-8-2010(1): It's a **bumper crop** , and there's wheat to spare. Weave some into a grass skirt and celebrate!

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 25-5-2008(23): Wheat, rice seedling, walking legs: The next hurdle for mission of the _rice seedlings with walking legs_ was the **imperial authority**. They had to cross through a _wheat_ field, but the **imperial authority** didn't give permission for rice seedlings and wheat to mix. How to solve this…?
column6: 2) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 6-8-2010(9): I changed the keyword to **ridge** because it seems to be more often used in mountain ridge and so many medical words for body parts involving a crest or ridge. (I use "tripping on shrooms" as the keyword for 夌 [Unicode-0x590c](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/22796) (#22796 夌).) Story: After _tripping on shrooms_ , the **ridge** seemed to be a good place to plant _wheat_.
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 2-2-2007(4): The **imperial authority** is coming to inspect the _wheat_ crop and the _rice seedlings_. No doubt they want to make sure they'll get very last bit of their dues. The poor farmers run around on their _walking legs_ to assure they haven't kept anything hidden.
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 23-12-2010(2): Agreed with CasualTatsumaki. **ridge** STORY: I made rice seedling = _Goomba_ (from Mario games) _Wheat_ fields are dangerous for _Goombas_ because their _walking legs_ are so short. Mario could pop out of the wheat at any minute and flatten them. So the crafty _Goombas_ find a ridge in the wheat field that lets them see him coming.
column9: 5) [[dancingblade](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dancingblade)] 6-9-2010(1): (+CasualTatsumaki) Next on the _rice seedling_ 's journey to the promised land was an encounter with their rival, sentient _wheat_. After a struggle, the _rice seedlings_ prevailed after forcing them off a **ridge**.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 4-5-2007(25): This region only has **sparse** agriculture. The few farmers _hope_ their _wheat_ crops will do well, but the soil isn't really good.
column6: 2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 15-7-2010(17): Food is **sparse** , so the _wheat_ crops are now their only _hope_.
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 3-12-2008(7): Scarce is a better keyword since this really means rare. Here, the farmer hopes he gets some wheat during the harvest since food is scarce.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 7-10-2011(4): 稀に =希に, 稀ガス =希ガス, 稀薄 =希薄, 稀釈 =希釈, 稀有 =希有, 稀代 =希代, [sparse](../v4/2611.html) (#2611 稀)キ, まれに … Parts:禾, 希 (cf 希釈 [hope](../v4/1489.html) (#1489 希)) … Note: This is an old form, simplified into 希 , and can be freely replaced by 希 in all but place/people names. 希 has separate meanings, but all of 稀 's meaning have been folded into 希 . … Story: I _Hope_ misidentified Kanji are **Sparse** from here out, and that it is not a _Cereal/Serial_ thing, but _Wheat/Wait_ there are more.
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 25-11-2008(3): With any decent rainfall being **sparse** , the _wheat_ farmers _hope_ that things will change soon.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 23-10-2007(37): I'm being **obeisant** to Doctor's orders – trying to get into _shape_ by eating only _wheat_ and drinking only from that _spring_.
column6: 2) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 23-7-2010(4): The African slaves were **obeisant** to their _white_ owners and had to work the _wheat_ field. But inside their cottage at night, they played with _small_ , _white_ men made of _play-doh_ , forcing them to be **obeisant** slaves..
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(2): I'm trying to be **obeisant** to my personal trainer's advice, giving myself a _buzzcut_ , eating _Wheaties_ , and drinking _spring_ water.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 9-3-2007(2): The _wheat_ farmers are **obeisant** towards the _shape_ of the _white little_ goddess.
column9: 5) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 6-12-2011(1): When _Mystique_ starts to get a little chubby, she is **obeisant** to the Doctor's orders to get into shape by eating only whole _wheat_ and drinking only from a _spring_ (which she accidentally falls into when she leans over to get a drink).

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 22-6-2007(41): Ladies, I apologize for **peep** ing through the _hole_ , but, you know, it's just _standard_ protocol.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(6): The _standard_ way to use a _hole_ is to **peep**.
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(1): At an adult entertainment emporium the star entertainer is Little Bo **Peep** : **peep** ing at her activities through a _hole_ is _standard_ procedure.
column8: 4) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 26-7-2009(1): 覗 peek **Peep** through the HOLE and your HUSBAND will SEE you.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 1-1-2009(1): Peter Griffin is **peep** ing through the hole in his neighbor's wall hoping to see his wife naked. Picture Peter **peep** ing through the hole with a naked Bonnie Swanson (Joe's wife) on the other side.

column5: 1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 2-2-2007(50): That _hole_ is still too **tight**. Bring the _saw_ to enlarge it!
column6: 2) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 20-5-2009(13): I tried to [squeeze](../v4/1324.html) (#1324 搾) my fingers through a _hole_. It did not work! But I was clever and amputated my fingers with the _saw_. However, it was still **tight**. But I am not stupid! Why not enlarging the _hole_ with the _saw_? Wait! I should have done that first! Oh no…
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 8-7-2009(6): Use a _saw_ to enlarge a _hole_ that's too **tight**.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 14-8-2008(4): You're screwing around on the roof of your _house_ and decide to jump through the skylight (a _hole_ in the roof). You hop through, no problem, but then your fat friend gives it a shot too, and he gets stuck - only his _legs_ stick down from the roof. "It's too **tight** ,", he says. "Get me out of here!". You try to pull him through, but no use - so now you have no choice but to carefully _saw_ a bigger _hole_ round his legs…careful!
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 22-5-2011(2): 窄める , 唇を窄める , [tight](../v4/2614.html) (#2614 窄) サク(乍), つぼめる … Parts: 穴 (宂)+乍 (cf: 搾 [squeeze](../v4/1324.html) (#1324 搾), 作品 , 昨日 , 詐欺 , 酢 ) … Story: If you Squeeze a Saw **Tight** , then you will lose Fingers.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-6-2007(23): There's a knock on my door, and it's the local dentist accompanied by an elephant. The latter is a patient, and the dentist explains that he wants to **drill** a hole in its tusk, but his normal dentist's **drill** is too small, so could he borrow my big DIY **drill**. Anyway, I **drill** the _hole_ in the _tusk_ for him.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 22-6-2007(17): No **drill**? Pfft, just use this here _tusk_ as a **drill** and make all the _holes_ you can!
column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 26-3-2007(5): The smugglers used live elephants to smuggle their drugs: they **drill** ed _holes_ into the _tusks_ and hid the drugs there.
column8: 4) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 8-11-2012(2): Stone age **drill** s were just people on mammoths trying to get them to use their _tusk_ s to bore a _hole_ in something.
column9: 5) [[ShinseiJiyuu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ShinseiJiyuu)] 28-12-2012(1): In the ancient days, elephants once had **drill** s for _tusks_ and made _holes_ in everything as they pleased. When the original continent broke apart as a result, God though to himself, "Maybe that wasn't such a good idea…".

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 12-7-2007(42): The original Japanese **kitchen stove** s were powered by _electric eels_ (hey, Edison never made it to the far east!), so a small _hole_ had to be placed in the _dirt_ under the stove (for the _eels_ to swim around in).
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 25-11-2008(7): We finally found the _tortoise that escaped_ ([straw rope](../v4/1377.html) (#1377 縄)), it has somehow crawled into a _hole_ just above the **kitchen stove** and had become quite _dirty_.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 23-10-2007(3): I'm going to make some turtle soup, so I take an _unbound_ [tortoise](../v4/534.html) (#534 亀) out of a _hole_ in the _soil_ , to place on the **kitchen stove**.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(1): A **kitchen stove** used to be a _hole_ in the _soil_ into which you put _eels_ for dinner.
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 13-4-2007(): To prepare my delicious _eels_ , I first have to dig a _hole_ in the _soil_ to make sure my **kitchen stove** is steady.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(21): In the _slave_ 's _crotch_ there something _standing_ with a _vase_ -like **longness**. What could it be?
column6: 2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 15-7-2010(18): When you're a _slave_ to your _crotch_ like me, you're often afraid to _stand_ because you don't want people to see your **longness**.
column7: 3) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 11-8-2008(4): Here we have the _runaway slave_ again. This time, it seems that there's been a poster put out describing him, with an award for returning him! The poster is wildly inaccurate - the only thing it says is "slave, with an immense **longness** …down there." The _runaway slave_ realizes that he is really going to stand out (he has no clothes), so he grabs a _vase_ and hides his _longness_ in it so he won't be spotted.
column8: 4) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 31-3-2007(2): The _masochist_ was amazed by the **longness** of the [strict](../v4/853.html) (#853 堅) dominatrix's high heels _standing_ on his _crotch_.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 23-12-2010(1): I'm using **height** for this keyword. It's slightly similar to [Heights](../v4/1294.html) (#1294 阪), but I think I can differentiate. Is **longness** even a word? STORY: The _brick golem_ (retainer)'s height is so extreme that most people only come up to it's _crotch_ when they _stand up_ fully.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 11-12-2008(33): When I hear **rustling** in the night I _stand up_ and go to check out what it is but it's always just _wind_.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 25-5-2008(9): Vase, wind (with gnats): He heard a **rustling** outside and when he checked, saw a host of killer gnats riding the _wind_ in the direction of his house. He quickly jumped into the large standing _vase_ and put the stopper in, to ride it out…
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 6-3-2010(2): Just as holding a shell to your ear gives the sound of the sea, doing likewise with a _vase_ gives the **rustling** of the _wind_. Note: To remember to use 風 instead of "empty" 几 - **Rustling** suggests a FULLER sound involving leaves, branches etc.
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 19-2-2007(2): The kidnappers locked him up in a big _vase_ , and he didn't know where he was. But from the **rustling** noises of the _wind_ , he determined he must be outside somewhere.
column9: 5) [[marcmiddag](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/marcmiddag)] 17-8-2011(1): (thanks cameron_en) But I prefer the keyword "suddenly"! When I suddenly! hear **rustling** in the night I stand up and go to check out what it is but it's always just wind. さっと 【 颯と · 颯っと irregular】quickly (esp. actions) —Usually written using kana alone.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-9-2008(18): A characteristic of an **outpost** is the lack of usual facilities. Here we see a _fortune teller_ with no crystal ball having to make do with a _vase_.
column6: 2) [[alucardchuu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alucardchuu)] 24-5-2010(13): At a good **outpost** , there are guards standing and a fortune teller that can foresee any threat to stop it on time.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 25-5-2008(11): Stand up, fortune telling: Something scary happened at the Mars **outpost** near the alien ruins. Suddenly, one of the soldiers _stood up_ and started to _tell fortunes_. (Which weren't all that positive for mankind). Then he fell down and never spoke again.
column8: 4) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 12-7-2007(5): "Sorry sir, its your _fortune_ in life to _stand_ outside your post at the **outpost** and keep watch. Look, I don't like it one bit either, but your _fortune_ is clear as day, no point in fighting it.".
column9: 5) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 19-2-2007(3): There really isn't much to do in that **outpost** , the only attraction is someone _fortunetelling_ with big _vases_. You pay, then you draw a lot from one of the _vases_ and it will tell your fortune.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(29): Many **repose** peacefully in a _blue vase_ after being cremated.
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 4-1-2010(4): I pose once by a red _vase_ & then **repose** by a _blue_ one.
column7: 3) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 22-5-2009(2): You put a _vase_ over that annoying _Smurf_. Ahhhh… **Repose**!
column8: 4) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 13-1-2012(1): I pose once by a red vase & then **repose** by a blue one.
column9: 5) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 24-10-2010(1): The first time I got high, I **repose** d peacefully in a suburban construction site after smoking out of a plastic blue vase that had been converted into a bong. (Hence my use of 立 as bong for all previous stories.).

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 22-6-2007(32): It's a **concubine** : feel free to [touch](../v4/672.html) (#672 接) her all you want.
column6: 2) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 12-12-2008(22): A **concubine** is a _woman_ you can _stand_ on and walk all over. She does not have the same status as a wife. The contrast can be seen in the compound: 妻妾 (one's wife and mistresses). Both are _women_ , however, the wife gets a _brush_ for her hair, whereas the **concubine** is _stood_ upon and trampled.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(9): **Concubine** s are women of low standing (which is also why the woman is at the bottom here).
column8: 4) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 22-2-2007(3): The **concubine** s here are merely work forces for the master of the house. See them walking around, a line of _women_ with a _vase_ on their head to carry water from the well to the house.
column9: 5) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-12-2006(3): A **concubine** is a woman on her back with her ' _vase_ ' in the air…

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 26-5-2008(28): Cloak, clock: The _cloaks_ of Muslims have a tiny _clock_ on their **lapel** , so that they can keep track on when to pray…
column6: 2) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 13-1-2009(7): "The boss wants to see you _now_ ," I said, grabbing him by the _lapel_ of his _cloak_ and dragging him into the room.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(7): The **lapel** of a _cloak_ sometimes has a _clock_ pinned on it for meditation sessions.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 21-2-2010(2): The judo instructor tells the student, " _Now_ grab the **lapel** of his _cloak_ and throw him over your shoulder.".
column9: 5) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 14-3-2008(2): The **lapel** s of nurse's _cloaks_ always have fob _watches_ on them.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 26-5-2008(16): Cloak, fit: The **lined kimono** was lined in such a way that it made people appear to be slimmer than they really were. Even people who didn't _fit_ in the accompanying cloak still bought the **lined kimono** …
column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 16-7-2007(11): Girls all **lined** up in front of the _cloakroom_ in the department store to be _fitted_ with **lined kimonos** for their coming of age ceremony.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-8-2007(9): I am wearing my nice **lined kimono** and trying on various _cloak_ s to find one that _fits_ with it.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 21-2-2010(4): Not wanting to be noticed, the beautiful princess wore a baggy brown _cloak_ as she walked through the streets. When she returned to the palace, she shed the _cloak_ and revealed an exquisite **lined kimono** that hugged her curves and _fit_ her perfectly.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(4): A **lined kimono** is like a _cloak_ but more expensive because they're custom _fit_.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 15-2-2008(35): You can 誇 [boast](../v4/1244.html) (#1244 誇) with words, or you can instead show off your expensive _cloak_ and **hakama**.
column6: 2) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 3-12-2010(4): 袴 , 紋付羽織袴 , ( 人名 : 袴田 ) [pleated skirt](../v4/2626.html) (#2626 袴) はかま … Parts:衤, 夸 (cf: 跨ぐ [straddle](../v4/2744.html) (#2744 跨), 誇る [boast](../v4/1244.html) (#1244 誇) … Note: The RHS 夸 (not a Kanji itself), actually appears in other Kanji ( 袴 (桍)[pleated skirt](../v4/2626.html) (#2626 袴), 跨 [straddle](../v4/2744.html) (#2744 跨), 誇 [boast](../v4/1244.html) (#1244 誇), 胯). So a primitive of Dog Catcher (Dog on the floor caught in a snare)? … Story: _Dog Catcher_ wears a _Cloak_ and a **Hakama (Pleated Skirt)** , both imprinted with picture of fire hydrants, to catch his dogs.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 13-3-2010(1): Many present wished they were wearing the **hakama** ( **pleated skirt** ) and _cloak_. Fortunately, we were spared any boastful words ( 誇 - 言 = 夸) from the lucky groom. Note: 夸 actually means "extravagant/handsome". So _words + extravagant_ = [boast](../v4/1244.html) (#1244 誇).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(1): I wear a _cloak_ with a **pleated skirt** so that my girlfriend can easily put her _jaws_ around my _big_ one.
column9: 5) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 28-6-2011(): (+mcfate): You can 誇 [boast](../v4/1244.html) (#1244 誇) with words, or you can instead show off your expensive _cloak_ and **pleated skirt (hakama)** and _boast without words_. 袴 (はかま): man's formal divided skirt 羽織袴 (はおりはかま): Japanese male formal attire (haori (formal coat) + hakama) 御袴料 (おんはかまりょう): betrothal money from woman to man 紺屋の白袴 (こうやのしろばかま): specialists often fail to apply their skills to themselves (lit: the dyer wears white).

column5: 1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 14-3-2008(31): Before you open the **sliding door** to the _core_ of the nuclear reactor, you'd better put on your anti-radioactivity _cloak_.
column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 17-7-2007(18): The safety violations at Japanese nuclear power plants are egregious! Not only are they built inside ancient Japanese castles, there are no considerations for contamination. I was visiting last month when I opened a **sliding door** to reveal the _cloak_ room. All the scientists had haphazardly piled their _cloaks_ on the _CORE_ itself!
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 16-1-2009(9): You move aside the **sliding door** into the inner (core) section of the house and catch a glimpse of the wife without her cloak on.

column5: 1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 17-3-2008(26): If I have any _bamboo_ shoots left over from my stirfry I wrap them up in _foil_ to keep them moist _overnight_. Then I can use them the next day.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(8): I always roll up my **foil** and hide it in sticks of _bamboo overnight_. This is to **foil** any attempt to steal it.
column7: 3) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 6-7-2008(4): Imagine staying in a _bamboo_ forest _overnight_ with only one of those thin, **foil** survival blankets to keep warm. <http://www.lasoutdoors.com/images/CS02-Reflective-Survival-bl.JPG>.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 7-8-2008(2): Mirrors are way played out - I keep it grimy with mine, and do my _cocaine_ off of some **foil**. Imagine getting caught with _coke_ , a mirror, and a razor - too obvious. But if you use **foil** , and divide your lines with a bit of _bamboo_ and get caught with all that, you might get off with the "my friend asked me to hold this for him" excuse.

column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 7-9-2009(3): **Slender bamboo** used to be obese _bamboo_ , but because of simple 修 [discipline](../v4/1722.html) (#1722 修) - whacks from a _walking stick_ by the _taskmaster_ and his assistant, _the person primitive_ , was all it took - it has lost its earlier _shape_ and become a fit and slender _tree_.

(And he is also encouraging Hitler to jump whispering shino, shino).

column8: 4) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 25-3-2008(4): With a _bamboo_ brush and I _keen_ eye I edit the paper and draw _big_ red _thread_ -like marks under the poor sentences that need to be **redacted** (revised, edited).
column9: 5) [[kioku3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kioku3)] 18-8-2009(3): The original story of _Spiderman_ showed Peter Parker with a genius _St. Bernard_ who could _calculate_ by using an abacus with his paws (not two hands). column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 3-12-2010(2): 天竺 , 唐天竺 , 天竺鼠 , 天竺牡丹 , 天竺木綿 , 竺 , [bamboo cane](../v4/2642.html) (#2642 竺) チク( 竹 ), 名乗り : あつし … Parts: 竹 , 二 (cf 竿 [pole](../v4/2632.html) (#2632 竿), … Similars: 側杖 [cane](../v4/2504.html) (#2504 杖), 天竺 [bamboo cane](../v4/2642.html) (#2642 竺) … Note: Kanji slang for India ( 天竺 ), used for animal, plant names: 天竺鼠 , 天竺牡丹 , and as a general term for things from India and China ( 唐天竺 ). (cotton, Buddhism, etc.) … Story: I stole the _Rod "丨"_ from my _Pole ( 竿 )_ to use as my **Bamboo Cane**.

column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 10-3-2010(1): **Bamboo cane**. Michael Caine SM: give him a _second_ whack with it  & see if he still has an American accent.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 27-7-2009(11): A **winnowing fan** made of _bamboo_ is used to cool off the _basketball player_.
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 21-1-2010(10): _Bamboo_ , _chess_. Winnow, from Old English _windwian_ , to remove (as chaff) by a current of air. It's a little known fact that Bobby Fischer's classic win with black in the third game against Boris Spassky was the result of one white pawn made of _bamboo_ rather than boxwood, which was light enough to be blown away when the mechanism Fischer had rigged to his clock turned on a **winnowing fan** in the remote control camera he had been fiddling with before the match.
column7: 3) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 19-8-2009(10): The hard working peasants get a little annoyed watching the aristocrats sitting around playing _chess_ , so they start a revolt and whack the chess board and pieces away with their _bamboo_ _winnowing baskets._.
column8: 4) [[dancingblade](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dancingblade)] 7-9-2010(6): The _chess_ player has a _bamboo_ fan that he brings along to his matches for good luck. It has the power to make the user WIN NOW. Thus it is a **winnowing fan**.
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 15-7-2010(3): A bunch of chess pieces got dropped into a pile of bamboo sticks, so they used a **winnowing fan** to separate the _bamboo_ from the _chess pieces_.

column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 22-6-2007(1): When I encountered an ravenous _panda_ , I just _reached back_ to my **backpack** and pulled out two _bamboo_ katanas.
column8: 4) [[lisbet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lisbet)] 21-10-2012(): People used to carry the bamboo they'd cut in **backpack** s with straps they had to reach out and pull forward to hoist the bag up onto their backs.
column9: 5) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 24-1-2012(): My **backpack** is just _bamboo_ slats so the homeless guy _reach out_ and takes the can of coke from inside it.

column9: 5) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 27-3-2010(1): The **LIVRAISON** depicted here is the original _folio_ of an ancient text, written on thin _BAMBOO_ strips. column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 17-7-2007(41): **Should** you put _bamboo_ through your _tongue_? If you don't already know the answer yourself, you **shouldn't** even ask.
column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 8-8-2009(17): Note: Mantixen has the right idea with his story. This **should** is not a moral obligation (eg, something you "should" do), but rather something that is expected (eg, my keys "should" be around here somewhere…). If you know some intermediate Japanese grammar, you'll be familiar with it as **はず**. Story: [「私の舌は竹から作られているよ！」「そんな](midori://search?text=「私の舌は竹から作られているよ！」「そんな) **はず** ないでしょう！｣.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(10): A _bamboo_ _tongue_ piercing **should** feel good, but I'd rather she took it out first.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(5): In some tribes, it is fully expected that you **should** put _bamboo_ through your _tongue_.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 8-9-2009(2): Tough without the puns available in the imaginative universe of **はず**. How to reach _bamboo tongue_ from **should**? Well, **should** rhymes with 'wood'. By a slip of the imaginative _tongue_ you confuse wood  & _bamboo_ & write 木舌 instead of 筈 . You **should** know better! You **should** learn the bloody language instead of horsing around with this mnemonic crap! You **should** know **はず** by itself! You **should** not equate bamboo tongues with verbal auxiliaries! Ooh, hey, _tongue_ and 'verbal'! There's a start!

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 17-6-2007(32): To **winnow** you need two things: a _winnowing fan_ (no. 2643 箕 ) and a _pelt_ (to use as a bag to collect the grain you **winnow** ed).
column6: 2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 25-3-2008(6): Having no _winnowing fan_ handy, the servant was forced to flap a large _pelt_ about in an attempt to **winnow** (fan) his master.
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 8-12-2009(3): After Bobby Fischer's 箕 [winnowing fan](../v4/2643.html) (#2643 箕) **winnow** ed Spassky's bamboo pawn from the other pieces in the famous game three, the rest was history: Spassky returned to Moscow in disgrace & was _pelted_ by fruits & vegetables.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 6-3-2010(2): Now you may have seen the traditional **winnow** ing technique whereby grain is placed on a sheet (or _pelt_ ) which is then held at the corners and flicked to send the grain into the air. The [winnowing fan](../v4/2643.html) (#2643 箕)箕 creates a draft to disperse the chaff. So the fan, by itself is not enough. To **winnow** we need to pair the _winnowing fan_ with the _pelt_.
column9: 5) [[dancingblade](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dancingblade)] 16-11-2011(1): The officials discovered that the _chess_ master was cheating using a [winnowing fan](../v4/2643.html) (#2643 箕) so they stripped him of it. However the _chess_ master somehow retained the ability to **WIN NOW**. Frowned upon by the _chess_ community, he is often _pelted_ with _rooks_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(32): **Settlings** at the bottom of sake are _white_ and made of _rice_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-6-2010(7): (in drawing order): The **settlings** you see in sake are actually bits of _rice_. How do you know? Because they are _white_.
column7: 3) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 12-12-2008(2): **Scrap, waste, **settlings**.** Think of **scrap** or waste paper - like the confetti or _rice_ thrown at a wedding - it is _white_.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 8-8-2009(1): **Settlings** stick to the bottom of the sake cup like _white_ on _rice_!
column9: 5) [[comeauch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/comeauch)] 6-8-2012(): As we've seen so far, the "white" primitive often means something like "the best" (see "chief", "ship"…) The best rice, the purest white rice is used to make sake and ultimately ends up as settling.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(25): New _cadets_ aren't allowed to drink with the seniors, so they have to settle for the _rice_ **lees** at the bottom of the empty sake bottles.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(9): The other _cadets_ are really cruel: giving this _cadet_ only the **lees** of the sake to drink….
column7: 3) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 19-8-2009(3): _Bender as a cadet_ is really cruel to the rest of his batallion, he only lets them have the **dregs** of the _rice_. The rest he distills and drinks.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 3-12-2010(1): 糟 =粕=!滓 [lees](../v4/2649.html) (#2649 糟) ?, かす … Parts: 米 , 曹 (cf: 曹 [cadet](../v4/1173.html) (#1173 曹), 水槽 [vat](../v4/1176.html) (#1176 槽), etc.) … Similars: 塵 [dust](../v4/2838.html) (#2838 塵), 屑 [rubbish](../v4/2219.html) (#2219 屑), 糟 [lees](../v4/2649.html) (#2649 糟), 滓[Unicode-0x6ed3](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/28371) (#28371 滓), 粕 [settlings](../v4/2648.html) (#2648 粕) … Story: In order to choke down the **Lees** , what's left at the bottom of the 水槽 [vat](../v4/1176.html) (#1176 槽), it's best to pick out the splinters of _Wood_ , and add some _Rice_.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 28-10-2010(1): **Lees** (sediment from liquor fermentation) and _rice_ is all _cadets_ get which is another reason why Bender only lasted one day.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(42): The _uncivilized_ used _rice_ as **paste**.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(19): Let the _rice age_ for one _month_ and it becomes an absolutely wonderful **paste**.
column7: 3) [[Sam79](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Sam79)] 15-7-2011(9): The meaning is starch used as glue to **paste** things. While in Japan they used to extract that **paste** from [rice](../v4/919.html) (#919 米), in the West _old flesh_ served that purpose. The old flesh of horses and other waste from the slaughterhouse that was boiled to extract gelatin. Seems rather [uncivilized](../v4/2470.html) (#2470 胡) to me, I like the rice-approach better…
column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 24-8-2011(3): While they were still _uncivilized_ , they used _months-old rice_ to make glue **paste**. 糊 [のり]: **paste** , glue, starch 糊口 [ここう]: bare livelihood, subsistence 糊口 [ここう] を 凌 [しの]ぐ: eke out a living.
column9: 5) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 17-1-2009(2): My _american_ friend is so _uncivilised_ his staple diet consists of tooth **paste** rather than _rice_.

column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 8-8-2009(8): What's all this unhulled _rice_ still doing here? You were supposed to hull this yesterday! Pick up that _blade_ and get to work immediately!
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(2): _Rice_ that has been through the _blade_ is most thoroughly **unhulled rice** , as it lacks the hull.
column8: 4) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 25-7-2010(1): In the small world of _rice_ , they're fighting an epic battle against a monster _blade_. "It breached our hull, Sir!". "We must flank it now, or we will become **unhulled rice** , Sir!". "All rice on an all-out attack, now!".

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 18-7-2007(25): Maybe the Japanese ought to rethink their nickname for America. Seriously, the only " _rice_ " I have seen in the _wild west_ is **foxtail millet**.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 29-5-2008(10): West, rice: In the _old west_ there was a special type of plant (it's now extinct): the **foxtail millet**. column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 10-3-2010(5): Davy Crockett's foxtail hat, symbol of the _Old West_ & early 米国 spirit, was not as popularly believed made from the tail of an actual fox. column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 22-2-2010(4): **Foxtail millet** is a grain that tastes like [chestnut](../v4/1609.html) (#1609 栗), but looks like [rice](../v4/919.html) (#919 米).
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(3): In the _Old West_ , **foxtail millet** was eaten like _rice_.

column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 11-12-2009(7): Because of the special _thread_ _Spiderman_ uses for **embroidery** , and the special location from which it is produced, he is always _solemn_ when he does **embroidery** , because it makes him hemorroidery.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(4): _Spider-Man_ _solemnly_ joins his Aunt May for an **embroidery** party.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(4): **Embroidery** is a much more serious affair than mere sowing. So if you see someone who is holding a _thread_ and looking very _solemn_ , then they are probably doing **embroidery**.
column9: 5) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(3): When she’s happy, she weaves. When she’s _solemn_ , _Black Widow_ does some **embroidery**.

column5: 1) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 11-1-2010(15): _Spiderman_ decides to try a new diet of _sprouts_ to see how it affects the consistency of his web. To his surprise (150m above ground) a lovely line of **pongee** comes out instead. Time to think quickly.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(11): Spiderman, sprout: **Pongee** is a soft thin woven cloth. _Spiderman_ \- a textile buff in his own right- found out that the mold growing on rotting Brussel _sprouts_ may also be used to make **pongee**. And it's much cheaper than silk!
column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 18-7-2007(9): **Pongee** is the soft thin cloth made from the _thread_ of mashed _brussel sprouts_.
column8: 4) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 30-10-2011(1): When _Spiderman_ eats _Brussel sprouts_ , his thread becomes just right for making **pongee**. However, it's not a viable business in today's market. The cost of importing the _sprouts_ from Brussels is more than the price of the produced **pongee**. So he continues earning his living through freelance photography. 紬 (つむぎ): **pongee** 繭紬 (けんちゅう): **pongee** (unbleached silk) 紬砂 (つむぎすな): fine sand.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 5-12-2009(1): Hired by the Chinese Ministry of Trade to revive popularity of the once-lucrative trade in the silk cloth woven along the banks of the Yangtze, and with an eye to demonstrating its resiliency to the European market, _Spiderman_ is in _Brussels_ for a series of spectacular demonstrations of bungee-jumping with **pongee** _threads_.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 26-11-2008(50): _Spiderman_ 's a _strange_ guy, wearing such **ornate** outfits to make himself look 綺麗 【きれい】.
column6: 2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 16-3-2008(7): SPIDERMAN wears such STRANGE outfits, that they seem almost **ORNATE** compared to the thugs he captures.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(4): _Spider-Man_ looks _strange_ in his **ornate** costume, but that's why you can't take your eyes off of him.
column8: 4) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 18-7-2007(3): What appears to many as _strange_ _thread_ , when woven, becomes something extrordinarily **ornate**.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 15-12-2009(2): _Spider-Man_ 's enemies have **ornate** outfits - outside the colourful pages of a comic book, this would look very _strange_. (This is the main reason they didn't use the traditional, **ornate** outfits of the X-Men in those movies - Wolverine would have just looked too 綺麗 .).

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 26-11-2008(14): The _rice seedlings_ notice that _Spiderman_ 's blocking their path to the promised land. So they put on **da mask** which was made of a figured cloth and managed to outsmart spidey.
column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 18-7-2007(11): Those _rice-seedlings_ on _walking legs_ had to carry this _thread_ all the way from the middle east to introduce the beautiful **damask** to the Japanese.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 9-8-2009(6): **Damask** : a firm lustrous fabric made with flat patterns in a satin weave on a plain-woven ground on jacquard looms. Sounds fancy. Clearly not the kind of _threads_ you should wear while planting _rice seedlings_ and _walking_ around in the field.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(3): _Spider-Man_ 's _ex_ left him because he wouldn't take off **damask**.
column9: 5) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 10-11-2012(2): _Spiderman_ takes off **da mask** to check his sight when he thinks he sees a bunch of _rice seedlings_ with _walking legs_.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 18-7-2007(27): The _thread_ with a _mysterious_ origin… hint: its not from a plant!
column6: 2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 6-4-2008(7): It turns out that **catgut** is the _mystery thread_ of bowstrings (see 1386).
column7: 3) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 1-9-2009(4): Spiderman vs Gandalf - Gandalf uses his lighting magic to attack spidey but of course spideys too fast, he avoids it while it accidentally blows the cat up, **catgut** s all strewn all over the place.
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 8-9-2009(1): The _mystery_ of _Spiderman_ gutting that cat was solved when we heard the _mysterious_ beauty of his performance on the shamisen.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 22-11-2010(): 絃楽器 =弦楽器, 管絃楽 =管弦楽, 三絃 =三弦, 絃歌 =弦歌, 絃 [catgut](../v4/2669.html) (#2669 絃) ゲン … Parts: 糸 , 玄 … Simplified to 弦 [bowstring](../v4/1386.html) (#1386 弦) in modern Japanese. … Story: _Spiderman_ uses _Mysterious_ **Catgut** for his violin strings, and 弦 [bowstring](../v4/1386.html) (#1386 弦) for his bow. They are actually the same thing though.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(37): Spiderman, tall: _Spiderman_ seemed _taller_ than he really was, due to the **stripes** in his uniform. As is to be expected from our textile expert…
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 24-10-2007(26): If you wear clothes with vertical **stripes** , those _threads_ will make you look _tall_ er.

Why Spiderman? "To help you remember both **Stripe** s and the fact that this is the full version of _Tall_ ," he says. It's the lucky **Stripe** Zebra with fruit colors.
column8: 4) [[manubear](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/manubear)] 10-8-2012(3): From afar you see _Spiderman_ looking especially _tall_. as you get closer you realise he's actually riding a **stripe** d horse, or zebra if you want to be pedantic ( 縞馬 ).

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 20-1-2009(10): No one can _accept_ the fact that _Spiderman_ is a **gimp**.
column6: 2) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 3-1-2010(9): Spiderman accepts the **ribbon** for most fashionable super hero.
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 29-10-2009(7): I cannot _accept_ that _Spiderman_ will star in the remake of Forrest **Gimp**.
column8: 4) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 18-1-2009(6): I used The **Gimp** to create such a real-looking photograph of _Spiderman_ , it was immediately _accept_ ed by The Daily Bugle.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 7-8-2008(3): _Spiderman_ 's in trouble - he's run out of Spider-silk! He ditches his enemy and ducks into an arts and crafts factory. Pressed for time, _Spidey_ dashes into an office looking for twine, yarn, anything - and sees the head of the factory. "Look, buddy, can you give some sort of _thread_? Anything will do." "All I got is **gimp** , buddy, is that cool?" _Spidey_ knows that this thick plastic thread will _gimp_ him up something fierce, but he has no choice but to _accept_ it.

column5: 1) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 2-10-2009(26): Thank god the thread section is over.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(22): If there are very _few threads_ , then the light will come through and the fabric be considered to be a **gossamer**.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(13): Because it has too _few_ threads, _Spider-Man_ decided not to use **gossamer** to make his skin-tight costume.
column8: 4) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(6): Spiderman, few: _Spiderman_ designed a new webbing, consisting of only a _few_ threads. The webbing is like **gossamer** , but stronger than steel.
column9: 5) [[kusterdu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kusterdu)] 27-8-2010(3): I once heard that according to Buddhism, if you fall into Hell, the only way to get out is by climbing a thin, **gossamer** thread. Needless to say, very, very few can get out.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 4-3-2007(39): A _house_ hold _spoon_ is used for the **rudder** of your model _boat_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(7): Tip: _house_ \+ _spoon_ : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig. REF: [snake](../v4/519.html) (#519 蛇), _rudder_ (FRAME 2674), [prevarication](../v4/2718.html) (#2718 詑), [Shakyamuni Buddha](../v4/2955.html) (#2955 陀).
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-2-2010(6): Let _house + sitting on the ground_ = _cold beer_ (because I like _sitting on the porch_ under the shade of my _roof_ drinking a _cold beer_. Also, I haven't used _cold beer_ as a primitive yet, and surely that's blasphemy.) Story for **rudder** : The laconic fisherman heads upriver while relaxing in his _boat_ , sitting back while the motor putts along, one hand on the **rudder** , the other on his _cold beer_.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 19-11-2010(2): 舵 (cf. 梶 ), 昇降舵 , 四輪操舵 , 操舵手 , 舵角 , 舵木 =梶木=旗魚, [rudder](../v4/2674.html) (#2674 舵) ダ( 蛇 ), かじ … Parts: 舟 , 宀, 匕 (cf: 蛇 [snake](../v4/519.html) (#519 蛇), 詫 [prevarication](../v4/2718.html) (#2718 詑), 陀 [Shakyamuni Buddha](../v4/2955.html) (#2955 陀)) … Similar: 舵 [rudder](../v4/2674.html) (#2674 舵), 梶 [oar](../v4/2502.html) (#2502 梶) … Story: If you look at the **Rudder** from underwater vantage point, the **rudder** looks just like a giant _Housed Spoon_ , with the rest of the _Boat_ acting as the housing.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 28-10-2010(2): If the **rudder** of your _boat_ is a _house_ -hold _spoon_ , you'll always be ready to have seafood for dinner!

column5: 1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 15-4-2008(31): My friend's new dangly _ear_ rings are interesting– _cacti_ **strung together** with butterfly _cocoons_.
column6: 2) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 4-1-2010(4): **Strung together** , with no ears to hear for predators, the cocoons rest on the cacti for safety.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 18-8-2011(3): 聯邦 =連邦, 聯盟 =連盟, 聯合 =連合, 連合艦隊 =聯合艦隊 [strung together](../v4/2676.html) (#2676 聯) レン( 連 ) … Parts: 耳 , 幺, 幺, Cactus (cf 滋賀県 [nourishing](../v4/1388.html) (#1388 滋), 慈しむ [mercy](../v4/1389.html) (#1389 慈), 關東軍 (Kwantung Army)[Unicode-0x95dc](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/38364) (#38364 關)) … Note: **old alternate version of modern 連[take along](../v4/287.html) (#287 連)** … Story: When the _Doubly mysterious_ man took off his hats, I could see his large _Ears_ and his _Cactus_ legs. He lost a bunch of weight recently so his 4X size pants are now _4Y_ and have to be **Strung Together** tightly to keep from fallling down.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 1-1-2009(2): I picture a bunch of ears **strung together** on a string hung on a cactus that's got two cocoons on top of it. Weird image but I can't think of anything better.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 13-1-2011(1): The criminal refused to be taken along 連 by the police．He just put his hands on his _ears_ and shouted: "I can't hear you!" over and over. "We'll have to do this the old fashioned way 聯 ," said the police officer. Two _cocoons_ were then shoved in the man's mouth to shut him up and he and the police car were **strung together**. They dragged him across a desert and over many spiky _cacti_. "Should have just been taken along 連 , wise guy.".

column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 28-11-2008(12): When my parents asked me to eat my _sprouts_ , I threw a _snare_ at their _ears_. The next day I received a **summons** to appear in court.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 28-11-2008(24): The waitress's **addiction** to drugs got her caught up in a huge mess with the mafia. Before maiming her and throwing her into the river to [sink](../v4/1888.html) (#1888 沈), they cut off one of her _ear_ s.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(15): Fearful that I was **addicted** to _ear_ piercings, my dad put a _crown_ around one of my _legs_ so that I couldn’t go to the piercing dude.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(9): Ear, crown/human legs (also in [sink](../v4/1888.html) (#1888 沈)): After they had recovered the body that had been _sunk_ by the mafia, the autopsy revealed that the victim had been **addicted** to drugs. This, they could see from the form of her _ear_! I love CSI!
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 30-3-2010(5): There are many forms of **addiction**. This kanji represents the iPod addict. The _ears_ are plugged into the _headphones (crown)_ while the _person on walking legs_ , oblivious to the approaching bus, steps off the curb.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 11-3-2011(2): 耽溺 , 耽溺生活 , 耽読 , 耽美主義 , [addiction](../v4/2679.html) (#2679 耽)タン,ふける … Parts: 耳 ,尢＊( 沈 -氵) (cf 沈む [sink](../v4/1888.html) (#1888 沈), 枕 [pillow](../v4/2472.html) (#2472 枕), 酖) … Story: My **Addiction** to 枕 _pillows_ was rather bad, I was 沈む _Sunk_ up to my 耳 _ears_ in them.

column5: 1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 14-1-2008(33): Quiet!!!! The _city walls_ have _ears_ he exclaimed.
column6: 2) [[kanjiknight](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjiknight)] 12-1-2010(14): The _city walls_ have _ears_!? Did you say that with an **exclamation** or **question mark**?
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 4-12-2008(5): This really means "question mark" so I assume Heisig was referring to an **exclamation** mark rather than some sort of verbal outburst. The RTKIII keywords are truly atrocious…I sort of picture the primitive on the right as resembling a question mark, so the kanji looks to me like a cartoonish ear straining to listen with a question mark next to it.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 26-7-2009(3): Spies press their _ears_ against the _city walls_ hoping to hear something audible, like an **exclamation**.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 25-10-2010(2): 耶蘇 , 耶蘇基督 , [摩耶＊](midori://search?text=摩耶＊) , 耶嬢 [exclamation](../v4/2680.html) (#2680 耶) ヤ … Parts: 耳 , .阝 … Note: **Phonetic Ya**. … Story: **Phonetic YA** is an **Exclamation**. and an interesting name. And you can yell it as loud as you like because Mr. Burns has lost most of the use of his Ears. In fact a conversation with _Mr Burns_ is likely to consist of him cupping his _Ear_ and you **Exclaiming** as loud as you can. So sing Hey Ya! as loud as you want.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(50): **Flea** s jump onto your _crotch_ , take _two drops_ of blood, and then go on their merry way: what vile _insects_!
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 20-12-2009(3): **Flea**! One bite in the middle of my _crotch_ another just to the left  & I can still feel the _insect_ itself crawling around down there.
column7: 3) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 7-1-2007(3): Right side of [boisterous](../v4/1985.html) (#1985 騒) (but without the drops there). A **flea** is an insect that is depicted here as jumping from (or to) a crotch (the two drops). Note: this is indeed **flea** , not louse, which has its own character (虱). I'm not sure of the stroke order, but by the rule of drawing from top to bottom, the crotch drop should come first. The louse (虱) then is of course a drop-like insect that attaches itself to body hairs by little hooks.
column8: 4) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 19-3-2011(): Those _two little marks_ you saw after scratching your _crotch_ might be because of that dreaded _insect_ , the **flea**.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 13-1-2011(): A mama **flea** ( _insect_ ) teaching her two kids(the _drops_ ) how to suck blood from the crotch region.

column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(12): You _unravel_ a **crab** leg, but _insects_ fall out of it. It's probably too old to be edible.
column7: 3) [[Evangelo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Evangelo)] 12-12-2009(6): Fun fact about this kanji: In Ancient China, they used the parts 解 and 虫 because a **Crab** 's legs were easy to take apart ( 分解しやすい ).
column8: 4) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 28-10-2010(3): A **crab** must be _unraveled_ to partake of it but some people don't like them because they look like _insects_.
column9: 5) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 7-3-2011(2): It took them a while to _unravel_ the genus of the **crab** , but eventually everyone agreed that it was not an _insect_.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(52): At the _zoo_ , most animals think of _insects_ as just good sources of **protein**.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(9): _Insects_ are fed to the _critters_ at the _zoo_ for **protein**.
column7: 3) [[shidosuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shidosuru)] 5-2-2012(3): The _zoo's_ had this huge _bug_ problem lately! Actually the problem wasn't the bugs exactly. All of the animals were eating the bugs, and got so much **protein** that they all became super strong! (imagine ripped penguins!) They started strong-arming all the visitors for their wallets and eventually ripped the iron bars of their cages open!
column8: 4) [[Miyumera](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Miyumera)] 30-8-2012(1): At the ZOO, most animals think of INSECTS as just good sources of **protein**. a ZOO was built on the back of a giant fly/INSECT and the zoo animals eat the flesh of this giant insect as source of **protein**.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 11-3-2011(1): 蛋白質 , 皮蛋 , 蛋白石映光 (opalescence), [protein](../v4/2683.html) (#2683 蛋)タン … Parts: 疋 [critters](../v4/2098.html) (#2098 疋), 虫 … Story:Work with the idea that in Earlier times, the only **protein** available to Buddhist Japan were fish. SO people living in the mountains kept zoos, and got their only **protein** from the _insects_ living off the animals in their _zoos_. **Protein** is written in kana on food packages: たん白質 . The actual meaning of the character is **Egg Whites**.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(35): Rather than die, _tenacious insects_ go down into **hibernation**.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-2-2010(5): Imagine _Jack Black_ as an _insect_. "Whoa, that was some good nectar. Well, I'm _happy_ , my _belly_ 's round, _my band_ just played a sellout show for the ladybirds (and oh yeah, there were groupies, lemme tell ya)… now it's time for THIS _insect_ to go into **hibernation**. Scientists call it diapause. Rock.".
column7: 3) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 28-7-2008(2): The _tenacious_ buddha doesn't seem to care about the _insects_ crawling all over him. I see, he simply went into **hibernation**.
column8: 4) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 12-12-2011(1): After hanging out with his groupies and living it up for like a week straight, all Jack Black from _Tenacious_ D wants to do is settle into **hibernation** and sleep it off in peace. Unfortunately for him, though, his bed is full of _insects_ , and the _tenacious_ little buggers won't leave him alone!
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 11-12-2009(1): The poor bear keeps trying to settle into a decent **hibernation** , but those _tenacious insects_ keep waking him. They're underneath his _round_ bottom now, disturbing his _happiness_. Shoo!

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(38): I unbind my _tortoise_ to let him catch that pesky _insect_ the **housefly**.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(5): Insect, unbound tortoise: Instead of using pesticides, you can also use natures' resources. For example, to get rid of **houseflies** (those pesky _insects_ ), you just _unbind your pet tortoise_ , which will make short work of it.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 17-1-2011(3): (Kind of Pictogram) Have a problem with houseflies? You need the _tortoise_ brand flyswatter! It has two swatting surfaces and a curved handle for maximum swatting action! Those pesky _insects_ don't stand a chance!!!
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 23-10-2010(2): 五月蝿い [housefly](../v4/2685.html) (#2685 蝿) はえ … Parts: 虫 , 黽…Or 虫 , 亀 -勹 … note: If Kanji, just a likely to be the older version 蠅 as the new version 蝿 . The RHS is is Green Frog Radical in the [旧字体、](midori://search?text=旧字体、) which has been simplified into 亀 without a head. (Or 龜 was simplified into 亀 Green Frog with a head.) … Similar Keywords: Scottish 蚊取り線香 [mosquito](../v4/1728.html) (#1728 蚊), A 五月蝿い [housefly](../v4/2685.html) (#2685 蝿) carries his house with him like a turtle, A righteous 蟻 [ant](../v4/2686.html) (#2686 蟻), An egotistical 蛾 [moth](../v4/2694.html) (#2694 蛾).
column9: 5) [[Panta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Panta)] 22-3-2013(1): The **housefly** is the _insect_ that buzzes as loudly as _two eels_ (think electricity).

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(66): The **ant** is an _insect_ of _righteousness_ , putting the group before its individual concerns.
column6: 2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 28-6-2007(8): In Aesop's stories, the **ant** is often considered righteous.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-2-2010(4): The **ant** is an _insect_ who lives by the principles of _righteousness_. You can see the **ant** s working hard every day to ensure the well-being of the colony. But if someone tries to harm the colony, the **ant** s will respond by inflicting _righteous_ vengeance en masse!
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(3): **Ant** s are _insects_ of _righteousness_ : invade their hive and they will enact justice!
column9: 5) [[LuisAlexandre](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LuisAlexandre)] 20-4-2012(1): The **ant** is an insect of righteousness, never straying from its path!!!

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(32): While I’m _game-hunting_ , I cover my dogs with **wax** so that they won’t be bother by _insects_.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 24-1-2009(16): I like to go [game-hunting](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1940) (#1940 猟) for exotic _insects_ and then store them in **wax**.
column7: 3) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 18-4-2012(2): When _game hunting_ , I cover my face and hands with **wax** to keep away the _insects_. (+Megaqwerty, minus "dog").
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-2-2010(2): The _insects_ nibbling away at the dead _rat_ are complaining about the taste of the animal. "God, this tastes disgusting!" "Millions of years of evolution and these mammals are still stupider than us." "Doesn't he know that **wax** isn't food? That's why he died you know, eating the sugary _beeswax_ from a melted candle." "Dumb _rats_.".
column9: 5) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 26-3-2011(1): In a **WAX** ing moon, an INSECT is easy prey for an OWL flying like the WIND through the CORNstalks.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(28): **Shrimp** are the only “ _insects_ ” that I can eat in my _spare time_ : anything else requires way too much willpower.
column6: 2) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 29-8-2011(12): 蝦夷 , 蝦夷地 , [shrimp](../v4/2689.html) (#2689 蝦) えぞ, エビ … Parts: 虫 , Hobby ( 暇 [spare time](../v4/1882.html) (#1882 暇) - 日 ) … Tip: Many different Kanji for **shrimp** : 蝦 , 海老 , 鰕､蛯. This Kanji is the old name for the Ainu: Ezo 蝦夷 , and their land Ezochi 蝦夷地 (now Hokkaido). (It also has meant Frog as well.) … **Shrimp** on menus and such is 海老 . Tiger Prawns ( 車海老 ), Lobster ( 伊勢海老 ).
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 22-1-2010(6): Bubba's _hobby_ was **shrimp** , and everything to do with **shrimp** \- bioled **shrimp** , fried **shrimp** , rotten **shrimp** covered with _insects_ … hold on a second.
column8: 4) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 4-1-2010(3): **SHRIMP** are the best INSECT to have for a HOBBY: watch them grow then eat them. (For HOBBY ref Katsuo [spare time](../v4/1882.html) (#1882 暇)).
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(3): A **shrimp** is like an _insect_ in many ways, kingdom Animalia, phylum Arthopoda, but the comparison breaks down at the subphylum level: have you heard of anyone whose _hobby_ is displaying different kinds of **shrimp** in a glass case?

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(43): The **octopus** holds up two of his legs so that they look like antennas and then walks on the other six. He bears a strong _resemblance_ to an _insect_ when he does that.
column6: 2) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 1-12-2008(11): The octupus seduces the INSECTS with a CANDLE to eat them later.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(7): Insect, candle: As _insects_ are drawn to _candles_ , so, also are deep sea divers drawn to the legend of the huge **octopus** living in the deep waters of the sea. (They also don't come back).
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-2-2010(4): The **octopus** enjoys a _candle_ lit dinner of fine, imported _insects_ with a loved one. It holds all the silverware as well as its glasses of wine and water, all at the same time.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(3): The **octopus** _resembles_ an _insect_ with its eight arms (not getting technical about how many legs an insect has).

column5: 1) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 22-5-2009(26): 螺 (にし) is a fresh water mollusk with a shell like a **screw**. When the mollusk has died the shell is used by _insects_ like a house. Thus, _insects accumulate_ in the **screw** shell.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(15): _Insects accumulate_ if a **screw** is missing.
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(9): I’ve _accumulated_ so many _insects_ at this point, I could easily **screw** anyone over.
column8: 4) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 3-4-2007(7): If too many insects accumulate you're **screw** ed ラ にし にな a small, edible, helical fresh- water mollusk.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 23-2-2010(3): How many _insects_ does it take to **screw** in a lightbulb? Obviously, at least two, but how did they _accumulate_ inside there in the first place?

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(23): **Cicada** s are _simple insects_ : they just pop out of the ground, mate, and die, albeit only every ten years or so.

column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 7-3-2010(5): The **cicada** is an _insect_ with a _simple_ yet rich song.
column8: 4) [[kusterdu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kusterdu)] 26-8-2010(1): When a young **cicada** gets a turn to lead the chorus, he tries a complex riff, but an older **cicada** shouts, "Hey! Keep it simple!".
column9: 5) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(1): Insect, simple: Gordon Ramsay: Preparing _insects_ for dinner is healthy, and even _simple_ minded blond girls can do it. Take the **cicada** : just wrench out its' wings, cook it, and your done.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(17): The **leech** is an _insect_ that sucks on you, but good luck reaching _climax_ with all that blood being lost.
column6: 2) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 4-4-2009(12): The _climax_ of this little _insect_ 's life is sucking your blood. **Leech** es suck.

column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 28-11-2008(2): The **leech** is an _insect_ which is supposed to be an aphrodisiac, causing stronger _climaxes_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(26): An _insect_ crosses _ten thousand cliffs_ to make it to sea, only to be eaten by an **oyster**.
column6: 2) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 8-9-2011(6): 牡蛎 =牡蠣=蠣=蛎=硴, [oyster](../v4/2697.html) (#2697 蛎) レイ( 励 ), かき … Parts: 虫 , Cliff/Drag, 万 (cf. 栃木県 [horse chestnut](../v4/514.html) (#514 栃), 励ます [encourage](../v4/866.html) (#866 励), 砺 [whetstone](../v4/2595.html) (#2595 砺)) … Note: 旧字体 - 牡蠣 =牡蛎, with 萬 for 万 … similars: (cf 蝦 [shrimp](../v4/2689.html) (#2689 蝦), 蛎 [oyster](../v4/2697.html) (#2697 蛎), 蛤 [clam](../v4/2695.html) (#2695 蛤)) … Story: When you are all _out of power_ to _encourage_ ( 励 - 力 ) your friends, or maybe you are feeling all whet ( 砺 - 石 ), just remember, the world is your **oyster**. Aw shucks.
column7: 3) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 26-7-2010(5): We can only advance through dedication and teamwork. Here we see _ten thousand_ **oysters** on top of each others, trying to overcome a _cliff_ to form a new settlement somewhere else. Unfortunately, those at the bottom got a heavy burden, and now an _insect_ is tickling one of them..
column8: 4) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 17-1-2009(4): **Oyster** s are " _insects_ " that produce pearls so strong they could bear the weight of _ten thousand cliffs_.
column9: 5) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 10-11-2012(1): I bought a really expensive gourmet **oyster** at a restaurant that cost _ten thousand_ dollars, and then a fly ( _insect_ ) flew and landed on it and died so I went and jumped off a _cliff_.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 24-7-2007(27): Keeping my _eye_ fixed directly over the paper, I hold down the _ivy_ and melt the strands with my _magic wand_. Viola, **ruled lines** are created! I bet most people think a machine does it.
column6: 2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 1-5-2008(6): The _cyclops_ couldn't make **ruled lines** with his wooden _wand_ because it wasn't smooth, so he had to use a _square jewel_.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 24-2-2010(2): The art gallery curator needed to take his _fingers_ off the painting he was trying to [hang](../v4/674.html) (#674 掛), and _keep his eye on_ the **ruled lines** that he'd pencilled in, so he could work out where exactly to place the artwork.
column8: 4) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 5-1-2010(2): When practicing kanji I use paper with **RULED LINES** which look kind of like a NET because there are horizontal and vertical lines. These lines would frame a SQUARED JEWEL very nicely. I needed a MAGIC WAND to help me make sense of this kanji.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 16-1-2011(1): A class at hogwarts: The assignment is to make perfectly **ruled lines** of _ivy_ using your _wand_. One kid has the idea of writing some nasty words with the ivy, but the teacher's _eye_ is on him.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 24-7-2007(24): In Japanese RPGs, you are well advised to _add_ a **stole** to your _clothing_ as a "freebie" way to _add_ defensive points without swapping out some other _garment_. column6: 2) [[alucardchuu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alucardchuu)] 14-7-2010(13): This **stole** really adds something to your garment, it's the final touch.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(5): The **stole** is a _garment_ easy to _add_ to your outfit: just drape it over your shoulders.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(5): That Buddhist priest **stole** that **stole** : it was like he subtracted some _clothes_ from me and _added_ some _clothes_ to him.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 29-10-2009(3): I _add_ ed a _garment_ and it was **stole** n. I _add_ ed another _garment_ and it too was **stole** n. I _add_ ed a third _garment_ , a mink **stole** , and it was not **stole** n. Of the three garments I _add_ ed, only my **stole** was not **stole** n.

column6: 2) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 16-11-2010(3): 袈裟 , 大袈裟な [monk’s sash](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2701) (#2701 裟)サ … Parts: 沙 [grains of sand](../v4/2296.html) (#2296 沙), 衣 … Note: 袈裟 only compound for 袈 [stole](../v4/2700.html) (#2700 袈)裟[monk’s sash](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2701) (#2701 裟) … Story: Like _Grains of Sand_ through the hourglass measures time, a **Monk's Sash** ay through the abbey can mark the time for the initiates. column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 25-2-2010(1): Monks hate going to the beach because their **monk's sash** is the perfect _garment_ for trapping _grains of sand_ , which irritate them as they walk home. column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(42): At _Thanksgiving_ , there’s a pretty common bet: **I wonder** how much you can stuff into your _mouth_!
column6: 2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 8-4-2010(9): If you want to exhibit your kanji mastery, then be sure to utilise this character every time you write ….かな, as in そう哉 - which is what the character traditionally represents.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 24-7-2007(30): In many Sicilian villages, when _words_ are spoken which can never be taken back, a **vendetta** exists until this retribution - "a _turkey_ for a _turkey_ " - can be extracted.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 24-1-2009(12): _Two turkeys_ (one from Foster Farms and the other from Butterball) exchange _words_ that cause a **vendetta**.

column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(6): You call a _turkey_ , and he comes back with his friend on a **vendetta** asking "What'd you _say_? Who you callin' a _turkey_?".
column9: 5) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 11-9-2012(4): A **vendetta** was started between the _two turkeys_ over just a few _words_. **Vendetta** : a _turkey_ for a _turkey_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(16): _Words_ in the _East_ **remonstrate** those who stand out.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 28-11-2008(15): While _talking_ to an _eastern_ man: "I will **remonstrate** to you how to draw this kanji." "Don't you mean 'demonstrate'?" "No, I mean **REMONSTRATE**!" **remonstrate** d the man.
column7: 3) [[dat5h](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dat5h)] 29-3-2010(2): ( 諌める [いさ.める]): In politics, the extreme _East_ wing political party comes out of nowhere and dissuades everyone from voting for them with their silly _speaches_.
column8: 4) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 27-1-2010(2): There's an old _Eastern saying_ that goes as follows: " **Remonstrate** and pay the price!".
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 11-8-2008(2): _Yao Ming_ is getting sick of not getting treated properly by the press, so he decides to **remonstrate** them. Unfortunately, his spoken English isn't the best, so he decides to send his **remonstrat** ion by _text message_ on his _cell phone_. "I just want to demonstrate my **remonstrate** ," he types. "If I don't start getting sponsorships, I'm going to officially demonstrate and boycott the team!".

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(31): When a Japanese person _say_ s they'll meet you at the _capital_ , it's best to **verify** whether they mean Tokyo or Kyoto.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 1-7-2007(10): You sure that the _capital said_ that? Sorry, but I'll have to go **verify** that.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 25-2-2010(7): Cameron_en's story is excellent. With emphasis added: When a Japanese person _say_ s they'll meet you at the _capital_ , it's best to **verify** whether they mean To **kyo** ( 東 **京** ) or **Kyo** to ( **京** 都).
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 10-7-2010(5): 諒闇 [verify](../v4/2710.html) (#2710 諒)リョウ, まこと … Parts: 言 , 京 … Note: 験 [verification](../v4/1980.html) (#1980 験). Mostly Name Use. … meconium, cameron_en remix: When Makoto and Akiko _say_ s they'll meet you at the _capital_ , it's best to **verify** whether they mean To **kyo** -to ( 東 **京都** ) or **Kyo** to ( **京都** ). One's the Capital District but it's not the capital, and the other is Eastern Kyoto even though it is Tokyo. So you really have to **verify** , in exact _words_ , which _capital_ they mean. … 熟語 : 諒解 ( 了解 ), 諒子 … cf:.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 11-3-2010(2): _Word_ from the _capital_. We cannot **verify** the news until we have _word_ from the _capital_.

I'll leave it up to you to decide whether it worked or not.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 31-5-2008(42): Word, needle, fishhook: The prisoner didn't speak a _word_ in response to our **query** , so we got out our _needles_ and _fishhooks_ to get things going.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 28-11-2008(9): I needed to **query** as to how much _ten fishhooks_ costs so I _said_ to the shopkeeper "How much for _ten fishhooks_?".
column7: 3) [[SimHuman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SimHuman)] 21-3-2010(4): Did you know that when you run a search **query** in Google, they probe web sites for your _words_ using _needles_ and _fish hooks_? True story!
column8: 4) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 8-7-2008(4): If I want to know if the primitives _ten_ and _fish hook_ were used previously, I **query** my spreadsheet with the _words_ given, and find [swift](../v4/280.html) (#280 迅). Well, well, that was a swift answer.
column9: 5) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 6-6-2010(1): The reporter's **QUERIES** are uncomfortable: his _WORD_ s are as sharp as _FISHHOOK_ s, as incisive as _CARPET NEEDLES_. (I use the _CARPET NEEDLE_ primitive also in 絨 [carpet yarn](../v4/2657.html) (#2657 絨)).

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(36): When you **split up** from your partner, you say _words_ that cut things off for good, like a _guillotine_.

column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 24-7-2007(5): _Words_ are the metaphorical _guillotine_ used to **split up** relationships between people.

Everything went exactly as planned when the _guillotine_ did its job, the man said the funny _words_ when his head was **separated** from his body, and everyone **split up** with laughter.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 25-7-2007(35): After someone moves into the _house_ next door, and after you give them a _best regards_ gift (something they can fill their _shelves_ with) the _words_ you can now speak are those of **familiarity**. No more " 始めまして " ect.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 24-2-2010(6): When you've achieved a certain **familiarity** with a Japanese person, you can do away with _words_ such as " **宜** しくお願いします" （よろしく おねがいします), roughly meaning "please accept my _best regards_ ".
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(4): Giving _words_ of _best regards_ can establish **familiarity**.
column8: 4) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 26-11-2012(1): The **familiarity** depicted here is that between a man, and the _words_ in the books in the _shelves_ of his _house_.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 11-3-2010(1): My _words_ were "Give my _best regards_ to Mr. Heisig who gave me kanji **familiarity** ".

column6: 2) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 23-4-2008(11): At my _check-up_ , the doctor tickled me with _feathers_ and I laughed. Doc says it means I'm **fallible**.
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(6): Thank god doctors are **fallible**. column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 28-7-2009(6): I started growing _feathers_ , so I went in for a _check-up_ and they told me I had chicken pox. I guess even physicians are **fallible**.

column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 1-6-2008(3): Ketchup, words: Do you know the **parable** of "The _Ketchup_ and the Holy _Word_ "? No?
