column7: 3) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 25-11-2009(2): I have a great **parable** about anal sex (the true meaning of what Heisig calls ketchup) but I can't say it here.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 5-3-2010(1): Have you heard the **parable** of the _ketchup_? "Yea, as too much _ketchup_ can ruin a good hot dog, so too can too many _words_ ruin thy reputation. Be sparing, with the _ketchup_ , my brethren, and also spare thy _words_.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 7-8-2008(1): One of _Socrates_ ' **parable** s. He once had a student who didn't like anything. This student decided that the way to make things better was to put _ketchup_ on them. Made carrots taste better, made annoying alarm clocks shut up, made ugly girls cry and run away. _Socrates_ heard about this, and told him he should stop. The student said no, this was the only way to make things agreeable for him. "Then maybe you should put ketchup on me," he said. The student saw the error of his ways.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 1-6-2008(23): Car, dog tag: A _car_ hung with hundreds of military _dog tags_ passed by the police station. The officer on duty immediately called in for **reinforcements** : the notorious veteran soldier killer had just passed by.
column6: 2) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 21-5-2009(12): Two kinds of **reinforce** ment the army needs: military _cars_ (tanks) and, of course, [offspring](../v4/2097.html) (#2097 甫): more soldiers.
column7: 3) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 27-4-2011(4): A cheap way to **reinforce** your _car_ \- cover it in metal _dog tags_!
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(2): In a last-ditch effort to **reinforce** their position, the generals ordered grunts to be brought to the front in old beat-up _cars_ , but in the end the generals were slaughtered where they stood and the grunts were reduced to hiding behind the _cars_ and trying to deflect the rain of bullets with their _dog tags_.
column9: 5) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 25-11-2011(1): (+perrin4869, gavmck) A cheap way to **reinforce** your _vehicle_ \- cover it in _dog tags_! Maybe the military should **reinforce** their _vehicles_ like this to reduce the number of _dog-tags_ being sent home. 唇歯輔車 (しんしほしゃ): mutual dependence 輔く (たすく): help, save, rescue 輔ける (たすける): help, save, rescue, give relief to, spare (life), **reinforce** , promote, abet 輔佐 (ほさ): assistant, counselor, adviser [Names: 勇輔 (Yusuke), 公輔 (Kosuke)].

column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 1-11-2010(4): 貰う , 貰い手 , 貰い物 , 貰い泣き (Cry in Sympathy), 貰い火 (catch fire from next door)[get](../v4/2737.html) (#2737 貰) もらう … Parts: 世 , 貝 … Story: The Kanji makes a point that the keyword does not. In Japanese, the distinction between coming into possesion and someone giving you something is strong. This Kanji uses _Generation_ to indicate that this is not just **Get** ting money, but **Getting someone to give you** some _Money_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(28): **Malt** made from _barley_ is often _bound up_ with _rice_ for brewing.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 2-3-2010(10): This means kouji mould, so I think **malt** is a poor keyword. Sake, shochu and other East Asian spirits use this mould in place of yeast, which is used to make most other alcoholic spirits in the world. Mould and yeast are two different types of fungus. **Yeast** might have been a better keyword, as it is the organism doing the fermenting. Story: **Kouji mould** is grown on _rice specially bound up_ to form a starter culture. To make _mugi_ shochu, the starter culture is added to a _barley_ mash.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 16-3-2011(2): I'm making my own special brew with **Kouji Mold** , barley, and some Chrysanthemum buds to add a floral aroma. Notice I'm not adding the actual flowers, just the buds. Otherwise things would taste too leafy.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 15-3-2010(1): This kanji refers to こうじ which is a preparation of grain such as _barley_ or _rice_ fermented by combining ( _binding_ ) it up with a mould. The mould converts the grain starch to sugar and grain sugar is **malt**. Note: Kouji is used for making sake, shouyu and miso.
column9: 5) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 9-6-2008(): This **malt** is no good! Some incompetent _bound up_ some _rice_ , which germinated with the _barley_.

column7: 3) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 16-1-2009(10): A _metal_ **handsaw** _reside_ s in every toolbox.

column9: 5) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 1-6-2012(1): A **handsaw** is a useful piece of _metal_. But if you use it in the place you _reside_ in, you end up with sawdust in the place you _reside_ in. Better to use it outdoors. 鋸 (のこぎり): **handsaw** 鋸屑 (のこくず): sawdust.

column9: 5) [[bennyb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bennyb)] 27-9-2009(1): Hint: 鍬形虫 (くわがたむし), or stag beetle. The kind with **hoe** -like horns kids like to have battle each other! (and if you've ever seen a certain episode of Gintama about a golden stag beetle, this kanji should be a snap).

M.C. **Hammer** was happy that his performance was no longer considered _wooden_.

column5: 1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 13-6-2008(22): The church **carillion** was composed of _metal_ bells that informed when it was the _correct_ time to go to church.
column6: 2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 22-1-2009(13): Wtf is a **carillion**? How about "gong" instead. Picture a game show where they bang on the gong every time you get the correct answer. Or, if you want to go with the book explanation, **carillion** is the "western" bell which is struck from the inside rather than outside. Story: just like everything else in the East (writing, utensils, etc) bells are harder to work than necessary, being hit from the outside and all. The correct way is to put the gong on the inside, makes it so much easier.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 29-11-2008(7): "How much do you think this _gold_ [carillion] is worth?" "Hmm.. a **carillion** dollars?" " _Correct!_ ".
column8: 4) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 2-10-2009(5): The correct spelling is **Carillon**.
column9: 5) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 13-1-2010(2): The Western bell, made of METAL and with the CORRECT spelling of CARILLON was used to notify people of various events (war, storms, fire, etc) so they could respond CORRECTLY.

column5: 1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 5-9-2007(29): The easiest place to spot **rust** is when it grows on _blue_ _metal_. All of my cars have been _blue_ , and as soon as the first red **rust** appears, its off to the scrapheap.
column6: 2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 16-7-2010(13): _Metal_ gets the _blues_ when it starts to **rust**.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(12): The _blue_ oxidation that forms on _metals_ like copper is a form of **rust**.
column8: 4) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 2-11-2007(3): **Rust** in these parts comes about when a METAL is exposed to anoxygen, which results in a strange form of BLUE **rust** covering them, unlike the [rust- colored/cinnabar](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2038) (#2038 丹) we're used to.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 3-3-2010(2): When the _gold_ wedding ring I gave my fiancee started to show signs of **rust** , her face turned _blue_ with anger, and I was forced to tell her I bought it in Chinatown for fifty bucks (although the vendor assured me it was 22 carat _gold_ ).

column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 14-11-2010(5): 鋏 , 鋏む , [scissors](../v4/2773.html) (#2773 鋏)はさみ, はさむ, ヤットコ … Parts: 金 , 夾(夹*) (cf. 夾雑物 [Unicode-0x593e](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/22846) (#22846 夾)) … Note: はさみ is **Scissors** 鋏 , and Claws: 蟹の螯 [Unicode-0x87af](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/34735) (#34735 螯) … Story:Easiest to see this as the Metal that does the 挟む [sandwiched](../v4/1267.html) (#1267 挟), but written with the old version of **Scissors** 挾=挟 Compare to 來, the old version of 来 [come](../v4/1884.html) (#1884 来) ( 倖田來未 ) , Assembly line is replaced by a line and a ten-ten. column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 23-1-2009(2): Picture a man tied to the gates of hell with his chest ripped open so you can see his heart, which is constantly being poked by little demons. Just an example of the kind of **agony** awaiting you inside.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(29): If you can't _fit_ through the _gates_ due to your size, try the **side gate**.
column6: 2) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 28-1-2011(7): 太閤 たいこう This refers to Toyotomi Hideyoshi, an important Japanese historical figure who ruled Japan for awhile. His secret to surviving in the warring states period was to always have a **side gate** for a quick escape. He built this gate so only he would fit through, and anyone chasing him couldn't follow.
column7: 3) [[EusthEnoptEron](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EusthEnoptEron)] 20-12-2008(3): Apart from the big _gates of hell_ , there are many **side gate** s leading out of hell. But they're designed to always be too little for the person trying to escape to _fit_ through. Invented by the devil to drive the humans to despair.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 11-3-2010(1): In fortifications with main gates, there is often a small **side gate** either next door or built into one of the main gates. They only risk opening the main _gates_ if something is too bulky to _fit_ through the **side gate**.
column9: 5) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 11-8-2009(1): When I want to sneak out of the house, I don't use the main _gates_. I squeeze out of the small **side gate** , it's a tight _fit_ , but it works.

column5: 1) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 20-1-2009(24): _Rain_ **trickle** s _down_ wards.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-7-2007(21): Is it _rain_ ing? Hmm…I can see some clouds up there, but I can't feel much _down_ here: must be just a **trickle**.
column7: 3) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 25-1-2009(8): **Trickle** -down raegan-nomics: wealth rains on the rich and **trickle** s down to the poor.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-7-2007(6): If there are **trickle** s running down your face – from your nose/eyes etc – this suggests you are feeling _under_ ( _below_ ) the _weather_.
column9: 5) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 27-7-2010(1): A shaman does a _rain_ dance, but all that comes _down_ is a **trickle**. The rest of his tribe were severely disappointed by his performance, and buried his magical wand below the ground (pictograph) and chased him away. Now they were stuck with the **trickle** forever, as no-one knew how to stop the rain..

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 7-10-2007(35): Jimi Hendrix works as a _weather_ forcaster in his _spare time_. Today he predicts a (purple) **haze**.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 7-2-2009(24): What a coincidence that work should give me _time off_ only days that have _rain_ or **haze** but no sun.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 2-6-2008(8): Rain, spare time: His _hobby_ is jogging. As he crosses the hills surrounding Kyoto, he can see a **haze** hanging around the city. "Well, let's hope it _rains_ soon. That damn smog is bad for my health!".
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 14-3-2010(5): My _hobby_ is landscape photography so I don't like it when the _weather_ is **hazy**. Note: [spare time](../v4/1882.html) (#1882 暇) 暇 - 日 = 叚 so I suppose _hobby_ is a diminutive of _spare time_. [叚 = [Unicode-0x53da](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/21466) (#21466 叚)].
column9: 5) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 19-1-2009(5): What a coincidence that work should give me _time off_ only days that have _rain_ or **haze** but no sun.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 24-6-2007(53): How to obtain **quill** s for free: Wait for a misty day, then under cover of the _mist_ creep up on an unsuspecting bird and quickly cover it with your _umbrella_. The bird will flap around wildly trying to escape and while doing so will shed a number of _feathers_. You can use these as **quill** s.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(3): The latest **quill** s are _feathers_ with an _umbrella_ -like point that sprays _mist_ you can write with.
column7: 3) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 6-2-2009(2): In olden times, lovers used _feathered_ **quill** s to write their names on tree trunks. On _misty_ days they'd have to bring an _umbrella_ to stop the ink from running.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 17-1-2009(1): Why **quill**? Letter is easier. On a misty day I like to sit down under my umbrella and use my writing feathers (quill) to write an old fashioned letter to my pen-pal.
column9: 5) [[endote](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/endote)] 16-8-2012(): Flowing a mist of ink from an umbrella-pointed feather, a **quill**.

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 11-1-2009(19): Under the **auspices** of the local observatory, we looked at the _Big Dipper_ on a _misty_ night, huddled under an _umbrella_.
column6: 2) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 19-4-2008(14): Under the **auspices** of NASA, we explored the _Big Dipper_ – it was _misty_ but NASA placed a giant _umbrella_ over the _Big Dipper_ to keep us dry.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 31-1-2011(7): Looking around on the internet, the only word I can find with this kanji is 斡旋 (あっせん) which means **mediation**. STORY: Mediation is what you do when two parties have a _mist_ between them. You put up an _umbrella_ between them, get them to come together, and measure out something for each of them to keep in a _measuring cup_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(4): Under the **auspices** of PepsiCo, a _measuring cup_ under an _umbrella_ gathers _mist_ with which to make Sierra Mist.
column9: 5) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 4-6-2008(4): Mist, umbrella, measuring cup: This was the annual 'catch as much _mist_ as you can with your _umbrella_ ' race. Under **auspices** of the mayor of Tokyo, contestants were to ride a bike through the _mist_ and collect it in their _umbrella_. Then it was put in a _measuring cup_ so that the winner would be known.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(59): A **saddle** is _leather_ that helps you _relax_ on horseback.
column6: 2) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 28-7-2010(3): Save a horse, ride your _woman_ inside your _house_ in a _leather_ **saddle** instead. (Just to pick up competition with mantixen's story ^_^).
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 1-2-2011(1): The warm _leather_ **saddle** felt so comfy that I _relax_ ed too much and fell off my horse.
column8: 4) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 24-10-2011(): Using a _leather_ **saddle** as a pillow, you _relax_ your head.
column9: 5) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 4-2-2011(): With a _leather_ **saddle** , you can _relax_ a bit more, but at the end of the ride, you are still going to have a saw ass.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-11-2007(34): There's a _leather_ section in the _convenience_ store now – that's where I got this **whip**.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(20): A **whip** is _leather_ that makes others do things at your _convenience_.
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 25-4-2008(8): Mr. Belmont's **whip** sure is a _convenient_ piece of _leather_. (Oh, come on! None of you guys played Castlevania?).
column8: 4) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 5-6-2008(4): A _leather_ **whip** is a _convenient_ way to get your horse to move faster – much better than gentle words of encouragement.
column9: 5) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 4-6-2008(1): Leather, convenient: Shocking scene in a Tokyo _convenience_ store. A guy dressed as Indiana Jones comes running in, chasing a half undressed lady in _leathers_. He's using his **whip** to **whip** her buttocks once in a while. Strange people, these Japanese..

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(29): A **scabbard** is a _leather_ sheath that should to _resemble_ the blade it's going to hold.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-7-2007(15): Originally, the _leather_ **saddle straps** were for holding _candles_ , but now they're more commonly used for holding swords, like **scabbards**.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 1-2-2011(6): It's all about the element of surprise. At the duel, I pull a _candle_ out my _leather_ **scabbard** and hurl it at my enemy to set him on fire. HA HA!
column8: 4) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 6-9-2007(3): These **saddle straps** sure _resemble_ _leather_ , but _leather_ cracks when dry. Instead, they are made of synthetic materials (to last longer).
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 29-11-2008(2): These **saddle straps** are made of extremely durable _leather_ , you can even try burning it with a _candle_ and nothing will happen to it.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(74): The first **briefcase** was a piece of _leather_ used to _wrap_ documents.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 15-2-2007(8): The businessman likes to make out he's important but the only thing his _leather_ **briefcase** keeps _wrapped up_ his the lunch his wife made.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 6-3-2010(3): I had a business lunch at a steakhouse, but the meat was so tough it was like eating _leather_! So I spat out the _leathery_ chunks and _wrapped_ them in paper napkins, and hid them in my **briefcase** so my colleagues wouldn't notice.
column8: 4) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 9-2-2009(2): LEATHER WRAPPED into a box (middle part of WRAP) is a BAG/BRIEFCASE.
column9: 5) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 19-1-2009(2): I was on my way to a PETA meeting but they wouldn't let me bring in my _leather_ **briefcase** in so I _wrapped_ it with some cloth.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 31-10-2007(34): A _leather_ _blade_ would make for a poor sword, because it's too **pliable**.
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 3-12-2009(12): A _leather blade_ is liable to be too **pliable** to be viable in a fight.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 10-3-2010(3): Barbers use a **pliable** _leather_ strop to sharpen their razor _blades_.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 8-3-2010(2): When cutting the hide off an animal, you need a **pliable** _blade_ , because the toughness of the _leather_ will cause most _blades_ to snap. (Note: something being **pliable** is a good thing! It means it will bend without breaking!).
column9: 5) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 9-10-2011(1): Imagine a prank where you are given a knife with a **pliable** _blade_ , only it looks perfectly fine. The problem is that as you find out about the prank just as you are about to try it out on a bull to get its _leather_ , by which time you are in real trouble.

column5: 1) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 31-12-2008(27): Wtf **terminate**? This is "ball". Use "leather ball" for keyword, imagine a leather american football packed with bound up rice.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(14): _Rice_ _bound up_ with _leather_ makes a good **hacky sack**. The game **terminate** s when the ball touches the ground. <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kemari>.
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 17-7-2007(5): To **terminate** the **Terminator** , we _bound-up_ his _rice_ with some _leather_ and watched him starve to death. I can't find anything in regards to how this means "terminate", just balls.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 21-3-2010(2): This kanji actually means "ball" but since we already have [ball](../v4/935.html) (#935 球) 球 how about "medicine ball" - traditionally sand (or in this case _rice_ ) _wrapped_ in _leather_. To link this with **terminate** : An oversize "medicine ball" is used as a wrecking ball to **terminate** old buildings.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 20-12-2009(2): To **terminate** use of this key word we _bound up_ a kilo of _rice_ in _leather_ & took turns using it as a **ball** to knock over **terminate** with. (+w/respect herman).

column5: 1) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 7-2-2009(32): The DNA evidence reveals the _truth_ about the crime but its too late to **overturn** the sentence now - they already chopped off the innocent prisoners _head_.

column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 8-9-2011(3): 顛末 =顚末, 顛末記 =顚末記, 主客顛倒 =主客転倒, 造次顛沛 =造次転沛, 顛倒 =転倒 [overturn](../v4/2789.html) (#2789 顛) テン … Parts: 眞/真, 頁 (cf: 転倒 [revolve](../v4/420.html) (#420 転), 顚末 , お願い [petition](../v4/135.html) (#135 願), 覆没 [capsize](../v4/1611.html) (#1611 覆) … Note: Now 転 . Also 眞/真 旧字体 : 顚 Spahn 9A10.1 (顚) … Since this is mostly used in the phrase 顛末記 , to know the **Full Details** you have to **Overturn** your misconceptions and get your _Head_ on _True_. If you want to get _truly_ great _head_ , you have to **turn over**.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(2): The verdict was **overturn** ed with a _page_ of _truth_.

column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 7-11-2010(4): 頚 [neck and throat](../v4/2796.html) (#2796 頚)ケイ, くび … Parts: 圣(巠), 頁 (cf 頸部 [Unicode-0x9bbc](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/39868) (#39868 鮼)) … Heisig got this wrong, it is not the simplified version Doctors use, it is the traditional version: 頸, with the old version of _Spool_ : 巠. All of the 漢字 that use _Spool_ can be written with either version : cf: 頚 -頸, 軽車 - 輕車 , etc. But just like the other non 常用漢字 this tends to stick with the old version.
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 29-11-2008(4): Your **neck and throat** gag as the smell of _soiled crotch_ hits your _head_.

column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 11-8-2009(23): The soldiers in the _Trojan Horse_ were supposed to wait several hours before coming out, but when they spotted a _scorpion_ in the horse with them, they all **rush** ed out at once.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 5-11-2009(10): A very hungry _scorpion_ climbed up the _hind_ leg of a _horse_ , and took a big bite out of the _horse's_ rump. The _horse_ squealed in fright and took off in a **rush** , leaving the _scorpion_ sitting there in a cloud of dust. The _scorpion_ called out to the horse in the distance: "Thank you for the meal! ( 御 **馳** 走様でした！ ごちそうさまでした！）".
column8: 4) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 4-6-2008(2): Trojan horse, scorpion: The soldiers inside the _Trojan horse_ got the scare of their lives when they discovered that a _scorpion_ was sitting on the hatch. One is poking at it with a stick, to get it moving. The other: 'Don't **rush** it. If this isn't done correctly, it might attack us and the mission be at risk!'.
column9: 5) [[endote](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/endote)] 7-8-2012(1): A horse and a scorpion sat down for a feast and **rush** ed down their food. 「ごちそうさまでした！！」.

column5: 1) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 11-8-2009(40): This character is だます, which means to trick or fool someone. The Greeks tricked (cheated) the Trojans by hiding in the _Trojan Horse_ , which actually had a secret _door_ from which the hidden soldiers would emerge. It was a brilliant tactic that would be recorded in the _tomes_ of history.
column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 13-9-2007(15): I got caught by my ex- with a pack of _Trojans_ and a _Hentai mag_ … of course she broke up with me, how the hell could I have convinced her I was not a **cheat**?!?
column7: 3) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 4-8-2009(10): An educational comic book that shows how the Greeks **cheat** ed by using a Trojan Horse.
column8: 4) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 26-10-2007(6): だます！ That salesman is a **cheat**! We were playing cards and he promised a TEAM OF HORSES for his next bet, but when I opened the DOOR on my awesome prize, all it was was a bunch of TOMES about horses. **Cheat** er!
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 5-12-2009(5): I forget the Kanji for _horse_ while doing reviews but **cheat** the system by glancing at my _Kanji poster_.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 17-7-2007(33): The guy who said that you can take a _horse_ to a _river_ , but you can't make it drink obviously has never encountered a **tame** _horse_.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 14-8-2008(13): The process to getting a **tame** horse is a bit like getting a **tame** Christian - baptizization! you take it into the _river_ at a young age (just after it's born is best) and dunk it in until it is almost drowned. Then at the last possible moment, when its life is flashing before its eyes (good baptizers know when this is), you pull it back above water. The first thing it sees is its "rescuer" and "savior", and it will be **tame** and follow you for the rest of its life.
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 13-1-2010(6): _Horse_ , _stream_. You can lead a **tame** _horse_ to _water_ & also make it drink.
column8: 4) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 28-7-2010(4): (+Megaqwerty) The _Trojan Horse_ was so well-behaved the Troys took it for being **tame**. They even took it to the _stream_ to drink. (Think of the Troys playing with the horse like little girls play with dolls). It didn't drink of course, and that's where the proverb 'you can take a horse to a river, but you cannot make it drink' comes from.
column9: 5) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 23-10-2008(2): Can you **TAME** this wild HORSE to cross this RIVER?

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 9-3-2009(21): _Wolverine_ 's had charges placed on him for murdering a _horse_ , but he make's a **rebuttal** stating that he couldn't have been in two different places at the same time (i.e. There cannot exist _two Wolverines_ ). He was having dinner with his Aunt Margaret at the time, it's impossible.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(8): Trojan horse, 2 sheafs: Proponents of taking the _Trojan Horse_ into the city employed convincing arguments in their **rebuttal**. They put _2 sheafs_ next to the _Trojan Horse_ and put them on fire. 'You see, if it were a trap, and enemies were inside, they would surely come out right now.' However, during the **rebuttal** , nobody noticed the caughing coming from inside the _Trojan Horse_ ….
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(6): _Wolverine_ gave a **rebuttal** that the _slash marks_ on the _horse_ didn't even look like his.
column8: 4) [[Green_Airplane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Green_Airplane)] 30-7-2010(2): <Http://www.break.com/index/horse-kicks-moron-in-the-face.html> some **rebuttal** … those two _X_ es are marks from where the _horse_ hit the moron.
column9: 5) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 15-1-2010(2): Just like **REBUTTAL** s that go on endlessly, a HORSE that's placed at an equal distance from TWO SHEAVES of hay will go on endlessly trying to make up its mind which one to eat.

column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(8): Trojan Horse, hill: The anchoring of the _Trojan Horse_ had broken, and now it was accelerating down the _hill_. To save the men inside, riders were **galloping** down the _hill_ to get them out in time.
column7: 3) [[nadiatims](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nadiatims)] 5-7-2009(4): To leap over a hill, first accellerate your horse to a fast **gallop**. It helps to feed the horses COOkies (KU) to energize them.

column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(1): A Gallup pole is taken to measure which _team of horses_ the public thinks can **gallop** up the _hill_ most quickly.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(38): The _team of horses_ is nervously asking a _tiger_ not to eat them. "Don't worry", says the _tiger_ , "over in that _paddyfield_ I can see my favourite _dish_ – **donkey**!".
column6: 2) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 14-2-2009(8): The team of _horses_ ran when they saw the _tiger_. But the stubborn **donkey** continued drinking from his _dish_ in the open _field_. Talk about easy prey.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 11-3-2010(4): It could so easily have been a "Trojan **donkey** " or even a "Trojan _tiger_ " but for a _brain_ storming session in which suggestions were thrown into a _dish_. The " _Trojan horse_ " idea came out first.
column8: 4) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 11-4-2010(3): **Donkeys** are small _horses_ that can therefore fit into _huts_ [Unicode-0x76e7](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/30439) (#30439 盧).
column9: 5) [[EusthEnoptEron](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EusthEnoptEron)] 20-12-2008(1): When the greeks were waiting inside the _trojan horse_ , they heard that the trojans eat _tiger_ _brains_ as their main _dish_ every day. Suddenly, they felt like they were in a mere **donkey** , rather than in a sovereign horse.

column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 22-1-2010(3): This is the _fish_ most belovéd by the _revered_ Kilgore **Trout** & also by his less- _revered_ son, Leon Trotsky **Trout**.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(26): The **bonito** is a _fish_ with _strict_ preparation procedures for making 出汁 （だし） and 鰹節 （かつおぶし）.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 10-11-2006(7): At the お好み焼き （おこのみやき）place I go to, they are so _strict_ about putting **かつお, **bonito**** flakes on to your okonomiyaki that if you ever tried to ask for it without, they would tell you never to come back!
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(5): Fish, strict: La Isla **Bonito**. Madonna is very _strict_ on the type of _fish_ imported to the island. Only the best is good enough…
column8: 4) [[wakeuplan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wakeuplan)] 16-2-2010(3): Bono (lead vocals for U2) loves FISH, be he STRICTly avoids eating **bonito** , because he has interpreted the species' name as, 'little Bono.'.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(3): Because he is worried about tuna being over- _fish_ ed, Katsuo is _strict_ about eating only **bonito**.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(32): Fish, autumn: Old man to his son: "You are **bullheaded** if you think you can catch a **bullhead** _fish_ in the middle of _autumn_. It's out of season!".
column6: 2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 20-3-2010(7): Perhaps a bit of a misnomer. **Bullhead** is a river fish (カジカ). This kanji is most likely to refer to young Japanese yellowtail or **amberjack**. It is a fish of many names depending on age: fry (もじゃこ), young ( [鰍・いなだ](midori://search?text=鰍・いなだ) or 魬・はまち), mature (鰤・ぶり). I suppose these kanji might crop up on a fish menu. STORY: Young **Amberjack** is not at its best in summer. Eat from **autumn** onwards (when it becomes more fatty). Also its tail is amber - the colour of _autumn_ leaves.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(1): A **bullhead** is a _fish_ that thrives in waters as warm as _autumn_.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(1): The real reason beaches are so empty during _autumn_ : that's the only season the **bullhead** _fish_ bring up their heads.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 12-2-2011(): Both my dictionaries agree with Heisig and call this **bullhead** , not amberjack. From Abaddon: Fish, autumn: Old man to his son: "You are **bullhead** ed if you think you can catch a **bullhead** fish in the middle of autumn. It's out of season!".

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(34): "Dude! What happened to your _chin_?" "Well, I was out _fishing_ …".
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 31-8-2007(14): Saltwater **crocs** swim in the sea like _fish_. Right side = _crocodile_ primative. Pictograph - 2 big eyes and _one_ massive _snare_ for a mouth.
column7: 3) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 3-9-2008(4): (This is pictographic cheating, but I think Heisig would approve.) The upper right is a CAJUN's two eyes and his mouth, licking his lips. He's set a SNARE out in the bayou, for the one delicacy he loves more than FISH– the fearsome **alligator**! He can't wait to catch one and make a fine sauce piquant!
column8: 4) [[melchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/melchan)] 3-10-2009(2): The right side looks like a pictograph of an **alligator** with its two eyes (the _mouths_ ), and _one_ _snare_ mouth waiting the unaware _fishes_ to go inside.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 9-10-2011(1): 鰐 , 鰐梨 =ワニナシ=アボカド, 鰐淵寺 , [alligator](../v4/2824.html) (#2824 鰐)ガク, わに … Parts: 魚 , 咢 (cf 咢[Unicode-0x54a2](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/21666) (#21666 咢), 顎 [chin](../v4/2795.html) (#2795 顎), 驚愕 [Unicode-0x6115](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/24853) (#24853 愕)) … Story: An **Alligator** eats many _Fish_ , by opening his **Alligator** jaw, but leaving his _Chin_ (咢) in place.

column5: 1) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-1-2009(15): The **crucian** _fish_ _adhere_ s strongly to **Crucian** ism principles.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(11): Due to its oxygenating properties, it is crucial that you _adhere_ to a **crucian** _fish_ if you plan on spending a long time underwater.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(7): Fish, adhere: It's crucial that you don't catch any **crucian** carp anymore. If we don't _adhere_ to this rule, the _fish_ will probably be extinct next year.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 28-3-2010(6): **Crucian** carp (ふな) is a freshwater fish most well known for its use in 鮒鮓 (ふなずし) which is an ancient forerunner to modern sushi.The fish is salted and allowed to ferment over a period of months. STORY: The **crucian** chefs prepare the _fish_ for funazushi by _adhering_ to the ancient ways. Note: This old way of preserving fish, known generally as なれずし ( 馴れ鮓 or 熟れ鮓 ), uses a rare kanji for すし - [Unicode-0x9b93](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/39827) (#39827 鮓) 鮓.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(3): The **crucian** is a _fish_ you can _adhere to_ yourself due to the fact that it can live more than 5 months without oxygen.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 28-11-2010(39): Japanese consider _fish_ to be most _delicious_ when eaten as **sushi**. (Note: In practice, **sushi** is more often written 寿司 , but occasionally 鮨 ).
column6: 2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 7-10-2009(11): They have a perfectly good kanji, yet they use the ateji 寿司 most of the time.
column7: 3) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 27-2-2012(4): This kanji is perfect ☺.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 19-3-2011(2): 鮨 =鮓=寿司, 鮨詰め =鮨詰, 握り鮨 =にぎり寿司, [sushi](../v4/2826.html) (#2826 鮨) すし … Parts: 魚 , 旨 [delicious](../v4/455.html) (#455 旨) … Note: 寿司 is the far more common way of writing the food, but this kanji is used to write expressing using the word 'sushi': 握り鮨 , 鮨詰め … Story: **Sushi** is _Delicious Fish_.
column9: 5) [[oregum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/oregum)] 29-5-2010(2): **SUSHI** is FISH that is DELICIOUS.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(25): Fish, old man, sun: An ominous **fish fin** approaches the _old man_ , who went for a swim as the _sun_ was going down. Soon, he'll sleep with the _fishes_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(14): The _old man_ thinks **fish fin** _sushi_ is _delicious_.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 12-8-2009(5): 1. Senile (耆) story: A **senile** _old man_ doesn't know what _day_ it is. 2. **Fish fin** story: You can estimate a fish's age when you scrutinize its **fish fin**. _Senile fish_ have tattered **fish fin** s. (thanks to Peppi).
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(4): _Old Man and the Sea_.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(21): A _bird_ that goes to the inland _wards_ for food is the **seagull**.

column7: 3) [[EusthEnoptEron](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EusthEnoptEron)] 21-12-2008(5): _Wolverine_ had enough of this _ward_ and hence went to the seaside with his _cardboard box_. Now he always kills a _bird_ , a **seagull** , when he wakes up and eats it for breakfast, while listening to the sound of the sea.
column8: 4) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 28-7-2010(2): Everybody hates **seagulls** , even Grim Reaper. Here we see _Grim Reaper_ hiding in a _cardboard box_ so that annoying _bird_ wont poo on him too.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 4-12-2009(2): In Minato _ku_ the **seagull** s are the _bird_ s that may be found on the East side (i.e., right side, for placement of the primitive). Some of them, I'm told, are plotting an 殴 [assault](../v4/1698.html) (#1698 殴) on 欧 [Europe](../v4/1699.html) (#1699 欧). On the West side one is more likely to find a 躯 [body [old]](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2986) (#2986 躯), like the one last week, done in by a 枢 [hinge](../v4/1697.html) (#1697 枢) gun in a 駆 [drive](../v4/1983.html) (#1983 駆)-by shooting.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(32): Companion, bird: **Roc** , the mythical _bird_ , was searching for a _companion_ for as long as he existed. Little did he know that he was the only one of his kind.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(30): The **parakeet** is a _bird_ that acts like a _suckling infant_ when it drinks from the water dropper.

column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(27): [+brose] The **cormorant** was historically used in Japan and China to catch fish. The fisher would use some rope or something to tie its throat so that it could only swallow small fish. If it caught something too big to swallow, it would take it back to the fisher's boat and the fisher would take it out. This particular **cormorant** is going after bigger and bigger prey - but one day it goes too far, and tries to swallow your _little brother_! Imagine trying to yank your brother out of its throat.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-3-2007(22): The **cormorant** is a _bird_ you use like your _younger brother_ to fetch things for you.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 6-9-2011(1): 鵜飼 =鵜飼い=鵜養, [cormorant](../v4/2832.html) (#2832 鵜) う … Parts: 弟 , 鳥 … Story: U, I got an idea: instead of **Cormorant** Fishing ( 鵜飼い ), I'll use my _Disciples_ 弟子 to catch _'Birds"_. And by birds, I mean women.
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(1): When my _younger brother_ said "I love **U** ", he was actually talking about the _bird_ , not me. 鵜 【 **う** 】.
column9: 5) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 1-6-2007(1): Check this out….it explains how the birds were used for fishing in Japan <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cormorant> テイ ダイ う.

column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 17-10-2007(10): As I was walking I noticed **hair-on** the _path_! When I bent to see what was up, I realized that they were in fact fine feathers poking through - someone had paved over a large _bird_!
column7: 3) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 15-1-2010(7): You have to watch out for the **HERON**! When walking on a lakeshore PATH this BIRD will dive bomb you from behind. (View 鷺 as if your looking at it from above and the story works).
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(6): The **heron** is a _bird_ large enough to walk on both _paths_.
column9: 5) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 22-7-2012(1): The **heron** is a _bird_ with a lot of **hair on** it, so it leaves a _path_ of hair in its wake and is therefore easy to track.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(33): Concerning, bird: The US senate had a meeting _concerning_ the **eagle**. Although symbol of the US, this _bird_ is close to extinction.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(37): Due to its waterproof _armor_ , the **wild duck** is a _bird_ that resurfaces even if you push it underwater.
column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 12-8-2009(19): かも, or **wild duck** , is a Japanese term that means an easy mark or a sucker because **wild duck** s are considered to be easy to catch. This kanji shows a duck that is wearing some _armor_ to avoid being an easy mark.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 17-3-2010(6): As a defense against wildfowlers, **wild duck** s began sporting ballistic _armour_. The next innovation was カモflage. Time to reappraise the term " _bird_ brained"!
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 20-12-2009(2): This **wild duck** is so wild that you need a suit of _armour_ to protect yourself from him. Duck! Here he comes again!
column9: 5) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 5-2-2011(1): Due to it's waterproof _armor_ the **wild duck** is the most buoyant of _birds._.

column5: 1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 5-2-2008(25): The **kite falcon** is a majestic _bird_ that flies in the sky as fast as an _arrow_. So much so that its feathers are often used to make arrows.
column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(3): A man from the medievil times goes hunting for **falcons** , he aims his _arrow_ , shoots and runs to look at the _bird_ he got. Sadly it was just a **kite** and he'd made some poor boy very upset.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 5-6-2008(3): Arrow, bird: The **black kite** is a _bird_ of prey (like the raptor). You can see it approaching its target, like an _arrow_ speeding through the air.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 19-3-2010(2): In RTK3 2 ed. this is **black kite**. A ubiquitous Japanese falcon. One diagnostic feature of these birds is that their tails are v-shaped just like the tail of an _arrow_. Note: Story for kunyomi - (Two Shakespearean birders with binocs) One says, "That _bird_ , トビ or not トビ?" The other replies, "Good question. Judging by _arrow_ -tail, I'd say トビ.".
column9: 5) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(1): The **kite falcon** flies like a kite so people fire _arrows_ at it to try and bring it down.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(37): The **owl** , being wise, is hiding its tail feathers in a _tree_ so that its prey can't tell what kind of _bird_ it is.
column6: 2) [[kanjiwarrior](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjiwarrior)] 12-6-2009(10): The **owl** is a very snooty bird, one could say that it has a tree stuck up it's ass. キョウ.
column7: 3) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 16-1-2009(6): The wise old _bird_ sits on top of a _tree_ , its feathers are camouflaged and blend in with the color of the tree. 梟悪 (great treachery, very atrocious person). 梟将 (brave general). 梟敵 (treacherous enemy). 梟猛 (Fierce). 梟雄 (Ringleader, accomplished villain).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(6): The **owl** is a _bird_ that often perches atop a _tree_.

column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(5): A _deer_ stomps on the _soil_ and is covered in **dust**.

column5: 1) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(29): A **giraffe** is like a _deer_ except that when it plays _chess_ it has a better overview of the board.
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 2-11-2007(10): A _deer_ standing on a _bushel basket_ still isn't tall enough to be mistaken for a **giraffe**.

column7: 3) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 5-10-2006(16): "Real _men_ don't use _mortars_ ", my **father-in-law** says. "It's a girly thing to use".

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 6-10-2007(145): You are chasing the famous three blind **mice** and try to catch them by slamming a _mortar_ on top of them. Success! You can see their _three tails_ sticking out from under the mortar. In fact the impact has broken the first two tails, as you can see from the sharp angle they bend at, and the _two drops_ (blood) on each. The third tail still curves nicely though, and hence has no drops of blood on it.
column6: 2) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 20-5-2010(13): Mighty **Mouse** is so tough you can hit him with a _mortar_ , double _plows_ coated with _4 drops_ of rat poison, and you'll still never _hook_ him.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 15-4-2009(6): A pictograph of an elaborate **mouse** -catching device. _A hook_ on the front to grab them, _a couple of alternating ploughs_ to slice them (spattered with _drops_ of blood) and a _mortar_ on top for the big jobs.
column8: 4) [[Regular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Regular)] 20-12-2010(5): Mortar LLC (a limited liability company) has a **mouse** dropping problem.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 6-10-2011(4): 鼠色 , 栗鼠 , 海鼠 , [mouse](../v4/2065.html) (#2065 鼠)(ソ), ねずみ … Parts: 臼 , Pictograph. (cf: 鎌鼬 [Unicode-0x9f2c](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/40748) (#40748 鼬), 鼡[Unicode-0x9f21](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/40737) (#40737 鼡)) … Note: Also comes in a simplified form: 鼡 (which appeared as a primitive in 猟る [game-hunting](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1940) (#1940 猟)) … Story: **Mouse** smashed with an 臼 [mortar](../v4/2063.html) (#2063 臼). Two legs splayed out front, 4 drops of blood (4 for death) , plus tail sticking out.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 11-1-2007(44): This is pretty much only used in the word 鑿 (のみ), chisel. Missile + metal is obviously a hammer being swung. The needle is the chisel and the mortar represents the impressions left ( **bored** ) by the chisel. For some reason the chisel is used to make a row of such impressions here, and the work is done in such a difficult place that it has to be done upside down. Perhaps this is some sort of sabotage, done in a place that is not readily visible to the outside.
column6: 2) [[At0m5k](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/At0m5k)] 4-8-2009(36): Hanging _upside down in a row_ are _ten_ _mortar_ s. You must shoot chisel tipped _missile_ s into all of them and successfully **bore** holes through them in order to get the prize of _gold_. Talk about a messed up county fair game!
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 24-10-2008(11): At _Staples_ someone used a _needle_ to **bore** a hole through the bathroom wall, turning it into an _adult movie theater_ where a _Golden_ eye can get his _missile_ launched.
column8: 4) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 17-9-2007(6): Going the chisel route… (the _missile_ that comes down on the _metal_ ) the **bore** work is done on pieces that are _hung upside down_ in a _dry_ place. That's to prevent rust or mould from affecting the tool or the work. If, unfortunately, rust or mould does form, then the piece is only as good as _mortar_ ammo.
column9: 5) [[tuuli](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tuuli)] 29-10-2008(4): To **bore** , take an _upside down row_ of _needles_ to try to get through the _mortar_ (of granite). If that doesn't work, use a _missile_ , then surely you can get to the _gold_!

column5: 1) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 8-1-2008(48): In military terms, a **small craft** is a _boat_ that only has enough room for a _mortar_ that fires _walking sticks_ \- which is pretty useless unless you hit the enemy in the _crotch_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(34): In a **small craft** , the _boat_ is so small that you hit yourself in the _crotch_ when trying to use a _mortar_ and _walking stick_ (as a pestle).
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 4-11-2008(13): The **small craft** was a tiny _boat_ made from a _mortar_ and had a _walking stick_ for a mast. It was so tiny that I couldn't even fit my _crotch_ inside it.
column8: 4) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 25-6-2008(6): [+nest0r] A drug dealer from Italy goes out into the sea in his gondola to make drugs (the Mediterranean is fairly lawless). It's small, so he has to hold the _mortar_ between his _crotch_ and use the _walking stick_ he uses to navigate the Italian rivers to grind. He is flagged down by a concerned navy boat - but he hides the drugs in his _crotch_ and says he's fine. The naval officer - "not that I was looking - but did you see the size of that thing? Looked like he was really packing!" (think about it…).
column9: 5) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 5-6-2008(3): Creative drug dealers go lo-tech and take a **small craft** (easily hidden, fast, efficient) out into international waters, and while they're in the _boat_ they can legally use their _mortar and pestle_ to grind up buffalo _crotch_ or whatever to make special kinds of aphrodisiacs/speed/E/et cetera.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(22): When you wake up in _Hades_ , you **close the eyes** and try to pretend it isn't happening.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(10): When you **close the eyes** of someone who just died…
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(5): It's as dark as _Hades_ when you **close your _eyes_**.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 28-11-2009(4): In Hades you are meant to keep your eyes closed. If the demons on duty in _Hades_ see an _eye_ open anywhere they all scream "Close the eyes!".
column9: 5) [[manubear](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/manubear)] 10-8-2012(2): Every time you **close your _eyes_** , you see a vision of _Hades_. Perhaps you should try meditating! ( 瞑想 ).

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(39): _Hades_ is normally very dark, and even when the _sun_ shines in it is still **murky**.
column6: 2) [[Maginican](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Maginican)] 15-6-2010(3): The Sunshine looks **Murky** in Hades.
column7: 3) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 2-3-2011(1): Even with the _sun_ out, _Hades'_ presence was enough to keep things **murky**.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-2-2010(): While they're toiling for eternity in the dim light of the underworld, the damned keep themselves in good spirits by singing the well-known subterranean folk song: 'The _murky sun of Hades_ is the only _sun_ for me!' (<http://www.amaranthpublishing.com/The%20Yellow%20Rose%20Of%20Texas.mp3>).

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 18-7-2007(43): The cave was too dark for my tastes, so I went out to **sit in mediation**.
column6: 2) [[mavelle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mavelle)] 3-3-2011(9): _2 people_ **sitting in mediation** on the _dirt_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(3): The _couple_ takes a break on the _soil_ for **sitting in meditation**.
column8: 4) [[fergal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fergal)] 25-4-2009(2): This is how buddhist monks are made. They **sit in meditation** on the _soi_ l, passing along an _assembly line_. (Note when they are finished, they come off the assembly line are are glued together to form a buddhist temple 寺 ).
column9: 5) [[paasan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paasan)] 29-7-2010(1): Two monks that been **sitting in meditation** (meditation or mediation?) for too long – a big pile of dirt under them. I wonder who feeds them, for these two sure don't have time to visit the toilet.

column5: 1) [[kazelee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kazelee)] 4-9-2008(51): On the **first day of the month** a mountain goat lets out a "Baah" as it jumps over the moon.
column6: 2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(21): The female _mountain goat_ can only give milk on one day of the _month_ : on the **first day of the month**. Her milk cycles are controlled by the _moon_.
column7: 3) [[Machine_Gun_Cat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Machine_Gun_Cat)] 27-8-2009(17): Ｗerewolves turn into wolves at the full moon, Weregoats turn into goats on the **first day of the month**.( primitave= Weregoat).
column8: 4) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 3-12-2007(6): Because they couldn't fit the _mountain goat_ into any of the weekdays they reserved him a character for the **first day of the month** , also because this day is when the _moon_ most closely resembles a _mountain-goat's_ curved horns. also see [model](../v4/1960.html) (#1960 塑).
column9: 5) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(5): Aside from there being a _moon_ up there in the sky, it's fairly easy to tell that it's the **first day of the month** when it's often accompanied by the _flesh_ of a _mountain goat_ on my porch.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(37): The _day_ seems to **drag** when it keeps you from having a _fiesta_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-4-2008(15): Bored with the _sun_ always going the same way (“it’s such a **drag** ”), I tuck the _sun under my arm_ and try to **drag** it in the opposite direction to usual. EDIT: Notes (1): _tucked under the arm_ is reversed here, i.e. a mirror image of the usual primitive. Note (2): **Tow** might be a better keyword: see my note at [dribble out](../v4/2849.html) (#2849 洩).
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 5-11-2010(10): 曳光弾 , 曳く , 曳き船 =引き船=曵船, 曳航 [drag](../v4/2848.html) (#2848 曳) エイ, ひく … Parts: 日 , 戈- 丶 (cf 洩らす [dribble out](../v4/2849.html) (#2849 洩)) … Note: this Kanji is confusing until you look at its older form 曵. It's not ’Under the arm’ but rather 戈Fiesta with one stroke doubled up with 日 . Often replaced by 引く in modern times. Old version 曵 is used in the Hikifune ( 曵船 ) place name in Tokyo. … Story:The _Fiesta_ can certainly **Drag** if it goes all day _Without a Drop_ to drink.
column8: 4) [[nac_est](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nac_est)] 6-11-2008(2): The _sun_ , as we all know, is very heavy. So the **drag** it generates when carrying it under your arm makes it a tiring burden.
column9: 5) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 17-2-2011(1): It was a real **drag** when the _sun_ dried up the last _drop_ to drink at the _fiesta_.

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 30-12-2008(22): (re: Katsuo) If you _tow water_ in a wheelbarrow, some of it is sure to **dribble out**.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-4-2008(22): Tip: Heisig has duplicated a primitive name here by calling the right side _drag_. We already have a two-stroke primitive called _drag_ (see numbers 1853-1861 盾 , 派 , 脈 , 逓 , 后 ). I suggest calling 曳 " _tow_ " instead.
column7: 3) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 27-8-2007(9): Good _water_ flows and thus keeps on moving, but here, the _water_ has too much _drag_ and thus can **dribble out** of its tube.
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(8): If you _drag_ your water bottle along behind you, _water_ will begin to **dribble out**.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 5-11-2010(5): 漏洩 , 洩れる =漏れる, 洩らす =漏らす, [dribble out](../v4/2849.html) (#2849 洩) エイ( 曳 ), もれる, もらす … Parts:氵, 日 , 戈-丶(see 曳く [drag](../v4/2848.html) (#2848 曳)) … Note: Now replaced by 漏れる . Also appears as 泄 in compounds. Used in Chinese Astrology) … Story: After the all _Day Fiesta without a drop_ to drink, it was not surprisingly that when I went to 'make _water_ , only a tiny bit **Dribbled Out**. Or when you _Drag_ a boat from the water, the _Water_ Dribbles Out the back.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(34): A **comet** flew by and knocked down _two bushes_ , so I went out there and _swept_ up the mess, cursing astrological bodies along the way.
column6: 2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 17-3-2010(10): Broom is ヨ. The lower primitive here resembles a rake 肀 without a handle (vertical stroke). STORY: **Comet** s actually have _2 bush_ y tails (<http://apod.nasa.gov/apod/image/9703/halebopp4_aac.jpg>). Imagine a NASA probe with an attachment like a _rake head_ designed to catch (rake up) the fine particles streaming from the tails for later analysis.
column7: 3) [[koohiikun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koohiikun)] 17-2-2011(5): Having _2 Bushes_ for president hurt like a **comet** hitting the planet and it'll take more than a _broom_ to clean it up.
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(4): A **comet** flew by and knocked down _two bushes_ , so I went out there and _swept_ up the mess, shocked to find a _broom_ from outer space! (big ups Megaqwerty).
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 25-10-2010(2): 彗星 =帚星=箒星 [comet](../v4/2850.html) (#2850 彗) スイ … Parts:2 丰, 彐＊ … Story: The two _Bushes_ both said 'No **Comet** ', trying to _brush_ the scandal under the rag. Bush malaprop: He meant to say _No Comment_.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 7-6-2008(36): Comet, heart: Heisig: "The **astute** reader will notice that the second stroke in the broom element of _comet_ doesn't pass through. The **astute** reader will take this observation to _heart_ ".
column6: 2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 18-10-2007(18): The **astute** astral observer Edmond Halley put his heart into his work. And in return, we named a comet for him.
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 22-4-2010(7): Were US voters **astute** to elect _two Bushes_ in such a _hurry_ (just 8 years apart)? (Note: let last seven strokes be abbrv. of 急 "hurry").
column8: 4) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 8-9-2010(2): After seeing the two Bushes arrive at the back of the convention center on one broom, the **astute** reporter knew in his heart that they were not really human. After publishing this story, his heart was ripped out in an occult ceremony.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 16-3-2010(1): The **astute** will know, deep within their _hearts_ , that _comets_ are not really witches riding cosmic _brooms_.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 26-4-2007(79): Story by katsuo (but not yet posted) - At a small concert for the Beatles I was hanging _eight towels_ from the _celing_. I asked Paul if he wanted me to _stitch_ them together but he said " **Let It Be** ".
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-10-2008(20): There's a new cabaret show in town called _"It's Raining X-Men"_ where _eight_ Chippendales dress up in superhero costumes for the ladies. I would say something _negative_ , but I just shake my head and **let it be**.
column7: 3) [[EratiK](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EratiK)] 25-8-2011(13): No matter what _tool_ you use, this _towel_ is beyond repair, even with _stitching_. Better **let it be**.
column8: 4) [[stupiddog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stupiddog)] 5-3-2011(6): The buddhist term Heisig refers to means jinenhoni 自然法爾 , "things come into being spontaneously of themselves without any cause or intention. Similarly, what will bring us to salvation is not our own power, calculations, or intention." (Ibrahim Soner Ozdemir, <http://www.sanart.org.tr/PDFler/85b.pdf>). So: _Eight_ _nails_ _stitched_ into your _belt_ won't repair it, just **let it be**.
column9: 5) [[rowdyphantom](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rowdyphantom)] 26-3-2010(6): **Let It Be** –This song drove a _wedge_ (nail) between the four Beatles (John thought it was too religious). It was the _eighth_ track. The _belt_ and _four stitches_ were an attempt to hold the band together long enough to create Abbey Road.

column7: 3) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 19-10-2007(4): The boisterous crowd began to **applaud** as the formerly "synth-only" group tossed out the broken electronics, and _added_ a real _drum_ to their stage show.
column8: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 31-10-2010(1): If you don't **applaud** the drummer, he may add you to his set.

column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 19-5-2010(1): After an encounter with the **evil** _villain, human legs_ were all that remained of the poor victim. Careful with [villain](../v4/1490.html) (#1490 凶).

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(30): The overly-cautious _white_ geek protects his entire upper body with a special **helmet** he constructed out of _two cardboard boxes_ , unfortunately his _human legs_ could still be easy targets for bullies.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 8-3-2010(12): The perfect image for this kanji: <http://bit.ly/stormtrooperhelmet> How to make a lousy stormtrooper costume: take _two cardboard boxes_ \- one will be for your **helmet** and the other will cover your trunk. column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(5): I pull out from between my girlfriend's _legs_ and shoot _white_ stuff all over the **helmet** she's put on for the occasion.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(4): To protect my very _white_ skull from the sun while standing on my _legs_ , I fashioned a **helmet** by placing _boxes_ all around my head.
column9: 5) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 5-3-2010(1): When walking through Harlem, it is advisable to cover your _white_ face with a **helmet** , or at least a _couple of boxes_ , and your _white legs_ with some trousers.

column6: 2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 1-12-2008(17): When a **kalpa** passes, all forms of _power_ we see today will be _gone_.

column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 1-9-2010(3): When all your strength is _gone_ , drink **Calpis** to restore your _power_.
column9: 5) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 1-3-2012(1): This is the picture of someone to whom it'll take a **kalpa** to build _muscles_ \- see how everyone leaves in shame as soon as he starts working out - they are _gone_ in shame.

column5: 1) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 3-10-2009(15): A _scarecrow_ **bemoan** s that it _lacks_ legs.
column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 13-8-2009(13): (I use "kanji" for the scarecrow primitive.) I **bemoan** the huge number of _kanji_ I must memorize, but I plod on despite my tired _yawn_ s.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(13): _Audrey II_ _yawns_ , **bemoan** ing being stuck in the flower shop with nothing to eat.
column8: 4) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 12-12-2008(4): **Grief, **bemoan** , lamentation.** The _scarecrow_ is made from _grass_ , and he has a _big mouth_ and arms made of a _stick_. He _lacks_ human characteristics. This is the source of his **grief** and **lamentation** , he **bemoans** his lack of humanity. When you feel like lamenting or **bemoaning** your fate, think of the poor _scarecrow_ who _lacks_ humanity, but wants it so desparately.
column9: 5) [[kanjisensei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjisensei)] 22-10-2009(3): After the scarecrow lets out a long [sigh](../v4/1579.html) (#1579 嘆), opens his mouth wider into a yawn, and now **bemoan** s the fact that he still doesn't have a brain.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(22): I hop into my **palanquin** , my _car_ of sorts, such that I may be transported to my next location of _entertainment_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(17): A **palanquin** is a _car_ used for the _entertainment_ of royalty when they want to take a joyride.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 25-3-2010(2): A **palanquin** is not exactly the same as a _car_ , but it's a hell of a lot more _entertaining_ to watch!
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-3-2010(2): Before there were _cars_ , the lesser nobility (who lived in small towns with only one long main street) used to be carried up and down the street in their **palanquin** s for _entertainment_. Little has changed today, but this activity is available to all youths with _cars_ and little better to do.
column9: 5) [[kanjisensei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjisensei)] 22-10-2009(1): Although they used to be used for real, nowadays in old towns in Japan, tourists can ride in a **Palanquin** car for their entertainment. As each **palanquin** is hand-made, none of them are the same!

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 25-11-2007(47): In the debate, your political opponent's has such a **warped** sense of perspective, that he believes the _negative_ is actually _correct_.
column6: 2) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 17-12-2008(7): **Warped** is a combination of _not_ and _correct_. If a piece of wood is described as **warped** , that means it is _not_ the _correct_ shape, according to a particular standard we have in mind. The _correct_ Kanji points us to the standard, while the _not_ or _un-_ Kanji denotes that the standard is not met. Hence, whatever we are talking about is not standard - i.e. it is _not correct_ or _not regular_. In other words, it is **warped**.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(4): On standardized tests they use _negative_ questions that are so **warped** you don't know which answer is _correct_.
column8: 4) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 16-2-2009(4): A **warped** person will often believe that _negative_ actions are the most _correct_ for any given situation.
column9: 5) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 25-3-2010(3): This kanji ひずみ is also used for guitar distortion.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(25): You're so jaded by the time you _graduate_ that when you finally spread your wings, your _feathers_ are all **jade green**.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(8): This what the valedictorian wears in Chinese high school _graduation_ s. It's a beautiful cap with **jade green** _feathers_ covering it. No tassel, just those pretty _feathers_.
column7: 3) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 4-9-2009(4): As a commemoration of graduation we got these **jade green** colored medals in the shape of wings.
column8: 4) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 7-6-2008(2): Feathers, graduate: She had **jade green** eyes and you could see _feathers_ coming out of her back. She told she was a _graduate_ of Holy Trinity College, but you never heard of that College before. Is she actually human??
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 19-6-2010(1): 翡翠色 [jade green](../v4/2863.html) (#2863 翠) スイ, みどり … Parts: 羽 , 卒 … Story: It is said that FNG's are green. But there is a special term for new college _graduate_ FNGs — **Jade Green**. It recognizes that they are still wet under the _feathers_ , but also that everyone else carries a little of the **Jade Green** eyed monster about their recent college escapades. … 熟語 : … cf:.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(39): A good _substitute_ for _black_ is **blue-black** , like the color women try to _substitute_ for their _black_ eyebrows with a pencil.
column6: 2) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 17-12-2008(2): _Substitute_ \+ _black_ = **blue-black** or **blackened-eyebrows**. A close _substitute_ for the color _black_ is the color **blue-black**. Also, women in Japan sometimes have **blackened-eyebrows** , since their color is naturally a faint **blue-black**.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 7-6-2008(2): Substitute, black: The _substitute_ techer didn't earn enough to buy a TFT with true _black_ pixels. He just had to make do with a screen that seemed **blue-black** (especially when the sky reflected in it).
column8: 4) [[Sunspot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Sunspot)] 5-2-2012(): Sigh… another Heisig fail. **Blue-black** is definitely 黝 (あおぐろい). Change the keyword to mascara or something.
column9: 5) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 5-2-2011(): They were really getting smashed in the game. They _subbed_ off one of their players who had been punched **blue-black** (black and blue). So they could not do as much damage to the next sub, they used a guy with _black_ skin.

column5: 1) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 7-6-2008(27): Here we have two people sitting on chairs, trying to set up their camera on a **tripod** and periodically checking the viewfinder with their _eyes_.
column6: 2) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 13-5-2010(4): (NB: I use **THREE-LEGGED KETTLE** for 鼎 , and reserve **TRIPOD** for 鬲 [Unicode-0x9b32](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/39730) (#39730 鬲).) This **THREE-LEGGED KETTLE** is used for sacrificial incense-burning. 鼎 shows a watchful _EYE_ carefully putting the offering material in the opening of the **KETTLE** , which is shown as being squarely supported _ON EACH SIDE_.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 2-12-2008(3): _Eye_ (I) really wanted a **tripod** , so I went into a camera store with _two pistols_ and got everyone to _put their hands in the air_.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-3-2010(2): For anyone who's read the series, to me this is a pictograph of one of John Christopher's **Tripod** s, with one large evil glowing _eye_ and a mechanical skeleton around it. <http://bit.ly/thetripods>.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(1): Your _eye_ looks through the viewfinder as a three-legged **tripod** supports your camera.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(39): The _fortune-teller_ tells _Wolverine_ that in a past life, she sees him covered in **rocksalt** from working in a salt mine.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-2-2008(24): You see a block of **rocksalt** containing a _pent-in ladybird_ (US = _ladybug_ ). Touch it with your _magic wand_ and the ladybird is set free. (Note: Let ladybird = sheaf + four drops. It's pictographic: the sheaf showing the curved back and the four drops the spots on the ladybird).
column7: 3) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 10-9-2008(6): The _fortune teller_ gives more acurate results if you stuff a _sheaf_ and four drops of **rocksalt** in her mouth.
column8: 4) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 3-6-2010(4): 鹵 is a pictograph of a **ROCKSALT** "cellar", with a handy lid _ABOVE_ , and filled with the _GRANULAR VILLAIN_ of the modern diet. (<http://tinyurl.com/25g3r5u>).
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 2-12-2008(4): The _fortune teller_ told _wolverine_ that to cure his bad luck he should constantly sprinkle **rocksalt** all over his body, so now you can see him with little bits of salt all over himself.

column5: 1) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 10-9-2008(27): **Lye** is white like _rocksalt_ and can be broken up with an _ice pick_.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 20-7-2007(15): **Lye** is white like _rocksalt_ and sharp like an _awl_.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 10-3-2011(12): (Agreed with Hissatsu, **Soap** it is!) STORY: This new "natural" hippy soap is ridiculous! It's hard as a _rock_ , smells like _salt_ , and I have to chips pieces of it off with an _awl_ (or ice pick) just to use it!
column8: 4) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 29-11-2010(8): **Soap** is a far better keyword than **lye** ( 鹸 is only used in words referring to soap). "In the final step in making **soap** , I add _rocksalt_ and stir with an _awl_." (Sort of true, in some soap production, salt is added to precipitate soap from the solution).
column9: 5) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 17-4-2009(5): Licking what he thought was _rocksalt_ , _Frankenstein_ (the _fit_ -together _man_ ) suddenly feels his tongue burning. Those kids lied to him…it wasn't rocksalt, it was **lye**!

column5: 1) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 13-8-2009(30): "That _tiger_ at the zoo was so **reserved**. He didn't say so much as one _sentence_." "Um, you know tigers can't talk, right?".

I light a _fire_ underneath them, and as they wilt and fall in the heat, passing commuters **swallow** them whole. Well, they are **swallow** s.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(15): _Twenty_ **swallow** s are perched atop the station's 北口 raining _droppings_ all over everyone. Keep your _mouth_ closed so you don't **swallow** any. (Thanks Katsuo).
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-3-2010(4): Stroke order: _twenty, mouth, north, oven fire_.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 2-1-2009(2): Twenty **swallow** s at the north exit of the station. The bottom part is a pictograph of their tail feathers.
column9: 5) [[Panta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Panta)] 22-3-2013(1): Hint: Now is a good chance to learn the verb "to **swallow** " as well, which is simply a mouth to the left of the bird: 嚥.

column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 22-10-2008(13): Those big white "mints" in the _outhouse_ urinals may look _delicious_ , but it's best not to **lick** them.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(30): **Mahjong tiles** , to the best of my understanding have only _one side_ and are considered a _lowly_ use of time.
