column8: 4) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 9-2-2009(2): **Mahjong tiles** are _one-sided_ , and only _lowly_ people who don't play mahjong don't know this.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 10-3-2011(1): Fox news ( _one-sided_ ) runs a story about how the _lowly_ game of Mahjong is destroying America.

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 21-5-2007(39): Sneak preview - **peek** \- _director_ lets you _see_ his new movie - 店を覗く （のぞく） - have a quick noze/look in a shop (nozoku).
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(27): If a _director_ lets anyone _see_ his film before it's finished, it's only a sneak **peek**.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 15-11-2010(3): 覗く (覘く)[peek](../v4/2875.html) (#2875 覗) シ( 司 ), のぞく … Parts: 司 , 見 … Similars: 覗く [peek](../v4/2875.html) (#2875 覗), 瞥見 [glimpse](../v4/2927.html) (#2927 瞥) … Story: Director - See- Sneak Peak. This is the kanji for upskirt cams and peep movies. So a **Peeking Tom** _Director_ makes his movies about _Seeing_ through a hole in the bathroom stall.
column8: 4) [[Median](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Median)] 22-7-2012(1): The porn director told the man to look intently at the woman for the scene where he is supposed to be **peek** ing at her changing. NOZOku.
column9: 5) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 9-12-2009(1): The porn director saw someone trying to catch a **peek** of his film in the making and offered her a minor role.

column5: 1) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 11-1-2009(29): (thx Katsuo) The so-called 'mighty' **Qin dynasty** died a nasty death from starvation because they focused on growing _bonsai_ instead of _wheat_.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-8-2008(19): What did man chew in the **Manchu dynasty**? Well, first man chew _bonsai_ , but he find that rather tough, so next man chew _wheat_. EDIT: I think the keyword should really be **Qin dynasty**. So how a about new story based on Bob Dylan's song "Mighty Quinn": " _Bonsai_ without, _wheat_ plants within, you'll not grow nothing like the mighty **Qin**. (dynasty).".
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-3-2010(14): Please note: this is a mistake in Heisig. This kanji does not refer to the **Manchu dynasty** , also known as the Qing dynasty, 1644-1911CE, the last ruling dynasty of China. Instead, it is used for the similarly-named Qin dynasty, which was the first dynasty of imperial China. Story: The **Qin Dynasty** of 221-206BCE laid the foundations for the golden age of Chinese development. Two agricultural innovations they implemented were the art of topiary (exemplified by the bonsai) and crop cultivation (wheat).
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 5-11-2010(3): 秦 [Manchu dynasty](../v4/2877.html) (#2877 秦) **Qin Dynasty, Not Manchu** シン, 名乗り :しげ, はた … Parts: Bonsai ( 春 - 日 ,1567.9), 禾 (cf. 榛 [hazel](../v4/2475.html) (#2475 榛)) … 秦 is the first unification of China BC221-206. Manchu=Qing (1636-1912)=清朝 [pure](../v4/1539.html) (#1539 清). Both シン … Story: Qin( 秦 ) short dynasty that lasted only a few years longer than China's first emperor. It got _two (three?)_ _big_ for its _Wheat_ supply, since the massive public works projects starved the population into revolt. But enabled the Han to rule for 300 years.
column9: 5) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 3-9-2011(): The dragon in the **Manchu dynasty's** flag giving its _bonsai_ some tasty _wheat_.

column8: 4) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 29-3-2007(5): Jack **Sparrow** has a _few turkeys_ on his crew ジャク ジャン サク シャク すずめ T1 ざく **sparrow**.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 14-11-2010(2): 麻雀 , 麻雀牌 , 雀牌 , 雀寿司 , 雀蜂 , 雀斑 =雀卵斑, 朱雀 , [sparrow](../v4/2878.html) (#2878 雀) ジャン, ジャク, すずめ … Parts: 小 /少+隹 … Used mostly for **MahJong** … Similars: 雀 [sparrow](../v4/2878.html) (#2878 雀), 燕 [swallow](../v4/2869.html) (#2869 燕) … Story: Some people think Jack **Sparrow** is interesting. I think he's just a _Little Turkey_ with a fake accent who plays **MahJong** all the damn time.

column5: 1) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 14-8-2009(26): The **peregrine falcon** is the fastest animal in the world. It can reach speeds of over 322 km/h in a dive - over _ten_ times as fast as a _turkey_!
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(20): My **peregrine falcon** recently has been having confidence issues - recently it dives out of the sky and misses the target completely. To boost its confidence, I got a nice, fat _turkey_ , killed it, and then set it up on a big _needle_ so it looked like it was still alive - just loafing about. Then I went to my **peregrine falcon** \- "hey buddy, look! A nice fat _turkey_. I bet you can get it!" It goes for it, but it spears itself on the _needle_!!
column7: 3) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 23-1-2010(2): Finally it emerges who has been killing the _turkey_ s of RtK3. Dihutenosa! Last _turkey_ down, speared along with dihutenosa's ill-fated **peregrine falcon** on a _needle_. The latter was 準 [semi-](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/564) (#564 準) conscious for a time, until the last drop of the water of life drained from him. The former leaves behind no living relatives.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(2): The **peregrine falcon** is used to feeding on medium-sized birds, so it would take _ten_ of them to lift up a _turkey_.
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 24-5-2009(2): A **peregrine falcon** is nothing more than a _turkey_ with a compass _needle_ to find its way.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 5-3-2013(24): When passing through **Ebisu** in Tokyo, (one stop south of Shibuya) you see an **ebisu** (= a barbarian/savage) whose pet _St. Bernard_ has swallowed his _bow_ , you can see the shape of the bow sticking through its skin. Notes: 1. I'm locating this in **Ebisu** to reinforce the sound, the place name **Ebisu** is actually written with different kanji. 2. As Meconium mentions, stroke order is [一、弓、人](midori://search?text=一、弓、人) .
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-3-2010(14): I don't like the way Heisig doesn't list stroke order in RTK3, like it's not important or something. This is written _one_ , _bow_ , _person_ , not _large_ then _person_. It's annoying to have to check each time. Note the second leg of _person_ comes from the bottom of _bow_ , not from _one_.
column7: 3) [[MethodGT](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MethodGT)] 5-4-2008(8): 征夷大将軍 (せいいたいしょうぐん) This is the 'i' part of the full name of the ancient shoguns. Sei i tai shougun (Great general who subdues the eastern barbarians). This Kanji is the "eastern barbarian" part. Being the shogun, the most powerful military leader in all of Japan, it is only fitting that he also have a very _large bow_ to go along with his office. So large in fact, that it was given to him by the god of good luck, **Ebisu**.
column8: 4) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 11-3-2011(4): (Y)ebisu is my favourite beer in Japan. I like it so much, I'd probably kill _one_ _person_ with a _bow_ right now if it would get me a six-pack. (P.S. I'm only being evil for the sake of the story!…. seriously!).
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 29-8-2011(2): 蝦夷地 , 蝦夷 , 尊王攘夷 , 征夷大将軍 , 夷 =恵比須=戎 [ebisu](../v4/2881.html) (#2881 夷) イ, えぞ, えびす … Parts: 弓 , 大 … Story/Note: **Ebisu** is not usually written with this Kanji. Tokyo place names is 恵比須 , as is the god of fishing. This Kanji represent **Barbarians** , represented with one **big bow**.

He is so proud of it that I hesitate to point out the bulging **Cyst** forming on it.

column9: 5) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(3): That **cyst** growing on the head of _tropical lass_ reportedly felt like a _needle inside_ her _hat_.

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(33): The _monkey_ is **carefree** with his _piggy bank_ , tossing it at whatever financial opportunity he stumbles upon.
column6: 2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 14-8-2009(8): As a **carefree** person, I'm always using my _piggy bank_ to _monkey_ around.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 12-3-2011(5): I am the most **carefree** person in the world! I'm even going to entrust my _piggybank_ with my life savings in it to this _monkey_!
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 17-1-2009(3): Picture the **carefree** monkeys hanging out in the hot water pools in Nagano during the winter. There's so many monkeys in there you can't even see the water.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 16-3-2010(2): _Monkeys_ have no money worries. Financially **carefree** , a _piggy bank_ is no more than a play thing.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 22-11-2007(50): A dishonest taxi driver is **circling** to increase the fare – trying to _stretch out_ the ride, going around the block many _times_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(8): A taxi driver _stretches_ out the time it takes to get to _Times_ Square by **circling** around it (thanks mcfate).
column7: 3) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-4-2010(2): Vultures are **circling** overhead while you are _stretched_ out on the ground, unable to move. "I wonder how many _times_ they'll circle before coming down to eat?" you think.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(2): "We seem to be **circling**! We've already seen this landmark fifteen _times_!" "Oi, that's quite a _stretch_! It's more like twelve or thirteen _times_.".
column9: 5) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 11-11-2012(): When **circling** (working with or drawing circles) it is important to know what you have to multiply _times_ the diameter to _stretch it out_ into the circumference. That number is pi.

column5: 1) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 27-4-2008(23): I feel **elation** when I realize the _axe_ murderer is _lacking_ his axe.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(13): I was bored, _yawn_ ing and such, so I picked up my _axe_ and was suddenly filled with much **elation**.
column7: 3) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 10-2-2009(6): You're stuck in another boring meeting, falling asleep as they go blah, blah, blah. Suddenly the presenter gets this expression of **elation** on his face, picks up a nearby _axe_ , and starts hacking up the table. Nobody's _yawning_ any more…
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 18-8-2011(2): 欣求浄土 , 欣喜雀躍 , 欣快 , 欣悦 , 欣然と ,( 中名 : 欣然 =Xinran), [elation](../v4/2888.html) (#2888 欣) キン ( 斤 ), 仏 : ゴン, … Parts: 斤 , 欠 … Story: **Elation** is knowing that, if you are injured by _Axe_ , you are covered by _Axe-lack_. Quack.
column9: 5) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 4-11-2007(2): "Heeeere's Johnny!" Jack Nicholson said with strange **elation** in The Shining. He didn't _lack_ an _axe_ as he terrorized his family who was hiding in the bathroom.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(32): A **stalwart** _sow stands_ up against a _missile_.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(11): Stand up, sow, missile: See our **stalwart** hunter _standing upon_ the _sow_ he just shot, his _missile_ launcher still smoking. (Nothing much left of the _sow_ by the way).
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 9-3-2010(4): During the Bay of _Pigs_ invasion, the Cuban **stalwarts** _stood up_ to the CIA- trained mercenaries in spite of the bullets and _missiles_ flying through the air.
column8: 4) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 27-6-2008(4): A **stalwart** _pig_ catches the _missile_ with his _vase_.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 9-8-2010(2): 毅然として , 剛毅な [stalwart](../v4/2889.html) (#2889 毅) キ ( 名乗り :つよし, こわし, たけし) … Parts: 立 +豕, 殳 … Story: Suffering from a bad case of **Stall Warts** , the _Pig_ decides to live life _Standing Up_ from now on. But doing so leaves him with a bad case of Windy Crotch (known to humans as flatulence) because of the change in posture, so he keeps a dog around as cover. … 熟語 : … cf:.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-11-2007(60): Tip: Learn "this" 斯 and "that" 其 at the same time. ("that", 其 , is not in Heisig, but is probably more common than 斯 ). Stories: **This** _bushel basket_ comes with an _axe_ to open it, but **that** one doesn't.
column6: 2) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 4-9-2009(9): (Thx Kats) **THIS** AXE can beat any CHESS peice… except for maybe THAT ROOK.
column7: 3) [[Satchmobgw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Satchmobgw)] 28-11-2012(2): " **This** game is over!" I said as I took an _axe_ to his _rook_. " **That** 's (其) what you think!" he replied as he took away my _axe_ and pulled out another _rook_ (Thanks to both Katsuo and Haych).
column8: 4) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 18-8-2010(2): 其 [Unicode-0x5176](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/20854) (#20854 其).
column9: 5) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 11-11-2012(1): **This** game is over! I said as I took an _axe_ to his _rook_.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-10-2007(22): After you get the **wooden spoon** in the "egg  & spoon" race another competitor explains that you need to hold the _spoon_ " _just so_ ".
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(13): A _spoon_ used to measure ingredients _just so_ is a **measuring spoon**.
column7: 3) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 30-7-2008(5): Use a **wooden _spoon_** when cooking foods that need to taste _just so_.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(5): This _spoon just so_ happens to be a **wooden spoon**.
column9: 5) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 9-11-2010(3): The metal spoon gets too hot, the plastic spoon melts, but the **wooden spoon** is just right!

column5: 1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(36): After the revolution, the _king_ was put into a _box_ so that the government could be **set straight**.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 16-7-2007(10): Walking through the park, I see many large _box_ es where homeless people live. But there's one guy dressed as a _king_ , who seems to be arranging them all, i.e. he's **set** ting the boxes **straight**. "Surely you're not a real _king_?" I ask. He replies, "Let me **set** you **straight** , I'm _king_ of the _boxes_ ".
column7: 3) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 2-12-2008(4): A country needs to be **set straight** \- if its _borders_ are breached and its _jewels_ missing.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 27-11-2010(1): 匡正する , 匡救する [set straight](../v4/2892.html) (#2892 匡) キョウ, 名乗り : ただし, まさ, まさし … Parts: 匚, 王 … Story: If you don't **Set it Straight** , it won't just be your dick in a box, it will be your _Balls in a Box_. Which is not nearly as much fun as the original.
column9: 5) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 4-9-2009(): Because the king was gay, they brainwashed him torturing him by suffocation in a cardboard box to he could be **set straight**.

column5: 1) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 17-1-2009(27): **Founding** of a nation is usually done by the taskmasters in charge behind closed doors. They sign some papers with their writing brushes and voila..
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-3-2010(6): Everyone seems to think that the **Founding** Fathers of the United States (the ones who signed the Declaration of Independence) were doing it out of their own free will. Truth is, George Washington, that hard old _taskmaster_ , wouldn't let people out the _door_ of the Pennsylvania State House until they had signed their name, and passed on the _writing brush_ to the next person.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(2): After the **founding** of Post Secret, people started to _disclose_ things with a _brush_ instead of their mouths.
column8: 4) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 22-7-2010(1): The **FOUNDING** of the correction facility is commemorated , right by the _DOOR_ of the _TASKMASTER_ 's office, with fine _BRUSH_ calligraphy.
column9: 5) [[danie115](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/danie115)] 21-12-2008(1): Before **founding** mcdonalds, we had to torture behind closed doors ronald to sign (with a writing brush) over the burgers See [disclose](../v4/1085.html) (#1085 啓).

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(48): Bending over constantly to cut all those woodblocks has given **Utamaro** a bad back. Now he smokes _hemp_ while he works to ease the pain in in his _spine_.
column6: 2) [[Fishface](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Fishface)] 25-3-2011(2): 歌麿 うた- **まろ** : The poor guy with leukaemia smokes _hemp_ to ease the pain from all the bone **マロ** that has to be injected into his _spine_. [Note: probably not medically accurate.].
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(1): A soft **Mashimaro** doll made with a _hemp_ _spine_ for some semblance of posture.
column8: 4) [[lisbet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lisbet)] 7-4-2013(): -I- , utaマロ have tried several thingns to ease the pain in my spine from working too long in the caves, singing an uta, and smoking hemp included.

column5: 1) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 18-8-2009(24): I have a huge **conglomerate** (collection) of old books I'm looking to get rid of. They're not in any particular order… some are _upside down in a row_ , some are _soiled_ … just look through them and _take_ whatever you want.
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 14-2-2008(10): This is similar to 業 [business/profession](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1792) (#1792 業), with "not yet" replaced by "take." A giant company that _takes_ up many companies with different _professions_ , is called a **conglomerate**.
column7: 3) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 29-4-2008(3): The _upside-down penguins in the back row_ are causing such a ruckus the performers on stage have to film _ten takes_ of their commercial for the big **conglomerate**.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-6-2009(2): Could think of the primitives as _upside-down-in-a-row + sheep + take_ (with some strokes shared). Story: "We **conglomerate** (bunch together) _upside-down_ ", said the _sheep_ , "so that predators don't _take_ us ".
column9: 5) [[EratiK](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EratiK)] 18-9-2011(1): The word **conglomerate** sounds too economical to me, while **agglomerate** seems broader (since this kanji is also used about bushes or clouds) and more suited as keyword.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 7-10-2007(21): Tip: "snack" or "appetizer" would be better keywords for this kanji.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(10): _Wolverine_ _possess_ es his own **snacks** when he goes out drinking.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(5): _Wolverine_ _posess_ es the most **treats** at the party because he's **entreat** ed for being famous.
column8: 4) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 27-5-2009(2): The _Possess_ or of the **Snacks** (i.e. Mom) thinks you've had too many, so she hands you a _sheaf of grain_ and says to chow down on something healthy. Mom was always kind of weird.
column9: 5) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(2): You're out at a restaurant with your family when all of a sudden the _Grim Reaper_ shows up to take your life. He's about to drag you away, when you say, annoyed: "Look, buddy. We just ordered the **appetizer**. Can you at least let us finish that part of our meal?" "That depends," says the _Grim Reaper_. "What did you order?" "A big _Fred-Flintstone-size side of ribs_ ," you say. "In that case," the _Grim Reaper_ says, "it's a deal. And I'll join you, I'm hungry for _flesh_ anyway.".

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 21-12-2008(25): The murderer who carved **symmetrical patterns** into all his victims was _sentenced_ life in a _jailcell_. (thanks tomusan).
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(13): In _jail_ , everyone wears symetrically patterned clothes - usually stripes. In this, particularly fashionable _Scottish_ jail, however, they have you wear _plaid_. It makes sense if you think about it - most jails have vertical bars, which translates into stripes - while this _Scottish_ joint has squarish, symetrically patterned bars that go very well with _plaid_.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(5): _Chun- Li_ gave the _death row inmate_ a **symmetrically patterned** footprint on the top of his head with a foot stomp cross-up.
column8: 4) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 2-11-2010(3): A cop stops me while driving on LSD. I shakily role down the window and the officer immediately barks, "Think of a **symmetrically patterned** sentence right now or I'll throw your ass in a jailcell!" I mumble: "Mr. Owl ate my metal worm".
column9: 5) [[manubear](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/manubear)] 10-8-2012(2): Groundskeeper Willie is in _jail_. Of course he's still wearing his **symmetrically patterned** _kilt_ ( やり甲斐がある ).

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 8-11-2007(48): British **magistrate** s wear wigs made of silver hair. But picture an eccentric **magistrate** who instead wears a _silver hare_ on his head.
column6: 2) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 20-1-2009(6): For all his righteousness in court, the **magistrate** is really a horny guy. How do I know this? I accidentally found his stash of Playboy magazines, and there was some _silver_ liquid on the _sign of the hare_.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 19-8-2011(2): A- 卿 [magistrate](../v4/2898.html) (#2898 卿) ケイ, キョウ … Parts: 卯 +艮 (cf 卯 [sign of the hare](../v4/2041.html) (#2041 卯), 卵 [egg](../v4/1422.html) (#1422 卵), 古郷 [home town](../v4/1849.html) (#1849 郷)) … Story: _Silver Hare_ 'd *Magistrate of my 郷 [home town](../v4/1849.html) (#1849 郷) keeps combing his hair straight ripping the middle bump out of both sides from 幺 to 乡to the box, and from 阝to 卩.
column8: 4) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 28-8-2009(2): Slight modification of katsuo (kiddo): british **magistrate** wear wigs made of silver hair . But just because they re compelled to do so doesn t mean they re necessarly comfortable with . If you saw the wig of mozart in Amadeus it s not very hard to picture a judge who wears his wig so badly that it looks like two huge hare/Bunny ears.
column9: 5) [[bizarrojosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bizarrojosh)] 28-2-2012(): British **Magistrate** s/Lords wear wigs made of SILVER hair, but an eccentric **MAGISTRATE** wore a SILVER HARE instead! Parts: 卯 +艮.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(23): In the _beginning_ you _learn_ by **fiddling with** things.
column6: 2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-6-2007(15): Emperor Nero **fiddled with** his fiddle while Rome burned. When he was later asked to explain himself he said, “Well, I was _learn_ ing how to play this piece and had to keep going back to the _beginning_ ”.
column7: 3) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 23-1-2009(4): In the _beginning_ , before education was mainstream, people _learnt_ things by **fiddling with** them.
column8: 4) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(1): We _learn_ what feels good in the _beginning_ by having a **fiddle with** ourself.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 15-3-2011(): In the _beginning_ , when I first started _learn_ ing to play the fiddle, all I really wanted was someone else to **fiddle with**.

column5: 1) [[dilandau23](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dilandau23)] 27-5-2007(37): Image: An Arctic explorer frozen **within** _ice_ , **within** his hands are an _umbrella_ and a _compass_.
column6: 2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 2-12-2008(16): "At" seems like a better keyword for this one. You're freezing under your umbrella and using a compass to figure out where you're at.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-3-2010(1): The new iPhone will not only have a digital _compass_ **within** it, but also an _umbrella_ that's strong enough to withstand blasting _ice_ storms. All crammed **within** something that can fit in your front pocket.
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 12-12-2009(1): The Sunday Naturalist meets the Scott expedition: _Ice_ **within** _compass_ & _umbrella_ , both useless, both meaningless, freezing rain, soaked to frigid bone, numb **within** & without, lost **within** fantasies of home, **within** a raw  & mordant sense of the fragility of life itself, without _direction_ , but, oh, wait - what light doth yonder? - **within** 300 metres of a convenience store!
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(1): You stand **within** the safe area under an _umbrella_ and use a _compass_ to figure out where you're **at** in the _ice_ of the tundra.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 5-11-2007(21): The **hackneyed** hangover cure is to have "some _hair_ of the _dog_ that bit you.".
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(12): You may think you're being original by sporting an afro, but it's **hackneyed** to have _big_ poofy _long hair_.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 1-9-2011(5): 外套 , 常套 , [hackneyed](../v4/2901.html) (#2901 套) トウ … Parts: 大 , [長＊](midori://search?text=長＊) (cf: 奮闘 [stirred up](../v4/565.html) (#565 奮) … Story: 外套 **Overcoat** is the most common use for this Kanji. So calling a guy in an **Overcoat** a detective is a 常套 **Hackneyed** way of seeing things, but it works. We see a _Dog in a Long_ coat and we thing McGruff the crime dog.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 7-10-2007(3): A hackney cab driver thinks his cab is too **hackneyed** so for a change he has it pulled along by a _hairy St. Bernard_.
column9: 5) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 12-8-2008(1): It was just plain **hackneyed** that the _dog_ was the one who coughed up the _hair_ ball and not the cat.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(36): The _half_ that was _anti-_ started a **rebellion**.
column6: 2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-3-2010(3): Once at least _half_ the population gets _into shape_ and everyone is strongly _anti-_ government, a **rebellion** can take place.
column7: 3) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 12-4-2011(2): A **rebellion** is when the _anti_ half starts pushing against the other _half_. (Like in this kanji).
column8: 4) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 9-11-2010(1): The **rebellion** was a half-ass attempt, being anti-violence.
column9: 5) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 30-7-2009(1): The **rebellion** was unpopular and HALF the population was AGAINST it.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(56): A _small_ tip on something _large_ creates a **sharp point**.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(9): Little, St Bernard: In primary school, I had a pencil sharpener shaped as a _little St. Bernard_. I put in my blunt pencil, and it came out with a **sharp point**.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 18-8-2009(5): A **sharp point** is, necessarily, _small_ , but it can do a _large_ amount of damage.
column8: 4) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-9-2007(5): Pictograph.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 8-10-2011(1): 尖り , 尖る , 尖鋭な =先鋭な, 先兵 =尖兵, 肺尖 , 尖端 =先端, 尖閣諸島 [sharp point](../v4/2903.html) (#2903 尖) セン, とがる, たがり, とんがり, とんがり … Parts: 小 , 大 (cf: 突然 [stab](../v4/1319.html) (#1319 突) … Story: This is the Kanji for **Tongari** Corn, the corn that goes from the _Big_ end to the _Small_ end, and ends in a **Sharp Point**. And the _Little_ things go in you, and end up in your 大便 .

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(22): The _samurai_ 's **crock** was so old it was a _crowned_ a heritage item of _Asia_ , and he wouldn't sell it.
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 5-11-2007(11): The E-mail read: "Hello, my name is Ubuntu Nonga, _crowned_ _samurai_ of a small _Asian_ country. I have $5 million that I need to move to a safe place …" But I knew that advance-fee scams are a **crock**.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(6): _Miss Asia_ uses her **crock** pot to cook her _samurai_ husband a meal. (thanks herman).
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 23-11-2008(4): Crowned Asia = Miss Asia (beauty queen). Samurai wins the Miss Asia contest and gets a **crock** for prize. Picture him walking out on the stage in his tiara holding the ornate **crock**.
column9: 5) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(3): Samurai, crown, Asia: At the pageant, the _samurai_ was _crowned_ as the most handsome one of whole _Asia_. As a token, he received a beautiful **crock** from the Ming dynasty.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(19): Magic wand, crown, 1-eyed valley, crotch: The archeologist was searching for the birthplace of the homo **sapience**. Wearing his _magic wand_ and his divining _crown_ , he was able to located it in the _1-eyed valley_ , somewhere in Bolivia. His _crotch_ got all excited, thinking on all the publicity of finding the birthplace of homo **sapience**.
column6: 2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 21-11-2007(14): The _magic wand_ in a guy's _crotch_ is _crowned_ with _one_ _eye_ , and _contains_ a certain **sapience** … but they should try not to "think with the little head.".
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(5): A _magic house_ with **sapience** has a _ceiling_ that can tell you've got your _eye_ on the _valley_ in the girl's _crotch_.
column8: 4) [[BladeWalker](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BladeWalker)] 27-7-2012(2): _One eyed valley_ \+ _magic wand crown crotch_ = **sapience**. Makes perfect sense.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 22-3-2010(1): 又 = _sitting cross-legged. Wand + crown_ here suggests a top sorcerer living on the _ceiling_ of the world (in a high place). In the _valley_ below an all seeing _eye_ watches. It's starting to sound like Sauron. Within his lair, the dark lord _sits cross legged_ , trance like, commanding his evil minions. Clearly **sapience** doesn't always imply benevolence.

column5: 1) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-5-2009(28): I have used _Red Bull_ as a primitive since [furthermore/waver](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1438) (#1438 猶), so now it is easy to remember the **chieftain** 's name: Chief Red Bull!
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(24): Only the **chieftain** could drink _horned whiskey_ since he was the one responsible for procreation.
column7: 3) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 3-1-2008(14): Tip to avoid confusing with 伯 [chief](../v4/967.html) (#967 伯): the other has "white" but a "chieftain" is a "tan chief," so this is the character without "white" in it.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 30-12-2008(5): The **chieftain** gets horny every time he has some whiskey.
column9: 5) [[NeoGlitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NeoGlitch)] 25-11-2010(2): The **chieftain** is [revered](../v4/1439.html) (#1439 尊) because he can drink _horned whiskey_ with absolute ease.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(31): The **nightingale** is a _bird_ that goes to a _schoolhouse_ at night to learn to sing.
column6: 2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 20-12-2009(10): This character is actually a 俗字 (unofficial simplification) of the character 鶯. As such, it is actually far less common than the traditional character according to a google search. Story for the correct character: The **nightingale** is bird with a crown (mane) as bright as a deep fire (two fires).
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(2): At the _school house_ we all learnt about some _bird_ named Florence **Nightingale**.
column8: 4) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(2): Schoolhouse, bird: The kids were trying to study in the _schoolhouse_ , but an annoying _bird_ which could sing beautifully - the **nightingale** \- was disturbing class. So, teacher got out his shotgun and shot the damn _bird_.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 18-3-2011(1): (a story that explains both the new and old version of the kanji) The _school house_ burnt down twice in a row ( _two fires_ ). Finally, the principal thought he had found the culprit. "But it wasn't it me!" said the kid. "It was a **nightingale**!" "Right kid… EXPELLED!" In the trees, a little _bird_ was laughing.

column5: 1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 8-1-2007(46): **Incandescent** red is naturally twice as bright as ordinary red ( 赤 ). Alternatively, this is a picture of spreading (already doubled), **incandescent** red fire. Note: This is used by far most commonly to write 赫 (あか)い, although dictionaries do not recognize such a reading (except for kanji dictionaries).
column6: 2) [[SimHuman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SimHuman)] 21-1-2010(9): **Incandescent** light bulbs work by passing an electric current through a filament, heating it so it produces light by incandescence. When you think of something heating up so it glows, it usually turns red (toaster coils, embers, etc.). An **incandescent** bulb is much brighter, so it's DOUBLE RED.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(3): _Rosy cheeks_ are **incandescent** , glowing red with heat.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 11-3-2011(2): 嚇々たる =赫々たる, 嚇怒する =赫怒する [incandescent](../v4/2908.html) (#2908 赫) カク( 嚇 ) … Parts: 赤 , 赤 (cf. 嚇す [menacing/upbraid](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2026) (#2026 嚇)) … Note: means, reads the same as 嚇 [menacing/upbraid](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/2026) (#2026 嚇) … Story: _Double Red_ filaments in a **Incandescent** bulb, as opposed to RED lighting (get it?).
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-3-2010(1): Strike the _red_ tip of a match against the _reddish_ brown side of the box and the tip will glow **incandescent**.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 3-2-2008(33): If a _person_ has _retainers_ , then he can spend his life **supinate** (i.e. lying on his back doing nothing). (note: for the writing order think: **S** u **P** inate = **S** lave- **P** erson).

column8: 4) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 10-10-2009(3): The _person_ gave his starved _slave_ some soup and he ate the **soup** **in** **eight** seconds.
column9: 5) [[Haych](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Haych)] 11-11-2012(): **SUPINATE** is when your arms are at your sides with your hands pointed forwards like for bicep curls, it is also for when too much weight is supported on the front of the foot. _Retainers_ , with their long work hours, were the first _people_ to learn that if you **supinate** while standing, your legs get tired out quicker. One needs to maintain a neutral center of balance.

column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(16): The _ghost_ who went to the _Big Dipper_ was a **pioneer**.
column7: 3) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 5-9-2009(4): The **pioneer** had discovered a ghost planet on the big dipper.
column8: 4) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 18-8-2009(3): A **pioneer** absolutely cannot be afraid of _ghosts_ , as he/she will have to spent nights alone in spooky areas. Additionally, he/she should learn to navigate by the stars, perhaps by using the _Big Dipper_.
column9: 5) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 28-5-2009(1): The _ogre_ looked up at the _Big Dipper_ and wished with his drop of brains that he could be a **pioneer** and touch the stars. Instead he just elbowed some more humans and ate them for dinner.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(15): Voice, missile, incense: Before they were going to launch the _missile_ , they were having a service to beg favor of the Gods. Then, when they lit the _incense_ , a booming _voice_ came out of nowhere: "Hmmm… this smell is great, no, **ambrosial**. Really worthy of the Gods…".
column6: 2) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 9-8-2010(11): Voice missle! The new gum that is guaranteed to give you **ambrosial** incense-like breath!
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(6): An army personell lit what he thought was an amrosial and frangrant stick of _incense_ but when he realised he'd just triggered the launch of a _missile_ a loud _voice_ came screaming "NOOOO!!!!!".
column8: 4) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 5-12-2009(3): [+abaddon] An **ambrosial** _voice_ , like a _missile_ from the Gods, said: 'That _incense_ is positively **ambrosial** '.
column9: 5) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 1-10-2010(2): Note: The meaning of this kanji is sweet fragrance or jasmine. Careful 薫 [fragrant](../v4/1681.html) (#1681 薫), 芳 [perfume](../v4/493.html) (#493 芳), 匂 [aroma](../v4/2147.html) (#2147 匂), 臭 [stinking](../v4/122.html) (#122 臭), 嗅 smell [/study/kanji/21957](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/21957) (#21957 嗅), 茉 [jasmine](../v4/2348.html) (#2348 茉). Story: Her sexy _voice_ made me feel like a _missile_ was getting ready to launch as I smelled her **ambrosial** _incense_ -like fragrance.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 13-2-2008(17): Tip: New primitive: Let _Tarzan_ = _generation_ \+ _tree_ – because _Tarzan_ lives with several _generation_ s of his family at the top of a _tree_. (This combination appears five times: [leaf](../v4/228.html) (#228 葉), [butterfly](../v4/521.html) (#521 蝶), [chatter](../v4/2158.html) (#2158 喋), [secret agent](../v4/2726.html) (#2726 諜), **label** (FRAME 2926)). Story: You notice _Tarzan_ is wearing his shirt inside-out and explain to him that clothes are _one-sided_ and that he can tell by looking at the **label**.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-9-2007(13): It is with mindless [chatter](../v4/2158.html) (#2158 喋) that _one-sided_ **label** s are attached to good, honourable people.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 22-3-2010(11): In botanic gardens, the _trees_ have **label** s on _one side_ (the side facing the path) so that upcoming _generations_ will know what they are.
column8: 4) [[penot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penot)] 26-9-2008(3): (let _generation_ & _tree_ = ' _ **leaf**_ ' _primitive_ , add the flower radical to make it a true "leaf" kanji) // Since ancient times, **Labels** have basically been _**one-sided**_ _**leaves**_ \- with your name on _**one side**_ of the _**leaf**_ and nothing on the other side. // other _**leaf**_ _primitives_ : [butterfly](../v4/521.html) (#521 蝶), [chatter](../v4/2158.html) (#2158 喋), [secret agent](../v4/2726.html) (#2726 諜).
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 3-12-2010(2): 符牒 [label](../v4/2926.html) (#2926 牒) チョウ( 枼) … Parts: 片 , 枼 (cf: 枼, 葉 [leaf](../v4/228.html) (#228 葉), 蝶 [butterfly](../v4/521.html) (#521 蝶), 喋る [chatter](../v4/2158.html) (#2158 喋), 防諜 [secret agent](../v4/2726.html) (#2726 諜),). … Similars: 札 [tag](../v4/212.html) (#212 札), 符牒 [label](../v4/2926.html) (#2926 牒) … Story: (枼=Leaf, abbrev. from 葉 ) If you are using _Leafs_ to write your **Label** s, you can only use one side, because the other side has those veins on it.

column5: 1) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 23-1-2009(38): My sharp _eye_ caught a **glimpse** of the confidential information before it went through the _shredder_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(11): As the _taskmaster_ makes me get down on my knees to clean the floor with _rags_ , my _eye_ catches a **glimpse** of her panties.
column7: 3) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 20-1-2010(2): I just caught a **GLIMPSE** of the SHREDDER before it tore up my EYE!
column8: 4) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 23-6-2012(1): The Temporal Agents put my _eyes_ in the _shredder_ after I caught a **glimpse** of the future through unauthorized time travel.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 19-8-2011(1): 瞥見 , [glimpse](../v4/2927.html) (#2927 瞥) ベツ( 鼈 ) … Parts: 敝＊, 目 (cf: 敝[Unicode-0x655d](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/25949) (#25949 敝), 鼈 [snapping turtle](../v4/3000.html) (#3000 鼈), 幣制 [cash](../v4/1040.html) (#1040 幣), 弊社 [abuse](../v4/1041.html) (#1041 弊), 遮蔽する [cover over](../v4/2358.html) (#2358 蔽)) … Place Names: 壮瞥町 , 徳舜瞥 , 徳舜瞥鉱山 , 徳舜瞥山麓 … Similars: 覗く [peek](../v4/2875.html) (#2875 覗), 瞥見 [glimpse](../v4/2927.html) (#2927 瞥) … Story: When he was a 督 [coach](../v4/719.html) (#719 督), my uncle usually hid under the bleachers to catch a **Glimpse** of things. His _Eye_ won't be glimpsing much once they’ve gone through the _Shredder_ , though.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-10-2007(39): Tip: primitives given in the book are: blood + happiness. But should be: drop + eye (/net) + happiness. Story: As you squeeze the last _drop_ out of your **testicle** s you go _cross-eyed_ with _happiness_.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(12): Sometimes I teabag my friend, _drop_ ping my **testicle** s on his _eyes_ , because it brings me _happiness_.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-3-2010(3): This kanji _can_ in fact be written with a longer horizontal stroke (stroke 6) so the primitives indeed are as Heisig intended. Different fonts show this. Story: His life was full of _happiness_ until I kicked him so hard in the **testicle** s that _blood_ started gushing out.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 20-3-2011(2): 睾丸 [testicle](../v4/2929.html) (#2929 睾)コウ … Parts: 血 , 幸 ….OR: 丶, 罒, 幸 (cf 銅鐸 [Unicode-0x9438](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/37944) (#37944 鐸) , 澤口 [Unicode-0x6fa4](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/28580) (#28580 澤), 演繹 ,[Unicode-0x7e79](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/32377) (#32377 繹)) … Note: If you go with Eye/Net, then this almost appears in 銅鐸 ( <http://bit.ly/ckEigk> ), 澤口 (Sawaguchi- Name Kanji, 演繹 ,[Unicode-0x7e79](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/32377) (#32377 繹)) … Story: The usual way of saying it is that someone has Brass Balls. In this case you are saying someone's **Testicle** s are the Clapper (the 丶) for Bronze Dotaku. It makes them _Happy_ but it also makes them _Bloody_.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 24-3-2010(2): _Blood_ flows into the **testicle** s in anticipation of a _happy_ experience.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(23): Craft, assembly line: The **sorceress** was very good at her _craft_. She magicked an _assembly line_ to produce all kinds of **sorceress** ' merchandise. Shrewed businesswoman, I'd say.
column6: 2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-9-2007(15): When _assembly lines_ first became popular, they were so quick at their _craft_ that some swore they had to be the work of a **sorceress**.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 22-3-2010(3): At the **sorceress** factory "sorcessories" (such as broomsticks, cauldrons and pointy hats) are _crafted_ and roll off the _assembly_ line.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 14-8-2011(2): 巫女 =神子=巫子＝みこ＝ふじょ, 巫術 , 巫山戯るな ! [sorceress](../v4/2930.html) (#2930 巫) フ, み … Parts: 工 , 人 , 人 (cf: 靈[Unicode-0x9748](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/38728) (#38728 靈), 旧字体 for 幽霊 [spirits](../v4/1791.html) (#1791 霊)) … Note: most commonly 当字 for 巫山戯るな , so … Story: the old crone **Sorceress** says: "Hey you damn kids. _Two people_ **fooling around with** an _I-Beam_ , someone's gonna get hurt!", so she uses sorcery 巫術 to turn _2 people_ into a single _"I"_. Now they cannot play with the I-Beam no more.
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 19-3-2011(2): The **sorceress** bewitches _two people_ to carry an _I-beam_ for her so she can build a new evil castle.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(27): A _taskmaster_ can be **empathetic** if she _receives_ something.
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(11): The 諄 [polite](../v4/2706.html) (#2706 諄) and 惇 [considerate](../v4/2279.html) (#2279 惇) _tall child_ grew up to be an **empathetic** _taskmaster_.
column7: 3) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 31-12-2008(4): The _taskmaster_ was very **empathetic** when the _tall kid_ explained how his dog had eaten his homework. Yeah, right. And if you believe that one …
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 20-9-2010(3): 敦子 [empathetic](../v4/2931.html) (#2931 敦)あつし, あつこ … Parts: 享 , 攵 … Note: Name Kanji read アツシ(guys), アツコ(girls) Girls name written 敦子 … Story: The reason Atsushi (or Atsuko) was so **empathetic** to the gawky _tall_ fourth grade _kid_ is that they had a classroom _Hitler Taskmaster_ make fun of them for being tall at that age. But they showed him by growing into fleet footed wide _receivers_. … cf: 諄 [polite](../v4/2706.html) (#2706 諄), 敦 [empathetic](../v4/2931.html) (#2931 敦), 淳 [immaculate](../v4/2318.html) (#2318 淳), 惇 [considerate](../v4/2279.html) (#2279 惇), 醇 [strong saké](../v4/2751.html) (#2751 醇).
column9: 5) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 18-8-2009(3): Don't expect to _receive_ any **empathetic** gestures from that _taskmaster_!

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-6-2007(23): (From Greek mythology). When Perseus goes to rescue **Andromeda** , he finds he's made a mistake. What looked from a distance like a beautiful maiden chained to a rock turns out to be a _St. Bernard_ tangled up in some _ivy_. (Andromeda was chained up a bit further down on another beach).
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(6): **Andromeda** is a _large_ constellation that represents the god of literature thought to inhabit _Ivy_ League schools.
column7: 3) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 15-3-2010(2): The girl everyone called " _Big Ivy_ " got a job as a stripper. She wanted to use the nickname everyone called her, but the club owner said it wasn't sexy enough, and gave her the stellar sobriquet **Andromeda** instead.
column8: 4) [[alucardchuu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alucardchuu)] 21-8-2010(1): **Andromeda** the saint seiya knight in his shiny pink armor had a tall ivy- like nebular chain!
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 28-3-2010(1): A _squared jewel_ of _St Bernadite_ , when inserted into the warp drive, will allow a spaceship to reach the distant **Andromeda** galaxy in a flash.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(43): If a _sheep_ had _feathers_ , it could **soar**.
column6: 2) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 25-1-2010(6): [+mantixen] If a _sheep_ had _feathers_ it could **soar**. This _sheep_ 's _feathers_ are a tad _sore_ & so the _sheep_ itself is slightly misshapen.
column7: 3) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 20-8-2008(5): Icarus' _wings_ made him **soar** across the [ocean](../v4/549.html) (#549 洋) without becoming wet.
column8: 4) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 17-4-2011(2): I stuck FEATHERS onto my pet SHEEP and dropped it off a cliff to see if it would **SOAR** … it **SOAR** ED straight to the bottom and thats why it's leg is messed up.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 24-10-2010(2): [哀川翔＊](midori://search?text=哀川翔＊) , 翔る , 飛び翔る , 滑翔機 , 飛翔 , 天翔る , [soar](../v4/2933.html) (#2933 翔) ショウ, かける … Parts: [羊＊](midori://search?text=羊＊) , 羽 … Yat another かける kanji (There are twenty different Kanji verbs that read かける. Also Aikawa Shou's first name, if you are a 99 fan. … Story: English: when pigs fly, Pigs get feathers. Japanese: when _Sheep_ **Soar** , _Sheep_ get _Feathers_.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 6-11-2007(18): The _revelation_ brought back by the _dove_ left Noah **beaming** – the flood waters were receding.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(10): A **beaming** _white_ light offers a life-changing _revelation_.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(7): The holy _white dove_ surrounded by **beaming** light came down from the sky with a _revelation_ to tell us.
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 28-5-2010(2): 皓々 [beaming](../v4/2934.html) (#2934 皓)コウ (old:皎々) … Parts: 白 , 告 … Story: One of the few non-name uses of this kanji is **Beaming** _White_ teeth. Just break revelation back down into _cow mouth_. … 熟語 : 皓歯 … cf. 酒造 , 浩然たる ,.
column9: 5) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(1): White dove, revelation: The _revelations_ left by the _white dove_ led to a **beaming** smile on the face of Noah: the waters were truly coming and he wasn't crazy after all… -Based on mcfate's story.

column5: 1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 6-11-2007(15): "tenebrous" = "dark" or "obscure." In **tenebrous** nights, _millet_ is found tied in _slipknots_ , in crop circles.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(9): The **tenebrous** _Slipknot_ forces their way into the _millet_ of Iowa.
column7: 3) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 12-7-2009(3): 暝 murky (dark and gloomy) It was a **tenebrous** day when the MILLET was SLASHed with a SWORD.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-8-2011(1): In **tenebrous** light I cut some _millet_ 黍 in half then notice a _drop_ of something on the _dagger_ I used. But what is it? Blood? Rain? Millet juice? I look closely, but can’t tell because the light is too **tenebrous**.
column9: 5) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 14-11-2010(1): 黎明期 , 黎明 , 後黎朝 , 黎族 , 黎語 [tenebrous](../v4/2935.html) (#2935 黎)レイ, 名乗り :はじむ, たみ … Parts: 黍 , [匁＊](midori://search?text=匁＊) … Or 黍 , ノ, 刀 (cf: 砂糖黍 [millet](../v4/2605.html) (#2605 黍), 漆 [lacquer](../v4/932.html) (#932 漆), 膝 [knee](../v4/2461.html) (#2461 膝). … Note: Bad Keyword: _Dawn/Dawn of a New Age, Lê Dynasty of Vietnam, Given name はじむ, Li/Hlai people/language of China_. So not **tenebrous** (dark, gloomy). … Story: One 匁 [monme](../v4/1027.html) (#1027 匁) of 黍 [millet](../v4/2605.html) (#2605 黍). Not even one Monme of Millet actually. It's quite the **Tenuous** connection.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(23): Run, cornucopia: The thief was **bold** , but stupid. He was _running_ away with the _cornucopia_ he just stole from the feudal lord. However, he was leaving an easy track to follow as the _cornucopia_ was pouring out its riches. So, **bold** , but stupid.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(7): A marathon _runner_ **bold** enough to race the _Fantastic Four_.
column7: 3) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 18-8-2009(3): He was so **bold** that he said "Of course I could _run_ a marathon. In fact, I could run _4_ of them!".
column8: 4) [[alucardchuu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alucardchuu)] 21-8-2010(2): De téméraires soldats ont couru dans les barbelés lors du débarquement.
column9: 5) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(2): It would be **bold** to _run_ for _4_ hours straight.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(39): This character would be the _sign of the snake_ if the last stroke didn't **stop short**.
column6: 2) [[hknamida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hknamida)] 24-1-2008(5): A common _snake_ strives to become a _sign of the snake_ , but **stops short** and never reaches its goal. (Based on mantixen's story.).
column7: 3) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 18-11-2010(): For some reason, Orobus, the sign of the snake 巳 , always stops short of swallowing itself.
column8: 4) [[kanjiwarrior](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjiwarrior)] 13-6-2009(): Igor (イ)'s move to steal a snake's girl was to **stop short**. <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxGRE2wpjsY>.
column9: 5) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 27-10-2007(): You whack the cricket ball away, but surprisingly it **stops short** even before it reaches short stop. The reason is it hit a passing _snake_ (and knocked a chunk out of him). Note: "short stop" is a fielding position in cricket.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(20): The _belt_ of thorns around a _tree_ is doubled in a **thornbush**.
column6: 2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 19-3-2010(13): A **thornbush** so thorny, even its _thorns have thorns_. Note: A good example is gorse <http://www.weeds.asn.au/gifs/line_art/gorse.gif>.
column7: 3) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 15-3-2009(7): There's no way that _two thorns_ make up a **thornbush**. Sorry.
column8: 4) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 16-2-2009(3): Only _two thorns_ are needed to make a **thornbush**.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 8-3-2010(1): I prick the beer writer **Horst Dornbusch** with _two thorns_ from a **thornbush**.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(33): Beings _exit_ the spirit world through the _altar_ when you **cast a spell**.
column6: 2) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 23-1-2009(7): SPOILER: The trophy in the Triwizard Tournament was just for _show_ , in reality Barty Crouch Jr. had **cast a spell** on the trophy so it would be a Portkey that would make anyone who touched it _exit_ the school grounds and teleport to the graveyard where Voldemort was waiting.
column7: 3) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 6-4-2010(5): A spirit tried to _exit_ the _altar_ to our world, but I **cast a spell** on his unworldly ass and sent him back to whatever dimension it was he came from.
column8: 4) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 14-5-2012(4): "haunt" or "haunted" seems a better keyword. ("curse" is already used.) Story: That place is so **haunted** there's an _exit_ sign over the _altar_.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 10-3-2010(1): The congregation sat in church, bored by the priest giving his sermon from the _altar_. A witch was hiding in the congregation, to appear as a normal human, but because everyone was bored she decided to **cast a spell** , whereby she made the _EXIT_ sign above the _altar_ flicker and change colour. ( _Exit_ signs are required in all churches now, for occupational health and safety reasons.).

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 8-6-2008(22): Grow late, life: It had nearly _grown too late_ to **resucitate** the half-drowned man, but a passer-by was able to breath _life_ back into him, thus **resucitating** him.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(10): To breathe _life_ into someone after it might have _grown (too) late_ is to **resuscitate** them.
column7: 3) [[Shakunatz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shakunatz)] 10-2-2011(4): [蘇る：死んだものが蘇る。](midori://search?text=蘇る：死んだものが蘇る。) [甦る：衰えたものが甦る。](midori://search?text=甦る：衰えたものが甦る。) However that's just a nuance found on the net. Just few dictionaries mentioned it. To breathe life into someone after it might have grown (too) late is to resuscitate them. Edit Mantixen.
column8: 4) [[jotakami](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jotakami)] 10-5-2011(2): Just found this kanji while playing FF7: the name of the Revive materia is 甦生 in Japanese. As such, I would replace the keyword with **revive**. And, in any case, it's misspelled: resu **s** citate.
column9: 5) [[shrimpster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shrimpster)] 28-11-2012(1): For those of you who watch Dexter: It had almost grown too late for young Hannah, but a fisherman jumped in and saved her life by resuscitation while her father stood on the sidelines.

column5: 1) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-1-2009(18): Lazy guide to **pruning** : Grab a _dagger_ and slash everything _in front_.
column6: 2) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 12-6-2008(8): In front (drops), dagger: The gardener is **pruning** his roses. He closes up to the one _in front_ of him until he can see the dew _drops_ on the petals. Then he gets out his _dagger_ and **prunes**.
column7: 3) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(7): **Pruning** is done by cutting what's _in front_ of you into _drops_ with a _sword_.
column8: 4) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-6-2009(5): Tip: imagine strokes 3 & 4 of 月 are falling because you just pruned them.
column9: 5) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 30-12-2008(1): Use butcher for "in front of" and picture a butcher holding a dagger **pruning** a hedge.

column7: 3) [[didz13](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/didz13)] 3-9-2010(6): When _fruits_ are _many_ , they are **plentiful**. (word order change) Thanks mantixen ().

column5: 1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 22-4-2007(31): If you **snore** , your _nose_ becomes _dry_. I try to remember the slightly different bottom part by wanting to hit the snoring nose with two hands but can't quite reach. KUN yomi reading いびき.
column6: 2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 18-3-2010(6): If you cannot breathe through your _nose_ , your airways become _dry_ and you **snore**. Note: To remember 丌 - An old snoring cure was to stuff a pie (mathematical π) into subject's mouth. Because so many choked this cure fell out of favour.
column7: 3) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 7-3-2011(3): People **snore** when a combination of two elements occur, 1. their _nose_ is deformed (the strange two arms) and 2. their nose is _dry_.
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(2): Stay _dry_ (from alcohol) and wear a _nose plug_ if you tend to **snore**.
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 24-5-2009(2): My girlfried has a sweet _SNUB-NOSE_ (to remember the short strokes) but she **snore** s amazingly strong…! She sucks the air into her nose until everything in the flat is _DRY_. She is like a hoover!

(Or, use the cheap trick of pinnacle = "B" for Buddha) 它 [Unicode-0x5b83](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/23427) (#23427 它).

column5: 1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 22-1-2009(30): If you mark each meter with a grain of _rice,_ after _1,000_ grains of rice you have measured out a kilometre.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 17-2-2007(7): A **kilometer** is made of _one thousand meters_.
column7: 3) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 5-4-2009(6): It seems that in _America_ they've tried a _thousand_ times to get us to go to **kilometers** , but we love our miles!
column8: 4) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 21-3-2011(2): 粁 , ㌖, km., [kilometer](../v4/2946.html) (#2946 粁) キロメートル … Parts: 米 , 千 , … Story: _1000 American_ units. is a **Kilometer**. (not that we use them but everything foreign is American to many Japanese anyway.).
column9: 5) [[errtu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/errtu)] 28-9-2010(2): It is funny how no one rates the stories anymore, so far into the kanji. we are all in a rush to finish it off :P.

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(21): A _rin_ of a _meter_ is a **centimeter**.
column6: 2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 30-4-2007(13): **Centimeter** is spelt the _American_ way. As mantixen says, it is a _rin_ of a meter.
column7: 3) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 10-7-2009(5): A **centimeter** is as long as a piece of _rice_ , which is oddly enough worth about a _rin_.
column8: 4) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 11-3-2010(2): One meaning of [rin](../v4/178.html) (#178 厘) is "one-hundredth", but if you're thinking of the old coin, the hole in a _rin_ coin was one **centimetre** in dia **me** ter.
column9: 5) [[Peppi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Peppi)] 4-6-2009(2): Remember? You threw the computer off the cliff and it was worth a _rin_! The size has reduced, too. The smallest pieces are about as big as a grain of _rice_ , the biggest pieces are some **centimeter** s "big".

column5: 1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(20): The portion of a _meter_ the width of _fur_ is a **millimeter**.
column6: 2) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 24-10-2008(12): RICE and cheap FUR are about 1 **MILLIMETER** thick.
column7: 3) [[taikura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taikura)] 10-12-2008(4): _Rice_ and _hair_ are both a **millimeter** thick.
column8: 4) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 23-7-2012(2): This is the last of the meter kanji in RTK, but if anyone's curious I went to ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/メートル and found a few more: 粆 micrometer (one millionth of a meter), 粉 decimeter (1/10 meter, already learned as _flour_ ), 籵 dekameter (10 meters), and 粨 hectometer (100 meters).
column9: 5) [[decals](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decals)] 23-3-2011(1): In [kilometer](../v4/2946.html) (#2946 粁), we put down a thousand grains of rice, one every metre, to make a kilometre. Here we put down a thousand hairs to make a metre (1 mm each). Basically, 1000 hairs per rice.

column5: 1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-6-2007(37): Unsuccessful dieter's excuse: "If I put anything in my _mouth_ , I _immediately_ put on a **ton**.".
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(4): A _mouth_ that says things _immediately_ without thinking gets into a **ton** of trouble.
column7: 3) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 19-4-2011(3): The character 頓 (IMMEDIATE) is pronounced "トン". The addition of the MOUTH to the left indicates that it is used for its sound and to convey a meaning other than the normal meaning of the character.
column8: 4) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 31-8-2010(1): An _earthworm's head_ is just a _mouth_ which it uses to create " **ton** nels". Note: 口 here signals that _immediate_ is being used phonetically giving 口 + 頓 = [噸・トン](midori://search?text=噸・トン) **ton**.
column9: 5) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 22-9-2008(1): _Immediately_ after the words left my _mouth_ , the stupidity of what I'd just said hit me like a **ton** of bricks. Very embarrassing.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 12-6-2008(28): Mouth, computer: The _mouth_ on my navigation _computer_ tells me it's only a **mile** left to my destination.
column6: 2) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 28-5-2009(5): Blah, blah, blah. After a **mile** of listening to the _mouth_ of the guy I was commuting with, I stuffed a _computer_ into his mouth to shut him up. I imagine we won't be riding together tomorrow.
column7: 3) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 19-4-2011(4): One RI is approximately equal to one **MILE**. The MOUTH indicates that this is a western measurement. (see TON).
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(2): A _computer_ with a _mouth_ could talk a **mile** a minute.
column9: 5) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 20-3-2010(1): Both the _ri_ and the **mile** [哩・マイル](midori://search?text=哩・マイル) are traditional units of measure which existed before the kilometre. In that respect they are analogous - unlike 口 in [ton](../v4/2949.html) (#2949 噸) which is used to signal a phonetic (rather than semantic) use of the kanji. Note: Contrary to RTK3 2nd ed, a [ri](../v4/173.html) (#173 里) is about 2.5 times longer than a **mile**. See RTK1 for correct measure.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 12-6-2008(30): Water, computer: Some _water_ leaked into my navigation _computer_ and now it expresses all distances in **nautical miles**. Very annoying!!
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(12): A _ri_ on _water_ is about a **nautical mile**.
column7: 3) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 28-5-2009(3): Crap, I got _water_ into my ship's _computer_! Now how am I supposed to track **nautical mile** s?
column8: 4) [[sadshaman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sadshaman)] 2-4-2009(1): A **nautical mile** is like a _mile_ , only in _water_.
column9: 5) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 18-7-2008(1): Check out this new _computer_ , which can be taken a **nautical mile** offshore (under _water_ , no less) and still work.

column5: 1) [[brendanmacdonald](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brendanmacdonald)] 24-10-2008(26): If you GLUE your MOUTH shut, you can't open it one **INCH**.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(6): To _glue_ your _mouth_ shut it only takes an **inch** of it.
column7: 3) [[dtcamero](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtcamero)] 19-4-2011(5): The character 寸 (すん）means approx 3.03cm, or a little over 1 **INCH**. The addition of the MOUTH indicates that this is a western measurement.
column8: 4) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 17-12-2009(2): The kidnap victim with her mouth glued shut **inch** ed her way across the floor to the phone and managed to dial 911 with her nose before realizing the obvious…
column9: 5) [[Spot53](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spot53)] 9-11-2011(1): Please _glue_ your _mouth_ shut…nobody needs to know my penis is only one **INCH**.

column5: 1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 12-6-2008(23): Mouth, shakuhachi: The hookers _mouth_ was huge and also she was very skilled in ' _shakuhachi_ ': she could hold up to one **foot**.
column6: 2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(10): Whenever my girlfriend puts a **foot** long in her _mouth_ I want her to give me a _shakuhachi_.
column7: 3) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 19-3-2010(9): 口 + 尺 = [呎・フィート](midori://search?text=呎・フィート) **feet**. Note: [尺・しゃく](midori://search?text=尺・しゃく) is being combined with 口 in same way as [mile](../v4/2950.html) (#2950 哩) to signal analogy between _shaku_ and **feet**. 尺 is about 3ocm - slightly under a foot.
column8: 4) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 16-1-2009(4): This means **feet** in the sense of measurement. A shaku is about the same length as a foot (~30cm) and Heisig explains that adding the mouth on the left often signals a phonetic reading of the kanji, in this case ふいいと.
column9: 5) [[krbtwo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/krbtwo)] 9-2-2010(3): The distance in **feet** from your mouth to the end of the shakuhachi is about one foot.

column5: 1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(20): This is a **Brahman** , a fully enlightened one. He's sitting in front of a _grove_ of _trees_ , legs open (looks like _wind_ ), just meditating. You run up to him asking him all sorts of crazy questions, and he looks at you and smiles. " **Brah, man, just chill, man.** Braaaaah#." Apparently he's a surfer **brahman**. You ask him the meaning of life, and he smiles, and waits…waits…waits…until a bit of wind blows by. He lets out a small _fart_ in the _wind_ , and nods knowingly at you.
column6: 2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 16-2-2009(13): **Brahman** who are _mediocre_ don't get the sweet meditation spots on the beach. Instead, they have to settle for a _grove_ of trees.
column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 7-9-2009(4): I abandon my _mediocre_ language in the _woods_ in order to learn **Sanskrit** , what a beautiful language… <http://jp.youtube.com/watch?v=HP1FoZpdNtM> (Sa Ding Ding - Alive).
column8: 4) [[HolyKotor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/HolyKotor)] 28-12-2011(2): **Sanskrit** is the liturgical language of Hinduism, Jainism and Buddhism. Most people who speak **Sanskrit** willingly live _mediocre_ lives in _groves_ of _trees_ to seek enlightenment from **Brahman**.
column9: 5) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 30-10-2009(2): Like many **brahman** s, this one owns a _grove_ , but he is not as rich as his **brahman** brethren and so his grove is _mediocre_.

column5: 1) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 5-12-2009(15): [+mantixen] A **bodhisattva** visits _The Pinnacle_ to provide _flowers_ and meditation _products_ to the unenlightened.
column6: 2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(15): [+megaqwerty] This is the **Bodhisattva** , who wants to help release the wicked from the painful cycle of life. Of course, the most vain and wicked are the pathetic lamers in the _Pinnacle_. He goes to register to stand at the station and hand out _products_. The registrar - "Okay, buddy, what are you selling?" "Nothing," he says. "I am giving out physical _products_ to entice true enlightment." "Whatever, dude…" He gets his license, and hands out _flowers_ to anyone who will take them.
column7: 3) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 12-6-2008(4): Flower, pinnacle, product: I didn't understand the terrorist: **bodhisattva** … body fatwa? Hmm.. just to be sure, I gave him the booby trap _flower_ (a _product_ of the _Pinnacle_ ). Later, I learned that **bodhisattva** is someone who postpones his or her own enlightenment to help others. Oops…
column8: 4) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 2-8-2009(3): A **bodhisattva** from the _pinnacle_ sells _flower_ -scented _products_ to the unenlightened.
column9: 5) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 11-3-2010(2): The **bodhisattva** sat outside the entrance to _The Pinnacle_ , blessing all the hand-made _products_ as they come out the gate. He stamps them with the mark " ピナクル産 ", meaning " _Product_ of _the Pinnacle_ ", which confirms their authenticity. After stamping, the **bodhisattva** 's assistant places a hibiscus _flower_ on top of the blessed _product_ , and everyone is happy. (The most popular agricultural _product_ of _The Pinnacle_ , incidentally, is the 薩摩芋 (さつまいも), or purple sweet potato.).

column5: 1) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 24-3-2010(16): Phonetic ボ. **Bo tree** is a sacred buddhist fig tree. The lovely smell from the _flower_ ing **bo tree** wafts down onto the meditating monks who are silent as though _muzzled_. [菩薩・ぼさつ](midori://search?text=菩薩・ぼさつ) bodhisattva.

column7: 3) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(7): A wannabe buddhist buys a tree and tries to give it to Buddha as a gift, "Yo **Bo** , 'sup, I got yo a **tree**!" Buddha gracefully accepts the gift and gives him a _flower_ in return to shut him up ( _muzzle_ him).
column8: 4) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 21-2-2009(5): The gardener has to put a _muzzle_ on the _flowers_ of the **bo tree** due to their carnivorous nature.

column5: 1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(37): **Babble** is what comes out of _Asian_ people's _mouth_ s until you learn their language.
column6: 2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 10-12-2006(12): The kanji has the meanings of "mute" ( 聾唖 ) and "speechless" ( 唖然 ), like "dumb" used to ("struck dumb" etc). Asian mouth is mute in a way, because they don't **babble** so much as they do in some parts of the world.
column7: 3) [[kapalama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kapalama)] 15-11-2010(3): 唖然 , 聾唖 , 唖者 , 聾唖者 , 唖 , [babble](../v4/2958.html) (#2958 唖) ア, おし … Parts: 口 , 亜 [Asia](../v4/1809.html) (#1809 亜) … Note: Odd Keyword. Really **Mute, and Phonetic for ア**. 亜 used to be ア phonetic, but as 亜細亜 (アジア) came to be a common term, 亜 came to used as a symbol for Asia, like 米 for America, 仏 for France, 阿 for Africa, 独 for Germany, etc. … Similars: 喋る [chatter](../v4/2158.html) (#2158 喋), 唖然 [babble](../v4/2958.html) (#2958 唖) … Story: Am I running my _mouth_ about things to do with _Asia_? Am I **Babbling**?
column8: 4) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 12-6-2008(2): Mouth, Asia: The baby opened its _mouth_ and started **babbling**. To me, it was as intelligible as an _Asian_ language, but the parents were **babbling** back in the same language.
column9: 5) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(1): At first, an _Asian mouth_ might sound like **babble**.
